diev et mon driot ¶ whole workes w tyndall iohn frith doct barnes three worthy martyr principall teacher churche england collected compiled one tome togither beyng ſcattered print exhibited church prayſe god profite good chriſtian reader mortui reſurgent london printed iohn daye ſold ſhop vnder alderſgate 1573 ¶ cum gratia priuilegio regiae maieſtatis arise day table ſeuerall treatiſes 184 anſwere syr thomas more dialogue 244 practiſe popiſhe prelate 340 pathway holy scripture 377 expoſition vpon firſt epiſtle iohn 387 expoſition vpon william tracy 429 fruitfull treatiſe vpon ſignes sacrament 436 two notable letter ſent vnto iohn frith 453 supper lord wherein confuted letter ſent vnto iohn frith ſuppoſed written tyndall 457 ¶ epiſtle preface chriſtian reader haue great cauſe geeue thankes high prouidence almighty god excellent arte printing moſt happely late found commonly practiſed euery ſingular benefite chriſtes church wherby great increaſe learnyng knowledge innumerable commodity el haue enſued dayly doe enſue lyfe man eſpecially fartheraunce true religion ſo agayne parte v generall wiſhed eſpecially procured occupie trade therof rightly vſe ſame glory hym gaue ende wherefore ordayned abuſe vnworthely worthy facultie eyther thruſting worlde euery vnworthy trifle commeth hand hauing reſpecte owne priuate gayne regarde publike edifiyng chriſtes church neceſſary preferment religion therefore ſuppoſe ſcience printing firſt ſet vp ſent god man vſe ſo much temporall commoditie taken man glory ſought thereby rather ſpirituall inwarde ſupportation ſoulehealth helpe religion reſtoring true doctrine repayring chriſtes church repreſſing corrupt abuſes heretofore ouerdarckened doctrine fayth reuiue agayne loſt lyght knowledge theſe blynde tymes renuing holſome auncient writer whoſe doinges teachinges otherwiſe lyen obliuion benefite printing brought agayne light v rather light wherfore ſuch printer mynde defrauded due commendation pretermitting light triflyng pamflets matter vnneedful impertinent little ſeruing purpoſe leſſe neceſſitie doe employe endeuour workemanſhip chiefly reſtore ſuch fruitfull workes monumentes auncient writer bleſſed martyr godly lyfe conſtant death gaue teſtimonie trueth tyme wherein ſuffered ſo doctrine learning geeue leſſe lyght age poſteritie number whome may rightly accompted leſſe recommended ſtudious chriſten reader theſe three learned father bleſſed memory printer booke hath diligently collected one volume togither incloſed workes meane william tyndall iohn frith robart barnes chiefe ryngleaders theſe latter tymes thys church england wherein haue much prayſe god ſuch good bookes left church alſo ſuch printer preſeruing induſtrie charge ſuch bookes periſhing ſo haue exhorte ſtudious reader wyth lyke diligence embrace benefite god offered ſeriouſly occupie ſelues markyng folowing valiaunt actes excellent wrytinges ſayd godly perſons concernyng prayſe whereof ſhall neede thys place beſtow much commendation becauſe neither prayſe men profite godly doe ſeeke yet contempt vngodly doe feare moreouer ſayde thought rather owne workes men wordes readyng bookes preface ſeene peruſing whereof thou ſhalt fynde gentle reader whether thou bee ignoraunt learne whether thou learned folowe ſticke briefly whatſoeuer thou art thou yong iohn frith thou middle age w tyndall elder yeares barnes matter founde onely doctrine enforme thee comfort delyte thee godly enſample directe thee alſo ſpeciall admiration make thee wonder workes lord ſo mightely workyng theſe men ſo oportunely ſtirryng vp ſo graciouſly aſſiſting albeit diuers alſo beſides theſe ſay nay well ſecrete operation god mighty prouidence haue beene rayſed vp famous learnyng floriſhyng witte ſtout zeale labouryng ſame cauſe haue leſſe valiantly doughtely ſtoode like defence chriſtes true religion agaynſt blynde errour peſtilent ſuperſtition perillous hypocriſie namely agaynſt arche enemye chriſt hys flocke byſhop meane rome hys tyrannicall ſeate namely england iohn wicklyffe rigge aſton swynderby w thorpe walter brute l cobham wyth reſidue former age alſo many moe freſhe wittes faythfull preacher learned writer haue ſprong vp lord hoaſtes furniſhe hys fielde briefly age tyme hath euerlacked ſome ſtyll bayting beaſt eſpecially nowe theſe preſent dayes ſuch plenty yea whole armyes lord hath powred vppon hys church heauenly ſouldiours onely number exceedyng knowledge alſo excellyng preaching printing doe ſo garniſhe church euery reſpecte may ſeeme ſo peraduenture wil thought time ſtand little neede ſuch bookes momumentes theſe former antiquitie yet notwithſtandyng mynde ſo thinke albeit increaſing learning tonges ſciences wyth quicknes wit youth doth maruailouſly ſhut vp ſeene ſufficient furniſhyng chriſtes church yet ſo happeneth tell farther looke backe thoſe former tymes tyndall frith others lyke ſimplicitie wyth true zeale humble modeſtie ſee wyth leſſe corruption affection yet wyth theſe dayes finde fault reading conferring workes togither may eftſoones appeare opening scripture trueth ſoundnes man require ſayd founde tyndall prologue vppon fiue bookes moſes vppon ionas vppon goſpelles epiſtles paule namely romaine perfectly doth hit right ſence true meaning euery thing obedience fruitfully teacheth euery perſon dutie expoſitions vppon parable wicked mammon pithely doth perſwade grauely doth exhort louingly doth comforte ſimply without oſtentation vehement without contention two faultes cōmonly wont folow moſt part writer ſo farre ſame reply aunſweres syr thomas doe well declare doctrine ſound hart humble life vnrebukeable diſputation modeſt rebuking charitable trueth feruent yet leſſe prudent diſpenſing ſame bearyng time weakenes men much might ſauing onely mere neceſſitie conſtrayned hym otherwiſe doe defence trueth againſt wilfull blyndnes ſubtile hypocriſie practiſe prelate notorious ſeene briefly ſuch modeſtie zeale charitie painefull trauaile neuer ſought thing leſſe hymſelfe nothyng chriſtes glory edification whoſe cauſe onely beſtowed labour hys life bloud alſo wherfore vnrightly might yet cauled apoſtle england paule cauleth epaphroditus apoſtle philippian ſingular care affection toward apoſtles primatiue age firſt planted church trueth goſpell ſo ſame trueth beyng agayne defaced decayed enemy thys latter tyme none trauayled earneſtly reſtoring ſame realme england dyd william tyndall william tyndall leſſe may adioyned alſo iohn frith barnes togither one cauſe one tyme ſuſtayned firſt brunt latter age gaue firſt onſet agaynſt enemy alſo ſpeciall giftes fruitfull erudition plentifull knowledge wrought god ſo left vnto v writinges wherfore accordyng promiſe booke actes monumentes wee thought good herein ſpend litle diligence collecting ſetting abroad bookes togither ſo many could founde remaine perpetuall lāpes ſhyning church chriſt geeue lyght poſteritie although printer herein taking great paynes coulde paraduenture come howbeit truſt lacke many yet lord thanked thoſe hath gotte publiſhed vnto v woulde god like diligence beene vſed auncient forelders tyme wickliffe puruey clerke brute thorpe huſse hierome ſuch ſearching collecting workes writing doubt many thinges remayned lyght lefte obliuion reaſon arte printing yet inuented worthy bookes ſooner abolyſhed wickednes thoſe dayes practiſe thoſe prelate ſo craftie good booke coulde appeare though scripture ſelfe englyſhe reſtrayned ſo conſumed whereby ignoraunce blyndnes ſo preuayled amonge people tyll laſt ſo pleaſed goodnes god prouide remedy miſchiefe multiplying good bookes printer penne ſuch ſort earthly power able though beſt ſtoppe courſe thereof neuer ſo myghtie fartheraunce chriſtes church wherefore receaue gracious reader bookes collected offered thy hand thanke god thou haſt reade whileſt thou mayſt time life memory ſerueth thee reading wherof lord graunt thou mayſt receaue leſſe fruit harty deſire ſetter forth wiſhe well vnto thee ſame lord alſo graunt beſeech exhortation wiſhe ſo may worke onely good enemy alſo yet wonne worde trueth ſetting aſide partialitie preiudice opinion woulde indifferent iudgementes beſtow ſome reading hearyng likewiſe theſe taſte doe teach vewe reaſons trye ſpirite marke expoſitions tyndall argumentes frith article allegation barnes ſhall finde agreable tyme antiquitie apoſtles doctrine touchſtone god worde vſe inſtruction myſlike finde cauſe haue firſt tryed thus deteine thee longer proceſſe reading better matter referre commende thee thy ſtudies gentle reader harty wiſhe prayer grace chriſt ieſu direction hys holy ſpirite deſiryng thee lykewyſe doe ſame mee iohn foxe martyrdome burning william tyndall brabant filford caſtell lord opē k englāds eye foloweth hiſtorie diſcourſe lyfe william tyndall booke actes monumentes briefly extracted ſomuch lyfe w tyndall author treatiſe immediately folowing ſufficiently large diſcourſed booke actes monumentes reaſon whereof ſhall néede greatly intermedle new repetition therof yet notwithſtanding becauſe haue takē hand collect ſet forth whole workes togither ſo thought vnconuenient collecte likewiſe ſome briefe note concerning order lyfe godly conuerſation teaching lyuing going togither one may edifie doctrine ſo may profit example firſt touching birth parentage bleſſed martyre chriſt hée borne edge wale brought vp childe vniuerſitie oxforde hée long continuance grew encreaſed aſwell knowledge tongue liberall artes eſpecially knowlege scripture whereunto mind ſingularly addicted inſomuch hée liyng magdalene hall read priuelye certaine ſtudentes felowes magdalene college ſome percell diuinitie inſtructing knowlege trueth scripture whoſe maners alſo tyndall vertuous godly man conuerſation correſpondent ſame ſuch knewe reputed eſtéemed bée man moſt verteous diſpoſition life vnſpotted thus hée vniuerſitie oxford encreaſyng learning procéeding degrées ſchooles ſpiyng tyme remoued thence ʋniuerſitie cambridge hée likewiſe made abode certayne ſpace béeing farther rypened knowledge god worde leauing vniuerſitie alſo hée reſorted one welſhe knyght gloceſter ſheare ſchoole maſter child good fauour maſter gentleman hée kept good ordinary commonly table reſorted vnto many tymes ſondry abbottes deanes archdeacon diuers doctours great beneficed men togither tyndall ſittyng ſame table vſe many tymes enter communication talke learned men luther eraſmus diuerſe controuerſies queſtions vpon ſcripture time tyndall learned wel practiſed god matter ſo ſpared ſhew ſimply playnely iudgement matter thought tyme varie tyndall opinion iudgment would ſhewe booke lay playnely open manifeſt place ſcriptures confute errours confirme ſayinges thus continued ſeaſon reaſoning contending togither diuers wilfull malice agaynſt opē trueth ſondry tymes till length waxed wery bare ſecret grudge harte againſt hym long happened certaine theſe great doctours inuited welſhe wife banket talke pleaſure vttering blindnes ignoraunce without reſiſtaunce gayne ſaying welſhe wife comming home calling tyndall beganne reaſon thoſe matter wherof prieſtes talked banket tyndall aunſwering scripture mainteyned trueth reproued falſe opinion ſayd lady welſhe ſtoute wiſe woman tyndall ſelfe reporteth well ſayd ſhe ſuch doctour may diſpend c l cc l ccc poūdes reaſon thinke ſhould beléeue tyndall gaue aunſwere tyme alſo becauſe ſaw would auayle talked litle thoſe matter tyme tranſlation booke called enchiridon militis christiani tranſlated delyuered maſter lady bad read well peruſed ſame doctourly prelate ſo often called houſe nether chere countenaunce came thing well marking perceiuing ſuppoſing leſſe came meanes tyndall refrayned thē ſelues laſt vtterly withdrewe ſelues came grewe prieſtes countrey cluſtering togither beganne grudge ſtorme againſt tyndall rayling houſes méeting place tyndall ſelfe firſt prologue firſt booke moſes teſtifieth owne wordes reporteth hée ſuffered much countrey ſort vnlearned prieſtes full rude ignoraunt ſayth hée god knoweth haue ſéene latyn onely reade porteaſſes miſſalles yet many ſkarſely reade except bée albertus de secretis author popiſhe priſtes doe ſtudie mulierum yet though bée neuer ſo ſorely learned pore daye night make note therein teach mydwifes ſay alſo booke called lynwood booke conſtitutions gather tythes mortuaryes offeringes cuſtomes pillage call god part duetie holy church diſcharge conſciences bound ſhall deminiſhe encreaſe thinges vttermoſt power perteineth holy church thus theſe blinde rude prieſtes flocking togither alehouſe preaching place raged rayled againſt affirming ſayengs hereſy addyng moreouer vnto ſayenges owne heades euer hée ſpake ſo accuſed ſecretly yt chauncelour biſhops officer folowed long ſitting byſhops chaūcelour appointed warning geuen prieſtes apere amōgeſt tyndall warned bée whether hée miſdoubt threatenings knowledge geuen would lay ſome thinges charge vncerteyne certaine hée ſelfe declareth hée doubted preuy accuſations ſo hée way going thitherwardes cryed mynde hartely vnto god geue ſtrength ſtand faſt trueth worde tyme came apperaunce chaūcelour hée threatened greuouſly reuiling rating though hée béene dogg layed vniuſt dcaling papiſtes charge many thinges whereof accuſer could yet bée brought forth commonly maner bring forth accuſer notwithſtanding prieſtes countrye ſame time preſent thus tyndall thoſe examination eſcaping handes departed home returned maſter againe dwelt farre certaine doctour béene olde chauncelor biſhop béene olde famyliar acquaintaunce tyndall alſo fauoured well ʋnto tyndall went opened mynde vpon diuers queſtions scripture hée durſt bée bolde diſcloſe harte ʋnto doctour ſayd doe knowe pope antechriſt scripture ſpeaketh béeware ſay ſhall bée perceaued bée opinion coſt life ſaid moreouer haue beene officer haue geuen vp defye workes long tyndall happened bée company certeyne deuine recounted learned man commoning diſputing hée droue hym iſſue ſayd great doctour burſt theſe blaſphemous wordes ſayd better bée without god lawe pope tyndall hearing notorious blaſphemy papiſt beeing full godly zeale bearing blaſphemous ſaying replyed agayne ſayd defie pope lawes farther added god ſpared life ere many yeares hée would cauſe boy driueth plough know scripture hée grudge prieſtes encreaſing ſtill againſt tyndall neuer ceaſed barki • g rating layd many ſore thinges charge ſaying y• hée heretick ſophiſtry hereticke logique hereticke diuinitie ſayd moreouer vnto hée bare hymſelf bolde y• gentlemē y• coū try notwithſtanding ſhortly hée ſhould bée otherwiſe talked withal tyndall aūſwering againe thus ſaid place hée ſtuck vpō hée cōtēted ſhould bring countrey england geuing x l yeare liue bynding teach child preach bée ſhort tyndall beeing ſo moleſted vexed countrey y• prieſts conſtrayned leaue countrye ſéeke another place ſo comming tyndall remoueth welſhe welſhe hée deſired good hée might depart hym ſaying thus vnto syr perceaue ſhall bée ſuffered tarye long countrie neither ſhall bée able though woulde kéepe mée handes ſpiritualitie alſo diſpleaſure might growe kéeping mée god knoweth ſhould bée right ſory fine tyndall y• good maſter departed eftſones came vp london preached according hée done countrye béefore length hée béethought hym ſelfe cutbert tunſtall byſhop london eſpecially great commendatiō eraſmus annotation ſo extolleth learning thus caſting ſelfe hée might attayne ſeruice hée happy man ſo comming syr henry gilforde kinges controller bringing hym oration iſocrates hée tranſlated gréeke engliſhe hée deſyred ſpeake ſayd byſhop london hym hée alſo willed tyndall ſueth tonſtall byſhop london coulde obtayne moreouer write epiſtle byſhop goe ſelfe hée likewiſe deliuered epiſtle ſeruaunt named william hebletwhait man olde acquaintaunce god ſecretly diſpoſed courſe thing ſaw y• beſt tyndals purpoſe profite church therefore gaue fynde litle fauour biſhops ſight aunſwere whome houſe full hee moe hée could well fynde aduiſed ſéeke londō abroad ſayd could lacke ſeruice c ſo remayned london ſpace almoſt yeare beholding marking ſelfe courſe world eſpecially ye demeanour preacher boaſted ſelues ſet vp auctoritie kingdome beholding alſo pompe prelate thinges greatly miſliked inſomuch vnderſtoode onely roome ye biſhops houſe tranſlate new teſtament alſo place doe england therefore fynding place purpoſe within realme hauing ſome ayde prouiſion god prouidence miniſtred vnto humfrev mommouth merchaunt shirife alderman london certaine good men tooke leaue realme departed germany good man inflamed tender care zeale countrey refuſed trauell diligence meanes poſſible reduce bretheren countryman england ſame taſt vnderſtanding god holy worde veritie lorde endued withall vpon conſidering minde partly alſo conferring iohn frith thought ſelfe way conduce thereunto ſcripture scripture vulgare tongue ſpeciall manifeſting trueth turned vulgare ſpeeche poore people might alſo ſee ſimple playne worde god firſt wiſely caſting minde perceiued experiēce poſſible ſtabliſh lay people trueth except scripture ſo plainlye layd eye mother tongue might ſee proceſſe order meaning y• text el whatſoeuer trueth ſhould taught theſe enemy trueth would quench agayne either apparaūt reaſōs sophiſtrye tradition awne making founded without ground scripture either el iugglyng text expounding ſuch ſence impoſſible gather text right proceſſe order meaning thereof ſeene agayne right well perceaued conſidered onely moſt chiefly cauſe miſchiefe church scripture god hydden ignoraūce scripture cauſe miſchife erroures religion people eye ſo long abhominable doinges idolatry mainteyned pharaſaicall clergie coulde eſpyed therefore labour might • mayne keepe downe ſo either ſhould bee read woulde darken right ſence myſt sophiſtry ſo entangle rebuked deſpiſed abhominations argumentes philoſophy worldly ſimilitudes apparant reaſons naturall wiſedome wreſting scripture vnto awne purpoſe contrary vnto proceſſe order meaning text would ſo delude deſkanting vpon allegoryes amaze expounding many ſences layed vnlearned laye people though thou felt thy heart ſure falſe ſayd yet couldeſt thou ſolue ſubtile ryddells theſe ſuch conſiderations good man moued doubt ſtyrred vp god tranſlate scripture mother tongue publique vtilitie profit ſimple vulgar people coūtrey firſt ſetting hand new teſtament firſt tranſlated yeare lord 1527 aftrr yt tooke hand tranſlate olde teſtament finiſhing v bookes moſes ſondry moſt learned godly prologue prefixed euery one moſt worthy read read againe chriſtians like alſo vpon new teſtament wrote alſo dyuerſe woorkes vnder ſondry title among moſt worthy monument intuled obedyence chriſtian man wherein ſingular dexteritie inſtructeth men office duetie chriſtian obediēce dyuerſe treatiſes may apere contentes booke ſoone theſe bookes compiled made william tyndall ſame publiſhed ſent ouer england bee ſpoken dore light opened eye whole engliſhe nation many yeares ſhut vp darknes theſe godly bookes ſpecially new teſtament william tindal tranſlation beyng ſpred abroad come many men handes wrought ſingular profitte godly ſo vngodly enuying diſdayning people reprobate alwayes offended ye trueth ſhould thing wiſer agayne fearing leaſt ſhyning beames trueth falſe hypocriſie workes darcknes ſhould diſcerned began ſtirre ſmall adoe lyke byrth chriſt herode ieruſalē troubled wyth hym ſo papiſtes made open exclamation agaynſt godly man publiſhed hym opēly ſermons hereticke bookes none damnable hereſies ſought meanes might empeach hynder godly man bleſſed trauayles returne ſtory william tyndall tranſlated fifth booke moſes called deuteronomium mynding print ſame hamborough ſayled thitherward way vpon coaſt holland ſuffered ſhipwracke loſt bookes writinges copyes ſo compelled beginne agayne • hynderaunce doublyng labour thus hauyng loſt ſhip money copyes tyme came ſhippe hamborough appointment couerdale taryed hym helped hym tranſlatyng whole fiue bookes moſes hee returned andwarp • lodged one whole yeare houſe thomas pointz engliſh man kept table engliſhe marchauntes tyme engliſhe man whoſe name henry phillips whoſe father cuſtomer poole comely man ſéemed gentleman man ſodainely entred henry phillippes wicked diſſembling iudas great loue fauour william tyndall greatly commended curteſie learning ende fell famylier loue acquaintaunce thomas pointz hoſt eſpying ſuch great loue familiaritie betwéene tyndall philippes vnto hym mere ſtrainger much meruell thereat fell gelouſy ſuſpition phillipes ſpye came betraye tindall wherefore time fore ſayd thomas poyntz aſked tyndall came acquainted phillipes tyndall aū ſwered honeſt man handſomely learned conformable pointz perceauing bare ſuch fauour vnto ſayd thinking hee béene brought acquainted ſome frende ſayd phillipes towne iij iiij dayes depart court bruxelles andwarp x • iiij myles ſo much procured bring thence andwarp procuror generall emperours attorney certaine officer firſt ſayd phillipes ſeruaunt came vnto poyntz demaunded whether tyndall maſter would come dyne foorthwith came phillipes aſked poyntz wife tyndall ſhe ſhewed chamber ſayd good meate ſhall haue dinner entend dyne ſhe aunſwered ſhould haue ſuch market would geue went phyllipes ſtraight vp tyndale chamber tolde way came loſt purſſe therefore prayed lend xl ſhillings foorthwith lent eaſie inough wilie ſubtilnes world ſimple vnexpert ſayd phillipes ſhall geſt day ſayd▪ tyndall got forth day dynner ſhall goe geſt ſhall welcome dynner tyme came tyndall phillipes went forth togither going forth poyntz houſe long narrow entrey ſo ij coulde goe front tyndall would haue put phillipes phillipes would wiſe put tyndall béefore hée pretended ſhew greate humanitie tyndall man great ſtature went phillipes tall perſon folowed behinde ſet officer either ſyde dore vpon ij ſeates beeing might ſée came entrye comming ye ſayd entrye phillipes pointed finger ouer tyndale head downe hym officer ſat dore might ſee hée ſhould take officer tooke tyndall afterward tolde fore ſayde poyntz ſayd pit • ed ſée ſimplicitie tooke tyndall hée came tyndals ſimplicitie pitied officer nere dore eſpied officer woulde haue ſhronke backe nay ſayd phill • ipes leaue ſhall goe forth force bare hym forward vpon officer aſſone officer taken forthwith brought vnto emperours attorney procurour generall hée dyned came procurour generall houſe poyntz ſent away tyndale aſwell bookes thinges thence tyndall caſtell filforde xviij engliſhe myles andwarpe hée remayned priſoner yeare halfe meane tyme came vnto diuerſe lawyer doctours diuinitie aſwell fryer hée many conflyctes laſt tyndall prayed hée might haue ſome engliſhe deuines come vnto maners ceremony religion douch land ſayd hée much differ maners ceremony vſed england ſent vnto hym dyuerſe deuines louayne whereof ſome engliſhmen many examination laſt condemned vertue emperours decrée made aſſembly auſbrough ſhortly brought forth place execution tyed ſtake feruent zeale loud voyce hée cried lord tyndals godly zeale prince open eye king englande firſt halter ſtrangled hangman afterward conſumed fier yeare lord 1536 power doctryne ſinceritie lyfe tyme impriſonment aforeſayd endured yeare halfe hée conuerted kéepers daughter houſholde alſo ſuch conuerſaunt caſtell reported hée good chriſtian man could tell truſt procurour generall emperours attorney teſtimony tyndals godly life euen aduerſarye béeing left teſtemony homo doctus pius et bonus learned good godly man worthy vertues doinges bleſſed martyr painfull traueles ſingular zeale countrey may worthelye called theſe dayes apoſtle england long recite amongeſt many one thing beecauſe ſemeth worthy remembraunce thought good ſhew vnto andwarp tyme amongeſt company merchauntes ſupper certaine iuggeler thorough diabolicall inchauntmentes art magicall woulde fetch kinde ʋyandes wine place would ſet vpon table incontinent many ſuch lyke thinges fame iuggeler much talked chaunced tyndall heard deſired certeine merchauntes alſo might preſent ſupper ſée playe partes ſhort supper appoynted merchauntes tyndall preſent iuggler called foorth play feates ſhew conning wonted boldnes began vtter • hat coulde fayth tyndall ſhewed manifeſt myracle doe vayne laſt labour ſweating toyling ſawe nothing would goe forward inchauntmentes voyde compelled openly confeſſe ſome man preſent ſupper diſturbed letted doinges man euen martyr theſe dayes lack myracles true fayth myracles deſired ende conclude hiſtory fewe note touching priuate behauiour dyet ſtudy eſpecially charitable zeale tender releuing poore fyrſt man frugall ſpare body great ſtudent earneſt laborer namely ſetting forth y• scripture god reſerued halowed hym ſelfe ij▪ dayes weeke named dayes paſtime thoſe dayes monday firſt day weeke satterday laſt day weeke monday viſited ſuche poore men woman fled england reaſon perſecution antwarp thoſe well vnderſtanding good exerciſes quality liberally comfort relieue like maner prouided ſicke deſeaſed perſons satterday walked round towne antwarpe ſeeking euery corner hole ſuſpected pooreperſon dwell god knoweth many found well occupied yet ouerburdened child el aged weake thoſe alſo hée plentefully releued thus ſpent ij dayes paſtime cauled truelye almoſe large great ſo might well bee exhibition yearely engliſhe merchauntes much moſt part beſtowed vpon poore afore ſayd reſt dayes weeke gaue hym wholy booke moſt dillgently traueled sonday came went ſome one merchaunts chamber whether came many merchauntes vnto would reade ſome one percell scripture eyther olde teſtament new proceded ſo frutefully ſweetely gentely much like writing iohn euangeleſt heauenly comfort ioy audiēce heare reade ſcriptures likewiſe dinner ſpent houre aforeſayd maner man without ſpot blemiſhe rancor malice full mercy compaſſion ſo man liuing able reprooue kinde ſinne cryme albeit righteouſnes iuſtification depended vpon god onely vpon bloud chriſt fayth vpon ſame fayth conſtantly dyed ſayd filforde reſteth glorious campany chriſtes martyr bleſſedly lord bleſſed ſaintes amen thus much w tyndall chriſtes bleſſed ſeruaunt martyr faultes eſcaped printing page 16 2 col margent theſe wordes put ſaluation christ ſame page ſame col next marginall note forth yeare 1534 concernyug reſurrection proteſte god ſauiour ieſus chriſt vniuerſall congregation beléeueth beléeue according opē manifeſt scripture catholicke faith chriſt riſen agayne fleſh receaued mother bleſſed virgine mary body wherein died ſhall good bad riſe fleſh body appeare togither iudgement ſeat chriſt receaue euery man according déedes body beléeue continue true faith chriſt ſhalbe indewed like immortalitie glory body chriſt proteſt god sauiour chriſt beléeue hym hold ſoules departed much may bée prooued manifeſt open scripture thinke ſoules departed faith chriſt loue lawe god worſe caſe ſoule chriſt tyme deliuered ſpirite handes father vntill reſurrection body glory immortalitie neuertheleſſe confeſſe openly perſwaded already full glory chriſt elect angel god neither article faith ſo ſée preaching reſurrection fleſh thyng vayne notwithſtanding yet ready beleeue may prooued open scripture moreouer take god alone ſéeth hart recorde conſcience beſéechyng hym parte bloud chriſt wrote haue written throughout booke ought euill purpoſe enuie malice man ſtirre vp falſe doctrine opinion church chriſt author ſecte draw diſciples mée woulde eſtéemed price aboue leaſt childe borne ſaue onely pitie compaſſion yet haue blyndnes brother brynge vnto knowledge chriſt make euery one poſſible perfect angell heauen wéede planted heauēly father bring downe lifteth vp ſelfe againſt knowledge ſaluation bloude chriſt alſo parte chriſt myne hart folow liue according teach alſo myne hart wéepe night day myne owne ſinne men indifferently beſéeching god conuert v take wrath v mercifull well men myne owne ſoule caring wealth realme borne king thereof tender harted mother woulde doe onely ſonne concerning haue tranſlated otherwiſe written beſéeche men read purpoſe wrote euen bring knowledge scripture farre ſcripture approoueth ſo farre allowe place worde god diſſalow refuſe doe sauiour chriſt congregation finde faultes let ſhewe mée nye write mée bée farre write openly agaynſt improoue promiſe ſhall perceaue reaſons conclude wyll confeſſe myne ignoraunce openly ¶ preface maſter william tyndall made fiue bookes moſes called geneſis 1530 ianua 17 tranſlated newe teſtamēt added epiſtle vnto latter ende deſired learned amend ought found amiſſe malicious wylie hypocrite whiche ſo ſtubburne hard harted wicked abhominations poſſible thē reaſon papiſtes make agaynſt tranſlation ſcripture engliſh amend thing ſee daylye experience lyuynges doyngs rebuked trouthe ſaye ſome impoſſible tranſlate scripture engliſhe ſome lawfull lay people haue mother toūg ſome would ſubtile ſhift pope clergy couer euill make heretickes would nodoubt many thynges whiche long tyme haue falſely taught whole cauſe wherefore forbid though clokes pretende ſome rather euery one ſay would make riſe agaynſt king ſelues vnto damnation neuer yet obeyed leſt temporall ruler ſhould ſee falſehode scripture came lyght cauſeth thē ſo lie tranſlation affirme vnto lay people haue heard ſay wotte many thouſand hereſies ſo papiſtes vexed tindal tranſlation new teſtament mended correct haue yet taken ſo great payne examine compare vnto would fayne haue owne imagination iugglyng termes haue ſomewhat rayle vnder cloke blaſpheme truth might litle labour ſuppoſe haue tranſlated moſt part bible tymes paſt wont looke ſcripture thē foūd theyr dun papiſtes ſhamed wreſt ſcriptures ſuche like deuiliſhe doctrine haue yet ſo narowly loked trā ſlation yt ſo much one therin lack title ouer hed haue noted nomber vnto ye ignoraunt people hereſy finally agreed driue knowledge scripture ye ſhall haue text therof mother toūg kepe world ſtill darkeneſſe entent might ſit conſciences people thorow vayne ſuperſtition falſe doctrine ſatiſfie filthy luſtes proude ambition vnſatiable couetouſnes exalte owne honour aboue kyng emperour yea aboue god hym ſelfe papiſtes haue wrought wonderfully haue ſuppreſſed y• ſcripture thouſand bookes leuer put foorth agaynſt abhominable doynges doctrine scripture ſhould come light long may keepe wil ſo darken ye right way miſt ſophiſtry ſo tā gle thē yt either rebuke deſpiſe abhominations argumentes philoſophie worldly ſimilitudes apparent reaſons naturall wiſedome wreſtyng scripture vnto owne purpoſe cleane contrary vnto proceſſe order meanyng text ſo delude deſcantyng vpō allegory amaſe expoundyng owles abide brightnes day ſo cannot papiſts abide lyght goſpell many ſenſes vnlearned lay people hath one ſimple litterall ſenſe whoſe light owles abide thoughe thou feele thine harte arte ſure falſe ſay yet couldeſt yu ſolue ſubtle rydles whiche thyng onely moued tranſlate new teſtament becauſe perceaued experience howe impoſſible ſtabliſhe firſt moued w tyndale tranſlate y• scripture englſſh laye people truth excepte scripture playnely layd eye mother toung might ſee proceſſe order meanyng text el ſoeuer truth taught theſe enemy truth quench agayn partly ſmoke bottomleſſe pitte wherof thou readeſt apocalipſis ix apparāt reaſons ſophiſtry tradition owne makyng founded without grounde scripture partely iugglyng texte expoundyng ſuch ſenſe impoſſible gather text thou ſee proceſſe order meanyng therof euē byſhops london houſe entented haue done biſhop lō tunſtall afterward biſhop durham ſo turmoyled coū trey could lē ger dwell proceſſe whereof long rehearſe wiſe thought ſelfe ſuffer becauſe prieſtes countrey vnlearned god knoweth full ignoraunt ſorte whiche haue ſene latin read porteſſes miſſales yet many ſcarcely read except albertus de ſecretis mulierū yet though neuer ſo ſorily learned poore day night make note therein teach mydwiues ſay linwode booke conſtitutions gather tithe mortuary offeringes cuſtomes pillage whiche call god part duety holy church diſcharge conſciences boūd ſhall diminiſhe encreaſe thyng vnto vttermoſt pope chaplens pulpet al • houſe power therfore becauſe thus vnlearned thought come together alehouſe whiche preachyng place affirme ſayinges hereſie beſides adde heades neuer ſpake maner prolōg tale ſhort time accuſed ſecretly chauncellour chriſtes apoitles dyd mekely admoniſh pope ſectaryes dyd braule ſkold byſhops officer dede came chauncellour hee threatned greuouſly reuiled rated though ben dogge layd charge wherof could none accuſer brought forth maner bryng forth accuſer yet yt prieſtes coūtrey ſame day thought byſhop london came remembraunce parcialitie ſometyme men great learnyng eraſmus whoſe toung maketh litles gnattes great elephant lifteth vp aboue starres whoſoeuer geueth litle exhibition prayſeth excedyngly amōg annotation new teſtament hys great learnyng thought might come man ſeruice happy ſo gatte london thorow acquaintance maſter came syr harry gilford kynges grace controller brought hym oration iſocrates whiche tranſlated greeke engliſh deſired hym ſpeake vnto lorde london whiche hee alſo dyd ſhewed willed write epiſtle lord go hym ſelfe whiche alſo dyd deliuered epiſtle ſeruaunt one william hebilthwayte man myne old acquaintaunce god tindale deceaued knoweth within hypocrite ſaw begyled counſayle next way vnto purpoſe therfore gatte fauour lordes ſight whereupon lord aunſwered houſe full mo could well finde aduiſed ſeeke londō ſayd could lacke ſeruice ſo london abode almoſt yeare marked courſe world heard prater would ſay preacher boaſted thēselues theyr hye authoritie beheld pompe prelate buſie yet ſet peace vnite world thoughe poſſible walke darkeneſſe continue long peace cā either ſtomble daſh themſelues one thyng yt ſhall roome enough lordes houſe belly chere none tranſlate new teſtament cleane vnquiet together ſawe thynges wherof deferre ſpeake tyme vnderſtode laſt onely rowme lord london palace tranſlate new teſtamēt alſo place englād experience doth openly declare vnder maner therfore ſhould ſubmit booke corrected amended whiche tindale could get place biſhop londōs houſe ſuffer nothyng bee well proteſtation ſhould make ſuch maner vnto prelate thoſe ſtubburne nimrothes whiche ſo mightely fight againſt god reſiſte hys holy ſpirite enforcyng crafte ſutletie quench yt lyght euerlaſtyng teſtament promiſes appointement made betwene god v heapyng fierce wrath god vpō prince ruler mockyng falſe fayned name hypocriſie ſeruyng luſtes pointes diſpenſyng euē lawes god chriſte hym ſelfe teſtifieth mathew 5 ſo much one title therof may periſh broken whiche prophet ſayth pſalme cxviij thou haſt commaunded thy lawes bee kept meod hebrew excedyngly diligence might power haue made thē ſo mad iugglyng charmes craftie perſuaſiōs thinke ful ſatiſfactiō wicked lyuing torment ſuch tell trouth burne yt word ſoules health ſlea ſoeuer beleue thereon notwithſtandyng yet ſubmitte booke haue tyndals ſubmiſſion ſuch ſubmit themſelues god either made tranſlated ſhall tyme come bee god ſhall labour harueſt vnto ſubmit ſelues vnto word god corrected yea moreouer diſalowed alſo burnt ſeme worthy haue examined hebrue ſo firſt put forth owne trāſlatyng correct prologue williā tyndall ſhewyng vſe scripture wrote fiue bookes moſes though man precious iuell rich yet hee wiſte value therof wherfore ſerued neither better richer ſtraw euē ſo though read scripture bable neuer ſo much yet know vſe wherfore geuen therein ſought profiteth v nothyng enough therfore read talke onely muſt alſo deſire toung life proueth true goſpeller god day night inſtantly open eye make v vnderſtand feele wherefore scripture geuen may applye medicine scripture euery man ſores vnleſſe entend idle diſputers braulers vaine wordes euer gnawyng vppon bitter barcke without neuer attaynyng vnto ſweete pith within perſecuting one defendyng lewde imagination phantaſies owne inuentions paule thyrd ſecond epiſtle trueſt toucheſtone religion chriſtes goſpell timothe ſayth scripture good teache ought men teach dreames owne makyng pope doth alſo improue scripture touch ſtone tryeth doctrine know falſe true vj epheſians calleth ſword ſpirite cauſe killeth hypocrite vttereth improueth falſe inuentions xv yt romains ſaith written written learnyng thorow patience ſcripture god y• ſworde spirite comforte scripture might haue hope example scripture comfort v tribulation make v put truſt god patiently abide hys leyſure x firſte corinthian hee bringeth example scripture feare v bridle fleſhe wee caſt yoke lawe god neckes fall luſtyng doyng euill nowe scripture lyght ſheweth true way hope defēce errour comforte aduerſitie diſpaire feareth v proſperitie ſynne séeke therefore scripture thou readeſt firſt law god commaundeth v ſecondarely promiſes whiche god promiſeth v agayn namely chriſt ieſu lord ſeeke example firſt comfort god purgeth tribulatiō gifte god ſubmit themſelues walke wayes purgatory tribulation deliueryng yet latter end neuer ſufferyng periſhe cleaue faſt hys promiſes finally note example writtē feare fleſh ſinne god ſuffereth vngodly wicked ſinners ought ſeeke scripture reſiſt god refuſe folow continue wickedneſſe euer waxyng worſe worſe vntill ſinne ſo ſore encreaſed ſo abhominable ſhuld lōger endure would corrupt elect ye electes ſake god ſendeth preacher neuertheleſſe harden harte agaynſte truth god deſtroyeth vtterly beginneth world new comfort ſhalt thou euermore finde playne texte litterall ſenſe neither ſtorye ſo homely ſo rude yea ſo vyle ſemeth outward wherein excedyng great comforte ſome ſeme thē ſelues great clarkes ſay wott profite many geſtes scripture read without allegory tale robenhode ſay thou goodly comfort agaynſt deſperation written conſolation comforte diſpayre ſuch like happen vnto v holyer noe though dronke neither better beloued iacob though owne ſonne defyled bead holyer lot thoughe daughter thorow ignoraunce deceaued hym peraduenture holier thoſe daughter neither holyer dauid though brake wedlocke vpon ſame committed abhominable murther thoſe men haue witneſſe scripture pleaſed god good mē thoſe thing chaunced alſo neuerleſſe ſuch thynges happened example ſhould counterfeite euill whyle wee fight ſelues enforſyng walke law god dyd yet fall likewiſe deſpayre come agayne lawes god take better hold read ſence tyme chriſtes enſāples euils bolden v feare v frō ſinne deſperation death virgin yt haue bene brought vnto common ſtues defiled martyr haue bene bound whore haue abuſed theyr bodyes iudgementes god bottomleſſe thynges chaunced partly example partely god thorow ſinne healeth ſinne pride neither healed yet appeare thorow ſuch horrible deades peraduenture pope ſect reioyſed fleſhly thinking heauen came dedes chriſt outward dede iuſtifyed made thē holy inward ſpirite receaued fayth conſent hart vnto law god thou readeſt therfore thinke howe ought prepare ſelues reading ſcriptures euery ſillable pertayneth thine ſelfe ſucke pithe scripture arme thy ſelfe agaynſt aſſaultes firſt note ſtrong fayth power god creatyng nought marke greuous fall adam v thorow light regardyng cōmaundemēt god iiij chapter god turneth hym vnto abell thē offeryng cain hys offeryng thou ſeeſt thoughe dedes euil appeare outwardly glorious dedes yt good yet ſight god looketh hart deede good becauſe man man good becauſe deede vj god ſendeth noe preach wicked geueth ſpace repent wax hard harted god bringeth nought yet ſaueth noe euen yt ſame water whiche deſtroyed marke alſo folowed pride buildyng tower babell conſider god ſendeth foorth abraham owne countey ſtraunge land full wicked people fayth ſureſt ſhield aſſaultes gaue bare promiſſe would bleſſe defende abraham beleued worde ſaued deliuered perilles ſo ſee mās life maintayned • bread onely chriſte ſayth much rather beleuyng promiſes god behold ſoberly circumſpectly abrahā alſo iſaac behaued ſelues among infidel abraham byeth might haue ben geuen nought cut occaſions iſaac welles whiche digged taken geueth rowme reſiſteth moreouer eare ſowe fede cattell make confederation take perpetuall truce doe outward thinges euen doe whiche haue fayth god hath made v idle world euery man muſt worke godly truly may truſt work • word promiſe god yt vttermoſt power god hath geuen yet truſt therin god word promiſe god worke v bryng good effect thē whē power extende god promiſes worke alone many thynges alſo reſiſted promiſes god iacob yet god burdened hys promiſe iacob coniureth god hys owne promiſes ſaying god father abraham god father iſaac lord ſaydeſt vnto returne vnto thine owne countrey vnto place thou waſte borne wil thee good worthy leſt thoſe mercyes trouth whiche thou haſt done thy ſeruaunt went ſtaffe come home two droues deliuer handes brother eſau feare greatly c god deliuered likewiſe call vnto promiſes repentyng hart neuer ſo great ſinnes marke alſo weake infirmity man loueth one wife one ſonne ſee god purgeth hym eſau threateneth hym laban begyleth beloued wife long baren daughter rauiſhed wife defiled owne ſonne rahell dyeth ioſeph taken away yea ſuppoſed rent wild beaſtes yet glorious ende note weakeneſſe child yea ſinne god thorow owne wickednes ſaued theſe example teache v man perfect firſt day begynneth liue well ſtrong therefore muſt ſuffer weake holy ghoſt breateth pleaſeth hym helpe thē vnity peace one vntill ſtronger note brother ſayd tached egypt haue verely ſinned ſayd agaynſt brother ſaw anguiſh ſoule hee beſought v would heare therfore tribulation come vppon v conſcience euill doynges fyndeth 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 men example thou ſeeſt cō ſcience euill doynges findeth men laſt namely tribulation aduerſitie temptatiō alſo deſperatiō yea paynes hell finde v yt ſoule feeleth fierce wrath god wiſheth moūtaines fall hyde poſſible angry face god marke alſo great euils folow howe litle occaſion dina goeth forth alone ſee daughter countrey great miſchief trouble foloweth iacob loued one ſonne howe greuous murther folowed harte theſe example ſmall occaſions riſe gret euils learnyng teache v walke warely circumſpectly yt world weake people geue man occaſions euill finally ſee god promiſed ioſeph dreames theſe promiſes accompanyed alwayes went downe hym euen depe dongeon brought hym vp agayne neuer forſoke hym till yt promiſed fulfilled theſe enſāples • earn • ng example writtē learnyng paule ſaith teach v truſt god ſtrōg fire tribulation purgatory fleſhe whiche ſubmitte ſelues folow god ſhould note marke ſuch thynges learnyng comfort frute ſcripture cauſe written ſuch purpoſe read way euerlaſting life thoſe ioyſul bleſſings promiſed vnto nation ſeede abraham whiche ſeede ieſus chriſt lord honour prayſe euer vnto god father thorow amen table expoundyng certayne wordes firſt booke moſes called geneſis abrech tender father ſome knee arke ſhyppe made flat cheſt cofer biſſe fine white whether ſilke lynen bleſſe god bleſſings gift firſt chapter bleſſed ſaying grow multiply haue dominion c ix chapter bleſſed noe ſonnes gaue dominion ouer beaſtes authoritie eat god bleſſed abraham cattell rich iacob deſired eſau receaue bleſſing whiche brought hym preſent gift god bleſſed yt vij day gaue preheminēce men ſhould reſt therin bodily labour learne know wil god lawes worke workes godly weeke god alſo bleſſeth nation abraham ſede turneth hys loue fauour vnto geueth ſpirite knowledge true way luſt power walke therin chriſtes ſake abraham ſonne cain ſo writtē hebrue notwithſtandyng whether call hym cain caim maketh matter ſo vnderſtand meanyng euery land hath maner cal iohn welſhmen call euan dutch haunce difference betwene yt ebrue greke latine maketh tranſlate ebrue varie name tranſlate latine greke curſe god curſe takyng away benefites god curſed yt earth made barren hunger dearth warre peſtilence ſuch like yet right curſes ſignes wrath god vnto vnbeleuers vnto thē know chriſt bleſſings wholſome croſſe true purgatory fleſh muſt goe liue godly ſaued thou readeſt math 5 bleſſed ſuffer perſecution righteouſnes ſake c hebr 11 lord chaſtiſeth loueth ſcourgeth child receaueth eden pleaſure firmament ſky fayth beleuyng god promiſes ſure truſt goodnes truth god fayth iuſtified abrah gen 15 mother good workes whiche afterafterward faith goodnes work ſight god good workes thing god commaundement wrought fayth ſow ſhoe commaundemēt god doe thy neighboure ſeruice withall fayth ſaued chriſte god promiſeth v much better thē build abbey thine owne imagination truſting bee ſaued fained workes hipocrites iacob robbed laban hys vncle moſes robbed egiptians abraham aboute ſlay burne ſonne holye workes becauſe wrought fayth god commaundement ſteale robbe murder holye workes worldly people vnto haue truſt god holy god commaundeth god commaundeth getteth rewarde god holy workes men imagination receaue rewarde chriſt teſtiſieth math 6 howbeit fayth workes haue ſpoken aboundantly mammon let deſireth ſeeke grace fauour noe founde grace ſay found fauour loue ham cam one iehouah god name neither creature ſo called much ſay one himſelfe dependeth nothing moreouer ofte thou ſeeſt lorde greate letter except error printing hebrue iehouah thou art marſhall hebrue called sartabaim thou wouldeſt ſay lorde ſlaughter men thoughe tabaim taken cooke manye place cooke ſlaye beaſtes themſelues thoſe day yet may taken put men execution alſo thought ſhould beſt ſignify muche ouerſight kynges priſon kyngs priſoners neuer ſo greate men vnder cuſtodie therfore cal chief marſhal officer yt lieuetenaunt tower maiſter marſhalſey slyme morter chap 11 ſlyme pittes chap 4 ſlyme fatneſſe iſſued earth like vnto carre thou mayſt call cement thou wilte siloh ſome muche ſay ſent ſome happy ſome ſignifieth meſſias ſay annoynted call chriſt greke worde propheſie chriſt tribe captiuitie kingdome deſtroyed yet tribe iuda ruler ſame bloud euen vnto commyng chriſt commyng chriſt romaine conquered emperour gaue kyngdome tribe iuda vnto herode ſtraunger euen edomite generation eſau teſtament appoymente made betwene god man god promiſes ſacramēt ſigne repreſentyng ſuch appointment promiſes raynebowe repreſenteth promiſe made noe god wyll drowne world circumciſion repreſenteth promiſes god abraham one ſide abraham ſeede ſhould circumciſe cutte luſtes fleſh ſide walke wayes lord baptiſme come roome therof ſignifieth one ſide howe repent beleue waſhed chriſtes bloud ſyde ſame muſte quenche drown luſtes fleſh follow ſteppes chriſt tirantes earth thoſe dayes ſonnes god ſaw daughter men c ſonnes god prophetes child though ſucceded father fell yet right way falſhode hipocriſie ſubdued world vnder became tirantes ſucceſſors apoſtles haue played v vapour dewie miſte ſmoke ſeething pot walke god liue godly walke hys commaundedementes enos walked god ſene lyued godly died god toke away god hid hys body moſes aaron leſt happly ſhould haue made idole hym great preacher holy man zaphnath paenea wordes egipt ſuppoſe muche ſay man whome ſecret thinges opened expounder ſecrete thinges ſome interprete ioſeph broughte egiptians ſuch ſubiection would ſeme vnto ſome cruell deede howe equall way payd yt fifth part grew grounde therewith quit dueties rente cuſtome tribute tolle kyng therwith found lordes miniſters defended pay half ſo much vnto prieſts beſide craftye exaction pay rente yearely thoughe grow neuer ſo litle yt ground yet kyng calleth pay neuer leſſe looke indifferently condition eaſier oures euen indifferent way common people kyng alſo see therfore thou looke enſamples scripture wyth worldly eye leaſt thou preferre cain abell iſmaell iſaac eſau iacob ruben iuda sarah phares manaſſes ephraim euen worſt beſt maner world prologue ſecond booke moſes called exodus preface vppon geneſis mayeſt thou vnderſtand howe behaue thy ſelfe booke alſo bookes scripture cleaue vnto ye texte playne ſtorie endeuour thy ſelfe ſearche meanyng learn read vnderſtād y• ſcripture deſcribed therein true ſence maner ſpeakinges scripture prouerbes ſimilitudes borowed ſpeach whereof entreated ende obedience beware ſubtile allegory note euery thyng earneſtly thynges pertainyng vnto thyne hart ſoule god vſed ſelfe vnto thē old teſtament euen ſo ſhall vnto worldes end vſe ſelf vnto v whiche haue receiued hys holy scripture teſtimonie hys ſonne ieſus god doth thing thē beleue promiſes herken vnto commaūdements patiēce cleaue vnto walke euen ſo ſhall v receiue witnes chriſt ſtrong fayth endure patiently folowyng ſteppes ſide fel promiſe god thorow vnbelief herken vnto voyce god bend ſelues hys wyl wyll god help v otherwiſe wyl plague v plagued vnthankful faythleſſe iewes lawe ordinaunces thorowe impatiēcie owne luſtes forſakē god ſo periſhed euen ſo ſhall many doe lykewiſe many mocke doctrine chriſt make cloke liue fleſhly folow luſtes note thereto howe god founde true laſt howe paſt remedy brought deſperation fulfilleth promiſes abiect caſt away deſpiſed refuſed perſō yea way impoſſible beleue cauſe captiuitie god people world • uer hateth fayth truſt whiche haue god vayne till fall fayth yt promiſes loue lawe ordinaunces god put truſt holy dedes truſt beleue god care world ſay owne finding liue altogether owne luſt pleaſure regarde god reſpect neighbour god forſaketh v ſendeth v captiuitie diſhonoryng name deſpiſyng neighbour world perſecuteth v fayth chriſt onely people nowe doth wicked liuyng kingdom thou mayeſt quietly licence vnder aprotection world liketh well wycked lyuers vngodly people ſoeuer abhominatiō thine hart luſteth god perſecuteth v bycauſe abuſe holy teſtament bycauſe knowe truth folowe note alſo mightie hande lord playeth aduerſaries prouoketh ſtyrreth vp litle litle deliuereth hys people houre patience elect alſo worldly wit wyly policie wicked wherwith fight agaynſt god might appeare marke yt long ſufferyng ſoft patience moyſes howe loueth people euer betwene ſet forth office euery good perſon wrath god ready liue dye put booke god written ſakes paule brother romaine ix taketh wronges patiently neuer auengeth ſelfe make moyſes figure chriſte rocheſter enſample vnto prince authoritie rule vnto god pleaſure vnto owne profite perfecter life world honor god profite neighbour yet greater croſſe thē rule chriſtianly aaron alſo ſee thou make figure chriſt vntill hee come vnto hys ſacrifiſyng example vnto preacher adde nothyng vnto god word take ought therefro note alſo god ſendeth promiſe people moyſes cō firmeth miracle people temptatiō triall true chriſtians beleue temptatiō commeth fall vnbelief fewe byde ſtandyng thou ſeeſt chriſten ſo called croſſe tryeth true fayned croſſe chriſt ſhould haue diſciples enough excellency faith gifte god whereof alſo thou ſeeſt excellent gift god true fayth impoſſible without ſpirite god aboue natural power mā time temtation god ſcourgeth hym ſhould beleue ſtedfaſtly god loueth careth hym thoſe whō god ſcourgeth dearely loueth hath prepared good thyngs hym ſcourgyng earneſt god hath elect choſen hym note oft moyſes ſtyred vp beleue truſt god putting remembraunce alway tyme neceſſary leſſon good precher temptation miracle wonder ggd hath wrought tyme eye ſight diligently alſo forbiddeth hee might withdraw harte god put ought god word take ought cōmaundyng onely ryght ſight lord ſhould make maner god commaundeth ſhold make image image kneele downe yea ſhould make none aultare hewed ſtone feare image fle heathen idolatry vtterly deſtroy idol cut downe theyr groues worſhypped ſhould take daughter vnto ſonnes geue daughter yt ſonnes ſoeuer moued worſhyp falſe god ſoeuer nighe kynne muſt accuſe bryng death yea whereſoeuer worſhipping idoles image abhorred god heard man woman citie worſhypped falſe god ſhould ſlea deſtroy citie euer builde agayne bycauſe ſhould worſhip nothing god put confidence thing ſaue word yea howe warneth beware witchcraft ſorcery c abhorred god witchcraft ſorcerie enchauntment nicromancie craftes deuill dreamer • othſayers miracle doer deſtroy word ſhould ſuffer none ſuch lyue thou wilt hapely ſay tell man truth god care knowe ſhall come haue v care onely kepe commaundementes committe chaunces vnto hym hath promiſed care v kepe v ill thynges hys hand remedy thynges truth ſake pray hym promiſes onely hee haue v truſt reſt ſeke farther alſo doth prouoke loue euer rehearſing benefites god done already godly promiſes come moſes often reherſeth benefites almighty god moue vsto feare hym loue neighbour goodly lawes loue geueth hee helpe one man ſhould hate neighbour hys hart loue himſelf leuit 19 charge geueth euery place ouer poore nedie ouer ſtraūger frendleſſe widowes deſireth ſhew mercy rehearſeth benefites god done neede might ſee cauſe leaſt waye god ſhew mercy loue vnto neighbour nede alſo lawe ſo ſimple apparaunce thoroughout v bokes moſes great reaſon yt makyng therof man ſearch diligently man forbyd ſethe kydde hys mother milke moueth v vnto compaſſion pitiful doth alſo man ſhould offer ſyre damme yoūg one day leuiticus xxij might ſeme cruell thyng much mother milke bloud wherfore god wil haue god haue v merciful neighbor ſodde therin haue man ſhew curteſie vppon beaſtes place hee commaundeth moſell oxe treadeth corne whiche maner threſhyng vſed hoate countreys bycauſe ſhould much rather liberall kynd vnto men v ſeruice happely god would haue none ſuch wanton meate vſed among people kydde ſelfe nouriſhyng goates milke reſtauratiue together might rancke therefore forbydden ſome lyke cauſe ceremony ſacrifices tabernacle hys glory pompe vnderſtand permitted onely alſo commaunded god lead people ſhadowe moyſes night ceremony olde teſtament •• preacher chriſt come olde teſtament vntill lyght chriſt day new teſtament come child lead phantaſies youth vntill diſcretion man age come vpon done keepe idolatrie coſtlineſſe • ea • 〈◊〉 tabernacle keepe iewes frō harkenyng heathen tabernacle beauty alſo pertayning therunto ſhould ſee nothyng among heathen ſhould ſee thinges beautiful home becauſe ſhoulde bee haue fayth truſt god cannot haue followeth either hys inuentions tradition mēs makyng without god worde finally god hath two teſtaments olde new olde teſtament thoſe tēporall promiſes god made child iſraell god two teſtaments olde new good lande would defend wealth proſperitie temporall bleſſinges thou readeſt ouer law moſes namely leuiticus 26 deut 28 auoyding threatenynges curſes thou readeſt likewyſe euery ſpecially two bookes aboue rehearſed auoiding puniſhment ordeyned tranſgreſſours law olde teſtament builte old teſtament built vpon obſeruatiō law altogether vpō kepyng lawe ceremony rewarde kepyng lyfe onely reached farther lyfe world thou readeſt leuit 18 mā doth ſhall lyue therin text paule reherſeth rom 10 gal 3 keepeth ſhall haue lyfe glorious according promiſes bleſſings law ſhal auoyde temporal puniſhments law threatnynges curſinges alſo neyther lawe tenne commaundementes yet ceremony iuſtified hart god purified vnto lyfe come ſo much moſes death euen fourtye yeares lawe ceremony geuen complaineth ſaying god hath geuen hart vnderſtande eye ſee eares heare vnto day ſhoulde law could geue lyfe haue ſayd god hath geuen ceremony ye knowe vſe hath geuen lawe god hath writen harte wherfore ſerueth law geue v power law paul anſwereth geuen vtter ſinne onely make appeare coroſie layd vnto old law vtterer ſinne ſore heale ſtirre vp make diſeaſe alyue man myght feele • eopardie nye death aware make way vnto healing playſter euen ſo ſayth paul gal 3 law geuen bycauſe tranſgreſſion make ſinne alyue might felt ſene vntill ſeede came vnto whome promiſed ſaye vntill child fayth came vntill chriſt ſede god promiſed abraham natiōs world ſhould bleſſed came law geuen vtter ſinne death damnation curſſe law geuen god ſhewe ſinne driue v vnto chriſt forgeuenes lyfe iuſtifiyng bleſſynges promiſed might ſee ſo great loue god v ward chriſt hence forth ouercome kindnes might loue agayne loue kepe commaundementes goeth quiet conſciēce iuſtifie ſelfe law doth heale hys woundes freatyng coroſeis hee goeth aboute purchaſe grace ceremony geuen iuſtify hart ſignifie iuſtificatiō chriſt ceremony doth ſucke ale pole quench thyrſt much ceremony geuen iuſtifie hart ſignifie iuſtifiyng forgeueneſſe chriſtes bloud ceremony iuſtifie thou readeſt hebr x impoſsible ſinne ſhould done away bloud ox goates ceremony cannot iuſtify law thou readeſt galla iij bene lawe geuen could haue quickened geuen lyfe righteouſnes iuſtifiyng come lawe deede law onely quickeneth hart alſo woundeth conſcience ſinne miniſtreth death damnation vnto ij cor iij ſhe muſt nedes dye damned except ſhe find remedy farre ſhe iuſtified holpen law new teſtament thoſe euerlaſtyng promiſes whiche made v new teſtament euerlaſtyng promiſes made v chriſt chriſt lorde throughout scripture teſtament built fayth workes ſaid teſtament worketh ſhall lyue beleueth ſhall lyue thou readeſt iohn iij god ſo loued world faith iuſtifieth gaue onely begotten ſonne none beleue hym ſhould periſhe haue lyfe euerlaſtyng teſtament preached beleued ſpirit entreth hart quickeneth geueth life iuſtifieth ſpirite alſo maketh law liuely thyng hart ſo man bringeth foorth good workes owne accord without compulſion lawe without feare threatenynges good workes ſpryng loue haue god curſings yea without maner reſpect loue vnto tē porall pleaſure power ſpirite receiued thorough fayth thou readeſt iohn gaue power ſonnes god beleued name power worke ſo hath ſpirit chriſt child neither learneth worketh lōger payne yt rod feare bugges pleaſure apple doth thynges owne courage chriſte ſayeth iohn vij beleueth ſhall haue riuers liuyng water flowyng hys belly good workes giftes grace ſprynge true fayth good workes flow abound hym naturally owne accord thou nedeſt wreſt good woorkes hym man would wryng veriuce crabbes nay flowe naturally hym ſprynges rockes new teſtamēt euer euen begynnyng world alwaies promiſes chriſt new teſtament beginnyng come fayth promiſes elect iuſtified inwardly god outwardly world kepyng law ceremony concluſion thou ſeeſt bleſſynges curſynges folowe breaking keping law moyſes euen ſo naturally bleſſynges curſynges folowe breakyng keping law nature temporall lawes ſpring law nature ſpryng temporall lawes people kepe temporall lawes land temporal proſperitie maner ſuch temporall bleſſynges thou readeſt moyſes accompany fall vpon contrarywiſe ſinne vnpuniſhed ruler haue reſpect vnto equitie honeſtie god ſendeth curſſe among hunger dearth morein bannyng peſtilence warre oppreſſion ſtraunge wonderful diſeaſes new kyndes miſfortune euill lucke man aſke ſeing faith iuſtifieth worke aunſwere loue cōpelleth lōg loue counſelleth faythfull worke ſoule feeleth loue god hath ſhewed chriſt loue god agayne wil commaundements loue worke hor ſeme hard vnto thinke ſelfe better woorkyng ſeeke heauen higher place heauē bycauſe chriſtiā worketh make weake brother perfecter ſeeke higher place heauen compare ſelfe vnto hym woorketh hee worketh day ſhall haue grace turne woorke morow meane tyme pitie muſt preſume well cōdēne others run aſtray laſt turneth god farre forward firſt hym pray hym wrought god thoſe thouſād yeares wrought deuill long day turne bee well willyng ſuffer chriſt hee hath day ouer taken far come ſhall haue much reward enuie hym reioyce moſt loſt treaſure found god haue theſe thouſād yeares ſuffered winne come prayſe name god theſe thouſand yeares haue prayed ſorowed longed ſighed ſought haue day found therefore reioyce might prayſe god grace mercy table expounding certayne wordes ſecond booke geneſis albe long garment white linnen arke cofer cheſt ſhrines ſaue flatte ſample taken therof booth houſe made bowes breſtlap breſtflappe ſuch flap thou ſeeſt breſt cope conſecrate appoynte thyng holy vſes prologue vpon exod occupye myndes people iſraelites kepe ſeruing god imagination blynde zeale good entent conſciences might ſtabliſhed ſure pleaſed god therin impoſſible man head commaunded god depended appointment made betwene hym god ceremony ceremony iſraelites • ewts good ſchole maſters young ſcholers vnto b c learne ſpell read nurſe feede mylke pappe ſpeake vnto capacitie liſpe wordes vnto accordyng babe child age might ſound agayne chriſt infancy childhoode world ſaw ſonne whiche ſee openly thorow cloud feble weake imaginatiōs chriſt child haue mennes deedes prophet except thyngs firſt reueled ceremony ſhadowes vntill pleaſed almighty god reuele hys ſonne ieſu chriſt yet deſcribed vnto ſacrifices ceremony likeneſſes riddle prouerbes darke ſtrange ſpeaking vntil full age come god would ſhew openly vnto whole worlde deliuer ſhadowes cloudelight hethen dead ſlepe ſtarck blinde ignorancy ſhadowe vaniſheth away comming light euē ſo ceremony ſacrifices comming chriſt henceforth neceſſary token left remembraunce bargayn neceſſary whē bargayne fulfilled though ſeme plaine childiſhe yet bee altogether fruiteleſſe puppet xx maner trifle mother permit vnto yong child vaine albeit ſuche fantaſies permitted small litle giftes geuē parentes child cauſeth loue obedience ſatiſfie childerns luſtes yet mother gift done place tyme commaundement keepe child awe make know vnto quicke declare liuely ſēſibly thē wordes world ſimilitudes haue vertue power bare wordes leade man wittes pithe marye ſpirituall vnderſtandyng thyng thē wordes imagined though alſo al ceremony play paſſion ſcaffold ſtage play openly eye people ſcape gote braſen serpent oxe burnt without hoſte paſſeouer lambe c ſo muche fully perſuaded cannot ceremony ordeyned confirme fayth beleue god comming moued ſuch thinges ſearch chriſtes ſecretes though god would god ſecrets opened fewe haue ſecrets chriſt generally known ſaue vnto fewe familiare frendes infācy made man wit helpe babe yet generall promiſe one ſeede abraham ſhoulde come bleſſe euen ſo generall fayth god woulde ſame man ſaue thoughe wiſt meanes apoſtles oft tolde yee could neuer comprehende till fulfilled dede beyond ſelfe vertue fayth ye promiſe ſacrifice ceremonye preached whereof token ſigne ceremony ſacrifices left commaū ded keepe promiſe remembraunce wake vp theyr fayth enough ſend many errandes tell ſhall muſt haue remembraunce ringe ruſhe aboute one finger inoughe make bargayne wordes onely muſt put therto othe geue earneſt confirme fayth ye perſon made like nature ſo weake muſt holpen outwarde ſignes token manner man promiſe whatſoeuer trifle beleued excepte hold vp hys finger alſo ſuche weakeneſſe world therfore chriſte himſelfe vſed ofttymes diuers ceremony curyng ye ſicke ſtirre vp fayth al example ye bloud ye lambe ſaued thē egipt ye angell ſmote egiptians mercy god hys truth wherof bloud token remembrance ſtirre vp faythes withall though god man holpen 〈◊〉 promiſes ſinners feele ſinne forgeuen finally beware allegory handſome apte thyng beguile withall allegory ſubtle peſtilente thyng world perſwade falſe matter allegory contrariwiſe better vehementer mightier thyng make man vnderſtand thē allegory allegory make man quicke witted printe wiſdome hym maketh abide bare wordes go one eare ſuch lyke ſayings put ſalt ſacrifices ſteade ſentēce dedes wyth diſcretion greeteth biteth bee vnderſtand plain wordes ſay ſtede theſe wordes boaſt ſelfe good dedes eate bloud fat ſacrifice greate difference betwene diſtance betwene heauen earth good dedes god work manſhip wee hys vnbeliefe ouerthrow ou • e • athers freewill doth ſhe taketh hand kepe yt law power helpe faith yt promiſes god ſhe leaueth maiſters carkaſſes way wilderneſſe bringeth lande reſt could enter becauſe vnbeliefe hebrue 3 beleued ſo bene vnder grace old ſinnes ben forgeuē power ſhould haue bene geuen haue fulfilled law thenceforth ſhould haue bene kepte temptation bene ſtrong writen iohn 1 gaue vtterly defied haue ſet vp another wilful chaſtitie required god whiche ſwere vowe profeſſe geue god whether wyll geue compel diſciples thervnto ſaying power euery man freewill obſerue contrary 〈◊〉 chriſt blaſphemy chriſtes death chriſt apoſtle paul obedience god man excluded haue vowed wilfull obedience condemned ſcripture wil yet geue god whether wyll become wilfull ſubtle fox thorow pouertie made themſelues lordes pouerty hath robbed whole worlde brought vnder either kyng emperor whatſoeuer degree except hold ſworne vnto ſeruaunte goe come luſt defende▪ quarels bee falſe true wilful pouertie hath alredy eaten vp y• whole world yet ſtil gredier euer ſo muche teune worldes mo inough ſatiſfie honger thereof moreouer beſides daily corruptyng men wiues open whore dome vnto abhominacions filthy ſpoken hath volū tary chaſtitie brought wilfull chaſtitie wilful wikednes wilfull obedience diſobedience diffiaunce al lawes god man ſo much prince begyn execute law man vpon curſe vnto bottome h • l proclayme right kyng hys lordes ought longer papiſt •… wilful obedience cō mon diſobedience prince obey hym interdite commō people heathen turkes saracenes man preach god law make hereticke burne aſhes ſieade god lawe man haue ſet vp one owne imagination whiche obſerue diſpenſations yet theſe workes haue ſo great confidence onely 〈…〉 commeth merites thorow ſayth bloud ou • ſauiour ieſus chriſt truſt ſaued therby hyer heauen yt ſaued chriſt alſo promiſe geuen • u • ſinnes thorough merites ſame wherin reſt teach reſt alſo excludyng whole world reſt forgeueneſſe aſcribe righteouſn •… workes therfore condemned chriſt therefore righteouſneſſe god preached vnto could perſecute deuill ſo ſtrong whiche thyng chriſt well deſcribeth luke xj ſaying deuill caſt commeth agayne findeth hys houſe ſwept made gay taketh ſeuen woorſe hym ſelfe dwelleth therein ſo ende man worſe beginnyng whē litle clēſed groſſe ſinnes world ſeyth made gaye ſight righteouſnes tradition commeth iuſtifiyng • ſelues maketh diu •… bu •… wold ſeuen ſay whole power deuill vij hebrues ſignifieth multitude without number extremitie thyng ſpeach borowed ſuppoſe leuiticus ſo ofte
