deuill vnto blindneſſe could deuils hell bring make thē beleue iuſtified thoroughe owne good workes beleued purged frō ſinnes made righteous thoroughe theyr owne holy workes rowme left righteouſnes merit •… ger • ye blindnes rebuked rebell againſt chriſt goly •… chriſtes bloudſhedyng therfore whē fallen blindneſſe hate perſecute light cleare euidently deedes rebuked furiouſſer maliciouſſer blinde vntill breake open blaſphemy ſynnyng agaynſte holy ghoſt malicious perſecutyng cleare trouth ſo manifeſtly proued hiſh agaynſt phariſeis perſecuted chriſt becauſe hee rebuked holy dedes proued hys doctrine scripture miracle yet thoughe could doctrine phariſes doctrine papiſts well agree improue hym reaſon agaynſt taught y• ſcripture muſt haue ſome meanyng becauſe inter pretation vndermined foundatiō plucked vp rootes ſects plāted aſcribed alſo miracle deuill lyke maner thoughe hypocrite deny ſcripture yet becauſe ſenſe gathered therof ouerthoweth buildynges therefore euer thinke hath ſome meanyng wordes ſounde man vnderſtandeth vnderſtode ſince tyme apoſtles thinke ſome wrote vpon ſince apoſtles vnderſtode yet thinke w •… like maner vnderſtand text ſelfe ſo vnderſtand meanyng wordes doctour thou layeſt iuſtifying holy workes denieſt iuſtifying fayth canſt thou vnderſtand paule peter iohn papiſtes cannot away iuſtification fayth actes ye apoſtles scripture ſeyng iuſtifying fayth almoſt entēde proue finally concernyng vowes wherof thou readeſt xxx chapter may many queſtions whereunto vowes aūſwere ſhortly ought put ſalt offerynges ought miniſter knowledge workes doe nothyng whereof could geue reaſon god wordes day light ſecretes god hys counſell wil opened vnto v promiſed ſhould come bleſſe v come alredy hath ſhed hys bloud v hath bleſſed v al maner bleſſinges hathe obtayned grace v hym haue wherfore god henceforth wil receiue god accepteth v none ſacrifice onely ieſu chriſt ſonne ſacrifices beaſtes v thou readeſt hebr 10 thou burne vnto god bloud fatte beaſtes obtaine forgeueneſſe ſinnes therby god ſhould better heare thy requeſt thou doeſt wrong vnto bloud chriſt chriſt vnto thee dead vayne god hath promiſed forgeueneſſe ſins onely alſo ſoeuer aſke keepe v ſinne temptation thou burne frankencens vnto thou burne 〈◊〉 holines imaginatiō robbing chriſtes honor candle thou burne thy chaſtitie virginitie vnto ſame purpoſe doeſt thou lyke rebuke vnto chriſts bloud moreouer thou offer gold ſiluer good ſame entēt difference euen ſo thou go pilgrimage faſteſt goeſt wolward ſpryneleſt thy ſelfe holy water elles ſoeuer dede obſerueſt ſoeuer ceremonie lyke meanyng lyke abhominatiō muſt therfore bryng ſalt knowledge god word al ſacrifices elles ſhall make ſwete ſauour vnto god therof thou wilt aſke ſhall vow nothyng yes god commaundemēt thou haſt vowed thy baptiſme entent verelye loue chriſte hath bought thee bloud made ſonne heyre god thou ſhouldeſt wayte hys commaundementes purifie thy member accordyng ſame doctrine hath purified thyne harte knowledge god word hath purified thine hart ſo yt thou conſenteſt vnto law god yt righteous good ſoroweſt yt thy member moue thee vnto contrary ſo haſt thou part chriſt thou repent thy ſinne ſo impoſſible thou faith foloweth repentaunce ſinne ſhouldeſt beleue chriſte deliuered thee daunger therof thou beleue chriſt hath deliuered thee ſo impoſſible thou ſhouldeſt loue god commaundementes thou loue commaundementes ſo chriſtes ſpirite thee earneſt forgeueneſſe ſinne ſaluation scripture teacheth firſt repentaunce repentāce goeth fayth prepareth way vnto chriſt fayth chriſt ſake ſinne forgeuen repent good workes whiche nothyng ſaue comaundement god onely commaūdements nothyng elles ſaue helpyng neighbour nede tamyng member might pure alſo hart pure thorough hate vice loue vertue god word teacheth v workes muſt procede fayth muſt doe loue workes good ſight god haue god great mercy hath ſhewed chriſt elles ſight god fainte yt payne ſlaying ſinne fleſh myne helpe promiſe aſſiſtance power god comforte reward come reward aſcribe vnto goodneſſe mercy truth promiſer hath choſē called taught work ſaueth word ſay promiſe geuen erneſt therof vnto merites doynges ſufferynges ſuffer way reward deſeruyng thereof kynges grace ſhoulde promiſe defende mee home myne owne realme yet way thether thoroughe sea wherin might happely ſuffer litle trouble yet might lyue reſt come thether would thinke ſo would ſay paynes well rewarded reward benefit would proudly aſcribe vnto merites apt ſimilitude reward good workes paynes takyng waye vnto goodneſſe mercyfulneſſe conſtant truth kynges grace whoſe gifte whō prayſe thanke thereof belongeth duety right reward gift geuen freely goodneſſe geuer deſeruynges receauer thus appeareth vowe ſoeuer vowes muſt made y• mortifying tamyng▪ member edifying neighbour el wicked purpoſe thē tame member enſample vertue edifying vnto neighbour ſacrifice vnſauery cleane without ſalt lampe without oyle one fooliſhe virgines ſhalbe ſhut yt feaſt bridegrome whē thinke ſelfe moſt ſure enter vow voluntary pouertie muſt purpoſe cō tent competent liuyng whiche commeth vnto either ſucceſſion ought vowe wilfull pouertie myne elder whiche get truly labour miniſtryng doyng ſeruice vnto common wealth one office one occupatiō becauſe rich honor ſhall corrupt mind draw myne hart god geue example vertue edifying vnto neighbour may haue liuyng wel make cloke diſſimulation vow laying net fayned beggery catch ſuperfluous aboundaunce whether fiſhed pope prelate •… n • rich hye degree authoritie thorough eſtimatiō falſe holyneſſe feede maintaine ſlouthful idlenes ſweate labour landes rente mē example ſpiritualtie robbyng faythes god honour turnyng vnto myne hypocriſie confidence ſhould geuen vnto promiſes god onely wily foxe rauenyng wolfe lambes ſkinne paynted ſepulchre fayre without filthy like maner thoughe ſeeke worldly promotion thereby yet doe iuſtified therewith get hyer place heauen thinkyng doe myne owne naturall ſtrength naturall power freewill euery man hath might euen ſo doe faulte negligence ſo proude phariſie compariſon ſelfe deſpiſe ſinnefull publicanes thyng eate bloud fat ſacrifice deuouring ſelf ſhould offered vnto god alone chriſt ſhortly ſoeuer man doth naturall giftes naturall witte wiſedom vnderſtandyng reaſon good workes ſtand wiſedome mā power god entēt otherwiſe cleane contrary taught god ſpirite haue receaued witte vnderſtandyng reaſon fleſhe worldly wrought abhominable blindneſſe whiche man ſeeke ſelfe owne profite glory honour euen ſpirituall matter alone wilderneſſe man ſeke profite prayſe yet would ſeeke heauen god could myne owne naturall giftes ſeke wayes merites deſeruyngs good workes enter therin way dore chriſte whiche theft chriſte lord ouer ſoeuer man haue god muſte haue geuen hym freely chriſtes ſake haue heauē myne owne deſeruyng myne owne praiſe chriſtes haue fauour grace chriſte myne owne merites alſo deſert free gift contrary free geuing deſeruyng ſtand together thou wilt vow thy good vnto god thou muſt put ſalt vnto thys ſacrifice thou muſte miniſter knowledge dede peter teacheth 2 pet 1 thou muſt put oyle god worde thy lampe accordyng knowledge thou wait comming bridegrome enter hym reſt thou peraduenture wilt hang image moue men deuotion deuotion feruent loue vnto god commaundementes deſire god hys euerlaſtyng promiſes ſhall ſight ſuch rich ſhewed thomas ſhryne walſingham moue mā ſight rich rather cauſe coueteouſnes meane honor god loue commaundements god better deſire bee looſed fleſh god ſhall rather make poore hart ſigh becauſe hath ſuch home wiſhe part another place prieſt ſhall haue god ſtead shall prieſt haue prieſt bought chriſtes bloude chriſtes ſeruaūt owne ought therefore feede chriſtes flocke chriſtes doctrine miniſter chriſtes sacramentes vnto purely loue filthy lucre ſake lorde ouer peter teatheth 1 pet v paul act xx beſide chriſt oures gift geuen v heyres chriſt chriſtes wherefore prieſtes doctrine oures heyres foode ſoules therfore whether dyd papiſt ſo miniſter truly freely vnto v wythout ſellyng theef ſoule murtherer euen ſo take vpon hym feede v haue wherwith like concluſion becauſe alſo haue chriſtes therfore prieſt heyre v alſo haue receiued god wherfore much yt prieſt wayteth yt word god ſeruaunt therin therfore right detters owe ſufficient liuyng goodes euen thereto wyfe daughter owe vnto hym hee require nowe haue appoynted yet y• ſpiritualities pillage theyr ſtanding ſtipēd ſufficiente liuyng whether tythes rente yearely wage ought content require yet receaue enſample ſoberneſſe deſpiſing worldly thing vnto enſample hys pariſhioners wilte thou vowe offer vnto poore people pleaſaunt good vowe kepe god commaundementes ſight god left almes vpon chriſtes ſtead right heyres aboundaunce ouerplus moreouer muſt haue ſchole teache god worde though needed bee ſo coſtly therfore lawfull vow vnto building maintenāce therof vnto helping good workes ought vow pay cuſtome tolle rent maner duty whatſoeuer owe god commaundement howe thou mayſt lawfully goe pilgrimage thou wilt vowe pilgrimage thou muſt put ſalt therto like manner ſhall accepted thou vowe go viſite poore heare god word whatſoeuer edifieth thy ſoule vnto loue good worke knowledge whatſoeuer god commaundeth wel done ſacrifice ſauoureth well ye wil happly ſay ye go place becauſe god hath choſen one place another wyll heare petition one place another prayer muſt according god worde ye may deſire god take vengeaunce hym whome god worde teacheth pity pray gloſe god one god heareth al call vppon tymes al place alyke place another ſuppoſe ſal infatuatum ſalt vnſauery wiſdome could excuſe yt deth steuen act 7 died article god dwelleth temple made handes yt beleue god temple god ſayeth paul man loue god keepe hys worde temple god hath god preſently dwellyng witneſſeth chriſt iohn 14 ſaying man loue wyll keepe worde father wyll loue hym wyll come vnto hym dwel hym 15 ſaith ye abyde wordes alſo abyde aſke ye wyll god regardeth hart y• place wee pray ye ſhall haue thou beleue chriſte haſt promiſes whiche god hath made thee thine hart go pilgrimage vnto thyne owne hart pray god wil heare thee hys mercy truthes ſake ſonnes chriſtes ſake ſtones ſakes careth god temple beaſtes haue life much better heape ſtones couched together ſpeake chaſtity gift wilfull chaſtitie mete perſons vow geuen vnto perſones teſtifieth chriſt alſo apoſtle paul wherfore perſons may vow moreouer bee cauſes wherefore many perſons may better lyue chaſt one tyme many may lyue chaſt twenty thirtie certayne cold diſeaſes folowyng xl health come ſo many occupyed wilde phantaſies youth care mariage ſome waxen ſad ſhalbe greatly deſirous daungerous thyng make ſinne none forſweare benefite god bynde thy ſelf vnder payne dānation thy ſoule yu wouldeſt vſe remedy god hath created nede required thyng beware thou get thee falſe fayned chaſtitie falſe fayned chaſtitie made vngodly perſuaſiōs hierome ouide filthy booke remedy agaynſt loue l • ſt throughe ſuch imaginatiōs thou haſt vtterly deſpiſed defied abhorred womankynde thou come ſuch caſe thoroughe fierce wrath god thou canſt neither lyue chaſt finde thy hart mary ſo compelled fall abhomination pope againſt nature kynde moreouer god wiſe father pope reſtrayned god permitted ſetteth liberty god forbiddeth knoweth infirmity child alſo mercyfull therefore hath created remedy without ſinne geuen therto fauour bleſſyng let v wyſer god imaginatiōs tempt godly chaſtitie euery mās gift euen ſo hath day hath power continue owne pleaſure neither hath god promiſed geue ſtil cure infirmity without hys naturall remedy hath promiſed ſlake hys hunger without meate thyrſt without drinke wherfore either let good adminition ſuch wil make vowes thynges byde free god hath created neither vowe god permitteth thee fauour bleſſing alſo el thou wilte nedes vowe vow godly vnder condition thou wilt continue chaſt ſo long god geueth thee gift long neither thyne neceſſitie neither charitie toward thy neighbour authoritie thē vnder whoſe power thou art driue thee vnto contrary purpoſe thy vowe muſt bee ſalted alſo wiſedome god thou mayeſt vowe iuſtified wherunto howe ſhould apply vowes thereby make ſatiſfaction thy ſinnes wynne heauē hyer place diddeſt thou wrong vnto bloud chriſt thy vowe playne idolatry abhominable ſight god thy vow vow made muſt onely vnto furtheraunce commaundementes god haue ſaid nothing tamyng thy member ſeruice thy neighbour thou thincke thy backe weake burthen wedlocke thou canſt rule thy wife child ſeruauntes make prouiſion godly without ouermuch buſying vnquietyng thy ſelfe drownyng thy ſelfe worldly buſyneſſe vnchriſtenly thou canſt ſerue thy neighbour ſome office better beyng chaſt maryed thy vowe faſteth ende thē tame body may waite vpon god deceiueth hym ſelfe good lawfull euen ſo muſt thou vowe abſtinence meates drinkes ſo farre forth profitable vnto thy neighbour vnto tamyng thy fleſhe thou mayſt vowe neither vnto ſlaying thy body paule commaundeth tymothe drincke wyne water becauſe diſeaſes thou wilt ſay timothy happely forſworne wyne thinke ſame apoſtles forſware wedlocke thoughe many lyued chaſt neither yet meate drincke though abſteined good v folow example howbeit though vowe ſweare thinke none exception doynges muſt tende honour god loue neighbour yet breakyng god cō maundemēts except chaunces hange god ſweare certain place certain houre make loueday without exception yet king meane tyme commaunde way muſt goe god commaundement yet breake myne othe like caſe father mother ſicke require preſence wife child houſhold viſited • ny aſſiſtance required neighbour houſe fire ſame houre thouſand ſuch chaunces whiche breake myne othe forſworne ſo forth read god word diligently good hart ſhall teach thee thynges prologue fifte booke moſes called deuteronomy booke worthy read daye night neuer handes moſt excellent bokes moſes boke preachyng fayth loue eaſy alſo lyght pure goſpell yt wit preachyng fayth loue deducyng loue god fayth loue man neighbour yt loue god herein alſo thou mayſt learne right meditation thou mayeſt learne right meditation contemplation contemplation nothyng el ſaue yt calling minde repeatyng harte glorious wonderfull dedes god terrible handling enemy mercyfull entreatyng come hee calleth whiche thyng booke doth almoſt nothyng elles foure firſt chapter rehearſeth benefites god done vnto prouoke loue workes god ſupernatural mightie dedes done aboue natural capacitie faith might beleue god truſt ſtrength thirdly rehearceth fierce plague god vppon enemyes impatiencie vnbeliefe fell hym partly tame abate appetite fleſh alway fight agaynſt ſpirite partely bridle wilde ragyng luſtes ſpirite though muſt abſtaine frō outward euill though loue yet feare vengeance god power good loue yet leſt way ſhould abſtaine outward euill feare wrath cruell vengeaunce whiche ſhould fall vpō ſhortly finde caſt vp god nurter runne riotte beyond lawes ordinaunces vnto law god may neither adde miniſh moreouer chargeth put nought take ought away god wordes diligēt onely keepe reēmbraunce hart teach childrē feare forgettyng beware either cō maunded abſtayne image makyng imagery bowyng ſelues vnto image ſaying ye ſaw image god ſpake vnto heard voyce onely voyce keepe thereunto cleaue lyfe ſhall ſaue finally frailtie fleſhe ſhal haue fallen god haue brought trouble aduerſitie combraunce neceſſitie yet repent turne hee god mercyful repent promiſeth god ſhall remē ber mercy receaue grace agayne fifte repeateth x commaūdementes might ſee cauſe loue biddeth remember bound egypt god deliuered thē mighty hande ſtretched arme ſerue kepe maundementes paule ſayth chriſt hath deliuered v therfore ought ſerue neyghbour ſake wee bought chriſtes bloud therefore ſeruauntes owne ought ſeeke wil honour onely loue ſerue one ſake ſixte ſetteth fountaine commaundementes beleue one god doth therfore ought onely bee loued hart ſoule might loue onely fulfillyng loue onely fulfillyng lawes god cōmaundementes paule alſo ſayth vnto romaine galathians likewiſe warneth alſo forget cōmaundementes teache child ſhew child alſo god deliuered bondage egiptians ſerue commaundements child might ſee cauſe worke loue likewiſe ſeuenth together faith muſt truſt onely god ſelues hee remoueth occaſions might withdrawe faith pulleth alſo confidence ſelues ſturreth vp truſt god boldly onely eight chapter thou ſeeſt cauſe temptation man might ſee hart whē brought extremity muſt either ſuffer forſake god ſhall feele much beleue truſt much loue like maner brother howe mā may trye examine hym ſelfe much loueth god neighbour euill good loue cauſe ſee loue god euen ſo hate feele perceaue loue wordly finally hee ſturreth thē fayth loue god driueth frō confidence owne ſelues ninth alſo hee moueth god ſtyrreth vp people vnto fayth vnto fayth put truſt god draweth confidēce ſelues rehearſing ye wickedneſſe whiche wrought firſt day knew vnto ſame day end repeteth right way prayer howe coniured god horeb ouercame prayer thou mayeſt learne right maner pray tenth reckeneth vppe pith lawes keping pith effect ye lawes god law hart feare god loue ſerue hym hart ſoule might kepe cō maundementes loue ſheweth reaſon ſhould euen becauſe god lord heauen earth hath alſo done owne goodneſſe without deſeruyng loue vnto god bringeth loue vnto wee firſte loue god loue wee muſt nedes loue neighbour man neighbour ſaying god lord aboue lordes loueth al ſeruauntes indifferētly well poore feble ſtraūger rich mighty therfore loue poore ſtraunger addeth cauſe ye ſtraungers god deliuered hath brought vnto land ye bee home loue ſtraunger therefore ſake xj exhorteth loue feare god rehearceth terrible dedes god vpō enemyes loue feare god deſpiſe hym rebelled agaynſt hym teſtifieth vnto wil folow loue feare god alſo deſpiſe hym breake commaundement xij hee commaundeth put word god may altered way might occaſion hurt fayth forbiddeth ought owne myndes alter word god xiij forbiddeth herken vnto ought ſaue vnto god word let mā draw v god worde though whiche counſeleth contrary ſhould come miracle paule doth vnto galathians xiiij beaſts forbidden partly vncleanneſſe partly cauſe hate betwene heathen haue conuerſation together one abhorreth eateth ʋnto xv chapter pertaine vnto faith mater common weal loue chiefly xv hee begynneth entreate ſpecially thinges pertainyng vnto common welth equitie exhorteth vnto loue man neighbour xvj among forgetteth ſame xvij entreateth right equitie chiefly ſo much hee looketh vnto faith vnto puniſhment idolater hee yet endeth law loue equitie forbiddyng condemne man vnder leſſe two witneſſes leſt none may condemned vnder two witneſſed commaundeth bryng treſpaſſers vnto open gate citie men go men might heare cauſe ſee right pope hath founde better way euen oppoſe accuſer ſecretly man know whether hee haue right either heare article aunſwere feare leſt people ſhould ſearche whether ſo xviij hee forbiddeth falſe deuiliſh craft hurt true faith moreouer becauſe people could heare voyce law ſpoken chriſt ſauiour declared old teſtament fire promiſeth prophet bring better tydynges whiche ſpoken chriſt sauiour xix ſo forth vnto end xxvij almoſt altogether loue vnto neighbour lawes equitie honeſty thē reſpect vnto faith xxviij terrible chapter trembled chriſren mās hart curſe wrath god ouer al thoſe break lawes might well bleed ſorrow readyng feare wrath like come vpon v accordyng vnto curſes thou readeſt accordyng vnto theſe curſe hath god delt nation fallen abhominations blindneſſe xxix like terrible godly leſſon end ſhold leaue may curious ſearchyng god ſecretes rather ſtudy vnderſtand duety towards god neighbour ſearchyng god ſecrets geue diligence walke accordyng hee hath opened vnto v keepyng commaundementes god teacheth wiſedome thou maieſt ſee ſame chapter moſes ſaith keepe commaundementes ye may vnderſtand ye ought doe ſearch god ſecretes blindeth mā wel proued ſwarmes ſophiſters whoſe wiſe bookes looke scripture founde full fooliſhneſſe prologue prophete ionas made william tyndall enuious philiſlines ſtopped ye welles abraham filled vp earth papiſtes kept scripture lay people becauſe onely publiſhers expoſitors therof put memoriall mynde entent might chalenge grounde euen ſo fleſhly minded hipocrites ſtoppe vp vaynes life ſcripture earth tradition falſe ſimilitudes lying allegory lyke zeale make scripture owne poſſeſſion merchaundice ſo ſhut vp kyngdome heauen god worde neither entring themſelues ſuffering would scripture hath body without ſcripture hath body ſoule within ſoule ſpirite lyfe hath without barke ſhel harde bone fleſhlye mynded gnaw vpon within hath pith cornell mary ſwetenes god elect hath choſen geue hys ſpirite write hys law fayth hys ſonne harte ſcripture conteineth iij thinges firſt lawe condemne ſcripture contayneth iij thinges fleſh secondarily goſpel ſay promiſes mercy al repente knowledge theyr ſinnes preachyng lawe conſent harte lawe good ſubmit themſelues bee ſcholers learne kepe law learn beleue mercye promiſed thirdly ſtories lyues thoſe ſcholers chaunces fortuned alſo meanes ſcholemaiſter taughte made perfect tried ye true falſe hipocrites come maner hipocrites reading law god law put gloſes make thē worldly law ſatiſfied outwarde worke whiche turke may alſo fulfill yet god law neuer ceaſeth condemne man vntil written hys harte vntill keepe naturally without compulſion reſpect ſaue onely pure loue god neighbour naturally eateth hungred without compulſion reſpect ſaue ſlake hys hunger onely come goſpell papiſticall corrupt doctrine papiſts mingle leuen ſay god receiueth v mercy mercy receueth v penaunce witte holy deedes y• make fatte belly v captiues ſoule body yet fayne idole pope ſo mercifull thou make litle money gliſter hys balaams eye neither penance purgatory faſtyng flye heauen ſwift thought twincklyng eye liues ſtories giftes men whith contayned bible papiſtes • ring wreſt ſcriptures reade thinges pertaining vnto tale robin hood thing wot wherto ſerue ſaue faine falſe diſcant iuglyng allegory ſtabliſhe kyngdome one chiefeſt fleſhlieſt ſtudies haue magnifie • aintes aboue meaſure aboue truth poetry make greter thē euer god made find infirmitie ſinne aſcribed vnto ſayntes excuſe diligence diminiſhyng glory mercy god robbyng wretched ſinners theyr comforte thinke therby flatter ſaintes obtayne fauour make ſpeciall aduocates euen man would obtayne fauour worldly tyrauntes alſo fayne ye ſaintes cruell euer heathē man wreakeful vengeable po • te fayne goddes fury torment ſoules bell euens faſted image viſited ſaluted wyth pater noſter prayer onely lippes acquainted harte vnderſtandyng none worſhipped wyth candle offring deuotiō place haue choſen heare ſupplicatiōs make petition clientes therin thou reader thynke law god altogether ſpirituall ſo ſpirituall neuer fulfilled wyth dedes work vntill flowe thyne harte wyth great loue towarde thyne neighbour deſeruyng yea thoughe bee thyne ennemy chriſt loued thee dyed thee deſeruyng thyne euen thou waſt hys ennemy meane tyme infantie childhoode chriſt till grown vp perfect men full knowledge chrſt full loue chriſt agayne neighbour hys ſake enſample hys loue v remēbring fulfillyng law faſt fayth chriſtes bloude coupled profeſſion ſubmit ous ſelues better goſpell promiſes thou meeteſt ſcripture beleue faſt god wyll fulfill vnto thee vnto vttermoſt iot repentance thyne hart thou turneſt hym forſakeſt euill euen hys goodnes fatherly mercy vnto thee thy flatteryng hym hipocritiſhe woorkes thyne owne fayning faſt fayth without reſpect work forgeueneſſe ſinne tyme ignorance luſt conſent ſinne alſo ſynne chaunce frailtie yt come knowledge haue profeſſed law harte dedes ſerue helpe neighbour tame fleſh fall ſinne agayne exerciſe ſoules vertue make ſatiſfaction godwarde ſynne paſte ſtories bible exception y• practiſing ye law goſpel true faythfull enſamples ſure earneſt god euen ſo deale v infirmity temtations lyke caſes chaunces wherin ye ſee one ſide fatherly tenderly cō paſſion god entreateth hys elect ſubmit themſelues ſcholers learne walke wayes hys lawes kepe loue forgate themſelues tyme would ſtirre vp agayne mercy fell hurt themſelues healed agayne compaſſion tendernes hart hath oft brought great tribulation aduerſitie vpon hys elect fatherly god correcteth loueth loue onely teach make ſee owne harte ſynne lay hid might afterward feele hys mercy mercy wayted vpon ridde agayne ſoone wer learned come knowledge god caſteth none away ſuch refuſe kept lawes harken vnto hys voyce harte ſo neuer caſt man away deepe ſo euer ſinned ſaue onely firſt caſt yoke hys lawes neckes vtter de • iaunce malice harte enſamples comfortable v fallen ſinne god come vpon v aſcourge diſpayre repent full hope mercy enſamples mercy gone therfore written learnyng teſtifieth paule rom 15 comfort v might better put hope truſt god ſee mercifull hathe bene tymes paſt vnto weake brethrē gone al aduerſities nede temptation ye horrible ſinnes nowe fell ſide ye ſee hardened harte ſinned malice refuſed mercy hardē harte harken god god caſteth offered power repent periſhed latter ende confuſion ſhame mercileſſely enſāples good neceſſary keepe v awe dread tyme proſperitie thou mayeſt ſee paul 1 cor 10 abide feare god waxe wylde fall vanity ſo ſinne prouoke god bryng wrath vpon v thirdly ye ſee practiſe god merciful long ſuffering euen ſo hys true prophetes preacher bearing open manifeſt trouth contrary vnto enſample pope ſinnyng agaynſt god quench truth holy ſpirite euer chiefe capitaine trompet blower ſet worke ſeketh fredome libertie priuiledge wealth proſperitie pope miniſters perſecutors ouer brother profite pleaſure paſtime honour glory bondage thraldom captiuitie miſery wretchednes vile ſubiection brethrē hys owne cauſe ſo feruent ſo ſtiffe cruell ſuffer one worde ſpoken agaynſt hys falſe maieſtie wily inuentions iugling hipocriſie vnauenged though chriſtendome ſhould ſet together eares ſhould coſt cared many hundred thouſande lyues thou mayeſt read ionas frutefully poetes fable obligation betwene god thy ſoule earneſt penny geuen thee god wyll helpe thee tyme nede thou turne worde god foode lyfe thy ſoule marke note firſt count ionas frend god man choſen god teſtify name vnto world yet yong ſcholer weake rude faſhiō apoſtles whyle chriſt yet bodily thoughe chriſt taught euer meeke humble thēſelues yet oft ſtroue among thēſelues ſhould greateſt ſonnes • ebede would ſitte one right hand chriſt lefte would praye fire might deſcend heauen conſume samaritanes chriſt aſked ſay men peter aunſwered thou art ſonne liuyng god though peter bene perfecte angel immediatly whē chriſt preached vnto hys death paſſion peter angry rebuked chriſt thought earneſtly raued wiſt ſayde another time chriſt ſo feruently cruell opiniō diſciples chriſt buſied healyng people leiſure eat went hold ſuppoſing bene beſide hymſelfe one caſt diuels chriſtes name forbade becauſe wayted ſo glorious yet though chriſt taught alway ignoraunce imperfection apoſtles forgeue yet peter long goyng ſchole aſked whether men ſhould forgeue ſeuen tymes thinkyng viij tymes bene much laſt ſupper peter would haue dyed chriſt yet within houres denyed cowardly ſhamefully ſame maner though ſo long heard man might auenge ſelf rather turne cheeke ſmite agayne yet chriſt takyng peter aſked whether lawful ſmite ſword taried none aunſwere layed raſhly though come firſt vnto knowledge truth peace made betwene god v loue lawes beleue truſt father haue good harte vnto borne new ſpirite yet childrē young ſcholers weake feble muſt haue leyſure grow vſed law fully ſtrife parteners good equally diuided take euery man part lot auoyde ſuſpition diſceitfulneſſe apoſtles firſt actes ſought ſuccede iudas traitour two perſōs preſented breake ſtrife dout much hand god leſſe mightie preſeruyng ionas alyue agaynſt naturall poſſibilitie deliueryng ſafe fiſh raiſing vp chriſt agayne ſepulchre may deſcribe power vertue reſurrection thereby chriſt extortion ſinne exceeding meritorious make many diſciples teach thē feare god hys ordinaunces care hye prelate ſo defended papiſtes taught thē ſelues theyr workes withall crueltiē right holy church worldly fleſhip interpretation ſcriptures iewes harte hardened falſe righteouſnes wer diſobediēt vnto righteouſnes god whiche forgeueneſſe ſinne chriſtes bloud could beleue ſo thorow fleſhly interpretyne law falſe imagined righteouſnes harte hardened made ſtony clay whot furnace fire could receiue neither repentance fayth moyſture grace heathen niniuites though blinded luſtes yet werin thoſe two poyntes vncorrupte vnhardened therfore •• repented preachyng ionas preachyng ionas came vnto knowledge ſinnes confeſſed repented truly turned euery man hys euil dedes declared ſorrow hart true repentaunce theyr deedes fayth hope forgeueneſſe chaſtieing body prayer faſtyng takyng pleaſures fleſh truſtyng god angry wickedneſſe euen ſo ſhould forgeue mercy repented forſoke miſſeliuing laſt ende thou haſt good profitable example yet goodly enſample learnyng ſee earthy ionas ſtill trying yt whale belly ſo ſore diſpleſed becauſe niniuites periſhed wery hys life wiſhed death ſorow loſt glory hys propheſiyng yt hys prophecie came paſſe god rebuked hym likenes ſaying greueth thine hart loſſe vile ſhrub ſpray wheron thou beſtowedſt labour coſt neither thine handy work much ſhould greue myne hart loſſe ſo great multitude innocentes niniue mine hādes worke nay note • great mercy god ionas god ouer father well vnto heathen vnto iewes merciful warneere ſmite neither threate ſo cruelly prophet forgeue repent aſke mercy neither ſide whatſoeuer promiſe fulfill ſaue ſakes onely truſt ſubmit themſelues keepe lawes loue naturall child maner read scripture right maner read scripture right vſe therof holy ghoſt cauſed written thou firſt ſeke yt law god wyll haue thee interpreting ſpiritually without gloſe couering brightnes moſes face ſo thou feele thyne harte damnable ſinne god loue thy neighbour thine enemy purely chriſt loued thee loue thy neighbour thyne hart haue committed already ſinne againſt therfore vntill loue come thou muſt knowledge vnfainedly ſinne beſt deede thou doeſt muſt erneſtly greue thine hart thou muſt waſh thy good dedes chriſtes bloud ere pure acceptable ſacrifice vnto god muſt deſire god father ſake take thy dedes worth deedes made perfect chriſtes bloud pardon imperfectneſſe geue thee power thē better feruent loue ſide thou muſt ſerch diligently promiſes mercye god hath promiſed thee two poynces witte law ſpiritually interpreted howe damnable ſynne vnfayned loue ground bottome harte enſample chriſtes loue v becauſe equally created formed one god father indifferently bought redemed one bloude ſauiour ieſus chriſt promiſes geuen vnto repentyng ſoule thurſteth longeth promiſed made god chriſt made thē repent thē pure fatherly mercy god thorow fayth deſeruyng dedes merites workes chriſtes ſake lone merites deſeruynges hys workes death paſſions ſuffered together v hymſelf two two keyes open • scripture poyntes ſay bee written thyne hart keyes ſo open scripture vnto thee creature locke thee thou ſhalt go find paſture foode euery theſe leſſons written thyne hart ſcripture ſhut vp cornel ſhale ſo thou mayeſt read commen reherſe ſtories diſpute wittily profounde ſophiſter yet vnderſtand one iot thereof thirdly thou take ſtories lyues contained bible ſure vndoubted enſamples god ſo wil deale v vnto worldes ende ¶ herewith reader farewell commended vnto god vnto grace hys ſpirit firſt ſee yt thou ſtoppe thyne eares vnto callyng god harden thine hart beguiled fleſhly interpreting law falſe imagined hipocritiſh righteouſnes leaſt niniuites riſe thee day iudgement condemne thee ſecondarily thou fynde ought amiſſe thou ſeeſt thy ſelfe glaſſe god worde thinke neceſſary wiſdome amend ſame betymes moniſhed warned enſample men rather tary vntill thou beaten alſo thirdly ſhall ſo chaunce wylde luſtes thy fleſh ſhall blynde thee cary thee cleane away wt fruitfull good leſſon tyme yet yt latter end god mercy ſhall haue compaſſed thee euery ſyde temtations tribulation aduerſities combrance bryng thee home againe vnto thine owne harte ſet thy ſinnes thou wouldeſt ſo fayne couer put mynde delectation voluptuous paſtunes eye thy conſcience cal faythfull enſample ionas like ſtories vnto thy remembrance ionas turne vnto thy father thou mayſt tymes apply ſtories bible thy great comfort ſmote thee caſt thee away lay coroſie fretting plaiſter vnto pocke lay hidde fret inward draw diſeaſe make appeare thou mighteſt feele thy ſicknes danger therof come receiue healyng plaiſter mercy forget whatſoeuer enſample mercy god hath ſhewed ſince beginnyng world law muſt fulfilled mercy chriſt ſame promiſed thee thou wylt like maner turne agayne receiue ionas bee knowen thy ſinne confeſſe knowledge vnto thy father law fretteth thy conſcience thine hart none outward thing euen ſo ſeeke within thy hart plaiſter mercy promiſes forgeuenes sauiour ieſus chriſt accordyng vnto enſamples mercy yt gone ionas let wait vanity ſeke god euery temple ſaue harte go ſeke thou teſtament god thyne harte thyne hart word law thine thy hart wordes law thine hart promiſes mercy chriſt hart word faith promiſes mercy ieſus chriſt thou confeſſe repentyng hart knowledge ſurely beleue ieſus lord ouer ſinne thou art ſafe finally rage thy conſcience ceaſed quieted faſt faith promiſes mercy thē offer ionas offring prayſe thankeſgeuyng pay vowe thy baptiſme god onely ſaueth ſinne ſelues remiſſion ſorgeuenes therof commeth frely mercy god chriſtes ſake onely mercy goodnes beleue ſtedſaſtly preach cō ſtātly god onely ſmiteth god onely healeth aſcribyng cauſe thy tribulation vnto thyne owne ſinne cauſe thy deliuerance vnto yt mercy god beware leuen ſayth haue power free preaching goſpel deſerue grace kepe law congruite god bee vnrighteous ſay iohn firſt law geuen moſes euen ſo grace fulfill geuen chriſt ſay deedes grace deſerue heauen ſay thou paule rom vj euerlaſtyng lyfe gift god thorough ieſus chriſte lorde made ſonnes fayth iohn therefore heires god chriſt rom viij ſay receaue god faith foloweth repentaunce doe workes vnto god either vnto ſelues ſlay ſinne god hath nede work muſt thē ſelues profite neighbor remaineth fleſhe waxe perfect either vnto neighbour much v agayne thynges man excedeth giftes grace let vnderſtand geuen well weake brother ſelf though bread committed vnto panter yet felowes whiche geue thee thankes vnto lord recompence panter agayn kynde ſeruice office ſay chriſt hath made frailtie baptiſme receaue ſigne yet renewed agayne repentance fayth chriſtes bloud twaine yt ſigne baptiſme euen continued among v baptiſing young childrē doth euer kepe v mind call v backe vnto math vi ye ſhall forgeue theyr fautes heauenly father ſhall forgeue ye ſhall forgeue men faultes ſhall father forgeue faultes alſo vertue ſtrēgth couenaunt wherewith god mercy hath bounde ſelfe v thē may bold truſt god chriſt deſeruing mercy god hath promiſed bounde ſelfe v ſhew v mercy father almighty v ſo ſhall neede feare power aduerſaries mā ſubmitteth ſelfe kepe cōmaundements good 〈…〉 forſake euill turne god kepe hys lawes fight agaynſt ſelues corrupt nature perpetually may god euery day better better thys haue ſayd moſt deare reader warne thee leaſt thou ſhouldſt deceyued bee euen ſo woordes chriſt iohn 3 well confirme condemnation ſayth light come world men loued darkenes light deedes euill behold light god worde commeth man whether reade heare preached teſtified yet refuſed mercy offered hym god offreth mercy vpon conditiō mende hys liuing wyll come vnder couenaunte houre forward waxech worſe worſe god taking hys ſpirit mercy grace vnthankfulnes ſake paul writeth rom 1 heathen becauſe whē knew god luſt honour hym wyth godly liuing therfore god poured wrath vpon tooke hys ſpirit gaue thē vp harte luſtes ſerue ſinne iniquitie iniquitie till thorowly hardened paſt repentance pharao becauſe ye word god countrey god people ſcattred throughout lād yet neither loued thē therfore god gaue hym vp takyng hys ſpirit grace hym ſo hardened hys hart couetouſnes afterward myracle could conuerte hym hereunto pertaineth yt parable talentes mat 25 lord commaū deth harkeneth word god doth ſame ſhalbe bleſſed deede talent taken away euill ſlouthfull ſeruant bynde hym hand foote caſt hym vtter darkenes geue talent vnto hym ten ſaying haue ſhall geuen hym hath hath ſhal taken hym ſay hath good harte toward word god garniſh godly liuyng teſtify ye ſame ſhall increaſe daily grace chriſt loueth lyue therafter edify ſame ſhall looſe grace true knowledge blinded agayne euery day wax worſe worſe blynder blynder tyll vtter enemy worde god hys hart ſo couenauntes turneth deſperation tyme tribulatiō god commeth iudge vineyard mat 21 planted hyred huſbandmen would render lorde fruit due tyme therfore takē hyred doth confirme ſame chriſte ſayth ſo locked vppe knockyng vayne though many take great payn god ſake luke 13 figge tree beareth fruite cōmaunded plucked vp finally hereto pertayneth infinyte terrible parable vncleane ſpirite luke 11 hee caſt hee commeth vncleane ſpirit returneth worſe ſort thē hee caſt forth findeth hys houſe ſwept garniſhed taketh hym 7 worſe hymſelfe commeth entreth dwelleth ſo yt ende man worſe beginnyng woorkes hereſy chylde perdition wicked biſhop rome hys lawyer hath broughte v chriſten abhominable idolater thē become ten tymes worſe end beginning firſt idolatry ſoone ſpyed eaſie rebuked prophet ſours worde 〈◊〉 god tame ſcourge thē ſelues thē god plague 〈◊〉 ſcourge chaſte hys fleſh hym wyll lord chaſtice ſcourge euery day ſharper ſharper tribulation miſfortune nothyng ſhall proſper ſhall go tender mercy god kepe meane let v ſo put truſt mercy god chriſt know duetie kepe law god loue neighbour father ſake whiche created lord ſake redemed bought thē ſo dearely bloud lette v walke yt feare god haue eye open vnto partes god couenaunts beyng certified none ſhalbe partaker mercy ſaue hee fight againſt fleſh kepe lawe let v arme ſelues remembraunce yt chriſts workes iuſtifie ſinne ſet v chriſtes deedes • et v fauour god owne helpe v continue fauour fauour god ſo owne dedes workyng ſpirite god helpe v continue fauour grace chriſt hath brought v longer continue fauour grace harte kepe law furthermore concernyng lawe god generall concluſion whole lawe whether ceremony ſacrifices yea sacramentes either preceptes equitie betwene man man throughout al degree world geuē profite neceſſitie onely nede god hath keping thē yt ioy encreaſed therby dede dede ſelfe doth pleaſe god requireth v whē one doe put truſt loue loue euery man neighbour pity hym haue compaſſion needes mercyfull vnto euen ſo chriſt teſtifieth vij math lawe prophetes thou wouldſt done accordyng meane doctrine scripture thou wouldeſt haue done thee law requireth prophet loue fulfilling lawand paul rom xiij affirmeth alſo yt loue fulfillyng law loueth doth owne accorde law requireth tim paul ſayth loue pure hart good conſcience faith vnfayned end fulfillyng law faith vnfained chriſtes bloud cauſeth ye loue chriſtes ſake loue pure loue onely onely faith cauſe loue cauſe good conſcience conſcience pure whē eye looketh chriſt deedes doe ſake owne ſingular aduaūtage wicked purpoſe iohn hys goſpel alſo epiſtles ſpeaketh neuer law loue one purely affirmyng haue god ſelfe dwellyng v god deſireth loue one seyng fayth god loue mercyfulneſſe neighbour ye law requireth therfore neceſſitie lawe muſt vnderſtand interprete inferiour lawes kept obſerued lōg ſeruaūts faith loue brokē immediatly thorough occaſion hurt either fayth whiche ſhould haue godward confidence chriſtes bloud loue whiche owe neighbour chriſtes ſake therfore blinde phariſeis murmured grudged diſciples brake sabboth day tradition elder ſelf eate publicanes ſinners aunſwered math ix allegyng eſayas ye prophet go rather learne meaneth require mercy ſacrifice god requireth mercie ſacrificeand math xij oh ye wiſt meaneth require mercy ſacrifice onely loue mercyfulneſſe vnderſtandeth law el nothyng hath writtē hart ſhall neuer vnderſtand law though al angel heauen went teache hath grauen onely loue vnderſtandeth law hart ſhal onely vnderſtand law alſo ſhall owne inclinatiō required law though neuer law bene geuen mother ſelues without law vnto child required law loue ouercommyng payne grief tediouſneſſe lothſomneſſe euen ſo doubt continued firſt ſtate innocencie ſhould euer haue fulfilled law without compulſion law bicauſe law doctrine throughe teachyng euery man duetie doth vtter corrupt nature ſufficiently deſcribed moſes therfore litle mention made therof new teſtament ſaue loue onely wherin law included ſeldome mētion made new teſtament old law ſaue promiſes made vnto thē chriſt ſhould come bleſſe deliuer goſpel new teſtamēt ſhould preached publiſhed vnto nation goſpellthe goſpell eternall life promiſed beleue death vnbeleuyng deedes kepe law rewarded temporall promiſes lyfe beleue chriſt chriſtes deedes haue purchaſed eternall promiſe euerlaſtyng lyfe cōmit nothyng worthy iuſt ſinnefull nature rebuked alſo neighbour haue offended perſon particularly contrition ſorowfulnes ſuch damnable ſinners haue ſinned wholy enclined ſinne ſtill thirdly fayth old • doctours haue neighbour haue hurt congregation god whome haue offended open crime found ſubmittyng man ſelfe vnto congregation churche chriſt officer ſame haue lyfe corrected gouerned henceforth accordyng true doctrine yt church chriſt note ſatiſfaction amēdes makyng counted righteouſneſſe world purgyng ſinne ſo world whē haue made full mendes hath complayne euen ſo fayth chriſtes bloud counted righteouſneſſe purging ſinne god moreouer ſinneth agaynſt brother ſinneth alſo againſt father almighty god ſynne committed agaynſt brother purged world makyng amendes aſking forgeuenes euen ſo ſinne righteous ye appeare worlde wherfore whether ye call metonoia repētance 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 conuerſion turning agayne god either amendyng c whether ye ſay repent conuerted turne god amend liuing ye luſt • n content ſo ye vnderſtande ment therby haue declared ¶ elder olde teſtament temporall hee nameth thē elder prieſts head ruler iewes gouernaunce ouer laye common people called elder ye may ſee foure euangeliſtes cuſtome paule epiſtle alſo peter call prelate ſpirituall gouernours whiche biſhops prieſtes elder nowe whether ye call elder prieſts one ſo ye vnderſtād officer ſeruaunts worde god vnto men hie lowe rebell againſt chriſt muſt obey lōg preach rule truely longer prologue made vppon goſpell marke william tyndall marke read act 12 william tyndals prologue vpon goſpell marke peter looſed priſon angell came markes mother houſe many diſciples praying hys deliueraunce paul barnabas tooke hym ieruſalem brought hym antioche act 12 act 13 paule barnabas tooke marke ſente preach whome alſo departed appeareth yt ſaid chapter returned ieruſalem agayne act 15 paule barnabas variaunce hym paule willing take hym becauſe forſoke firſt iorney notwithſtanding yet paule wrote epiſtle colloſſians marke hym ſayth yt fourth chapter whō paule alſo teſtifieth hee barnabas ſiſters ſonne alſo fellowe worker kyngdome god 2 timothie 4 paul cōmaundeth timothie bring marke wyth hym affirmyng needefull hym miniſter hym finally alſo peter wrote hys firſt epiſtle ſo familiar peter calleth hym hys ſonne whereof ye ſee learned hys goſpel euen apoſtles hys continuall conuerſation alſo authoritie writing worthy credence prologue made vppon goſpell luke william tyndall lvcas paules companion leaſt way prologue w tyndall vpon goſpell luke 16 actes forth hym tribulation went paule hys laſt goyng vp ieruſalem thence followed paul ceſarea lay two yere priſon ceſarea went paul rome lay ij yeares priſon paul whē wrote coloſſians teſtifieth fourth chapter ſaying beloued lucas phiſitian ſaluteth paul wrote ſecond epiſtle timothie ſayeth 4 chapter ſaying onely lucas wherby ye ſee autoritie man credence reuerence hys writing worthy thereto whome learned ſtory goſpell hymſelfe ſayth familiaritie chriſt euer one yt thre witneſſes moſt ſecret thing cauſe writing certaine hereſies aroſe tyme namely ij one denyed chriſt god man become fleſhe nature man agaynſt whiche ij hereſies wrote goſpell alſo firſt epiſtle beginnyng goſpell ſayth worde thing beginning god alſo god thinges created alſo made fleſh ſay became man dwelt among v ſayth ſaw glory beginnyng hys epiſtle ſayth vpon epiſtle paule romaine william tyndall foraſmuch epiſtle principal epiſtle romaynes excellenteſt part new teſtament moſt excellent part new teſtament moſt pure euangelion ſay glad riding call goſpell alſo light way vnto whole ſcripture thinke meete euery chriſten man onely know roate without boke alſo exerciſe himſelf therin euermore continually daily bread ſoule man verily read oft ſtudy prepare way therunto ſo farreforth god ſhall geue grace may better vnderſtand euery man hath ben hitherto euill darkened gloſes wonderful dreames ſophiſters man could ſpy intent meanyng neuertheleſſe ſelfe bright lyght ſufficient geue light vnto ſcripture firſt muſt marke diligently muſt note theſe wordes law ſinne c law vnderſtand maner ſpeakyng apoſtle aboue thing know paul meaneth theſe wordes law ſinne grace fayth righteouſnes fleſh ſprite ſuch lyke el read thou neuer ſo ofte thou ſhalt looſe thy labor word lawe may vnderſtand common manner vſe paul terme maner men man wayes thou wouldeſt ſay law place nothyng learnyng techeth ought done ought done goeth man law law fulfilled outward workes though harte neuer ſo far god iudgeth grounde harte ye thoughtes ſecret mouinges mynde therfore hys law requireth grounde hart loue bottome therof law god requireth bottom harte content outward worke onely rebuketh thoſe workes moſt ſpryng loue ground low bottome hart though appeare outward neuer ſo honeſt good chriſt goſpell rebuketh phariſes aboue open ſinners calleth hipocrites ſay simulars paynted sepulcher phariſes yet liued men ſo pure pertayning outward dedes workes yt law ye paul third chapter epiſtle vnto philippiās confeſſeth himſelfe touching lawe ſuch one man coulde complayne notwithſtandyng yet murderer chriſten per paul great perſecutor chriſtians ſecuted tormented ſo ſore compelled blaſpheme chriſt altogether mercileſſe many fayne outward good workes cauſe 115 pſalme calleth men lyers becauſe man kepeth law ground harte neither kepe men naturally inclyned vnto euill hate law fynde ſelues vnluſt tediouſnes good luſt delectation euill free luſt good bottom hart fulfilleth law doute willing good doth ſinne raign v alſo ſinne wrathe deſerued god though neuer ſo great outwarde ſhew apparance honeſt liuing cauſe concludeth paule ſecond chapter iewes ſinners tranſgreſſors law thoughe make men beleue thorow hipocriſie outward work fulfill law ſayth onely whiche doth law righteous god meanyng therby man fulfill law chriſt onely mā outward workes fulfilleth law thou ſaith iewe teacheſt mā ſhould breake wedlocke yet breakeſt wedlocke thy ſelfe wherin thou iudgeſt man therein condemneſt thou thy ſelfe thou thy ſelfe doeſt euen ſame thynges whiche thou iudgeſt thoughe hee would ſay thou liueſt outwardly well workes law iudgeſt liue ſo thou teacheſt men ſeeſt mote mās eie art ware beame thyne owne eye though thou keepe lawe outwardly work feare rebuke ſhame puniſhment either loue reward vantage vayne glory yet doeſt thou without luſt loue toward law haddeſt leuer great deale otherwiſe thou diddeſt feare lawe ye inwardly thine harte thou wouldeſt law p •• e perfect kepyng law • • e 〈◊〉 yet god author venger lawe poſſible ſo paynefull vnto thee haue thyne appetite refrayned bee kepte downe wherfore playne concluſion thou grounde bottome thyne hart art enemy law preuayleth thou teacheſt man ſteale thou thyne owne ſelfe art thefe thyne hart outwardly wouldeſt fayne ſteale thou durſt though outward dedes abyde alway behind ſuch hypocrite diſſimulers breake forth among euen euill ſcabbe pocke alwayes kept violence medicine thou teacheſt man teacheſt thy ſelfe ye 〈…〉 • inward loue thou w •… eſt thou teacheſt thou vnderſtadeſt law right fulfilled ſatiſfied inward loue affection much leſſe fulfilled outward deedes workes onely law encreaſeth ſinne moreouer law encreaſeth ſinne ſayth fift chapter becauſe mā enemie law much requireth ſo many thinges cleane contrarie nature wherof able fulfill one pointe title law requireth therfore prouoked haue greater luſt breake whiche cauſes ſake ſayth ſeuenth chapter lawe law ſpiritual ſpirituall though would ſay law wer fleſhly man doctrine might fulfilled ſatiſfied ſtilled outward deedes law ghoſtly man fulfilleth except doth ſpryng loue bottome hart new hart luſty courage vnto law ward canſt thou neuer come thyne owne ſtrength enforcement operation workyng ſpirite ſpirite god onely maketh man ſpirituall ſpirite god maketh mā ſpirituall like vnto law ſo hence forth hee doth nothyng feare lucre vantage ſake vaine glory free hart inward luſt law ſpirituall wilbe loued fulfilled ſpirituall hart therefore neceſſitie requireth ſpirit maketh man hart free geueth luſt courage vnto law ward ſuch law good righteous holy ſpirite remaineth ſinne grudging hatred againſt law law neuertheleſſe good righteous holy acquaint thy ſelfe therfore maner ſpeakyng apoſtle let ſticke faſt thyne hart one dedes workes law fulfill law worke yt law workes law fulfilling law two thing ſoeuer man doth doe owne free owne proper ſtrength enforcing notwithſtandyng thoughe neuer ſo great workyng yet long remaineth hart vnluſt tediouſnes grudgyng grief payne lothſ • nne compulſion toward law ſo long workes vnprofitable loſt ye damnable ſight god meaneth paule iij chapter ſayth dedes lawe ſhall fleſhe iuſtified ſight god hereby perceaueſt thou thoſe ſophiſters diſceauers whiche teach man may muſt prepare ſelfe grace fauour god good workes workes law man iuſtified cā prepare ſelues vnto fauour god whiche good ſelues good thinke good thought conſent good deuill poſſeſſing harte myndes thoughtes captiue pleaſure cā thoſe workes pleaſe god thinkeſt thou whiche done grief payne tediouſnes euill contrary grudgyng mynde holy ſaint proſperous mightely scripture paule diddeſt thou confound hereſie twelue hundred yeares goe therupon fulfill law yt workes therof ſoeuer lawe commaundeth law ſpiritual ſo muſt fulfilled ſpiritually loue luſt inward affection delectation lyue godly well freely willyngly without compulſion lawe euen thoughe lawe luſt free libertie loue law commeth onely workyng ſpirite hart hee ſayth firſt chapter ſpirite none otherwiſe geuen fayth onely beleue promiſes god without waueryng god true fulfill hys good promiſes toward v chriſtes blonde ſake playne firſt chapter aſhamed ſayth paule chriſtes true fayth ſpirit god glad tydynges power god vnto ſaluation many beleue together euen beleue glad tydynges preached v holy ghoſt entreth harte looſeth bondes deuill whiche poſſeſſed harte captiuitie held could haue luſt yt god law ſpirite commeth fayth onely euen ſo fayth commeth hearyng word glad tidynges god chriſt preached hee god ſonne man alſo dead riſen againe ſakes iuſtification fayth chriſt ſayth thyrd fourth tenth chapter iuſtifying commeth faith faith ſpirite come god v hereof commeth fayth onely iuſtifieth maketh righteous fulfilleth law bringeth ſpirit chriſtes deſeruinges ſpirite bringeth luſt looſeth hart maketh free ſetteth hym libertie geueth ſtrength worke deedes lawe loue euen law requireth laſt ſame fayth ſo workyng hart ſpryng good workes owne accorde meaneth thyrd chapter hath caſt away true fayth ſpringeth good worke • workes law ſo ſoundeth though would breake diſanulle law fayth aunſwereth might bee layd agaynſt ſaying deſtroy law fayth mayntaine ſtabliſh law fayth ſay fulfill law thorough fayth sinne scripture called • ſynne outward worke onely committed body whole buſines ſo euer accompanyeth moueth ſtirreth vnto outward sinne deede whence workes ſpring vnbelefe pronenes readynes vnto deede grounde hart power affection appetite wherwith ſinne ſo ſay man ſinneth caried awaye headlong ſinne together much poyſon inclination corrupt nature wherein hee conceiued hart fayth onely iuſtifieth bryngeth ſpirit luſt vnto outward good workes euen ſo vnbelefe onely damneth keepeth ſpirit prouoketh fleſh ſtyrreth vp luſt vnto euill outwarde work fortuned adam eu • righteous ſafe cauſe heare goſpell glad tidinges fayne owne ſtrength certaine imagination thoughtes harte ſaying haue heard goſpell falſe fained faith remember ſtory loe beleue counte right fayth neuertheleſſe man imagination faining euen ſo profiteth neither followe good workes amendmēt liuing right fayth thing wrought holy ghoſt v chaungeth v turneth v new nature begetteth v new god maketh v ſonnes god thou readeſt firſt iohn killeth olde adam maketh v altogether new hart mynde wyll luſt affectiōs power ſoule bringeth holye goſt fayth liuely thing true faith liuely mighty working valiant ſtrong euer doyng euer fruitfull ſo vnpoſſible whiche endued therwith ſhould worke alwayes good workes without ceaſing aſketh fayth idle whether good workes done hath done already ere mention made alway ſuch nature quicke fayth hys hart liuely mouyng ſprite driue hym ſtirre hym therunto whoſoeuer doth good woorkes vnbeleuyng perſon faithles loketh roūd groping faith good work woteth faith good workes meane though bable neuer ſo many thinges faith good workes fayth liuely ſtedfaſt truſt fauour god wherewith true definition fayth commit ſelues altogether vnto god truſt ſo ſurely grounded ſticketh ſo faſt harte mā would doubt though ſhould die thouſand tymes therefore ſuche truſt wrought holy goſt faith maketh man glad luſty chereful true harted vnto god vnto creature meanes wherof willingly without compulſion glad redy good euery man ſeruice euery man ſuffer thinges yt god may loued prayſed hath geuen hym ſuch grace ſo impoſſible ſeparate good workes good worke • cannot ſeparate true fayth fayth euen impoſſible ſeparate heat burning fire therfore take hede thy ſelfe beware thyne owne fantaſies imagination iudge fayth good workes wyll ſeme wyſe dede ſtarke blind thing moſt fooliſh pray god wyll vouchſafe worke faith thine hart el ſhalte thou remayne euermore faythleſſe fayne thou imagine thou enforce thou wraſtle thy ſelf thou wilt canſt righteouſnes euen ſuch faythe righteouſnes vnderſtād called god righteouſneſſe righteouſnes value god god gift altereth man chaungeth new ſpiritual nature maketh free liberall pay euery man duety fayth mā purged ſinnes obteyneth luſte vnto law god whereby geueth god hys honor payeth hym oweth hym vnto men doth ſeruice willingly wherwith ſoeuer payeth euery man duety righteouſnes nature freewill owne ſtrength neuer bring paſſe man geue himſelfe faith ſo take away vnbeliefe take away ſinne wherefore falſe hipocriſie ſinne whatſoeuer done without fayth vnbeliefe euident 14 chapter vnto romains though appeare neuer ſo glorious beautiful outwardes fleſhe ſprite mayeſt thou fleſh ſpirite • ow vnderſtand vnderſtand though fleſh onely pertayneth vnto vnchaſtitie ſpirite inwardly pertayneth harte paul calleth fleſh
