ſpiritual procede faith ſoeuer done lawes god though wrought body wiping ſhooes ſuch like ſoeuer groſe appeare outward ſuch vnderſtādyng theſe wordes canſt thou neuer vnderſtand epiſtle paule neither place holy scripture take hede therfore ſoeuer vnderſtādeth theſe wordes otherwiſe ſame vnderſtā deth paule ſoeuer prepare ſelues vnto epiſtle much becommeth preacher chriſtes glad tydings firſt neceſſary profitable inſtruction preacher openyng law rebuke thinges proue thynges ſinne procede ſpirite faith chriſt proue men ſinners child wrath inheritaunce howe ſinne nature nature otherwiſe doe ſinne therewith abate pride man bring vnto knowledge ſelfe miſerie wretchednes might deſire helpe euen ſo doth paule beginneth firſt chapter rebuke vnbelefe maner paūles doctrine groſe ſinnes men ſee idolatrie groſe ſinnes heathen ſinnes whiche liue ignoraunce without fayth without fauour god ſayth wrath god heauen appeareth goſpell vpon men vngodly vnholy lyuyng though knowē dayly vnderſtād nature ſo blinde cā ſee vnderſtand goodnes god hys mercy ſhewed vnto v chriſt ieſu hys • owne creature one god yet nature herſelf ſpirit grace ſo corrupt ſo poyſoned men neither thanke neither worſhip neither geue due honor blind thē ſelues faule without ceaſyng worſe caſe euen vntill come vnto worſhipping image workyng ſhamefull ſinnes whiche abhominable agaynſt nature moreuer ſuffer ſhame vnrebuked hauing delectation pleaſure therein ſecond chapter procedeth rebuketh thoſe holy people alſo whiche without luſt loue law liue wel outwardly paule cōdemneth hipocriſi • face world condemne gladly nature hypocrite thinke ſelues pure reſpect open ſinners yet hate law inwardly full couetouſnes enuy vnclēnes math xxiij theſe whiche deſpiſe goodnes god accordyng hardenes harte heape together thē ſelues wrath god furthermore paule paul rebuketh hypocrite true expounder law ſuffreth man without ſinne declareth vnder ſinne whiche freewill nature liue well ſuffreth better thē open ſinners yea calleth hard harted ſuch repent thyrd chapter mingleth together iewes gentile ſayth one difference betwene iewe gentile ſinners difference betwene ſaue onely iewes word god committed vnto though many beleued thereon yet god truth promiſe thereby neither hurt miniſhed taketh way allegeth ſaying 50 pſalme god might abyde true wordes ouercome iudged returneth purpoſe agayn proueth men ſinners scripture men without difference exceptiō ſinners workes law mā iuſtified law geuen vtter declare ſinne onely thē hee begynneth ſheweth right way vnto righteouſnes meanes waye howe wee muſt bee made righteous mē muſt made righteous ſafe ſayth ſinners without prayſe god muſt without deſeruyng made righteous throughe fayth chriſte hath deſerued ſuch righteouſnes v become vnto v god mercyſtole remiſſion ſinnes paſt thereby prouyng chriſtes righteouſnes commeth v fayth helpeth v onely whiche righteouſnes ſayth declared goſpell teſtified lawe prophetes furthermore ſayth faith obteineth fulfillyng law law holpē furthered thorough fayth thoughe workes therof boaſt brought nought iiij chapter 3 firſt chapter ſinnes opened way faith vnto rightuouſnes layd begynneth aunſwere vnto certain obiections cauillations firſt putteth forth thoſe blinde reaſons whiche commonly wilbe iuſtified owne workes wont make heare faith onely without workes iuſtifieth ſaying ſhall men good paule aūſwereth caueling queſtion papiſtes vſe agaynſt iuſtificatiō faith onely workes yea fayth onely iuſtifieth nedeth man ſtudie good workes putteth forth therfore abraham enſample ſaying abraham workes vayne came workes profite ſo concludeth abraham without al workes iuſtified made righteous ſo much worke circumciſiō prayſed scripture called righteous fayth onely gene xv worke circumciſion bee holpen vnto righteouſneſſe whiche yet god commaunded hym good worke obedience likewiſe doubt none workes helpe thyng vnto mās iuſtifiyng abraham circumciſiō outward ſigne wherby declared righteouſnes fayth obedience readynes vnto god euen ſo good workes outward ſignes outward frutes fayth good workes ou • ward ſignes true fayth ſpirite iuſtifie man man iuſtified already god inwardly hart faith ſpirite purchaſed chriſtes bloud herewith ſtabliſheth paul doctrine faith afore rehearſed thyrd chapter bringeth alſo teſtimony dauid xij pſalme whiche calleth man bleſſed workes ſinne rekened fayth imputed righteouſnes though abide afterward without good workes iuſtified iuſtified wee firſt iuſtified thē foloweth good workes receiue ſpirite good workes neither otherwiſe poſſible good workes except firſt ſpirite howe poſſible doe thyng well ſight god yet captiuitie bondage vnder deuill deuill poſſeſſeth v together holdeth harte ſo conſent vnto god man therfore preuent ſpirite doyng good ſpirite muſt firſt come wake ſleepe thunder law feare ſhew miſerable eſtate wretchednes make abhorre hate ſelfe deſire helpe comfort agayne pleaſaūt rayne goſpell ſay ſweete promiſes god chriſt ſtirre vp faith beleue promiſes beleueth god mercy moueth v fayth promiſes ſo god al thing worketh iuſtification promiſes god mercyfull promiſe ſo true fulfill wil geue ſpirite ſtrength loue god worke ſee god onely whiche accordyng scripture worketh thinges woorketh man iuſtifiyng ſaluation health yea poureth fayth belefe luſt loue god ſtrength fulfill ſame v euen water poured veſſell good purpoſe deſeruynges merites god god mercy ſaueth v ſelues mercy promiſing truth fulfilling promiſes ſaueth v ourſelues therfore al laude prayſe glory geuen vnto god mercy truth vnto v merites deſeruynges ſtretcheth hys example agaynſt good workes law cōcludeth iewes arahams heyres becauſe bloud kinred onely much leſſe workes law muſt inherite lack abraham fayth cannot abraham child abraham fayth wilbe right heyres abraham much abraham law moſes alſo circumciſion faith made righteous called father beleue worke moreouer law cauſeth wrath much mā fulfill loue luſt longe ſuch grudgyng hate indignation agaynſt law remayneth hart takē away ſprite commeth fayth ſo long doubt workes law fayth onely receaueth grace cōmeth abraham declare euidētly wrath god vpon v fauour wherfore fayth receyueth grace promiſed vnto abraham theſe enſamples written abraham ſake onely ſayth oures alſo beleue fayth ſhallbe reckened lykewiſe ryghteouſneſſe ſayth end chapter 5 chapter commendeth frutes workes fayth fruit workes faith peace reioycing conſcience inwarde loue god mā moreouer boldneſſe truſt confidence ſtrong luſty mynd ſtedfaſt hope tribulation ſuffering ſuch follow right fayth aboundant grace ſake giftes ſprite god hath geuen v chriſt ſuffred hym die v yet enemy haue fayth workes iuſtifieth fayth workes iuſtifieth followeth yet therfore man ſhould good workes yt right ſhapē workes abide behind accompany fayth euen brightneſſe doth ſunne called paul fruites ſprite yt ſpirite alwayes ſommer good workes fruites fayth alwayes good fruites ſay good workes paules order good work ſpring ſprite ye ſpirit commeth fayth faythe commeth hearyng worde god glad tidings promiſes god hath made vnto v chriſt preached truely receiued ground hart waueryng doub • ing law hath paſſed vpon v hath damned conſciences worde god preached purely true fayth good workes receiued hart faith ſpirit god alſo good workes neceſſitie whenſoeuer occaſiō geuē god word purely preached men dreames tradition imagination inuentiōs ceremony ſuperſtition fayth conſequently ſpirite commeth god god ſpirite bee good workes euen apple tree grow apple vnbeliefe diuels ſprite euill workes god ſprite hys fruites haue holy hipocrites knowen neither yet taſted ſwete though fayne many good workes imaginatiō iuſtified withal one cromme true fayth ſpiritual fayth lacketh euill workes loue inward ioy peace quietnes conſcience much haue worde god ſuch workes pleaſe god euen rotten fruites rotten tree breaketh forth runneth large ſheweth whence ſinne righteouſneſſe death life come compareth adam chriſt together thus wiſe reaſonyng diſputyng chriſt muſt nedes come ſeconde adam make v heyres righteouſneſſe new ſpiritual birth without deſeruinges euen firſt adam made v heyres ſynne bodily generation without oure deſeruyng wherby euidently knowne •• ā came ſinne ſo chriſt came ſaluation proued vttermoſt man bryng himſelfe ſynne vnto righteouſneſſe could haue withſtād borne bodily yt proued herewith much yt law god right ſhould haue helped thyng could haue holpē onely came brought helpe alſo encreaſed ſynne becauſe euil poiſoned nature offēded vtterly diſpleaſed law yt ſhe forbid lawe ſhe prouoked ſet fyre fulfill ſatiſfie luſtes law ſee clearely muſt needes haue chriſt iuſtify v grace helpe nature vi ſetteth forthe chiefe principall worke fayth battayle principall work faith battaile betwen ſpirite fleſh ſprite agaynſt fleſhe ſprite laboureth enforceth kyll remnaunt ſinne luſt remayne fleſhe iuſtifiyng chapiter teacheth v ſo free ſinne fayth ſhould henceforth go vp idle careleſſe ſure ſelues thoughe ſynne v yes ſinne remayning v reckoned becauſe fayth ſprite fyght agaynſte wherefore haue inough doe lyues long tame body compell member obey ſprite appetite therby myght like vnto chriſtes death reſurrection might fulfill baptiſme ſignifieth mortifiyng ſinnes new lyfe grace battayle ceaſeth v vntill laſt breath vntyll ſinne vtterly ſlayne deth body thyng meane tame body ſo forth able doe ſayth ſeyng vnder grace vnder lawe vnder lawe himſelfe expoundeth vnder lawe ſo vnderſtand euery mā may hym luſteth vnder law haue fre hart vnder law renewed ſprite ſo thou haſt luſt inwardly thine owne accorde lawe commaundeth without compulſion yea though law grace ſay god fauour bringeth v ſprite maketh v loue lawe ſo ſinne neither law agaynſt v one agreed v vnder law vnder lawe deale workes law worke without ſprite grace ſo long doubt ſinne raigneth v law ſay lawe declareth yt wee vnder ſinne ſinne hath power dominion ouer v ſeyng fulfill law namely within hart much man nature fauoureth law conſenteth therunto deliteth therein thyng exceedyng great ſynne cannot conſent law law nothyng el ſaue god right freedome libertie right fredome libertie frō ſinne law ſinne lawe whereof writeth vnto ende chapter freedom good onely luſt liue well without compulſion law wherfore freedome ſpirituall freedome deſtroyeth lawe miniſtreth law requireth wherwith law fulfilled vnderſtand luſte loue wherewith law ſtilled accuſeth v compelleth v neither hath ought craue v euen thoughe thou debt man wer example able pay two maner wayes mighteſt thou loſed one way would require nothyng thee break thine obligation way ſome good man woulde paye thee geue thee muche thou mighteſt ſatiſfie thyne obligation wyſe hath chriſte made v fre law therfore wylde fleſhly libertie yt ſhould nought doth thynges free crauyng debt law ſeuenth confirmeth yt ſame ſimilitude ſtate matrimony whē huſband dyeth wyfe libertie one loſed departed woman ſhould haue power mary vnto man rather firſt ſhe free hath power mary vnto man ſhe could till ſhe looſed firſt huſband euen conſciences bound daunger lawe olde adam ſo lōg liueth v ſo conſciences bound daunger law vnder olde adam long liueth v law declareth yt harte bound cannot diſconſent hym mortified killed ſprite conſcience free libertie ſo conſcience ſhall nought doe nowe firſt cleaueth vnto witte chriſt bringeth forth fruites lyfe vnder lawe able fulfill law detter able pay lawe requireth loſe lawe fulfill pay lawe demaundeth ſo henceforth aſke thee nought conſequently paul declareth largely nature ſynne law requireth v cannot pay law law ſynne reuiueth moueth ſelfe gathereth ſtrength olde man corrupt nature forbidden kept vnder law offended diſpleſed therwith much cannot pay yt required lawe ſynne nature himſelfe cannot ſinne therefore law death hym torment martirdom lawe euill becauſe euill nature ſuffer yt good cannot abyde law ſhould require good thing like ſicke mā cannot ſuffer man ſhould deſire hym runne leape doe deedes whole man cauſe paule concludeth law vnderſtand perceiued beſt wiſe doth vtter ſynne bryng v vnto knowledge ſelues therby kyl v make v bond vnto eternall damnation detters euerlaſtyng wrath god euen well feeleth vnderſtandeth whoſe conſcience truely touched law ſuch daunger ere law doth vtter declare ſinne law came knew ſinne ment neither yet knowe wrath god vppon ſinners tyll law vttered ſeeſt thou man muſt haue ſome thyng ye greater mighty thing law make hym righteous ſafe vnderſtand law wiſe blinde go worke preſumptuouſly ſuppoſing ſatiſfie law workes know law requireth free willing luſty louing hart therfore ſee moſes right yt face vayle hangeth betwene hideth face ſo behold glorie countenaunce law ſpiritual requireth hart may myne ſtrength refraine myne enemy hurt loue myne hart put awaye wrath cleane w • may ſelues may mind cā mine ſtrength maye refuſe money myne owne ſtrength put away loue vnto rich myne hart myne owne ſtrength abſtaine adultery concernyng outward dede doe myne owne ſtrēgth deſire mine hart vnpoſſible vnto choſe whether hungre thruſt yet ſo law requireth wherfore man owne ſtrength law neuer fulfilled muſt haue therunto god fauour ſpirite purchaſed chriſtes bloud neuertheleſſe ſaye man may many thing outwardly clean agaynſt hart muſt vnderſtand y• mā driuen diuers appetite greateſt appetite ouercōmeth leſſe carieth mā away violently deſire vengeaunce feare alſo incōuenience like folowe feare bee greater abſtaine appetite deſireth vengeaunce greater proſecute dede ſee experiēce many murtherers theeues though brought neuer ſo great perill death yet haue feare ſhame away wickednes committed eſcaped euen ſame agayne common woman proſecute luſtes becauſe feare ſhame away whiche haue ſame appetite harte abſtaine leſt way outwardly worke ſecretly beyng ouercome feare ſhame ſo likewiſe appetite furthermore declared ſpirite fleſh fight together one man maketh enſample ſelf might learne know worke right meane kill ſinne ſelues calleth ſpirit alſo fleſh law becauſe like nature god law fleſhe contrary ſprite driue compell craue euen ſo fleſh driueth compelleth craueth rageth agaynſt ſpirite wil haue luſtes ſatiſfied ſide driueth ſpirite crieth fighteth againſt fleſh haue luſt ſatiſfied ſtrife dureth ſprite luſteth contrary fleſh v long liue ſome ſome leſſe ſpirite fleſh ſtronger man owne ſelfe ſpirite fleſhe fighteth owne ſelf vntil ſinne vtterly ſlayne together ſpirituall viij chapter comforteth ſuch fighter diſpayre cauſe ſuch fleſhe either thinke leſſe fauour god ſhewed ſinne remaynyng v hurteth daunger thē chriſt daunger chriſt whiche walke fleſh fight agaynſt expoundeth largely nature fleſh ſpirit ſpirite commeth chriſt whiche ſpirite maketh v ſpirituall tameth ſubdueth mortifieth fleſh certifieth v neuertheleſſe ſonnes god alſo beloued though ſinne rage neuer ſo much v ſo long folow ſpirite fight agaynſt ſinne kill mortifie becauſe chaſtiſyng fleſh croſſe ſufferyng nothyng pleaſaūt comforteth v paſſions affliction aſſiſtance ſpirite maketh interceſſiō god v mightely gronynges paſſe man vtteraunce man ſpeach comprehēd creature morne alſo v great deſire haue looſed ſinne corruption fleſh ſee theſe three chapter vj vij viij none othyng right worke fayth mortify fleſh ſo much driue v vnto right worke faith whiche kill old man mortifie fleſh ix x xj chapter treateth god predeſtinatiō whēce ſpringeth together whether ſhall beleue beleue looſed frō ſinne looſed whiche predeſtinatiō iuſtifiyng ſaluatiō cleane taken hand put hand god onely thyng moſt neceſſary predeſti •… cion handes god ſo weake ſo vncertaine ſtode v would truth man ſaued deuill doubt would deceaue v god ſure predeſtinatiō deceaue neither man withſtand let therefore haue hope truſt agaynſt ſinne muſt marke ſet vnto thoſe vnquiet buſie hye climyng ſpirites farre ſhall go firſt bryng hether hye reaſons pregnaunt wittes begyn firſt hye ſearch bottomleſſe ſecretes god predeſtination whether bee predeſtinate theſe muſt nedes either caſt ſelues headlong deſperation el commit thē ſelues fre chaunce careleſſe folow thou order farre may proceede predeſtination epiſtle nooſell thy ſelfe chriſt learne vnderſtand law yt goſpell meane office two thou mayeſt one know thy ſelfe thou haſt thy ſelfe ſtrength ſinne grace chriſt ſee thou fight agaynſt ſinne fleſh vij firſt chapter teach thee thou art come viij chapter art vnder croſſe ſuffryng tribulation neceſſitie preſtination waxe ſweete thou ſhalt well feele precious thyng except thou haue borne croſſe aduerſitie temptation haſt felt thy ſelfe brought vnto brimme deſperation yea vnto hell gate thou canſt neuer medle ſentēce predeſtination without thyne owne harme without ſecret wrath grudgyng wardly agaynſt god otherwiſe ſhall poſſible thee thinke god righteous iuſt therefore predeſtin • tion raſhly diſputed muſt adam well mortified fleſhely wytte brought vtterly nought yet thou mayeſt awaye thyng drinke ſo ſtrong wyne take hede therefore vnto thy ſelfe thou drinke wyne thou art yet ſucklyng euery learning hath tyme meaſure age chriſt certaine childhode whiche man muſt content milke ſeaſon vntill waxe ſtronge growe vp vnto perfect man chriſt able eate ſtrong meate xij chapter geueth exhortation maner obſerueth paul epiſtles firſt teacheth chriſt fayth exhorteth good workes vnto continuall mortifiyng fleſh teacheth good workes deede true ſeruyng god maketh men prieſtes offer vp money beaſtes maner tyme law body good workes mete done killyng mortifiyng luſtes fleſhe deſcribeth outward conuerſation chriſten men ought behaue ſelues ſpirituall thinges teach preach rule cō gregation chriſt ſerue one ſuffer thing patiently commit wreake vengeaunce god concluſion chriſten mā ought behaue ſelfe vnto men frend foe whatſoeuer theſe right workes chriſten mā whiche ſpryng fayth fayth keepeth holy day neither ſuffreth man idle whereſoeuer ſhe dwelleth xiij teacheth honour worldly temporall ſword though man law ordinaūce make man good god neither iuſtifie hart yet ordeined furtheraunce cō mon wealth mainteine peace puniſh euill defend good therfore ought good honor temporal ſword haue reuerence though concernyng ſelues neede would abſtaine euill owne accord yea good without man lawe law ſpirite gouerneth hart guideth vnto god finally comprehendeth knitteth vp loue loue nature beſtoweth ſhe hath euen ſelfe whiche loued thou loue y• fulfilling law nedeſt bid kynd mother belouyng vnto onely ſonne much leſſe ſpiritual loue hath eye geuen god nedeth man law teach duetie yt begynnyng put forth chriſt cauſe author righteouſnes ſaluation euen ſo ſetteth hym forth enſample counterfaite hath done v euē ſo ſhould one xiiij chapter teacheth deale ſoberly conſciences weake fayth whiche yet vnderſtand libertie chriſt perfectly enough fauour muſt deale louingly weake brother chriſten loue vſe libertie faith vnto hinderāce vnto furtheraunce edifiyng weake ſuch conſideratiō foloweth debate deſpiſing goſpell better forbeare weake vntill waxe ſtrong learnyng ſhould come altogether vnder fote ſuch worke ſingular work loue ye loue perfecte muſt nedes ſuch reſpect vnto weake thing chriſt commaunded charged aboue thinges 15 chapter ſetteth forthe chriſt agayne counterfaited alſo hys enſample ſhould ſuffer yet weake weaknes brother conſidered fraile open ſinners vnlearned vnexpert lotheſome maners caſt thē away forthwith ſuffer thē til waxe better exhort meane tyme ſo delte chriſt goſpel dealeth v dayly ſuffering vnperfectnes weaknes conuerſation maners yet faſhioned doctrine goſpell ſmell fleſh ye ſometyme breake forth outward deedes conclude withall wiſheth encreaſe fayth peace ioye conſcience prayſeth committeth god magnifieth office adminiſtration goſpell ſoberly great diſcretion deſireth ſuccour ayde poore ſayntes ieruſalem pure loue ſpeketh dealeth withall fynde epiſtle romaine conteyned ſufficient doctrine chriſten man epiſtle plentuouſly vnto vttermoſt whatſoeuer chriſten man woman ought know witte law goſpell ſume grace fayth righteouſnes chriſt god good workes loue hope hope croſſe euen wherin pith pertayneth chriſten fayth ſtandeth chriſten mā ought behaue himſelfe vnto euery man perfect ſinner good bad ſtrong weake frend foe concluſiō behaue ſelues towarde god toward oure ſelues alſo thynges profoundly grounded scripture declared enſamples hymſelfe father prohets man deſire wherfore appeareth euidently paules mynde comprehende brieflye hys epiſtle whole learnyng chriſtes goſpell prepare introduction vnto olde teſtament without doubte whoſoeuer hath epiſtle perfectly hys harte ſame hath light effect olde teſtament wyth hym wherfore let euery man without exception exerciſe himſelfe therein diligently recorde night day continually vntill full acquainted therwith laſt chapter chapiter recommendation wherein yet mingleth good monition ſhould beware tradition doctrine men beguile ſimple beware traditious men ſophiſtry learnyng goſpell draw chriſt nooſell weake feble paul calleth epiſtle gallathians beggerly ceremony entent would lyue fat paſtures authoritie taken chriſt ye aboue chriſt ſitte temple god witte conſciences men god onely worde chriſt ought ſit compare therfore maner doctrine mē vnto yt ſcripture ſee whether agree commit thy ſelfe whole together vnto chriſte ſo ſhal holy ſprite withal fulnes dwell thy ſoule amen prologue vppon firſt epiſtle paule corinthian william tyndall epiſtle declareth ſelfe chapter chapter nedeth epiſtle declareth ſelf prologue introduction declare paul conuerted great number corinthum ye read act 18 departed came immediatly falſe apoſtels ſectmakers drew euery man diſciples hym ſo people whole vnquieted deuided variaunce among themſelues euery man zeale hys doctour thoſe newe apoſtles regardyng diuiſion vncleanneſſe liuing falſe opinion amonge people long might bee authoritie well eaſe theyr belly paul firſt foure chapiter great wiſdom ſoberneſſe rebuked firſt diuiſion author therof calleth people chriſt agayne teacheth howe preacher takē 5 rebuketh vncleanes amongſt 6 rebuketh debate goyng law together pletyng cauſes heathen 7 reformeth concernyng chaſtitie mariage 8 9 10 11 teacheth y• weake yong conſciences ſtubborne laſt ſhal receiue equall reward firſt ſtrong forbeare weake yet vnderſtand libertie goſpell enſample ſelf though apoſtle authoritie yet loue abſtayned winner feareth enſamples olde teſtament rebuketh diuers diſorders among concernyng sacrament goyng barehedded maried woman 12 13 14 teacheth manifold gyftes ſpirite proueth ſimilitude bodye giftes geuen yt eche ſhould helpe loue ſeruice loue fulfilleth law proueth loue nothing pleaſeth god one ſhould loue god requireth v therfore deſire ſpiritual gift teacheth thoſe giftes bee deſired helpe neighbour 15 teacheth reſurrection body laſt exhorteth helpe poore ſayntes prologue vpō ſecond epiſtle paul corinthian w tyndall firſt epiſtle rebuketh corinthian ſharpely ſo comforteth prayſeth commaūdeth excommunicate receiued louingly congregation agayne 1 2 chapiter hee parte good ſhepherd vē ture hys lyfe hys ſheepe ſheweth loue warde ſpake ſuffered ſakes ſaluation 3 4 5 prayſeth office preaching goſpell aboue yt preaching law ſheweth goſpel groweth perſecution throughe croſſe whiche maketh man ſure eternall lyfe tribulatiō goſpell ſake maketh v ſure eternall lyfe toucheth yt falſe prophetes ſtudied turne faith people chriſte vnto workes law 6 7 chapter exhorteth thē ſuffer goſpell lyue becommeth goſpell prayſeth hym latter ende 8 9 chapter exhorteth thē helpe poore ſaintes ieruſalem 10 11 12 inueyegth againſt falſe prophetes laſt chapter threateneth ſinned amended themſelues prologue vpon epiſtle paule gallathians w tyndall ye read act 15 certaine came ieruſalem antioche vexed yt diſciples affirming yt coulde ſaued except circumciſed euen ſo paul conuerted galathians coupled chriſt truſt remiſſion ſynne hope grace ſaluation departed came falſe apoſtles vnto thē vnto corinthiās vnto place paul preached name peter iames iohn called hye apoſtles preached circumciſion kepyng law ſaued miniſhed paules authoritie confounding thoſe paul magnifieth hys office apoſtleſhip repent iuſtified thorough ſaith chriſt workes two firſt chapiter maketh hymſelfe equall vnto hie apoſtles concludeth euery man muſte iuſtified without deſeruyngs without workes without helpe law alone chriſt 3 4 proueth ſame scripture example ſimilitudes ſheweth law cauſe ſinne bryngeth curſe god vpon v iuſtifieth law condēneth beleuyng god promiſes iuſtifieth v iuſtifiyng commeth grace promiſed v god deſeruyng chriſte whome beleue iuſtified without helpe woorkes lawe 5 6 exhorteth vnto workes loue folow fayth iuſtifiyng epiſtle obſerueth order firſt preacheth damnatiō law iuſtifiyng fayth thyrdly workes loue cō dition wee loue henceforth worke mercy giuen v el worke god henceforward fall fauour grace inheritance freely geuen v chriſtes ſake owne fault loſe agayne prologue vpon epiſtle saint paule epheſians epiſtle namely three firſte chapter paul ſheweth goſpell grace therof foreſene predeſtmate god begynnyng deſerued chriſt laſt ſent forth men ſhould beleue thereon thereby iuſtified made righteous liuyng happy bee deliuered vnder damnation law captiuitie ceremony fourth teacheth auoyde ſekyng ſatiſfaction thē chriſt beceau • ſelues tradition men doctrine beware puttyng truſt thyng ſaue chriſt affirmyng onely ſufficient haue thynges beſide neede nothyng v vj exhorteth exerciſe faith declare abroad good workes auoyde ſinne arme ſpiritual armour agaynſt deuill might ſtand faſt time tribulation vnder croſſe prologue vpon epiſtle saint paule philippian w tyndall paule prayſeth philippian exhorteth ſtād faſt true faith encreaſe loue becauſe falſe prophetes ſtudy alwayes impugne deſtroy y• true hereby warned workes ſaue v word promiſe fayth warneth ſuch worke learner teacher woorkes prayſeth epaphroditus doth hee firſt ſeconde chapter thyrd reproueth faythles man righteouſnes whiche falſe prophetes teach mainteyne ſetteth enſample howe mannes righteouſnes zeale imagination without god worde odious ſelfe liued ſuch falſe righteouſnes holineſſe vnrebukeable ſo man could complaine yet ſetteth nought therby chriſtes righteouſnes ſake finally affirmeth ſuch falſe prophetes enemyes croſſe make bellyes god may ſafely without perill ſufferyng preach chriſt prologue vpon epiſtle saint paule coloſsians w tyndall epiſtle yt galathians holdeth maner faſhion epiſtle romains briefly comprehendyng therein length diſputed euen ſo epiſtle foloweth enſample epiſtle epheſians conteynyng tenour ſame epiſtle fewer wordes firſt chapter praiſeth thē wiſheth continue fayth preached bringeth ye ſpirite power fulfill law fayth grow perfecter therin thē deſcribeth goſpell wiſedome confeſſeth chriſt lord god crucified v wiſedome hath bene hyd chriſt ſence afore beginning world firſt begon opened throughe preachyng apoſtles ij warneth men doctrine deſcribeth falſe prophetes vttermoſt rebuketh accordyng yt thyrd exhorteth frutefull ſo hath pure fayth aboūd good workes pure fayth maner good workes one deſcribeth al degree duty fourth exhorteth pray alſo pray ſaluteth prologue vpon firſt epiſtle paul theſſalonians w tyndall epiſtle paule write exceeding loue care prayſeth two firſte chapter becauſe receiue goſpell earneſtly tribulation receauyng goſpel cō tinuaunce latter ende maketh v bleſſed perſecution continued therin ſtedfaſtly become enſample vnto congregation thereto ſuffred kinſmē chriſt apoſtles ye iewes puttyng therto mynde purely godly lyued among thē enſample thanketh god hys goſpel brought forth ſuch fruite among third chapter ſheweth meaneth therby leſt ſhould fall worde already receaued diligence care leaſt hys ſo greate labor ſo bleſſed beginning ſhould haue bene vayne sathan apoſtles vexyng perſecution deſtroying faith men doctrine therefore ſente tymothie comforte ſtrengthen fayth thanketh god ſo conſtantly endured deſireth god encreaſe fourth exhorteth kepe themſelues ſinne good one another thereto informeth concernyng reſurrection fift writeth laſt day ſhould come ſodenly exhortyng prepare ſelues thereafter kepe good order concernyng obedience rule prologue vpon ſecond epiſtle paule theſſalonians w tyndall becauſe fore epiſtle ſaid yt laſt day ſhould come ſodenly theſſalonians thought ſhould come ſhortly wherefore epiſtle declareth hymſelfe firſt chapter comforteth patiēce perſecution chriſts ſake rewarded y• crowne euerlaſting ioy felicitie euerlaſting reward fayth patience ſufferyng goſpell puniſhment perſecutours euerlaſtyng payne ſecond ſheweth yt laſt day ſhoulde come till firſt departing ſome men thinke hereby haue euident ſignes latter day hand frō vnder ye obedience yt emperour rome antichriſt ſhoulde ſet vp himſelfe ye ſame place god deceyue vnthankefull worlde falſe doctrine falſe lying myracles wrought workyng sathan vntill chriſt ſhoulde come ſlay hym glorious commyng ſpirituall preachyng worde god third geueth exhortation warneth rebuke yt idle would labour handes auoyde company would amende prologue vpon firſt epiſtle paule tymothe w tyndall epiſtle writeth paul enſample biſhoppes ſhoulde teache ſhould teache ſhould gouerne congregation chriſte degree ſhould nede gouerne chriſtes flocke doctrine owne good meanynges firſt chapiter commaundeth office biſhop biſhop ſhall maynetayne yt right fayth loue reſiſt falſe preacher make lawe woorkes equall chriſt hys goſpell maketh ſhorte concluſion chriſtes learning wherto law ſerueth ende therof alſo goſpell ſetteth himſelfe comfortable enſample vnto ſinners troubled conſciences ſecond commaundeth pray degree chargeth woman ſhall preache weare coſtly apparell obedient vnto men thyrd deſcribeth maner perſons byſhop prieſt wyues ſhould alſo deacon wiues commēdeth man deſire byſhop maner fourth hee propheſieth pope prelate playnly ſet forth chriſt looſed freely pope bynd loſe agayne money ſheweth falſe byſhops ſpirituall officer ſhould aryſe among chriſten people preach cleane contrary fore deſcribed enſample ſhould depart fayth chriſt forbyd marye eate certain meates teachyng put truſt therin iuſtifiyng forgiueneſſe ſinnes alſo deſeruyng eternall life fift teacheth howe byſhop ſhould vſe ſelf toward yong old concernyng widowes done ſhould found common coſt teacheth alſo vertuous byſhops worthy double honor men ſhould honour vertuous biſhops prieſtes rebuke euill ſixt exhorteth yt byſhops cleaue goſpell chriſt true doctrine auoyde vayne queſtions ſuperfluous diſputynges gēdre ſtrife quench truth alſo falſe prophetes get authoritie ſeke ſatiſfie inſatiable couetouſneſſe prologue vpon ſecond epiſtle saint paule vnto timothe w tyndall epiſtle paul exhorteth timothe go forward begō preach yt goſpel diligence neede ſeyng many fallen away many falſe ſpirites teacher ſprong vp already wherfore byſhops muſt vigilant vocation • byſhops part euer watche labour goſpell third fourth ſheweth notablie ieoperdous tyme toward end yt world falſe ſpiritual liuing ſhould diſceine ye whole world outward hypocri • ie apparance holineſſe vnder abhominatiōs ſhould hath already ben fulfilled ſpiritualtie haue free paſſage courſe ala haue ſene propheſie paule fulfilled ſpiritualtie vnto vttermoſt iote prologue vpon epiſtle paul titus ſhort epiſtle wherin yet conteyned needefull chriſten know firſt chapter ſheweth maner man byſhop curate maner man byſhop curate ought ought witte vertuous learned preach defende goſpell confounde doctrine truſtyng woorkes men tradition whiche euer fight agaynſt faith cary away cō ſcience captiue fredome chriſt bondage owne imagination inuentions though thynges ſhould make man good light god whiche profite ſecōd teacheth degree old young men womē maiſters ſeruauntes behaue thē ſelues chriſt bought bloud proper peculiar people glorifie god good workes thyrd teacheth honour temporall ruler obey thē good deedes pleaſe god ſo farre foorth applied kepyng commaundements chriſt onely iuſtifieth yet bryngeth chriſt agayne grace hee hath purchaſed v man ſhould thinke obedience prince lawes woorke ſhould iuſtifie v god laſt chargeth auoyde company ſtubburne heretickes prologue vpon epiſtle saint paule vnto philemon w tyndall epiſtle paule ſheweth godly enſample chriſten loue ſee paule taketh poore oneſimos vnto maketh interceſſiō vnto maſter helpeth may behaueth ſelfe none otherwiſe though ſelfe ſayd oneſimos whiche thyng yet doth power authoritie hee well might haue done putteth authoritie whatſoeuer might right philemon might likewiſe toward oneſimos great mekeneſſe wiſedome teacheth philemon ſee dutie chriſt ieſu prologue vpon firſt epiſtle saint peter william tyndall epiſtle dyd peter write heathen conuerted exhorteth ſtād faſt faith grow therein waxe perfect maner ſufferyng alſo good workes firſt declareth iuſtifiyng fayth chriſtes bloud comforteth hope lyfe come ſheweth haue deſerued prophetes propheſied ſhoulde geuen v chriſt redemed v ſynne vncleanneſſe holy ſo exhorteth lead holy conuerſation becauſe richly bought made heyres riche inheritāce take hede loſe agayn owne negligence 2 chapter ſheweth chriſt chriſten man chriſt foundation hed corner ſtone wheron al built fayth whether iew gentile chriſt made prieſtes offer themſelues god chriſt dyd hymſelfe ſlea luſtes fleſhe fyght againſte ſoule firſt teacheth generall obey worldly ruler ſpecial teacheth yt ſeruantes obey maiſters good badde ſuffer wrong chriſt ſuffred wrong v 3 teacheth wiues obey huſbandes ye though vnbeleuers apparell themſelues godly becommeth holynes therto huſbandes ſuffer beare infirmity mē ought rule theyr wiues god • word wyues lyue accordyng knowledge generall exhorteth ſoft curteous patient frendly one ſuffer righteouſneſſe enſample chriſt 4 exhorteth flye ſynne tame fleſh ſoberneſſe watch onely abſtaine ſlepe alſo auoyde occaſions may drawe v ſinne watching prayer loue ech know good giftes god euery man helpe hys neighbour ſuch hath receiued god finally wonder reioyce though muſte ſuffer chriſtes name ſake ſeeyng partaker hys affliction ſo ſhall partaker glory come 5 teacheth biſhops prieſtes ſhould lyue fede chriſtes flocke warneth v deuil whiche euery ſide lyeth wayte v prologue vppon ſecond epiſtle peter william tyndall epiſtle written agaynſt thē whiche god reioyceth dede ſelfe▪ ſo doth •… dle faith without work thought yt thriſten faith might idle workes yet promiſe chriſt made v vpon condition henceforth worke god fleſh therefore exhorteth exerciſe themſelues diligently vertue good workes therby ſure haue true faith good workes ſhew fayth fruit tree man knoweth goodnes tree hys fruite commendeth magnifieth goſpel willeth men harken men doctrine ſayth came prophetical ſcripture man wil holy ghoſt onely knoweth god neither ſcripture priuate interpretatiō ſay may otherwiſe expounded agreyng open place generall article couenantes god reſt ſcripture therfore ſecond warneth falſe teacher ſhould come throughe preachyng confidence falſe workes ſatiſfie couetouſneſſe withall ſhoulde denye chriſt threatneth thre terrible example fall toe angel floude noe ouerthrowyng sodome gomorre ſo deſcribeth inſatiable couetouſnes pryde ſtubbornnes propheſieth pope ſpiritualtie diſobedience temporall rule authoritie abhominable whoredome hipocriſie blinde man may ſee prophecied pope holy ſpiritualtie deuoured whole worlde couetouſnes liuyng luſt pleaſure raigning temporall tyrantes third ſheweth latter dayes people vnbeliefe lacke feare iudgement laſt day ſhall euen epicure wholy geuen fleſhe laſt day ſhall yet ſurely ſhortly come ſayth thouſand yeres one day god one ſheweth alſo terrible day ſhall ſodenly ſhall come therfore exhorteth men loke earneſtly prepare themſelues agaynſt holy conuerſation godly liuyng finally firſt chapiter ſheweth ſhold go tyme pure condition worlde ſhall waxe worſe worſe true goſpell ſecond ſhould go tyme pope men doctrine third laſt men ſhoulde beleue nothyng feare god prologue vppon three epiſtles iohn william tyndall firſt epiſtle saint iohn contayned doctrine verye apoſtle chriſt ought right follow hys goſpel goſpell ſetteth true faythe teacheth men ſaued reſtored vnto fauour god agayne euen ſo epiſtle goeth agaynſt boaſte themſelues fayth yet continue without 〈◊〉 true fayth alſo good workes good workes teacheth many wayes true fayth workes tary behinde contrary workes followe true fayth falſe imagination vtter darkenes writeth ſore agaynſt ſecte heretikes began deny chriſt come fleſhe calleth thē antichriſts ſect goeth full ſwinge though deny openly mouth yt chriſt come y• fleſhe yet deny yt hart wt doctrine liuing wil iuſtified chriſtes bloud purchaſeth forgeuenes ſinnes man workes ſaued owne workes ſame doth much denyed chriſt come fleſhe ſeyng chriſt came therfore fleſh ſhould iuſtifye v purchaſe v pardon ſynnes bryng v fauour god agayne make v heyres eternal life workes bloudſhedyng without workes fighteth epiſtle againſt ſaued owne good workes alſo agaynſt wyll ſaued fayth hath luſt workes kepeth v yt middle way beleue chriſt ſaued workes onely know duty kyndnes prepare oure ſelues doe commaundement god loue euery man neighbor chriſt loued hym ſekyng owne workes god honour neighbour wealth truſtyng eternall lyfe god hath promiſed v chriſtes ſake two laſt epiſtles though ſhort yet goodly enſamples loue fayth ſauour ſpirite true apoſtle prologue vpon epiſtle saint paule hebrues william tyndall epiſtle hatheuer ben much doubting whether paules epiſtle great learned men haue doubted amōg great learned men ſhould authour thereof diuers affirmyng paules partly becauſe ſtyle ſo diſagreeth ſo vnlike hys epiſtles partly bicauſe ſtandeth ſecond chapter learnyng confirmed v ward ſay taught v heard ſelues lord paule teſtifieth gala 1 receyued goſpell man mā immediatly chriſt reuelation wherfore ſay ſeing man confeſſeth hee receiued doctrine apoſtles paules ſome diſciple apoſtles whether paul ſay permit men iudgementes neither thinke article man fayth man may doubt authour moreouer many hath bene onely haue denyed epiſtle deny haue bene written anye apoſtle refuſe catholike haue bene written apoſtles haue alſo refuſed together catholicke godly epiſtle bicauſe certaine textes written therin firſt ſayth ſixt impoſſible whiche lighted haue taſted heauēly gift become partaker holye ghoſte haue taſted good worde god power worlde come fall ſhoulde bee renewed agayne repentaunce conuerſion tenth ſayth ſinne willingly haue receiued knowledge truth remaineth ſacrifice ſinnes fearefull lookyng iudgement violent fyre whiche ſhall deſtroy aduerſaries xij ſaith eſau found way repentaunce conuerſion thoughe ſought teares whiche textes ſay ſound man ſinne baptiſed forgeuen contrary scripture therefore refuſed catholicke godly vnto whiche aunſwere ſhould denye epiſtle thoſe textes ſakes ſo ſhould deny firſt ſolution former doubt mathew xij chapter affirmeth blaſphemeth holy ghoſt ſhall neither forgiuen world come marke thyrd chapiter ſayth blaſphemeth holy ghoſt ſhal neuer haue forgiueneſſe ſhalbe daunger eternall damnation thirdly luke ſaith ſhall remiſſion blaſphemeth ſpirite god moreouer iohn firſt epiſtle ſaith ſinne vnto death man ſhould pray ij pet ij ſaith man fled vncleaneſſe world knowledge sauiour ieſus chriſt wrapt agayne ende worſe beginnyng better neuer haue knowen truth paule ij ti iij curſeth alexander copperſmith deſiring lord reward accordyng deedes whiche ſigne either yt epiſtle ſhould good alexander ſinned paſt forgiueneſſe prayed wherfore ſeyng scripture priuate interpretation muſt expounded accordyng generall article fayth agreable open euident textes confirmed denied paules epiſtle compared lyke ſentences ſhould vnderſtand theſe place like reuerēce namely remnaunt epiſtle ſo godly ſo great learnyng firſt place vj chapiter whiche know truth yet willingly refuſe light chuſe rather dwell darkenes refuſe chriſt make mocke y• phariſies whē ouercome scripture miracle y• chriſt meſſias yet ſuch luſt iniquitie forſoke perſecuted ſlewe ſhame could imagined bee renued 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſayth greeke conuerted ſay ſuch malicious vnkyndneſſe none blaſphemyng holy ghoſt deſerueth ſpirite ſhall neuer come conuerte whiche beleue true text scripture ment place tenth chapter ſayth ſinne willingly haue receiued yt knowledge truth remaineth ſacrifice ſinne declared immediatly maketh compariſon betwene moſes chriſt ſaying deſpiſed moſes law dyed without mercy much worſe puniſhment worthy treadeth ſonne god vnderfoote counteth bloud couenaunt whiche bloud ſanctified vnholy thyng blaſphemeth ſpirite grace wordes manifeſt meaneth none fore wordes ſinne blaſphemy ſpirite ſinne ignoraunce infirmitie remedy knoweth truthe yet willingly yeldeth ſelfe ſinne conſenteth vnto lyfe ſinne ſoule body rather lye ſin haue poyſoned nature healed mercy locked vp hym wilfully yeldeth body 〈◊〉 ſoule ſinne helpe ſpirite grace maliciouſly perſecuteth truth ſay remedy way mercy locked vp ſpirite taken vnthankefulneſſe ſake geuen truthe mā turne god beleue chriſt muſt forgiuen deepe ſoeuer hath ſinned wil without ſpirite ſuch blaſphemers ſhall haue ſpirite offred let euery man therefore feare god beware yeld ſelf ſerue ſinne oft ſoeuer ſinne let gyn agayne fight freſhe doubt ſhal laſt ouercome meane tyme yet vnder mercy chriſtes ſake becauſe hart worketh would fayne louſed vnder bondage ſinne ſayth xij eſau founde way 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 bee conuerted reconciled vnto god reſtored vnto byrth right agayn though ſought teares text muſt haue ſpirituall eye eſau ſellyng byrthright deſpiſed onely temporall promotion ſhould haue bene lord ouer brother kyng countrey alſo refuſed grace mercy god ſpirituall bleſſyng abrahā iſaac yt mercy promiſed v chriſt ſhould haue bene ſeede ye ſee epiſtle ought refuſed holy godly catholicke autentike scripture therfore come purpoſe agayne though epiſtle ſayth ſixt lay grounde fayth chriſt yet buildeth cunnyngly thereon pure gold ſiluer precious ſtones proueth prieſthode chriſt scripture ineuitable moreouer worke place ſcripture ſo plainly deſcribeth ſignifications figure olde teſtament epiſtle doth scripture ſo playnly declareth meanyng ſignificatiōs ſacrifices ceremony figure old teſtament epiſtle ſo much wilful blindnes malicious malice cauſe epiſtle onely enoughe wede harte papiſtes cankred hereſie iuſtifiyng workes cōcernyng sacrament ceremony maner tradition owne inuention finally ye ſee tenth bene bondes priſon chriſtes ſake yt ſo mightely driueth chriſt ſaued thorough ſo cared flocke chriſt wrote ſent hee heard begon faynte comforte courage ſtrength word god alſo ſent timothe paules diſciple vertuous well learned great reuerence eaſy ſee faythfull ſeruaunt chriſtes ſame doctrine timothe yea paule hym epiſtle agreeth reſt ſcripture ought equal authoritie ſelfe y• apoſtle apoſtles tyme nere thereunto ſeyng epiſtle agreeth reſt scripture indifferently looked ſhould bee authoritie taken holy scripture prologue vpon epiſtle iames w tyndall thoughe epiſtle refuſed old tyme denyed many epiſtle apoſtle though alſo laye foundation fayth chriſte ſpeaketh general fayth god neyther preacheth death reſurrection either mercy layde vp ſtore v euerlaſting couenant made v bloud office duety apoſtle chriſt ſayeth iohn 15 ye ſhall teſtifye yet becauſe ſetteth vp man doctrine cryeth keepe law god maketh loue epiſtle taken holy ſcripture without parcialitie fulfillyng law chriſt apoſtles hath thereto many good godly ſentēces hath alſo nothing agreable reſt ſcripture loked indifferētly thinketh ought rigt takē holy ſcripture place happely beginnyng refuſed holy men ought meant toke papiſtes alleage text purpoſe thorough miſunderſtandyng ſame place onely falſe vnderſtandyng hath bene chiefly receiued papiſtes yet circumſtances well pondered wyll appeare author entent farre otherwiſe toke ſaith 2 chapter fayth without deedes dead ſelf meaneth none thyng ſcripture doth fayth hath good dedes following falſe fayth none fayth iuſtifieth receyueth forgeueneſſe ſins god promiſed thē forgeuenes theyr ſinnes onely whiche turne god keepe lawes wherfore purpoſe cōtinue ſtill ſynne haue part promiſe deceyue themſelues beleue god hath forgeuen olde ſynnes chriſtes ſake ſayth man iuſtified deedes faith faith doth iuſtify euery nothyng iuſtifieth ſaue fayth dedes alſo iuſtify fayth iuſtifieth god ſo dedes onely iuſtify world whereof inough ſpoken partly yt prologue paul romaynes alſo place paule affirmeth rom 2 abraham iuſtified workes god fayth gen beareth record ſo wil iames deedes onely iuſtified hym fayth iuſtifieth world faith wrought deedes ſay fāyth wherwith righteous god hart cauſe hym worke wyll god outwardly whereby righteous worlde whereby worlde perceiued beleued god loued feared god hebr 11 yt ſcripture affirmeth raab iuſtified god faith ſo doth iames affirme workes whiche ſhe ſheweth fayth ſhe iuſtified world true epiſtle iudas though men haue yet doubt authour thoughe ſeeme alſo drawne ſecond epiſtle peter thereto alleageth ſcripture founde yet ſeyng matter ſo godly agreeyng holy scripture ſee ought haue authoritie holy scripture expoſition vpō certaine wordes phraſes new teſtament infernus gehenna differ much ſignificatiō though haue none interpretatiō either thē thē engliſh word hell gehenna ſignifieth place puniſhment infernus taken maner place beneth earth graue ſepulchre caue hell called hebrue valley hennon place ieruſalem brent child fyre vnto idoll moloch vſurped taken place wicked vngodly ſhalbe tormented ſoule body generall iudgement geue roume wrath god rom 12 wrath taken vē geaunce meanyng let god auenge either himſelfe officer beare hys roume tary abide till ye go marke 6 chap wherſoeuer ye enter houſe abide tyll ye go thence luke 9 whatſoeuer houſe ye enter tary go thence ſay whoſoeuer receiueth abyde long citie towne go ſhamefully begging houſe houſe frier doe duſt ſhake duſt feete math 10 commaunded ſhake duſt witnes ſayth luke deede may teſtifye againſt day iudgement doctrine ſaluation offred would receyue thē ye ſee alſo ſuch ieſtures ceremony haue greater power thē haue bare wordes onely moue harte ſtirre vp fayth laying handes annointyng oyle c hipocrites ye diſcerne face heauen diſcerne ſigne tymes ſay could iudge ſignes ſkye weather ſhould follow could know chriſte ſignes scripture yet ſignes might geuen ſayth knoweth chriſt kepeth commaundementes lyar know chriſt beleue chriſt ergo keepeth commaundementes forth good worke huſband marieth wyfe haue lawfull child furthermore huſbande marieth hys wyfe ſhe ſhoulde continue vnfruitefull ſhe ſtate virginitie wherin impoſſible beare fruite contrariwiſe make fruitefull euen ſo fayth iuſtifieth v ſay marieth v god ſhould continue vnfruitfull ſhould put ſeede holy ſprite v iohn firſt epiſtle calleth make v fruitfull ſayth paul ephe 2 grace ye made ſafe likewiſe compelled otherwiſe aboade faythfull companion hath taken another voyage vpon preach chriſt ſuppoſe neuer yet preached god put hys hart thether go ſende ſpirite hym comforte hym bryng hys purpoſe good effecte one william roye man william roye fal • e diſciple ſomewhat crafty commeth vnto new acquayntance knowne namely ſpent came vnto offred hys helpe long money ſomwhat could rule hym lyues men ſay day longer departed went gate new frendes thyng doe paſſeth euer yet knew ſtored hym money gate hym argentine profeſſed wonderfull faculty maketh boaſt ſmall thing yeare xij monthes y• printyng worke came one ierome brother grenewich alſo ierome brother grenewich wormes argentine ſaying y• intended chriſtes diſciple another whyle kepe nye god would geue grace y• profeſſion hys baptiſme get hys liuyng hādes lyue lōger idlely ſweate labour thoſe captiues whiche taught beleue chriſte cut ſhooes ruſſet coat ierome diligence warned royes boldnes exhorted beware hym walke quietly wyth patiēce long ſufferyng according haue chriſt hys apoſtles enſāple thyng alſo promiſed neuertheleſſe whē commyng argētine williā roye whoſe toung able onely make fooles ſtarke mad one cā knowen without marke alſo aboue thinges antechriſt antechriſt outward thyng ſay man ſhould ſodēly appeare wonder father talked hym verely antichriſt ſpirituall thyng much ſay agaynſt chriſt yt one preacheth falſe doctrine contrarie chriſt antechriſt old teſtamēt fought prophetes alſo tyme chriſt apoſtles thou readeſt epiſtles iohn paule corinthian galathians epiſtles antechriſt ſhall doubt endure till worldes ende nature vttered ouercome worde god go playe ſeaſon diſguiſe hymſelfe come agayne new name new rayment thou ſeeſt scribe phariſeis antechriſtes howe chriſt rebuketh scribe phariſes goſpel antechriſtes ſaying wo phariſes ye robbe widowes houſes ye praye long prayer vnder colour ye ſhut vp kingdom heauē ſuffer thē y• would enter ye haue taken away keye property thee whatſoeuer thou art readeſt note well iewes loke antechriſt hath bene among v lōg tyme chriſt come xv hundred yeares agoe ware alſo haue loked antechriſt hath raigned long ware becauſe eyther v looked carnally hym place ought haue ſought iewes found chriſt verily ſought hym lawe prophetes whether chriſt ſendeth ſeke iohn iohn 〈◊〉 5 alſo ſpied antechriſt long ago looked doctrine chriſt hys accompteth treaſon bee acquainted wt chriſt come lyght maketh treaſon vnto kyng bee acquaynted chriſte chriſte may raigne together one hope haue chriſt ſhal liue euer olde antichriſtes brought chriſt vnto pilate ſaying lawe ought die whē pilate bade iudge hym lawe aunſwered lawfull v kyll man whiche dyd intent whiche regarded ſhame falſe excōmunications ſhould yet feare confeſſe chriſt becauſe ioyne pope beleue teſtament promiſes man aſke peraduenture take labour make worke much burne ſeyng burnt goſpell aunſwere burnyng new teſtament dyd none thyng looked ſhall burne alſo god ſhall ſo neuertheleſſe tranſlatyng teſtament dyd dutie ſo doe doe much god hath ordeined offered al men correct ſoeuer could euen ſo ſoeuer therfore readeth compare vnto scripture god word beare recorde vnto thou alſo feeleſt thine hart ſo good comfort geue god thankes god word condemne hold accurſed ſo doe doctrine paule counſeleth galathians beleue euery ſprite ſodenly iudge thē word god whiche trial doctrine laſteth euer amen parable wicked mammon certain luke 16 rich man whiche ſteward accuſed vnto hym hee waſted goodes called hym ſayd vnto heare thee geue accoumptes thy ſtewardſhyp thou mayſt longer ſteward ſteward ſayd ſelfe ſhall maſter take away frō ſtewardſhyp digge begge aſhamed wote doe put ſtewardſhyp may receaue theyr houſes called maſters detters ſayd vnto firſt much oweſt thou vnto maſter ſayd hūdred tonne oyle hee ſayd hym take thy bill ſit downe quickely write fiftie ſayd oweſt thou ſayd hundred quarter wheate ſayd hym take thy bill write foure ſcore lord commended vniuſt ſteward becauſe done wiſely child world kynde wiſer child light ſay alſo vnto make frendes wicked mammon ye ſhall haue neede may receaue euerlaſtyng habitation luke xvi chapter much diuers ſuch wiſedome god thou mayſt ſee corint j ij though worldly righteouſnes 1 cor 1▪ 2 obedient vnto righteouſnes god rom x yet ſo euer read ariſtotle yt muſt firſt true rom 10▪ mainteine rent teare scripture diſtinctions expounde violently contrarie meanyng text circumſtaunces go thouſand cleare euidente textes wherfore haue taken hand expounde goſpell certaine place new teſtament far forth god ſhall lende grace bryng scripture vnto right ſence digge agayne welles abraham purge cleanſe thē earth worldly wiſedome theſe philiſtenes haue ſtopped whiche grace graunt god loue hath vnto ſonne ieſus lord vnto glory name amen fayth onely workes without merites chriſtes faith onely iuſtifieth onely iuſtifieth ſetteth v peace god proued paul firſt chapiter rom rom 1 aſhamed ſayth goſpell ſay glad tidinges promiſes god hath made ſworne v chriſt ſay goſpell power god vnto ſaluation beleue followeth foreſayd chapiter y• iuſt righteous muſt liue faith fayth haue chriſt god promiſes fynde faith bringeth lyfe mercy lyfe fauour peace law fynde death damnation law bryngeth death wrath moreouer curſe vengeaunce god vpon v ſay lawe called paule 2 corin 3 miniſtration 1 cor 3 death damnation lawe proued enemyes god hate peace god loue hym ſeing conceiued borne vnder power deuill poſſeſſion kingdome captiues bondman ledde wyll holdeth harte ſo impoſſible v conſent wil god much impoſſible man fulfill lawe owne ſtrength power ſeyng birth nature heires eternall damnation ſayth paul ephe 2 ſayth nature ephe 2 child wrath whiche thyng lawe doth vtter onely helpeth v yea requireth impoſſible thynges v lawe commaūdeth thou ſhalt luſt geueth thee power ſo doe damneth thee becauſe thou cauſt ſo thou wilte therefore bee peace god loue thou muſt turne promiſes god yt goſpell called paul goſpell miniſtratiō righteouſnes place rehearſed corinthian miniſtration righteouſnes ſpirite fayth bringeth pardō forgeuenes freely purchaſed chriſtes bloud bringeth alſo ſprite ſprite looſeth bondes deuill ſetteth v libertie ſprite lord libertie ſayth paule ſame place corinthian ſay harte free hath power loue god hart mourneth cannot loue inough conſent yt hart vnto law god eternall life yea though bee power yet member fulfill let euery man therfore accordyng paules councell 6 chapter eph arme himſelfe yt armour god vnderſtand god promiſes aboue thing ſayeth take vnto ſhield fayth wherewyth ye may able quenche fierye dartes wicked ye may able reſiſte deuill ſhield fayth reſiſt euill day temptation namely houre death see therfore thou haue god promiſes thyne hart thou beleue without waueryng temptation ariſeth deuill layeth law thy dedes agaynſt thee aunſwere promiſes turne god confeſſe thy ſelfe hym ſay euenſo el howe could mercifull remember god mercy truth cannot fulfil promiſes alſo remember hys ſonnes bloud ſtronger ſynnes wickednes whole world therewith quiet thy ſelf therunto commit thy ſelfe bleſſe thy ſelfe temptation namely houre death holy cādle el periſheſt faith y• holy • de wherewith muſt bleſſe ſelues y• laſt houre thou though thou haſt thou ſand holy candels thee c ton holy water ſhipfull pardones clothe ſacke full frier coates ceremony world al good workes deſeruings merites men worlde bee neuer ſo holy god worde onely laſteth euer hath ſworne doth abide whē thynges periſh long thou findeſt conſent thyne hart vnto law god righteous good alſo diſpleſure thou canſt fulfill diſpayre neither doubt god ſpirit thee thou art choſen chriſtes ſake inheritaunce eternall lyfe agayne rom 3 ſuppoſe rom 3 man iuſtified fayth without deedes therfore ſaith child fayth child abraham child fayth child abraham scripture ſaw god would iuſtify heathen gentile fayth ſhewed glad tidings vnto abraham thy ſede ſhall nation bleſſed wherfore fayth bleſſed witte made righteous righteous abraham many deedes law vnder curſe written ſaith curſed euery man continueth thinges written booke lawe fulfill item gala ij reſiſted peter face ſayth whiche gal 2 iewes nation ſinners gentile know man iuſtified deedes law fayth ieſus chriſt haue therfore beleued ieſus chriſt might iuſtified fayth chriſt deedes law deedes law ſhall fleſh iuſtified item ſame place ſayth touchyng yt liue lyue ye fayth ſonne god fayth iuſtifieth v loued gaue ſelfe deſpiſe grace god righteouſnes come ye law thē chriſt dead vayne ſuch like enſamples epiſtles paul full marke paule laboreth ſelfe expreſſe excedyng miſteryes fayth epiſtle epheſians epiſtle colloſſians theſe many ſuch like textes ſure forgiuenes ſinnes iuſtifying appropriate vnto faith onely without addyng workes take alſo ſimilitude chriſt maketh math vij good tree math 7 bringeth forth good frute bad tree bringeth forth bad frute ſeeſt thou frute maketh tree good tree frute tree muſt afore hand good made good yer bryng forth good frute alſo ſayth math xij either mat • 2 make tre good frute good alſo either make tree bad hys frute bad alſo ye ſpeake wel ye ſelues euil likewiſe true nothyng true mā good workes muſt firſt good impoſſible workes ſhould make hym good good yet good workes chriſtes principle ſay generall rule principle taught chriſt ye ſpeake well ye euill ſo likewiſe ye good ye euill therfore playne ſure concluſion bee doubted muſt firſt hart man good worke greater preciouſer thyng good workes world reconcile god bryng loue fauour god make loue god agayne make righteous good ſight god way ſinne deliuer loſe captiuitie conceaued borne whiche could neither loue god neither god el worke good woorke ſhould pleaſe god ſome ſupernaturall goodnes giuen god freely good worke muſt ſpryng euen ſicke man muſt firſt healed made whole yer dedes whole man blind man muſt firſt haue ſight geuen yer ſee hath feete fetter giues ſtockes muſt firſt looſed go walke runne euen whiche thou readeſt goſpel poſſeſſed deuils could laude god till deuils caſt precious thing muſt hart yer man worke good worke y• word god goſpell preacheth profereth fayth beyng ioyned worde god bringeth forth good fruit bryngeth vnto repent beleue fauour god chriſt ſoeuer heareth word beleueth ſame thereby righteous thereby geuen hym ſpirite god leadeth vnto god looſed captiuitie bondage deuill hart free loue god hath luſt god therfore called word lyfe word grace word health word redemption word forgiuenes word peace heareth beleueth cā meanes made righteous god confirmeth peter xv actes ſeyng god act 15 fayth doth purifie harte nature ſo euer word god ſame nature muſt harte whiche beleue thereon cleaue thereunto word liuyng pure righteous true euen ſo maketh harte beleue theron ſayd paul ſaith iij romaine fleſhe ſhalbe iuſtified deedes law meaneth ceremony ſacrifices vntrue ſaying foloweth immediatly law commeth knowledge ſinne ceremony vtter ſinne law cō maundementes iiij ſayth law cauſeth wrath whiche bee vnderſtand ceremony geuen reconcile people god agayne ſinned ſay ceremony law cannot iuſtify v geuen purge ſinne reconcile iuſtifie neither bleſſe temporally onely much law commaundementes iuſtifieth whiche proueth man ſick health neither doth cauſe wrath bring fauour neither whiche damneth ſaue man mother commaundeth childe euen rocke cradle grudgeth commaundement doth vtter poyſon lay hid ſetteth bate hys mother maketh hym beleue ſhee loueth theſe commaundements alſo thou ſhalt couet thy neighbour houſe thou ſhalt luſt deſire wiſhe thy neighbour wife ſeruaunt mayde oxe aſſe ſoeuer pertaineth vnto thy neyghbour geue power ſo doe vtter poyſon damne becauſe ſo proue god wrath ſeing wil mine ſo contrary therefore ſayth paul gal iij ben geuen gal 3 ſuch law could haue geuen lyfe doubt righteouſnes come law scripture concluded vnder ſinne ſayth promiſe might bee geuen vnto beleue fayth ieſus chriſt promiſes beleued fayth chriſtes promiſes doth iuſtify v iuſtifie bring ſpirite whiche looſeth hart giueth luſt law certifieth v yt good god vnto v ward ſubmit ſelues vnto god deſire heale v wil meane tyme becauſe conſent y• hart vnto y• law count v full whole wil hate v pitie v cheriſh v tender harted v loue v doth chriſt ſelfe chriſt redemer sauiour peace attonement ſatiſfactiō hath made amendes ſatiſfaction godward ſinne whiche repēt conſentyng law beleuyng promiſes haue done ſhal chriſt ſtorehouſe mercy v fragilitie fall thouſand tymes day yet repent agayne haue alway mercy layd vp v ſtore ieſus chriſt lord ſhall ſay thoſe scripture whiche go ſo ſore vpō good workes read math xxv hungred ye gaue meate c ſuch like whiche ſound though ſhould iuſtified accepted vnto fauour god chriſt good workes aunſwere many whē heare read fayth cōſent therunto haue certaine imagination opinion fayth man telleth ſtory thyng done ſtraunge lande pertayneth thē yet heleue tell true thyng imagination opinion definition true fayth call faith thinke fayth thyng ſtandeth power haue naturall workes whiche men worke feele maner workyng ſpirite neither terrible ſentence law fearefull iudgements god horrible damnation captiuitie vnder sathan therefore ſoone haue opinion imaginatiō harte ſayth verely doctrine ſemeth true beleue euē ſo thinke right fayth afterward feele ſelues alſo ſee none alteration workes folow altogether euē abide old eſtate thinke yt faith ſufficient muſt ſome greater thing fayth ſhould iuſtifie man faule away fayth agayne crye ſaying fayth onely iuſtifieth man maketh acceptable god thou aſke wherfore aūſwere ſee many beleue yet theſe whiche iudas epiſtle calleth dreamer deceaue themſelues owne fantaſies faith bringeth forth fruite dreame thing imagination call fayth dreamyng fayth opinion owne imagination wrought without grace god theſe muſt nedes worſe latter end thē begynnyng theſe old veſſels rent new wyne poured math ix heare mat 9 god word hold therfore waxe worſe right fayth ſpryngeth man fantaſie neither mās power obtaine together faith gift god pure gift god poured v freely without maner doyng v without deſeruing merites yea without ſekyng v ſayth paul ſecond epheſians euen god gift grace ephe 2 purchaſed chriſt therfore mighty operation full vertue euer working alſo renueth man begetteth freſh altereth chaungeth hym turneth altogether new nature conuerſation ſo man feeleth hys hart together altered chaunged farre otherwiſe diſpoſed hath power loue whiche could hate deliteth abhorred hateth could loue ſetteth ſoule libertie maketh free folow god doth ſoule euen health doth vnto body man pined waſted away long ſokyng diſeaſe legges cannot beare hym cannot lift vp handes helpe hymſelf taſte corrupt ſuger bitter hys mouth ſtomacke abhorreth longyng ſlibberſauſe ſwaſhe whole ſtomacke readye caſt hys gorge helth commeth ſhe changeth altereth hym cleane geueth hym ſtrength hys member luſt owne accord could neither could ſuffer mā exhorted hym hath luſt holeſome thynges hys member free libertie haue power owne accorde thinges belong whole man afore power captiuitie bondage likewiſe thyng doth right fayth ſoule ſprite god accompanieth fayth bringeth light wherwith man beholdeth hymſelfe lawe god ſeeth miſerable bondage captiuitie humbleth ſpirite god accompanieth faith himſelfe abhorreth himſelfe ſhe bringeth god promiſes good thinges chriſt god worketh worde worde worde preached fayth rooteth ſelfe harte elect faith entreth worde god beleued power god looſeth hart captiuitie bondage vnder ſinne knitteth coupleth god wyll god altereth hym chaungeth hym cleane faſhioneth forgeth hym new geueth hym power loue doe whiche vnpoſſible hym eyther loue turneth hym new nature ſo yt loueth hated hateth loued cleane altered chaunged contrary diſpoſed knit coupled faſt god naturally bringeth forthe good workes ſay god commaundeth thinges hys owne imagination doth hys owne accorde tree bringeth forth fruit accord thou needeſt bid tree bryng forth fruite ſo law fayth ſelfe bringeth forth good frutes good workes put vnto hym beleueth iuſtified fayth ſayth paul firſt epiſtle timothie fyrſt chapter neither nedeful law god written graued harte pleaſure therein without commaundement euē hys owne nature eateth drincketh ſeeth heareth talketh goeth euē ſo owne nature without coaction compulſion yt law bringeth forth good workes whole man thurſt tarieth drinke hungreth abideth meate drinketh eateth naturally euē ſo ye faithfull euer thurſt hungred god tarieth occaſion whenſoeuer occaſion geuen worketh naturally wyll god bleſſing geuen truſt chriſtes bloud thruſt hunger god wyll hath fayth vnprofitable babler faith true fayth good workes workes wotteth neither bableth meaneth wherunto wordes pertayne feeleth power faith ye working ſpirite hart enterpreteth ſcriptures ſpeake fayth workes hys owne blynd reaſon foliſh fantaſies feeling hath hart man rehearſeth tale man mouth wotteth whether ſo ſayth hath experience yt thing ſelfe doth ſcripture aſcribe fayth true fayth good workes gift god come ſelues workes v god belong onely whō appropriate whoſe gifte proper worke ſpirit frowarde peruerſe blindnes teach man nothing owne ſelfe yet preſumptuouſly take vpō greateſt hyeſt worke god euen make fayth themſelues power owne falſe imagination thoughtes therfore ſay muſt diſpayre ſelues pray god chriſtes apoſtles geue v fayth encreaſe fayth haue neede thing ſhe bringeth ſpirite onely teacheth v thinges worketh alſo mightely v carieth v aduerſitie perſecution death hel vnto heauen euerlaſting lyfe marke diligently therfore ſeing come anſwer scripture becauſe ſuch dreames fayned faythes ſake vſeth ſuch manner ſpeakinges workes man ſhould therby made good godwarde iuſtified declare vnto take differēce difference betwene falſe fayth right faith betwene falſe fayned fayth ryght fayth right fayth bringeth ſhe forthe good workes followe good workes doubt dreame opinion fained fayth wherfore looke fruit maketh tree good declareth teſtifieth tree knowen fruit • right fayth knowen fruit outwardlye tree good chriſt ſayeth euery tree knowen fruite euen ſo ſhall ye know right fayth fruite take ēnſample mary annoynted chriſtes feete luke 7 example simō bad chriſt houſe condemned chriſte defēded iuſtified ſaying simon haue certayne thyng ſay vnto thee ſayd maiſter ſay certayne lender whiche two detters one ought v c penny fiftie nothing pay forgaue bothe tell loue hym moſt simon aunſwered ſayd ſuppoſe whome forgaue moſt ſaid thou haſt truly iudged turned y• womā ſayd vnto simon seeſt thou womā entred thine houſe thou gaueſt water fete ſhe hath waſhed foot teares wypte heares head thou gaueſt kiſſe ſhe ſince tyme came hath frutes fayth ceaſed kiſſe feete heade oyle thou haſte annoynted ſhe hath annointed feete coſtly precious oyntment wherfore ſay vnto thee many ſinnes forgeuen ſhe loueth much leſſe forgeuen ſame doth loue leſſe c hereby ſee dedes work outward ſignes inward grace bounteous plenteous mercy god frely receyued without merites deedes ye dedes chriſt teacheth know inwar • fayth loue outward deedes deedes fruites loue loue fruit fayth loue alſo deedes great ſmal according proportion fayth fayth mighty ſtrong loue feruent dedes plenteous done excedyng mekenes fayth weake loue cold dedes ſeldom beare flower bloſſomes winter symon beleued fayth yet weakly according proportion fayth loued coldly dedes therafter chriſt vnto ſimple bare feaſt onely receaued great humanitie mary ſtrong fayth therfore burning loue notable dedes done excedyng profound depe mekenes one ſide ſhe ſaw differēce betwene true faith fained faith ſelfe clearely law daunger ſhe cruell bondage vnder ſinne horrible damnation alſo feareful ſentence iudgement god vpon ſinners ſide ſhe heard goſpell chriſt preached promiſes ſhe ſaw egles eye excedyng aboundant mercy god paſſeth vtteraunce ſpech whiche ſet foorth chriſt meke ſinners whiche knowledge ſinnes ſhe beleued word god mightyly glorified god ouer mercy truth beyng ouercome ouerwhelmed yt vnſpeakeable yea incomprehenſible aboundat rich kyndnes god enflame burne loue yea ſo ſwolne loue ſhe could abide hold muſt breake ſo drōke loue ſhe regarded nothyng euen vtter feruent burnyng loue hart onely reſpect ſelfe though ſhe neuer ſo great notable ſinner neither curious hipocriſie phariſeis whiche euer diſdaine weake ſinners neither coſtlines oyntment humblenes run vnto feete waſhed teares eye wyped heares head anoynted precious oyntment yea would doubt haue runne groūd vnder feete haue vttered loue toward hym yea would haue deſcended downe hell bene poſſible euen paul ix chapter epiſtle romaine dronke loue rome 9 ouerwhelmed plēteouſnes infinite mercy god receaued chriſte vnſought wiſhed hym ſelfe baniſhed chriſt damned ſaue yt iewes might haue ben man feeleth god hym ſelfe ſo hys neighbour marke thyng alſo moſt part becauſe groſſenes knowledge procede frō whiche laſt hi •• oſt vnto firſt begynnyng latter end diſputyng makyng argumentes backeward begyn effect worke procede vnto naturall cauſe enſample firſt ſee moone darke ſearch cauſe find puttyng earth betwene sunne moone naturall cauſe darknes earth ſtoppeth backeward diſputations light diſpute backeward ſaying moone darkned therfore earth directly betwene sunne moone yet darkenes moone naturall cauſe earth betwen sunne moone effect therof cauſe declaratiue declaryng leadyng v vnto knowledge earth betwene sunne moone directly cauſeth darknes ſtopping light sunne moone contrarywyſe beyng earth directly betwene sunne moone naturall cauſe yt darknes likewiſe hath ſonne therfore father yet ſoone cauſe father contrarywiſe notwithſtandyng yt ſonne cauſe declaratiue wherby know father ſame maner many ſinnes forgeuen ſhe scripture ſpeaketh ye moſt groſſeſt maner diligent therfore thou deceaued curiouſnes mē ſmall reputation haue bene deceaued owne ſophiſtry hereby ſeeſt thou great difference betwene beyng righteous thou art called choſen god vnto eternall lyfe looſed frō bondes sathā whoſe captiue thou waſt peter exhorteth yt firſt ſecond epiſtle good workes make callyng election wherewith called choſen god word mammon ſignifieth rich temporal good namely ſuperfluitie yt aboue neceſſitie required vnto neceſſary vſes wherwith man may helpe without vndoyng hurtyng himſelfe hamon hebrew ſpeach ſignifieth ſpeaketh vnto epheſ 5 ephe 5 dayes euill thoughe god hath made good worke god makyng yet called euill becauſe dayes called euil becauſe euill men vſe euill men vſe amiſſe much ſinne occaſions euill peril ſoules wrought thē euē ſo rich called euill becauſe euill men beſtow thē amiſſe miſuſe rich goeth common prouerbe hath money hath liſteth cauſe fighting ſtealing laying awaite lying flatering vnhappines againſt man neighbour men holde rich part ſingularly god called vnrighteous mammon becauſe beſtowed miniſtred vnto neighbor nede neighbour neede geue neyther depart liberally haue withholde vnrighteouſly hys owne much bounden helpe hym lawe nature whātſoeuer thou wouldeſt y• thee doe thou alſo bound law nature helpe needye neighbour hym chriſt math 5 geue euery mā deſireth thee iohn firſt epiſtle man haue thys worldes good ſee hys brother nede loue god hym vnrighteouſnes mammō ſee men becauſe ſpirituall thoſe goodes whiche gotten moſt truely iuſtly whiche beguile men ſuppoſe man wrong keepyng got ſtealyng robbing oppreſſion vſury neither hurt man thirdly many haue buſied thēſelues ſtudying vnrighteous ſteward becauſe yt chriſt ſo praiſeth ſhortly plainly aunſwere chriſt vnrighteous stuard prayſeth vnrighteous ſtuard neither ſetteth forth v coū terfait becauſe vnrighteouſnes becauſe wiſedome onely vnright ſo wiſely prouided himſelf would prouoke another pray ſtudy gold ſilke pleaſe louers wilt thou garniſh thy ſoule fayth pleaſe chriſt prayſe whoredome y• diligence whore miſuſeth wiſe paule alſo rom v likeneth adam chriſt together ſaying adam figure chriſt yet nie tree bloſſome nowe bloſſomyng tree cauſe yt ſommer draweth nie drawyng ni • ſommer cauſe ye bloſſoms bloſſomes put v remembraunce ſommer hand chriſt teacheth simō feruentnes loue outward dedes ſee ſtrong faith within whence ſo great loue ſpringeth y• maner certaine phraſes ſpech expounded ſay charitie ſhew charitie deede charitie ſhewe mercy deede mercy meanyng thereby yt deedes declare loue neighbour much haue compaſſion thē neede moreouer poſſible loue except ſee cauſe except ſee harte yt loue kyndnes god v warde chriſt lord poſſible loue god aright ſay alſo loueth dogge loueth mā ſhould loue dogge firſt man loued loue wherewith loueth would compell loue dogge though dogge deſerued yea though dogge done diſpleaſure yet loued ſame loue would refrayne hym reuenging himſelfe cauſe referre vengeaunce vnto ſpeakinges finde ſcripture iohn fourth hys firſt epiſtle ſayth ſaith loue iohn 4 god yet bateth brother lyar loueth brother ſeeth loue god ſeeth ſpoken man ſhould firſt thy handes frō robbeſt thou hym owne art thiefe mercyfull hath ſpirite god chriſtian man hath chriſtes ſpirite chriſt mercifull thing therefore thou mercifull y• enſample chriſt haſt thou ſpirite thou haue chriſtes ſpirite thē art thou none ro 8 rom 〈◊〉 haſt part wyth hym moreouer though thou ſhew mercy vnto thy neighbour yet thou ſuch burning loue chriſt vnto thee ſo muſt y• knowledge thy ſinne deſire mercy chriſt chriſtian man hath nought reioyce concerning deedes reioycing chriſt dyed hym waſhed chriſtes bloude deedes reioyceth neither counteth merites neither geueth pardon neither ſeeketh hyer place heauen neither maketh himſelfe ſauiour men thorough good workes geueth honour god greateſt deedes mercy knowledgeth himſelfe ſinner vnfainedly aboundauntly content y• place prepared chriſt good deedes ſigne onely chriſtes ſpirite chriſt thorow chriſt elect eternall life order loue charitie loue ſeketh owne profite ſome dreame goſpell chriſt knoweth man ſhould beginne himſelfe ſerue ſelfe firſt diſcend wot ſteppes loue ſeketh profite ij cor xij maketh 2 cor 12 man forget ſelfe turne profite man chriſt ſought ſelfe owne profite terme ſelfe goſpell neither yet father mother ſiſter brother kinſman one ſhould preferred loue aboue chriſt thing chriſt thynges euery chriſten man chriſt ſelfe thy neighbour nede hath good right thy good hath chriſt ſelfe • lord ouer looke thou oweſt chriſt thou oweſt thy neighbour nede thy neighbour oweſt thou thine hart thy ſelfe thou haſt canſt loue ſpringeth chriſt excludeth man neither putteth difference betwene one chriſt al one degree without reſpect perſous notwithſtandyng though chriſten man hart open mē receaueth men yet becauſe habilitie goodes extendeth ſo farre prouiſion made euery man ſhall care owne houſhold euery one muſt care owne houſholdes father mother thine elder haue holpen thee wife child ſeruauntes thou ſhouldeſt care prouide thyne houſhold thou infidele ſeyng thou haſt taken thee ſo much thy part committed thee congregation thou firſt looke thyne owne houſhold poore haſt done thy dutie thyne houſhold yet haſt aboundance bleſſyng god oweſt thou poore cā labour would labour get worke deſtitute frēdes poore meane thou knoweſt thyne owne pariſh prouiſion ought cōgregation euery pariſh care poore thy neighbour whiche thou knoweſt ſerued thou yet haue ſuperfluitie heareſt neceſſitie among brother thouſand myle thē art thou detter yea y• infidel detters nede farforth maynteine thē agaynſt chriſt blaſpheme chriſt thus euery man nedeth thy helpe thy father mother ſiſter brother chriſt euen euery man doth father father mother ſiſter brother vnto chriſt moreouer infidele falſe chriſten forſake houſehold wife childrē ſuch helpe ſelues art thou bound haue wherewith euen much thyne owne houſhold haue good right thy goodes thou thy ſelfe thou withdraw mercy haſt wherewith helpe thou thefe thou ſhew mercy ſo doeſt thou thy dutie art faythfull miniſter houſhold chriſt chriſt ſhalt thou haue thy reward muſt chriſtes ſake ſhew cōpaſſion charitie men ſo far habilitie extend thanke whole world thyne yet hath euery brother right thy goodes heyre thee heyres chriſt moreouer rich haue wiſedome muſt ſee poore ſet worke many able may feede ſelues labour owne handes accordyng scripture commaundemēt god ſeeſt thou almes deede meaneth wherefore ſerueth ſeketh almes mercyfull neighbour ſuccour brother nede dutie brother giue brother oweth ſame blind ſeeth chriſten mā haue felowſhyp chriſtes bloud pertaining good workes vnderſtand yt workes good good workes ar • done within law god fayth thākeſgeuyng god vnderſtand thou thē pleaſeſt god ſo euer thou doeſt law god thou makeſt water truſt either winde water ſtopped thou ſhouldeſt feele preciouſe thyng either thankes ought geuen god therfore moreouer put difference betwene workes ſoeuer commeth thy handes time place occaſion geueth god hath put thee degree hie low touchyng pleaſe god worke better god looketh firſt thy woorke world doth though bewtyfulnes worke pleaſed hym doth world though nede god looketh firſt thy hart fayth thou haſt wordes thou beleueſt hym truſteſt thou loueſt hym mercy hath ſhewed ther looketh hart thou workeſt thou workeſt thou accepteſt degree hath put thee degree thou art whether thou apoſtle ſhoemaker set enſample thine eye thou art kechinpage waſheſt thy maſters diſhes apoſtle preacheth word god apoſtle harke paule ſayth 2 corinth ix preach ſayth haue nought reioyce 2 cor 9 neceſſitie put vnto ſhould ſay god hath made ſo woe vnto preach willingly ſayth haue reward ſure god ſpirite ſelues apoſtles alſo compell men take thē greater apoſtles yea greater thē chriſt ſelfe thē wo vnto damnation iuſt preach hart right yet miniſtreth office god hath put haue ſpirite god heare voyce iuſtified written thirde chapter rom lawe iuſtifieth vttereth ſinne onely compelleth driueth penitent repentyng ſinner flee vnto ſanctuary mercy bloud chriſt alſo repent neuer ſo much neuer ſo well willyng vnto law god yet ſo weake ſnares occaſiōs ſo innumerable fall dayly hourely coulde diſpeire rewarde hanged worke whoſoeuer aſcribeth eternall life vnto deſeruing merite workes muſt faule one two incōueniences either muſt blinde phariſey ſeing lawe ſpirituall carnall looke reioyce outward ſhining deedes deſpiſing weake reſpect iuſtifie himſelfe el ſee lawe ſpirituall neuer able aſcend vnto yt yt law requireth muſt nedes deſpaire let euery chriſten mā therfore chriſt hope righteouſnes reioyce chriſt hope truſt righteouſnes loued choſē accept vnto yt enheritaunce eternall lyfe neyther preſuming perfectnes neither deſpayring weakenes perfecter man clearer ſight ſeeth thouſand thinges diſpleaſe alſo perfectnes obtayned life therefore deſireth chriſt ſinne let hym let mā deſpayre put hope chriſt ſhalbe ſafe weake doe would fayne doe deſpayre turne ſtrong hath promiſed geue ſtrength aſke chriſtes name complayne god deſire hym fulfill promiſes god committe hym ſelfe ſhall mercy truth ſtrength make feele loue beloued chriſtes ſake though neuer ſo weake righteous god heare lawe lawe ſhall iuſtified rom ij text playner thā rom 2 needeth expounded chapter paule proueth law naturall holpe gentile appeareth lawes ſtatutes ordinaunces made city yet kept great keepe ſmall vnder owne profite violence lawe euery man prayſeth lawe farre forth profitable pleaſant vnto himſelf owne appetite ſhould refrayned grudgeth againſt law moreouer proueth knowledge holpe gentile though learned mē philoſophers came knowledge god creature world yet power worſhippe god thys ſecōd chapter proueth yt iewes though lawe written yet holpe coulde keepe idolater alſo murtherers adulterer whatſoeuer lawe forbad concludeth therfore yt iewe well dāned gentill hearing lawe onely might haue iuſtified thē iewes bene righteous required mā lawe righteous becauſe y• iewe leſſe dāned thē gētill publiſhing declaring ye lawe doth vtter mās ſin geueth neither ſtrēgth help fulfill law law killeth thy cōſcience geueth man fulfill ye law hee beleueth chriſt thee luſt fulfill law faith chriſt geueth luſt power ye law true yt doth ye law righteous yt doth mā ſaue yt beleueth putteth truſt chriſt man worke hath builte vpon abide ſhall receaue rewarde 1 cor 21 cor 2 circumſtance ſame chapter witt goeth foloweth declareth playnely ment paule talketh learning doctrine preaching ſayth himſelfe hath layde foundation chriſt ye ſure foundation ieſus chriſt man laye exhorteth therfore euery man take hede buildeth vpon boroweth ſimilitude y• goldſmith trieth metalles fire ſaying fire iudgement yt ſcripture ſhall trie euery man worke euery mās preaching doctrine builde vpon foundation layde paule meane ieſus chriſt golde ſiluer precious ſtone one thyng thou ſure good reward ſhall folow chriſt rewardeth owne workes v whiche reward thy deedes chriſtes haue purchaſed thee whoſe purchaſing alſo luſt thou haſt god law might thou fulfilleſt remember alſo
