workes paule iohn thereby iuſtified ſaued ſoeuer imagineth fayth deceaueth ſelfe vaine diſputer brauler wordes hath feelyng hart though thou conſent law good righteous holy ſoroweſt repenteſt becauſe thou haſt broken morneſt becauſe thou haſt ſtrength fulfill yet art thou fayth maketh v one god therby one god yea thou ſhouldeſt ſhortly deſpayre blaſpheme god promiſes forgiuenes helpe fayth thyne hart beleue fayth therfore ſetteth thee one god fayth prayeth alway ſhe hath alway infirmity weakeneſſes eye alſo god promiſes ſhe alway longeth fayth prayeth always place place blind vnbeleffe prayeth alway place churche onely ſuch churche lawfull preach god promiſes neither teach men truſt therein fayth ſhe prayeth ſetteth good dedes ſaying lorde good dedes bargaineth god ſaying lord graūt wil thee mumble ſo much dayly go ſo farre faſt faſt enter religion ſuch pointes infidelitie yea rather idolatrie ſhe ſetteth infirmity lacke face prayer faithfull man god promiſes ſayinge lorde thy mercy truth whiche thou haſt ſworne mercyfull vnto plucke priſon hell looſe bondes sathan giue power glorifie thy name fayth therfore iuſtifieth hart god deedes iuſtifie outwardly world teſtifie onely mē inwardly god ſoeuer looketh perfect law libertie continueth therein bee forgetfull hearer doer worke ſhalbe happy deede iames law libertie iaco▪ requireth free hart thou fulfill declareth free hart lowſed bondes sathan preachyng law maketh man free bindeth key byndeth conſciences vnto eternall damnation whē preached promiſes goſpell keye lowſeth conſciences repēt bounde preachyng law iuſtified hys dedes offered hys ſonne iames 3 iſaac vpon altar iames iij hys deede iuſtified hym world declared vttered faith iuſtifieth god wrought wonderfull worke iames alſo affirmeth raab harlot betwene hym take enſample example thou mayeſt vnderſtand let two poore men deſtitute rayment colde winter one ſtrong feleth griefe greuouſly mournyng payne colde come moued wyth pitie compaſſion ſay example ſpake promiſe one becauſe feeleth hys diſeaſe commeth god promiſes man holpe ſinners yt fele ſinnes mourne ſorrow repent wyth harte iohn baptiſt went chriſt preached repē taunce preached lawe god god well theyres promiſes v well preſente v well aſke ſhal obtain knocke open ſeeke wee ſhall finde thyrſt truth ſhall fullfill luſt chriſt v vntill worldes ende math y• laſt let little flock bold therefore god ſide matter maketh againſt v byſhops cardinalles pope ſo euer name marke alſo god ſende thee ſea promiſe goe thee bring god tryeth fayth child thee ſafe lande rayſe vp tempeſt agaynſt thee proue whether thou wilt abide worde thou mayſt feele thy fayth perceiue goodnes alwayes fayre weather thou neuer brought ſuch ieoperdy whēce mercy onely deliuered thee thy fayth ſhould preſumption thou ſhouldeſt euer vnthanckfull god mercileſſe vnto thy neighbour god promiſe ritches way therto god worketh backward pouertie loueth chaſteneth whome exalteth caſteth downe whome ſaueth damneth firſt bringeth man heauen except ſend hell firſt promiſe life ſlayeth firſt buildeth caſteth downe firſt patcher builde man foundation woorke vntill paſt remedy brought vnto ſuch caſe y• men may ſee hand power mercy goodneſſe trueth hath wrought together let man partaker hys prayſe glorye workes wonderful contrary vnto man workes euer ſauing deliuered owne ſonne onely ſonne hys deare ſonne vnto death enemy ſake winne enemye ouercomme loue might ſee loue loue againe loue likewiſe men ouercome well ioſeph ſaw sunne moone xj ſtarres worſhipping neuertheleſſe ioſeph ere came paſſe god layed hym could neither ſee ſunne moone neyther ſtarre ſkye many yeares alſo vndeſerued norture humble meeke teach god wayes make apt meet roome honor againſt came might perceiue feele came god might ſtrong ſpirite miniſter godly promiſed child iſraell iſraelites lande riuers milke honny brought ſpace fourty yeares land onely riuers mylke honny ſo much drop water nourture teach father doth ſonne behold begin mocke maketh mocke ſelfe caſteth ende • begin ſaying man beganne builde able make ende ſo likewiſe none forſaketh hath diſciple whoſoeuer therefore caſteth aforehand muſt ieoberd life helpe working ſpirite 2 cor 12 lord ſayd vnto paul grace ſufficiēt thee ſtrēgth made perfect weaknes lo chriſt neuer ſtrong v till weake ſtrength abateth ſo groweth ſtrength weake • world ſtronger chriſt may dwell therfore haue delectation ſayth paule infirmity rebuke need perſecutions anguiſh chriſtes ſake weake weakenes fleſh ſtrength ſpirite ſtrong meaning weaknes fleſhe ſtrength ſpirite euerlaſting ſuffer ij thing put choiſ • tribulatiō aduerſity lord ſauiour chriſt euerlaſting curſe little pleaſure ſake withdrawe ſelues chaſtyſing nurture god wherewith teacheth ſonnes faſhioneth godly maketh perfect chriſt maketh apte meete veſſels receiue grace hys ſpirite might perceaue feele exceeding mercy haue chriſt innumerable bleſſinges vnſpeakeable inheritance whereunto called choſen ſealed ſauiour ieſus chriſt vnto whome prayſe euer amen finally whome god chuſeth raigne euerlaſtingly chriſt ſealeth mighty ſpirite poureth ſtrength differēce betwen child god deuill hart ſuffer afflictiōs alſo chriſt bearing witneſſe vnto truth difference betwene child god ſaluation betwene child deuyll damnation child god haue power theyr harte ſuffer god worde theyr life ſaluatiō hope wage wage pleaſures world ar earneſt euerlaſting damnation concluſion xij chap hebrues well confirmeth ſaying ſonne deſpiſe thou chaſticing lord neither faint whē thou art rebuked lord god child vnder chaſticing loueth chaſticeth yea ſcourgeth euery ſonne whome receaueth perſecution aduerſitie truthes ſake god ſcourge god rod pertaineth vnto child indifferently ſayth ſcourgeth euery ſonne maketh none exception moreouer ſayth text ye ſhall endure chaſticing god offreth hymſelfe vnto vnto ſonnes ſonne father chaſticeth ye vnder correction whereof partaker ye baſtardes ſonnes foraſmuch muſt needes bee baptiſed tribulation red ſea great fearefull wildernes land cruell giantes naturall coū trey▪ yea aſmuch playne earneſt way kingdome way go byſhops heauen life perſecution ſufferyng payne death enſample chriſte therefore let v arme ſoules comforte scripture god euer ready hand time neede helpe v ſuch tyrant perſecutors god ſcourge rod chaſtice v father hath alway time correction rod faſt hand ſo rod doth nothing father moueth euen ſo hath god tyrantes tyrātes haue power doe would hys hande letteth whatſoeuer would much onely appoynteth far forth neceſſarye v childe ſubmitteth himſelfe vnto hys father correction nurture humbleth himſelf altogether vnto father thē rod taken away euen ſo ar come vnto knowledge right waye haue forſaken owne offer ſelues cleane vnto god walke way ſoeuer haue v turneth tyrantes el enforce perſecute v putteth way according vnto comfortable enſamples ſcripture moreouer let v arme ſoules promiſes helpe aſſiſtance promiſes god ſtrength walke way haue thee beleue goe thee aſſiſt thee ſtrengthen thee agaynſt tyrātes deliuer thee al tribulatiō way meanes committe vnto godly pleaſure wiſedome caſt care vpon though ſeeme neuer ſo vnlikely neuer ſo impoſſible vnto naturall reaſon yet beleue ſtedfaſtly ſhall according olde vſe chainge courſe worlde euen twinckling eye come ſodenly vpon gyantes theefe night cō paſſe wyles worldly wiſedome crye peace ſafe ſhall theyr ſorrowes beginne panges woman traueileth childe ſhall deſtroy deliuer thee vnto glorious prayſe hys mercy truth amen pertayning vnto deſpiſe god worde ſhall know whether ye agaynſt chriſt fals prophetes ſeing ye let ſee ye alleage ſcriptures chriſt ſayth theyr deedes ye ſhall know agaynſte chriſt knowen dedes ſeuerall kyngdome looke deed ſee ye ſworne together haue ſeperated yourſelues lay people haue ſeuerall kingdome amōg ſelues ſeuerall lawes owne making wherewith ye violently binde lay people neuer seuerall lawes chriſt lowſeth • rely pope byndeth lowſe agayne money ſecret coū ſayle conſented vnto making thouſand thinges forbidde ye chriſt made free diſpence agayne money neyther exception lacke money ye haue ſecret counſell ſelues men ſecretes counſels know ye man ye ſeek honour rich promotion authoritie raigne ouer obey man father geue ought curteſie ye cō pell ſonne geue violently whether crafte owne lawes theſe deedes againſt chriſt whole pariſh v hyre ſcholemaiſter teach child reaſon ſhoulde compelled pay thys ſcholemaiſter wage ſhould haue licence goe wil dwell contrey leaue child vntaught doth pope ſo haue geuen vp tithe curteſie vnto one teach v god worde commeth pope compelleth v pay violently neuer teach maketh one parſon neuer commeth v perſon yea one ſhall haue v vj many get wotteth oftentimes neuer one ſtandeth another made ʋicare vicare geueth diſpenſation goe ſet pariſhe prieſt miniſter ſort dumme ceremony pariſhe prieſt becauſe hath moſt labour leaſt profite polleth hys part fetteth maſſe peuy trentall yonder dirige money beadroule confeſſion peny ſuch like thus neuer taught yet neuertheles compelled ye compelde hyre many coſtly ſcholemaſters theſe deedes verely agaynſt chriſt shall therefore iudge dedes chriſt commaundeth ye falſe prophetes diſciples antechriſt agaynſt chriſt sermon thou readeſt actes apoſtles apoſtles preached doubt preached mother tongue might written mother tounge one v preach good ſermon may written saint hierome alſo tranſlated bible mother tounge may alſo ſay tranſlated tounge ſo rude ſo rude falſe lyers greeke tounge agreeth engliſh wyth latin property prop •… tie hebrue toung agree engliſh hebrue tounge agreeth thouſand tymes wyth engliſhe wyth latyn maner ſpeaking one ſo thouſand place thou needeſt trāſlate engliſh worde worde thou muſt ſeeke compaſſe latin yet ſhalt haue much worke tranſlate welfauouredly ſo haue ſame grace ſweteneſſe ſence pure vnderſtanding latin hath hebrue thouſand partes better maye tranſlated engliſh thē latin yea except memory fayle haue forgotten red whē childe thou ſhalt finde engliſhe cronicle kyng adelſtone cauſed kyng adelſton holy scripture tranſlated tounge englande prelate exhorted thereunto moreouer ſeyng one euer contrary preachyng preacheth contrary two meete one diſputeth brauleth wyth two ſcoldes foraſmuch one holdeth doctor one foloweth dun contrary doctours saint thomas bonauenture alexāder de hale raymond lyre brygot dorbell holcot gorram trumbett hugo de ſancto victore de monte regio de noua uilla de medium villa ſuch lyke nūber thou haddeſt euery authour one booke thou couldeſt pyle vp ware houſe london euery authour one contrary vnto ſo great diuerſitie ſpirites ſhall know lyeth ſayeth truth whereby ſhall trye thē iudge ʋerely god worde onely true ſhall thou wilt let ſee ſcripture nay ſay ſcriptures ſo harde thou couldeſt neuer vnderſtand doctours muſt meaſure mete yarde cloth twenty clothes diuers lengthes diuers bredthes ſhall ſure length mete yarde ſuppoſe rather muſt firſt ſure length mete yarde thereby meaſure iudge clothes muſt firſt beleue doctour doctour firſt true truth ſcripture dependeth hys truth ſo truth god ſpringeth truth man thus antechriſt turneth rote tree vpwarde cauſe damne antechriſt turneth rootes tree vpward ſome origenes workes alowe ſome know ſome hereſy ſome ſcripture trow know saint auguſtine beſt one beſt euer wrote vpon scripture wrote many thynges amiſſe beginning many doctours scripture triall doctrine right touch ſtone doe ʋerely scripture hymſelfe well perceaued afterward looked diligently vpon reuoked many thynges agayne wrote many thinges vnderſtode newly conuerted yer throughly ſeene scripture folowed opinion plato common perſwaſions man wiſedom famous philoſophy wyll ſay yet ſhamefully man vnderſtād scripture without philautia ſay philoſophy man muſte firſt bee well ſeene ariſtotle yer cā vnderſtand scripture ſay ariſtotle ariſtotles doctrine worlde wythout beginning ſhall wythout ende firſt man neuer laſt ſhall neuer god doth neceſſitie neither careth doe neither wyll aſke accomptes scripture wythout thys doctrine coulde vnderſtande scripture ſayth god created world nought god worketh thyng hys free wyll ſecret purpoſe ſhall ryſe agayne god haue accomptes ariſtotle haue done thys lyfe ariſtotle ſayth geue man lawe hath power hymſelfe doe fulfill lawe becō meth righteous wyth workyng righteouſly paul paule ſcripture ſayth lawe doth vtter ſinne onely helpeth neyther hath man power doe lawe tyll ſpirite god geuen hym fayth chriſt madnes ſay coulde vnderſtand scripture wythout ariſtotle ariſtotle ariſtotles righteouſnes hys vertues ſpring man free wyll turke euery infidell idolater may righteous vertuous wyth righteouſnes thoſe vertues moreouer ariſtotles felicitie bleſſednes ſtandeth auoyding tribulatiōs rich health honour worſhip frendes authoritie felicitie pleaſeth ſpiritualty well without theſe thouſand ſuch lyke pointes couldeſt thou vnderſtand scripture 〈◊〉 ſayth righteouſnes commeth chriſt man vertues fruites gift god ſpirite chriſt bleſſeth v tribulation perſecution aduerſitie ſay couldeſt thou vnderſtād ſcripture without philoſophy much paule philoſophy paul ſecond colloſſians warned beware leaſt man ſhould ſpoyle ſay robbe fayth chriſt thorough philoſophy deceitful vanity thorough tradition men ordinaunces ye world chriſt▪ meanes thou wilt man teach euery man take scripture learne hymſelfe nay man teach deſire▪ god teach verely ſo ſay neuertheleſſe ſeyng ye wyll teach man thyrſt truth read scripture hymſelfe deſiring god open dore knowledge vnto god truthes ſake wil muſt teach hym howbeit meaning mayſter teacheth prentice know poyntes mete yarde firſt many inch many feete halfe yarde quarter nayle teacheth mete thing therby euen ſo ye teach people order teachyng god lawe obedience god requireth v vnto father mother mayſter lord king ſuperiours wyth frendly loue commaundeth one loue teach know naturall vename byrth poyſon moueth hart v rebell againſt ordinaunces god proue man righteous ſight god damned lawe whē thou haſt meeked feared wyth lawe teache teſtament promiſes god hath made vnto v chriſt much loueth v chriſt teach principle ground fayth ſacramentes ſignifie ſhall ſpirite worke wyth thy preaching make thē feele would come paſſe know naturall wit followeth true principle naturall reaſō euē ſo ye becommeth saintes neither filthines neither fooliſhe talking geſting whiche comely ye knowe whoremonger either vncleane perſon couetous perſon worſhipper image hath enheritaunce kyngdome chriſt god wrath god vpon forbidding loue ſoules thouſand reaſons moe might made thou mayſt ſee paracleſis eraſmi preface paraphaſis mathew vnto ſhould cōpelled holde peace geue ſhamefull aunſweres hope theſe prince make common obediē ce mō •… 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 • ey 〈◊〉 • 〈…〉 〈…〉 〈◊〉 ſayuyng make hauoke mēs goodes therfore haue made litle treatiſe foloweth cōteinyng obedience god ſoeuer readeth ſhal eaſly perceaue cōtrary onely lye alſo cauſe ſuch blaſphemy ſtirreth thē ſo furiouſly rage belye truth howbeit new thyng vnto word god rayled vpon neither firſt tyme hypocrite haue aſcribed god worde vengeaunce hyppocrites lay god worde themſelues • e cauſe god warneth ere ſtrike thē ſelues euer cauſe hypocrite falſe doctrine idolatry haue euermore ledde wrath vengeaunce god vpon people ſo ſore god could lē ger forbeare differre puniſhmēt yet god alwayes mercyfull would take vengeaūce hath euer ſent hys true prophetes true preacher warne people might repent people moſt part namely heades ruler comfort perſuadyng hyopcrites haue euer waxed hard harted haue perſecuted word god prophetes thē god whiche alſo righteous hath alwayes poured plague vppon without delay plague hypocrite aſcribe vnto god word ſaying ſee whē god puniſheth • oo •… ry hipocrites ſay new learning cauſe thereof miſcheue come vpō v ſence new learnyng came vp new ſect newe doctrine ſeeſt thou hieremias xliiij people cryed goe old idolatry agayne ſaying ſence left haue bene neceſſitie haue bene conſumed warre hunger prophet aunſwered idolatry wēt vnto hart god ſo could lenger ſuffer maliciouſnes people ſedition ſayd pylate haue found felow peruertyng people forbiddyng pay tribute caeſar ſayth chriſt kyng agayne ſame chapter hee moueth people ſayd teachyng throughout iury began galile euen place likewiſe layd apoſtles charge thou mayſt ſee actes cyprian alſo auguſtine many mo made workes defence word god againſt ſuch blaſphemies thou mayſt ſee new thyng old accuſtomed thyng hypocrite wyte god word true preacher miſchieue lying doctrine cauſe neuer later dede preachyng god worde becauſe trouble foloweth preaching goſpell truly receaued god ſendeth great trouble world partly auenge hym ſelfe tyrauntes perſecutours worde partly deſtroye thoſe worldly people whiche make god word nothyng cloke fleſhly libertie good folow goſpell chriſt math xiij like neth kyngdome heauen vnto net caſt sea katcheth fiſhes good bad kyngdome heauen preachyng goſpell vnto come good bad good fewe chriſt calleth chriſtes flocke little flocke therfore litle flocke luke xij euer come goſpell true entent ſeekyng therin nothyng glorye prayſe god offering thē ſelues frely willingly take aduerſitie chriſte goſpels ſake bearyng recorde vnto prelate take vocation ſeke god glory honour liue eaſilie promote themſelues dignitie truth al men may heare greateſt nomber come euer came folowed euen chriſt hym ſelfe worldly purpoſe thou mayſt well ſee iohn vj howe almoſt fiue thouſand folowed chriſt would alſo haue made hym kyng becauſe well fedde rebuked ſaying ye ſeke becauſe ye ſaw miracle becauſe ye eat bread filled droue away hard preachyng euen ſo euer moſt parte ſeke libertie glad libertie heare vnſatiable couetouſnes ſpiritualitie rebuked heare falſehood wile vttered tyrāny oppreſſiō preached againſt heare kynges officer ſhould rule chriſtenly brotherly ſeke thyng ſaue wealth ſubiectes heare haue ſuch authoritie god ſo pylle polle doe raiſe vp tax gatherynges maynteine phantaſies make warre wote cauſe therefore becauſe heades ſo rule alſo longer obey reſiſte god deſtroyeth one wicked god word cauſe euill riſe agaynſt euill heades one wicked deſtroyeth yet god word cauſe neither yet preacher though chriſt hym ſelfe taught obedience lawfull reſiſte wrong officer appointed thereunto howe man muſt loue enemy pray perſecute bleſſe curſe hym vengeaunce muſt bee remitted god man muſt forgeue hee wil forgeuen god yet people moſt part receaued euer ready riſe fight euer scribe phariſeis wēt take chriſt afraide people holy day ſayde math xxvj leſt rumour aryſe among people math xxi would haue takē feared people luke xx chriſte aſked phariſeis queſtion vnto whiche durſt aūſwere leſt people ſhould haue ſtoned laſt much diſciples chriſtes diſciples long weake worldly mynded apoſtles chriſt ſo lōg hearyng chriſtes doctrine yet ready fight chriſte cleane agaynſt chriſtes teachyng peter math xxvi drew ſword rebuked luke ix iames iohn would haue fire come heauen cōſume samaritanes auenge iniury chriſte likewiſe rebuked chriſtes diſciples ſo long carnall wonder perfect firſt daye yea much bee pope doctrine cauſeth cō maundeth murther taught euen babe kil turke ſlea iewe burne hereticke fight liberty right church cal yea aſmuch wee brought belefe wee ſhed bloud euen chriſten ſonne ſhed bloud hys father begat hym defence pope godhead onely alſo ſo euer cauſe bee yea though cauſe holynes commaundeth onely deſerue much chriſt deſerued v dyed croſſe ſlaine quarel ſoules goe nay flye heauen ere bloud cold much ſaye haue ſucked ſuche bloudy imaginatiōs bottome hart euen mother milke haue ben ſo long hardened therein wonder yet young chriſt thought lawful fight true word god yea though man throughly perſuaded lawful reſiſt kyng thoughe would wrongfully take away lyfe goodes yet might thinke lawful reſiſt hipocrites riſe agaynſt kyng kyng deliuer kyng bondage captiuitie wherin hipocrites hold hym wyles falſehode ſo man may bee ſuffered come tell trouth ſeeſt thou bloudy doctrine pope cauſeth diſobedience pope doctrine bloudy rebellion inſurrectiō hee teacheth ſight defende hys tradition ſoeuer dreameth fire water ſworde diſobey father mother maſter lorde kyng emperour yea inuade chriſtes doctrine peaceable ſo euer lād natiō receaue admit godhead peaceable doctrine chriſte teacheth obey ſuffer word god remit vengeaunce defenſe word god mighty able defende alſo ſoone god auengeth hys doctrine ſelfe worde openly preached teſtified witneſſed vnto world hath geuen ſeaſon repent ready take vengeaunce enemy ſhoteth arrowes heades dipte deadly poyſon poureth hys plague heauen downe vpon ſendeth moren peſtilence among ſinketh city maketh earth ſwalow cōpaſſeth wyles taketh theyr owne trappes ſnares caſteth thē pittes whiche digged men ſendeth daſyng head vtterly deſtroyeth owne ſuttle councell prepare mā ought behaue ſelfe readyng doctours alſo scripture thy mynde therefore vnto litle treatiſe read diſcretly iudge indifferently alledge scripture loke thou text whether interprete right whiche thou ſhalt eaſely perceaue circumſtance proceſſe thē thou make chriſt foundation ground build referreſt hym findeſt alſo expoſitiō agreeth vnto common article faith opē ſcriptures god father mercy whiche hys truthes ſake rayſed sauiour chriſt vp agayne iuſtifie v geue thee hys ſpirite iudge righteous eye geue ſtrength abyde mayntayne withall patience long ſufferyng vnto example edifying congregation glory name amen obedience degree proued god word firſt child vnto theyr elder god worketh thynges ſecrete iudgement purpoſe hys godly pleaſure prouided houre thy father mother ſhould come together make thee throughe preſent thee thy mother wombe faſhioned thee brethed lyfe thee yt great loue vnto thee prouided milke thy mother breſtes thee agaynſt thou borne moued alſo thy father mother loue thee pitie thee care thee made thee ſo hath caſt thee vnder power authoritie obeye ſerue ſtede ſaying honor thy father mother exo xx father mother v god ſtede vnderſtand bowyng knee puttyng cappe onely thou loue al thyne hart feare drede wayte commaundementes ſeke worſhyp pleaſure profite thynges geue thy life counting worthy honour remembryng thou art theyr good poſſeſſion thou oweſt vnto thē thine owne ſelfe thou art able yea thou art able doe vnderſtand alſo ſoeuer wee doe father mother god thou doeſt vnto thē good bad thou doeſt vnto god whē thou pleaſeſt y• pleaſeſt god whē thou diſpleaſeſt thē thou diſpleaſeſt god whē angry thee god angry wt thee neither poſſible thee come vnto y• fauour god againe though aūgels heauē pray thee vntil thou haue ſubmitted thy ſelf vnto thy father mother agayne thou obey though carnally reward obedience either feare vayne glorie profite thy bleſſyng ſhalbe long lyfe vpon earth ſayth honour thy father mother thou mayeſt liue long vpon earth exod xx contrarywiſe reward diſobedience thou diſobey thy life ſhalbe ſhortned vpon earth foloweth exod xxj ſmiteth father mother ſhalbe put death curſeth ſay rayleth diſhonoured hys father mother opprobrious woordes ſhalbe ſlayne deut xx • man haue ſonne ſtubburne diſobedient heareth voyce father voyce hys mother ſo haue taught hym nurtoure regardeth let father mother take hym bryng forth vnto seniours elder citie vnto gate ſame place let ſay vnto seniours citie ſonne ſtubburne diſobedient harken vnto voyce rioter dronkard thē let men citie ſtone hym ſtones vnto death ſo ſhall ye put awaye wickedneſſe among iſraell ſhall heare ſhall feare though temporall officer owne damnation negligent puniſhing ſuch diſobedience ſpirituall officer teache winke looke thorough finger yet ſhall ſcape vnpuniſhed vengeance god auengeth diſobedience hym ſelfe though officer god ſhall accōpanie thou mayſt ſee deut xxviij miſfortune euill lucke ſhall depart vntill murdered drownde hanged either vntill one miſchaunce vtterly brought nought yea world often tymes hangeth many man neuer deſerued god hāgeth becauſe would obey harkē vnto elder conſciences many well finde come vnto galowes preach teach whiche thē ſelues would learne ſeaſon mariage alſo child mariage perteineth vnto elder thou mayſt ſee cor vij throughout scripture authoritie ſayd commaundement child obey father mother whiche thyng heathen gentile haue euer kept day keepe vnto thee great ſhame rebuke v chriſtē couetouſnes maketh ſpiritualitie cannot ſee turke aſhamed much weddyngs virgin ſhame ſpeake lyke vnto ſaute bitche mariyng reaſonable creature se dayly three foure calengyng one woman commiſſary officiall whiche one hath conſent father mother yet hee hath moſt money hath beſt right ſhall haue deſpite frendes deffiaunce god ordinaunces moreouer ſhe geuen iudge vnto yt one party alſo maried euen oft tymes ſhall contrary party ſue hyer iudge ſuccedeth ſame money deuorce agayne ſhamefully doth couetouſnes ambition prelate mocke lawes god paſſe ouer ſilence many yeares prolōg ſentence cauillations ſuttletie well monyed party get child ſay ſo ſhall thy cauſe bee beſt damſel promiſe ij ſhamefull councel geue ſecond alſo religious sathan ſeparate vnſeperable matrimonie thou art lawfully maryed commaundemēt father mother conſent thy frendes yet thou wilt diſgiſed eke god commaundementes breake throughe owne tradition vnto one ſweare obediēce vnto tradition thou mayſt diſobey father mother breake othe thou haſt ſworne god holy congregation withdraw loue charitie hyeſt god cō maundements dutie ſeruice thou oweſt vnto thy wife whereof chriſt diſpence thee chriſt agaynſt god god came breake god ordinaunces fulfill hee came ouercome thee wt kindnes make thee loue thyng law cōpelleth thee doe loue onely ſeruice vnto thy neighbour fulfillyng law yt ſight god monke frier thou mayſt thus forſake thy wife thou haſt lyne ſeculare prieſt yet thou art profeſſed pope money wil diſpence money maketh marchaundiſe thee thy coate thy obedience make ſeculer prieſt thee likewiſe ſimonie ſell benefice call reſigne vpon penſion thē redeine ſame ſimony oh crafty iugglers iugglers mocker word god ¶ obedience wiues vnto huſbandes eue deceaued serpent god ſaid vnto gene iij thy luſt appetite ſhall perteyne vnto thy huſband ſhall rule thee raigne ouer thee god whiche created woman knoweth weake veſſell peter calleth hath therefore put vnder obedience huſband rule luſtes wanton appetite peter iij exhorteth wiues bee ſubiection vnto huſbandes enſample holy wemen whiche old tyme truſted god sara obeyed abraham called hym lord whiche sara ſhe maried abraham ſiſter equall ſoone ſhe maried mariage altereth degree nature ſubiection became compariſon inferior ſo nature wedlocke ordinaunce god much better wiues folowed enſample holy wemen old time obeyeng huſbands worſhyp pater noster aue credo ſticke vp candle image paul ephe v ſayth wemen ſubmitte ſelues vnto huſbādes vnto lord huſband wiues head euen chriſt head congregation therfore congregation ſubiection chriſt likewiſe let wiues ſubiectiō vnto huſbādes thing let woman therfore feare huſband paul ſayth ſayd place huſband vnto yt ſtede god ſhe obey wayte hys commaundementes hys commaundementes god commaundements huſband 〈◊〉 wife god ſtede ſhe therfore grudge agaynſt reſiſte hym ſhe grudgeth againſt god reſiſteth god ¶ obedience seruauntes vnto maiſters seruauntes obey carnall maſters feare tremblyng ſingleneſſe harte vnto chriſt ſeruice eye ſight mē pleaſeres ſeruauntes chriſt doyng wil god hart good euen thoughe ye ſerued lord men eph vj pet ij ſeruauntes obey maſters feare onely good curteous alſo though froward commeth grace man conſcience towarde god endure grief ſuffering wrongfully ſufferynge wronges patiētly • e folow ſteppes chriſt prayſe ye buffeted faultes ye take paciently ye well ye ſuffer wrong take paciently thē thanke god hereunto verely ye called chriſt alſo ſuffred ſakes leauing v example follow hys ſteppes ſo euer kynde therefore thou art ſeruaunt tyme thy couenauntes thy maiſter vnto thee maſter vnto ſeruan̄t god ſtede ſtede rowme god god thorough hym feedeth thee clotheth thee ruleth thee learneth thee cōmaundementes god commaundementes thou oughteſt obey hym god thinges ſeeke pleaſure profite thou art good poſſeſſion hys oxe hys horſe ſo much ſo euer doth deſire thee hys hart without loue licence condēned god ſayth exod xx see thou couet thy neighbour ſeruauntes paule apoſtle ſent home onemus ſpiritualtie retayne men ſeruauntes honour god tradition ceremony onely vnto maiſter thou readeſt epiſtle paule philemon ſo much though ſayd philemon ſeruaunt alſo cō uerted paul obeyed vnto paule worde paule preached hys ſeruaunt onely alſo himſelfe yea though paule neceſſitie lacked miniſters miniſter vnto hym yt bondes ſuffered goſpels ſake yet would retaine ſeruaunt neceſſary vnto furtheraunce goſpell wythout conſent mayſter ſore differeth doctrine chriſtes doctrine pope differre chriſt apoſtles doctrine pope apoſtles man wyll obeye neither father mother neither lord maiſter neither king prince thy maſter pleaſe thee ſhaue thy ſelfe monke frier prieſt ſame needeth onely take marke beaſt ſhaue himſelfe monke fryer prieſt immediatly free exempted ſeruice obedience due vnto man obey man moſt acceptable obey man ſpirituall thyng vnto diſobedient thou art vnto god ordinaū ce apt meete art thou neither profeſſing vowing ſwearyng obediēce vnto ordinaunces thyng thē defiyng denying forſwearyng obedience vnto ordinaunces god ¶ obedience subiectes vnto kinges prince ruler let euery ſoule ſubmit himſelf vnto rom 13 aucthoritie hyer power power god power ordayned god whoſoeuer therefore reſiſteth power reſiſteth ordinaunce god reſiſt ſhal receaue themſelues kyngs choſen ſuppreſſe wicked ſupport good damnation ruler feared good workes euill wilt thou without feare power well ſo ſhalt thou prayſed ſame miniſter god thy wealth thou euill feare beareth ſwearde nought miniſter god take vengeaunce euill wherefore ye muſt needes obey feare vengeaunce onely alſo becauſe conſcience euen cauſe pay ye tribute god miniſters ſeruing ſame purpoſe geue euery man therefore hys dutie tribute tribute belongeth cuſtome cuſtome due feare whome feare belongeth honour whome honour perteineth owe nothing man loue one loueth fulfilleth lawe theſe commaundementes thou ſhalt commit adultery thou ſhalt kill thou ſhalt ſteale thou ſhalt beare falſe witnes thou ſhalt deſire ſo forth commaundement comprehended thys ſaying loue thyne neighbour thy ſelfe loue hurteth neighbour therfore loue fulfilling lawe father ouer child • pte ſimilitude lorde iudge forbidding one brother auenge hymſelfe cauſe ſtrife betwene haue brought vnto hymſelfe aſſignes iudged correct ſo god forbiddeth men auenge themſelues taketh aucthoritie office auenging vnto himſelfe ſaying vengeance myne rewarde deut xxxij text paule alleageth rom xij impoſſible man ſhould righteous egall indifferent iudge hys owne cauſe luſtes appetite ſo blinde v moreouer thou auengeſt thy ſelf thou makeſt peace ſtirreſt vp debate god therefore hath geuē lawes vnto nation landes hath put kinges gouerners ruler hys owne ſtede rule world thorough hath commaunded cauſes brought thou readeſt exod xxij cauſes ſayth iniury wrong whether oxe aſſe ſhepe veſture loſt thing chalengeth let cauſe party brought vnto god whome god condemne ſame ſhall paye double vnto neighbour marke iudges called god iudges called god scripture becauſe god rowme execute commaundements god place ſayde chapter moſes chargeth ſaying ſee thou rayle god neither ſpeake euill ruler thy people ſo euer therefore reſiſteth reſiſteth god y• rowne god reliſte ſhall xviij keepe ordinaunces lawes man keepe ſhall liue therein text paule rehearſeth rom x prouing thereby righteouſnes law worldly rewarde thereof lyfe thys worlde curſe curſe breaketh loſſe thys life thou ſeeſt y• puniſhment appointed whoſeuer keepeth lawe whether feare vayne glory profite though man rewarde hym yet ſhall god bleſſe aboundantly god rewardeth • obedience though mā el ſend hym worldly proſperitie thou readeſt deut xxviij good bleſſinges accompany keping lawe ſee turkes farre exceede v chriſten men worldly proſperity iuſt keeping temporall lawes god auengeth diſobedience though mā el likewiſe though man puniſhe breaker lawe yet ſhall god ſend hys curſes vpon till vtterly brought nought thou readeſt moſt terribly euen ſame place neither may inferior perſon auenge hymſelfe vpon ſuperior violently reſiſte hym ſo euer wrong doe condemned deede doyng much taketh vpon hym belongeth god onely ſayth vengeaunce vēgeance god mine rewarde deut xxxij chriſt ſayth mat 26 take ſworde ſhall periſhe ſworde takeſt thou ſworde auenge thy ſelfe ſo geueſt thou rowme vnto god auenge thee robbeſt hym moſt hye honour thou wilt let hym iudge ouer thee mā might haue auenged ſelfe vpon ſuperior might dauid moſt righteouſly haue done vpon dauid kyng saul ſo wrongfully perſecuted dauid euen cauſe thē god annointed kyng promiſed kyngdome yet god deliuered saul yt handes dauid might haue done would thou ſeeſt firſt booke kynges xxiiij chapter saul came caue dauid dauid came hym ſecretly cut peace garment ſoone done hart ſmote becauſe hee done ſo much vnto hys lord mē couraged ſlea aūſwered lord forbid ſhould lay myne hand neither ſuffered men hurt saul gone dauid folowed ſhewed hym peece garmēt ſayd beleueſt thou wordes men ſay dauid goeth thee harme perceaue ſee neither euill wickedneſſe hand haue treſpaſſed againſt thee yet thou layeſt awayte lyfe god deſtroyeth one wicked god iudge betwene thee auenge thee myne hand vpō thee old prouerbe ſayth ſayd dauid wicked ſhall wickedneſſe proceede myne hand vpō thee meanyng god euer puniſheth one wicked another agayne ſayd dauid god iudge iudge betwen thee behold pleate cauſe geue iudgement right thee babylon abuſeth whore babylō ſhe prince world dronke hath ſhe made wyne ſhamefull licence doth ſhe geue vſe nichromancy hold whore diuorſe ſelues breake fayth promiſes one maketh confeſſours ſhall deliuer vnto kyng confeſſion diſpē ceth confeſſion euen lawe god whiche chriſt ſelfe ¶ agaynſt pope falſe power mathew xxvj chriſt ſayth vnto peter put vp thy ſword ſheth lay hand vpon ſword ſhal periſh ſword ſoeuer without cōmaundement temporall officer peter onely chriſt alſo vnder temporall ſword god hath geuē ſword layeth hand ſword take vengeaunce ſame deſerueth death deede doyng god put peter onely vnder tēporall ſword alſo chriſt ſelfe appeareth fourth chapter galathiās chriſt ſayth math iij thus becommeth v fulfill righteouſnes ſay ordinaunces god head vnder tēporall ſword member excepted peter ſinned defendyng chriſt againſt temporall ſword whoſe authoritie miniſters byſhops abuſed agaynſt chriſt excuſe prelate ſinne obey man neither king ſinne geuing exēptions prelate receauyng kyng emperour yea excuſe ſinne either kynges geue either byſhops receaue ſuch exemption contrarie god ordinaunces chriſtes doctrine math xvij chriſt alſo peter pay tribute meanyng chriſtes queſtion vnto peter prince take tribute ſtraungers onely child verily ought free whiche ſonne god whoſe ſeruaūtes miniſters haue authoritie yet becauſe neither knew neither chriſt came vſe authoritie bee ſeruaunt beare burthen obey ordinaunces right wrong ſakes teach v therfore ſayd peter pay thee meleſt offend thē moreouer though chriſt peter becauſe poore might haue eſcaped yet would feare offendyng hurtyng conſciences might well haue geuen occaſion vnto tribute gatherer haue iudged amiſſe doctrine yea iewes might happely haue bene offended thereby haue thought ben lawful haue payd tribute vnto heathen prince idolater ſeyng ſo great prophet payd yea thyng cauſeth lay ſo litle regarde prince ſee ſpiritualitie payeth tribute deſpiſed diſobeyed ſpiritualtie prelate whiche care none offendyng conſciences leſſe god ordinaunces pay nought prince muſt fight moſt holy father quarell agaynſt chriſt firſt alſo none ſo poore hath ſomewhat geue marke paſt ſhame shameles iugglers ſchole doctours rocheſter sermon agaynſt martin luther text mathew diſpute peter becauſe payd tribute greater apoſtles hath authority power head vnto thē cōtrary vnto ſo many cleare textes chriſt rebuketh ſaying heatheniſh thyng one ſhould clyme aboue deſire greater great kingdome heauē ſeruaunt moſt humbleth hym ſelfe becommeth ſeruaunt vnto enſample chriſt meane apoſtles pope apoſtles cardinal byſhops ye ſame greateſt kingdome peter paying tribute became greateſt commeth pay none pay tribute ſigne ſubiectiō verely cauſe chriſt payed becauſe houſhold ſame cauſe payed peter alſo houſe ſhippe nettes thou readeſt goſpell let v go paul agayne wherfore ye muſt needes obey feare vengeaunce onely alſo becauſe conſcience though thou ſo naughty nowe many yeares pope prelate euery thou nedeſt obeye temporall ſword feare make conſciēce euill doyng vengeaunce yet muſt thou obey becauſe conſciēce firſt becauſe thine owne conſcience though thou able reſiſte yet ſhalt thou neuer haue good cōſcience lōg god care theyr neighbour y• wolfe doth ſhepe word law ordinaunce againſt thee secondarily thy neighbour conſcience though craft violence thou mighteſt eſcape obteyne libertie priuilege free euill enſample ſpiritualtie cauſeth lay beleue bound obey maner dueties yet oughteſt thou neither ſue ſeeke ſuch thing neither yet admit accept profered leſt thy fredome make thy weake brother grudge rebell ſeeth thee go emptie ſelfe ladē thy part alſo layd ſhoulders seeſt thou man fauour one ſonne one ſeruaunt reſt grudge loue peace vnitie broken chriſtenly loue thy neighbour ward thou canſt chriſtē loue thē finde thyne hart go vp empty day long ſee ouer charged yea fal vnder burthen yet wilt ſet thyne hand helpe good conſcience cā among ſpiritualtie gather ſo great treaſure together hypocriſie falſe learnyng robbe almoſt euery man houſe landes yet therewith content craft wilenes purchaſe ſo great liberty exemption maner bearyng brother ſeekyng chriſt nothyng lucre paſſe ouer ſilence teach prince purpoſe euen flatter prince may abuſe authoritie ſle • ſoeuer beleueth 〈◊〉 chriſt mainteine pope euery lande lade new exaction tyranny ſubiectes dayly neither purpoſe ſay god truſt ſhall ſhortly diſcloſe iugglynge bryng falſhode light lay medecine thē make ſcabbes breake neuertheleſſe ſay haue robbed realmes god word onely alſo wealth proſperitie haue driuen peace landes withdrawen ſelues obediēce prince haue ſeparated ſelues lay men countyng thē viler thē dogges haue ſet vp great idole whore babylō antichriſt rome call pope haue conſpired agaynſt common wealthes haue made ſeuerall kyngdome wherin lawfull vnpuniſhed woorke abhomination euery pariſh haue ſpyes euery great man houſe euery tauerne alchouſe thorough confeſſi • confeſſions knowe ſecretes ſo man may open mouth rebuke ſoeuer ſhalbe ſhortly made hereticke prelate know men ſecretes 〈…〉 man •… coūcels one yea moſt part chief ruler councels councell man euen cauſe pay ye tribute witt conſciences ſake thy neighbour cauſe foloweth god miniſters ſeruyng ſame purpoſe becauſe god ſo haue muſt obey doe looke haue chriſtes ſpirite v good profitable glorious honorable v neither owne god onely geue euery man therefore dutie tribute tribute belongeth cuſtome cuſtome due feare whō feare belongeth honour honor perteineth thou mighteſt feele workyng ſpirite god thee leſt bewtie deed ſhould deceaue thee make thee thinke law god whiche ſpirituall contēt fulfilled outward bodyly dede foloweth owe nothyng mā loue • oue fulfilleth law god outward dede one loueth fulfilleth law theſe commaundementes thou ſhalt commit adultery thou ſhalt kill thou ſhalt ſteale thou ſhalt beare falſe witnes thou ſhalt deſire ſo forth commaū dement comprehended contained ſaying loue thy neighbour agaynſte workemen therfore loue fulfillyng law haſt thou ſufficient agaynſt ſophiſters workeholy iuſtifiers world ſo magnifie dedes law ſpirituall requireth hart neuer fulfilled dede ſight god ye dede thou fulfilleſt law deede fulfilleth law world world liueſt thereby y• enioyeſt preſēt life auoydeſt wrath vengeaunce death puniſhment law threatneth breake god thou keepeſt law thou loue onely ſhal make v loue faith maketh man loue ʋerely ſhall fayth thou behold much god loueth thee chriſt vengeaunce hath deliuered thee ſake kyngdome hath made thee heyre ſhalt thou ſee cauſe inough loue thy enemie without reſpect reward either lyfe lyfe come becauſe god ſo haue chriſt hath deſerued yet thou ſhouldeſt feele thyne harte thy deedes come abundantly recompenſed ready chriſt thou wilt ſay haply loue fulfill lawe iuſtifieth ſay wherewith man fulfilleth law declareth hym iuſtified geueth wherewith fulfill law iuſtifieth hym iuſtifiyng iuſtifiyng vnderſtande forgeueneſſe ſinnes fauour god ſayth text rom x ende law cauſe wherfore law made chriſt iuſtifie beleue law geuen vtter office dutie law ſinne kill conſciences damne deedes bryng repentaunce driue vnto chriſt whō god hath promiſed fauour forgeueneſſe ſinne vnto repente conſent law good beleuyng god promiſes iuſtifieth thou beleue promiſes doth god truth iuſtifie thee forgeueth thee receaueth thee fauour chriſtes ſake ſuretie wherof certifie thine hart ſealeth thee ſpirite ephe iiij ij cor v ſayth paul whiche gaue v ſpirite earneſt ſpirite geuen v chriſt read viij chapter epiſtle romaine gallat iij ij cor iij neuertheleſſe ſpirit frutes ſpirite inward vertues knowen outward dede wherewith y• hart purified fayth hope loue pacience long ſufferyng obedience could neuer ſene without outward experience thou brought ſometime combraunce whence god onely could deliuer thee thou ſhouldeſt neuer ſee thy fayth yea except thou foughteſt ſometyme agaynſt deſperation hell death ſinne power worlde thy faythes ſake thou ſhouldeſt neuer know true fayth dreame except thy brother offended thee thou couldeſt know whether thy loue godly turke angre till hurt offended thou loue doth thee euill thy loue god likewiſe thy ruler alway kinde thou ſhouldeſt know whether thyne obedience pure thou canſt paciently obeye euill ruler thyngs diſhonour god thou hurteſt thy neighbour art thou ſure god ſpirite worketh thee thy fayth dreame falſe imagination therfore counceleth paule rom xij recompenſe man euill part haue peace men dearely beloued auenge ſelues geue rowme vnto wrath god written vengeaunce myne reward ſayth lord therfore thy enemie hungre ouercome thyne enemy well feede hym thurſt geue hym drinke ſo doyng thou ſhalt heape coales fire heed thou ſhalt kindle loue ouercome euil let man wickedneſſe make thee wicked alſo ouercome euill good ſoftenes kindneſſe pacience winne euen god kindneſſe wonue thee law geuē thūder lightenyng fire ſmoke voyce law trumpet terrible ſight exod xx people quaked feare ſtode farre ſaying moyſes speake thou v wil heare let lord ſpeake vnto v left dye eare awaked vnderſtandeth meanyng able abide voice law except promiſes mercy thunder except rayne mercy ioyned deſtroyeth buildeth law witneſſe agaynſt v teſtifieth god abhorreth ſinnes v v ſinnes ſake like maner god gaue kyng people iſraell kyng thundred rained y• people feared ſo ſore cryed samuell pray ſhould dye reg xij law terrible thing euen ſo kyng ordeined take vengeaunce hath ſword hād pecockes feethers feare therfore looke hym thou wouldeſt looke ſharpe ſword hanged ouer thy head heare heades gouerners ordeined ruler god gift god euen gifte god whether good bad ſoeuer done vnto v yt doth god good bad euill euill verely ruler euill wickedneſſe ſake euill becauſe whē good would receaue goodneſſe hand god thankefull ſubmitting ſelues vnto lawes ordinaunces abuſed goodneſſe god vnto ſenſuall beaſtly luſtes therefore doth god make hys ſcorge turne vnto wilde beaſtes cōtrary nature name office euen lyon beares fox vncleane swine auenge himſelfe vnnaturall blind vnkindneſſe rebellious diſobedience cvj pſalme thou readeſt deſtroyed riuers dryed vp ſpringes water turned yt fruitfull land barenneſſe wickedneſſe inhabiters therein whē child iſraell forgotten god egipt god moued harte egiptians hate ſubdue craft wilynes pſal ciiij deuteronomiun iij moyſes rehearſeth ſaying god angry wyth ſakes ſo wrath god fell moyſes wickedneſſe people ſecōd chap ſecond booke kynges god angry people moued dauid number ioab lord wondred hee would haue numbred becauſe feared leſt ſome euil ſhould folow diſſwaded kyng yet holpe god ſo hardened hart purpoſe haue occaſion ſlay wicked people euill ruler ſigne euill ruler ſigne god angry v god angry wroth v great wrath vengeaunce father mother ſhould hate child euen fleſh bloud huſband ſhould vnkinde vnto wife maſter vnto ſeruaunt wayteth profite lordes kynges ſhould tyrauntes vnto ſubiectes tenauntes pay tribute tolle cuſtome rente laboring toyling finde honour mainteine eſtate fearefull iudgemēt god cruell wrath prelate ſhepheardes ſoules whiche wont feede chriſtes flocke chriſts doctrine walke lyuyng geue lyues enſample edifiyng ſtrengthē weake faythes ſo ſore chaunged ſmell one flocke cal lenger chriſtes long deſire true knowledge chriſt ſlay hym burnyng fire moſt cruelly cauſe prelate ſo wicked alſo teach falſe doctrine confirmyng lye veryly hād god auenge wickednes haue loue luſt vnto truth god preached reioyſe vnrighteouſnes thou maiſt ſee ſecond epiſtle paul theſſalonians ſpeaketh comming antichriſt whoſe commyng ſhalbe ſayth workyng sathan miracle ſignes wonder lye deceanable vnrighteouſnes among periſh becauſe receaued loue cauſe falſe miracle haue luſt vnto truth truth haue bene ſaued therefore ſhall god ſend ſtrong deluſion beleue lye marke god auenge truth ſendeth vnthankefull falſe doctrine falſe miracle confirme harden hart falſe way afterward ſhall poſſible admitte truth thou ſeeſt exod vij viij god ſuffered falſe miracle ſhewed yt ſight pharao harden hart ſhould beleue truth much hys ſorcerers turned roddes serpēts turned water bloud made frogges inchauntment ſo thought moſes miracle ſame craft power god abode therfore vnbelefe periſhed reſiſting god let v receaue thinges god right way came bondage whether good bad let v humble ſelues vnder mighty hand ſubmitte ſelues vnto nurture chaſtiſing withdraw ſelues correction read hebr xij thy comfort let v take ſtafe end ſeke auenge ſelues rodde euill ruler child long ſeketh auenge ſelfe vpon rodde hath euill hart thinketh correctiō right hath deſerued neither repenteth reioyſeth wickednes ſo lōg ſhall neuer without rodde yea ſo long ſhall rodde made ſharper ſharper knowledge faute take correction mekely euē kiſſe rodde amende ſelfe learnyng nurture father mother rodde takē away burnt reſiſte euill ruler ſekyng euill ruler ought reſiſted ſet ſelues libertie ſhall doubt bring ſelues euill bondage wrappe ſelues much miſerie wretchednes heades ouercome lay weight backes make yoke ſorer tye ſhorter ouercome euill ruler make way cruell natiō ſome tyraunt nation whiche hath right vnto crown ſubmitte ſelues vnto chaſtiſyng god mekely knowledge ſinnes whiche ſcourged kiſſe rodde amende liuyng god take rodde away geue ruler better hart continue malice perſecute well doyng becauſe ye put truſt god god deliuer tyranny truthes ſake ſame god alwayes one alwayes true alwayes mercifull excludeth mā promiſes god old time deliuered father prophetes apoſtles holy saintes ſoeuer ſware hath ſworne v deliuered temptation combraūce aduerſitie becauſe conſented ſubmitted ſelues vnto truſted goodnes truth euen ſo v likewiſe ſoeuer child iſraell fel way god cōmaunded walke gane vp vnder one tyraūt ſoone came knowledge thē ſelues repented cry mercy leaning vnto truth promiſes ſent one deliuer hyſtories bible make mention chriſten man reſpect god chriſt • man doth ſuffer onely paſſiue thing thyng ſuffereth onely doth nought ſicke reſpect surgion phiſition doth ſuffer onely surgen launceth cutteth dead fleſh ſearcheth woundes thruſteth tentes ſereth burneth ſoweth ſticheth leyeth corſies draw y• corruption laſt leyeth healyng plaiſters maketh whole phiſitiō likewiſe geueth purgation drinkes driue diſeaſe reſtauratiues bringeth health ſicke reſiſte raſer ſearching yron ſo forth doth reſiſte owne health cauſe owne death likewiſe euill ruler wholeſome medicine v reſiſte euil ruler rodde ſcourge wherewith god chaſtiſeth v inſtrumentes wherewith god ſearcheth woundes bitter drinkes driue ſinne make appeare corſies draw rote core poxe ſoule freateth inward chriſten mā therfore chriſten man receaueth receaueth thyng hand god good bad ſweete ſowre wealth wo perſon good whether father mother ſo forth receaue god god geue thankes gaue wherewith gaue commaundement moued hart ſo aduerſitie alſo receaue hād god wholeſome medicine though ſomewhat bitter temptation aduerſitie kill ſinne alſo vtter though profitable aduerſitie chriſten man knoweth euery thyng lyue yet fleſh ſo weake cā neuer take vp croſſe ſelfe kill mortifie fleſh muſt haue lay hys backe many alſo ſinne lyeth hidde within feſtereth rotteth inward ſene ſo thinke good perfect kepe law younge man math xix ſayd obſerued child yet lyed falſly hart text folowing well declareth peace man troubleth v thinke paciēt loue neighbour ſelues let neighbour hurt v woorde deede finde otherwiſe fume rage ſet vp briſtels bend ſelues take vengeaunce loued godly loue chriſtes kindnes ſake ſhould deſire vengeaunce pitie deſire god forgeue amend knowing well fleſh otherwiſe ſinne except god preſerue hym thou wilt ſay good doth ſuch perſecution tyranny vnto righteous firſt maketh feele woorkyng god ſpirite theyr fayth vnfayned secondaryly ſay greateſt ſinner righteous chriſt promiſes perfecteſt holyeſt ſinner lawe fleſhe man ſo great ſinner repent beleue righteous chriſt promiſes yet thou looke fleſh vnto law man ſo perfect founde ſinner man ſo pure hath ſomewhat yet purged ſhall ſuffice time concernyng obedience becauſe god excludeth degree mercy ſo euer repenteth beleueth promiſes ſoeuer degree ſame ſhalbe partaker hys grace therfore haue deſcribed obedience vnder power rule euen ſo god helpe dutie declare ruler whiche god ſhall vouchſafe call vnto knowledge truth ought rule ¶ office father ſhould rule father mother weywarde haſtie churliſhe euer brauling chiding yt child anone diſcouraged hartleſſe apte nothing neither right bringing vp child thyng aright bryng vp nurtoure information lord teach thē know chriſt ſet god ordinaunce ſaying ſonne daughter god hath created thee made thee thorough v thy father mother commaundement haue ſo longe thus kindely brought thee vp kept thee peril hath commaunded thee alſo obey v ſaying childe obey thy father mother thou meekely obey ſo ſhalt thou grow fauour god man knowledge lord chriſt thou wilt obey v hys commaundement thē charged correct thee yea thou repent amende thy ſelf god ſhall ſley thee hys officer deſtruction marring child puniſhe thee euerlaſtingly nurtoure thē worldly worldly wiſedome ſaying thou ſhalt come honour dignitie promotion rich thou ſhalt better ſuch ſuch thou ſhalt haue iij iiij benefice great doctoure byſhop haue ſo many men wayting thee nothing hauke hunte lyue pleaſure thou ſhalt neede ſweate laboure take payne thy lyuing ſo forth filling thē full pride diſdaine ambition corrupting theyr myndes wyth worldly perſwaſions let father mother marke themſelues diſpoſed age experience owne infirmity helpe child keepe occaſions let teach child axe maryages maryage child without con •… paren • e vnlawfull father mother let theyr elder prouide mariages ſeaſon teaching alſo know ſhe hys wyfe y• ſonne taketh huſband daughter taketh wythout conſent good wyll elder haue aucthoritie ouer thē frends wil marry thē blame marry thēſelues let yt father mother alwayes take vtmoſt authoritie child time ſuffer beare theyr weakneſſes chriſt doth oures seeke chriſt child wiues ſeruants ſubiectes father mother ſonne daughter maiſter ſeruaunt kyng ſubiect name worldly regiment chriſt one thing chriſt ſeruaunts hath knowledge bounde none better brother muſt ſeeke chriſt brother profit chriſt hath knowledge whether lorde kyng bounde ſubmitte hymſelfe ſerue brethrē geue hym ſelfe winne chriſt ¶ office huſband ought rule huſbandes loue wiues chriſt loued congregation gaue hymſelfe ſanctifie clenſe men ought loue wiues owne bodyes cauſe ſhall man leaue father mother ſhall continue wife ſhall made one fleſh see euer one loue wyfe euen hys owne bodye thys ſayth paul ephe v collo iij ſayth huſbādes loue wiues bitter vnto thē peter thyrd chapter hys firſt epiſtle ſayth men mē ought rule wiues god worde dwell wiues according knowledge according doctrine chriſt geuing reuerence vnto wife vnto weaker veſſell helpe beare infirmity vnto heyres alſo ye grace lyfe prayer let many thynges man ſtronger woman god hath made men ſtronger woman rage vpon tyrantes vnto helpe thē beare weakeneſſe curteous thereaefore vnto winne thē vnto chriſt ouercome kyndnes loue may obey y• ordinaunce god hath made betwene man wife ¶ office maiſter ought rule paule ephe vi ſaith ye maiſters euen ye ſame thinges vnto thē maiſter ye example doctrine chriſt taught y• ſeruauntes obey vnto maiſters vnto chriſt putting away threanings geue teach thy ſeruaunt know chriſt chriſtes doctrine deale hym thē fayre wordse exhort thē kyndely theyr dutie yea nurtour thine ſonnes y• lord nourtour may ſee chriſt cauſe ought louingly obey remember ſaith maiſter alſo heauen neither reſpect perſons wyth hym indifferent parciall great hys ſight ſeruaunt maiſter third chapter col ſaith ye maiſters vnto ſeruaunts iuſt equal remembring ye alſo haue maiſter heauen geue ſeruaunts kinde wordes fode rayment learnyng bitter vnto rayle geue thē cruell countenaunce according enſample doctrine chriſt deale labour ſore cheriſhe thyng god worde agayne ye correct thē let god worde wyth ſuch good maner may ſee ye doe amende onely bring vnto way god biddeth v walke auēge ſelues wreke malice tyme thorough haſtines ye exceede meaſure puniſhing recompence way pardon tyme ¶ dutie landlordes let chriſten landlordes content wyth rent landlordes ſhould raiſe rente bring vp new cuſtomes olde cuſtomes reyſing y• rent fynes bringing vp new cuſtomes oppreſſe tenauntes neither letting two three tenauntryes vnto one man let take commune neyther make parkes paſtures whole pariſhes god gaue earth god gaue • earth men men inhabite vnto ſheepe wilde deare father vnto tenauntes yea vnto chriſt vnto v ſhew vnto loue kyndnes ſoeuer buſines among thē parciall fauouring one thē complayntes quarels ſtrife among counte diſeaſes ſicke people mercifull phiſition heale wyth wiſdome good councell pitifull tender harted vnto let one thy tenauntes teare others throte iudge cauſes indifferently compell make diches hedge gate wayes euē ſuch cauſes ye made landlordes ſuch cauſes payde men rent beginning ſuch order one ſhould ſley ſhould goe waſt thy tenaunt ſhall labour toyle yeare pay thee thy rent hath beſtowed al labour neighboures cattell ſhal deuoure frutes tedyous bitter ſhould life landlordes ſhould withſtand worng tenauntes se therefore ye doe duty agayne ſuffer man doe wrong ſaue kyng onely doe wrong muſt abyde god iudgement ¶ dutie kynges iudges officer let kynges leuer chriſten deede ſo called geue themſelues together wealth realmes enſample chriſt remembryng people god ye chriſtes inheritaunce poſſeſſion bought bloud moſt deſpiſed reſpect perſon afore god perſon realme kynges brother felowmember hym equall kyngdome god chriſt let therfore thinke ſelfe good thē ſeruice neither ſeke thing father ſeketh child yea chriſt ſought v though kyng temporal regiment rowme god repreſenteth god ſelf compariſon better thē ſubiectes yet let put become brother leauing vndone thinges reſpect common wealth men may ſee ſeketh nothing profet ſubiectes cauſe requireth execution brought onely let take ye perſon god let know creature heare indifferently whether ſtraunger one owne realme ſmall well great iudge righteouſly iudgemēt lordes deut tyme iudgement miniſter kyngdome chriſt preacheth goſpell ſharpe law vengeance let take holy iudges olde teſtament example namely moſes executing moyſes law mercyleſſe otherwiſe mother vnto neuer auengyng owne wronges ſuffering thing bearing euery man weakenes teaching warning exhorting euer caryng ſo tenderly loued deſired god either forgeue damne hym let iudges alſo priuatly iudges haue put perſon iudge exhort good counſell warne people helpe come god iudgemēt cauſes brought vnto ſit god ſtede let iudge cō demne ye treſpaſſer vnder lawfull witneſſes breake vp conſciences tyranny compell man accuſe himſelfe men example antichriſtes diſciples compell thē either forſweare ſelues almightie god holy goſpell mercyfull promiſes teſtifie againſt ſelues abhominatiō prelate learned cayphas prelate learned cayphas math xxvj ſaying chriſt adiure charge thee name liuing god thou tell v whether thou chriſt ſonne god secret ſinnes pertayne vnto god puniſhe open ſinnes vnto kyng let ſecret god onely profe cā made lawfull witneſſe brought abyde vnto commyng lord ſhall opē ſecretes malice breake forth let iudge onely authoritie hath god geuen moyſes deut xvij warneth iudges ☜ kepe vpright looke man perſon preferre parcialitie iudges wicked hye low great ſmall rich poore acquaintaunce frende kinſman countrey man one nation ſtraūger frend aliant ye one faith infidell looke cauſe onely iudge indifferently rowme law execute god hath made god ſonnes euen ſo iudge ouer wil haue al iudged law indifferently haue right law auenge wrong done vnto turke sareſon though vnder euerlaſtyng teſtament god chriſt v called chriſten euen mo thē god hath ſent promiſes poured ſpirite hart beleue fayth grauen luſt harte fulfill law loue yet vnder teſtament ye law naturall lawes euery land made common wealth peace vnite one may lyue whiche lawes infidel kepe haue promiſes worldly thing ſoeuer therfore hyndreth parcialitie bribe takyng peſtilence iudges infidell right law ſinneth agaynſt god god auēged moreouer moyſes warneth receaue giftes rewardes bribe thoſe two pointes fauoryng one perſon receauyng rewardes peruerte right equitie ye onely peſtilence iudges kynges warneth ☞ haue many wiues leſt harte turne away read alway law god learne feare leſt harte lift vp aboue brother ij pointes wemen pride deſpiſing woman pride cōtempt ſubiectes peſtilence prince ſubiectes deed owne brother common peſtilence prince read ſtories ſee shyriffes bayly arauntes conſtables ſuch like officer may let man hurteth neighbour ſcape bryng iudges except meane time agree neighbour make amendes let kinges defende ſubiectes wronges natiōs picke quarels euery trifle let moſt holy father make ſo dronkē vayne name vayne name forth paul preached chriſt paule greater thē peter peter ſuffered hys congregation greater peter ye teſtimony chriſt xij ſayth nothing inferior vnto y• hye apoſtles though paul proued apoſtleſhyp
