ſhadowes old teſtament falſly expounded moreouer apoſtles ſent immediatly chriſt chriſt receaued authoritie paul boaſteth ſelfe euery chriſt apoſtles ſent chriſt wt like authoritie ſayth ſent preach goſpell corint receaued lord deliuered vnto cor xi gal certifie brethrē goſpell preached maner men witte carnal fleſhly neither receaued man neyther taught receaued yt reuelation ieſus chriſt gal ij mighty peter apoſtleſhip ouer circumciſion mighty among gētiles 1 timoth 1 readeſt thou lykewyſe iohn xx chriſt ſent forth indifferently gaue lyke power father ſent ſayth ſo ſend preach ſuffer haue done conquer enemyes kyngdomes ſubdue temporall power vnder wyth diſguiſed hypocriſie gaue thē holy ghoſt bynde looſe indifferently thou ſeeſt afterward ſent forth paule wyth like authority thou ſeeſt actes laſt mathew ſayth power geuen heauē earth goe therfore teach naciōs baptiſing name father ſonne holy ghoſt teaching obſerue whatſoeuer commaunded authoritie authoritie chriſt gaue preache chriſtes word chriſt gaue thē preach yet would imagine commaunded loe ſayth alwayes euen vnto ende world ſayde goe way loe peter ſtede ſent euery man ſundry countrey whether ſoeuer ſpirite caried went thē ſelf wrought peter went ſo wrought went paul boaſteth ſelfe vnto galathians seyng haue chriſtes ☞ doctrine chriſtes holy promiſes ſeyng chriſt euer preſent v owne ſelfe commeth chriſt may raigne immediatly ouer v well pope commeth neuer v seyng alſo office apoſtle preach onely pope chalenge right authoritie preacheth commeth alſo rocheſter let v called one congregation reaſon one god one chriſt one ſpirite one goſpell one fayth one hope one baptiſme well becauſe one pope naturall beaſt hys worldly wiſedome ſtriue one ☞ greater becauſe congregation one ſent ſee actes aūſwere peter ſent man ſent ſelfe iohn ſent paul sylas barnabas ſent howbeit ſuch maner ſendynges worldly prince ſend ambaſſadours frier ſend limiter gather brethrenhedes muſt obey whether thyng free willyngly holy ghoſt bringeth thē together whiche maketh willes free ready beſtow ſelues vpon neighbour profit come offer thē ſelues haue cā ſerue lord brethrē euery mā found apt meete ſerue neighbour ſo ſent put office holy ghoſt ſent conſent brother owne conſēt alſo god word ruleth congregation vnto word euery man confirmeth chriſt alway preſent head biſhops heare chriſtes voyce ſo ſee byſhops make god earth preſent therfore make god earth kinde ſuppoſe aaron calfe bringeth forth aarō made calfe pope maketh bulles frute bulles much alſo chriſt great peter ſeate great peter head empire ben ieruſalem ben mention made peter verely paul ſayth xj chap ij epiſtle corinthian falſe apoſtles diſceatful worker faſhion ſelues like vnto apoſtles chriſt ſhauē nation hath put chriſt hys • owme kinges emperour ſhauen nation preached chriſt falſly yea vnder name chriſt preached ſelues raigne chriſtes ſtede haue alſo taken away keye knowledge haue wrapped y• people ignoraunce haue taught thē beleue ſelues tradition falſe ceremony ſo chriſt vayne name chriſt vaine name put chriſt rowme gate ſelues emperour kyngs ſo long miniſtred buſines till haue alſo put thē rowmes haue got proper miniſters authority raigne alſo ſtede ſo y• emperour kynges vayne name ſhadowes chriſt hauyng nothyng world thus raygne ſtede god man haue power vnder liſt let v ſee poynt great clarke litle beginning rocheſter proued ignorant malicious hys sermon entendyng proue clearer ſonne ſerueth purpoſe ite miſſa eſt ſerueth proue lady borne without originall ſinne alledgeth ſaying martin luther ſayth affirme one epiſtle paul one place epiſtles perteineith vnto vniuerſall church congregation beleue chriſt take away paules authoritie wherupō ſayth rocheſter thus woordes paule much rather true goſpels chriſt euery place malicious blyndnes firſt note blindnes vnderſtā deth worde goſpell foure euangeliſtes mathew marke luke iohn thinketh actes apoſtles epiſtles peter paul iohn epiſtles paule goſpell like alſo goſpell paul calleth preachyng goſpell rom ij cor iiij gal timoth goſpel euery one though preached diuers ſignifieth glad tidynges goſpell ſignifieth witte open preachyng chriſt holy teſtament gracious promiſes god hath made chriſtes bloud repent beleue goſpell one epiſtle paule ſay chriſt clearely preached moe promiſes rehearſed one epiſtle paul iij firſt euangeliſtes mathew marke luke conſider alſo maliciouſnes wickedly craftely taketh away ye authoritie paule much rather true goſpelles euery place paule one goſpell one ſpirite one truth ye foure euangeliſtes wrote truer paule wrote one goſpell preached neither one ſpirit taught one goſpell one ſpirite one truer paule proueth authoritie ye galathians authoritie paule hys goſpell corinthian becauſe receaued goſpell reuelation chriſt man becauſe com •• ed wyth peter ye hye apoſtles hys goſpell preaching coulde improue nothyng neither teach hym thing becauſe alſo many cō uerted great miracle ſhewed preaching preaching hie apoſtles therefore leſſe authoritie thē peter hie apoſtles haue goſpell leſſe reputation fynally thou mayſt know rocheſter rocheſter playeth bo • pepe euer remnaunt within ye ſkinne marke playeth bo pepe ye scripture allegeth beginning tenth chapter hebrues vmbram habens lex futurorum bonorum lawe hath ſhadow thynges come immediatly expoundeth figure cleane contrary vnto chapter folowing whole epiſtle making aaron figure yt pope epiſtle maketh figure chriſt allegeth halfe texte paule timoth iiij latter dayes ſome ſhall depart faith geuing hede vnto ſpirites error deuiliſh doctrine foloweth text geuing attendaunce hede vnto deuiliſhe doctrine ſpeake falſe thorow hypocriſy haue conſciences marked hote yron forbidding mary commaūding abſteine meates god hath created receaued wyth geuing thākes two thynges neuer mā bad marry ſaue pope euer ſaue ye pope rocheſters god makyng ſinne creature god hath created mās vſe receaued wyth thankes kyngdome heauē meate drinke ſayth paule righteouſnes peace ioye holy ghoſt whoſoeuer theſe thynges ſerueth chriſt pleaſeth god alowed men rom xiiij rocheſter therfore cō ſcience marked wyth hote yron malice ſo conſent vnto god glory chriſt woulde haue ſo alleaged texte contrary none ſaue themſelues alleageth text paule ſecond chapter ſecond epiſtle theſſalonians erit diſſeſſi • primum ſayth rocheſter comming antichriſt ſhall notable departing fayth paule ſayth lord commeth except come departing firſt paules meaning laſt day commeth ſo ſhortly antichriſt ſhall come firſt deſtroy faith ſit temple god make men worſhip beleue hym pope doth ſhal god worde come light againe doth thys tyme deſtroy hym vtter iuggling cōmeth chriſt vnto iudgement ſay ye crafty cōueyar would ſpare ſuppoſe ye alleage wreſt doctours peſtilently feareth iugle wyth y• holy ſcripture god expounding y• vnto antichriſt paule ſpeaketh chriſt ye ſure euen maner wiſe peruert whole ſcripture doctours wreſting thē vnto abhominable purpoſe cleane contrary meaning text circumſtaunces goe deueliſhe falſhod leſt lay men ſhould perceaue cauſe haue ſcripture engliſhe cauſe y• ſuffer scripture engliſhe tounge neither worke made ſhould bring people knowledge truth alleageth pope authoritie saint ciprian saint auguſtine ambroſe hierome origene neuer one knew authoritie one biſhop ſhould haue aboue saint gregory alleageth would receaue ſuch authoritie aboue hys brother profered hym maner call tully chiefe oratours hys tully chiefe oratours ſingular cloquence ariſtotle chiefe philoſophers ʋirgill chiefe poet thir ſingular learnyng authoritie ouer ſo maner call peter chiefe apoſtles ſingular actiuitie boldnes ſhoulde lord ouer brother contrary hys owne doctrine yet compare chiefe apoſtle vnto paule found great way inferior ſay woulde man ſhoulde make god paule contrary vnto hys owne learning notwithſtāding yet maner ſpeaking left vnto v elder ſay apoſtle ſayth ſo vnderſtand paule hys excellency aboue apoſtles would would tel hieroin auguſtine bede origene doctours expound texte vpon rocke wyll builde congregation enterpret keyes alſo thereto paſce paſce paſce rocheſter leaueth without engliſhe ſignifieth pol • ſhere ſhaue ʋpon texte beholde faithfull expoſition bede note alſo craftely would enfeoffe apoſtles chriſt rocheſter alleageth paule blinde ceremony contrary paules doctrine wicked tradition falſe ceremony themſelues haue fayned alleaging paule ij theſſal ij aunſwere paule taught mouth ſuch thing wrote epiſtles tradition goſpell chriſt honeſt maners liuing ſuch good order becommeth doctrine chriſt woman obey huſband haue head couered keepe ſilence goe womanly chriſtenly apparelled child ſeruauntes ſubiection younge obey elder man eate laboureth worketh men make earneſt thing god word hys holy sacramentes watch faſt pray ſuch lyke scripture commaundeth thynges woulde breake chriſten man may well cō playne crye god helpe lawfull v tell prayer faſting wherefore ſerueth lawful pope tyranny teach y• people prayer faſting wherefore ſerueth alſo certayne cuſtomes alway commaunded paine hell euerlaſting dānatiō watch night kyſſe one ſoone people abuſed brake thē cauſe byſhops myght breake many thynges lyke maner paule alſo many thynges god made free gaue pure faythfull coū cell without tangling man cō ſcience without maner commaundyng vnder payne curſing payne curſing damnatiō ſo forth payne excommunication payne hereſie payne burnyng payne deadly ſinne payne hell payne damnatiō thou mayſt ſee cor 7 counceleth vnmaried widowes virgines good ſo abyde haue gift chaſtitie winne heauē therby neither circumciſion neither vncircumciſion thyng kepyng commaundementes altogether might without trouble might alſo better wayte god worde ſ • elyer ſerue brother paule none authoritie thē peter none pope authoritie ſayth faithfull ſeruaunt none authority lord geue commaundement apoſtles gaue v blynd ceremony wherof ſhould know reaſon denye alſo defie thyng cleane contrary vnto learnyng paul euery paul commaundeth rocheſter improued man ſpeake church congregation toung men vnderſtand except interpreter cōmaundeth labour knowledge vnderſtandyng feelyng beware ſuperſtition perſuaſions worldly wiſedome philoſophy hypocriſie ceremony maner diſguiſing walke y• playne open truth ye darkenes ſayth ye light lord walke therefore child light ephe v doth paul alſo wiſh encreaſe grace euery epiſtle crieth god augment knowledge ſhould child waueryng euery winde doctrine would vouchſafe make full men chriſt vnderſtandyng myſteries ſecretes chriſt ſo ſhould poſſible man diſceaue entiſyng reaſons worldly wiſedom beguile blind ceremony lead waye ſuperſtitiouſnes diſguiled hypocriſie vnto ful knowledge wherefore ſpirituall officer ordayned ſpirituall officer ordeined bring epheſ iiij farre away chriſtes apoſtles ſhould geue tradition blind ceremony without ſignification whiche man ſhould know reaſon rocheſter whiche loueth ſhadowes darkenes lyeth god ſtoppe blaſphemous mouth conſider alſo ſtudiouſly rocheſter rocheſter alleageth heretikes purpoſe lacke ſcripture alledgeth origene pope alſo ſtabliſh blind ceremony origene heretickes condemned greateſt auncient doctour ſayth yea whō point great fayth geuen yea verely robynhode authoritie enough proue pope withall ariſtotle plato euen robynhode beleued ſuch point ſo greatly mainteineth holy father authoritie diſguiſinges laſt craftie theefe whē eſpied folowed cryed vnto people stoppe thefe ſtop thefe many begyn caſt firſt man teth feareth ſhould layd owne charge euen ſo rocheſter layeth martin luther charge ſlaying murtheryng chriſten men becauſe beleue doctrine thing rocheſter brethrē haue ceaſed certein hundred yeares ſuch malice whē dead theyrage burnyng body ſome ſelues lickelyhode killed ſecretly becauſe worlde knoweth martin luther ſlayeth mā killeth onely ſpirituall ſword word god ſuch cankred cōſciences rocheſter hath neither perſecuteth ſuffereth perſecution yet rocheſter goodly argument proueth would could marke pray oratour vehemently rocheſter oratoure perſuadeth martin luther hath burned pope decretals manifeſt ſigne ſayth would haue burnt pope holines alſo like argument ſuppoſe rather true make rocheſter holy brethrē haue burnt chriſtes teſtament euident ſigne verely woulde haue burnt chriſt ſelfe alſo almoſt verely left rocheſter cleane beſide hymſelfe chiefeſt point rocheſter abhominable ſhameleſſe yea ſterke mad pure malice ſo adaſed braines ſpite cā ouercome truth ſeeth rather careth ſayth ende firſt deſtruction would ſay inſtructiō calleth intēding proue iuſtified thorouh holy workes alleageth halfe texte paule fift galathians maner iuggle cōuey craftely fides per dilectionem operans rocheſter ſuch iuggler ſuppoſe ye reſt let rocheſter example therfore iudge texte thys wiſe engliſheth fayth wrought loue maketh verbe paſſiue verbe deponent rocheſter haue loue goe fayth ſpring loue thus antichriſt turneth rote tree vpward muſt firſt loue bitter medicine rocheſters doctrine beleue wholſome naturall reaſon firſt hate bitter medicine vntill brought belief phiſition holeſome bitternes ſhall heale afterward loue beliefe doth childe loue father firſt thē beleue ſonne heire rather becauſe knoweth ſonne heire beloued therfore loueth agayne iohn ſayth faith roote loue ſpringeth fayth third firſt epiſtle see loue father hath ſhewed vpon v ſhould called ſonnes becauſe ſonnes therefore loue fayth ſonnes iohn ſayth fyrſt chapter goſpel gaue power ſonnes god beleued hys name paule ſayth thyrd chapter hys epiſtle galathians ſonnes god faith ieſus chriſt iohn ſayd chapter hys epiſtle ſayth hereby perceaue loue gaue hys life v coulde ſee loue cauſe loue agayne except beleued dyed v ſaued thorough death chapter folowing ſayth iohn herein loue loued god loued v ſent ſonne make agreement ſinnes god ſent hys ſonne loue hym loue v ſent hys ſonne myght ſo loue loue agayne paule lykewiſe 8 chapter romaynes hath declared infinite loue god v ward ſpared hys owne ſonne gaue hym v cryeth ſaying ſhall ſeparate v loue god ſhall perſecution ſhall ſworde c ſayth ſure creature ſhall ſeparate v loue god chriſt ieſus lord ſhould ſay ſee ſo great loue god v warde chriſtes death though miſfortune ſhould fall v loue agayne know god loueth v verely fayth therefore though rocheſter though rocheſter haue ſpirite iudge ſpirituall thinges yet ought reaſon haue kept ſo ſhameful lying god hath blynded bring falſhod light beaſt faythleſſe yet ought naturall reaſon haue taught hym loue ſpringeth fayth knowledge fayth knowledge loue let v ſee text paule ſayth thus chriſt ieſu neither circumciſion thyng worth incircumciſion fayth worketh thorow loue thorow loue ſtrōg mighty working wrought loue iuggler ſayth faith loueth god cōmaundemēts iuſtitieth mā thou beleue god promiſes chriſt loue commaūdementes art thou ſafe thou loue ye commaū demēt art thou ſure y• thy fayth vnfained god ſpirit thee fayth iuſtifieth god hart loue ſpringeth fayth compelleth v worke workes iuſtifie worlde teſtifie certifie v fayth vnfayned ye right ſpirit god v ſee booke ye iuſtifiyng faith ſhalt thou ſee thyng aboundantly alſo controuerſie betwene paul controuerſy betwene iames paule iames ſee neuer later whē rocheſter ſayth faith onely iuſtified deuils alſo ſinners lie ſtill ſinne ſhould ſaued hys argument worth ſtrawe neyther deuils yet ſinners continue ſinne purpoſe delectation deuils haue none paules fayth ſinners repent haue ſuch fayth paul ſpeaketh paules fayth beleue god promiſes fayth ſayth rom x cōmeth hearing hearing commeth worde god ſhall heare wythout preacher ſhall preach except ſent writtē ſaith beautifull fecte bring glade tydinges peace bringe tydynges good thynges ſent god meſſengers vnto deuils preach peace good thyng deuill hath promiſe therefore excluded paules fayth deuill beleueth mā may beleue chriſt died many thynges 〈◊〉 beleue chriſt chriſt dyed dyed hys ſinnes neither doth cō ſenteth hart continue ſinne beleue chriſt dyed beleue chriſt dyed v ſee horrible damnation beleue chriſt appointed vnto eternall paine feele ſure deliuered therefrō thorough chriſt haue power hate ſins loue god commaundements ſuch repent haue harte looſed captiuitie bondage ſinne therefore iuſtified thorough fayth chriſt wicked ſinners haue fayth imagination opinion chriſt ſchole men haue principle whiche braule ſo faſt one another thyng beleue y• kyng rich rich vnto part therein ſpare peny rich neede beleue king rich moued beleue rich neuer faile nede loue loue ready worke vnto vttermoſt power let v returne laſt vnto purpoſe agayne cauſe laye men ſay men rule rule well time paſt turkes yet doe ʋerely becauſe antichriſt wyth miſte hys iugglyng hath beguiled eye hath caſt ſuperſtitious feare vpon world chriſten men hath taught thē dread god worde hymſelfe word god law ordinaunces prince officer god hath ſet rule world owne law ordinaunces tradition ceremony diſguiſed diſciples hath ſet euery deceaue world expell lyght god worde darcknes may haue roome ſee dayly experience certayne hundred yeares lōg feareth neyther god hys worde neyther regardeth father mother mayſter chriſt hymſelf rebelleth againſt god ordinaunces riſeth men feare pope oyle god cōmaundement agaynſt kynges reſiſteth hys officer dare lay handes one pope annoynted though ſley hys father hys face violence vnto brother defile ſiſter wife mother like honour geue vnto tradition ceremony deuotion haue bleſſed call chalice byſhop lifteth vp holy hand ouer v dare handle chalice touch alter ſtone put hand fount hys finger holy oyle reuerence geue vnto holy water holy • yre holy bread holy ſalt halowed belle holy waxe holy bowes holy candels holy aſhes laſt vnto holy cādle commit ſoules laſt departyng yea cloute byſhop chapplen ſtandeth knitteth childrens neckes confirmatiō lay perſon durſt ſo bold vnlooſe knot thou wilt ſay ſuch thinges bring holy ghoſt put away ſinne driue away ſpirites ſay ſtedfaſt fayth belefe chriſt promiſes god hath ſworne geue v hys ſake bringeth holy ghoſt scripture make mention paul ſayth actes xix haue ye receaued holy ghoſt fayth beleuing fayth rocke chriſt fayth driueth y• deuil • away buildeth hys congregation agaynſt whiche • ayth chriſt math xvj hell gate ſhall preuaile ſoone thou beleueſt chriſt holy ghoſt commeth ſinne falleth away deuils flye caſt holy water deuill ryng belle fleeth doe byſhops make hym flee ſhotyng gunnes men young child mocketh v bring v true fayth god word vnto ſuperſtitious falſe belefe owne imagination thou haddeſt fayth threweſt vnhalowed ſtone head would earneſtly flee without mockyng yea though thou threweſt nothyng would yet abyde though beginnyng miracle ceremony dyd miracle fayth ſhewed ſuch ceremony moue infidel beleue word god thou readeſt apoſtles annoynted ſicke oyle healed paul ſent pertelet iirkyn ſicke healed alſo yet ceremonie miracle fayth preacher truth god promiſed confirme ſtabliſh goſpell ſuch miracle therfore ſoone gift miracle ceaſed ought ceremonie haue ceaſed alſo el needes haue ceremonie ſignifie ſome promiſe benefite god whiche prayſe would haue god word preached euery sonday entent sondayes holy let tell ceremony meaneth dayes ordeined let tel people meaneth ſet vp haulde naked ceremonie without ſignificatiō make people beleue therein quenche fayth ought geuen vnto word god helpeth alſo prieſt prieſt diſguiſeth hym ſelfe paſſion chriſt whē goeth maſſe diſguifeth ſelfe great part paſſion chriſt playeth reſt vnder ſilence ſignes profers noddyng beckyng mowyng iacke ape neither ſelfe neither man el woteth meaneth verely hurteth excedyngly much onely deſtroyeth fayth quencheth loue ſhould domme ceremony quench fayth loue make infidel mocke v geuen vnto commaundements maketh people vnthankefull bringeth ſuch ſuperſtition thinke haue done aboundantly ynough god yea deſerued aboue meaſure preſent day ſuch mummyng alſo maketh infidel mocke v abhorre v ſee nothyng ſuch ape play among v man geue reaſon commeth paſſe fulfill propheſie chriſt propheſied propheſie chriſt fulfilled marke xiij luke xxj ſhall come name ſhall ſay ſelues chriſt verely pope holy order religion vnder name chriſt preach thē ſelues word tradition teach people beleue pope geueth pardon full power treaſure church merites saintes frier lykewiſe make benefactours onely call brother ſiſters partaker maſſes faſting watchynges prayings wolward goynges yea whē nouice obſeruauntes profeſſed teſtament obſeruauntes father aſketh ye kepe rule holy fraunces ſayth yea ye ſo dede ſayth aunſwereth yea forſoth father ſayth father promiſe agayne euerlaſtyng lyfe blaſphemy eternall life due vnto pilde tradition lowſie frier teſtament become god made vnto v chriſtes bloud chriſt ſayth math xxiiij mark xiij ſhal come pſeudochriſts falſe annoynted though conſideration haue tranſlated falſe chriſtes kepyng greeke word yet ſignifieth engliſh falſe annoynted ought ſo tranſlated ſhall come ſaith chriſt falſe annoynted falſe prophetes ſhall miracle wonder ſo greatly poſſible elect choſen ſhould brought way compare pope doctrine vnto word god thou ſhalt finde hath ben yet great goyng way euill men deceauers paul propheſied ij timo iij haue preuailed waxed worſe worſe beguiling beguiled ſelues thou trembleſt quakeſt ſaying ſhall god let v go ſo ſore right way aunſwere chriſt warneth v chriſtes propheſis▪ neuer ſo terrible muſt yet fulfilled knew ſhould follow ſo propheſied true prophet propheſie muſt nedes fulfilled god annoynted hys ſonne ieſus holy ghoſt therfore chriſt neither ſhanen ſhorne annoynted oyle called chriſt much ſay annoynted outwardly diſguiſed made hym like mē ſent world bleſſe v offer ſelfe v ſacrifice ſwete ſauour kill ſtench ſinnes god hence forth ſhould ſmell thinke make full ſufficient ſatiſfaction amendes repent beleuyng truth god ſubmitting ſelues vnto ordinaūces ſinnes haue done ſhal ſinne fragilitie neuer ſo oft yet ſoone repente come right way agayne vnto teſtament whiche god hath made chriſtes bloud ſinnes vaniſh away ſmoke winde darkenes commyng light thou caſt litle bloud milke yt mayne ſee ſo hee doth ought make ſatiſfaction get heauen hath loſt parte chriſtes bloud much ſoeuer goeth make ſatiſfactiō ſinnes god ward ſaying hart much haue ſinned much doe agayne wiſe lyue make amendes wil get heauen ſame infidell faythleſſe damned deede hath loſt part chriſtes bloud becauſe diſobedient vnto god teſtamēt ſetteth vp owne imagination vnto compell god obey loue god haue cō maundemēt loue neighbour alſo ſayth iohn epiſtle haue offended make amendes neighbour make amendes haue wherewith aſke forgeueneſſe doe ſuffer thynges ſake wynne god noriſh peace vnitie godward chriſt euerlaſtyng ſatiſfaction euer ſufficient chriſt fulfilled hys apoſtles neither ſhaue ſhoren annoynted oyle courſe annoynted hys apoſtles diſciples ſame ſprite ſent forth without maner diſguiſing like men alſo preach attonemēt peace chriſt made betwene god man apoſtles likewiſe diſguiſed man choſe men annoynted wyth ſame ſpirit one preach worde god call greeke tounge byſhop ouerſear byſhop prieſt engliſhe ouerſear elder annointed thou readeſt timothe iij byſhoppe ouerſear true annoynting old prieſt muſt faultleſſe huſband one wife many iewes alſo gentils conuerted vnto faith tyme diuers wine yet compelled put thē away paule becauſe enſāple would haue preacher much chriſt returne agayne vnto y• firſt ordinaunce god one man one woman ſhould goe together muſt ſober honeſt behauiour honeſtly apparelled harbarous ready lodge ſtraungers apte oyle among byſhops teach dronckard fighter geuen filthy lucre gentle abhorring fyghting abhorring couetouſnes one ruleth hys owne houſeholde honeſtly hauing child vnder obedience wyth honeſtie man rule hys owne houſe care congregation god may younge fayth man would ſay nouice leaſt ſwell fall yt iudgement yt euill ſpeaker may vnlearned ſecretes fayth ſuch attonce ſtubburne headſtrong ſet little themſelues ala haue aboue twenty thouſand know ſcripture written portoues among exceding well learned turne ſeruice muſt well reported thē yt without leaſt fal rebuke ſnare euill ſpeaker leaſt infidel yet beleue ſhould hurt hym driuen fayth man defamed made head ouerſeer congregation muſt haue wife two cauſes prieſtes ought haue wiues one may therby knowē mete rowme vnapt ſo chargeable office neuer houſholde rule cauſe chaſtity exceeding ſeldom gift vnchaſtitie exceding perilous degree much y• people looke well vnto liuyng vnto preachyng hurte liuing diſagree fall frō fayth beleue worde ouerſeer becauſe takē prieſtes dutie haue hys owne buſines labour preach god word vnto pariſhe hath right authoritie hys office chalenge honeſt liuyng yt pariſhe thou mayſt ſee y• enangeliſtes alſo paule haue ſeruaunt geue hym meate drinke rayment thing neceſſary would men bound pay prieſt tithe god law pay hym whether money aſſigne hym ſo much rent tithe guiſe many countreies libertie lykewiſe euery congregation deacon ſignifieth office choſe ſame enſample euen ſo annointed ſee ſayd chapter paule act vj greeke word call deacon ſay engliſh ſeruaunt miniſter whoſe office helpe aſſiſte ye prieſt gather vp dutie gather poore pariſhe deſtitute frends could beggers worke common beggers runne frō dore dore thē ſuffered yt saintes dayes namely ſuch holy dayes offerynges came vp ſuffered death worde ſake came men together church prieſt preached vnto exhorted cleaue faſt vnto worde ſtrong fayth fight againſt power world wyth ſuffering faythes ſake saintes yet god enſample saintes taught thē beleue ſaintes truſt merites make god tooke ſaintes example prayed god geue lyke fayth truſt hys worde lyke ſtrength power ſuffer therefore geue ſo ſure hope lyfe come thou mayſt ſee collectes saint laurence saint stephen lady matens ſuch dayes offer ſo gaue euery mā portion according abilitie god put hart maintenaunce prieſt deacō common miniſters poore finde learned men teach ſo forth put handes deacon thou mayſt ſee ye lyfe saint laurence hiſtories ſuch purpoſes lādes geuē vnto ſpirituall officer befor fell fayth gaue men landes afterwarde eaſe pariſhes made hoſpitals alſo place teach child bring vp nourtour god worde landes monkes deuour antichriſt antichriſt maner hath ſent forth diſciples thoſe falſe annointed chriſt warneth v falſe annoynted ſhould come ſhewe miracle wonder euen bring elect way poſſible annointeth shauyng borowed heathen oylyng y• iewes maner y• iewes ſhaueth ſhoreth maner heathen prieſtes whiche ſerue idoles heſendeth forth falſe oyle onely falſe name falſe name alſo compare name vnto deedes thou ſhalt finde falſe ſendeth forth paule propheſied ij theſſ ij wyth lying ſignes wonder ſigne lying ſignes annointing full holy ghoſt compare ſignes holy ghoſt paule reckoneth thou ſhalt fynde falſe ſigne biſhop muſt faultles huſband one wyfe nay ſayth yt wife • n whore pope huſband wife holder many whore liſteth god commaundeth degree burne liue chaſt marry pope ſaith thou burne take diſpenſation concubine take diſpenſation put away thou art olde el lawyer ſay ſi non caſte tamen caute ye liue chaſte knaueate ſee ye cary cleane play knaue ſecretly harbarous yea whore baudes poore man ſhall ſoone breake necke faſt ſcraps wyth dogges dinner done apt teach peter ſayth j pet ij ready alwayes geue anſwere euery man axeth reaſon hope ye haue wyth meekenes thing ſignified bootes doctours diuinitie bootes created becauſe ſhould ready alwayes goe thorough gentleman abiure ſecretly curſe iiij time yeare curſe thē make afrayde euery thyng namely touch mine annoynted feare thē make feare ſentence church ſuſpentiōs excōmunications curſes right wrōg beare hand feared yet preach mine authoritie terrible thyng curſe blacke maketh ſoules holydayes ordeined preach god word ſet vp long ceremony long matines long maſſes lōg euenſonges latin vnderſtand latine roule darkenes ye may lead whether ye leſt rolle thē ſuch thinges ſhould tedious ſing syng ſome ſay ſome pype ſome ryng ryng belle lulle rocke ſlepe yet paul ij cor xiiij forbiddeth lulle thē holy father byſhops ſay falſe god man noble realme true kyng ſo bolde dare councell ſhould hys honour wealth realme waite ſeaſō hym men ſay wyll prouide ghoſtly father hym god bring wickednes light miſchiefe wherof roote bloudſhedde thorough cauſe either counſell preach true obedience teach people feare god faythfull ſeruaunt courte ſhall haue twēty ſpies wayting vpon ſhalbe caſt courte ſaying conuayed callice made captayne ambaſſadoure ſhalbe kepte farre inough kynges preſence kinges ought ſay remember dutie kynges god ſteede ordayned god themſelues wealth ſubiectes let remember ſubiectes brother fleſhe bloud member owne body euē owne ſelues chriſt therefore ought pitie rid ſuch wylye tyrāny encreaſeth dayly though kynges falſhod byſhops abbottes ſworne defend ſuch liberty yet ought vnlawfull othes ought broken may without diſpenſation keepe othes breake much vnright cleane agaynſt god ordinaunce euen cruell oppreſſion contrary vnto brotherly loue charitie moreouer ſpirituall officer ought puniſh ſinne ſinne kyng ought puniſh ſinne meane broken forth hart muſt remaine god breake kyng ordained puniſhe preach exhort thē feare god ſinne let kinges put downe ſome theyr tyranny turne ſome vnto common wealth tenth part ſuch tyranny geuen kyng yearely laide vp ſhyre townes agaynſt realme neede would grow certayne yeares moreouer one kyng one lawe god ordinaunce euery realme therefore ought king ſuffer haue ſeuerall lawe themſelues draw hys ſubiectes thether mete ſay ſpirituall man ſhould iudged worldly temporall man abhomination ſprite perteineth vnto ſhauen onely ſee deuide ſeparate themſelues laye man worlde ſo god beleue chriſt mēber chriſt chriſtes brother chriſtes fleſhe chriſtes bloud chriſtes ſpouſe coheyre wyth chriſt hath ſpirite earneſt alſo ſpirituall woulde robbe v ſpirite god ſhould feare robbe v worldly goodes becauſe thou art put office preach god word art thou therefore one brother maior london one citie becauſe chiefe officer kyng realme becauſe head thereof king roome god king law god law hys lawe god lawe nothyng lawe nature naturall equitie god graued hart men yet antichriſt good iudged lawe god muſt haue new hys owne making mete verely went lawe needed woulde ſtudie preach god worde truely contented wyth ſufficient lyke one theyr brother queſtion aroſe y• fayth men ought iudge queſtions ſcripture ſcripture let iudge prieſtes elder recorde taught repentaunce fayth y• councell god yet deſired man golde ſiluer veſture fedde himſelfe labour hys handes yet theſe two taught prayed people much prelate doe wyth goeth commaundement god tyme tyed therfore great commaundemēt ende commaundementes conteyned men ſhould continue buie prayer foure fiue hundred yeares moe haue done would foote grounde chriſtendome neither worldly thyng y• called ſpirituall onely ſhoulde poſſeſſe thus ſhoulde called ſpirituall wo lawyer ye lade men wyth burdēs able beare ye ſelues touch packes wyth one finger ſaith chriſt luke xj lawyer verely haue laden v thouſand burden ſpirituall lawyer tymes ſpirituall kynred haue made baptime let matrimonie beſides haue added certaine degree vnto law naturall ſame purpoſe vnbearable burthen chaſtitie violently thruſt mēs backes eaſely beare themſelues ſore burden cruell hāgman greuous torment yea confeſſion tormenteth conſcience robbeth purſe money ſoule fayth paynefull hell eare confeſſion vnto men conſciences people brought beliefe ſaued ſo much ſome faſte certayne dayes yeare pray certayne ſuperſtitious prayer lyues longe may die without confeſſion perill death prieſt ſhippemen ſhriue themſelues vnto maſt preſent runne euery mā eare god promiſes flye know man haue deathes wounde cryeth immediatly prieſt man die without ſhrift many take ſigne damnation many reaſon falſe beliefe die deſperation many ſhame keepe backe confeſſion xx xxx yeares thinke damned knew poore woman childe longed ouercomen paſſion eate fleſhe friday thing ſhe durſt confeſſe ſpace xviij yeares thought ſhe ben damned yet ſinned ſhe ſore burden ſo weyeth downe ſoule vnto bottome hell ſhoulde ſay great booke ſufficient rehearſe y• ſnares haue layde robbe men goodes alſo truſt ſhoulde haue god worde scribe phariſeis workes ſene men ſet abroade philacteries make long border garmentes loue ſit vppermoſt feaſtes haue chiefe ſeates ſynagoges congregation councels called rabby ſaye maiſters ſayth chriſt math xxiij beholde deedes ſpiritualtie many thouſand faſhions among knowen none like ſo loueth none bagges bables knowen euery one ſuppoſeth polle faſt make many captiues yet reſiſte chriſt agreed leaſt ſhoulde compeld deliuer vp priſoners hym beholde monſters diſguiſed miter croſes hatt • croſſes pillers pollaxes wyth thre crownes name haue lord prior lord abbot glorious name lord byſhop lord archbiſhop cardinall legate pleaſe fatherhod pleaſe lordſhip pleaſe grace pleaſe holines innumerable ſuch like beholde eſteemed eſtemed hie crept vp aboue worldly ſeates onely ſeate god harte men ſit aboue god himſelfe whatſoeuer make owne heades feared dread god commaundements deſeruinges put truſt chriſt hys merites promiſes geue fayth promiſes god hath ſworne chriſtes bloud hypocrite ſay vnto king lordes theſe heretickes would haue v downe firſt make cōmon nay ye hypocrite kinges go lower right heretickes approued open scripture kinges lordes downe already ſo low go lower ye treade vnder feete lead thē captiue haue made bonde ſeruaunts waite filthy luſtes auenge malice euery man contrary vnto right god word ye haue onely robbed lād authoritie honour due obediēce ye owe vnto alſo wittes ſo without vnderſtādyng god word onely euē worldly matter pertaine vnto office child ye beare hand ye haue brought euē caſe like vnto daunce naked nettes beleue inuiſible would haue vp agayne reſtored vnto rowme authoritie god hath geuen whereof ye haue robbed inward falſehode vtter onely light god word hypocriſie might ſene learned therfore ye iudge world leſt god angry ye periſh right way wo scribe phariſeis hypocrite ye make cleane yt vtterſide cuppe platter within full brybry exceſſe ſaith chriſt mat xxiij hypocrite lyue theft hypocrite eate drinke riotous exceſſe thyng ſaue robbery haue falſly gotten lying doctrine learned therefore ye iudge world compell make reſtitution agayne ye blinde guide ſayth chriſt ye ſtrayne gnat ſwalow camell math xxiij blinde guide alſo ſtomble ſtraw lepe ouer blocke makyng narow conſciences conſciēces ſo narrow tradition haue wyde mouthes god cōmaundementes trifle matter weight none happen ſwalow hys ſpitle water wherewith waſheth mouth ere goe maſſe touch sacramēt noſe aſſe forget breath happen handle finger whiche annoynted ſay alleluia ſtede laus tibi domine ite miſſa eſt ſtede benedicamus domino poure much wine chalice read goſpell without light make croſſes right trembleth feareth horrible ſinne committed cry god mercy ſayth ghoſtly father hold whore man wife bye benefice ſet one realme variaunce cauſe xx thouſand mē dye day trifle paſtime iewes boaſteth ſelues iewes childrē abrahā ſo byſhops ſucceſſours apoſtles abraham chriſt ſayd vnto iohn viij ye abraham child ye would deedes abraham hypocrite boaſt ſelues authoritie peter paul apoſtles cleane contrary vnto deedes doctrine peter paul apoſtles obeyed worldly authoritie power vſurpyng none ſelues taught feare kynges ruler obey thing contrary commaundement god reſiſte though tooke away life goodes wrongfully paciently abyde god vengeaunce ſpiritualtie neuer yet ſpiritualty haue taught feare tradition taught taught feare god commaundementes feare tradition ſo much euill people feare reſiſt good kyng riſe againſt dare lay handes one neither defilyng wife daughter mother wynne ſomewhat alwayes men loſe lyfe landes remaine alwayes ſure ſafetie euer wynne ſomewhat ſoeuer cō quereth men landes vnrightfully euer geueth thē part thyng lawfull councels parlamentes chief without may kyng ☜ crowned neither vntil ſworne liberty ſecretes know euen thoughtes men harte thinges miniſtred kyng realme may thorough falſehode liue peace beleue teach chriſt diſguiſed hypocriſie compell men buy redemptiō forgeuenes ſinnes people ſinne eate thereof waxe fat wicked people proſperous common wealth kinges great men amiſſe muſt builde abbayes colledges meane men builde chauntreis poore finde trētals brotherhodes beggyng frier owne heyres men diſherite endote kynges compelled ſubmitte ſelues read ſtory kyng iohn kynges haue cauſes auenged though whole realmes ſhould therefore periſhe take deſguiſing ſo ſpirituall compare haue taught v vnto scripture ſo without fayth chriſt ſayth iohn v chapter ſeke honor haue fayth neither god meſſage ye beleue receaue glory one ſeke glorious haue fayth prelate faythleſſe verely iohn vij ſayth ſpeaketh hym ſelfe ſeeketh owne glory ſeke glorie honour ſure token man ſpeaketh owne ſelfe doth owne meſſage maſters doctrine prelate ſelues god learned therefore ye iudge earth leſt god angry ye periſh right way learned leſt hypocrite bring learned wrath god vppon heades compel ſhed innocent blould haue compelled predeceſſours ſlay prophetes kill chriſt apoſtles righteous y• ſence ſlayne god word god wordought men know pertaineth vnto men perteineth vnto ſeruaunts know maſters pleaſure ſubiectes know lawes theyr prince let hypocrite thing ſecretly reaſon ſecretly ☞ myne enemy ſhould put priſon pleaſure diet handle luſteth iudge ſelfe ſecretly condemne law owne makyng deliuer pylate murther let god word try euery god wordought ſo iudge man doctrine ſo euer god word proueth vncleane let taken leper one scripture • right way vnderſtād ſcripture helpe declare circumſtaūces ſay place go wil geue light vnto middle text opē manifeſt scripture euer improue falſe wrong expoſition darker ſentences let temporall power whō god hath geuen ſword take vengeaunce looke euer leape ſee let cauſes diſputed let accuſed haue rowme aunſwere ſelfe king haue iudge ſoule helpeth power god hath committed ſword ſhall geue acountes euery droppe bloud ſhed earth ſhall ignoraunce excuſe ſaying hypocrite helpe ſoule grace ſhall meritorious deede grace ought heare old hereſy cōdemned church king ought looke scripture ſee whether truly condemned puniſh king officer ſlay ſo ought kyng officer iudge kyng vnto damnatiō lend ſword kill iudgeth owne lawes let hym accuſed ſtand one ſyde accuſer ſyde let kynges iudge ſit iudge cauſe kyng kill murtherer god hereof may ye ſee onely preach thou wilt rebuke hypocriſie perſecution ſame cauſe chriſtes ſay nothing chriſt ſayde alſo perſecution onely rebuking hypocriſy ſay mās righteouſnes holy dedes man hath imagined pleaſe god ſaued without god worde beſide teſtamēt god hath made chriſt chriſt rebuked yt phareſeis becauſe taught people beleue tradition holynes offeringes came auantage taught widowes thē frendes dead beleue prayer prayer dead ſhould ſaued thorough meanes robbed goodes alſo teſtament promiſes god made repented chriſt come might haue bene vncrucified vnto day saint paule alſo preached againſt circumciſion iuſtified vowes offeringes ceremony iuſtified righteouſnes forgeuenes ſinnes came deſeruing deedes faith beleuing ye promiſes god deſeruing merites chriſt onely might haue liued vnto houre likewiſe preached againſt pride couetouſnes lechery extorcion vſury ſymony againſt euill lyuing ſpiritualtie well temporalitie againſt incloſings parkes reiſing rent fine carying wolle realme might endure long enough toutch ſcabbe hipocriſie popeholynes goe vtter falſe doctrine wherewith reigne god hart conſciences men robbe landes goodes authoritie onely alſo teſtament god ſaluation chriſt helpeth thee neither god worde yet thou diddiſt miracle thou art heretike onely haſt deuill within thee alſo breaker kinges peace traytor let v returne vnto lying ſygnes agayne ſignifieth prelate prelate clothed red ſo bloudy clothed red ready euery houre ſuffer martyrdome teſtimony god worde alſo falſe ſigne man dare open mouth aſke queſtion god worde becauſe ready burne ſignifieth pollaxes pollaxe • borne hye legate latere ſo euer falſe ſigne make care ſure olde hypocrite ſlayne chriſt ſet pollaxes keepe ſ • pulcre ſhould riſe againe euē ſo haue hypocrite buried teſtament god made vnto v chriſtes bloud kepe downe riſe againe ſtudie wherof theſe pollaxes ſigne ſhepardes hoke biſhopes croſe falſe ſigne white rochette byſhops chanons weare ſo like nunne ſo effeminatly falſe ſigne thinges ſandals gloues myters whole pompe diſguiſing falſe ſignes paule propheſied ſhoulde come clothed falſhod ¶ ſacramentes foraſmuch come ſignes wil ſpeake word two ſignes god hath ordeined ſay ſacramentes chriſt left amongeſt v comfort may walke light truth feling power god walketh y• day ſtumbleth contrariwiſe walketh night ſtumbleth ioh xi walke darknes wote whether goe ioh xij worde ſacrament much ſay holy ſigne repreſenteth alway ſome promiſe god sacramentes ſignes god promiſes sacrament preacheth iuſtifieth onely bloud thou haue thys promiſe faſt thine hart body ſlayne bloud ſhed thy ſins beleueſt ſo art thou ſaued iuſtified thereby ſo helpeth thee though thou heareſt thouſand maſſes day though thou doeſt nothing el thy life long eate body drinke bloude thē ſhould helpe thee dead thyrſt beholde buſhe tauerne dore thou kneweſt thereby wine within ſold • ¶ baptime baptime hath alſo worde promiſe prieſt ought teach people chriſten engliſhe tounge play y• popengay credo ſay ye • olo ſay ye baptiſmum ſay ye ought mumming ſuch matter prieſt baptiſeth aſketh ſaying ſaith act ij waſhing without worde helpeth worde purifieth clenſeth v thou readeſt ephe v chriſt clenſeth congregation fountayne water worde word promiſe god hath made preacher preaching ſacramētes iuſtifie worde god ſaueth hearer beleue ſo doth waſhing preacheth repreſenteth vnto v promiſe god hath made vnto v chriſt waſhing preacheth vnto v clēſed chriſtes bloudſhedding offering ſatiſfaction wedlocke betwene v chriſt woman though ſhe neuer ſo poore yet ſhe maried rich huſband euen ſo whē repent beleue promiſes god chriſt though neuer ſo poore ſinners yet rich chriſt merit hath cauſe call prieſt aaron prieſt ſacrificed people mediator betwen god engliſh ſhould haue ſome name prieſt antichriſt hath deceaued v vnknowen ſtraūge termes bring v confuſion ſuperſtitious blyndnes maner chriſt himſelfe ye deſires petition hart ſacrifice kil luſtes appetits fleſh prayer faſting maner godly liuing worde greeke called preſbiter latin senior engliſhe elder nothing preſbiter officer teach mediator betwene god v nedeth annointing man • yt olde teſtament annointed oyle prieſtes ought annointed oyle ſignifie annointing chriſt v thorough chriſt holy ghoſt wiſe man prieſt choſen ſaue time neceſſitie euery parſon chriſteneth ſo may euery man teach wife houſholde wife child time neede ſee brother ſinne may betwene hym rebuke damne deede lawe god may alſo comfort diſpayre promiſes god ſaue beleue prieſt new teſtament office prieſt vnderſtand nothing elder teach younger bring thē vnto full knowledge vnderſtanding chriſt miniſter sacramentes chriſt ordeyned alſo nothyng preach chriſtes promiſes geue ſtudie quench light truth holde people darcknes vnderſtand diſciples sathan meſſengers antichriſt ſoeuer name haue ſoeuer call themſelues concerning ſpiritualtie called make themſelues holyer lay people take ſo holier deedes holy great landes goodes pray promiſe pardon forgeuenes ſinnes abſolution without preachyng chriſtes promiſes falſehode woorkyng antichriſt haue ſayd rauenyng thoſe wolues paul act xx propheſied ſhould come hys departyng ſparyng flocke doctrine marchaundiſe wherof peter ſpeaketh ſaying coueteouſnes ſhall fayned wordes make marchaundiſe ij pet ij reaſons wherewith proue doctrine ſayth paul timo vj ſuperfluous diſputynges arguynges braulyngs mē corrupt mindes deſtitute truth whiche thinke compare dedes doctrine end deedes chriſt apoſtles iudge fruites lucre godlynes chriſt ſayth math vij frutes ſhalt thou know filthy couetouſnes ſhameleſſe ambition dronken deſire honor contrary vnto example doctrine chriſt apoſtles chriſt ſayd peter laſt chapter iohn fede ſheepe ſhere thy flocke pet ſayth pet v lordes ouer pariſhes theſe ſhere become lordes paul ſaith ij cor ij lordes ouer faith theſe lordes compel v beleue ſoeuer luſt without witnes scripture yea cleane contrary scripture whē opē text rebuketh paul ſayth better geue thē receaue act xx theſe nothyng world lay ſnares katch receaue ſo euer cōmeth gapyng mouth hell ij cor xij ſeeke theſe ſeeke chriſt thē ſelues therfore leſt dedes ſhould rebuked come light neuertheleſſe truth equally beloued chriſt god hath ſworne indifferently according therfore euery man beleueth god promiſes longeth thē diligent pray vnto god fulfill ſo prayer heard good prayer cobler cardinall bocher byſhop bleſſing baker knoweth truth good bleſſyng moſt holy father pope bleſſing vnderſtand bleſſing meaneth wagging pope biſhops hand ouer thyne head prayer ſay god make thee good man chriſt put ſpirite thee geue thee grace power walke truth folow hys cōmaūdementes c rebecca frendes bleſſed whē ſhe departed gene xxiiij ſaying thou art ſiſter grow vnto thouſand thouſandes thy ſeede poſſeſſe gate enemy iſaac bleſſed iacob gene xxvij ſaying god geue thee dew heauen fatnes earth aboundaunce corne wyne oyle c gene xxviij almighty god bleſſe thee make thee grow multiply thee thou mayſt great multitude people geue thee thy ſeede thee bleſſings abraham thou mayſt poſſeſſe land wherin thou art ſtraū ger promiſed thy graundfather ſuch lyke laſt one ſingular doubt haue maketh prieſt annoynting puttyng handes ceremonie wordes braule ſcolde one ready teare others throte one ſayth cā agree neither cā make ſo ſtrong reaſon improue way without ſpirite god iudge ſpirituall thing howbeit aūſwere whē chriſt called xij vp moūtaine choſe immediatly without annointing ceremony apoſtles witte miniſters choſen ſent preach teſtament vnto whole world reſurrection whē opened wittes geuen knowledge vnderſtand ſecretes hys teſtament bynde looſe would haue thē thynges ſent forth commaundemēt preach bynde vnbeleuyng continue ſinne looſe beleuyng repent commaundemēt commaundement maketh prieſtes charge made thē byſhops prieſtes pope thyng ſay chriſt made thē prieſtes maundey laſt supper ſayd remembraūce aunſwere though apoſtles wiſt hee ment yet ſtriue ſay agaynſt neuer latter commaundement charge gaue made thē prieſtes actes firſt mathias choſē lotte douted apoſtles common maner prayed god would geue grace miniſter office truely put handes exhorted gaue charge diligent faithfull great beſt actes vj diſciples beleued choſen vj deacon miniſter widdowes apoſtles prayed put handes admitted without adde putting hand putting hāds maner dome bleſſing holy byſhops two finger ſpake vnto tolde dutie gaue charge warned faythfull lordes buſines chuſe temporall officer read duty promiſe faythfull miniſters admitted neither maner ceremonie required makyng ſpirituall officer chuſe able perſon thē rehearſe dutie geue charge ſo put rowme ſolemne doubte call whether iudas prieſt iudas care ſure onely prieſt alſo byſhop cardinall pope ¶ penaunce penaunce word owne forgyng diſceaue v many scripture finde panitentia repentaunce agite poenitentiam repent poeniteat vos let repēt metanoyte greeke forthinke yo let forthinke repentaunce point practiſe haue made penaunce blinde people make thinke muſt take payne ſome holy dedes make ſatiſfaction ſinnes namely ſuch enioyue thou mayſt ſee ☞ cronicles great kynges tyrauntes violence ſword conquered kynges landes ſlew came hand came ſelues conſcience wicked dedes byſhops coupled chriſt vnto pope preached pope vnto made ſubmit ſelues alſo realmes vnto holy father pope take penaunce call ſay ſuch iniunctions pope biſhops would commaund build abbays endote liuelode prayed euer geue exemption priuilege licence luſt vnpuniſhed repentaunce goeth faith repentaunce prepareth way chriſt promiſes chriſt commeth vnto ſee ſinnes law repent repentaunce ſay mornyng ſorrow hart laſteth liues long finde ſelues liues long weake god law therfore ſorrow morne longyng ſtrength repentaunce sacrament faith hope loue knowledge man ſinnes called sacramentes ſpirituall inuiſible muſt sacrament outward ſigne may ſene ſignifie repreſent put man remēbraunce ſome ſpirituall promiſe ſene faith onely repentaunce good dedes accompanie repentaunce ſlay luſtes fleſhe ſignified baptiſme paule ſayth repentaunce ſignified baptime rom vj aboue rehearſed remember ye ſaith whiche baptiſed name chriſt ieſus baptiſed dye buryed baptiſme dye kil luſtes rebellion remayneth fleſh ſayth ye dead concernyng ſinne lyue vnto god ieſus chriſt lord thou looke profeſſion ☜ hart ſpirit forgeuenes haue receaued thorough chriſtes merites full dead thou looke rebellion fleſh begyn dye baptiſed drowne quench luſtes full baptiſed laſt minute death cō cernyng workyng ſpirite begyn lyue grow euery day knowledge alſo godly lyuyng accordyng luſtes abate child receaueth ye • ull ſoule firſt day yet groweth dayly operation workes therof ¶ confeſsion confeſſion diuers one foloweth true fayth inſparably confeſſing knowledging one confeſſion knowledge wherein thou putteſt thy truſt mouth wherein put truſt confidēce ſay credo confeſſing truſt god father almighty truth promiſes ſonne ieſus lord merites deſeruinges holy ghoſt power aſſiſtance guiding confeſſion neceſſary vnto men wyll ſaued chriſt ſaith mathew x denyeth men hym deny father heauen confeſſion ſayth holy apoſtle paule x chapter beliefe hart iuſtifieth knowledge wyth mouth maketh man ſafe wonderfull text philoſophers rather ſophiſters worldly wyſe enemy wiſdome god deepe profounde welles wythout water cloudes wythout moyſture rayne ſay naturall ſoules without ſprite god feeling godly thynges iuſtifie make ſafe one thing confeſſe mouth good worke frute true fayth workes thou repent beleue promiſes god truth iuſtifieth thee forgeueth thee thy ſinnes ſealeth thee hys holy ſpirite maketh thee heyre euerlaſtyng lyfe chriſtes deſeruinges thou haue true fayth ſo ſeeſt thou exceeding infinite loue mercy god hath ſhewed thee freely chriſt muſt thou needes loue agayne loue compell tyrauntes oppoſe thee thou haue power confeſſe art thou ſure thou art ſate thee worke boldly confeſſe knowledge thy lord chriſt truſt thou haſt word knowledge maketh thee ſafe declareth thou art ſafe already certifieth thine hart maketh thee feele thy fayth right god ſpirite thee good workes doe commeth vnto point thou haſt luſt worke power confeſſe couldeſt thou preſume thinke god ſprite thee confeſſion confeſſion knowledge thy ſinnes 〈…〉 vnto god goeth ſaith accompanieth repentaunce ſo euer repenteth doth knowledge ſinnes hart ſoeuer doth knowledge ſinnes receaueth forgenenes • ayth iohn firſt firſt epiſtle knowledge ſinnes faythfull iuſt forgeue v ſinnes clenſe v vnrighteouſnes becauſe hath promiſed muſt truthes ſake doe confeſſion neceſſary liues long repentaunce thou vnderſtandeſt repentaunce ſo vnderſtand confeſſion likewiſe included ſacrament baptime alwayes repent alwayes knowledge cōfeſſe ſinnes vnto god yet diſpayre remember waſhed chriſtes bloud thing baptime doth repreſēt ſignifie vnto v shrift eare verely worke sathan • alſeſt euer shrift wrought moſt hath deuoured fayth began among greekes reckē mās ſinnes prieſtes eare aſke coūcell ſuch doubtes men thou mayſt ſee hierome author neither went prieſtes onely fewe tyme moe preached worde god ſo great vantage ſo many maſſes ſaying yet founde went indifferently ſaw good learned man becauſe shrift put downe knauery among greekes ſtabliſhed • among v litle knauery deacō conſtantinople plaide thorough cō feſſion one chiefe wiues citie layde downe agayne antichriſtes poſſeſſion knauery ſee growe thereby dayly ſtabliſhe chriſten man ſpirituall thing hath god word hart god ſpirite certifie thing bound come eare reaſons make perſuaſions man wiſedome firſt perteining vnto keyes maner bynding looſing eough aboue rehearſed place thou maiſt alſo ſee apoſtles vſed actes paules epiſtles preaching fayth ſpirite came certified hart iuſtified thorough beleuing promiſes man feeleth hart mā ſhall know 〈◊〉 ſinnes forgeuen conſenteth vnto law god feeleth hymſelfe meeke pacient curteous mercifull hys neighbour altered faſhioned like vnto chriſt ſhoulde doubt god hath forgeuen choſen put ſpirite hym though neuer cromme hys ſinne prieſtes eare one blynde reaſon haue ſaying blind reaſon guide god ſpirite ſhall prieſt vnbynde looſe forgeue ſinne knoweth apoſtles scripture forſake runne vnto blinde reaſons draw scripture vnto carnall purpoſe haue tolde thee thyne eare haue done life long order circumſtances ſhamefulleſt maner cāſt thou doe preach promiſes ſaying thou repent beleue god truth ſhall ſaue thee chriſtes ſake thou ſeeſt myne hart thou knoweſt whether repent neyther whether conſent law holy righteous good moreouer whether beleue promiſes alſo vnknowen thee thou preach law promiſes apoſtles ſo ſhould god hath choſen repent beleue ſaued euen well antichriſt muſt know ſecretes ſtabliſh kingdom worke miſteries withall bryng alſo ſtorie x leper whiche written learne know verely leper theyr harte xvij chapter luke marke falſehoode learne knowe euer fourtene sonday feaſt trinitie begynnyng vij le •… n ſayd goſpell viij ix leſſons reſt ſeuenth expoſition bede vpon ſayd goſpell ſaith bede chriſt healed ſo euer diſeaſe ſent none vnto prieſtes leper leper enterpreteth folowers falſe doctrine onely ſpirituall officer learned men congregation ought examine rebuke learning god word warne congregation beware afterward healed grace chriſt ought come cōgregation openly confeſſe theyr true fayth vice ſaith doth god heale within conſcience though wiſe reade mattens yet hie maſſe haue ſermon lie cleane contrary vnto open truth neither aſhamed walke altogether darcknes ¶ contrition contrition repētaunce one nothyng el ſorowful mournyng hart becauſe god hath promiſed mercy vnto contrite hart ſorowfull repentyng hart beguile god word ſtabliſh wicked tradition haue fayned new word attrition ſaying thou canſt know whether thy ſorrowe repentaunce contrition attrition except thou attritiō leues phariſeis ſhreuen thou art ſhreuen thē true contritiō oh foxy phariſay thy leuen chriſt ſo diligētly bad v beware math vj propheſie peter thorough couetouſnes fayned wordes ſhall make marchaūdiſe ij pet ij ſuch gloſes corrupt god word ſit conſciences y• people lead captiue make praye thē byeng ſellyng ſinnes ſatiſfy vnſatiable couetouſnes neuertheleſſe truth man hath treſpaſſed agaynſt god repēt knowledge treſpaſſe god promiſeth forgeueneſſe without eare ſhrift hath offended neighbour repente knowledge fault aſkyng forgeuenes neighbour forgeue god forgeueth alſo holy promiſe mat xviij likewiſe ſinneth openly openly rebuked repent turne congregation forgeue hym god forgeueth ſo forth ſoeuer repenteth rebuked knowledgeth fault forgeuē alſo doubteth hath hys conſciences tangled ought open minde vnto ſome faythfull brother learned ſhall geue hym faythful councell helpe withall man treſpaſſeth vnto ought confeſſe confeſſe man offendeth 〈◊〉 muſt hee confeſſe ſelfe vnto thee antichriſt haue offended bounde old law confeſſion eare neither apoſtles folowed many hundred yeares knew ſuch whiſperyng wherby attritiō turned vnto contrition yea whiche chriſt came looſe bound thē iewes yea bounde without scripture chriſt came make v bounde looſe v make thouſand thynges ſinne ſinne become ſinne agayne left none law v law loue looſed v frō moyſes bynde v vnto antichriſtes eare god tyed chriſt vnto antichriſtes eare neither hath poured mercy thether hath recorde old teſtament antichriſtes eare ſhould propiciatorium witte god hath recorde 〈◊〉 y• scripture god ſhuld crepe hyde 〈◊〉 antichriſtes eare mercy ſtole god ſhould crepe ſo narow hole ſo hee could el founde neither dyd god write lawes neither yet hys holy promiſes antichriſtes eare hath graued holy ſpirite harte beleue might haue alwayes ready hand ſaued therby ¶ satiſfaction pertainyng vnto ſatiſfactiō wiſe vnderſtād loueth god hath commaundement iohn ſayth fourth chap firſt epiſtle loue neighbour alſo thou haue offended thou muſt make amendes ſatiſfactiō leſt way thou able aſke forgeuenes haue mercy god bound forgeue thee yet god forgeueth thee thou thus ſubmit thy ſelfe vnto godward chriſt perpetuall chriſt 〈◊〉 euerlaſtyng ſatiſfaction euerlaſtyng ſatiſfaction euermore oft thou falleſt frailtie repent come agayne thou art ſafe welcome yu mayſt ſee ye ſimilitude riotous ſonne luke xv thou lopen ſanctuary come agayne thou fallen way truth come thereto agayne thou art ſafe thou gone aſtray come ye folde againe ſhepheard chriſt ſhall ſaue thee yea aungels heauen ſhal reioyce thy commyng ſo farre mā ſhal beate thee chide thee phariſey enuye thee grudge thee rayle vpon thee thy father ſhall make aunſwere thee thou ſeiſt fore rehearſed likenes parable ſoeuer therfore gone way whatſoeuer vnknowen toung ſhall vnlearned ſay amen vnto thy thankes geuing wotteth yu ſayſt likewiſe lay wotteth whether thou looſe bynde whether thou bleſſe curſe like maner lay vnderſtād latine though prieſt abſolue engliſh hys abſolution rehearſeth promiſe god ſpeaketh owne wordes ſaying authoritie peter paul abſolue looſe thee thy ſinnes thou ſayſt ſo art lying man neuer verely thou ſayſt forgeue thee thy ſinnes scripture iohn firſt chriſt onely forgeueth taketh away ye ſinnes world paul peter apoſtles preache forgeuen chriſt chriſts ſake god word onely looſeth thou preachyng mighteſt looſe alſo el ¶ ſoeuer hath eares let heare let hath eye ſee man loue blinde blindnes owne head mine byndyng looſing pope authoritie power alledge thē ſelues ſaying chriſt peter math xvj whatſoeuer thou byndeſt earth ſhalbe boūde ſoeuer thou looſeth ſo forth lo ſay ſoeuer bynde ſoeuer looſe nothing excepted text lay chriſt ye laſt mathew power geuen ſayth chriſt heauen earth go therfore preach c preachyng leaueth pope chalengeth power ouer man onely ouer god alſo pope ſayth loe power geuen heauen earth thereupon taketh vpon temporall power aboue kyng emperour maketh lawes byndeth like power taketh ouer god lawes diſpenſeth luſt makyng ſinne whiche god maketh ſinne maketh ſinne god maketh none yea wypeth god lawes cleane maketh pleaſure lawful luſteth bindeth god looſeth looſeth god bindeth bleſſeth god curſeth curſeth god bleſſeth taketh authoritie alſo bynde looſe purgatorypurgatory pope creature may therfore bold permit vnto creature owne makyng alſo byndeth aungels read pope haue commaūded aungels fet diuers purgatory pope bindeth aungels howbeit yet certified whether obeyed vnderſtand therrfore bynde looſe preach lawe true byndyng looſing god goſpell promiſes thou mayſt ſee third chapter ſecond epiſtle corinthian paule calleth preaching law miniſtration death damnation preaching promiſes miniſtring ſpirite righteouſnes law preached men found ſinners therefore damned goſpell glad tydinges preached repent beleue founde righteous chriſt ſo expounde olde doctours hierome agaynſt biſhops prieſtes saint hierome ſayth vpon text whatſoeuer thou bindeſt biſhops prieſtes ſayth lacke vnderſtanding take litle preſumption phareſeis vpon thē thinke haue authoritie bynde innocentes looſe wicked thing pope byſhops doe ſay curſe feared curſe bee feared right wrōg though thou haue deſerued yet ye pope curſe thee thou art perill thy ſoule lie yea though neuer fo wrongfully curſed muſt fayne right maner looſing buy abſolution saint hierome ſayth ye prieſt olde law made leper cleane vncleane ſo byndeth vnbyndeth prieſt new law ☜ prieſt made man leper neither clenſed mā god prieſt iudged onely moyſes law cleane vncleane whē brought vnto hym haue law god iudge ſinne bounde moreouer man haue ſinned yet repent beleue promiſe ſure god word looſed forgeuen chriſt authoritie wiſe preach haue prieſts chriſtes apoſtles thē ſelues appeareth thoroughout new teſtamēt therfore manifeſt haue saint paule ſayth corinth xv chriſt vnderſtode texte power geuē heauen earth alſo vſed farre wiſe pope ſay thinges vnder chriſt excepted put vnder hym god father vnder chriſt aboue chriſt chriſtes head corinth vi chriſt ſayth iohn xij haue ſpoken myne owne head father ſent gaue commaundement ſhould ſay ſhould ſpeake ſoeuer ſpeake ☜ therefore euen father bad ſo ſpeake chriſt law ſhould doe happeneth pope ſo runneth large lawleſſe though power geuen vnto chriſt heauen earth yet power ouer father yet raigne temporally ouer temporall prince commaundemēt obey hath pope thē ſuch temporall authoritie ouer king emperour hath authoritie aboue god lawes cōmaunde angel ſaintes god himſelfe chriſtes authoritie gaue authoritie chriſt gaue hys apoſtles diſciples preach lawe bring ſinners repentaunce preach vnto promiſes father made vnto men ſake ſame preach onely ſent apoſtles right byndyng looſyng kyng ſendeth forth iudges geueth authoritie ſaying ye doe doe geue full power yet meaneth full power ſhould deſtroy towne citie oppreſſe mā doe liſt ſhould raigne ouer lordes duke realme ouer hys owne ſelfe geueth lawe authoritie bynde looſe farforth law ſtretcheth maketh mention puniſhe euill doe wrong auenge ye poore ſuffer wrong ſo farre law ſtretcheth king defend iudge agaynſt men tēporall iudges binde looſe temporally ſo doe priſtes ſpiritually wayes falſhod pope reigneth vnder chriſt ſubtiltie pope reigneth vnder chriſt cardinal byſhops vnder kinges lawleſſe pope ſay abſolueth looſeth poena et culpa poena et culia proper brea •… faulte treſpaſſe payne due vnto treſpaſſe god man repent forgeueth offence onely paine alſo ſay ſaue turneth euerlaſting payne vnto temporall payne appointeth ſeuē yeares purgatory euery deadly ſinne pope money forgeueth pope mightie mercifull money thē god death onely ſonne hath power thē god mercifull thē god doe ſaith pope full power ye treaſure church deſeruinges martyr cōfeſſours mērites chriſt firſt merites saintes ſaue themſelues ſaued chriſtes merites onely merites ſaintes secondarily god hath promiſed chriſtes merites vnto repent ſo whoſoeuer repenteth immediatly merites chriſt heire chriſtes merites beloued god chriſt thē came foule monſter lord ouer pope ſelleth god geueth frely chriſtes merites ſo hath power ſell god geueth freely dreamer yea deuils venimous ſcorpians poyſon haue ye tayles peſtilēt leauen ſo turneth ſweete bread chriſtes doctrine bitterneſſe gall frier runne ſame ſpirite fryer teach ſaying good deedes redeeme paine y• abide purgatory yea geue v ſomewhat doe good workes heires goodnes god good workes worke god tyll hys ſonnes know hys wyll haue hys ſpirite teach v saint paule ſayth yt fyft chapter hys epiſtle epheſians chriſt clenſed congregation fountayne water thorough worde peter ſaith firſt firſt epiſtle ye borne anew mortall ſeede immortall ſeede worde god liueth laſteth euer paule euery epiſtle warneth v put truſt workes beware perſwaſions argument man wiſdome ſuperſtitiouſnes ceremony pope holynes maner diſguiſing exhorteth v cleaue faſt vnto naked pure ☜ worde god promiſe god anker ſaueth v tēptations y• world againſt v god word ſtronger ye world world kill v ſhall make v aliue agayne poſſible worlde caſt v hell thence yet ſhall god worde bring v agayne herby ſeeſt thou workes neuer ſo glorious iuſtifie worke promiſe iuſtifieth v thorough fayth promiſe fayth therefore iuſtifiyng though neuer ſo glorious workes sacrament chriſtes body wiſe preach thou muſt thing leaue ou • promiſes beleue bread body chriſt fleſh bloud bone euen went earth ſaue coate yet wot many place pray thee helpeth promiſe deuils know chriſt dyed fryday iewes alſo holpe thereby haue promiſe chriſt body bloud ſuffered ſacrifice raunſome full ſatiſfaction ſinnes god ſake wyll thinke haue power repent beleue holy worke men thinke god reioyceth deede ſelfe without reſpecte thinke alſo god cruell tyrant reioyceth hath delectation payne takyng without reſpect therefore many martyr themſelues wythout cauſe enſample baal prieſtes iij reg xviij cut themſelues pleaſe theyr god olde heathen pagan ſacrificed child fyre vnto god monkes charterhouſe thinke y• eating fiſhe ſelfe pleaſeth god referre eating vnto chaſtening body haue ſlayne bodyes wyth colde fleme fiſheating yet eate fleſhe ſley themſelues dayes alſo offer ſonnes daughter compell perſwade vowe profeſſe chaſtitie thinke y• payne rage burning ſuffer abſteining make pleaſeth god ſo referre chaſtitie vnto neighbour profet ſee thouſandes fall innumerable diſeaſes therby die dayes yea though ſee thē breake commaundementes god dayly alſo impatiency worke abhominations againſt nature ſhamefull ſpoken yet wyll let marry compell continue ſtill wyth violence thus teach deuines appereth argumentes taketh moſt payne ſay greateſt ſo forth people throughly brought beliefe deede ſelfe without reſpect ſaueth ſo long church ſay ſo many pater noſters reade ſo much toung whtch vnderſtand goe ſo much pilgrimage take ſo much payne faſt ſuch ſuperſtitious faſt obſerue ſuch ſuperſtitious obſeruaūce neither profitable himſelfe hys neyghbour done good entent onely ſay pleaſe god withall ye kiſſe paxe thinke meritorious deede loue neyghbour forgeue hym thyng ſignified thereby ſtudie doe haue power doe thinke bounde doe offended hym fore haue falſe prophet brought y• people wittes haue wrapped thē darcknes haue rocked ſleepe blyndnes ignorauncy ſuch doctrine falſe doctrine ſuch fayth falſe fayth deede pleaſeth farre forth deede acceptable god farre forth applyed vnto neyghbours profet taming bodyes keepe commaundement muſt body tame onely wyth remedy god hath ordeined kylled thou muſt forſwere naturall remedy god hath ordeined bryng thy ſelfe ſuch caſe thou ſhouldeſt eyther breake god commaundement kyll thy ſelfe burne nyght day wythout reſt ſo thou cāſt thinke godly thought neyther lawfull forſake thy neyghbour withdraw thy ſelfe ſeruing get thee den lyue idlely profitable man robbing men firſt fayth goodes land hath wyth makyng hym beleue hypocriſy thy ſuperſtitious prayer popeholy deedes prayer fayth ye deedes thereof ſpring loue accepted god prayer good according proportion prayer acceptable according fayth ou • deedes according meaſure loue fayth deede according meaſure loue bideth world monkes call hath fayth cloyſterer hangeth god thynges muſt truſt god ſende hym good ſpeede good lucke fauour helpe good mayſter good neyghbour good ſeruaunt good wyfe good chapman marchaunt ſend hys marchaundice ſafe land thouſand like loueth alſo appeareth hee doth ſeruice alwayes vnto neighbour pray one equally boūd pray thyng may alwayes doe ſo euer haue hand may man hyre chriſtes bloud hath hyred v ready thus deede deliteth god farforth either ſerue neighbour haue ſayd tame fleſh may fulfill commaundement bottome hart payne takyng god reioyſeth therin tyraunt pitieth v morneth v alway ready hand helpe v call mercyfull father kynd mother neuer later hee ſuffereth v fall many temptation much aduerſitie yea ſelfe layeth croſſe tribulatiō backes reioyſeth ſorrow driue ſinne y• fleſh none otherwiſe cured phiſition surgion many thinges paynefull ſicke reioyſe paynes poore wretch perſecute driue diſeaſes otherwiſe healed people beleue therfore doe ſo much woorke ſuffer ſo much payne go ſo much pilgrimage ſafe falſe fayth chriſten man ſaued woorkes fayth promiſes good woorkes though woorkes worke god commaūdement good wil workes imagination declare ſafe ſpirite hath made v ſafe v yea god preachyng fayth doth purge iuſtifie hart euen ſo thorough workyng deedes doth purge iuſtifie member makyng v perfect body ſoule lykeneſſe chriſt neither nedeth chriſten man chriſtē mā nedeth go pilgrimage ſaued therby runne hether thether rome hieruſalem iames pilgrimage farre nere ſaued thereby purchaſe forgeuenes ſinnes chriſten mās health ſaluation euen saluation v mouth rom x word nye thee euen thy mouth thyne hart word faith preach ſayth paul beleue promiſes harte confeſſe mouthes ſafe health v ſhall beleue heare ſhal heare without preacher ſayth paul rom x looke promiſes god ſo preacher domme preach ſo ſauſe thē leuen thē ſtomacke brooke finde ſauor paynte v ſuch eare confeſſion confeſſion impoſſible kept impoſſible ſhould ſtand promiſes teſtament god ioyne penaunce call faſt go pilgrimage geue ſo much make ſatiſfaction preach maſſes merites pardon ceremony put promiſe cleane poſſeſſion word health ſaluation nye thee thy mouth thyne hart ſayth paul nay ſay thy ſaluation ☞ faythfull eare hold thereby know ſecretes thereby mocke men men wiues beguile knight squier lord kyng betray realmes byſhops byſhops worke treaſon thorough confeſſion pope haue certaine conſpiration ſecret treaſon agaynſt whole world confeſſion know king emperours thinke ought agaynſt neuer ſo euill moue captiues warre fight geue pardon ſlay haue taken way haue falſehode taken kynges emperours right duty whiche call freedomes liberty priuileges haue peruerted ordinaunces god left world haue made euery kyng ſweare defend falſehode kynges ſworne biſhops byſhops vnto kynges againſt ſelues man preach god worde truly ſhew fredome libertie ſoule whiche haue chriſt entende reſtore kynges agayne vnto duty right rowme authoritie haue god ſhadowes make thē kynges deede put world order agayne kynges deliuer ſwordes authoritie vnto hypocrite • lay dronken wine whore ¶ text foloweth paule wil happely lay charge others ſhall preach except ſhall preach except ſent expounded ſent ſayth paul ſayd x romaine wil ſay pope cardinal byſhoppes authority scripture perteineth vnto v poſſeſſion haue law ſoeuer preſume preach without authoritie biſhops excommunicate deede doyng whence therefore haſt thou thine authoritie wil ſay old phariſeis scripture captiuitie likewiſe aſked chriſt authoritie doeſt thou theſe thynges ſhould ſay phariſeis thou art none order haſt authoritie v chriſt aſked queſtion ſo hypocrite ſēt god howe know ſent god nay hee ſent god ſpeaketh god word iohn iij ſpeake ye god worde thyng ſaue lawes made cleane contrary vnto god worde chriſtes apoſtles preached chriſt ſelues truth preacheth truth ye preach nothyng lye therefore deuill father lye hym ye ſent mine authoritie ſent report vnto workes chriſt iohn v x god word beare recorde ſay truth ſhould man doubt god father truth lyght hath ſent father lye darknes hath ſent ſpirite truth light ſpirite lye darkenes meanes thou wilt euery man preacher ſay nay verely god man may preach called ſent god ☜ therfore would euery man london mayre london euery man realme kyng therof god author diſſention ſtrife vnitie peace good order therefore congregation gathered together chriſt one choſen rule paul hee onely preach el mā openly euery thing god ſaue hath promiſed farre hath promiſed ſo farre bodū beleue haue ſayth without god promiſe idolatrie fayth therefore truſt thing god hath promiſed plaine idolatry worſhipping thyne imagination ſtede god let v ſee pith ceremony two iudge reſt coniuring holy water pray whoſoeuer ſprinckled therewith may receaue health well body ſoule likewiſe makyng holy bread ſo forth holy water wyth eating holy bread mercifull forgeueth wrong becommeth one enemy patient leſſe couetous ſo forth ſure token ſoule health preach alſo wagging byſhops hand ouer v bleſſeth vsthe byſhops paul ſaith ephe j ſinnes full done away chriſt remayneth done away ſuch phantaſies apoſtles knew wayes put away ſin bleſſe v preaching chriſt paule ſayth gal ijhow apoſtles bleſſed v righteouſnes come law chriſt dyed vayne diſpute bleſſing come wagging byſhops hand dyed chriſt vayne death bleſſeth v little afore ſayth paule ſeeke iuſtified chriſt yet found ſinners ſo muſt iuſtified law ceremony chriſt miniſter ſinne diſpute ſeeke bleſſed chriſt yet vnbleſſed muſt bleſſed wagging byſhoppes hand haue chriſt curſe thou wilt ſay come firſt fayth chriſt forgeueth v bleſſeth v ſinnes afterward commit forgeuen v ſuch thinges aunſwere repentāce ſure fayth chriſt purgeth ſinnesif man repent truely come fayth put hys truſt chriſt thē oft ſinneth frayltie ſygh hart ſinne put away chriſtes bloud chriſtes bloud purgeth euer bleſſeth euer iohn ſayth ſecond firſt epiſtle write vnto ye ſinne though man ſinne meaning frailtie ſo repent yet haue aduocate father ieſus chriſt righteous obteineth grace ſinnes heb vij written man meaning chriſt becauſe laſteth abideth euer hath euerlaſting prieſthod therefore able alſo euer ſaue thē come god hym ſeing euer liueth make interceſſion v byſhops therefore ought bleſſe v preaching chriſt deceaue v bring curſe god vpon v wyth wagging handes ouer v preache dutie onely offer feete bee kiſſed teſticles ſtones groped feele alſo experience pope byſhoppes cardinal bleſſing otherwiſe diſpoſed ſoules let ſufficient concerning ſacramentes ceremony proteſtation author proteſtation cā ſay better improue god word man ſhall better content therewith ſeeke nothing truth walke light ſubmit therefore worke haue made ſhall make god ſhall make vnto iudgements furiouſly burne truth ready god worde correct thing ſayde amiſſe god worde talke worde two confeſſion robbeth sacrament maketh thē fruteleſſe worldly wiſdome make ende matter ſacramentes iuſtifie ſay vnderſtand iuſtifiyng forgeuenes ſinnes wrong vnto ſacraments much robbe moſt part confeſſion effect cauſe wherfore ordeined man may receaue body chriſt mā may marry man may oyled aneiled call man may receaue order except fyrſt ſhriuen ſinnes forgeuen ſhrift afore hand nought god alſo giftes grace working ſpirite v loue kyndnes patience obedience mercifulnes deſpiſing worldly thynges howe knowe iuſtifieth bringeth grace peace concorde ſuch like thou haſt heard ſo many maſſes matens euenſonges thou haſt receaued holy bread holy water byſhops bleſſing cardinal pope thou wilt kinde thy neighbour loue better thou obediēt vnto thy ſuperiors mercifull ready forgeue wrong done vnto thee deſpiſeſt world thyrſt ſpirituall thynges prieſt hath taken order leſſe couetous wife ſo many oft pilgrimage chaſt obedient vnto huſband kynde maydes ſeruauntes gentleman knightes lordes kinges emperours haue ſayd ſo often dayly ſeruice wyth chappellaynes know chaplayns quoth hee god geue grace chaplayns laſt make ſo mad ſay ſeruice alone chriſt better ſkill rule tenauntes ſubiectes realmes chriſtenly content duty ſuch thinges encreaſe grace lie whether ſo report experience haue enterpretations iuſtifiyng grace pray teach would gladly learne let v goe purpoſe agayne ¶ miracle worſhipping saintes antichriſt ſhal come lying ſignes diſguiſed wyth falſhod alſo wyth lying miracle true miracle draw chriſt wonder ſaith paule ſaid place ij theſſ ij true miracle god ſhewed aboue rehearſed moue v heare god word ſtabliſhe fayth therin confirme truth god promiſes might without doubting beleue thē god worde thorough fayth bringeth ſpirite harte alſo life chriſt ſayth iohn vi wordes ſpeake ſpirite lyfe worde alſo purgeth v clenſeth v chriſt ſayth iohn xv ye cleane meanes word paul ſayth timo ij one god one mediatour ſay aduocate interceſſor atonemaker betwene god man man chriſt ieſus gaue ſelfe raunſon men peter ſayth chriſt actes iiij neither health neither yet alſo name geuen vnto men wherin muſt ſaued chriſt peace redemption raunſom ſinnes righteouſnes ſatiſfactiō promiſes god yea amen ij cor yt great infinite loue whiche god hath v chriſt loue agayn loue alſo lawes loue one deedes whiche effect force good deedes hence forth doe make ſatiſfaction obteine heauen ſuccour neighbour tame yt fleſh may waxe perfect ſtrong men chriſt thankefull god againe mercy glorifie name contrarywiſe miracle antichriſt falſe miracle driue chriſt done pull thee worde god beleuyng promiſes chriſt put thy truſt man ceremonie wherin god word ſoone god woorde beleued fayth ſpread abroad ſeaſe miracle god miracle antichriſt becauſe wrought deuil quench fayth grow dayly neither ſhall ceaſe vntill worldes end among beloue god worde promiſes seeſt thou god looſed ſent forth deuils old world among heathen gētiles deuils wrought miracle ſpake euery image euen ſo ſhal deuill woorke falſhode one craft vntill worldes end amōg beleue god word iudgement damnation hym hath luſt heare truth heare lye ſtabliſhed grounded therein falſe miracle ſee worthy blind biddeth ſpirite god go worthy without paul peter true apoſtles preached chriſt onely miracle confirme ſtabliſh preachyng thoſe euerlaſtyng promiſes eternall teſtament god made betwene man hym chriſtes bloud miracle dyd teſtifie alſo true ſeruauntes chriſt paul preached ſelfe taught mā truſt holynes peter ceremonie promiſes god hath ſworne onely yea mightyly reſiſteth ſuche falſe doctrine corinthian galathians epheſiās euery teacheth truſt ſaint falſe prophet true true nothyng truer paul preached ſelf taught mā beleue holynes prayer thyng ſaue promiſes god hath made ſworne geue v worlde ſtyuch filthines therto ſoeuer fayth ſinne rom xiiij fayth commeth hearyng god woorde rom x thou faſteſt doeſt thyng worſhip saint beleuyng come fauour god bee ſaued thereby thou haue god worde
