deſeruynges ſelues ſay per chriſt 〈◊〉 dominū nostrum chriſt lordes ſake ſay ſaue v good lord thorough ſaintes merites chriſtes ſake ſaue v saintes merites chriſtes ſake hys deſeruyng merites loue take example gentleman ſayth vnto vttemoſt power thee loue whiche owe vnto thy father though thou haſt neuer done pleaſure yet loue thy father well thy father frend hath deſerued doe thee c teſtament promiſe made vnto loue father onely come ſayd gentleman name one ſeruauntes whiche neuer ſaw neuer ſpake neither haue acquaintaunce ſay syr pray good maſter vnto ſuch cauſe haue deſerued ſhould ſo neuertheleſſe pray doe ſuch ſeruauntes ſake yea pray loue owe father doe ſuch ſeruauntes ſake wiſe made petition would mē thinke come late patrikes god y• father fulfilleth promiſes v chriſtes ſake merites ſaintes y• papiſtes taught purgatory left wittes behinde teſtamēt promiſes made vnto v chriſt deſire god fulfill hys promiſes saintes ſake yea chriſtes ſake saintes ſake haue alſo martyr neuer preached god worde neither dyed therefore priuileges liberty ſuch martyr pope martyr god martyr ſignifieth witnes bearer god witnes teſtifieth worde falſely purchaſed contrary vnto god ordinaunces yea ſuch saintes though deade yet robbe faſt euer neither leſſe couetous aliue doubt make saint lord cardinall death v aliue know iuggling crafty conueiaunce ſhrine gloriouſly mightily defending right holy church except diligent leaue commemoration nimroth behind v reaſons wherewith proue doctrine fleſhly reaſons make y• worſhipping saintes ſolued paule calleth entiſing wordes man wiſdome witte ſophiſtry brauling argumentes men corrupt mindes deſtitute truth whoſe god bellye vnto idole whoſoeuer offereth ſame heretike worthy brunt saint great wyth god aliue appeareth myracles god ſhewed muſt therfore great ſay rea • ō appeareth wiſdome foliſhnes wyth god myracle ſhewed thou ſhould put thy truſt saint worde ſaint preached worde thou beleueſt would ſaue thee god hath promyſed ſworne would make thee alſo great wyth god dyd ye saint mā haue matter wyth great man kyng muſt goe fyrſt vnto one hys meane ſeruauntes thē hyer hyer till come kyng entiſing argumēt blinde reaſon man witte like kingdome worlde like wyth kynges god kingdome god chriſt kynges moſt part haue none acquaintaunce neither promiſe alſo moſt cōmonly mercileſſe moreouer promiſe yet mē vnconſtant people vntrue god haue beliefe accompted haue open way vnto hym dore chriſt neuer ſhutte vnbeliefe neither porter keepe man ſaith paul ephe ij ſay chriſt haue open way vnto father ye ſtraungers forreiners ſayth citizen wyth saintes houſholde god god hath alſo made v promiſes hath ſworne yea hath made teſtament couenaunt hath bounde hymſelfe hath ſealed obligation wyth chriſtes bloud confirmed wyth miracle alſo mercifull kinde cōplayneth wyll come vnto hym mighty able performe promiſeth true true god therefore lyke kyng god ſinners ſay god wyll heare v beholde flee god tyraunt mercileſſe mā counteth moſt mercifull vnto hym ſoneſt flyeth theſe teacher dare come god ye childrē caine saintes loue whome god hateth god saint deuided thou prayeſt ye ſaintes doe know except god thou counteſt mercileſſe tell god ſo cruell ſo hateth thee likely wyll tell saintes thou prayeſt vnto ſay ſinners anſwere chriſt ſinner ſaue chriſt ſinner ſatiſfaction offering ſynne take imaginatiō hundred place onely god commaundeth ſeemeth good righteous hys ſight owne ſight nothing bringeth wrath god ſo ſone ſo ſore man idolatry owne imagination laſt theſe argument contrary conſcience law hath hurt goſpell life mercy forge • ene frely together healing plaiſter peter doth hurt make woūde none euē ſo doth law thinke holy righteous full good deedes y• law preached right righteouſnes good dedes vaniſh away ſmoke winde left damnable ſinners onely thou ſeeſt chriſt healeth till peter woūded healyng plaiſter helpeth till y• corroſie hath troubled wounde euē ſo goſpell helpeth whē law hath woūded ye conſcience brought ſinner ye knowledge ſinne allegory proueth nothyng neither cā scripture allegory proue nothyng exāple ſimilitude borowed scripture declare text concluſion scripture expreſly roote graue hart ſimilitude example doth printe thing much deper wittes man doth plaine ſpeakyng leaueth behynd ſtinge pricke forward awake moreouer could proue open text thou c • proue allegory open text falſe doctrine allegory doth expreſſe allegory thyng bee geſted greater value tale robyn hode allegory touching firſt part proued paul ye iij chap epiſtle romanes ſayth law cauſeth wrath ye vij chapter romanes law commaundement came ſinne reuiued become dead ij epiſtle cor third chap law called miniſter death dānation c concernyng ſecond part paul ſayth rom v chap iuſtified faith peace god ij epiſtle corinthiās iij goſpell called miniſtratiō iuſtifying ſpirite gala iiij ſpirite cōmeth preaching litterall ſenſe proueth allegory faith c doth litterall ſence proue allegory beare foundatiō beareth houſe becauſe allegory proue nothyng therfore vſed ſoberly ſeldome onely text offereth thee allegory maner aboue haue done doth paul borow ſimilitude yea thou ſhalt fynde inough preach chriſt proue ſoeuer poynte thee fayth thou wilt well fabell ouide poet poetry good diuinitie scripture ſchole men iohns goſpell paules epiſtles yea come vnto ſuch blyndnes onely ſay litterall ſence profiteth alſo hurtful noyſome killeth ſoule damnable doctrine litterall ſenſe killeth ſay ſophiſters proue text paule ij corinth iij ſayth letter killeth ſpirit geueth life lo ſay litterall ſence killeth ſpirituall ſence geueth life muſt therfore ſay ſeeke ſome choplogicall ſence learne ſophiſtrie blind thou mayeſt abhorre ſpue thy ſtomake euer paule letter meaneth moyſes law proceſſe text folowyng declareth bright ſunne guiſe looke order text find doctours ſo alledge ſo vnderſtād paule maketh compariſō betwene letter killeth expound law goſpell iuſtifying whē chriſt preached promiſes whiche god hath made chriſt beleued ſpirit entereth hart looſeth hart geueth luſt law maketh law liuely thyng hart ſoone hart luſteth loue law righteouſnes law righteous god ſinnes forgeuen neuertheleſſe law letter graued ſtone harte ſo glorious moyſes face ſhone ſo bryght child iſraell could behold face brightnes alſo geuen thunder lightning terrible ſignes ſo feare came moſes deſired would ſpeake let god ſpeake leſt dye ſayd heare thou mayſt ſee exod xx wherupon paule maketh compariſon ſaying miniſtratiō death thorough letter figured ſtones glorious ſo childrē iſraell could behold face moſes glory countenaunce ſhal adminiſtration ſpirite glorious agayne adminiſtration damnation glorious much ſhall adminiſtration righteouſnes excede glory law killeth ſinners helpeth thē glorious goſpel pardoneth ſinners geueth power ſonnes god ouer come ſinne much glorious text goeth cleare holy apoſtle paule ſayth ye corinthian epiſtle vnderſtand read ſtone preache bringeth ſpirite lyfe vnto breſtes ſpirite writeth graueth law loue harte geueth luſt god furthermore ſayth ablenes cō meth god hath made v able miniſter new teſtamēt letter yt ſay law ſpirite letter ſay law killeth ſpirite geueth life ſay ſpirite god whiche entreth harte whē ye beleue glad tydinges preached chriſte quickeneth harte geueth life luſt maketh loue owne accorde without compulſiō law compelled dāned becauſe ye could doe loue luſt naturally thus ſeeſt thou letter ſignifieth litterall ſence ſpirite ſpirituall ſence rom ij paul vſeth terme littera law rom vij ſetteth thou tell thyng done farre land tell contrarie wote beleue fayth wrought goddes word maketh ſur • fayth god lye power god god word preached ſpirite entereth thyne hart maketh thy ſoule feele maketh vncircumciſion nothyng kepyng cō maundementes together looke wherein thou canſt beſt kepe commaundemētes thether get thy ſelfe therin abyde whether thou widow wife mayde haſt thou god haue infirmity hath promiſed ſlake thine honger without meate aſke god hath promiſed commeth falſe faith playne idolatry deſire miracle naturall remedy temptyng god payne takyng wiſe vnderſtand taketh payne kepe commaundementes god ſure therby loueth god hee hath god ſpirite hym 〈…〉 paine man taketh meane paciently without grudgyng loueth god perfecter hee nearer vnto health y• ſoules chriſten mē long purged infirmitie ſinne remaineth fleſh loke reward promotion heauen life come god hath promiſed chriſtes ſake chriſt hath deſerued v payne takyng abhominable ſight god chriſte onely hath purchaſed reward payne takyng keepe commaundemētes doth purge ſinne remayneth fleſhe certifie v choſen ſealed god ſpirite vnto reward yt chriſt hath purchaſed v creatyng doctours diuinitie opponēt brought ſame reaſon proue widow merite virgine becauſe ſhe greater payne much ſhe proued pleaſures matrimony ego nego domine doctor ſaid reſpōdent though virgine haue proued yet ſhe imagineth pleaſure greater deede therfore moued hath greater temptation greater paine theſe diſputers paule ſpeaketh ſixt chapter firſt epiſtle timot content wholeſome woordes lord ieſus chriſt doctrine godlineſſe therefore v god ſhut ſhall open natural reaſon come knowledge god hath hyd vnto ſelfe yet let v ſee one reaſons wherewith proue chief reaſon euery mā doth mother ſay like maner muſt chriſt mother therefore hath ſhe preheminence body heauen yet chriſt xij chapter math knoweth mother farrefoorth ſhe kept father commaundementes paule ij epiſtle corinthian v chap knoweth chriſt himſelfe fleſhly worldly purpoſe laſt god free bounde bindeth ſelfe hee haue made promiſe bounde finally thou ſet aboue rehearſed chapter math thee chriſte woulde know mother ij iohn rebuked ij luke ſhe loſt negligent ſhe leaue behinde ieruſalem vnwars go dayes iorney ere ſhe ſought hym y• mighteſt reſolue many reaſons make matter ſhe without originall ſinne read alſo eraſmus annotation ſayd place cō mit ſuch matter vnto thoſe idle belyes haue nought el doe moue ſuch queſtions geue free libertie holde lyſt long hurteth faith whether bee ſo exhortyng yet paule pleaſe god obtayne ſaluation chriſte geue hede vnto vnneceſſary braulyng diſputations labour knowledge thoſe thinges without ſaued remember ſunne geuen v guide v way woorkes bodyly thou leaue naturall vſe ſunne looke directly hym ſee howe bright ſuch like curioſitie wil ſunne blind thee scripture geuen v guide v way woorkes ghoſtly way chriſt promiſes hym ſaluation long ſhall leaue right vſe turne ſelues vnto vayne queſtions ſearche vnſearchable expounde ☜ ſcriptures drawing thē vnto worldly purpoſe cleane contrary vnto example lyuyng practiſyng chriſt hys apoſtles expoundyng scripture muſt haue reſpect vnto liuyng practiſing chriſt apoſtles prophetes holy prophetes ſayth peter ij pet propheſie scripture hath priuate interpretation scripture▪ came man holy men god ſpake moued holy ghoſt place scripture may haue priuate expoſition may expounde man wil fleſh drawen vnto worldly purpoſe cōtrary vnto open textes generall article faith whole courſe scripture contrary liuyng practiſing chriſt apoſtles holy prophetes came mā ſo may bee drawen expounde man came holy ghoſt ſo muſt expoūd vnderſtād holy ghoſt scripture wherewith god draweth v vnto hym wherewith ſhould leade scripture ſpring god flow vnto chriſt geuen leade v chriſt thou muſt therfore go alōg ſcripture geuen leade v vnto chriſt scripture lyne vntill thou come chriſt ye wayes end reſtyng place mā therfore vſe scripture draw thee frō chriſt noſell thee thyng ſaue chriſt ſame falſe prophet thou mayſt perceaue peter meaneth foloweth y• text falſe prophetes among people whoſe propheſies ☞ bely wiſedome ſhalbe falſe teacher among ſhall priuely bryng damnable ſectes thou ſeeſt howe diuided settes order monſtrous ſectes order religion euen denying lord hath bought euery one taketh hym ſell thee money whiche god chriſt promiſeth thee freely many ſhall folow damnable wayes waye trouth ſhalbe euill ſpokē thou ſeeſt way trouth become hereſie ſeditious cauſe inſurrectiō breaking ye kyngs peace treaſon vnto hyghnes conetouſnes fayned wordes ſhal make marchaundiſe couetouſnes couetouſnes deſire honour ende falſe doctrine falſe prophet ſeke concluſion couetouſnes ambitiō ſay lucre deſire honor finall end falſe prophetes falſe teacher looke vpon pope falſe doctrine end thereof ſeeke thereby wherefore ſerueth purgatory purge thy purgatory purſe polle thee robbe thee thy hayres houſe lāds thou haſt may honour serue pardon pardon ſame purpoſe whereto perteineth praying saintes offer vnto praying ſaintes belies wherfore ſerueth confeſſion ſit thy conſcience confeſſion make thee feare tremble ſoeuer dreame thou worſhip god ſo forth tradition ceremony coniurations ſerue lord belies falſe expoundyng scripture drawyng contrary vnto example chriſt apoſtles holy prophetes vnto damnable couetouſnes filthy ambition take example math xvj peter ſayth example falſe expoūding y• ſcriptures chriſt thou art ſonne liuyng god chriſt aunſwered thou art peter vpō rocke build congregation rocke interpret peter thē commeth pope wilbe peter ſucceſſour whether peter yea whether god though scripture ſay nay ſuch ſucceſſiō ſaith loe rocke foundation head chriſtes church ſayth scripture chriſt • ayth god word rocke chriſt fayth god word chriſt ſayth math vij heareth wordes doth rocke pope therafter like man buildeth rocke houſe build god woorde ſtand though heauen ſhould fall iohn xv chriſt wine braunches ſo chriſt rocke ſtocke foū dation wheron built paul cor iij calleth chriſt foundatiō whether peter paule hee calleth ſeruauntes preach chriſt build v hym therfore pope peter ſucceſſour dutie preach chriſt onely auctority peter ſucceſſour • preach authoritie hath none ij xj paule marieth v vnto chriſt driueth v truſt confidence man epht ij ſayth paule ye build foundation apoſtles prophetes y• word preached chriſt beyng ſayth head corner ſtone euery buildyng coupled together groweth vp holy temple lord alſo ye built together made habitatiō god ſpirit peter y• ij firſt epiſtle buildeth v chriſt contrary pope whiche buildeth hymſelfe hell gate ſhall preuaile agaynſt ſay agaynſt congregation builde vppon chriſtes ſayth vpon god word pope rocke hell gate could preuayle agaynſt houſe could ſtand rocke foundation wheron builte periſh contrary ſee pope hell gate haue preuayled agaynſt many hūdred yeares haue ſwalowed vp god word true ſtoryes written yea true ſee eye geue thee keyes heauen ſayth chriſt geue iohn xx yt reſurrecciō payed 〈◊〉 gaue y• keyes indifferently ſoeuer thou byndeſt earth ſhalbe bounde heauen ſoeuer thou louſeſt earth ſhalbe louſed heauen text maketh pope expoundeth contrary scripture contrary expoſitiō falſe agaynſt th • • en ſcripture agaynſt th • practiſing chriſt hys apoſtles chriſtes practiſing apoſtles prophetes ſcripture geueth record himſelfe euer expoundeth thee alone heare thee thou haſt wonne thy brother heare thee thē take thee one two ſo forth ſtandeth text concludeth ſaying whatſoeuer ye bynde earth ſhalbe bound heauen ſoeuer ye louſe earth ſhalbe louſed heauē byndyng rebuke ſinne louſing forgeue repent iohn xx whoſe ſinnes ye forgeue forgeuen whoſe ſinnes ye hold holden paul cor v byndeth ij cor ij louſeth ſame maner alſo byndyng louſyng binding 〈◊〉 lowſing one power one power byndeth ſo louſeth yea byndeth firſt ere cā louſe louſe bound ſoeuer peter byndeth ſucceſſour wilbe called dead yt ſucceſſour sathan ſo vnderſtood peter pope hath power commaunde man deadly ſinne bee damned go • hell ſaying bee thou deadly ſinne thou damned go thou hell go thou purgatory expoſition contrary euerlaſtyng teſtament god hath made vnto v chriſt ſent ſonne chriſt louſe v ſinne damnation hell teſtifie vnto world ſent diſciples actes paule alſo hath power deſtroy edifie ij cor x xiij chriſt geue diſciples power agaynſt ſelfe againſt euerlaſtyng teſtament ſend preach ſaluation geue power damne luſt mercy profite haue chriſtes death goſpell pope paſſeth men wickedneſſe hath power ſende hell damne luſteth thē cauſe call ieſus ieſus ſignifieth y• ſay ſauiour might right call deſtroyer wherfore bynding vnderſtood chriſt interpreteth place aboue rehearſed bynding meaneth apoſtles practiſed nothyng rebuke men ſinnes preachyng law man muſt firſt ſinne agaynſte god law ere pope bynde hym yea man muſt firſte ſinne agaynſte god lawe ere hee neede feare pope curſe curſing binding one nothyng ſauing rebuke curſing meaneth mā ſinnes god law foloweth alſo louſyng like maner nothing forgeuing ſinne repent lowſing meaneth throughe preachyng promiſes whiche god hath made chriſte onely haue forgeuenes ſinnes chriſt interpreteth apoſtles prophetes practiſed falſe power pope taketh hym louſe god lawes geue man licence put awaye hys wife god hath bound bynde chaſtitie god commaūdeth mary wite thē burne liue chaſte alſo falſe power bynde whiche god worde maketh free makyng ſinne creature whiche god hath made man vſe pope ſo faſt lowſes ☜ purgeth purgatory louſinges purgation hath either louſe purge appe tites luſt rebellion v agaynſt law god yet purging right purgatory purge alyue purgeth thē dead apoſtles knew wayes purge preachyng god word worde onely purgeth hart thou mayſt ſee iohn xv ye pure ſayth chriſt word pope preacheth fayne lye purgatory doth v liue thē purgeth pope pope robyn goodfelow kynne robin good fellow ſwepeth houſe waſheth diſhes purgeth night day commeth nothyng found cleane man ſay pope byndeth binde ſelues aunſwere hee byndeth ſelfe pope leuer haue life ſoule ruled pope thē god pope word worde god foole leuer bonde free wiſe abyde freedome wherein chriſt hath ſet v alſo mad maketh deadly ſinne none ſeeketh cauſes hatred betwene god right wittes furthermore man cā bynde ſelfe hee hath power ouer ſelfe vnder ſelues performe noth • ng thē god •… geue v power power man bynde call rekening geue accomptes hath done pope law cōmaundeth ☜ ſaying though pope liue neuer ſo wickedly draw hym euill enſample innumerable thouſādes vnto hell yet ſee man preſume rebuke head ouer man ouer ſet thee gallates ij paule rebuketh peter openly ſee corinthiās alſo galathians haue ſuperiour god word hee could teach better god worde becauſe god woorde men iudge mentes rehearſed preachyng hys doynges vnto hygh apoſtles could improue nothyng therfore equall beſt frier ſay thē dutie whē preach fryer bound preach thē bound ſay ſeruice boūd ſay dutie preach bound set thou thee chriſtes bloud ſhedyng hath bounde v loue one withall might vttermoſt power one paul ſayth cor ix wo vnto preach yea wo vnto y• hath wherewith helpe neighbour make better thinke dutie preache chriſt vnto thinke dutie pray ye ſhould come knowledge chriſt therefore maruell though take ſo great labour yea ſo great wage alſo kepe ſtill darkenes crye furiouſly hold heretikes vnto wall reuoke burne without reaſon thē article condēned father set thou thee ſaying peter pet iij aſke ready geue aunſwere hope mekenes father iewes biſhops whiche great authoritie ouer haue ouer v condemned chriſt doctrine inough ſay father haue condē ned thē y• iewes beholdē excuſed yea yet right way falſe iewes bound loke scripture ſee whether father haue done right wrong likewiſe bound looke scripture whether father haue done right wrong ought beleue nothyng without reaſon scripture authoritie god word maner defend thy ſelfe agaynſt maner wickednes ſpirites armed alway god woorde ſtrong ſtedfaſt fayth thereunto without god word nothing word adde nothyng neither pull thyng ther • rō moyſes euery teacheth thee serue god ſpirite thy neighbour god ought ſerued outward ſeruice serue god hath appoynted thee thy good intent good zeale remember saul caſt awaye god euer good intent god requireth obediēce vnto woorde abhorreth good intentes good zeales without god word nothyng el playne idolatry woorſhyppyng falſe god remēber chriſt end chriſt reſt conſcience onely thyng onely reſtyng place peace ephe ij chap ſaluatiō name ſo peace name thou ſhalt neuer haue reſt thy ſoule neither ſhall y• worme conſcience euer ceaſe gnaw thyne hart till thou come chriſt till thou heare glad tydings god ſake hath forgeuen thee freely thou truſt thy workes reſt thou ſhalt thinke haue done inough haue done ſo great loue ſhould ſo glad doyng would receaue helpe neede haue left vndone ſuch like thou truſt confeſſiō ſhalt thou thinke haue told haue told circumſtances repent inough great ſorow repentaunce ſinnes pleaſure doyng likewiſe holy pardōs pilgrimage getteſt thou reſt thou ſeeſt god thē ſelues ſell pardon ſo good cheape ſome while geue thē freely glory ſake truſt therein ſelues build colledges make perpetuity prayed euer ladey• lyppes beadmen chaplaynes ſo many maſſes diriges ſo lōg ſeruice haue knowen ſome haue byd deuill take founder ſoules impaciencie werines ſo paynefull labour pertainyng good deedes therfore beſt thou canſt deſire good deedes truſt chriſt god geue ſtrength better dayly chriſt put thy truſt pardon promiſes god hath made thee ſake rocke build thine houſe dwell onely ſhalt thou ſure ſtormes tēpeſtes wyly aſſaultes wicked ſpirites ſtudy falſhead vndermyne v god mercy geue grace ſo vnto glory euer amen ¶ compendious rehearſall goeth haue deſcribed vnto obedience child ſeruauntes wine ſubiectes theſe iiij order god worde rule childrē ſeruauntes wyues ſubiectes god makyng ye rule thereof god word kepeth thē ſhalbe bleſſed yea bleſſed ready breaketh ſhalbe curſed perſon impaciency ſtubburne rebellious mynde withdraw hym ſelfe theſe get order let hym thinke thereby auoyde vengeaunce god obeying rule tradition man imaginatiō thou poulledſt thine head worſhip thy father breakeſt commaundementes ſhouldeſt y• ſo eſcape thou payntedſt thy maſters image wall ſtickedſt vp cādle ſhouldeſt thou therewith make ſatiſfaction breaking cōmaundementes thou wareſt blew coate worſhyp kyng brakeſt hys lawes ſhouldeſt thou ſo go quyte let man wife make ſelfe ſiſter charterhouſe aūſwere huſband byddeth hold peace brother kepe ſilence ſee whether ſhe ſhal ſo eſcape thou ſure god gelouſe ouer commaundementes man ouer hys man ouer wife becauſe blynd god hath appointed ye scripture ſhuld ſerue pleaſe perteynyng vnto owne perſon aboundātly • pleaſe god • beleue hys promiſes loue hys commaundementes pleaſed beleue promiſes holy teſtament hath made vnto v chriſt mercy • e ſhewed v loue commaundements bodyly ſeruice muſt done mā god ſtede muſt geue obedience honour tolle tribute cuſtome rent vnto whō belong thou haue ought beſtow geue vnto yt pore left chriſtes ſtede ſhew mercy kepe commaundements loue thē ſure fulfill law ſight god bleſſing ſhalbe euerlaſtyng life obey patiently without grudgyng euill prince oppreſſe v perſecute v kinde mercyfull mercyleſſe v doe worſt cā v ſo take fortune patiently kyſſe ſoeuer croſſe god layeth backes ſure keepe commaundementes loue declared god hath taken vengeaunce handes auēge vnright ſelfe either power officer whiche appointed thereto el negligent ſend curſes vppon trāſgreſſours deſtroy ſecret iudgementes ſhewed alſo whoſoeuer auengeth ſelfe auēge robbeth god honour damned deede falleth hādes temporall ſword becauſe taketh office god vppon robbeth god moſt high honour wil patiētly abide iudgement ſhewed authoritie prince god ſtede may reſiſted doe neuer ſo euill muſt reſerued vnto wrath god neuer latter commaunde euill muſt diſobey ſay otherwiſe cōmaū der god riſe agaynſt thē wil kil v thē ſayeſt thou therfore ſay chriſten called ſuffer euen bitter death hys hope ſake becauſe euill 〈◊〉 ſoeuer kyng 〈…〉 vnto th •… great gift god ſhewed alſo kynges ruler neuer ſo euill yet great gift goodnes god defende v thouſand thynges ſee proued alſo men without exception vnder temporall ſword ſoeuer name geue ſelues becauſe prieſt choſen lay men teach obedience lawfull cauſe diſobey becauſe preacheth lay mā ſhould ſteale therfore lawfull hym ſteale vnpuniſhed becauſe thou teacheſt may kill kyng muſt kill agayn therfore lawfull thee kil go free either whether rather mete thou whiche guide teache rightwaye ſhouldeſt walke therin prieſtes old law high biſhop aaron ſucceſſours though annointed god commaundement appoynted ſerue god temple exempte office miniſtering wordly matter yet neuertheleſſe vnder temporall ſword brake ye lawes chriſt ſayth peter take ye ſword ſhal periſh ſword none exception paul ſaith ſoules muſt obey none exception paule hym ſelfe exempt god ſayth gene ix ſoeuer ſheddeth man bloud man ſhall bloud ſhed agayn none exception moreouer chriſt became poore make men riche bound make free left alſo diſciples law loue loue pope hath law none ſprites may ſuerty ſeketh owne profite neighbour loue ſceketh fredome becommeth ſuretie bonde make neighbour fre dā ned therfore ſpiritualtie lawes god falſhead diſguiſed hipocriſie haue ſought ſo great profit ſo great rich ſo great authoritie ſo great liberty haue ſo bedgerd lay ſo brought ſubiectiō bondage ſo deſpiſed thē haue ſet vp frā chiſes townes village ſoeuer robbeth murthereth ſlayeth euen traytours vnto kynges perſon alſo proued alſo kyng hath power graūt ſuch libertie well damned geuyng falſe purchaſing god geueth father power ouer child euen ſo geueth hym commaundement execute ſuffer wickedly vnpuniſhed vnto damnation thou mayſt ſee hely hygh prieſt c maſter hath authoritie ouer ſeruauntes euen ſo hath commaundement gouerne huſband head ouer hys wife euen ſo hath commaundemēt rule appetite damned ſuffer whore miſſe liuer ſubmit ſelf make head euen lyke maner god maketh kyng head ouer kyng ſeruaunt execute lawes god realme euen ſo geueth cō maundement execute lawes vppon men indifferently law god kyngs king ſeruaunt execute law god rule owne imagination ſhewed alſo law kyng feared thinges geuēin fire thunder lightning terrible ſignes ſhewed cauſe ruler euill meanes might obtaine better ſhewed alſo wholeſome thoſe bitter medicine euill prince right chriſten men declared whiche god hath made gouerners worlde ought rule chriſtē ought remēber heades armes defend body miniſter peace health wealth euē ſaue body haue receaued office god miniſter ſeruice vnto brethrē kyng ſubiect maſter ſeruaunt name world chriſt chriſt one euen brother man chriſtes ſeruauntes bought chriſtes bloud therfore ought mā ſeke ſelfe owne profite chriſt chriſt man ruleth kyng ſubiectes maſter ſeruaunts ſerueth one hand doth handes vnto feete feete handes thou ſeeſt 1 cor xij alſo ſerue ſeruauntes vnto maſters bought chriſtes bloud ſerue chriſt hym ſelfe ſeruauntes vnto chriſt ſoeuer one chriſtes name vnto chriſt reward ſhall receaue chriſt kyng counteth farre kyng ought ſeeke common handes cōmōs chriſt himſelfe therfore doth thē ſeruice willingly ſeeking thē thē ſufficiēt mainteine peace vnitie defēde realme obey agayne willingly louingly vnto chriſt chriſt euery man ſeketh reward warned iudges take enſample miniſter office ſpiritualtie whiche bought ſolo sathā scripture whence haue authoritie let ſecret abyde ſecret till god open iudge ſecretes cruell thyng breake note 4 vp man hart compell put either ſoule body ieopardy ſhame ſelfe peter great piller feare death forſoke hys maſter ought ſpare weake conſciences declared kyng ought ridde realme wily tyrā ny hypocrite bryng hypocrite vnder lawes yea ought learned heare looke vpon cauſes ſelfe wil puniſh beleue hypocrite geue ſword kill kyng ought count hath ſpent pope quarell ſens kyng firſt viage coſt vpō xiiij hundred thouſand poundes rekē ſens hath bene ſpēt ſea land betwene v frenchman scottes triumphes ambaſiaſies hath bene ſent realme ſecretly mainteine holy father doubt ſurmount ſome xl l hundred thouſand poūdes cauſe ſpend one peny holy father king therfore ought make pay money euery farthing fette myters croſes ſhrines maner treaſure church pay common onely cardinal biſhops compelled commōs lend made thē ſweare ſuch enſample tyrāny neuer thought alſo hath gathered el cōſent common keepe ſtore defence realme yea kyng ought loke chronicle pope haue done king time paſt make reſtore alſo ought take away theyr landes whiche haue gotten falſe prayer reſtore vnto right heyres agayne conſent aduiſemēt turne vnto maynteinyng poore bringyng vp youth vertuouſly maynteine neceſſary officer miniſters defend common wealth ought common take pacience take god ſcourge thinke god hath blynded kyng theyr ſinnes ſake commit cauſe god ſhall god make ſcourge driue temple hys wonderfull iudgement ſide haue alſo vttered wickednes ſpiritualtie falſhead byſhops iugglyng pope haue diſguiſed ſelues borowyng ſome pompe ye iewes ſome gentile haue ſuttill wyles turned obedience ſhould geuen god ordinaunce vnto ſelues haue put god teſtament god truth ſet vp owne tradition lye haue taught ye people beleue ſit conſciences god haue meanes robbed world landes goodes peace vnitie temporal authoritie haue brought people ignoraunce god haue heaped wrath god vpon realmes namely vpon king haue robbed ſpeake worldly thinges onely euen natural wittes make thē beleue moſt chriſten whē lyue moſt abhominably ſuffer man realmes beleueth chriſt defender fayth burne goſpell promiſes god fayth ſpringeth ſhewed haue miniſtred chriſt kyng emperour rowmes haue made ſeuerall kyngdome gote firſt deceauyng prince peruert whole ſcripture proue haue ſuch authoritie god leſt lay men ſhould ſee falſely alledge place scripture father deliuer written pope cardinal byſhops know confeſſion emperour kyngs lordes confeſſion know captiues beleue chriſt confeſſion know shriue thy ſelfe thou wilt whether manifolde enormity outwarde pretence god honor po ••• clergie procured owne dignitie pretend outwardly honour god common wealth entent ſecret councell onely bryng vnder power take way ſoeuer letteth mighty whē ſend hart loue haue hys luſt recorde therein night day vnderſtanding god hath geuen profeſſeth law hath 〈…〉 promiſes chriſt apoſtles expounde ſame hath part promiſes haue true faith bloud chriſt becauſe lawe iuſtifie ſinne agayne muſt ſtand iudgement feate chriſt receaue euery man according deedes body ergo lawe deedes 2 cor 〈◊〉 lawe iuſtifie theſe ſuch naughty argumēts ye ſee kyng pardoneth murtherer condition henceforth keepe lawe ſo yet ye know well inough ſaued grace fauour pardon yet keping y• lawe come howbeit breake lawe afterwarde falleth agayne ſame daunger death euen ſo none v receaued law keepyng lawe continue grace grace vpon condition keepe law neyther yet continue longer grace purpoſe laſteth breake law muſt ſue new pardon haue new ſight agaynſt ſinne hell deſperation ye • come quiet fayth againe fele ſinne forgeuen neyther ſtable vndoubted fayth thy ſinne forgeuen thee except alſo luſty courage thine hart truſt thou wilt ſinne condition thou endeuour thy ſelfe ſinne promiſe mercy forgeuenes made vnto thee thy loue lawe increaſeth ſo fayth loue hope inſepararable lyfe doth thy fayth chriſt ſo doth thyne hope longing life come thy loue colde ſo thy fayth weake thine hope longing lyfe come litle loue lawe neither fayth chriſt forgeuenes ſinne longing lyfe come ſteede fayth wicked imagination god ſo vnrighteous offended ſinne ſtede hope deſire liue euer gredines worldly voluptuouſneſſe vnto ſuch scripture locked loue law cannot vnderſtand scripture ſaluation vp made impoſſible vnderſtand may reade rehearſe ſtories thereof diſpute turkes may may turkes lawe may ſucke pride hipocriſye maner poyſon ſlaye owne ſoules put ſtombling blockes mennes wayes thruſt truth get ſuch learnyng therin ariſtotles ethikes morall philoſophy preceptes olde philoſophers impoſſible apply one ſentence thereof ſoules health faſhion liues thereby pleaſe god make loue lawe vnderſtand either feele power chriſtes death might reſurrection ſwetnes life come euer remayne carnall fleſhly thou haſt enſample scribe phariſeis iewes new teſtament concluſion care beleue chriſt remiſſion ſinne loue law thouſand degree god careth weake ſo one perfecter weaker thē another great ſort ſo feble cā neither go forward profeſſion purpoſe yet ſtand except holpe borke ſtrōger brother tended young childrē care father mother therfore doth god commaund elder care younger paule teacheth rom xv ſaying ſtronger ought beare feblenes weaker gala vj brother man caught fault ye ſpirituall bearyng eche weakenes fulfil lawe chriſt growen knowledge haue gottē victory fleſh teach ſuch ſpirite ſoftenes callyng heretickes firſt choppe threatenyng fier fagottes alter alterius onera portate ſayth ſic adimplebitis legē chriſti ſaye beare eche others burthen ſo ſhall ye fulfill law chriſt euen ſo veryly ſhall ye fulfill lawe chriſt ſmityng brother puttyng ſtomblyng blockes theyr weake feete killyng theyr conſciences makyng afrayde ſhadowes bugges breake theyr father commaundementes truſt wordes winde vanitie theyr father promiſe ſakes alſo hath ordeyned ruler ordayned ruler ſpirituall temporall teach exhorte warne keepe occaſions cuſtome ſynne fall profeſſion take vpon elder brother become hypocrite god ſcourgeth hys turned wily fox cruell wolues fierce lyon officer waxen euill ſeruauntes mammon miniſtryng office owne lucre onely profite brother fauouryng vice whereby may haue vauntage god compelled fatherly pitie ſcourge weake hym ſelfe pouertie oppreſſion wrong loſſe daunger thouſand maner diſeaſes bryng agayne fallen kepe harte faſt profeſſion diligentibus deum omnia cooperantur bonum rom viij loue god ſay law god loue god vnto god turneth beſt ſcourgeth luſtes owne weakenes theyr owne ſaluation concluſion god receaueth perfite weake lyke grace chriſtes ſake father receaueth hys child ſmall great lyke loue receaueth ſonnes maketh condition couenaunt couenaunt beare theyr weakenes chriſtes ſake till waxen ſtronger often ſoeuer fall yet forgeue turne agayn neuer caſt till yeld ſelfe ſinne take ſinnes part affection luſt ſinne fight agaynſt owne profeſſiō deſtroy correcteth chaſtiſeth child euer home rodde mercy loue make thē better bryngeth forth iudged condemnation law concluſion euery man two men fleſh ſpirite ſo fight perpetually one agaynſt man muſt go either backe forward ſtand long ſtate ſpirit ouercome fleſh ſpirite temptation ſhe ſtronger fleſh weaker fleſhe get cuſtome ſpirite none otherwiſe oppreſſed fleſh though ſhe mountaine vpon backe ſometyme dreames thinke beare heuyer milſtone breaſtes dreame would runne away feare legges ſeme heauyer leade euen ſo ſpirite oppreſſed ouer laden fleſh cuſtome ſhe ſtruggeleth ſtriueth get vp breake lowſe vayne vntil god mercy heareth grone ieſus chriſt come lowſe power put croſſe tribulation backe fleſh keepe downe miniſh ſtrength mortifie wherfore euery man muſt haue croſſe croſſe nayle fleſhe mortifieng thou ſtrong inough diſcrete thereto take vp thy croſſe thy ſelfe tame thy fleſhe prayer faſtyng watchyng deedes mercy holy meditation euill luſtes affection purged croſſe chriſt readyng scripture bodely labour withdrawyng maner pleaſures fleſh exerciſes contrary vice thou markeſt thy body moſt enclined abſteinyng courage fleſh agaynſt ſpirite readyng wanton bookes wanton communication fooliſh ieſtyng effeminate thoughtes talkyng couetouſnes whiche paule forbyddeth ephe v magnifieng worldly promotion takeſt ſay vp ſuch croſſe thyne owne ſelfe counſell better learned exerciſed thou muſt god put croſſe aduerſitie vpon thee muſt haue euery man croſſe world damned world ye ſee difference betwene ſinne vnder grace 〈◊〉 vnder lawe ſinne beleue y• bloud chriſt remiſſion ſinne conſent ſubmit themſelues vnto lawe ſin yelde themſelues vnto ſinne ſerue c firſt ſinne vnder grace ſinnes veniall ſay forgeueable ſinne vnder lawe vnder damnation lawe fight great part agaynſt grace againſt ſpirite grace agaynſt law god fayth chriſt corrupt text couenaunt falſe gloſes diſobedient god therefore ſ •… deadly • alſo ye ſee difference betwene lambes true beleuers betwene lambes swyne dogges vncleane ſwyne follow carnall luſtes fleſhly libertie churliſhe hypocr •… e dogges blinde zeale owne righteouſnes perſecute righteouſnes fayth chriſtes bloud effeminate careles ſwyne cōtinue swyre haue • fayth fleſhlines ceaſe wallow thē ſelues olde podell thinke beleue well chriſtes bloud deceaued thou mayſt clearely perceaue becauſe feare damnation euill workes loue lawe good workes therefore haue part promiſe cruell doggiſhe hypocrits dogges loue lawe take vpon worke thinke loue lawe yet neuer ſawe ſaue vnder vayle deceaued thou mayſt perceaue beleue chriſt forgeuenes ſinne whereby alſo meane beleue thou mayſt perceaue vnderſtand lawe vnderſtoode lawe would eyther driue chriſt make diſpayre immediatly true beleuers beholde lawe owne likenes ſee impoſſibilitie true fayth coupled loue lawe thereof fulfilled wyth naturall power therefore flee chriſt mercy grace power thankfulnes mercy receaued loue lawe owne likenes ſubmit thēſelues learne profit therein morow day ye ſee alſo difference manner faythes fayth true beleuers difference faythes vnderſtoode fayth iuſtifieth god iuſtifieth forgeueth chriſt deſerueth fayth truſt chriſtes bloud receaueth certifieth cōſcience thereof ſaueth deliuereth feare death damnation meane ſay fayth iuſtifieth fayth meane chriſt owne workes certifieth conſcience ſinnes forgeuē v chriſtes bloudes ſake fayth hypocrite god fayth hipocrites forgeueth workes deſerue ſame falſe fayth owne workes receaueth mercy promiſed merites owne workes ſo chriſt vtterly excluded thus ye ſee faith thing affirmed iuſtifie partyes faith chriſtes bloud god promiſe quieteth conſcience true beleuers falſe fayth truſt workes owne fayning beguileth blynde hypocrite ſeaſon tyll god greatnes ſinne • ull openeth eye diſpayre ſwyne ſay god ſo good wyll ſaue deuilles damne man perpetually fayth 〈◊〉 whatſoeuer concluſion beleue chriſt remiſſion ſinnes thankfulnes mercy loue lawe truely ſay loue god father geueth ieſus chriſt lord v bought v al harte ſoules power might brother father ſake becauſe bapt •… outward waſhing bodye ſpirituall character badge ſigne wherewith god thorouge hys ſpirite marketh immediatly aſſoone ioyned chriſt made member hys church true fayth church chriſt multitude church chriſt beleue chriſt remiſſion ſinne thankfulnes mercy loue lawe god purely without gloſes hate haue ſinne world long life come church cannot erre dampnably long tyme aſſoone queſtion aryſeth truth god promiſe ſtirreth vp one teach truth euery thing needefull ſaluation god worde lighteneth harte true member ſee ſame conſent thereto haue harte waſhed wyth inwarde baptyme ſprite church haue keyes ſcripture ye binding lowſing erre euen ſo ſinne purpoſe wyll heare faultes whoſoeuer derogate thyng frō 〈◊〉 chriſt church tolde ſeeke liberty priuilegies ſinne vnpuniſhed gloſe lawe god mainteine ceremony tradition cuſtomes deſtroy fayth chriſt ſame member sathan doctrine poiſon errour darcknes ye though pope byſhoppes abbotes eurates doctoures diuinitie though rehearſe ſcripture without booke though ſeene greeke ebrew latine ye though ſo preach chriſt paſſion chriſt make poore woman weepe howle agayne haue lawe write • harts▪ cānot vnderſtand paſſion chriſt ſaluation come point ſhould miniſter chriſtes paſſion vnto ſaluation ſoules poyſon together gloſe lawe ſhould make v feele ſaluation chriſt driue v poynt chriſt teach v put truſt owne workes remiſſion ſatiſfaction ſinnes apiſh play hypocrite ſell merites ſteede chriſtes bloud paſſion▪ • deare reader beleue chriſtes 〈◊〉 peting bloud remiſſion ſinn • putchaſing good promiſes helpe lyfe come loue law inward baptiſme ſoule • long life come inward baptiſme ſoule baptiſme onely auayleth ſight god new generation image chriſt onely keye alſo binde • owſe ſynners touchſtone trye doctrine lanterne light mariage betwene ſoule chriſt properly mariage garment yea ſigne thau defendeth v thau ſ •… tyng power euill aungels alſo rocke whereon chriſtes churche built whereon built ſtandeth againſt weather wynde tempeſtes yet might profeſſion fayth chriſtes bloud loue law longyng lyfe come faith • ope charitie inſeperable called theſe thynges malyce froward vnderſtandyng away becauſe one three none becauſe one knowen impoſſible know truly deceaued reſpect compariſon thou wilt ſure thy faith faith hope charitie knowen one perfect examine thy ſelfe whether thou loue law lyke maner thou wilt knowe whether thou loue lawe aright examine thy ſelfe whether thou beleue chriſt onely remiſſion ſinne obtayning promiſes made scripture euen ſo compare thy hope lyfe come vnto fayth loue hatyng ſinne lyfe whiche hate loue law engendereth thee accompanie one another thre together ſure hypocriſie ſay ſeyng fayth loue hope three vertues inſeperable ergo fayth onely iuſtifieth anſwere though inſeperable yet haue ſeperable ſundry office aboue ſayd lawe fayth fayth onely ſure • nd office fayth vndoubted truſt chriſt father thorow hym certifieth conſcience ſinne forgeuen dampnation impoſſibilitie lawe taken away aboue rehearſed condition couenaunt wyth ſuch perſwaſions molleſieth hart maketh loue god agayne lawe oft ſinne faith onely kepeth forſake profeſſion loue vtterly quench hope fayle onely maketh peace agayne true beleuer truſteth chriſt onely owne workes ought el remiſſion ſinne office loue powre agayne office loue ſame goodnes ſhe hath receaued god vppon neighbour hym ſhe feleth chriſt ſelfe office loue onely haue compaſſion beare neighbour burthen infirmity writtē 1 pet 4 operit multitudinem peccatorum couereth multitude ſinnes ſay conſidereth infirmity enterpreteth beſt taketh ſinne thouſand thinges leaſt inough man loued go law trouble vnquiet whole towne ſometyme whole realme two office hope comfort aduerſitie office hope make patient faint fall downe vnder croſſe caſt •… backes thus ye ſee theſe three inſeperable life haue yet ſeperable ſundry office effectes heate drith beyng inſeperable fyer haue yet ſeperable operation drith onely expelleth moyſtnes conſumed fyer heat onely deſtroyeth coldenes drith colde may ſtand together ſo may heate moyſtnes one ſay dryth onely dryth alone one ſay fayth onely fayth alone go deſire god print profeſſion thyne hart encreaſe dayly thou mayſt full ſhapē like vnto image chriſt knowledge loue meeke thy ſelfe creepe lowe grounde cleaue faſt rocke profeſſion tye thy ſhippe anker ſaluation perfect faith chriſtes bloud anker fayth chriſtes bloud wyth gable loue caſt againſt •… peſts ſo ſet vp thy ſayle get thee mayne ſea god worde reade wordes chriſt expoſition folowing thou ſhalt ſee lawe fayth workes reſtored eche right vſe true meaning therto cleare difference betwene ſpirituall regiment temporall ſhalt haue entraunce opē way reſt ſcripture wherein thinges ſpirite veritie guide thee thyne vnderſtandyng amen ¶ fift chapter mathew ſaw people 1 went vp moūtaine ſat downe diſciples came hym opened mouth taught ſaying bleſſed poore ſpirite kingdome heauen chriſt firſt sermon begynneth reſtore law ten commanndements vnto right vnderſtandyng agaynſt scribe phariſeis hipocrites falſe prophetes falſe preacher corrupt ſcripture leauen gloſes without great myſterie chriſt beginneth pouerth ſpirite preachyng pouertie ſpirite neither beggerie agaynſt poſſeſſing richeſſe vertue cōtrarie vice couetouſneſſe inordinate deſire loue richeſſe puttyng truſt richeſſe rich gift god geuen mā rich mayntaine y• degree world therefore euill yea ſome muſt poore ſome rich ſhal haue order world god father deuideth richeſſe pouertie among childrē accordyng godly pleaſure wiſedome neither rich pouertie exclude aſſure v god bleſſing richeſſe doth exclude bleſſing ſo doth pouertie certifie thee put thy truſt liuyng god maketh y• heyre therof thou truſt liuing god thē thou poore thou coueteſt rich thou art certified y• thy father ſhall miniſter vnto thee fode raymēt thy defēder thou haue rich thou knoweſt vanitie thou broughteſt world ſo ſhalt thou carie thyne day ſo may man morow fauour god onely gaue alſo kepeth thee thy wiſedome power neither ought el cā helpe nede ſaue good thy heauenly father onely happy bleſſed poore ſpirite pithely declared poore ſpirite ſay rich haue confidence conſolation vanitie richeſſe poore deſire inordinatly riche haue truſt liuyng god fode raymēt partayneth either body ſoule kyngdome heauen contrarywiſe vnhappy accurſed riche ſpirite firſt depeſt curſes rich ſpirite ſay couetous beyng riche truſt richeſſe beyng poore long conſolation richeſſe comfort ſoules promiſes heauenly father confirmed y• bloud lord chriſt vnto harder enter y• kingdome heauen camel enter y• eye nedle mar 10 haue part kyngdome chriſt god ephe v therefore euident chriſt ſo diligētly warneth beware couetouſneſſe hee admitteth none diſciples except firſt forſake together neuer couetouſe perſon true yet either god man couetous mā choſē preach god word falſe prophet immediatly couetouſnes thyng contraris worde god miniſters ſame lay ſorte ſo ioyneth ſelf vnto falſe prophetes perſecute truth couetouſneſſe onely aboue luſtes thoſe thornes choke yt word god poſſeſſe alſo deadly enemy interprete god word truly vice though laugh thē ſcorne talke godly yet ſuffer thē lyue dwell countrey couetouſnes cannot reſt long one cleaueth god word land take hede thy preacher therfore couetouſnes falſe prophet chiefly knowen ſure couetous gape promotion falſe prophet leaueneth scripture cry father father holy church fiften hūdred yeares holy pretenſes bleſſed mourne ſhall comforted 2 mournyng alſo ſpirite kinne ſowre lokyng cry world nought • owne others iniquitie waywardnes cā enioye theyr owne luſles hipocrites impaciēt weywardneſſe thoſe fleſhely euer whyne complayne world naught becauſe cānot obtayne enioy luſtes therin neither forbiddeth alwayes mery laugh make good chere forget ſorrow ouermuch heauyneſſe ſwalow man cleane vp wiſe man ſayth ſorow hath coſt many lyues prouer xvij heauy ſpirite drieth vp bone paule commaundeth philip iiij reioyſe euer rom xij ſayth reioyſe reioyſe ſorow thē ſorow wepe wepe ſeme two contrary mourning croſſe without neuer diſciple godlye mournyng chriſt euer ſhalbe ſoeuer ſtate degree thou world thou profeſſe y• goſpell foloweth croſſe warmeneſſe warmeth accō panieth ſ • nne ſo foloweth croſſe true chriſtian man accompanieth ſonne ſhynyng vnder thy ſpirite ſhall grone mourne ſecretly onely becauſe world thyne owne fleſh carie thee away cleane cōtrary purpoſe thyne hart alſo ſee behold wretchedneſſe miſfortunes thy brethrē becauſe thou loueſt well thy ſelfe thou ſhalt mourne ſorow leſſe thē thy ſelfe though thou king emperour yet thou knoweſt chriſt god chriſt entendeſt walke fight god miniſter thyne office truly thou ſhalt kepe iuſtice compelled dayly thou art leſſe loth thou ſhouldeſt cut arme hand member thyne owne body yea thou wilt folow right way neither turne right hand left thou ſhalt haue immediatly thine ſubiectes thyne owne ſeruauntes thyne owne lordes thyne coūſellours thyne owne prophetes thereto agaynſt thee ʋnto whoſe froward malice ſtubburneſſe thou ſhalt cō pelled permitte thouſand thynges agaynſt thy conſcience able reſiſte whiche thyne hart ſhall blede inwardly ſhalt ſawſe thy ſwete ſoppes world weneth thou haſt ſorowes mough ſtill mournyng ſtudyeng either alone el frēdes ſecretly night day ſighing god helpe mitigate furious frowardneſſe whō thou art able ſtand go vngodly dauid cōpelled ſuffer dayes lyfe ſeruauntes ſonnes seruia beſide miſchaūces child king iohn k iohn forſaken owne lordes would haue put good godly reformatiō owne land henry ſecōd compaſſed lyke maner henry ſecond prelate promoted nought ſecrete conſpiracie ſome temporal lordes thē ſpare ſpeake ye mournyng true preacher poore cōmon people haue none helpe ſecret hand god word promiſe ſhalbe cōforted promiſe goddes word y• cōfort y• afflicted world chriſts ſake tribulatiō ſorrow ſhalbe turned ioye infinite euerlaſtyng lyfe come neither without comfort world chriſt hath promiſed ſēd comfortour euer ſpirite trouth whiche world knoweth iohn xiiij reioyſe hope comfort come rom xij ouercome fayth written hebr xj saintes fayth ouercame kyngdomes obtained promiſes iohn v victorie ouercōmeth faith victory world euē faith blind world neither ſeeth comfort truſt god god thorough faith word helpeth v maketh v ouercome ouercome wilt thou ſay alwayes perſecuted euer ſlayne verely euery battaile ſome wynne field ſlayne yet leaue victorie vnto deare frēdes whoſe ſakes toke fight vppon therfore conquerours ſeyng obtayne purpoſe maynteine fought curſed riche worlde whiche haue ioye comfort rich haue ſence begynnyng fought agaynſt wede thē worlde yet vayne perſecution death y• truthes ſake obteine lyfe get victory though haue alwayes ſlayne ſom yet thoſe ſlayne wanne victory brother death euer increaſed nūber though ſemed dye ſight fooliſh yet peace haue obtayned euerlaſtyng kyngdome fought beſide mourner righteouſnes ſaued god taketh vengeance y• vnright 〈◊〉 wiſe god plagueth world ſinne theſe y• mourne ſorrow marked ſigne thau foreheades ſaued plague periſh wicked thou ſeeſt ezech ix lot deliuered frō among sodomite contrariwiſe curſed laugh now▪ ſay haue ioy ſolace comfort rich ſhall ſorrow weepe luke vj anſwered rich man luke xvj ſonne remember thou receauedſt thy good dayes thy life tyme lazarus likewiſe euill therefore comforted thou tormented bleſſed meeke 3 ſhall enherite earth earth vnderſtand mekenes poſſeſſeth earth poſſeſſe world god keepe v ſofte • ke whatſoeuer trouble ariſe yet patient abide end go ſide writtē 36 pſal wicked ſhall weded abide lordes layſure ſhall enherite y• earth agayne within wicked ſhall gone thou ſhalt beholde place ſhalbe away meeke ſofte ſhall enherite earth euen ſay ſtill haue thy little medling commeth much reſt patient man ſhall weare enemy impoſſible dwell place diſpleaſure ſhould done thee done vnwillingly whē thy neighbour beaſtes breake thy corne ſome chaunce againſt reaſon thou ſofte forgeue done malice ſelfe wil reuenging thou dooſt pottering fire make flame greater geueſt occaſiō euill done thee man rayle thee rebuke thee anſwere agayne heat malice ſhal die ſelfe goe immediatly fire doth woode laide theron wrong done greater referre y• reuenge thy cauſe magiſtrate whō god appointeth forbyd ſuch violence thou art able beare truſt god complayne meekeneſſe vnto officer ſet god forbid ſuch violence ye gentleman dwell thee tyrauntes ready helpe fet home woode plow land bring harueſt ſo forth let thy wife viſit lady couple fat hennes fat capon ſuch like thou ſhalt poſſeſſe remnaunt reſt el one quarell may picked thee make thee quite together chuſe whether thou wilt ſoftneſſe ſuffering haue god thy ſide euer ſaue thee geue thee euer inough haue good conſcience peace earth wyth furiouſneſſe impatiencie haue god agaynſt thee polled littel little together haue euill conſcience neuer reſt earth haue thy dayes ſhortened thereto god hath promiſed thou meke ſofte ſuffer little perſecution geue thee onely hundred folde life come alſo hundred folde life ſay geue thee owne ſelfe thy protectour miniſter thee euer inough may right called hūdred folde treaſure paſſing treaſure prince finally chriſt teacheth priuat perſon may aduenge officer muſt euery mā muſt liue ſelfe amōg neighbour priuate matter neighbour though king thou canſt ſoft thou officer thē thou muſt good kynde mercifull milkeſoppe negligent thou art father muſt thou rule make obedient ſharpneſſe ſoftneſſe heard ſo office bleſſed honger thirſt righteouſneſſe 4 ſhalbe fulfilled righteouſnes place taken principall righteouſnes righteouſneſſe chriſten man thorow parſon good accepted god theſe viij pointes doctrine frutes workes chriſten man fayth muſt make righteous wythout deſeruing workes tree ſuch fruites workes muſt ſpryng wherefore vnderſtand outward righteouſnes word righteouſnes ought vnderſtode word true faythfull dealing ech iuſt executing office maner degree meke obedience vnder power meaning happy onely duty men alſo ſtudy helpe vttermoſt power worde deede counſell exhorting deale truely alſo according degree euery man beareth world deſirous good order righteous dealyng hungry thirſty deſirous eate drinke note naught ſaith hunger thirſt except thy ſoule hunger thirſt righteouſnes new nature body doth meate drinke hys olde nature deuill child world cannot ſuffer monkes man either deale truely himſelfe helpe ſo reſiſt thee monkes runne religion plague thee ſo weary thee thou haddeſt leuer myſtruſt deſperation thy ſtate ſhould better forſake make thy ſelfe mōke fryer yea rūne ſtraūge coūtry leaue thy frends abide world let chuſe whether wil ſinke ſwimme comfort v faint weary well chriſt promiſeth haue thyrſt honger ſhall haue luſt ſatiſfied trāſlated kingdome none vnrighteouſnes beſides thou ſhalt length ſee many come right way helpe thee many thinges cannot together mended yet ſomewhat bettered tolerable ſo righteouſneſſe ſhall quenched contrariwiſe curſed full luke vj ſayth luc vi ſay hypocrite auoyde labour ſorrow care combraunce ſuffring wyth brother get dennes liue monkes curſed reſt fill belly wealth mē regarded grief better alone may taken holy whoſoeuer heauen muſt buy yea ſo full preferre ſelues poore ſinners looke narowly phariſey publican • thanking god alone good euyll curſed yet fulneſſe ſhall hunger wyth euerlaſting hunger none ſhall geue eate haue refreſhing paynes bleſſed mercifull ſhall obtaine mercy 5 mercifull haue compaſſion mercyful manye wayes mercy may ſhewed feele mās diſeaſe mourne thē mourne ſuffer ſuffer helpe ſuccour tribulation aduerſitie cō fort good counſell wholſome inſtruction louing wordes merciful louingly forgeue offended thee aſſoone knowledge miſdoyng aſke thee mercy mercifull patiently long abide conuerſion ſinners luſty courage hope god laſt conuert meane tyme pray inſtantly euer ſeeth occaſion exhort thē warne moniſhe thē rebuke mercifull interpret beſt looke thorow finger many thynges make greuous ſinne euery ſmall trifle ſuffer forbeare owne cauſe malice wil repent knowen theyr wickedneſſe long ſuffer long ought ſuffred lenger complayne haue auctoritie forbidde wrong puniſhe ſuch euill doer hypocrite cleane contrary monkes condemne mē greuous ſinners ſaue onely buy holyneſſe becauſe wyll ſuffer wyth man get ſilence becauſe helpe man haue ſay pertayneth couent none offended couent wyll auenged immediatly clooke ſhould ſeeme aduēge thēſelues matter ſay pertayneth god holy church ſome saint one holy thyng thou ſmite one one cheke turne thee yer aduenge himſelf iniury holy oyle wherwith • le annointed muſt aduenge ſpirituall puniſhmēt holy oyle muſt bee aduenged thou muſt accurſed blacke colyer deliuered sathan thou come aſke abſolution offer thy ſelfe penaunce paying thereto wyll ſuffer till deuil fetch thee deliuer thee fyre meane tyme zeale righteouſnes ſay hypocrite zeale righteouſnes hart foule filthineſſe hart thoughtes ſtudy breake god cōmaundementes wherfore pureneſſe purenes hart hart conſenting ſtudious purpoſe keepe law god meane truly al thy word work true intent foloweth mayſt pure harted drudge world lot pure harted amōg sodomite nicodem • beyng councell among conſpired death chriſt pure harted conſented death innocent law written thyne hart ende lawe 〈◊〉 iuſti •… hypocrite yt worke falſe purpoſe either prayſe profite iuſtified thereby paynted ſepulchres chriſt calleth neuer ſee god bee ſure ſtate grace theyr workes accepted becauſe haue god word cleane agaynſt bleſſed peacemaker ſhalbe called child 7 god inherite bleſſing peacemaking onely required thou haue peace thy ſelfe thou take beſt offēded lightly euery ſmall trifle alway ready forgeue▪ ſowe diſcorde aduenge thyne owne wrong alſo thou feruent diligent make peace go betwene thou knoweſt heareſt malice enuie ſeeſt bate ſtrife ariſe betwen perſon perſon thou leaue nothing vnſought ſet one though chriſt ſpeake temporall ſword teacheth euery man ſhall liue ſelfe toward neighbour yet prince prince ought 〈◊〉 yet make warre wilbe god child muſt onely giue cauſe warre begyn alſo though haue iuſt cauſe ſuffer ſelfe entreated gaue cauſe repent muſt alſo ſeke al wayes peace fight howbeit ſought nothing helpe ought bound defend land ſubiectes ſo doyng peacemaker well whē cauſeth theeues murtherers puniſhed euill doyng breakyng common peace land ſubiectes thou haue peace thy ſelfe whē thou maiſt aſſure thy ſelfe y• ſonne heyre god loueſt peace thy brother maner ſo god chriſt peace thee thou beloued ſonne heyre alſo moreouer wrong done thee greater thou mayſt beare whē thou art perſon thy ſelfe onely reſpect ſoeuer worldly degree haſt office committed thee thou haſt warned good maner none amendement wilbe kepe peace thyne hart loue ſtill complaine ſet reforme ſuch thing ſo art thou yet peacemaker ſtill ſonne god thou aduenge thy ſelfe deſireſt ſuch wronges forbidden vengeaūce pertayneth god onely thou ſinneſt againſt god taking authoritie god vpon thee without commaundemēt god father ouer right iudge ouer child onely partayneth aduēging therfore without commaundemēt aduengeth either hart hand ſame doth caſt hym ſelfe handes ſword loſeth right cauſe ſide curſed peacebreakers picquarels whiſperers backbyters ſowers diſcorde diſprayſers thē good bring thē fauour interpreter euill done good purpoſe finder faultes none ſtirrers vp prince battaile warre aboue curſed falſly bely true preacher god word bring hate ſhed bloud wrongfully hate truth ſuch child deuill bleſſed ſuffer perſecution righteouſnes ſake 8 kyngdome heauen faith chriſt law god two righteouſnes contained ye fayth chriſt lawe god▪ • r righteouſnes conteyned writtē thine hart thou righteouſnes ſake vnrighteouſnes prayſe ſayeth peter ſecond firſt epiſtle though ye ſuffer ye buffeted offence wherfore ye fourth ſame ſayth ſee none ſuffer murtherer thefe euill doer buſy body men matter ſuffering glorifieth god thou art therby heire heauen beware therefore thou deſerue thou ſuffereſt thou beware much would beare thee hand bow ſuch ſuffering ſhould ſatiſfaction thy ſinnes deſeruing payne 〈◊〉 payne ca • ſatiſfaction god 〈◊〉 chriſtes paſſion heauen ſuffering righteouſnes though heauen promiſed therto yet doth deſerue heauen yet make ſatiſfactiō foreſinnes chriſt doth twaine thou repent beleue chriſt remiſſion ſinne cōfeſſe onely god alſo open ſee thee ſuffer thou haſt deſerued thou ſuffreſt breaking good righteous law thy father takeſt • puniſhmēt patiently holeſome medicine heale thy fleſh ſinne feare thy brother fall like offence moſes teacheth euery thy paciēce ſuffering pleaſaunt ſight thy brethrē behold thee pitie thee ſuffer thee hart euen ſo ſight god thee ſure token thou haſt true fayth true repentaunce bleſſed ſuffer righteouſnes euen ſo accurſed runne away let troden vnder feete wyll ſuffer fayth lord lawe father ſtande neighbour iuſt cauſes bleſſed ye reuile perſecute ſay 9 maner euil ſayinges againſt ſake yet lye reioyce glad rewarde great heauē euē ſo verely perſecuted prophet ſeeſt thou vttermoſt chriſten man muſt looke inough ſuffer righteouſnes bitterneſſe poyſon left thy cuppe thou ſhalt reuiled rayled vpon euen whē thou art condempned death moſt cruell perſecution excommunicat deliuered sathan depriued felowſhip holy church company y• angel thy part chriſtes bloud ſhalt curſed downe hell defied deteſted execrat blaſphemous raylinges poyſonfull hart hypocrite thinke imagine ſhalt ſee thy face thou goeſt thy death world perſwaded brought beliefe thou haſt ſayd done thou neuer thoughteſt thou dyeſt thou art giltleſſe childe vnborne well though iniquitie ſo highly preuayle truth thou dieſt ſo low kept vnder knowen worlde ſo much ſemeth rather hindered thy death furthered griefes greateſt yet let thyne hart fayle thee neither diſpaire though god forſaken thee loued thee comfort thy ſelfe olde enſamples god hath ſuffred olde frendes ſo entreated alſo onely deare ſonne ieſus whoſe enſample set example chriſt thee aboue ſet thine eye becauſe thou art ſure beloued aboue thou doubt thou art beloued alſo fie wretch deſtroyeſt yt temple god yet beloued god ſo art thou cauſe came lyght alſo ſo ſhall thyne laſt yea thy reward great heauē thy deepe ſuffering ſide curſed leaue righteouſneſſe deſtitute curſed ſuffer therewyth moſt accurſed ſo moſt accurſed know truth yet onely flee therefrom becauſe ſuffer alſo lucre become moſt cruell enemy thereof moſt ſubtill perſecutors moſt falſſy lye theron alſo finally though god promiſeth bleſſe workes bynde workes iuſtifie • v worke obtayne bleſſing promiſe yet muſt beware phareſaicall peſtilence thinke work deſerue promiſes whatſoeuer god commaundeth v dutie though ſuch promiſe made v promyſe therefore commeth deſeruing worker though god neede ought could doo pure mercy god make v wylling dutie c done god commaundeth v gaue v vp handes tyrauntes kylled v ſent v purgatory mē ſo greatly feare hell aungels heauen v v wrong vnrighteous ought coulde chalenge deſeruing howſoeuer god vſeth creature euer abydeth righteous till worker ye pure mercy god cauſe promiſe made vnto thou cāſt proue hath boūd ſelfe wyth owne woorde mercy breake promyſe wyth keepe couenaunt nought promiſed nought coulde chalenge whatſoeuer therefore promiſe commeth goodnes promiſer onely deſeruing thoſe workes god hath neede leſſe duty though ſuch promiſe ye ſalt earth ſalt waxen vnſauery ſalted therwith henceforth nothyng worth caſt troden vnder foote men office apoſtle preacher ſalt onely corrupt office true preacher maners conuerſation earthly people alſo roten hart within ſpringeth therof natural reaſon vnderſtā dyng wiſedome yea fayth belefe haue spiritualtie 〈◊〉 diſpi •• foote men preacher whiche doctrine called ſalt haue loſt ye nature ſalt ſay ſharpneſſe rebukyng vnrighteouſnes naturall reaſon naturall witte vnderſtandyng truſt confidence troden vnder foote muſt weriſh vnſauery ceremony muſt ſalted ceremony whiche haue loſ • e ſignificatiōs onely teach become vnprofitable ſeruice man alſo haue obtained authoritie god hart man mā ſerueth putteth truſt confidence ſhould put god hys maker thorough ieſus chriſt redemer inſtitutions man better god yea god ordinaūces better thē old tyme prophet trode vnder foote defied tēple god ſacrifices god ceremony god ordained ſaſtinges prayinges people peruerted committed idolatrie haue ſtraite commaundement ſalt rebuke vngodlineſſe ye prophetes haue ceremony honourably ſpokē let reſtore right vſe put ſalt true meanyng ſignifications thē agayne vſed none loueth chriſt cā ſpeake honourably true chriſten man geue honour taketh honour frō chriſt geue honour ſlayeth ſoule brother robbeth hart truſt cō •• dēce ſhould geue lord hath bought bloud▪ ye light world citie ſet hil cānot hid neither men light candle put vnder buſhell cādleſticke ſo geueth light houſe let light ſo ſhine mē may ſee good woorkes prayſe father heauen chriſt goeth forth deſcribeth y• office apoſtle true preacher another likeneſſe callyng ſalt earth euē ſo light world •… ſignifiyng therby holineſſe wiſdome vertue perfectneſſe righteouſnes ye world among men howſoeuer perfect holy appeare yet dampnable darckneſſe except right knowledge chriſtes bloud firſt • ftifie hart holineſſe cōcluſion citie built hill hid light chriſtes goſpell let world rage much yet wil ſhine ſore eye whether content concluſion men light candle whelme vnder buſſhell put candleſticke light houſe euen ſo light chriſtes goſpell may hid made ſeuerall thyng though pertayned ſome certayne holy perſons onely nay light whole world pertaineth men therfore may made ſeuerall madneſſe diuerſe men ſay lay people may know laye laye ought haue goſpell except proue laye people world moreouer hid lightning breaketh cloudes ſhyneth ouer euen ſo doth goſpel chriſt truely receaued purifieth hart maketh perſon conſent lawes god beginne new godly lyuing faſhioned god lawes without diſſimulation wil kendle ſo great goſpell propertie y• goſpell loue hym towarde neighbour ſhall onely haue compaſſiō hym hys bodely aduerſitie much pitie ouer blyndenes ſoule miniſter goſpell tr • e goſpell hid dennes chriſtes goſpel wherfore ſay saint fraunces coate dominickes ſuch like thou wilt put coat thou ſhalt finde falfe y• ſpiritualty light ought woulde make •… ues pore make riche make poore themſelues riche thou ſhouldeſt ſee ſhyne abroad though thou creptſt ſell monkes coule thou ſeeſt y• lightning without crepyng cloudes yea light would ſo ſhine men ſhould onely ſee y• lyght goſpell alſo good workes would faſt come runne ſo much y• ſhouldeſt ſee thē make thēſel e pore helpe make poore make thēſelues rich lyght ſalt pertayned apoſtles kinges ought learned biſhops ſpiritualtie onely pertayneth temporall men alſo kynges ruler bound ſalt light onely example liuing alſo teaching doctrine vnto ſubiects wel bounde puniſhe euill doer doth ſcripture teſtifie kyng dauid choſen ſhepeheard feede people wyth god worde euill ſcholemaſter cannot beate onely good ſcholemaſter ſo teacheth neede beatē ſalt light therefore partayne temporaltie alſo euery mē ber chriſtes church ſo euery man ought ſalt light order euery man may preacher euery man may common preacher thou wilt ſay preach euery owne auctoritie nay verely man may yet commō preacher ſaue called choſen thereto commō ordinaunce congregation long preacher teacheth true worde god euery priuate man ought vertuous lyuing light ſalt hys neighbour ſo much pooreſt ought ſtriue ouerrun byſhop preach hym enſample liuing moreouer euery man ought preach worde deede vnto houſhould vnder gouernaunce c none ought preach •… ly ſuch admitted y• ordinaunce congregation though mā may preach openly ſaue hath office committed vnto hym yet ought euery mā endeuour himſelfe well learned preacher nie poſſible euery man may priuatly enforme hys neighbour yea preacher byſhop nede preacher preach wrong may man whatſoeuer rebuke firſt priuately helpe complayne proued according order charitie yet none amendment thē ought euery man cā reſiſt ſtand chriſtes doctrine ieoparde lyfe looke olde enſamples ſhal teach thee goſpel hath fredome temporall regiment spirituall temporal req •… biffer though euery man body good vnder y• kyng right wrōg yet auctoritie god woorde free aboue kyng ſo worſt realme may tell ye kyng hym wrong doth nought otherwiſe thē god hath cōmaunded hym ſo warne hym auoide wrath god pacient aduenger vnrighteouſnes may ought alſo reſiſt father mother temporall power wyth god worde wrōgfully commaunde hurteth killeth body haue power reſiſte byſhop preacher wyth falſe doctrine ſlayeth ſoules maiſter lord chriſt hath ſhed bloud otherwiſe vnder byſhops chriſt hys apoſtles prophetes vnder byſhops olde law nay verely therefore may alſo ought dyd aunſwere apoſtles dyd act v oportet magi obedire deo euery mā muſt defēde chriſtes doctrine 〈◊〉 owne perſon quàm hominibus muſt rather obey god men goſpell euery man chriſtes diſciple perſon himſelf defend chriſtes doctrine owne perſon fayth byſhop helpe byſhoppes keeping lawe ſufficient muſt beleue chriſt remiſſion ſinne myne owne ſelfe myne owne perſon biſhops preacher defending god woorde inough muſt defende mine owne perſon ieopard lyfe thereon ſee neede occaſion boūd get worldly ſubſtaūce ſelfe myne houſhold iuſt labour ſomewhat thē cannot ſaue neighbour body boūd labour god word haue therof ſtore ſaue neighbour ſoule ſo much tyme reſiſte god yes thou father mother maſter • ſ •… ſſe mā may angry without ſinning huſband lord ruler yet loue mercy angre rebuke puniſhment exceede fault treſpaſſe may man angry loue ye mother ſo wyth child enemyes aſſe fall downe vnder hys burthen thou ſhalt helpe vp agayne leuit xix thou ſhalt hate thy brother thyne hart ſhalt wiſe rebuke thy neighbour thou beare ſinne ſake thou sinnerse helpeth • nde ſinners muſt ſuffer puniſhed ſtudy amēd thy neighbour whē ſinneth ſo art thou partaker ſinnes therfore whē god taketh vengeaunce ſendeth ſoeuer plage puniſh opē ſinners thou muſt periſh thou dyddeſt ſinne light god deepe becauſe thou dyddeſt loue law god mainteine withall thiue hart ſoule power might ſeeth neighbour houſe ieopardie ſet fire warneth helpeth time auoide perill worthy peſtilence warre thy citie puniſh ſinne thereof art y• worthy thine houſe ſhuld infected periſh thou mighteſt haue kept ſinnyng thou haddeſt bene willyng thereto thou thy beſt law god kepe thy land
