laſt farthyng ergo ſhall pay hell ergo purgatory wyſe reaſon ioſeph knew marie till ſhe borne firſt ſonne ergo ſhe bare ſecond knew forgiue thee till dead lyue ergo doe death thouſand like ye haue hard ſayd olde tyme committe adulterie ſaye ſoeuer looketh wife luſtyng hath committed aduoutrie ready hart commaundement committe none adultery phariſeis blinded corrupte ſophiſtrie corruptly phariſeis dyd attribute euil deede onely leuen interpretyng concupiſcēce hart lewde toyes filthy geſtures vncleane wordes clipping kiſſing ſo forth imputed ſinne euen acte dede alone though moyſes ſay text thou ſhalt couet thy neighbour wife c chriſt putteth light ſalt bringeth precept true vnderſtanding naturall caſt agayne condemneth roote ſinne concupiſcence conſent hart world murtherer til haue killed myne hand god kil hate ye loue loue keepe doyng hurt alſo ready prepared helpe nede euen ſo cō ſent hart meanes folow therof well aduoutry god dede ſelfe finally aduouterer god ſo loue neighbour loue forbyd couet hys wife loue fulfilling commaundementes loue fulfillyng law without loue impoſſible abſteine ſinnyng agaynſt neighbour precept occaſion geuen carnall loue ſuffer mother robbe childe maketh robbe ſelfe make riche naturall father ſhal neuer luſt ſonnes wife careth chaſtitie ſonne doth hym ſelfe euē ſo would loue neighbour kepe frō ſinning againſt aduoutrie damnable thyng aduoutrie ſight god much miſchief foloweth therof dauid ſaue honour driuen commit greuous murther alſo vnright ye ſight god man thy child ſhould man coſt man heyre neither canſt thou thy mother haue lightly quyet conſcience god merie hart long ſo moreouer greater ſhame cāſt thou thy neighbour greater diſpleaſure neuer knowen come child thereof preciouſeſt gift mā hath world god true hart wife abyde wealth wo beare fortune haſt thou robbed ſhe hath coupled ſelfe thee ſhe ſhal lightly loue ſo truly haply hate procure hys death moreouer thou haſt vntaught feare god haſt made ſinne agaynſt god god promiſed ſhe man onely law matrimonie god ordinaunce written geneſ xxxix putiphars wyfe would haue ioſeph lye anſwered could wickedneſſe ſynne agaynſt god yea verely impoſſible ſinne agaynſt man except thou ſinne agaynſt god firſt finally read chronicle ſtories ſee hath folowed adulterie ſhall ſay ſome doctours doctoure • aue doubted chriſt hath flatly condemned haue diſputed douted whether ſingle fornication ſhould ſinne condemned chriſt moſes paule teſtifieth 1 cor 6 fornicatour whore keeper ſhall poſſeſſe kyngdome god right th • hope god ſhould bryng vp trute feare knowledge god leaue ſeede careth come therof wherefore thy right eye offende thee plucke caſt frō thee better thee one thy mēbers periſh thē thy whole body ſhould caſt hell euen ſo thy right hand offende thee cut caſt frō thee better thee one thy member periſhe thy whole bodye ſhould caſt hell meant outward mēbers muſt cut noſe eares hand • ote ye muſt procure deſtroy ſeing hearing ſmelling taſting tealing ſo euery man kill himſelfe phraſe ſpeach ebrue tongue cut occaſions daunſing kiſſing riotous cating drinking luſt hart filthy imagination moue man coucupiſcence let euery man haue wyfe thinke fayreſt beſt filthy conditioned euery woman huſband ſo god hath bleſſed wife thy wife made without ſinne good thyng thee ought ſeeme beautifull fayrenes y• ye ſuffer together one bleſſed alſo made croſſe chriſt pleaſaūt ſight god ſhould ſhe thē lothſome thee becauſe little ſuffering yu ſhouldeſt iuſt ſhould defile thy ſoule • lea thy conſcience make thee ſuffer euerlaſtingly ſayd whoſoeuer putteth away wife let geue teſtimoniall deuorcemēt ſay vnto ſoeuer putteth away wife except fornication maketh breake wedlocke ſoeuer marieth deuorced breaketh wedlocke moſes deut xxiiij permitted hys iſraelites extreame neceſſitie ſo hated wiues yt abhorred company put away auoyde worſe inconuenience whereof ye read alſo mat xix knitte thereto might receaue agayne bene knowne perſons • cence ye iewes abuſed put away wiues euery light fayned cauſe whenſoeuer luſted chriſt calleth backe agayne enterpreteth ye lawe firſt ordinaunce cutteth cauſes deuorcement ſaue fornication wiues partie whē ſhe breaketh matrimony caſe moſes law pronoūceth dead ſo ye lawes many coū treyes lawes vſed man free without queſtion let liue man ſee ſigne repentaunce amendment may forgeue may finde hys hart ioſeph holy coulde finde hart take chriſtes mother hym ſpied childe free doubt take lawe interpreteth deede ſinne ought right bynde ſhall woman doe ſhe repent ſo tempted fleſhe ſhe cannot liue chaſte verely ſhew nothing ſcripture office preacher office preacher preach x commaundements lawe naturall promiſe ſubmitte themſelues keepe loue feare god euerlaſting life labour thorow fayth chriſt threatē diſobedient euerlaſting payne hell puniſhment man haue offended thorow frailtie rebuked turne repent receaue vnto grace abſolue hym amende whē rebuked caſt among infidelles ſay temporall power ſhut vp conuict perſon appointing ſober liuyng make ſatiſfaction congregation dampnable example amiſſe better one miſdoer ſuffer common wealth corrupt officer negligent woman able put ſelfe penaunce ſhe went ſhe knowen marry god god mercy man ſame place ſhe treſpaſſeth pitied maryed coulde ſuffer libertie woulde next way prouoke weary huſbandes commit adultery deuorced might marry loued better let temporall ſworde take heede theyr charge therefore truth law temporall bleſſings ſet lawe moſes keeping lawes foloweth kepyng law wealth proſperitie long life vpperhand enemy plenteouſneſſe fruites cheape thyng without peſtilence warre famiſhment maner abhominable diſeaſes plague pertayne v well keepe temporall lawes curſſes terrible plague law threatned throughout foloweth breaking law law moſes hunger dearth warre diſſentiō peſtilence feuers wonderfull ſtraunge fearefull diſeaſes ſweate pockes falling ſickneſſe ſhortyng dayes ſworde hunger ſuch diſeaſes ſhal eate vp youth enemy ſhould haue ye vpperhand people land ſhould miniſhed townes decayed y• land brought wilderneſſe plenteous lande ſhould made barren ſo ordered dearth ſhall deuoure enhabyters wealth amonge ſhoulde oppreſſe reſt thouſand ſuch like ſo nothing beginne ſhould haue proſperous ende thoſe curſſes ſay pertaine v well breake temporall lawes let england looke marke hath chaunced ſince ſ • ue right kyng god annointed ouer king rycharde enormity haue chaū ced ſince y• ſlaughter king richard ye ſecōd vnto realme englād ſecond people townes village miniſhed third parte noble bloude remayneth thirde beleue ſixte yea durſt bolde wene might ſafely ſweare remaineth ſixteneth part owne ſworde hath eaten vp though paſtures enlarged aboue meaſure yet rotte ſheepe moren beaſtes parkes warennes reiſing fine rent make thing twiſe ſo deare owne cōmodities ſo abuſed deſtructiō owne realme right know god keepe lawes ſhould tiraunts god geueth v vp leaueth v handes titaunts miſery god know v keepe v care v fulfill promiſes mercy vnto v ſayth paul ro heathen sicut non probauerunt habere deum noticia ita tradidit illos deus ſeemed good luſt admitted alowed right theyr harte know god god geue honor god feare god auenger euill ſeeke hys euen ſo god gaue vp follow owne blyndneſſe tooke ſpirite grace woulde longer rule wittes euen ſo caſt v yoke temporall lawes yt lawes god drawen ten commaundementes lawe naturall loue thy neighbour thy ſelf god ſhall caſt v let v ſlippe follow owne wit ſhall goe agaynſt v ſoeuer take hand ſo much gather parliament reforme amēoe ought determine ſhalbe owne ſnare confuſion vtter deſtruction ſo enemy haue vnder heauen coulde wiſhe v ſo great miſchiefe owne coūcell ſhall v god ſhall ſo blinde wiſedome wiſe man haue godly councell ſhall haue none audience errour madneſſe daſing ſhall haue vpper hand let ſpiritualtie take heede looke well ſee whether walke haue promiſed admonition god ſteppes hys ſonne chriſt apoſtles whoſe office beare promiſe thē ye deuilles hell god let thē lo wſe coulde haue geuē thē worſe coūſell haue geuen thēſelues xx yeare long god gaue vp hys iſraelites oftē time whē woulde ruled know thēſelues dutie god brought captiuitie vnder enemy proue feele ſaith text whether better ſeruice either ſerue god willingly obay hys lawe coupled wyth ſo manifolde bleſſings ſerue enemy obey cruelneſſe tyranny ſpite heades neede neceſſitie ſet temporaltie remēber becauſe thoſe nacious vnder iſraelites captiuitie deale cruelty puniſhe thē idolatry ſinne committed agaynſt god haue landes goodes ſeruice onely reioyſing make worſe father fauour therefore god ſcourged child mough beate labour purpoſe mā ruler ought touching ſuch runne runne wife leaue deſolate ʋerely ruler ought make law ſo come agayn certaine day ſpace yeare ſo thē baniſhed countrey come agayne flie wiues without • uſt cauſe come head let wife free mary ſhe right lewde wretch ſhould take good runne wife without cauſe ſit whore yea come agayne yeare two haue knowen robbe hys wife ſhe hath gotten ye meane time goe agayne whore paul ſayth corinthiaus man womābe coupled infidell infidell depart free mary luſt 1 timo 5 ſaith man prouideth namely thē owne ſhould ſame denieth faith worſe infidell euen ſo man much interpreted infidell cauſeleſſe runneth wife let ſay gouerners take heede let ſinne vnpuniſhed bring wrath god vppon realmes god wilbe aduenged iniquitie puniſhe plague heauen like maner woman depart cauſeleſſe reconciled though ſhe commit none adultery man ought right free marie agayne cauſes ſeperate ſelues impaciēcie one ſuffre others infirmity muſt remaine vnmaried part burne let ſame ſuffer y• payne infirmity temporalitie ought make lawes bridle vnruly partie agayne ye haue heard howe ſayd old tyme forſweare thy ſelfe pay thyne othes vnto lord ſay vnto ſweare neither heauen ſeate god neither earth hys footeſtole neither ieruſalē citie great king neither ſhalte thou ſweare thyne head thou canſt make white heere blacke communicatiō ſhalbe yea yea nay nay ought aboue procedeth euill hate hart couet swearing man wife ſinne phariſeis hide one thyng hart ſpeake mouth deceaue mās neighbour bounde oth though moſes ſay leuit xix lye deceaue man hys neighbour one yet interpreted good councell man deſired perfect precept bynde vnder payne ſinne ſo meanes onely ſpake true alſo lyed deceaue compelled ſweare confirme wordes othes would beleued chriſt bringeth light ſalt texte phari • eis darckened corrupt ſtynkyng myſt ſophiſtrie forbiddeth ſweare either god creature god thou canſt ſweare none othe except diſhonour ſhall redound vnto ye name god thou ſweare god ſweare god ſo god wil meanyng thou makeſt god iudge aduenge thee thou ſayeſt thou ſhalt thou promiſeſt truth thy woordes thou ſhameſt thyne heauenly father teſtifieſt thou beleueſt righteous iudge wil aduenge vnrighteouſneſſe wicked thou art conſēteth laugheth thee thou deceaueſt thy brother well created likeneſſe god deare bought precious bloude chriſt thou thus thee wicked ſonne name thy father diſhonoured law feared hys promiſes beleued thou ſweareſt goſpell booke bible meanyng god thon lye ſhall fulfill vnto thee promiſes mercy written contrarywiſe bryng vpō thee curſſes plague vē geance therin threatned vnto ye diſobedient euill doer euen ſo thou ſweareſt creature bread ſalt meanyng thou deſireſt creatour therof ſhall aduenge thee thou lye c wher men ought ſo 〈◊〉 deale wordes may credited without othes fore dealyng ought ſo ſubſtā tiall wordes might beleued without othe wordes ſignes truth harte ought pure ſingle loue toward thy brother ſoeuer proceedeth loue damnable falſehead deceaue pure loue ſtand together therfore damnable ſinne deceaue thy brother lying though yu adde othe thy woordes much damnable deceaue adde othe therto c howbeit maner ſwearyng swearing ſort lawfull▪ forbydden maner killyng whē cōmaundement ſaith kill iudges ruler muſt kill euē ſo ought whē put man office take othe ſhalbe true faithfull diligent therein ſubiectes lawfull take othes offer thē ſelues beare witneſſe ſuperiour would compel inferiour ſweare ſhould diſhonour god hurting innocent inferiour ought rather dye ſweare neither ought iudge cōpell man ſwere agaynſt ſelf make ſinne forſweare wherof inough ſpoken place forbidden ſwearyng betwene neighbour neighbour priuate buſyneſſe dayly communicatiō cuſtomable ſwearyng though lyed doth robbe name god due reuerence feare dayly cōmunication buſineſſe one ſo much vanitie wordes many thyngs lye confirme othe though beguile take name god vayne vnreuerently agaynſt ſecond precept lye entent beguile damnable ſelf much abuſe holy name god thereto call god vengeaunce vpon thyne owne ſelfe many caſes yet chaunce dayly charitie moderareth law betwene man man charitie compelleth ſweare know neighbour falſely ſclaundered bound report truth may lawfully ſweare yea bounde neede though iudge vnto y• weake ye nay haue loſt credence thorow multitude lyers man may lawfully ſweare put doubt yet commeth y• othe euill abuſe language deceaue withall finally ſweare performe euill othe double • ſinne euill dampnable performe double damnation herodes oth made innocent giltleſſe death iohn baptiſt though hipocrite knowen wiues daughter would haue aſked whē men ſay king worde muſt ſtand trouth oth promiſe lawfull expedient promiſes added god lawfull • et though added interprete added borow thy ſworde houre promiſe bring thee agayne thou beſide thy ſelfe promiſe pay certaine day meane tyme robbed decayed chaunce cannot performe forſworne whoſe hart ment truly hee promiſed forſworne myne hart ment truely promiſed many like caſes touched place lye alſo diſſemble alway ſinne dauid 1 reg 27 tolde kyng achis philiſtine robbed hys owne people iewes bene rouing among amalekites flayne man woman childe telling lye diſſemble 〈◊〉 ſome cauſes culpable tale yet lye ſinne deſtroy amalekytes thoſe deadly enemy fayth one almighty god neither ſinned cuſai dauids truſty frend 2 reg 17 fayning beguilyng abſolon pleaſed god highly beare ſicke man hand wholeſome bitter medicine ſwete make hym drinke dutie charitie ſinne perſwade hym purſueth hys neighbour hurt hym ſlay hym hys neighbour gone contrary way duty euery chriſten man law charitie ſinne though confirmed othe lye deceaue hurt dampnable onely c ye haue heard ſayde eye eye toth toth ſay vnto ye withſtand wrong mā geue thee blow right cheeke turne alſo man goe lawe thee take away thy coate let hym haue thy clocke thereto mā compell thee goe mile goe twaine geue aſketh hym would borow turne away chriſt entēdeth diſanull temporall regiment forbid ruler puniſhe euill doer ment deſtroy matrimony forbad luſt couet man wife hart forbad defileth matrimony euen ſo forbiddeth troubleth vnquieteth deſtroyeth temporall regimēt thyng forbid temporall regiment ordayned man aduenge himſelfe chriſt medleth temporall regiment long ſermon fighteth agaynſt phareſeyes falſe doctrine ſalteth law purge corruption filthy gloſes bring vnto right taſte true vnderſtanding agayne phariſeyes ſo enterpret lawe moſes pertayned onely vnto ruler euery priuate perſon might aduenge hymſelfe aduerſary much harme againe receaued hym angry haue deſerued men pronounce death vpon hym ſayth racha hath deſerued mē ſhould gather coū ſell determine ſome ſondry cruell death ſo haynous crime calleth hys brother foole haue deſerued hell deſerueth ſmiteth aduengeth himſelfe wyth owne hand forbidden therfore priuate wrath onely man aduenge himſelfe turne cheeke mater cheke ſpeaking vnderſtand woordes ſounde turne cheke cutte hand plucke eye commaunde child onely come nie brooke water alſo ſo hardy looke way either looke fier thinke fier impoſſible obſerued ſpoken ment feare make perceaue earneſt commaunde euen ſo meaning yt wiſe aduenge prepared euer ſuffer much neuer thinke lawfull aduenge great ſoeuer iniurie himſelfe turned cheeke whē ſmitten byſhoppe yet paule whē buffeted byſhop alſo ye haue heard little aboue bleſſed meeke mekenes ſhall poſſeſſe earth let world ſtudie thee wrong yea let thee wrong yet thou meeke thou ſhalt haue foode rayment inough thee thyne moreouer worſt come god ſhall yet ſet ſuch tyraunt ouer thee thou meeke canſt cō tent polle thee properly euen thou mayſt beare ſhall defend thee polled pollyng auoyde intollerably hys lite bitter euen death hym impatient cannot ſuffer polled yea poll thy ſelfe preuent geue baylife like officer capon pigge gooſſe ſo thy landlord likewiſe thou haue great ferme lambe calfe let thy wife viſit thy landladye three foure tymes yeare wyth ſpiſed cake apple peares cheries ſuch like thou ready thyne ox horſes three foure halfe doſen dayes yeare ſet home wood plow lād yea thou haue good horſe let haue hym good cheape take worſe hym ſhal thy ſhilde defende thee though tyraūtes care god man elſe ſhall dare polle thee thereto thou maiſt wiſdome get ſhall recompence thou dooſt thys meane thou patient wiſe feare god thereto loue thine neighbour none euill thou keepe thy ſelfe fauour hurting thy neighbour thine ende euill laſt deſperation thys worlde hell thou canſt polle thy ſelfe wiſdome laugh beare good countenaūce though thou reioyſedſt ſuch perſonnes polle thee euery man ſhall polle thee ſhall mainteine defende thee let therefore cō mon prouerbe contented polled ſome man polled euery man ye muſt vnderſtand two ſtates degree thys worlde two maner ſtates degree regimētes kyngdome heauen regiment goſpell y• kingdome world temporall regimēt firſt ſtate neither father mother ſonne daughter neither maſter mayſtres mayoe manſeruaunt huſband wyfe lord ſubiect man woman chriſt ech chriſt himſelfe none better like good brother chriſt onely lord ouer neither thyng law ſaue loue one chriſt loued v temporall regiment huſband wyfe father mother ſonne daughter maiſter mayſtreſſe mayde manſeruaunt lord ſubiect euery perſon double perſon euery mā ſpiritualtie temporalitie vnder regimentes firſt regiment thou art perſon thyne owne ſelfe vnder chriſt doctrine mayſt neither hate angry much leſſe fight aduenge muſt enſample chriſt humble thy ſelfe forſake deny thy ſelfe hate thy ſelfe caſt thy ſelfe away meeke patient let euery mā goe ouer thee tread thee vnder foote thee wrong yet loue pray chriſt crucifiers loue loue damnable caſt kyngdome kyngdome knowledge god chriſt loueth knoweth neyther god 〈…〉 loueth neighbour • ath ye true fayth chriſt chriſt therefore loueth kingdome minor wiſe proued knoweth god chriſt ſeeth light chriſt light hateth hys brother darcknes walketh darcknes wotteth whether goeth darcknes hath blinded hys eye 1 ioh 2 ergo hateth brother knoweth chriſt hath done hym therefore hath true fayth ſpirituall kyngdome god hate thy ſelfe ſhalt thou get thou conſidereſt thyne owne ſinnes deepe dampnation long thereto due repentaunce loue thou ſhalt obtayne thou beholde great infinite mercy god wyth ſtrōg faith none ſo great enemy thee worlde thou ſhalt lightly loue hym thou looke well loue god ſhewed thee chriſt temporall regiment thou art temporall regiment perſon reſpect thou art huſband father mother maiſter maiſtreſſe lord ruler wife ſonne daughter ſeruaūt ſubiect c thou muſt accordyng thyne office yu father thou muſt office father rule el thou damneſt thy ſelfe thou muſt bryng vnder obedience whether fayre meanes foule thou muſt haue obedience thy wife thy ſeruauntes thy ſubiectes muſt obey wil obey loue thou muſt chide fight farre law god law land ſuffer thee yu cāſt rule thē thou art bound many caſes deliuer thē vnto hyer officer thou dyddeſt take charge ouer thē purpoſe whether mā violence reſiſt violēce vnderſtode may reſiſt violence defend aduenge ſelfe ſay nay firſt ſtate thou art perſon thy ſelfe alone chriſtes diſciple thou muſt loue loue ſtudie enforce yea ſuffer thynges chriſt dyd make peace bleſſyng god may come vpon thee ſayth bleſſed peace maker ſhalbe child god thou ſuffer keepeſt peace thy ſelfe onely thy bleſſyng poſſeſſion world thou ſo loue peace thy brethrē thou leaue nothyng vndone vnſuffred thy bleſſyng thou ſhalt god ſonne conſequently poſſeſſe heauen worldly ſtate thou art priuate man perſon reſpect thou onely mayeſt alſo muſt art bounde vnder payne dāuation execute thyne office thou art father thou muſt haue obedience fayre meanes foule thou art huſband thou muſt require obedience chaſtitie get attēpt law land commaundeth thy ſeruauntes thou muſt exact obedience feare mayeſt ſuffer thy ſelfe deſpiſed thou art ruler therto ruler muſt puniſhe • ut malice defence people maintenaunce y• lawes appoynted thou muſt take priſon ſlea malice hate aduenge thy ſelfe defend thy ſubiectes mainteine thine office concernyng thy ſelfe oppreſſe thy ſubiectes rent fynes cuſtome neither pitie tax ſuch like mainteine thyue owne luſtes louyng kinde chriſt thee price bloud thoſe euill doer among vexe brother know thee iudge feare thy law ſmite vpon draw thy ſword put vp vntill thou haue thyne office yet without hate thee perſon maiſters ſake becauſe firſt regiment thy brother amende euely cānot thou muſt loſe one ſaue many execute thine office ſuch aſſertion ſuch compaſſion ſorow hart thou wouldeſt thine owne arme ſaue reſt body take example thou art thy father houſe among thy brother example vnderſtand y• two regimentes ſiſters one fight thee wrōg thou mayſt aduenge ſmite pertayneth thy father onely thy father geue thee authoritie hys abſence commaund thee ſmyte ruled art perſon notwithſtanding yet thou haſt put firſt perſō art brother ſtill muſt euer loue proue thyng rule loue loue ſerue thou muſt vſe office perſon ſinne agaynſt thy father euen ſo thou art temporal perſon thou putteſt ſpirituall therfore thou muſt euer loue loue wil helpe thou muſt loue execute office temporall perſon ſinne agaynſt god mother ſmite loue ſo mayſt thou loue execute office thy ſeconde ſtate wife ſonne ſeruaūt ſubiect brethrē firſt ſtate put perſon reaſon ſecōd degree therfore muſt loue euer loue pay cuſtome tribute ſoeuer thou art bound loue feare honour obedience belong paule teacheth rom xiij though doe dutie loue thee rule rigorouſneſſe deale vnkindly thee thou deſeruyng yet cleaue thou chriſt loue ſtil let euill ouercome thy goodneſſe make thee euill alſo example aboue thy father hath power ouer thee commaund thee vſe power ouer thy brother euen ſo hath thy maſter geue thee hys authoritie ouer thy felowes whiche thou haſt thou muſt remember thou art felow ſtill bound loue ſtill loue alone helpe put thy maſters authoritie vnto thy loue ſo hath ruler power ouer thee ſend thee vſe violence vppon thy neighbour take priſon hym happly kill thou muſt euer loue thy neighbour thyne hart reaſon thy brother firſt ſtate yet obey thy ruler go cōſtable like officer breake open thy neighbour doore opē kynges name yea yeld kyngs name thou muſt lay ſmite ground till ſubdued loke harme getteth yea though ſlayne owne head thine hart loued yt deſiredeſt louingly obey haſt aduēged thy ſelfe ſtate thou art brother worldly ſtate thou art maner perſon caſe thou executed authoritie hath ſuch power god commaunde thee thou damned god thou diddeſt obey like thy lord prince warriour ſend thee warfare land thou muſt obey god commaundement go aduēge thy prince quarell whiche thou knoweſt right thou commeſt thether remember thou art firſt ſtate thē agaynſt whō thou muſt fight thy brother deepely bought chriſtes bloud thou chriſtes ſake beloued thyne hart ſee thou deſire neither life goodes ſaue aduēge thy prince quarell bryng vnder thy prince power content thy prince wage ſuch thou 〈…〉 〈…〉 〈…〉 parte ſpoyle thou haſt wonne thy prince deputie appointeth thee thou hate thē thyne hart coueteſt goddes art glad occaſion founde thou careſt whether right wrong thou mayſt go robbyng murtheryng vnpuniſhed art thou murtherer ye ſight god thy bloud wil ſhed agayne either ſame warre folowyng thou art come home thou dyddeſt thyne hart ſo ſhalt thou robbe ſteale hanged thy labour ſlayne ſome miſchief cōcernyng goodes world eaſie iudge goodesin firſt ſtate degree yt oughteſt thankfull chriſt loue geue lend bought precious bloud thou art able thou oweſt chriſt whoſe ſeruaūt thou art muſt pay thē thou doeſt math xxv thē ſame thou doeſt chriſt thou art ready thē denyeſt thou chriſt thy brother hold take away force aboue thou mayſt ſpare reaſon ſome office thou haſt ſecond ſtate inuade thee violently lay thy backe thou canſt beare thē hold thyne hart hand thou neither hate ſmite ſpeake fayre louingly let neighbour goe betwene thou haſt proued meanes loue vayne complaine law officer ſet thy father defend thee iudge betwene thee thy brother go • 〈◊〉 lawethou wilt ſay text forbiddeth go law ſayth •… man law thee take thy coate thou muſt let haue gowne muſt ſuffer ſelfe robbed ye law wilt thou ſay right law recouer myne aunſwere behold text diligently right law man take thy coate frō thee ye law ordeyned god mainteine thee thy right forbydde wrong ſhould done thee wherfore text meaneth thus law vniuſtly miniſtred gouerners iudges corrupt take brybes parciall pacient ready ſuffer euer much ſoeuer vnright done thee rather riſe agaynſt iudge magiſtrate ſo reſiſte god impaciencie thou ſhouldeſt aduenge thy ſelfe thy neighbour rayle make inſurrection agaynſt ſuperiours whiche god hath ſet ouer thee riſe agaynſt rebell againſt god againſt thy father ſcourgeth thee thyne offēce thouſād tymes ſinne aduēge thee thy neighbour rayle rayle god though thou wouldeſt blaſp •… made ſicke poore 〈◊〉 • ow degree otherwiſe thē thou wouldeſt made thy ſelfe thou wilt happely ſay ſubiectes euer choſe ruler make prince whether may reſiſted put downe ſubiectes caſe hym ſweare keepe law mainteine priuilegies •… erties vpon ſubmit ſelues vnto hym ergo rule amiſſe bounde obey may reſiſt put downe agayne aunſwere argument nought huſband ſweareth wife yet though forſweare ſelfe hath power compell hym alſo though maiſter keepe couenaunt ſeruaunt one neighbour yet hath neither ſeruaunt yet neighbour though vnder none obedience power aduenge vengeaunce pertayneth euer higher officer whō thou muſt complayne yea • ay like whole body ſubiectes choſe thoſe ruler cuius eſt ligare eius eſt ſoluere ergo rule amiſſe ſet vp may put hym downe agayne anſwere god common people chuſeth prince though chuſe hym deut xvi god commaundeth chuſe ſet vp officer therefore god chiefe chuſer ſetter vp ſo muſt chiefe putter downe agayne ſo without ſpeciall commaundement may put downe agayne hath god geuen commaundement put downe agayne contrariwiſe haue annointed kyng ouer v commaundement ſayth touch myne annointed ieopardy riſe agaynſt thy prince annointed ouer thee euill ſo euer ſee ſtory kyng dauid thoroughout bookes kinges authority kyng authority god ſubiectes king hath god authoritie compared king ſubiectes ſtill though king neuer ſo euill thouſand ſonnes gathered together ſinnes ſtill commaundement obey father goeth ouer well ouer one euen ſo goeth commaundement ouer ſubiectes obey prince higher power reſiſteth reſiſteth god getteth dampnation vnto argument cuius eſt ligare eius eſt ſoluere aunſwere bindeth aunſwere former argument wyth abſolute power without higher authoritie might louſe agayne bindeth man commaundement may louſe agayne without y• commaundement ſame london chuſe maior may put downe agayne euill ſo euer without authority hym whoſe licence choſe long power officer one vnder inferior thee wrong complayne higher hygheſt thee wrong thou muſt complayne god onely wherefore onely remedy againſt euill ruler thou turne thine eye thy ſelfe thyne owne ſinne thē looke vp god ſay father ſinne ſinne father miſery come vpon v know thee father obey thee walke thy wayes therfore thou knoweſt v thy ſounes ſet louing ſcholemaſters ouer v hate thy law therefore haſt thou thorough wickednes vnrighteous iudges made law defence tyraunt moſt cruel oppreſſe v v iniury aboue kindes violence robbing amende thy liuing meeke patient let robbe much yet ſhall god geue thee foode raiment honeſt poſſeſſion earth mayntaine thee thine withall moreouer concerning thy good goodes thou muſt remember thou art perſon temporall regimēt kyng ouer thy body euē ſo lord thy good kyng • ee lord thy body ſo 〈◊〉 hee thy goodes hym thou holdeſt thy ſelfe onely maintaine thy wife child ſeruauntes maintaine kyng realme countrey towne citie tho •… dwelleſt wherefore thou mayſt ſuffer thē waſted thou able thy dutie thē ſeruaūt may ſuffer maſters good go wracke neghgently prouideth namely hys owne houſholde ſayth paule denieth fayth worſe infidell euery man bounde labour diligently truely therewith ſo ſoberly make light worke many may beate one alone cannot thy wife thy child ſeruauntes art thou bounde defende man would force thy wife thy daughter thy mayde inough thee looke ſay god amede nay thou muſt execute thine office authoritie kyng geueth thee way y• muſt defēde thy maſter good king good thou haſt maintaine thy wife houſholde withall thine neighbour goeth thee agaynſt theues murtherers againſt ſuch perſons lay thee thou wouldeſt thou vnder kinges ſtandard againſt enemy inuaded realme ſuch perſons mortall enemy realme ſeeke put downe king law altogether make might lawfull ſinne vnpuniſhed maner thou marke well difference theſe two ſtates regimentes thou mayſt ſoyle like doubtes ſhalbe layde agaynſt thee moreouer whē ſay two regimēts regiment ſpirituall temporall euen ſo heare ou • god worde ought beleue liue rule pooreſt begger realme euen ſo ſpirituall officer ſinne againſt neighbour teach ſpiritualitie may rebuke king vice ſo may kyngs vſe temporall correctiō good yet moſes ſayth thou ſhalte hate thy brother thyne hart agayne thou ſhalt aduenge thy ſelfe beare hate thy minde agaynſt child thy people thine enemyes aſſe ſinke vnder burthē helpe lift vp oxe euill yet loue ſhew kyndneſſe father ſake ſtudy amend thē haſt thou reioyce thy religion better religion theenes publican theeues loue among ſelues ſo couetous world vſurers publican bought great emperours tribute make moſt aduauntage ouer ſet ye people nay inough thee loue thy benefactours onely monkes frier thine owne coate order brother thyne owne abbay onely among ſome loue ſtretcheth impoſſible perfect haue pure doctrine without falſe opinion thyne hart folow learnyng expoſition ſixt chapter take heede almoſe ye men ſene thē el ye get reward father whiche heauen therfore thou geueſt almoſe make trompet blowen thee hypocrite synagoges ſtretes prayſed mē ʋerely ſaye vnto haue reward thou thou geueſt almoſe let thy left hand knowe thy right hand doth thine almoſe may ſecret thy father ſeethin ſecret ſhall reward thee openly hee rebuked theyr doctrine aboue euē ſo rebuketh workes deuiliſh doctrine cā almoſe ſpryng godly workes workes rebuketh verely ſuch god scripture beauty hys fayle finally many diſpute becauſe workes iuſtifie ſinne neither deſerue rewarde promiſed god hath promiſed rewarde deedes heauen deedes deſerue heauen becauſe promiſeth ſhew mercy ye benefite ſo able recompence oweth father mother thouſand partes though able dutie blindneſſe know hys dutie yet father mother promiſe moe giftes ſtill without ceaſing ſuch thinke ſhoulde moſt make ſee loue prouoke willing part dutie hath done amiſſe though haue power ſatiſfaction luſt courage come ye right way agayne yet loue mercy abydeth ſtill ſo great vppon appointment mending onely forgeue paſt fulfill promiſe neuertheles promiſe greater giftes euer better father mother thē euer cannot y• thouſand part dutie coulde deſerue ſuch promiſes father mother labourer doth hyre rewarde therefore commeth loue mercy truth father mother well childe keepeth appointment fulfill promiſe hath broken appointment deſeruing childe euen ſo thus drowned rewarde commeth deſerts th •… loue god beareth 〈◊〉 thorough faith ieſus chriſt blindneſſe ſhould eaſely ſee cannot thouſand parte dutie god though life come life come right ſhould touch creature god otherwyſe hath appoynted though life come neuertheleſſe bene right adā abſtayned forbiddē apple tree bene forbid yea though life come leſſe right loued brother forgaue day ſeing ſhall ſinne agaynſt morrow becauſe father cannot geue child heauen hath power charge loue one another forgeue aduenge one hath right beat ſmite ech becauſe cannot geue heauen bondman hath maſter cruell reaſonable man would dogge heauen might bond ſeruaunt accuſe god vnrighteouſnes becauſe hath made hym maſter cannot dutie thouſand partes though ſuch promiſes thyng commaunded leſſe dutie though ſuch promiſe eaſie perceaue reward promiſed commeth goodnes mercy truth promiſer make v gladder dutie deſeruing receauer haue done ought ſay hart dutie ought thouſand tymes god promiſed v mercy goodneſſe chriſt might yet right damne v haue left vndone touching forgeueneſſe ſinne though forgeueneſſe ſinne may chalēge pro •… merites chriſtes bloud promiſed vnto thee yet chalenge thy merites merites chriſtes bloud heare paule ſayth phil iij concerning righteouſnes law faultleſſe ſuch man could rebuke thinges vauntage thought domage chriſtes ſake ye thinke thing dammage loſſe excellēt knowledge ſake chriſt ieſus lord whoſe ſake let go loſſe count thē chaffe refuſe ſay thinges purged refuſed thyng tryed made perfect might wynne chriſt might found hauyng righteouſnes yt cōmeth yt lawe y• cōmeth faith chriſt ieſu righteouſnes commeth god fayth know power reſurrection lord ouer ſinne onely thyng ſlayeth vanquiſheth ſinne know alſo felowſhyp paſſions might made like vnto death righteouſneſſe true merites tryed muſt content chaffe chriſtes pure corne ſcome refuſe croſſe chriſtes pure gold muſt faſhion ſelues lyke vnto chriſt take euery man croſſe ſlea mortifie ſinne fleſhe el cannot bee partaker hys paſſion ſinne doe conuerſion forgeuen clearely thorough fayth repent ſubmit ſelues new lyfe ſinne doe agaynſt willes meane ſpirite conuerſion workes haue two willes fightyng one agaynſt ſinne alſo • • forgeuen v fayth repent ſubmit ſelues amēde diligence workyng kepeth v frō ſinnyng agayne miniſheth ſinne remaineth fleſh maketh v pure leſſe apte diſpoſed ſinne maketh v mery aduerſities ſtrong temptation bold go god ſtrong feruent ſayth prayer ſure ſhalbe heard whē negligēce 〈◊〉 doyng •… ed bryn •… th v deſperation cry helpe nede either ſelues brother negligent ſinne brought temptation vnto point deſperation feele paynes hell ſo ſtand doubt whether god hath caſt away aduerſitie ſorowfull diſcouraged thinke god angry puniſheth ſinnes two apte ſimilitudes 〈◊〉 well •… l doings child taketh payne hys father pleaſure ſure ſhal haue thāke reward labour mery reioyſeth worke paine ſuffreth ſo aduerſitie keepe ſelues ſinnyng child whē beaten faute whē thinketh father angry loueth hym anone deſperate diſcouraged ſo aduerſitie weake ſinne oft child neuer diſpleaſeth father bold father preſence ſpeake hym ſelfe frend oft offē deth correct chidde though peace made agayne yet remembraunce hys offence maketh fearefull miſtruſt thinke hys father would heare ſo fayth weake promiſe ſinne oft profeſſe profeſſeth newe lyfe hath promiſe mercy chriſt new liuyng euer ſo much dreame faith haue faith haue promiſe except conuerted new lyfe therfore aduerſities temptation death vtterly diſpayre mercy periſh thou prayeſt thou ſhalt like hipocrites loue ſtand pray sinagoges corner ſtreates might ſene men ʋerely ſay vnto haue reward thou therfore thou prayeſt goe thy chamber ſhut thy doore pray thy father whiche ſecret thy father ſeeth ſecret ſhall reward openly almoſe foloweth prayer prayer chriſten man part helpe neighbour beare hym hee ouer charged ſuffer • ſtād one long lyue earth euen ſo becauſe euer ſuch perill combraunce cānot rydde ſelues muſt dayly hourely cry god aide ſuccour wel neighbour ſelues geue almoſe pray faſt workes muſt ſeaſoned god worde ſhall pleaſe god thing whether betwen thee god betwen thee thy neighbour cāſt thou neuer pleaſe god therewith except thou haue true knowledge god word ſeaſon thy deedes god hath put rule scripture without thou cauſt moue heere thyne head damnable ſight god y• iewes though paul beareth record haue feruent zeale god yea haue scripture therto yet becauſe haue true vnderſtā dyng dānable hypocrite ſcrappes almoſe get hundred fold prayer get prayſe thou ſeeſt pray therto robbe widowes houſes thou readeſt math xxiij faſtyng get fat belyes full diſhes euer inough yet none almoſe praying faſtyng among ſight god prayer exclude true prayer make impoſſible ſhould amōg prayer either longyng honour prayer name god men ſhould feare kepe preceptes many wayes benefites receaued contrary firſt haue thankes world prayer robbe onely widowes houſes alſo lord prince emperour world houſe land yea wittes bynde god thāke geue beſide thankes haue gotten world thy wordes long habling knoweth thy matter better thou thy ſelfe though iewes heathen ſo fooliſhe thorough vnbeliefe bable many word yet neuer ſo madde • mble buze woordes vnderſtoode thou wilt ſay matter maketh ſpeake wordes vnderſtand pray ſeing god knoweth matter ready aunſwere haue thee open thine hart enforme edifie thine owne ſelfe thou mighteſt know goodnes put thy truſt confidence hym flie time neede thankfull loue obey cō maundementes turne cō uerted vnto thy lord god runne wilde vngodly know benefites god therefore vnthankfull obey hys commaundementes thou mayſt know pray geueth thee ſhort inſtruction enſample ſaying maner pray father art heauē dater noſter expounded firſt thou muſt goe mercifull father owne goodnes fatherly loue beareth thee ready thee thou cāſt deſire though thou haue merites becauſe thy father onely thou wilt turne henceforth ſubmitte thy ſelfe learne hys wyll honoured thy name honour god name honoured prayſed thy name honoured prayſed thou honour god honour yt name god one honour name god dread loue hym keepe hys commaundementes whē childe obeyeth father honoureth prayſeth hys father rebellion diſobedient diſhonoureth hys father vnderſtandyng meaning father ſeing thou art father ouer powre thy ſpirite vppon fleſh make men feare dread loue thee father keeping thy commaundementes honour thee thy holy name thy kingdome come kinges muſt commaunde nothyng forbid thing contrary god worde ſeyng thou art kyng ouer make know thee make kynges ruler thy ſubſtitutes commaunde nothyng according thy worde make ſubiectes obey thy fulfilled earth heauen one goeth much thou art father kyng ouer thy child brother among ſelues make v obedient ſeeke thy aungelles heauen make man ſeeke hys owne thine thou withdraw thyne hād tempt thy child ruler cōmaunde ought contrary thy make ſubiectes ſtand faſt thy worde offer themſelues ſuffer extremitie rather obey finally pray thee temptation requeſt thing god hād muſt pray done aduerſities deſiring thee whatſoeuer thyng meane truely yet thou knoweſt ſeeſt better way thy glory profite thy thy ſonne ieſus gaue v enſample deſired bene poſſible cuppe bitter death might haue departed frō hym ſaying yet thou wilt geue v dayly bread bread vnderſtoode maner dayly breade whereby vnderſtoode pertaineth vnto neceſſitie lyfe ſuſtinaunce ebrue ſpeach yea vnderſtand therby pertayneth vnto neceſſitie thys life haue bread dearth nothing yt pinch namely land geue v dayly bread geue v neceſſitie life dayly requireth geue v day day nede deſire haue ſtore many yeares exclude neceſſitie praying thee thy daunger forget thee miniſter day day may dayly feele thy benefites neuer forget thee thou geue v aboundaunce aboue deſire geue v hart vſe beſtow purpoſe thou gaueſt deale neighbour loue inordinatly thinke thyne thou mayſt take away euery houre content thou ſo ac thy pleaſure ſo euer haue dayly bread forgeue v treſpaſſes forgeue treſpaſſers becauſe knoweth nature ſo weake cannot ſinne dayly therefore teacheth v dayly repēt reconcile ſelues together dayly aſke god forgeueneſſe seing cōmaundeth v aſke may behold ſo beleue forgeue v mā therfore nedeth diſpayre repent aſke forgeueneſſe euer ſo deepe hath ſinned thinketh looked ſomewhat nerer text neded make pope ſo great god pardon chriſt man beleued ſheweth v ſure ſurer way pardon way yea ſenſible way may feele pardoned ſinnes forgeuen haue experiēce pope thyngs whether ſo pardon deliuer man purgatorie god putteth v vnto world cā bleſſe heale man ſo much poore agew totheach diſeaſes yet hys owne confeſſion god putteth v purge v ſinne cannot ſee feele haue experience ſo hee mightie come land neuer mā ſure neuer mā ſhould come might tel many wonder maſter doth vtopia man could rebuke chriſt maketh thee ſure thou mayſt bee ſure pardon thy ſinnes pardon thou canſt forgeue thy brother god hath bound ſelfe forgeue thee man haue ſinned agaynſt hard lyfe neuertheleſſe yet profeſſion thyne hart yu knoweſt thy dutie forgeue thy brother thy father ſake art obedient thy father ordinaunce wouldeſt forgeue thy brethrē offended thee aſke thee forgeueneſſe haſt thou ſame ſpirit god deſireth marke chriſt ſayth aboue begynnyng fift chap bleſſed mercyfull ſhall haue mercy doeſt thou pitie thy brethen ſinne doeſt thy beſt amend thē thy father name may honoured thē haſt thou whereby thou art ſure mercy ſoone thou deſireſt agayne bleſſed peace maker ſhall god child lo variaunce among thy brother one haue offended thy beſt ſet thē one thou haſt ſame thing god deſireth thee hathe bound himſelfe forgeue thee leade v temptation let v ſlippe thy leaſe hold v faſt geue v vp ceaſe gouerne v take thy ſpirite v hounde folow game ſeeth cannot ſelues • 〈◊〉 lowſe ſo fall ſinne occaſiō geuen v thou vnthankfull diſobediēt thy true prophetes yet let deuill lowſe vpon v deceaue v falſe prophetes harden v way gladly walke thou diddeſt pharao falſe miracle ſorcerers thine apoſtle paule threateneth v miracle ſuffici • perſuade couetouſneſſe pharao gredyneſſe hold child iſraell bōdage ſeruice thy true miracle ſhewed moyſes deliueraūce thee ſame kynd done ſame craft miracle ſorcerers ſo harden ſonnes doctrine iohn vij beleue yt fayninges moſt holy father ſuperſtitions poperie inuiſible bleſſinges hardē ſtone caſt vp y• ayre neither go higher neither yee abyde whē power hurler ceaſeth driue euen ſo father ſeyng corrupt nature go downeward onely deuill world driueth therto y• ſame waye procede vertue ſtand thy power ceaſe v leade v therfore mercyful father temptation ceaſe tyme gouerne v ſeyng god al mercy knoweth thine infirmitie commaundeth thee pray temptation aduerſitie hath promiſed helpe thou truſt excuſe ſay whē thou haſt ſinned could ſtand ſelfe power ready helpe thee thou haddeſt aſked deliuer v euill firſt aboue let v fall temptation secondarely fallen liueth falleth neuer neuer fall inough make ſhuld thinke hym ſelfe without ſinne euill lucifer mā euill lucifer beleue ſtode owne power therfore fallen euen bottome ſo euer deepe put thine arme long ſtrong inough plucke v agayne thirdly deliuer v frō euill plucke v fleſh world power deuill place v thy kyngdome paſt ieopardy ſinne kingdome power glorie thyne euer amen becauſe thou onely art y• king ſubſtitutes becauſe power thyne men power borowed thee therfore ought honour obedience thyne right chief lord none geuen men onely office hold thee neither ought creature ſeeke world brother till thou haue put office thē brotherlyneſſe helpe whiche ought firſt proue let hym execute thy power neither may mā take authoritie ſelfe till god haue choſē til choſen ordinaūce god hath ſet y• world rule finally king lord maſter ruler hath abſolute power world thyng whiche called ceaſed bee brother ſtill neither could ſinne ſoeuer commaunded authoritie limered power tranſgreſſe ſinne agaynſt brother ought reconcile ſelues brother aſke forgeueneſſe bounde forgeue finally let kynges ruler officer kynges 〈◊〉 ſubiectes one afore god remember god kyng referre honour geuen office ſake humble ſelues knowledge confeſſe hart brother euen better god worſt ſubiectes amen ye forgeue men theyr fautes heauenly father ſhall forgeue alſo ye forgeue men fautes ſhall father forgeue fautes god couenaunt v couenaūt god bounde forgeue v forgeue ech confirmation petition aboue rehearſed pater noſter forgeue v treſpaſſes forgeue treſpaſſers thou wilt enter couenaūt thy lord god forgeue thy brother ſoeuer thou haſt committed agaynſt god thou repēt aſke forgeueneſſe thou art ſure thou art ſo abſolued theſe wordes none heauen earth bynde thee though moſt holy father curſe thee blacke coales ſeuen foote vnder earth ſeuen foote aboue caſt lightenyng vpon thee burne thee powder keepe couenaunt yt lord thy god therfore feare bugges thon wilt god couenaunt ſure abſolution keepe come within couenaunt god whē thou haſt profeſſed receaued ſigne therof thou caſt yoke lord thy necke thou ſure thou art bound theſe wordes ſo faſt none heauen earth lowſe thee though earthyſhe god whiſper abſolutions ouer thee claw thee ſtroke thyne head ſwete bleſſynges furthermore though forgeueneſſe thy ſinnes annexed thy worke forgeuyng thy brother yet ſaid thy workes iuſtifie thee god fayth chriſtes bloud promiſes made v ſake doth bryng righteouſneſſe hart righteouſneſſe hart fayth felt knowen worke peter firſt ſecond epiſtle commaūdeth good workes make vocatiō election ſure might feele fayth certified right except man proued tryed cannot knowen neither hym ſelfe men righteous true faith take example leaſt thou beguiled ſophiſtrie chriſt ſayth math xiij kyngdome heauen like leuen womā taketh hideth thre peckes meale till leuenned ſour • leuen leauen many wayed taken ſometyme takē euill ſence doctrine phariſeis corrupted ſweteneſſe word god leuē gloſes ſometime good ſence kingdome heauen ſay goſpell glad tydinges chriſt leuen altereth nature dowe maketh ſowre euen ſo goſpell turneth man new life altereth litle litle firſt hart member faith chriſt firſt certifieth cō ſciēce faith power fruites ſpring thereof forgeueneſſe ſinnes deliuereth v feare euerlaſtyng damnation bryngeth loue god law hart loue righteouſneſſe y• hart loue bringeth good workes mēbers workes y• outward righteouſneſſe righteouſneſſe mēbers hate god vnrighteouſneſſe hart cauſeth euill workes vnrighteouſneſſe member whē hated brother toung ſpake euill handes ſmote loue righteouſnes ſo forth loue righteouſneſſe hart cauſeth good workes righteouſneſſe mē bers loue brother haue nede pouertie loue make put myne hand purſe almory geue ſome refreſh c loue god commaundementes righteouſneſſe hart doth man doubt ſaue hartleſſe loue ſpryngeth fayth thou mayſt euidētly ſee ioh ij y• loueth faith bringeth loue brother dwelleth yt light hate h brother darkenes walketh darckeneſſe wotteth whether goeth darckeneſſe hath blynded eye hateth darckneſſe verely becauſe ſeeth loue god chriſt ſaw coulde loue brother ſo kynde father ſake man hate brother thou ſure ſame mā darckneſſe hath ye light true faith ſeeth chriſt hath done man ſo loue cā forgeue brother aſſure thy ſelfe light true faith ſeeth mercy ſhewed chriſt ſumme altogetheri workes outward righteouſnes workes y• world may called righteouſnes ye mēbers ſpring loue inward loue loue righteouſnes hart ſpringeth faith fayth faith truſt chriſtes bloud gift god epheſ ij whereunto man drawen goodneſſe god driuen thorow true knowledge lawe beholding decdes luſt deſire member vnto requeſt lawe ſeing owne dampnation glaſſe lawe man ſawe owne dampnation yt law ſhould immediatly hate god hys workes vtterly diſpayre except god offered chriſt forgaue paſt made hym hys ſonne tooke dampnatiō lawe away promiſed would ſubmit himſelf learne beſt ſhould accept well angell heauē therto fell frailtie malice ſtubbornneſſe ſhould forgeuen vpon amendment god would euer take ſonne onely chaſtice home whē dyd amiſſe moſt fatherlyeſt maner eaſely diſeaſe would ſuffer neuer bring forth iudged rigorouſnes yt law leauen ſeene • oafe without ſmell taſt ſo cannot ſaith v without good workes y• intent ſame ſeene appeare thou couldeſt ſee leauen though thou brakeſt vp loafe except thou ſmelledſt taſtedſt ſourenes euē ſo couldeſt thou neuer ſee true faith loue except thou ſaweſt workes alſo ſaweſt entent meaning ye worker leaſt hipocriſie deceaue thee deedes effect righteouſneſſe thereto outward teſtimonie certifiyng inwarde righteouſnes ſourenes leauen ſay fayth iuſtifieth vnderſtanding faith receaueth iuſtifiyng god promiſeth forgeue v ſinnes impute v full righteous god iuſtifieth fayth iuſtifieth • meaneth v actiuely ſay forgeueth v reckoneth v full righteous chriſtes bloud deſerueth faith promiſe receaueth certifieth conſcience therof faith chalēgeth chriſtes ſake hath deſerued promiſed cleaueth euer promiſe truth promiſer pretendeth goodnes worke knowledgeth work deſerue crowned rewarded deſeruinges chriſt take enſample young child father promiſeth good thing yt ſome trifle come rewarde delayeth ſaying thou haſt done worth halfe ſo much ſhould geue thee ſo great thing ſo little trif • ▪ aunſwere ye promiſe ye ſayd ſhould haue ye promiſe ye ſay ſo let ſay driue euer ſay agayne ye promiſe ſo ye ye ſayd ſhould haue ſo ye hirelinges wyll pretend woorke ſay haue deſerued haue done ſo much ſo much labour worth firſt couenaunt making god oft reconciled haue ſinned righteouſnes commeth god altogether attonement fayth made reconciled partly righteous ſelues vnrighteous righteous farre loue vnrighteous farre loue vnperfect faith ye promiſe god yt doth reckē v full righteous doth euer ſupply yt vnrighteouſnes imperfectnes▪ whole righteouſnes beginning finally workes god commaundeth vnto annexed promiſes reward workes ſacramentes ſacramētes viſible ſenſible ſignes token earneſt obligation witneſſes teſtimonies ſure certifiyng ſoules god hath according promiſe ſtrēgth weake fayth keepe promiſe mynde iuſtifie v viſible workes ſacramentes example worke baptime ward waſhing viſible facramēt ſigne iuſtifieth v god onely iuſtifieth v actiuely helpe hinder pardōs good without ſaue onely ſtabliſhe weake ſoules could beleue except reade letter looked ſeale ſaw print saint peter keyes mercifull god moſt louing father careth v firſt aboue fleſh loue life come keepe cōmaundemētes god whē ſuch thing beyng impoſſible eaſie naturall feele ſure altered new creature ſhapen righteouſneſſe image chriſt god father ſeing lawes righteouſnes written harte ye faſt ſad hipocrites faſhion new countenaunce might appeare vnto men faſt ʋerely ſay vnto faſt haue rewarde thou therefore thou faſteſt annointe thine head waſhe thy face appeare vnto men thou faſteſt vnto thy father ſecrete thy father ſeeth ſecrete ſhall rewarde thee openly aboue almoſe prayer enē ſo chriſt rebuketh falſe entent hipocriſie faſting ſought prayſe worke ordayned tame fleſhe vſed faſting vſed tame fleſhe thereby may prone ſerue god abuſed ſuch faſhions worlde might know faſted prayſe ſay holy mē theſe pale pitifull looke euen like death hanging downe heades beholding earth mē cleane world theſe come heauen ſhall become v poore wretch worlde theſe great fauour god prayer heard whatſoeuer aſke caſe laye people happy may brother among partaker prayer witte fal • e iudgement infecteth body luſt maketh whole man ſo vnquiet ſelfe body cannot ſit ſtill reſt one place continue worke mynde perſeuer endure one purpoſe let prouide diligent fiſhyng sea weakes ſake yea though land ſo plenteous neded cōmaūde ſuch faſt auoide dearth yet ought ſet ſuch vp becauſe cannot rule ſelues ruler ordained thē cannot rule thēſelues whoſe ſakes ought forbyd oppreſſors mighty tirants ye ye rich euer pray though proſper ye end outwardly yet feare euer guaweth harte inwardly houre death know feele haue gathered naught ſorrow like one dreameth rich morning findeth nought heauy ſory remēbraunce pleaſaunt dreame finally moſt loth die hope liue long thē periſhe ſodainly enſample ye rich man entended make larger barnes ſtore houſes happy therfore layeth vp treaſure • uke xij heauen rich faith good workes rewarde thereto promiſed ſhall god kepe ſure man take away forbidden haue rich loue truſt carefull god hath promiſed care v geue v inough keepe gotten care keepe commaundementes whatſoeuer office degree thou art world dutie thine office diligently truſt god let hym care thou huſband man eare ſow huſband thy ground let god alone reſt care make grow plenteouſly ſend ſeaſonable weather haue prouide thee good market ſell▪ c like maner thou kyng office king receaue duty kyng let god care keepe thee thy kingdome ſauour ſhall thee thē thouſand million golde ſo hath little ſure god ſhall keepe richer hath thouſandes hath none hope thē muſt kept wyth hys owne care policy finally marke one point luke 14 none • uſeth luke xiiij al poſſeſſeth cā diſciple caſteth away y• loue worldly thinges ſcholer chriſtes learne doctrine thē addeth ſalt good ſalt vnſauery hath loſt •… e ſeaſoned therwith verely nothing ſalt vnderſtand doctrine meaning couetouſnes maketh ſalte godes worde vnſauery ye couetous loue worldly thinges corrupt ye ſalt doctrine ſo whatſoeuer powder therewith ſhalbe vnſauery treaſure harte treaſure ye worlde ſo loue harte ye loue world thynges world loue god loue god loue commaundements couetouſnes maketh falſe prophet loueth god commaundementes ſhall neuer preach truely becauſe loueth ſhall corrupt gloſes may ſtand hart loueth vntill haue ſence euer god gaue ergo couetous perſon true prophet nought chriſt oft ſo diligently warneth diſciples beware couetouſnes thing wiſt well euer corrupt woorde god euer ſhoulde light thy body thyne eye wherfore thine eye ſingle thy body ſhall full lyght thine eye wicked thā ſhall thy whole body darcke therfore light thee darckneſſe great darkneſſe note concluſion wyth proper ſimilitude eye light body light eye darckeneſſe member ſee gouerned long eye ſeeth hand foote duty neyther feare man ſhould ſinnible fall fire water eye blynde body blinde ſo blinde remedy al ſet candle ſeeth geue hym lanterne hys hand yet goeth ſtraighte bring ſunne point hym vnto yt thou wouldeſt haue hym ſee yt boteth euen ſo couetouſneſſe couetouſnes cauſeth darckneſſe haue blinded ſpirituall eye peruerted right entent lawe god workes commaunded god ſacrif • ce ceremony ſacramentes ordinaunces god entent ſpirituall eye doctrine darcke blyndnes yea darke darcknes pure blindnes beleued light darcke doctrine teach man may compell god wyth woorkes free geue hys fauour grace make god vnrighteous darcke doctrine ye rebuke chriſtes bloud teach woorkes iuſtifie god make ſatifaction ſinnes blinde thinke prayer pattering many wordes therefore onely prayſed payed world alſo title thereof chalenge heauē ye merites chriſtes bloud darcke doctrine whoſe fayth onely together appointmentes themſelues haue fayned betwene god vnto yet god neuer ſubſcribed alſo aſſigne worke much rewarde great god muſt geue chuſe whether vnrighteous darcke doctrine darckeneſſe ſay ſtifly worke sacramentes ſelfe referring ſtyrre vp faith promiſes annexed thē doth iuſtifie affirme bodely payne payne ſelfe referryng either loue ye law god neighbour doth pleaſe god darcke damnable deueliſh doctrine onely thinke lucre ſeruice god alſo ſo farre paſt ſhame affirme holy church cannot erre da •• ne pope doctrine plainely appeareth decree muſt article fayth damnable doubt ſearch scripture whether doctrine therto agree ſay decree muſt beleued ſound contrary ſo euer scripture scripture muſt expounded made agree neede regarde scripture ſay holy ghoſt moueth scripture contrary make noſe waxe wreſt way way till agree faith workes darckneſſe falſe prophet fayth workes darckneſſe true could draw faith workes blyndneſſe phariſeis neither iohn baptiſt chriſt could bryng though iohn baptiſt pyped reaſons scripture uincible chriſt therto added miracle yet phariſeis would daunce iohn baptiſt thought mad lyue ſo ſtrayte life refuſe iuſtified therby chriſt diſciples phariſeis much holyer ſelues faſted oftener prayed thicker yea vttered many mo wordes prayer fayth workes belefe turkes iewes driueth euer away chriſt faith workes hath ben light darcknes great part v chriſten haue walked euer ſence pelagius fauſtus well xij c yeares euer mo mo religious haue walked foure fiue hundred yeare prieſtes alſo haue walked long ſeaſon lord bryng agayne finally darcke darckneſſe darcknes phariſey pelagian ſtandeth vp preacheth agaynſt phariſeis pelagians alowed al ye audience concluſion world euer ſence began hath doth naturall blindneſſe beleue owne workes thē scripture peruerted confirme errour ſore harte hardened depe darckeneſſe man ſerue two maſters ſhal either hate one loue cleaue one deſpiſe ye ſerue god mammon mammon rich aboundance mammon good chriſt concludeth plaine ſimilitude impoſſible ſerue two contrary maſters impoſſible retayned vnto two diuers lord enemy one ſo impoſſible ſerue god mammon two maſters one mynde one might man ſerue one wil one mynde one accorde twenty one maſter two maſters one vnder ſubſtitute may man ſerue ſeruice inferiour cōmaundement ſuperiour ſerue obey father mother huſband maſter lord god commaundement inferiour contrary ſuperiour commaūde contrary thing mayſt thou obey two cōtrary maſters god mammon mammon god two cōtrary maſters yea two contrary god contrary commaundementes god ſayth thy lord god one ſhalt yu ſerue alone yu ſhalt loue thyne hart thyne whole hart thy ſoule thy might thou ſhalt neither ſerue obey loue thyng ſaue byd thee farre byd thee mammon ſayth ſame mammon wilbe god alſo ſerued loued alone god ſayth ſee thou loue thy neighbour thou labour thine hāds get thy liuyng ſomewhat aboue helpe māmon ſayth called thy neighbour becauſe nye thee ſo nye thee thy ſelf ergo proximus eſto tibi loue thy ſelfe make lewde vyle wretch labour diligently get thee much thou mayſt ſome ſcrappes aboue ſelues wilt thou perfect diſguiſt thy ſelfe put mammon maketh mē diſguiſe thē ſelues gray coate blacke pyed geue thy ſelfe deuotion deſpiſe world take couetous would ſay contemplatiue life vpon thee tell people hoate purgatorie paynes muſt ſuffered ſmall fantes geue mercyfully thouſād folde one ſpirituall temporall geue heauen take houſe land fooliſh temporall thynges god ſayth iudge truly betwene thy brother therefore take giftes mammon ſayth good maner apoynt curteſie take offered geueth thee loueth thee better ſuch chur •… e geueth thee naught yea thou ar • bound fauour cauſe god ſayth fell geue almoſe mammon ſayth lay vp haue inough mainteyne thyne eſtate defēd thee thyne enemyes ſerue thee thyne age c much god mammon ſeruauntes mammon • chri •• e church two ſo contrary maſters whoſoeuer ſerue god muſt geue vp mammon ſerue mammō muſt forſake god foloweth mammōs ſeruaunt knowen maſter mammon ſeruaunt verely firſt gettyng ſecondarely poore neighbour complaineth mammon ſeruaunt mammon wil ſhut vp hart make hym without compaſſion thirdly croſſe chriſt trye one whē perſecution ariſeth word true ſeruaunt chriſt byd mammon • dew faithfull ſeruaunt mammon vtter hypocriſie onely renounce doctrine chriſt alſo cruel ſharpe perſecuter therof put away ſurmiſe fidelitie hath maſter mammon map openly appeare therfore ſay vnto care lyues ye ſhall eate ye ſhall drinke neither bodyes ye ſhall put lyfe meate body rayment bundeth coſtely houſe euē tylyng leaue loſe ſo great coſt ſo ſmall trifle gaue thee ſo precious ſoule ſo bewtifull body goodnes god towarde mankynd let either periſh agayne ye day ſo ſmall thnig foode rayment god neuer made mouth made meate body made rayment alſo howbeit mā mon blindeth eye ſo neither ſee iudge right behold foules ayre ſow neither reape gather ſtorehouſes yet heauenly father fedeth ye farre better takyng thought able put one cubite vnto ſtature careth y• leaſt creature much care yt greateſt byrdes beaſtes teache v put away care byrdes ayre beaſts preach v ſhould leaue caring put truſt father mammon hath made v ſo dull ſo cleane without capacitie none example argument neuer ſo vehement cā enter wittes v make v ſee iudge right finally madnes take ſo great thought fode rayment wealth health life thy body together thy power world thyne thou couldeſt make thy ſelfe one inche lēger thy ſtomacke ſhall diſgeſte meate thou putteſt thou art ſure whiche thou putteſt thy mouth ſhall go thee whether ſhall choke thee thou canſt make thou lyeſt ſitteſt thou ſhalt ariſe agayn thou ſlepeſt thou ſhalt awake agayne thou ſhouldeſt liue one houre lōger cared thee thou couldeſt care muſt care thee ſtill el thou ſhouldeſt periſh care thee thy ſoules profite thou miſtruſt care thy ſelfe rayment take ye thought behold lyly field grow labour neither ſpynne yet ſay euen salomon glorie apparelled lyke one wherefore graſſe whiche day fieldes morow ſhalbe caſt furnace god ſo clothe howe much ſhal ſame vnto ye litle fayth onely foule beaſt alſo care tree herbe floures earth crye vnto v truſt god caſt away care coupled couetouſneſſe ſufficient beare charge whiche haue handes reaſon ſtate world care annexed miſtruſt god ſhuld miniſter inough beare charge endeuer ſelues keepe commaundementes euery man craft office truly god proue v ſuffereth v haue neede neighbour firſt complayne god deſire prepare harte neighbour agaynſt come deſire helpe māmon pypeth ſong ſaying thou ſhouldeſt make mammon maner labour benefice thou careddeſt whether thou deſt haddeſt would lōg ere thou gatteſt one would take thyne hand aunſwere thy labour get ſuch ſhalbe thy hauiour thou flatteredeſt haue ſo ſhalt thou thou boughteſt ſouldeſt get ſo ſhalt thou ſell bye • auour ſet world thy principall tent thou ſeekeſt benefice lucre take hede example thy forefather symon magus let thy actes 〈◊〉 care therefore office god neighbour ſake alſo righteouſneſſe haue ſayd afore ſo farre perfect lacketh ſupplied faith god word hath promiſed accept til come righteouſnes kingdome heauen foloweth outward righteouſneſſe workes come owne accord promiſe god yea chriſt promiſeth thee hū dredfolde euen life thou leaueſt ſake true would ſome ſay would rather ſerue mammon yet true firſt thou ſeruaunt mammō thou muſt kepe thy god thy god thee euery man ſtrōger thou take thy god thee moreouer god take either thee thy mammon thy mammon thee ere thou wouldeſt aduenge▪ ſelfe thy blynd vnkyndneſſe hath made thee geuen thee thou forſakeſt ſerueſt mortall enemy thou folow chriſt world let take deuils • thou folow chriſt thou canſt 〈…〉 ſufficient liuing hell ſhall able diſappointe thee ſufficiēt lyuing though perſecute deſperation thy hart • eeleth thou art ready hell thē may wel called thouſand fold care day folowyng let day folowyng care ſelfe day preſent hath euer inough owne trouble thou looke well conenaūt care betwene thee thy lord god one ſide temptation worlde fleſhe satan thou ſhalt ſoone perceiue day preſent hath euer inough cared thou muſt • ry inſtantly god helpe alſo though thou thy beſt thē ſeing yt day preſent ouercharged owne care madneſſe lade vpon alſo care day folowing yea care yeare ye xx yeare though thou neuer entendeſt die torment vexe ſoule thorow miſtruſt vnbeliefe make thy life ſoure bitter vnquiet▪ lyfe deuilles hell therefore care day day houre ought ch •• •• eſt care houre earneſtly keepe couenaunt lord thy god recorde therein day night thy part vnto vttermoſt thy power god part let hym care himſelfe beleue thou wordes ſtedfaſtly ſure heauen earth ſhal ſooner periſhe one iote bide behinde hath promiſed thine owne part alſo care maner though thou ſhouldeſt alone nay god hath firſt promiſed helpe thee secondarily accept thine hart little y• thou art able neuer ſo imperfect thirdly though wynde weather ſtreame cary thee cleane contrary thy purpoſe yet becauſe thou bideſt ſtill thy profeſſion ready turne right courſe ſoone y• tempeſt little ouer blowen god promiſeth forgeue yt leſſe fulfill promiſes one iote doth chriſt ſo defend tempte god letteth hys child tempted aduerſitie neuer come daunger trouble yes come ſuch ſtraites oft witte reaſon ſee way ſaue fayth onely ſure god hath make way thorow temptation houre teach make feele goodnes father ye paſſions brother maſter chriſt alſo louyng mother make childe perceaue feele kindnes loue aagaine thankfull letteth hunger morning calleth breakfaſt maketh ſhe heard til paine impaciencie beginneth cry good ſhe ſtilleth geueth aſketh pleaſe peaced beginneth eate reioyceth glad fayne ſhe aſketh gaue thee thy mother ſayth ye ſayth ſhe good mother geue thee thynges anſwereth ye ſhe aſketh wilt thou loue thy mother c ſayth ye ſo commeth knowledge hys mother kindneſſe thankfull temptation chriſtes elect wyſe forbiddin manner care forbiddē care worldly deuilliſhe care ſpringeth inordinate loue worldly thynges myſtruſt god enſample couet inordinatly ſufficient euē haue nede becauſe miſtruſt god haue hope hym therefore pray commeth mourne ſorrow pine away whole vnquiet mynehart whether haue much ſufficient loue inordinatly care keeking becauſe miſtruſt god haue hope wil helpe therefore haue locked doores chamber cofers neuer nerer reſt care ſtil caſt thouſand perilles moſt part might auoyde though neuer ſlept care word god haue reſting place choked vp ſoone ſowne care ſpringeth loue god euery loue hath care care keepe care wh •… care euery man ought haue god commaundementes care muſt euery man haue mā liueth bread onely much euery worde proceedeth mouth god keping god commaundement life man well world worlde god commaundement man lyfe come childe obey father mother thou mayſt long liue earth father mother vnderſtand al ruler thou obey thy bleſſing ſhall long life contrary thou diſobey ſhort life ſhalt either periſhe ſworde ſome plague ſhortly euen ſo ſhal ruler rule god hath commaunded oppreſſe thou widow fatherleſſe child ſayth god ſhall cry heare voyce exod xx wrath waxe hot ſo ſinite ſworde wiues ſhall widowes child fatherles ſay ſee none proſper longer continue thoſe god ſuffereth tirauntes proſper moſt cruell tyrauntes yet ſay god abideth euer true ſetteth vp tyraūt continueth proſperitie ſcourge wicked ſubiects haue forſaken couenaunt lord god vnto hys good promiſes pertayne ſaue hys curſſes onely ye ſubiectes would turne repēt folow wayes god would ſhortly deliuer thē yet ſuperior corrupteth inferior el diſpoſed inough goodnes god wyll let long continue expoſition ſeuenth chapter ivdge ye iudged ye iudge ſo ſhall ye iudged wyth meaſure ye mete ſame ſhall meaſured agayne lookeſt thou mote thy brother eye markeſt beame thine owne eye canſt thou ſay thy brother let plucke mote thine eye behold beame thyne owne eye thou hipocrite plucke firſt beame thine owne eye thou ſhalt ſee clearely plucke mote thy brother eye ment temporall iudgyng iudgemētes chriſt forbad oft ſtabliſhe peter paule epiſtles alſo forbidden iudge thoſe deedes manifeſt againſt lawe god thoſe ought euery chriſtē mā perſecute yet muſt order chriſt hath ſet whē ſayth hipocrite caſt firſt iudgyng rebuked beame thyne owne eye eaſie vnderſtand maner iudging meaneth hipocrites haue faſtings prayinges kneling crouching ducking thouſand ceremony owne inuention whoſoeuer doo counte dampned ſoule chriſt ſay faſt thy diſciples phariſeyes plucke eares corne rubbe handes though compelled pure hunger lawfull sabboth day breake ye tradition elder waſhe ye ſitte downe meate yea dooſt thou thy ſelf heale people vpon holy day diddeſt thou onely heale bedred 38 yeares dayes indifferent good dedes y• prayſe god profite neighbore alſo baddeſt beare bedde away vpon saboth day workyng day ſufficient good deede prayſe god profite thy neigybour thou muſt breake thy saboth day cannot damned perſon breaketh holy day deſpiſeth ordinaunce holy church eateth butter frydayes withour diſpenſation holy father pope yea cakebread made wyth milke egges white meate lent taketh holy water commeth church heareth maſſe frō sonday sō day either hath beades al el y• ſhalt heare ſtone clink hand hym yet hys lippes wagge maſſe mattens hipocrite caſt firſt beame beame thine owne eye thou ſhalt ſee better thou vnderſtandeſt god lawes falſely therefore thou kepeſt none thē truely lawes require mercy • ſacrifice moreouer thou haſt falſe entent workes y• dooſt therefore dampnable ſight god hipocrite caſt beame thine owne eye learne vnderſtand lawe god truely thy workes aright entent god ordayned thou ſhalt ſee whether thy brother haue mote eye haue plucke el knoweth entent ceremony hee breaketh vnitie zeale ceremony vnder ſlandeth god law lawe workes though obſerue thouſand ceremony hys owne exerciſe ſhall neuer condēpne brother breake vnitie thoſe thinges chriſt neuer commaunded left indifferent ſee mo • e brother eye obſerueth brother ſome certaine ordinaunce made good purpoſe becauſe knoweth ceremony entent plucke fayre ſoftly inſtruct louingly make well content thing ſpiritualty would men would ſo abhorre obey tyranny hipocrites commaunde workes falſe purpoſe therefore iudge ſlea ſhedde brethren bloude mercileſly god y• father mercy therefore gaue hipocrites ſuch abſolute power compell theyr brother obey liſte ſlay without pitie ſhewing eyther cauſe cōmaundemētes ſo haue el aſſigning entent dampnable contrary ſcripture paule rom 14 ſayth obſerued ceremony ſhould iudge obſerueth knoweth entēt iudgeth thē obſerued ſhould deſpiſe obſerued obſerueth ought deſpiſe weakenes ignoraunce brother till perceaue obſtinate learne moreouer ſuch meaſure thou geueſt meaſure▪ thou ſhalt receaue againe thou iudge thy neighbour god ſhal iudge thee thou iudge thy neighbour ſuch thinges thou knoweſt lawe god entent workes art therefore condempned god c giue holy thyng vnto dogges neither caſt pearl fore ſwyne leſt treade thē vnder feete turne agayne teare dogges thoſe obſtinate indurate blynd zeale dogges ſignified therby leuen wherwith haue ſowred y• doctrine alſo workes maliciouſly reſiſte truth perſecute miniſters therof thoſe wolues among chriſt ſendeth ſhepe warnyng onely ſingle pure doctrine alſo wiſe circumſpect beware mē ſhould bryng iudges kynges ſlay thinkyng god ſeruice therein paul romains teſtifieth iewes blynd zeale falſe fayned righteouſnes perſecute righteouſneſſe god ſwyne whiche haue receaued pure goſpell swyne truly deſcribed chriſt yet continue ſtill ſinne rowle ſelues podell myer old filthy conuerſation ignoraunt alſo weake vſe vttermoſt libertie interpretyng largeſt faſhion moſt fauour fleſh pope pardon therewith make yt truth euill ſpoken thouſandes el might haue ben eaſely wonne therof ſtyrre vp cruel perſecution el would much eaſyer yea ſometime none yet thoſe ſwyne commeth poynt abyde perſecution offer ſelues wyllyng euen firſt chope deny ere ſcarſly appoſed doctrine therfore lay firſt law god call repentaunce thou ſee hope mendyng ſeaſe go ſwyne ala euer ſhall y• greater nōber receaue wordes newneſſe curioſitie ſay ſeme ſomewhat haue gone ſchole vayne forthwith yer haue felt chaūge liuyng ſelues ſcholemaſters begyn libertie practiſe opēly diſciples phariſeis ſee tradition broken rage perſecute immediatly new ſcholemaſters neither grounded doctrine defend doinges rooted profeſſion new life ſuffer chriſt c aſke ſhalbe geuen ſeke ye ſhall finde knocke ſhalbe opened vnto aſke receaue ſeeketh findeth knocketh ſhalbe opened man among ſonne aſked hym bread would proferre ſtone aſked fiſhe would offer serpent ye whiche euill know geue good giftes child howe much ſhall father whiche heauen geue good thynges aſke hym firſt note theſe wordes pray god commaundement pra • er commaū dement beleue god loue god loue thy neighbour ſo almoſe faſtyng alſo neither poſſible belefe beleue god loue loue thy neighbour prayer beleue god ſpryng hēce immediatly beleue god ſure thou haſt thou nedeſt muſt come whiche thou thou canſt continually thanke benefites thou continually without ceaſyng▪ receaueſt hand therto euer cry helpe thou art euer nede canſt whence el holpen thy neighbour ſuch neceſſitie alſo wherfore thou loue cōpell thee pitie cry god continually thanke well thy ſelfe secondarely heapyng ſo many wordes together aſke ſeke knocke ſignify prayer muſt continuall ſo doth parable widowe ſued wicked luke 18 iudge y• cauſe euer continuall neceſſitie ſay lyfe euen warre fare perpetual battaile preuaile prayer prayer wynne victory onely therefore thynges • moſt neceſſary long pray ouercome aſſoone ceaſſe praying iſraell ouercame amalechites exod xvij long moſes held vp hand prayer aſſoone let downe handes weryneſſe amalechites preuayled better chriſt warned diſciples laſt ſupper haue peace affirming ſhould haue none y• world falſe prophetes falſe prophetes wickednes 〈◊〉 ſhal euer impugne faith chriſtes bloud inforce quenche true vnderſtāding law right meanyng intent workes commaunded god fight fight aboue fightes firſt ſhalbe ſuch nōber chriſtes true diſciples ſhalbe ſmall flocke reſpect ſhall haue workes like chriſtes ſo faſtyng prayer pouertie obedience chaſtitie ſhall name profeſſion paule ſaith corinthian aungels meſſengers sathā ſhall chaunge ſelues aungels meſſengers light truth ſhall come chriſtes name mark xiij ſignes miracle haue vpper hād alſo euen deceaue elect poſſible yea beyonde math 24 thou get victory falſe prophetes plucke multitude handes ſhall immediately riſe ſame ſet vp new falſe ſect agaynſt thee agaynſt thy hart muſt ioy ned thy prayer theſe amalechites onely remedy lift vp handes thy harte god continuall prayer hādes thou werynes let fall thou goeſt worſſe immediatly beſide fight conflict ſuttle ſophiſtrie falſe miracle diſguiſed hypocritiſh workes theſe falſe prophetes commeth dogges wolues diſciples ſeruauntes mammon ſwyne thyne owne ſcholers agaynſt whiche thou haſt ſhilde defence prayer ſinne luſtes thyne owne fleſh sathan thouſand temptation vnto euil world wil either driue thee caſtell refuge prayer take priſoner vndoubtedly laſt thy neighbour neceſſitie thyne owne compell thee riche muſt pray dayly bread crye father art heauen geue v dayly bread though thou rich kyng salomon chriſt commaundeth rich well poore cry god continually dayly bread haue ſuch neede chriſt deceauer mocker nede pray thee geue lende myne poſſeſſion ready firſt cō maūdemēt one god thou put thy whole truſt written thyne hart thou ſhouldeſt eaſely perceaue though thou haddeſt many thouſandes dauid left behynd salomō heaped mo thou haddeſt poore begger goeth doore dore yea begger cōmaundement written hart ſure rich thou firſt thou muſt knowledge thou haſt receaued y• great treaſure y• hand god wherſore whē thou fetteſt halfepeny therof thou oughteſt geue god thākes thyne hart gift therof thou muſt confeſſe alſo god thinke ſelues ſaued preſerued meanes gods▪ idolatry onely hath kept thee ſame night euer el idolater put thy truſt ſome thyng god thou muſt confeſſe god onely muſt keepe thee day night folowing ſo continually thine owne witte power witte power creature creature god kept thee woulde thine owne deſtructiō helpe thee keepe woulde cut thy throte king chriſtendome ſo well beloued hath •… ow owne euill ſubiectes god kept downe feare woulde one houre riſe vpō ſlea hym make hauocke hath ſo well beloued thorow englād •… ow ſame pariſhe nie would good wiſhe hell coulde woulde wyth theyr handes deſtroy god kept hym caſt feare god muſt euer keepe thee thou muſt dayly receaue hand poore man doth receaue almoſe man thou art ſuertie thy dayly bread though thou cardinall pooreſt wherfore howſoeuer rich thou yet muſt thou euer cry god thy dayly bread commaundemēt pray continually ſhort thicke oft pſalmes prayer bible finally third commaunded faith muſt ioyned prayer pray faith truſt beleue lorde god doubt promiſes vnto chriſt enduceth v wyth apt ſimilitude ſaying ye beyng euill yet geue good thynges vnto child much ſhall god fulfill hys promiſes mercy vnto child cry vnto hym better mercifull men wherfore ſeing god commaundeth thee pray much thou haſt ſo great neceſſitie ſo becauſe mercifull hath promiſed true cannot deny owne wordes therefore pray thou prayeſt looke thine vnworthines cōmaūdemēt mercy goodnes truth faithfulnes beleue ſtedſaſtly hym moreouer whatſoeuer thou haſt done yet thou repent wilt amende promiſeth thynke though god differ thy requeſt yet muſt thou ſaynt thy ſinnes though differ thee thinke long faint thy fayth ſlacke thy prayer ſurely come geue thee thou deſireſt though differre thy profite chaunge thy requeſt better thyng thinges therefore whatſoeuer ye woulde men ſhoulde ſo ye verely lawe prophetes ſhort ſermon mā neede complayne cannot length beare away ſo nye doubtes thee thou needeſt ſende ouer ſea thee thou • oyle doubtes needeſt importune vpon maſter doctor ſaying ſyr pray ſay ye caſe lawfull may ſo ſo well inough aſke thyne owne conſcience thou mayſt oughteſt wouldeſt thou mē ſo thee wouldeſt thou ſo dealt thou wouldeſt men ſhoulde thee wrong oppreſſe thee thou wouldeſt men ſhoulde thee ſhame rebuke lie thee kyll thee hyre thine houſe thee tice thy ſeruaunt away take againſt thy ought thyne thou wouldeſt men ſhoulde ſell thee falſe ware thou putteſt truſt make ready lay note thee thou wouldeſt men ſhoulde deceaue thee wyth great othes ſwearing good deede naught thou wouldeſt alſo men ſhould ſell thee ware naught deare vndo thee ſuch thinges thy neighbour loth thou wouldeſt buye falſe ware deare vndoing thy ſelfe ſo loth thou ſell falſe ware deare vndoing thy neighbour al thy needes glad thou wouldeſt holpē ſo glad helpe thy neighbour ſo caſes examine thy conſcience aſke done doubtes betwene thy neigh bour thee ſhe teach thee except thou filthy thē ſwine together beaſtly ſayth lawe prophetes math xxij note ſayth thou ſhalt loue thy lord god thyne hart wordes loue ye truth plame ergo ſuch woordes falſe prophetes full ſwyng paules rule ij theſſa ij concluſion loue truth falſe prophetes greateſt world haue leaſt loue truth ergo falſe prophetes chaplaines greateſt may ſword compel reſt kynges iſraell compelled worſhyp golden calues falſe prophetes vnderſtand fal • e teacher peter calleth wycked expounder scripture ſoeuer heareth theſe word doth lyken vnto wiſe man built hys houſe vppon rocke fell rayne floudes came windes blew beate vppon houſe fell grounded vpon rocke heare theſe wordes ſhalbe lykened vnto fooliſhe man buylt houſe vpon ſand fell rayne floudes came windes bl • w daſhed vpon houſe fell fall therof great chriſt hath two ſortes hearer beleuers without 〈◊〉 worker without fayth built 〈◊〉 neither one wilbe ſaued fayth theyr owne makyng without workes workes owne makyng without faith firſt thoſe voluptuous haue yelded ſelues vp ſinne ſaying tuſhe god mercyfull chriſt dyed v muſt ſaue v onely cannot ſinne without reſiſtāce ſecond hypocrite deſerue theyr owne imagined woorkes onely fayth haue experience ſaue litle meritorious paynefull beleued chriſt borne virgin came way child great inconuenience aboue vnder arme yet made hole though naturall body mē haue bread sacrament wyne though fiue wittes ſay ye meritorious payne belefe ſo heauy except fayned thouſand wiſe ſimilitudes lowſye lykeneſſes many madde reaſōs ſtay helpe captiuate vnderſtandyng like caſt backes onely refuge great many keepe fayth caſt myndes thinke vpon though forgeue yet put diſpleaſure myndes thinke til good occaſion geuē aduēge thinke loue neighbour well inough good charge fayth beſt like theyr fayth worldly 〈…〉 〈…〉 • 〈…〉 ieſus chriſt ſtories fayth truſt confidence ſaued haue ſinnes forgeuen chriſt ſo borne haue fayth haue theyr owne workes onely true hearer vnderſtand lawe chriſt interpreteth feele thereby theyr righteous damnation runne chriſt ſuccour remiſſion ſinnes paſt ſinne chaunce thorough infirmity ſhall compel thē remiſſion law ſtronge weake nature upon conſent lawe loue profeſſe fulfill vttermoſt power go worke faith confidence fayth breedeth chriſtes bloud without helpe workes law bringeth maner ʋerely commaundement loue thy neighbour thy ſelfe written may ought miniſter onely baptim tyme neede ſo neceſſarie preach sacramēts ſignifications 〈◊〉 finally though ſure god hymſelfe geuen v ſacrament whatſoeuer yet ye ſignification loſt muſt neceſſitie either ſeeke vp ſignificatiō put ſome ſignificatiō god word therto ought beleue therby el put downe impoſſible obſerue ſacrament
