queſtion whether whether y• church cā •… church may erre ye vnderſtand pope hys generation verely hard queſtion aſke whether hath hys eye blynde whether poſſible hath one legge ſhorter thē halt ſayd chriſtes elect church ye church fayth ſaueth whole multitude repenting ſinners beleue chriſt put truſt confidēce mercy god feeling harte god chriſtes ſake loueth thē rather mercifull vnto forgeueth thē ſinnes repent forgeueth alſo motion vnto ſinne feare leaſt ſhoulde thereby drawen ſinne agayne faith haue reſpect owne deſeruinges yea none cauſe mercifull truth god father lie hath ſo promiſed ye ſpirite truth ſpirite purgeth v ſinne euen ſo frō lie errour noyſome hurtfull faith foundation layd apoſtles prophetes whereon paul ſayth epheſ ij ephe 〈◊〉 ▪ built therby houſhold god fayth rocke leſſe written iohn ſay haue 1 iohn 1 ſinne deceaue ſelues truth v agayne ſay haue ſinned make hym liar word v paul rom vij ſayth good would euill would ſayth ſinne dwelleth thus ſinners ſinners ſinners thou looke vnto profeſſion harte toward law god repentaunce ſorow haue becauſe haue ſinned alſo becauſe yet full ſinne ſtill vnto promiſes mercy sauiour chriſt vnto fayth sinner thou loke vnto frail fleſhe deth ſinne tie fleſh weakeneſſe one newly recouered great diſeaſe y• reaſon wher dedes imperfect reaſon wherof alſo occaſions great fall horrible dedes frute ſinne remaineth mēbers breaketh notwithſtanding yet ſpirite leaueth v rebuketh v bryngeth v home agayne vnto profeſſion ſo neuer caſt yocke god frō neckes neither yeld vp ſelues vnto ſinne ſerue fight freſh begyn new battaile ¶ chriſten man erre may yet erre ſinne ſo erre ſide ſinne ſo erre neuer vnto death damnation neuer ſinne purpoſe hold errour maliciouſly ſinnyng againſt holy ghoſt weakeneſſe infirmitie good obedient childrē though loue father commaundements yet breake oft reaſon weakeneſſe yeld ſelues bond vnto ſinne ſinne frailtie weakenes ſerue euē ſo erre thyng ſhould agaynſt promiſes chriſt thynges errours vnto damnation though neuer ſo great becauſe hold maliciouſly ſome read new teſtament chriſts brother would thinke ladyes child byrth chriſt becauſe know vſe ſpeakyng scripture hebrues • ye kinſinē called brother happely might ioſephes child ſome firſt wife neither haue teach tyrāny ſo great yet could hurte though dyed therein becauſe hurteth redēption chriſtes bloud though ſhe none chriſt therfore neuer ſaued neither yet ye leſſe though ſhe ſuch lyke may erre yet ſaued hundred plucke man faith chriſt might erre yet neuertheleſſe ſaued though contrary written goſpell ſinnes ſoone rebuked repent euen ſo aſſoone better taught ſhould immediatly knowledge errour reſiſte maliciouſly maynteine opinion agaynſt scripture yt cā proued scripture ſuch make matter vnto scripture ſaluation chriſt whether true blind zeale make ſectes breakyng yt vnitie chriſtes church whoſe ſake ought ſuffer thyng riſe agaynſt neighbour ought loue erre way • ayth ſelues ſle • ſuch men ſay fallen chriſt make idole opinion except put truſt ſuch opinion thought neceſſarie vnto ſaluatiō cankred conſcience went deceaue ſome filthy purpoſe would neuer breake vnitie fayth yet ſlea brother playne concluſion yt truſt work alſo yt put confidence theyr owne opinion fallen chriſt erre way fayth chriſtes bloud therfore none chriſtes church becauſe built vpon rocke fayth ¶ fayth euer aſſayled fought moreouer fayth haue chriſt euer fought agaynſt faith euer aſſailed beſperation euer aſſayled beaten beſperation ſinne alſo temptation aduerſitie god bringeth v nurtour v ſhew v owne harte hipocriſie falſe thoughtes lye hid almoſt fayth little loue euen thē haply thought ſelues moſt perfect temptation come ſtand haue ſinned fayth feeble wrong done v forgeue ſickeneſſe loſſe goodes tribulation impatient neighbour needeth helpe muſt depart hym loue colde thus learne feele goodnes yet power good god onely power readines good cō • eth god ſelues ſuch tēptatiōs fayth periſheth vtterly neither loue conſent vnto lawe god weake ſicke wounded cleane dead good childe father mother haue taught nurtoure wiſdome loueth father good example commaundementes perceaueth yt goodnes ſhewed father loueth hys father preceptes vnto hys wealth profite father commaundeth nothing neede father hath thereof ſeeketh profite onely therefore hath good fayth vnto father promiſes loueth cōmaundementes doth wyth good good goeth ſchole way haply ſeeth cōpany play ſight taken rauiſhed memory forgetteth himſelfe ſtandeth beholdeth falleth play alſo forgetting father mother kindnes lawes owne profite thereto howbeit knowledge father kindneſſe fayth hys promiſes loue hath agayne vnto hys father obedient minde vtterly quēched lye hid thynges man ſleepeth lieth traunce ſoone hath played luſtes faythfull though ſl •• yet fall warned meane ſeaſon commeth againe vnto olde profeſſion neuer later many temptation goe ouer hart law right hangman tormenteth hys conſcience goeth nye perſwade father caſt away hang hym ketch hym ſo like great runne way rather returne vnto father agayne feare dread rebuke loſſe father loue puniſhment wraſtle truſt hath father goodneſſe geue faith fall riſeth againe aſſoone rage firſt brunte paſt minde quiet goodneſſe father olde kindneſſe commeth vnto faith y• good ne • god ſtaye remembraunce eyther owne corage comfort ſome beleueth father dogges rent good learning wyth teeth pope holy following righteouſnes owne faining reſiſte righteouſnes god chriſt cannot attend harken vnto truth rage luſtes luſtes abate come obey well inough therefore chriſten man muſt chriſtian mē muſt patient patient ſuffer long win brother chriſt yt attēdeth day may receaue grace heare morowe ſee ſome latter ende colde feare death hath quenched heate ſo alleage scripture bring euen falſe ſence auguſtine conuerted heathen mā philoſopher full worldly wiſdome vnto preaching chriſt foliſhneſſe ſayth paule corin 〈◊〉 cor 1 diſputed wyth blynde reaſons either heare belene authoritie auguſtine meane ſhal beleue tyll liuyng ſpiritualtie conuert v like bide long inough vnbeliefe whē aſke whether receaued ſcripture aunſwere come receaue ſcripture go aſke whether beleue god worde reaſon tell v ſo aunſwere two manuer faythes two maner faithes hiſtoricall fayth feelyng fayth hiſtoricall fayth hangeth truth honeſtie teller common fame cōſent many hiſtoricall fayth one tolde turke wonne citie beleued moued honeſtie man come ſeemeth honeſt hath better perſwaſions ſo thinke immediatly lyed loſe fayth agayne feeling fayth man preſent wonne wounded loſt taken priſoner alſo man ſhould ſo beleue ye worlde could turne hys fayth euen likewiſe mother blowen finger tolde fire woulde burne ſhoulde haue beleued hiſtoricall fayth beleue ſtories world becauſe thought ſhe woulde haue mocked ſo ſhould haue done ſhe tolde fire bene cold would haue burned aſſoone put finger fire ſhould haue beleued feeling fayth reaſon wyth feeling faith ſo ſhe could haue perſwaded afterward contrary hiſtoricall fayth may beleue y• ſcripture god teaching ſo ſhould haue done though tolde roben hode bene ſcripture god fayth opinion therfore abideth euer frutleſſe falleth away glorious reaſon made vnto preacher liue contrary feeling fayth written iohn 6 iohn vi ſhall taught god god ſhall write hart holy ſpirite paule alſo teſtifieth rom 8 ſpirite rom 8 beareth latria fynde thē referred vnto god thouſand place therefore thou beguiled wyth falſhod ſophiſticall word vnderſtand wordes ſcripture vſeth worſhipping honouring god theſe loue god true wordes thee chriſt hath bought hym well thee hate lawe ſo breake diſhonour god diſhonour neighbour myne hart hate diſhonour god maker therof breake outwardly diſhonour god worlde officer miniſtreth hurt appointed diſhonour god abuſe creature geue honour vnto thē ſhuld make idole loue god hys commaundement diſhonour neighbour whoſe nede withdraw like maner officer abuſyng power cōpell ſubiect god ſuch thynges ſeruice ſticking vp candels moue thy mynde follow enſample saint worſhyp image idolatry teach thy ſoule godly learning thē image ſerueth thee thou yt image ſo art thou idolater ſay engliſhe ſerue image thus appeareth vngodly belly doctrine wherwith ye ſo magnifie deedes ceremony pilgrimage offering deede ſelfe pleaſe god obtaine fauour dead saintes moue put remembraunce lawe god promiſes ſonne follow enſample saint exhorting ſerue image ſo ye image ſeruers idolater finally deuotion men haue vnto ſuch deedes leſſe haue vnto god commaundement ſo much moſt wont offer image ſhew ſo colde offering poore wyll ſcarce geue ſcrappes muſt el geuen dogges olde ſhone may haue new brome ¶ pilgrimage ſpeake pilgrimage ſay chriſtian man ſo hee true pilgrimage walke place place better ſerue god helpe neighbour leaue nothyng vndone home bounde free go whether hee onely doctrine lord whoſe ſeruaunt owne go viſite poore ſicke priſoner wel done worke god commaundeth hee goe place heare sermon becauſe hys mynde quyet home becauſe hys harte muche occupied worldly buſineſſes reaſons occaſions home get quiet ſtill place hys minde abſtract pulled worldly thoughtes well done theſe place whatſoeuer whether liuely preaching ceremony relique image ſtirre vp hart god preach worde god enſample sauiour ieſus one place thether go content yet bideth lord thinges ſerue hym whether entēt ſo deedes teſtifie vertuous gouerning houſe louing demeanour towarde neighbour yea god worde wil alway hart hys mouth euery day perfecter thē nothing edifie man ſoule ſaue preacheth hym god worde onely worde god worketh health ſoule whatſomeuer preacheth hym make perfecter beleue god wyll ſought one place god heare thee ☜ one place image falſe faith idolatrie image ſeruice firſt god dwelleth god yet dwelleth liuely iohn 4 gloriouſly ye myndes aūgels onely harte men loue lawes truſt promiſes whereſoeuer god findeth ſuch hart heareth prayer place tymes indifferently outward place neither helpeth hindreth except ſayd man mynde quiet ſtill rage wordly buſineſſes ſome thyng ſtyre vp word god example sauiour one place ¶ whence idolatrie image ſeruice ſpryngeth thou mayſt ſee whence poſſeſſiōs ſide preached promiſed god agayne kepe commaundemēts ceremony ordinaunces whē ſaw young child circumciſed cōſented vnto appointement made betwene god moued preachyng ſame iuſtified therby howbeit dede ſelfe cuttyng yt foreſkyn manchilds • • e ſayth iuſtified deedes lawe priuey member iuſtified ſatiſfactiō childes ſinnes preachyng onely iuſtifie thē receaued fayth therof badge geuē indifferently aſwell vnto neuer cōſented theyr harte vnto god law vnto elect whoſe harte law written meanyng circumciſion may proued many wayes namely paul rom 2 ſayth circumciſion much worth firſt fruit preached receaued firſt frutes ſuch fruites hand god god gaue land kept bleſſe make fruites grow token wherof vnto lord roiall brought firſt ripe frutes harueſt remēbrance long abode harces moued thē loue god againe neighbour hys ſake ſo oft deſired ceremony fette bleſſing new ripe fruit like purpoſe though haue loſt ſignification offering yt ſacrices sacrifice dones turtle lambes kiddes ſheepe calues goates ox ſatiſfactions ſinne onely ſigne token yt repē taunce hart thorow offering come ſeedes ſake promiſed abraham theyr ſinnes forgeuen like maner ornamentes phareſey publican declare luke xviij luke 18 ſee paule thoroughout al byble became captiue ſerue put truſt neyther god hys worde ſo better creature agaynſt nature ſerue worſe whereof likelihode god ſhould haue accepted worke reaſon hart iewes became ſeruauntes captiues theyr workes bene right haue accepted ſoules blouds ſake calfe ſhepe much man much better calfe ſhepe chriſt teſtifieth math xij pleaſure ſhould god haue bloude calues light candels hys pleaſure onely harte loue commaundementes went imagination blynd reaſon ſaying blinde reaſon hipocrites much god accepteth theſe holy workes fayth faithleſſe faith fayned faith owne making god ſcripture deſcribeth fayth ſo beleuing chriſt would iuſtified owne deedes denying chriſt papiſtes beleue mad thē thoſe iewes beleue nothing reaſon mahomet therfore argumentes fayth turkes better fayth thereto may ſtand owne confeſſion miſchiefe well appeareth yeldyng themſelues worke wickedneſſe full delectation enſample faith father deuil hauing wife xx child able finde though ſole papiſtes preſerred ceremony neighbour know neceſſitie ſhal get begging chriſtes ſake long ſommers day inough fynde two dayes honeſtly diſguiſed monſter come ſhall wyth houres lying pulpit get inough finde thirty forty ſturdy lubber moneth long y• weakeſt ſhall ſtrong belly commeth vnto manger might • eſt porter y• weyhouſe beſt courſer y• kynges ſtable cauſe diſguiſing ceremony ye deedes ceremony count better thē deedes god cōmaundeth done neighbour hys nede thinketh good deede feede poore ſticke vp candle poſt ſprinckle himſelf holy water neither poſſible otherwiſe long ſignification loſt thyng long ſignificatiō ceremony ſo long ſufferable y• •… •… tion beyng gone ceremony mere ſuperſtuiō people thinke ſuch deedes ordeyned god becauſe euident ſerue neighbour neede referred vnto ye perſon god though aſpirite yet ſerued therewyth forth diſpute blynde reaſon god greater man ſo deede appointed ſerue god greater ſerueth man poſſible thinke ordeyned nought wiſe thinke ordeyned iuſtitie ſhould holy therby according pope doctrine though god better pleaſed ſprinkle ſelfe water ſet vp candle block fed clothed holpe neede ſo tenderly feareful terrible countenaunce holy ghoſt reuell gamboldes mayd ipſwich alſo matter maketh whether man haue deuill holy ghoſt ye ſay deuill thē ſhe likewiſe deuill holy ghoſt moreouer thoſe poſſeſſed vnto old blocke read legend bartholomew deuils bartholomew hurt men lynnues aſſone brought certain temple idole departed ſo beguiled people makyng beleue idole healed ſome naturall diſeaſes howbeit let holy ghoſt mayd kent thē pray thyng woorthy ſo great prayſe hath lady done lady lady dyd mayde kent ſmall pleaſure hath deliuered holy ghoſt emptied much hygh learnyng goodly poetiſſe ſhe vttered rime appoſe chriſt scripture teſtifieth hym thou ſhalt finde cleane without rime reaſon maide home alſo heauenly pleaſures lady hath deliuered ioyes oreſtes brought oreſtes miſeries middell earth agayne xvij chapter doulia hyperdoulia lattia though ſhew thē worſhypped cardinal hat aunſwered vnto already xviij chapter xviij would fayne tradit •… proue pope churche erre alledgeth thynges wherof might aſhamed paſt ſhame proue byſhops haue authoritie lade v traditiōs neither profitable ſoule body bringeth falſe allegorie vppon ouerplus samaritane layde promiſed pay came agayn byſhops tradition nay beſides allegory euery man may fayne allegory▪ pleaſure proue nothing chriſt interpreteth ſelfe betokeneth kynde mynde louyng neighbour ſo loued ſtraunger neuer left caryng abſent well parable • •… tan offered vnto haue done repare thinges fallen decay ruine common wealth begger realmes falſe idolatry imageſe • uice haue left wherewith beare coſt common charge moreouer scribe phariſeis taught owne doctrine ſat vpon moſes ſeate owne therfore chriſt ſo far would haue v hearken god hath planted ſhalbe plucked vp rootes vnto man doctrine • ayd beware leuen scribe phariſeis saduces doctrine rebuked doctrine brake ſelfe taught diſciples ſo excuſed ſayd traditiōs ſoeuer heauenly father planted ſhould plucked vp rootes therto perſecutiō apoſtles iewes breakyng tradition prelate ought ſeruauntes apoſtles teach byſhops ſhould ſeruaunted lordes v chriſtes doctrine lordes ouer v oppreſſe v theyr owne peter calleth temptyng holy ghoſt actes xv lade heathē actes 15 ought aboue neceſſitie brotherly loue required paul rebuketh corinthian ouer much obedience galathians alſo warneth men ſtand faſt ſuffer ſelues brought bondage ſayth peter paule pope obey prince though god haue commaunded hym ſo commaunded v obey ſuperiours trouth cōmaunded v obey temporall ſword pope commaū ded obey byſhops doctrine chriſt owne teach breake thyngs raſhly vntruly reporteth v whiche ſene bookes men looke vpon tradition therfore vnderſtand generally traditiōs may free foole bonde wilineſſe thou brought bondage tradition hurt thy ſoule thy faith bee broken immediatly though loſſe thy lyfe greue body onely thē borne till god take breakyng peace vnitie ſore maketh chriſtes chriſtes burthen eaſie gentle burthē ſo ſore ſo cruell helpe byſhops lade v ſurely ſpeaketh vndiſcretly chriſt dyd lade v one ſillabe euer bound neither thyng interpret law truly beſides geueth vnto hys loue vnto law loue maketh thinges eaſie borne impoſſible ſayth ye ſalt math 5 • earth ſpoken byſhops prieſtes onely vntrue ſpoken generally vnto beleue know truth ſhould ſalt vnto ignoraunt perfecter vnto weaker ech euery man meaſure moreouer ſpokē vnto prelate onely fortuneth y• ☞ ſo • uſie • ault ſtrōger weaker much beleue ſo much loue ſo much hope ye ſo much worke xix chapter xix hee proueth praying saintes good miracle cōfirme god el church ſayth doth erre foloweth dede pope church erreth aunſwere ſprāge falſe fayth loue haue god ſhould loue god moreouer promiſed thinges sauiour chriſtes ſake▪ saintes much loue god ſpringeth put faith ſhould beleue truſt god fayth god greater feruent deuotiō saintes ſhould praye saintes ſeyng haue promiſes thinges sauiour ieſu saintes none xxv chapter yt xxv iuggleth proue y• perteyneth vnto faith writtē alledging iohn iohn 21 laſt world could conteine bookes ſhoulde written iohn meaneth miracle ieſus neceſſary pointes fayth bringeth perpetuall virginitie lady virginitie lady though neuer ſo true yet none article fayth ſaued beleue ſtory fayth becauſe ſee cauſe reaſonable thinke contrary ſayth many miſteries antichriſt knowen yet opened commyng antichriſt nay verely babe knowne well inough token ſpide ſcripture deſcribeth hym alleageth paules tradition theſſalo proue hys paules tradition doctrine goſpel phantaſie haue anſwered rocheſter obedience tradition goſpell preached alleageth paule corin ſay paule neuer knew word maſſe neither chriſtes supper maſſe man gather thereof ſtraunge holy geſtures playne contrary vſe breake bread amōg ſupper chriſt therefore calleth chriſtes ſupper maſſe learned y• maner conſecration conſecration great doubt though coulde gather ſcripture water prieſt mingleth wyth wyne great doubt alſo perilois caſe left either done water mixed wyne ſlake heate wine put ceremony ſignifie water without aſketh ſcripture know womā may chriſten anſwere baptim ſo neceſſary make loue thy woman baptiſe neighbour thy ſelfe doth teach woman baptiſe tyme neede yea teach rule huſbandes beſides ſelues vnderſtanding scripture teach y• people happeneth care ſo ſore balde ceremonie y• ſignificatiō loſt though chriſt hymfelſe inſtitute coulde obſerue without falſe faith without hurtyng ſoules finally ſo haue law god written beleue god haue lawe written hart • harte taught yt ſpirite know ſinne abhorre feele power reſurrection chriſt beleue much ſurer haue none certeintie fayth pope preachyng doctrine mynded olde pope cardinalles byſhops ſayd ye thyng meane whereunto theſe raigne ſay nay ſyr gather generall counſell matter church fraunce italy beleue church spayne douchland becauſe ſo ſay liued much bounde beleue could erre wherefore muſt graunt god muſt ſhew myracle tone parte el muſt bring autētike ſcripture ſyr god hath made hys laſt euerlaſting teſtament ſo open behynde appearyng prophetes hath lye legendes preachynges bookes haue loue vnto truth appeareth great ſinnes haue ſet vp aboue abhominatiō heathen euer long continuaunce therin frailtie malice vnto truth obſtinate appointementes made betwene founder ſee whether accuſers •• aytours alſo accuſ • r mē ſecretly theyr owne kynges owne nation headmeſte ſee heady • whether proue bold runne headlōg vnto miſchief mighty iugglers iugglers poynt popiſhe wyth finger ſayth men wyth corrupt mindes caſt awaies concernyng fayth ſo fleſhly mynded ſo croked ſo ſtubbu • ne ſo monſtrous ſhapen cā receaue faſhion ſtand buildyng grounded vppon fayth whē yu haſt turned wayes done thy beſt hew make frame thou muſt fayne caſt wyth turkes iewes ſerue god wyth image ſeruice owne falſe workes ☞ theſe ſuch like textes ſimilitudes chriſt maketh goſpell kyngdome heauen appeareth though holy ghoſt choſen teacheth truth chriſt put truſt hym ſo cannot erre therein yet whyle worlde ſtandeth god ſhall neuer haue church ʋnderſtand therefore god calleth congregation vnto hys name ſendeth forth meſſēgers call generally meſſengers bring great multitude amaſed aſtonied wyth myracles power reaſōs preacher make therewyth compelled cōfeſſe one god power might aboue chriſt god man borne virgine thouſand thynges thē great multitude called choſen haue gotten thys fayth common wel deuils ſtrongly perſuaded vnto deuils vnto go vnto owne imagination ſaying may longer ſerue idoles god one maner ſeruice fet owne fleſhly churche ſerue god workes owne braynes worde god ſerue god wyth bodely ſeruice tymes paſt idoles harte ſeruing owne luſtes ſtill one ſerue hym white blacke grey pyed frier ☜ god pleaſure withall ſure ſhow ſhall haue two three good thicke ſoles vnder wyll cut blaſing hypocrite hym aboue ſo ſommer whyle weather hot thou mayſt ſee hys bare fote winter hys ſocke wyll ſhorne ſhauen saduces ſay righteous phariſeis ſeperated faſhions frō men yea wyll conſecrat thēſelues altogether vnto god wyll annoint handes halow chalice al maner lay vſes ſo may ſerue neither father mother maiſter lord prince poluting thēſelues muſt wayte god onely gather vp hys rente tythes offeringes duty ſacrifice come cōſume altar belly make calil ſacrifice mā may haue part calil ſacrifice • may haue parte therof beleue god loue hys lawes ſo haue power beleue hym put truſt confidence owne workes workes ſaued rich world whē ſue vnto great men hope giftes preſentes obtayne cauſes neither ſeruing god know ſaue ſuch eye may ſee bellyes feele zeale god vicar preſcribe maner vnto faſhiō ſhall ſerue god compell thē therto auoyding idolatry thou ſeeſt phariſeis little flocke ſoone ſmall flocke chriſt commeth word promiſes god perſwaded god rū neth vnto hys owne imaginatiōs vnto meſſēger called hym hym aſketh ſhall ſerue god litle paul act ix whē chriſt ouerthrowen caught actes 9 hys net aſked ſaying lord wilt thou multitude cōuerted act 2 aſked actes 2 apoſtles ſhoulde preacher ſetteth lawe god offer harte haue written therein conſenting good righteous becauſe haue runne cleane contrary vnto good law ſorrow mourne becauſe alſo bodyes fleſh otherwiſe diſpoſed preacher comforteth ſheweth thē teſtamēt chriſtes chriſt onely perfect cō forte • chriſtian bloud ſake y• done forgeuē weaknes ſhalbe taken worth vntil ſtronger onely repent wyll ſubmit themſelues ſcholers learne keepe law little flocke receaueth thys teſtament hys hart walketh ſerueth god ſpirit henceforth chriſt wyth hym chriſt chriſtes receaueth receaueth chriſt ☞ doth doth chriſt father mother maiſter lord prince chriſtes vnto hym chriſt ſerueth wyth loue hys wife child ſeruauntes ſubiectes chriſt vnto hym teacheth ſerue chriſt hymſelfe hys luſtes receaue good chriſtian mā thinges ſeketh • honour chriſt thyng mā thāketh god chriſt moued man hart neighbour ſerueth chriſt hys neede ſuch thynges god hath lent becauſe degree bought chriſtes bloud wil ſaued ſeruing hys brethrē neither promiſeth brother heauē ſeruyng hym heauen iuſtifying forgeuenes gyftes chriſtian ſel • eth ſaluatiō onely chriſt grace promiſed receaue chriſt hys merites freely yt haue receaued chriſt ſerue ech freely one hand doth ſeekyng ſeruice thē one hand doth ech others health wealth helpe ayde ſuccour aſſiſte one way chriſt god ſerue ſpirit loue hope faith dread great multitude pretye 〈◊〉 n •• theſis betwen pope churche chriſtes litle flocke called choſen cain iſmaell eſau carnall iſraell ſerue god night day wyth bodely ſeruice holy workes ſuch wont ſerue idoles withall beholde little flocke come forth ſeruice god rore thou commeſt thou forth takeſt holy water wherfore ſaith y• little flock put away thy ſinnes nay brethrē god forbid ye ſhould ſo thinke chriſtes bloud onely waſheth away ſinnes repent beleue fire ſalt water bread ☜ oyle bodely thynges geuen vnto man neceſſitie helpe hys brother wyth god ſpirit cannot ſerued therwyth neyther ſuch thynges enter ſoule purge god worde onely purgation ſay ſuch thynges halowed ſay halowing popiſh church aūſwereth ſoeuer ſprinkled wyth water eateth bread ſhall receaue health ſoule body sir bleſſinges litle flocke promiſed vnto abraham nation chriſt bloud muſt fet word bread ſalt water ſoules god hath geuē power geue thorow charmes ſuch vertue vnto vnſēſible creature hath halowed himſelfe made cleane bodely vſe beleue thorow word promiſe permiſſion thankes geuing god ſayth thou beleue saint ihons goſpell thou ſhalt ſaued ye bearyng thee ſo many croſſes obſeruing ſuch obſeruaunces god thy bitter paſſion rore pope church hereticke tel thee holy church neede alleadge ſcripture haue holy ghoſt inſpireth thē euer ſecretly ſo yt erre whatſoeuer ſay ordayne wilt thou diſpiſe bleſſed sacramentes holy church wherewyth god hath bene ſerued xv hundred yeare ye verely v thouſād yeres euen ſince cain hetherto ſhall endure vnto worldes end among thē haue loue vnto truth ſaued thereby thou art ſtrong hereticke worthy burnt thē excommunicat church yt little flocke feare bugge goe ſtraight vnto king like grace perilous people ſeditious euen inough deſtroy maner • yt pope cleargie realme ye ſee betimes ſo obſtinat tough wyll conuerted rebellious agaynſt god ordinaunces hys holy church much ſhal ſo againſt grace encreaſe grow multitude wyll peruert ſurely make new lawes eyther ſubdue grace vnto ryſe agaynſt thē goeth part yt little flocke pot reſt ſcatter little flock g •• th euer wracke thus hath euer bene ſhall euer • e let man therefore deceaue hymſelfe aunſwere more ſecond booke firſt chapter ye may try doctrine ſpiritualtie scripture ſay beleue vndoubtedly try scripture thou pope 〈…〉 ••• ſcripture ſcripture muſt iudged 〈◊〉 finde playne contrary scripture thou mayſt beleue scripture ſeke gloſe allegorie make agree whē pope ſayth ye iuſtified woorkes ceremony sacramentes ſo forth scripture ſayth iuſtified repentaūce hart chriſtes bloud firſt true playne pope ſayth ſtandeth text ſecōd falſe appeareth vnto thine vnderſtandyng literall ſence killeth thou muſt therfore beleue pope chriſtes doctrine ſeeke allegorie myſticall ſence thou muſt leaue cleare light walke miſte yet chriſt apoſtles miracle required ☞ brother bee vnder kyngdome pope putteth ieopardy worſhpp vnconſecrated hoſte feareth worſhip vncōſecrated hoſ • e worſhyp men ſhould woorſhyp conſecrated doth teach neither vſe sacrament ought may worſhipped teacheth onely thynges may worſhypped ſheweth right worſhyp falſe noteth paul 1 cor 1 exhorteth v agree onely 1 cor 1 truth good onely agree great multitude together muſt firſt know true way agree ſame deepe blindneſſe dyd paule firſt teach true way hee inſtruct new true way ſaid epiſtle rebuke falſe confidence men cauſe diſſention errours among ſayth iewes saintes honour patriarkes prophetes teach diſhonour none iewes prayed none chriſt rebuked phariſeis garniſhyng ſepulchres prophetes folowed cōditions thē ſlew tyndale chriſt rebuked falſe truſt iewes wil work yes falſe truſt ſuche woorkes ye syr thinke ye deſerue heauen worſhyppyng saintes bone ready ſlea beleue teach lyue saintes dyd father ſlea thē beſides ye worſhyp saintes folowed chriſt example holy cardinall doubt ye make god proceſſe tyme alſo repeateth forgettyng eliſeus bone raiſed vp dead body confirme preachyng onely iſraelites wicked neither prayed hym myracles done prophetes apoſtles cō firme doctrine neither kiſſed bone offered ſticked vppe candels hym whiche thyng done kyngdōe y• iewes doubt ſome good kyng wold haue burnt bone aſhes wel braſen serpent great relique dead bone chriſt ſhewed woman whole hys coate coate becauſe ſhould worſhyppe chriſt ſayd fayth hath made whole coate chriſt miracle ſhewed prouoke worſhyppyng preachyng coate though kepe coate reuerently memoriall deede prouoke vnto fayth chriſt euill ſelfe miracle done confirmation doctrine paule doctrine ſent hys napkin heale yt ſicke mē ſhould ſhrine ſneueled napkin beleue preachyng x chapter x chapter saint god hys promiſes teſtament follow owne imagination more doctrine teacheth ſayth bodely ſeruice latria bodely ſeruice done referred vnto hym▪ ſpirite idololatria truſteth men know image saint aſke god hide moſes body diuers moſes iewes would haue knowen yt moſes bene god moſes▪ bone moſes bone bene moſes knew braſē ſerpent god yt golden braſen serpent calues god wod ſtone god syr euer falſe imagination world becauſe worſhip god ſpirite repent euill loue lawe beleue wyll helpe al neede therfore runne vnto owne imagination thinke god ſuch ſeruice image fulfill worldly deſires godly cā nought deſire god ſpirite wilbe worſhipped hys woorde god ſpirite wilbe worſhipped ſpiritually onely ſpirituall wil haue bodely ſeruice ceremony olde law ſet vp ſignifie word onely keepe people mynde hys teſtament obſerueth ceremony purpoſe idolater image ſeruer ſayth men aſke woman whether lady walſingam ipſwich ſaluted gabriel ſtoode chriſt hung croſſe wyll ſay neyther nother aſke hym meaneth ſay lady walſingam pray lady ipſwich idolatrou • perſō worſhippeth image yt saint pray lady wilſdō pray ſo much y• ſome recken thēſelues ſmall fooles make roules halfe houre long pray maner ſo pray thou mayſt • e ſure meane lady ſtoode croſſe ſaluted therto rehearſeth many abuſes womē ſing ſonges ribaudry proceſſion • though abuſed may put downe proceſſions cathedral church vnto abhominatiōs yet holy church cānot erre cōſent wyth full delectatiō one ſide amende abuſe ſide haue hyred proue ſophiſtry ye thing ought put downe bringeth wilde wilde iriſhe welch mē iriſh welch pray go ſteale aſketh whether becauſe abuſe prayer ſhould put praying downe nay like many thinges altered abuſes ſake prayer god commaundement fayth muſt prayer needes cannot away thynges men tradition indifferent thynges may well without wyth may well put downe diſhonouring god thorow y• abuſe haue turned kiſſing church pax haue put downe watching night church ſaintes eues abuſe ezechias brake ezech • braſen ſerpēt 4 king 18 abuſe euen ſo ſuch proceſſions multitude ceremony holydayes might wel put downe ceremony left would haue ſignifications put people ſhould taught sondayes god woorde woulde truely preached hys holy church would neyther true preaching god worde remoueth theft wickednes iriſhe yet welſhe woulde ſo pray praying like blyndneſſe may ſee buzſing latine holy dayes helpeth harte people wonder laugh rather weepe compaſſion ſee ſoules chriſt ſhed hys bloud periſh yet beleue holy church refuſe eaſter receaue y• tithe ſuch blynde people robbe well diſpence wyth falſe gottē good brought wyll lay enſample abraham melchiſedeck xii chapter xij alleageth hierome auguſtine prayed saint concludeth ſecte one better beſt anſwere though coulde proue prayed saintes yet coulde proue hymſelfe thereby beſt ſect good therefore pray saint firſt apoſtles patriarkes prophetes ſure folowed prayed none ☞ agayne good man might erre many thynges damned ſo hys errour directly agayuſt good mā may erre yet dampned promiſes chriſtes bloud neyther held maliciouſly beleued ſoules heauē immediatly prayed v one beleue heard al ſpake thought vppon prayed ſome saint pray put hym remēbrance onely pray neighbour without truſt confidence though falſe yet ſhould damned ſo lōg obſtinacie therein fayth haue chriſtes bloud ſhould ſwalow vp errour till better taught ſhould haue alleaged place prayed vnto ſaintes alleageth agaynſt hym ſelfe miracle wrought god confirme hys doctrine teſtifie preacher true meſſenger myracles confirme praying saintes confirme th • myracles though wonne ſaying olde holy doctours falſe doctrine vntrue miracle fayned let come forth miracle themſelues proue fayned syr ye haue doctours myracles ſtabliſhe worſhippyng doctours neither apoſtles myracles eſtabliſhe worſhipping • amages image ſo forth doctrine opinion faythleſſe people cōfirme yt deuil hath wrought much ſubtiltie myracles done saint graues preſence reliques long true myracles endured vntill ſcripture antentickly receaued done confirme preaching yt ſuch saint preached aliue therto myracles witch confound wyth myracles wyth ſcripture witch proue god deuill ſtabliſhe falſe fayth leade god doctrine doth likewiſe confound true doctrine ſet forth▪ needeth myracle falſe doctrine autēticke manifeſt ſcripture neede myracle bryng god teſtament cōfirmed wyth myracles ye ought require v like maner ye firſt geue ☜ v autenticke ſcripture doctrine ye haue ſcripture come let y• papiſtes lacke ſcriptures come torch miracle forth preach doctrine cō firme wyth myracle bring autenticke ſcripture agaynſt confounde myracle wyth greater moſes dyd ſorcerers egipt wyll beleue ſpeaketh tryall god wor • y• touchſtone tri • myracles myracles ye trie myracles whether true fayned beſides god worde ſhould triall ye refuſe ye falſifie ſpeaketh ſectes heretickes anſwere ye call heretickes beleue one chriſt ſcripture teacheth ye ſaue chriſt falſe • ectes y• popiſts church almoſt innumerable doctrine owne fayning wythout ſcripture ye haue many ſundry ſectes monkes fryer ſtudents diuinitie vniuerſities firſt yer ye come diuinitie ye taught deny ſaluation chriſt none teacheth nother ſo much article fayth follow almoſt euery man ſundry doctour ye ſcripture hys owue brayne framyng euer falſe opinion whiche hath profeſſed yer come ſayth god would ſoone vtter fayned myracles anſwere mahomet doctrine hath preuailed theſe viij hundred yeares god hath time one another improue wyth god woorde aſke whether mahometes fayned myracles haue preuayled viij hundred yeares abhominable deedes worſe turkes teſtifie ye loue truth leſſe vnto cauſe falſe miracle loue truth hath god promyſed mouth paule 2 theſſ 2 ſend aboundaunce ſtrength falſe myracles ſtabliſhe lye deceaue lead thē way ſo cannot periſhe vnkindneſſe loued truth liue therafter honour god member whē ſaith heretickes haue scripture nedeth miracle miracle anſwer nede ſo long haue autentickeſcripture ſayth god ſheweth myracles doctoures heretickes nedeth preach ſcripture confirmed wyth myracles receaued many hundred yeares agoe therefore god nedeth ſhew myracles preacher worde god nede miracle whyle liue ſtrength preaching ſhew myracles dead moue people pray put truſt ye make idoles saintes ſpeaketh myracles done church tyme perſecution anſwere thoſe miracle churche beleued scripture ſuffered yt heretickes ye neuer perſecution falſe falſe docctrine neuer perſecuted doctrine ye haue brought beſides scripture dyed ye perſecute • lea whoſ • euer god woorde doth rebuke owne miracle ye make boaſt ye haue fayned ſo groſly throughout al papiſtes aſhamed legēd lye legendes saintes ye aſhamed would fayne bee rid thē ye wiſt honeſtie ſo would ye thouſand thinges ye haue fayned cauſe heretickes fayne miracle ye doe walke purely entend falſehead deuill doth none cleaue faſt god word whiche deuill hateth miracle hinder doth read deuill hath holpē pope dignity ſtories pope cardinal ſee whether deuill hath holpe vnto highe dignity looke whether holy byſhoppes come otherwiſe vnto promotion ſeruing deuil ſetting chriſtendome variaunce ſheddyng bloud bringyng common wealth tyrāny teaching chriſten prince • ule cruelly euer heathen cōtrary vnto doctrine chriſt turkes saraſenes ye ſpeake aūſwere chriſtē leſt way moſt part becauſe loue vnto truth liue cauſe turkes iewes ca • come truth ye haue god ſend falſe miracle cary right waye ye iewes hyde onely becauſe haue ſet vp righteouſneſſe ye haue therfore admit righteouſneſſe chriſtes bloud ye ye haue forſworne ſayth haue miracle heretickes none popiſh doctrine nedeth miracle chriſtes doctrine nedeth miracle confirmed chriſt myracles ſure ſigne true churche heretickes ye god word miracle heretickes doctrine without true becauſe ye haue miracle without god word confirme falſe imaginatiōs whiche ye call heretickes haue god word cōfirmed miracle fiue hū dred yeares together ſure ſigne true church ye much alſo chriſt ſaith y• deceauers ſhall come miracle ye name therto ye whē chriſt ſaith ſhal come name yt ſhal ſay ſelfe chriſt math 24 ſaue pope wilbe chriſtes ʋicare yet maketh men beleue pope commeth 〈◊〉 chriſtes name falſe miracle ſelfe bulles calues ſkinnes ſoeuer liſteth thoſe falſe annoynted ſhall come miracle deceaue elect poſſible ſaue pope greſiamus repeteth miracle proue olde holy doctours good men right belefe aunſwere agayne doctours planted god word watered miracle alyue whē dead god ſhewed preacher god word confirmed ſame miracle whyle alyue miracle graues confirme ſame heliſeus liuing man might bold folow whoſe doctrine man might beleue reaſon theyr miracle iuggleth god ſuffe • eth ſuch haue loue hys truth deceaued lying miracle ſaying god ſhould ſo new teſtamēt haue doctours miracle confirme doctrine liuynges contrarywiſe ſhould bryng paſſe ſuffer bee brought paſſe falſe miracle church ſhuld take hypocrite saintes expoſided scripture falſly ſhould hee deceaue receaued olde tyme confirmed wyth myracles therewith trie controuerſie elder aſketh whether noe true fayth adam noe anſwere god partly wrote fayth ſacrifices partly patriarkes ful miracle ye may ſee bible vtter darcknes blynde ignoraunce ſayth ouerwhelmed wyth yes floud good faith bringeth hym nicolaus de lira anſwere nicolaus de lira delirat faith •… th impoſſible haue fayth ſaued except man conſent vnto god law hart ſoule righteous holy good kept men thereuppon repent hath broken ſorow fleſh moueth vnto contrary come beleue god mercy forgeue hath done agaynſt lawe wyll helpe hym tame fleſh ſuffer weakenes meane ſeaſon till true faith repentaūce amēdment 〈◊〉 waxed ſtronger fayth periſhed noyes floud coulde haue mended liuinges hardened hart thorow vnbeliefe prouoked wrath god waxed worſe worſe hundred twenty yeares god gaue thē repent vntill god could lōger ſuffer thē waſhed filthines away ye floud doth ye pope ſhamefull ☜ abhominacions like invndacions water deſtroyed aſketh taught church know true ſcripture falſe bookes anſwere true miracle ſcripture aucthoriſed true myracles confounded falſe gaue authoritie vnto true ſcripture therby haue euer ſince iudged bookes doctrine know legendes falſe bookes ſet forth papiſtes corrupt wyth lie eraſmus hath improued many falſe bookes ye haue fayned put forth name hierom auguſtine ciprian eraſmus dioniſe partly wyth autenticke ſtories partly ye ſtile latine like euident token • ayth vnto thē beleue nought ye ſcripture proue ye ſcripture bounde beleue church thinges wherefore haue ſcripture becauſe god hath promiſed ſcripture holy ghoſt ſhall teach hys church truth nay text wil proue firſt church taught nought cōfirmed myracles coulde done god till ſcripture autentickly receaued church folowing true church teacheth nothing ſcripture proueth mainteineth teacheth nought haue beleued article fayth ſcripture proueth mainteineth auguſtine proteſteth workes men ſhould compare vnto ſcripture therby iudge caſt away whatſoeuer ſcripture allow therfore beleued without ſcripture falſe hypocrite chriſtes church though know meſſenger chriſt ſendeth lie yet cō • many liers know without token ſcripture miracle ſayth ſcripture ſel • e maketh v beleue ſcripture church teacheth v know ſcripture man might read beleue ſo ſay man might heare preach yet beleue pope hideth ſcripture alſo ſay therto church teacheth know scripture hideth latine common people papiſtes hide ye ſcripture vnderſtand latine hid true ſe •• e wyth thouſand ſal • e gloſes ſay moreouer ſcripture cauſe men beleue ſcripture cauſe doe ſay ſhould ye beleue doctrine papiſtes docctrine n •• beleued wiihou • ſcripture beſides ſcripture al expoſitions y• ſcripture well ye beleue tell ſuch ſuch bokes ſcripture may ſhew falſe booke yes therfore beginning beleue like euery lye tell owne braines beleue ſcripture ſo ſhould beleue thē ſhewed • alſe booke whē haue read ſcripture fynd • doctrine depend thereof geue ſo great credence vnto doctrine vnto ye ſcripture finde mo wi •• eſſes vnto ſcripture thē vnto doctrine finde whole nacions 〈◊〉 beleued wt ſcripture true church countryes receaue ſcripture refuſe doctrine expoſitions written harte neither god lawe papiſtes neither god lawe man refraine frō wicked liuyng man refraine opē outward wicked liuing looke chronicle bloude hath cofle england attempt bring thē vnder law yea ſee buſines ye realme hath keepe prelate within realme taking benefice lying rome yet ſcarſely brought paſſe pope hath ſtint euery byſhoppricke euery great abbey therto oft voyde yer new admitted roome ſee thē bond vnto owne conſent vnto al god hath forbiddē ſee thē people moſt vain glorious ſee walke iohn 10 fleſhly birth ſee ſo farre frō image chriſt onely dye flocke enſample alſo yer would loſe one towne vilage polling priuilege haue falſly gotten bryngyng ſelues good paſtures wile ſhuttyng theyr papiſtes loſe nothing belongeth flocke without would caſt away hundred thouſand thē one day begger realmes yea interdite bring ſtraunge nation though turke cō quere ſlea vp ſo much innocent cradle ſee doctrine vā tage onely therewith haue gotten haue finde scripture ye iewes cōmyng chriſt knew thoſe bookes ſcripture scribe ye phariſeis yet many beleued doctrine many expoſitions chriſt deliuered iewes errour ſcripture deceaued ye ſee chriſt deliuered errour ſee agayne ſmall miracle mercyfull care god keepe scripture ☜ teſtimonie vnto elect ſo great men gelous ouer bookes kepe ſhew alledge scripture god true read eares haue power beleue iewes popiſh therfore becauſe neither beleue falſe neither conſent none haue care ſcripture thoſe beleue true ſoundeth playnly eares ſo contrary vnto fleſhly wiſedome depart ſeke thouſand gloſes turne ſenſe make agree vnto beaſtlyneſſe receaue ſuch gloſes theyr thinke man vnderſtandeth end chapter cōmeth vnto wiſe concluſion proueth nothing ſaue ſheweth ignoraunce thyng ſayth beleue doctrine scripture without scripture example pope pardon becauſe onely church ſo teacheth though scripture confirmeth ſo becauſe ſayth holy ghoſt inſpiration doe endeuour captiuate mine vnderſtandyng teacheth beleue church concernyng god worde taught churche grauen men harte scripture well teacheth v beleue wordes written scripture marke hee afore hee ſaith scripture cauſeth v beleue scripture man may reaſoneth agaynſt himſelfe read beleue much preacher maketh v beleue ye preacher man may heare beleue alſo ſee apoſtles could cauſe men beleue though scripture outward inſtrument preacher alſo moue mē beleue yet chief principall cauſe man beleueth beleueth within ſpirite god teacheth child ☜ beleue deuill blyndeth child kepeth vnbeleffe maketh conſent vnto lye thinke good euill euill good actes apoſtles ſay many actes 13 place beleued many ordeyned vnto euerlaſtyng lyfe chriſt ſayth iohn viij iohn 8 god heare god word vnto wicked iewes ſaith ye cā beleue becauſe ye god ſame place ſayth ye father deuill ye bode truth therfore ſuffer child conſent truth iohn ye x ſaith preach chriſt truty murtherers chriſt came theeues murtherers ſhepe heard theyr voyces preach ſaluatiō ſaue chriſt murther ye ſoules howbeit many hundred yeares affirme vnto contrary ſay firſt wyth paule kingdome god rom 14 meate drinke ſame reaſon neither huſband wife yt keeping commaundements loue euery man neighbour himſelfe therefore meate drinke ordeined man neceſſitie man may care drinke needes degree ſo farre letteth keepe commaundementes loue neighbour himſelfe euen ſo wife created man neceſſitie therefore may man vſe hys neede degree farre ſhe letteth hym keepe god lawe nothing el paules learning man loue hys neyghbour himſelfe deſire reaſon more doctrine doth ſecond wife third hinder more doctrine ſuperſtitious loue chriſt thē choſen ordeyned beleue put truſt ſaued man taketh wife geueth himſelfe honour hys rich hath maketh equall degree vnto himſelfe king ſhe beggers daughter yet ſhe ye leſſe quene honour aboue al emperour ſhe empreſſe honoured men emperour partaker euen ſo man repēt come beleue chriſt ſaued dampnation ſinne repenteth chriſt hys owue good immediately chriſtes death paine prayer paſſion faſtyng merites man ſinnes full ſatiſfaction ſacrifice might power abſolue hym 〈◊〉 pena et culp 〈◊〉 chriſtes enheritaunce loue fauour hath wyth god father man man mariage pure chriſt cleane wythout ſinne honourable glorious weibeloued fauour thorow yt grace mariage becauſe prieſt muſt repreſent v ſignification cauſe prieſt may haue ſecond wyfe ſay popiſhe reaſon hath deceaued many wiſe deceaued ſome thing receaue doctrine auctoritie elder except haue occaſion haue runne moſes prophetes heare ſee owne eye beleue longer reaſon oure forefather ſee ſo ſhamefully beguild themſelues beguile v thouſand thing turkes ſee purpoſe doctrine true muſt euery prieſt haue wife haue wife neuer wife repreſent v againe hath whore man wife hath loſt property therfore ought put downe againe ſecond mariage thē man sacramēt doctrine yet deſcribe mariage chriſt well mariage hath ix wyues hath tenth hath firſt ſay wyfe idolater came chriſt virgine maried sir ſignification ſtandeth yt virginitie actuall wedlocke virgines came chriſt cōmon whore beleuing thouſand idoles ſecond mariage tenth ye man hath one wife wiues land huſbande wife ſay therfore paul deuiliſhe doctrine hath ſimilitude godlines power away myſte blyndeth eye ſimple beguileth ſee thouſand abhominations wrought vnder cloke therfore ſay ſtill apoſtles meaning ſhoulde paules doctrine prieſts ſhuld haue wiues haue wi • e haply age greater one wi • e excludeth two defamed ſaue owne wiues woulde haue thē ſuch knowen vertuous liuing reuerence honour vnto doctrine chriſt appeareth widowes excludeth lx yeares feare widowes vnchaſtitie admitteth yet none age except ſhe well knowen chaſt honeſt godly behauiour honour god word withall pope hath nothing vile whē mock bringeth forth text wydowe ſhe muſt wife one man anſwere ieſting paule excludeth x huſbands one ij huſbandes attonce laugheth though neuer ſco • fer bene guiſe would god mercy guiſe day ſure hys wrath would ſo great paule meaneth onely would haue diffamed woman choſen wydowe diſhonouring worde god congregation chriſt therefore excludeth common woman ſuch diffamed beſides huſbandes haply yt deuorced therto proue ſame doctrine paule kingdome god ſuch buſines keping god commaundementes onely loue one looke yt thing office widowe waite ſicke poore people waſhe ſtraūgers feete widowes ten huſbandes muſt haue founde coſt congregation deſticute frends poore though tyme paſſed haue bene diffamed perſons vnder lx would paule let none miniſter feare occaſions vnchaſtity therto none ſuch well knowen honeſt liuing good report much widow ten huſbands muſt foūde common coſt neede vncleanes reaſon ſecōd huſband ſhe good inough ſeruaunt vnto poore people dreſſe meate waſhtheir clothes make beddes ſo office w • ddowes ye primatine church forth waſh ſtraūgers feete came one congregation vnto buſineſſe▪ maner ſeruice loue vnto poore brother ſiſters haue ſecond huſband ſhame among heathen ſhame amōg chriſten huſband dead wife free mary ſhe lord good reaſon huſband right free prieſt therfore ſhame doctrine cōgregation diſhonour god amōg heathen weake chriſten whē haue playne rule whiche rom 13▪ loueth neighbour ſelfe kepeth lawes god let hym tell cauſe loue toward hys neighbour widow two lawfull huſbands may ſeruice vnto poore people may widow fifty ſeruice vnto poore paule whiche knytteth ſnares leadeth v blind teacheth v without reaſon geuing doctrine aunſwereth feare occaſions euill leſt ſhe tempted tempt ſhe taken miſdoyng doctrine chriſt euill ſpoken therto weake offended mocketh reaſon would haue euerye prieſt haue wife becauſe men cā liue chaſte aunſwere loued honor chriſt neighbour doth owne couetouſneſſe ſhould finde good argument paul maketh ſame much ſclenderly ſophiſtrie hee diſputeth thus ſome yoūg widowes young widowes forbiddē miniſter commō ſeruice diſhoneſt ye congregation chriſt doctrine therfore ſhall young widow miniſter common ſeruice therof ſhal maried beare child ſerue huſbādes farre leſſe rebuke doctrine chriſt cōgregation womā ſhould amiſſe biſhop prieſt ſo mad thinke yt could prieſt line chaſte neither ſo fooliſh thinke many womē could liue chaſt fifty prieſtes xxiiij yet though thouſand widowes fifty yeare old ix hundred xc ix could liue chaſt paul becauſe knoweth one wil let none miniſter common ſeruice amōg occaſions vnchaſtitie chriſtes apoſtles conſidered infirmity might hynder doctrine chriſt therfore dyd beſt preuēt occaſiōs wherfore fiſhe better fleſhe fleſhe better fiſhe kingdame chriſt fiſh better fleſh fleſh better fiſh kyngdome chriſt euen ſo virginitie wedlocke widowed none better ſaued nature pleaſe god ſoeuer may beſt ſerue brother euer beſt accordyng vnto tyme faſhion world perſecution good euery man liue chaſt namely preacher peace man may liue quietly abyde one place wiſe ſure thyng cut occaſiōs would make ſeme prieſtes wiues occaſions hereſies 〈◊〉 ☞ tyndall almany nay fell firſt hereſies tooke wiues ye ſell firſt pope holy doctrine tooke whore church byndeth man tyndall chaſtitie tyndall truth geueth licence ſoeuer wil kepe whore permitteth abuſe men wiues ſuffereth ſodomitrie doth onely forbid matrimonie ſayth chaſtitie moſt receaued generall cuſtome three lye •… ce lawe made one lye good father dyd geue theyr aduiſe therto lye ratified receaued cōſent chriſtendome third lye well choſe poete defender firſt attempted generall coūcell reſiſted holy father yet thēſelues neuer maried ſaying men might knit •… ate weake brethrē agaynſt doctrine chriſt hys apoſtles neither could bee brought paſſe vntill pope got emperours ſword hys hād grekes one halfe chriſtendome ſuppoſe would neuer admit godly loue would neuer ſuffer cōſent ſhould boūd vnto burthen themſelues could beare place affirmeth dyd agayne haue manifeſt ſtoryes brought violence ot ſword prieſtes germany 〈…〉 cōpelled put away wiues finde wherſoeuer pope raigneth came deceauyng kyng countrey ſword cō • elled reſt pope came late wale raigne ouer byſhops prieſtes ſword kyng england yet though clergie chriſtendome graunted church made yet tenth part church lay people well churche prieſtes neither prieſtes world right make law wherin part lyeth without conſent perteineth vnto cōmon people moſt vnto prieſtes muſt endued wyth vertue honeſty weakeſt prieſtes endued vertue honeſtie chaſtitie wife daughter ſeruaunt perteineth vnto euery particular man ſee experience defiled dayly vnchaſt chaſtitie ſpiritualitie wherfore pariſhes one pariſh ſene experience incōueniences came chaſtitie would haue curate except wife cut occaſions paule ſene proofe would haue young widowes miniſter ſaue tyraunt ſhould agaynſt moreouer generall councels ſpiritualtie maner generall counſell ſence pope god generall parlamentes temporalitie man dare ſay hys mynde frely liberally • eare ſome one flatterer looke captiuitie parlamentes vnder priuate coū ſels parl •… ment kinges ſo generall coū cels vnder pope cardinal maner one two three wilye fox haue ſubiection ye 〈◊〉 vſed generall to▪ •… e alſo 〈◊〉 parliamentes haue ſene lord cardinall imagine ought luſt haue conceaue theyr braynes go child ſome tyme yeare ij iij iiij v vi vij ſome tyme xx aboue caſtyng • eſing compaſſing byrth agaynſt oportunitie openyng matter priuely vnder othe litle litle vnto certaine secretary whoſe part therin finde men actiuitie courage prepared ſell ſoule body promotion matter meane tyme turmoyled toſſed among themſelues perſuaſions ſutle reaſons forged blind right way beguile men wittes whō feare haue aduerſaries able reſiſt ſuch meanes ſought bring vnto partie conuey way whē oportunitie come call counſel parlamēt vnder contrary pretēce maſſe holy ghoſt deſire farre away poſſible ſong goodly sermon made blere men eye ſodenly mē vnprouided matter opened moſt ſuttle maner many beguiled ſuttle argumentes craftie perſuaſions hold hard agaynſt practiſe vſed counſayles parlamentes thē called aſide reaſoned part handled faſhion partly entiſed fayre promiſes partly feared cruell threatnyngs ſo ſome ouercome ſiluer ſyllogiſmes feare threatnyng driuen vnto ſilence found laſt obey falſehead tyranny rayle ieſt coūtenaunce call opinatiue ſelfe mynded obſtinate beare hand deuill ſo cleaueth vnto owne witte though ſpeake ſilllable god word aſked whether wilbe wiſer mē ſpiritualitie excommunicate make hereticke ſpiritualtie make heretickes reſiſt theyr power true clergy chaſtitie cleare ye day manifeſt chronicle ſo much prelate rome brewyng aboue hundred yeares wot long lenger yer could bryng paſſe yet vayne til got emperours ſword proue moſt expedient ſo entent prieſtes may haue wyues bryng vnder pope prelate landes might old maner come wayte pope rome prepared thē whore inough ſworne prelate euery land might conueniently wayte kyngs courtes miniſter commō wealth vnto pope pleaſure profite clergie kept wiues could neuer haue come vnto theſe plurality vniōs totquottes lay man though neuer ſo euill diſpoſed could wife child haue leyſure cōtr •… e ſuch miſchiefe runne countrey countrey learne falſhead ſubtiltie ſpiritualtie without feare chaſtitie •• ergy pert •• neth tempo •… ie much ſpiritualtie god ſhame man keepe whore wherſoeuer come thus ye ſee clergy chaſtitie pertayneth much vnto temporaltie vnto ſpiritualtie power among profeſſe truth may bynde god lowſeth ſaue onely loue neighbour neceſſitie requireth neyther power binde come may freely keepe breake thing hurtfull expediēt neither bond loue neceſſitie requireth contrary law loue thy neighbour helpe thou wouldeſt holp muſt interpret man lawes ſworne young vnwiſely would liue chaſt world bound afterwarde burnt could ouercome paſſion ought mary muſt condition vow vowes ſhew cauſe thereto may vow chaſtitie ſelfe though ſacrifice pleaſe god ſelf idolatry heathen muſt therfore vowe neyghbour ſeruice caſe may require geue ſelfe quietly prayer ſtudie poſſible long burne minde quiet may better keepe ye lawes god burne ſtand thorow chaſtitie ieopardy breake oth kept agaynſt charitie neceſſitie hurt neighbour ſhame yt doctrine chriſt like maner forſworne fleſh al world bound yet neceſſitie require ſaue life health ought breake againe though ſworne chaſtitie cōmon wealth neceſſitie required contrary muſt breake one ſide euer burnt pope chaſtitie neuer gaue prieſt licence take wife keepe whore onely ſide vow vow thing ſelfe though ſayd ſeruice ſacrifice god delite deede young child haue apple deede ſhall haue higher roome heauē neighbour idolatry heathen whē ought beſtow vow vppon hys neighbour bryng heauen enuie ſeeke thereby higher roome caring whether neighbour come thether finally burne vſe naturall remedy god hath made tempt god thinges god haue brought thee ſtraite haue therto takē naturall remedy thee reſiſte crie vnto god helpe ſuffer ſigne yt thou loueſt god lawes loue god law ſure thou art god childe elect mercy child onely writeth token ſayth euery man hath choyce whether prieſt nettes ſnares doth pope ſnares antichriſt lay firſt falſe doctrine elder beguiled cōpell child 〈◊〉 ſacrifice burne pope chaſtitie mynde thoſe olde idolater ſacrificed child vnto falſe god moloch ſo thinke merites childrens burning pope falſe doctrine pleaſe god get heauen cleane ignoraunt teſtament made chriſtes bloud multitude blinded 2 drawen net baite promotion honour dignitie pleaſures freedome libertie ſinne miſchiefe vnpuniſhed thing euill feare god deſire number brought vp idely vnto xx aboue put 3 heades halter becauſe haue craſt get liuinges becauſe liue chaſt alſo ſome liue chaſt xxiiij ſame burne xxx true 4 dayly experience teacheth good naturall cauſes thē looke apoſtles learning 5 ordinaunce one two young wydowes brokē chaſtitie would neuer let moe bee choſen ſame age commeth pope ſo many hundred thouſandes miſcary neither breake ordinaunce mitigat let goe backe burne ſendeth vnto ſhame chriſtes doctrine offending hurt hys church neuer vnto lawfull remedie mariage calleth hereſie tyndall doth playnly proue hereticke thinke maried pleaſaunt god vnmaryed ſurely hereticke thinketh cōtrary chriſtes kingdom neither meate drinke huſband wife widow virgine keepyng commaundementes ſeruing man neighbour louingly doctrine paul eate helpeth keepe commmaūdementes better eate better eate eate eate helpeth keepe euer beſt moueth man kepyng god commaundementes commaundementes dutie vnto neighbour better eate eate like caſe without wife helpeth keepe cōmaundemētes ſerue man neighboure better vnmaryed maried wife helpeth keepe commaundementes better without better haue wife wythout hart onely ready let vndone ☜ thinges neighbour ſake pleaſaunt thing ſight god haue prieſtes liue chaſt reuerence sacramentes deuiliſh doctrine deuilliſhe doctrine hauing ſimilitude godlines pith marow away meane water oyle ſalt ſuch like y• wyfe body vſes lawes god incomparable purer holyer meane ſacrament chriſtes body aunſwere handes defile man ought goeth thorow handes neuer ſo vnwaſhed teſtimony chriſt much leſſe math 15 defile chriſt moreouer prieſt toucheth chriſtes natural body sacrament chriſtes naturall body wyth handes owne doctrine ſeeth eye breaketh wyth hys finger eateth wyth hys mouth chāmeth teeth drinketh bloud lippes chriſt impaſſible repenteth toward lawe god sacrament body 〈◊〉 bloud chriſt muſt receiued ſight ſacrament breaking feling eating chamming drinking calleth remembraunce death chriſt body breaking bloud ſhedding ſinnes paſſion ſame eateth sauiours body drinketh bloud thorow fayth onely receaueth forgeuenes ſinnes therby haue doctrine sacrament come therto vaine therfore cauſe ſayth maſſe ſhould liue chaſt heareth miniſtreth sacramēt receaueth great maruell vnlawfull whoredome couetouſnes extortion defile handes well law full matrimonye curſſed therefore deuilliſhe doctrine wyth falſe appearing godlines fruit power away harte chriſten men bringeth enſample heathen prayſe heathen becauſe could vnderſtand god ſpiritually ſerue hym ſpirit beleue loue lawes therfore turned hys glory vnto image ſerued hym owne imagination bodely ſeruice whole kingdome pope doth hauing leſſe power ſerue hym ſpirite turkes heathē made image ax feuers ſacrificed ther ☞ knew ye image feuers vnder ye ſimilitude ye image worſhipped power god plagued feuers bodely ſeruice pope doth aboue idolater euer worlde paint saint machael weying ſoules michael wayeth 〈◊〉 ſoules ſticke vp candle flatter make fauourable vnto v regarde teſtament chriſt lawes god becauſe haue power beleue loue truth euen ſo referre virginitie vnto perſon god pleaſe hym therwith falſe ſacrifice heatheniſhe idolatrie onely ſeruice god true ſeruice god beleue chriſt loue lawe wherfore thou muſt referre thy wedlocke thy virginitie thy deedes vnto keepyng lawe ſeruing thy neighbour whē thou lookeſt wyth louing hart law ſaith breake wedlocke keepe whore ſo forth findeſt thy body weake thyne office ſuch thou muſt haue conuerſation mēs wiues daughter ſeruauntes better haue wife thē without againe thou ſee ſeruice done yt thou canſt ſo well wyfe without thou haue power without beſt ſo ſuch like el one good difference take wife pleaſure good abſteine diſpleaſure ſeeth cauſe beſt ſpiritualitie gelded loſſe merite reſiſtyng beſides imagination playne idolatrie hold beguiled read gelded men true experience ſee beaſtes gelded luſt fleſh much vngelded true gelded whether beſt prieſtes gelded taketh ſuch great payne geldyng miniſhe luſtes luſtes ouercome yet haue wherewith hurt neighbour deſerueth vngelded beſt eate drinke make fleſh ſtrōg burned deſerue reſiſting ſome holy saintes haue layd virgin beddes kindle courage might ☜ quench heate cold water deſerue merite holy martyr whē ſayth prieſtes old law abſteined wiues ſerued tēple many thynges forbidden kepe bonde ſeruile feare purpoſes yet trow h • findeth text forbidden wiues imagineth ſo becauſe zacharias courſe gat home houſe thinke better go houſe ſend houſe alſo old wife forbidden tyme geue prayer might right well wel read leuit 10 bidden drinke wine ſtrong drinke miniſtred whiche powre without meaſure chriſt liued chaſt exhorteth vnto chaſtitie tyndall chriſtes tyndall complection neither exhorteth chaſtitie wedlocke ſaue tyme ſerue neighbour yt pope chaſtitie ſerue mās neighbour runne riotte carie away liuyng poore true preacher euen tythes v vj pariſhes go either dwell ſtewes cary ſtewes corrupt men wiues paphnutius man neuer proued paphnutius mariage prayſed ſtories reſiſtyng ſuch doctrine god word generall councell pope god man hath proued twiſe magnified defendyng ſophiſtrie agayn ſemeth great two wiues therefore bigamus ouer ſight thinke chriſt though neuer maryed would accept ſeruice maried mā would ſay truth hym abhorre wedlocke much ſpiritualtie accept humble ſeruice reward merites ſo high honour becauſe better fayne vnchaſt would ſay owne chaſt people though bigamus paſt grace necke verſe finally loke ſo much ye pleaſure mariage ſetteth eye thankes geuyng pleaſure pacience diſpleaſures xiiij chapter wicleffe occaſion vtter ſubuerſion realme boheme faith good liuing loſſe many thouſand liues tyndall rule fayth tyndall chriſtes promiſes rule liuyng god law▪ loſſe pope cruell tyra • nt liues truth pope ſ •• e thinke hundred thouſand becauſe fayth wold l • nger ſerue ſ •• e england many thouſand ſ •• e true • yng ſee vp falſe vnto e • fuſion noble bloud murthe ryng vp comminaltie becauſe ſhould deſender conſtitution byſhops scripture ſhall engliſh man may tranſlate owne authoritie read vntill approued tyndall tranſlatiō ſhalbe tyndall vntill geue licence till approue ſhal neuer ſo one effect ſay ſhalbe ſpiritualtie would haue ſcripture engliſhe none engliſh ſay till admitte ſeyng ſo malicious none admitte fayne cauillations proue expedient ſpite hart ſhall neuer thereto haue done beſt haue enacted parlament ſhould engliſh xv chapter ieſteth hunnes death hunne poetrie built ʋ topia many great lordes came baynardes caſtell nameleſſe examine cauſe y• credible prelares ſo well learned ſo holy ſo indifferent whiche examined bilney arture alſo nameleſſe horſey tooke pardon becauſe horſey good refuſe god pardon kynges tyndall god pardon man tyndall haue except knowledge himſelfe ſinner euen ſo yt receaueth kynges yeldeth ſelfe giltie moreouer poſſible yt giltie neede pardon putteth truſt god ſhould feare xij men iudges receaue pardon hee neuer faultie vnto diſhonoring ſauiour ieſus would haue denyed rather vnto death therto matter ſo cleare ye ieſt ſure kynges grace curteſie wiſedome wold haue charged iudges woulde excuſe murther hunne haue examined euidēce layd agaynſt diligētly ſo haue quit hym honeſty geue pardon neuer treſpaſſed haue rid ſpiritualitie hate ſuſpition ſayth hunne ſore ſuſpect hunne hereſie conuict ſayth hunne hereticke deede perill ſo proued ☜ conuict heard ſay firſt conuict whē dead wrōg burne till ſpoken whether would abiure byſhop london wiſe vertuous cunnyng tyndall thoſe three yet tyndall would haue made old deane colet paules hereticke tranſlatyng doetour lolet pater n • ſter engliſh byſhop canterbury holpe deane xvj chapter meſſenger aſketh hym old lawfull tranſlatiō wicleffes happeneth olde tranſlation ſo men handes ſeyng ſo many deſire aunſwereth printer dare print hang doubt • ul triall whether tranſlated ſence trāſlated ſence muſt firſt approued may ſay authoritie ſubtill poet poetrie lawfull trāſlation yt mā knoweth much lawfull trāſlatiō might ye biſhops ſhew lawfull trāſlation let printed nay might haue bene obteined thē large money printed ye may ſure lōg yer sir aunſwere vnto happeneth ye defender tranſlate one ſelues ceaſe murmour people put gloſes preuent heretikes ye would doubt haue done long ſence ye hauyng scripture engliſh vtterly agaynſt myndes popiſh clergie could haue made gloſes agree wt text euery place ſay beſides haue done beſt diſanull trāſlating parlament haue diſputed kynges grace perilous mete ſo concluded ſhall vnder pretēce deferring certein yeares ſpeciall orator fayne lye purpoſe nothyng diſcourageth clergie ſo much worſte ſorte moſt calleth tyndall might well phariſeis tyndall full holyneſſe long publican hunger mercy might ſore deſire howbeit deede ſuſpect thyng great ſigne heretike require iuggleth allegory ſcripture firſt deliuered p • op • e vulgere toung syr moſes deliuered receaued god mother toung hart therto ſtudied prieſts onely thou mayſt ſee scripture apoſtles kept nothyng behind paul teſtified actes xx ſhewed counſell god kept nought backe shuld lay people leſſe hearken vnto expoſitions prelate doubtfull place text handes preached iewes geue great reuerence vnto bible ſit tyndall pope putteth vnder tyndall feete treadeth tokē lord ouer ſhould ſerue god hath ordeined ordinary chief phiſitions tyndall lawyer ordeined tyndall pope ſkill scripture neuer ſaw ye haue profeſſed contrary doctrine right hangman ordina •… hangmē ſuch deſire knowledge ſcripture murther ſoeuer deſireth doctrine god hath geuē ordinary fayth liuyng maketh ſo great difficultie hardneſſe paules epiſtles ſay impoſſible vnderſtand eyther peter paul ought ye ſcripture denieth yt iuſtifiyng faith chriſtes bloud agayn impoſſible vnderſtād ye none vnderſtand scripture except knewe ſcripture turke whoſoeuer hath lawe god written hart fulfill pointe true faith feare voyde empty ſpiritualtie whoſe defender ye chriſt iuſtification haue taken vppon bee mocke truth lucre vaū tage aunſwere more fourth booke chriſtes church hath true doctrine already ſelfe ſame paule woulde geue angell audience vnto contrary tyndall tyndall pope church heare doctrine confirmed ſuch multitude miracle ſo much bloud martyr commō conſent neceſſitie breake vnlawful vowes broken immediatly martine appealed vnto next generall councell ſhould bee gathered martine tyndall holy ghoſt ſeke long delay tyndall truth lōg delay ſhould martine liue till pope would gather councell holy ghoſt godly purpoſe like euery heere hys head thouſand yeares old bringeth inconſtancie martine becauſe ſaith later martine booke ſeeth firſt paraduenture kynne doctours whiche preachyng agaynſte plurality falſehode eſpyed one 〈◊〉 haue got thre foure benefice alledge ſame excuſe yet ſay truth apoſtles chriſt learned truth one day long aſcention wiſt heathē ſhould receaued vnto fayth could martin brought vp blyndneſſe ſect aboue xl yeares ſpye falſehead one day martine offered wormes emperour lordes germany abyde booke diſpute might well doe ſithens ſafe conduct ſhould haue bodyly harme tyndal mercyful god come tyndall ye owne ſhame ye cā diſpute except ye haue mā owne daunger hym bodyly harme diote faſhion tormēt murther ye might haue pleaſure ye wold haue diſputed firſt ſophiſtrie corrupting scripture ☜ offeryng hym promotion thē ſword ye would haue bene ſure haue ouercome hym one argument would agree iudges martine tyndall tyndall iudges offered ye hym ſane blynd byſhops cardinal enemyes truth whoſe promotion dignity feare plucked truth came light ſuch iudaſes corrupt money maynteine ſect apoſtles might haue admitted well heathen biſhops idoles haue bene iudges offered autenticke scripture harte whole world ij iudges ye good conſciēces truſt god ye would haue refuſed iiij chapter fourth chapter firſt poetrie hath complection pope cardinal worldly tyraūts martin abyde scripture martin onely tyndall ye come ſcripture tyndall▪ onely old doctours ye heare litle ſaue pleaſeth cry old holy father tell haue ye england condēned vnion vn •• n doctours becauſe ye would haue falſhead diſcloſed doctrine ſay chriſten man diſcharged lawes ſpirituall temporall ſaue goſpell tyndall ye iuggle ſay tyndall chriſten man ought bynde brother violently vnto law wherof could geue reaſon chriſtes doctrine ye law loue ſide ſay far chriſten man bounde ſuffer chriſten man called ſuffer wrong tyranny though man ought bynde hym vntill god rid v therof ſo farre yet tyranny directly agaynſt law god fayth chriſt martin cauſe deſtruction vplandiſh people germanie tyndall falſe tyndall coulde haue eſcaped himſelfe martin much cauſe cō fuſion chriſt deſtruction ieruſalem duke elector saxon came warre thoſe vplandiſhe people duke wittenberge martin xv hundred men armes ſo martin bene giltie coulde haue gonne quite therto duke lordes cleaue vnto word god day leſſe cumbred theyr common people men loudeſt maner ſetteth cruelnes emperor ſouldiours vſed rome maketh mention treaſon holy church wrought ſecretly wherwith men warre ſo ſet fire viij chapter good deede beleueth martin haue frewill good helpe grace tyndall poete without ſhame tyndall harme ſhall care forbeare beleueth luther god alone without worketh miſchiefe tyndall naturall ſonne father tyndall lie ſhall care long liue ſinne beleueth luther ſhall life feele neyther good euill bodye ſoule vntyll day dome tyndall chriſt hys apoſtles tyndall taught warned looke chriſtes comming agayne euery houre comming agayne becauſe ye beleue neuer therfore haue ye fayned marchaundiſe martin bookes open ye beleue v tyndall nay ye haue ſhut tyndall vp therefore bolde ſay ye luſte liue teach teach liue tyndall neither teach lyue tyndall lye ix chapter though turke offer pleaſures vnto receauers death vnto refuſers ſecte pope doth yet ſuffereth none breake promiſes chaſtitie dedicate god though haply vſe ſuch vowes pope wil except money luther teacheth breake holy vowes tyndall luther teacheth vnlaw tyndall full vowes grounded falſe fayth vnto diſhonouring god vnlawfull vowes obſerued broken agayne conſtrayned ſeruice pleaſeth god thirdly pope geueth licēce bleſſing breake lawfull vowes moſt vnlawfull ye diſpence bringeth forth enſample heathen confirme pope chaſtitie wrong ſame falſe imagination heathē hath pope hys ʋnderſtand therfore thou vow indifferent thing pleaſe god vowes owne perſon receaueth thyne idolatrie hys pleaſure honour thou ſhouldeſt hath made thee ſhouldeſt receaue ſuch thinges hand vſe ſo farforth needfull geue thankes bounde hym thou ſhouldeſt thou haddeſt made thy ſelfe ſhould receaue ſuch thinges thee bounde thee thanke thee rewarde thee agayne thou muſt geue reaſon thy vow worde god moreouer thou vowes made wyth great aduiſement voweſt lawfully thou maiſt preciſely alway except thyne owne thy neighbour neceſſitie required contrary thou haddeſt vowed neuer eate fleſhe drinke wine ſtronge drinke tame thy fleſhe thou afterwarde felleſt diſeaſe ſo thy body behalfe tame coulde ſuſtinaunce gotten thā thou muſt interprete ſuche caſes excepte though thou madeſt mention making thy vow man woulde ſay ſhifte might made drinke • ſt vſe god creature nec •… e hoate wine ſame operation meate ſame power vertue fleſhe muſt ſhouldeſt thou forſweare wine fleſhe ſeing longer taming thy body ſo forth haue aboue declared bringeth apoſtles martyr confeſſours xv hundred yeares cleane contrary ſuch falſe imagination chaſtity worke vſed ſerue neighbour abſtinence chaſtiſing ſelues owne profite auoyde trouble time perſecution eaſed burthen heauy weake ſhoulders cōpell god beleue luſt god commaundeth affirmeth martin ſayth ſinne ſelues owne blaſphemeth god god ſinneth v vſeth v dead inſtrument forceth v therunto dāneth v owne deedes owne pleaſure compelleth vnto ſinne honour god commeth mercy god hath opened wittes ſhewed light ſee goodnes righteouſnes lawe god way chriſt fulfill wherby loueth naturally truſteth doth god open one man eye others paule rom ix forbiddeth aſke deepe mās may curious ſearch god ſecretes capacitie god ſee honoured therby mercy ſet ſeene veſſels mercy popiſhe ſuffer god haue ſecret hid himſelfe haue ſearched come botome hys
