power iuſtifie antichriſt xj chapter xj chapter true ſtory doct ferman ʋtopia poetrie meaneth doctour ferman perſon hony lane whō hādled ſecret maner diſputed ſecretly made ſweare ſhould vtter dealt haue made many contriued maner diſputatiōs ſuch oppoſitions aunſwearynges argumentes ſhould ſerue onely ſet forth purpoſe thoroughout booke maketh quoth maſter doctour fermon vertuous godly learned mā diſpute moue queſtions ſuch maner ſoyle make appeare ſoyled maketh graunt lyſteth laſt concluded lad whether haue wherfore wil rehearſe argument long alſo beleued ſo made ſo diſputed added pulled away fayned liſte guiſe declare light ruffeleth vp darkeneſſe ye may ſee falſhead firſt ye falſe hypocrite true note know hypocrite ye diſputed openly world might haue heard borne recorde whiche ye ſay true cauſe lay people might well haue heard wordes hys mouth read writyng except ye iugglyng ſpirites walke darkneſſe ſayth church teacheth men ſhould truſt theyr workes falſe meane ye pope church teach man truſt domme ceremony sacramētes penaūce maner workes come profite whiche yet helpe vnto repentaunce fayth loue man neighbour declareth meanyng ſentence hee deſcribeth proper ſignification word difference ſignificatiōs terme runneth foorth confuſedly vnknowen wordes generall termes one word hath many ſignifications maketh man ſome tyme beleue many thynges one thyng ſome tyme leadeth one ſignification vnto mocketh man wittes iuggleth 〈◊〉 iuggle • termes terme church makyng v begynnyng vnderſtand beleue concluſion prieſtes onely telleth office law deſcribeth penaūce vertue therof vſe declareth sacrament meane vſe wherin frute cō feſſion ſtandeth whence power abſolution commeth wherin reſteth iuſtifying meaneth order ſheweth diuerſitie faythes though faith one fayth one thyng marke therfore way toward iuſtifying forgeueneſſe ſinne order iuſtifying law god cauſeth law preached vnto v writeth hart maketh v good reaſons feele law good ought bee kept keepe worthy damned ſide fele power kepe law wherupon would ſhortly folow ſhould diſpaire ſhortly ho • pe lyuely deſcriptio • 〈◊〉 fication god hath begon cure hath layde coroſy vnto ſores goeth forth cure ſetteth hys ſonne ieſus paſſions death ſayth deare ſonne hath prayed thee hath ſuffred thee ſake forgeue thee thou haſt done agaynſt good lawe heale thy fleſh teach thee kepe law y• wilt learne beare thee take worth thou doeſt till thou cauſt better meane ſeaſon withſtandyng thy weakeneſſe yet loue thee leſſe aungels heauen ſo thou wilt diligent learne aſſiſte thee keepe thee defend thee thy ſhielde care thee hart beginneth mollifie waxe ſoft receaue health beleueth mercy god beleuyng ſaued frō feare euerlaſtyng death made ſure euerlaſtyng life beyng ouercome great mercy kindenes god moueth mā repētaūce kindneſſe begynneth loue agayne ſubmitte ſelfe vnto law god learne walke note order firſt god geueth light ſee goodneſſe righteouſneſſe law myne ſinne vnrighteouſneſſe whiche knowledge ſpryngeth repentaunce right order iuſtificatiō repentaunce teacheth law good euill light ſpirite god hath geuen whiche light repentaunce ſpringeth ſame ſpirite woorketh myne hart truſt confidence beleue mercy god truth hee hath promiſed whiche beleffe ſaueth immediatly truſt ſpryngeth loue toward law god agayne ſoeuer man worketh loue thē pleaſeth god loue godly loue doth receaue mercy fayth onely whiche fayth loue ſpringeth loue power agayn vpon neighbour goodneſſe haue receaued god fayth hereof ye ſee cā iuſtified without repentaūce yet repentaunce iuſtifieth hereof ye ſee haue fayth iuſtified ſaued except loue ſpryng therof immediatly yet loue iuſtifieth god naturall loue god agayne doth make firſt ſee feele kyndneſſe god chriſt fayth thorough preachyng loue god firſt cōpell loue agayn loued v firſt gaue ſonne v might ſee loue loue 1 iohn 4 agayne ſayth iohn firſt epiſtle loue god v ward receaue chriſt thorough fayth ſayth paule example haue ſet faith apprehendeth iuſtification diuers place blynd popiſh eye haue power ſee couetouſneſſe hath ſo blynded ſay faith onely iuſtifieth v ſay receaueth mercy wherewith god iuſtifieth v forgeueth v meane fayth whiche hath repentaunce fayth whiche hath loue vnto lawes god agayne vnto good workes wicked hypocrite falſly belye v thē ſhould ſuffer miſery cal blind ignoraūt vnto repentaunce good workes conſent vnto euill ſtudy miſchief day long preachyng iuſtifying good woorkes let improue ſophiſtrie ſet foorth owne doctrine may ſee reaſon walke light hereof ye ſee fayth faith iuſtifieth iuſtifieth v fayth chriſtes bloud repentyng hart toward law doth iuſtifie v onely maner faythes ye muſt vnderſtād therfore ye may ſee come more blynd maze many faythes faythes one faith though al called generall name ſtory diuerſities faith one faith iuſtifieth v faith without feelyng hart wher may beleue whole ſtory bible yet ſet myne hart earneſtly thereto takyng fode ſoule learne beleue truſt god loue dread feare doctrine example ther ſeme learned know ſtory diſpute make marchaundiſe haue exāples ynough fayth wherewith man doth miracle gift faith repētyng hart ſaued chriſtes bloud one kynne though would haue ſo appeare neither deuils fayth pope fayth wherwith beleue god chriſt ſtory bible may yet ſtond wickedneſſe full cōſent euil kynne vnto fayth hate euill repent miſdeedes knowledge ſinnes fled full hope truſt mercy vnto bloud chriſt ſayth fayth certifie harte bee fauonr god ſinnes forgeuen become workes good yer good workes tree muſt firſt good yer bring forth good fruite chriſtes doctrine thē make good workes ſhadowe wherewith man neuer better nay sir make good woorkes fruites whereby liuely iuſtifiyng faith ſpringeth good workes neighbour better whereby god honoured fleſhe tamed make ſure tokēs wherby know fayth fayned imagination dead opinion made captiuing wit pope tradition lyuely thyng wrought holy ghoſt diſputeth haue faith haue loue vnto lawe purpoſe fulfill faith alone iuſtifieth proue argument fayth alone iuſtifieth iuggleth wyth worde alone would make people beleue ſaid bare faith without company repē taunce loue vertues yea without god ſpirite iuſtifie v ſo ſhoulde care good scripture ſo taketh alone ſo meane knoweth well inough horſe ſimilitude beareth ſaddell man therin may wel ſay yt horſe onely alone beareth ſaddell holpe man bearing thereof would make men vnderſtand ment horſe bare ſaddell emptie man therin let marke ſee ignoraunce woulde god coupled malice euery man hath wit hath maliciouſly blynde more argument witte onely geueth light vnderſtanding concluſion falſe contrary true yt wit without helpe geueth light vnderſtanding neyther doth woorke vntill wit haue determined good bad faith ſaue ſpirituall light vnderſtanding inwarde knowledge feelyng mercy knowledge loue doth ſpring loue brought knowledge knew yer loued loue proceſſe nature diſpute cauſe ap • proper exſample loue effect helpeth feeling god mercifull louing hart kinde behauiour obedient wife huſband maketh ſee loue kyndneſſe many ſuch haue vnkinde huſbandes hys kynde deedes doth ſhe ſee hys loue euen ſo loue deedes make ſee god loue proceſſe nature kinde deedes gaue ſonne maketh ſee loue loue againe loue good workes make god firſt loue v chaunge hym hate loue turke iewe vaine popiſhe meane loue deedes make v loue chaunge v hate loue rom 5 loued v euill enemy teſtifieth paule diuers god loued v firſt place choſe v make v good ſhew v loue draw v ſhould loue againe ſhould loue agayne father loueth childe hath power good muſt ſuffered runne owne luſtes without lawe neuer loueth better make better ſhew loue loue agayne ye coulde ſee writtē firſt epiſtle iohn though ſcripture layde parte ſhould ſee ye muſt vnderſtand ſometyme diſpute forwarde cauſe effect ſometyme backward effect cauſe muſt beware therwyth beguiled ſay ſommer come therefore grene diſpute forwarde ſomme • cauſe ☜ greneſſe ſay tree grene therfore ſommer come diſpute backward effect cauſe grene tree make ſommer maketh ſomme • knowen diſpute backward man doth good loueth god loueth hys neighbour deedes profitable vnto neyghbour muſt therefore loue god loueth god muſt therefore haue true fayth ſee mercy yet woorkes make loue loue faith faith god mercy cōtrary god note mercy goodnes god mercy maketh fayth fayth loue loue work pope could ſee mercy worke loue neighbour ſell woorkes god heauen more doctrine needed ſo ſuttle diſputing faith alleageth paule corinthian proue faith may without loue proueth nothing iuggleth onely ſaith faith may wt loue barreine naked faith euident wordes paule mā may haue faith miracle without loue may geue good almes without loue geue body burne name chriſt al without charitie wel ſticke hym may ſo without charitie without fayth therto mā may haue faith without faith ye verely becauſe many differēces faith haue ſayd faithes one fayth maiſter iuggleth read woorkes ciprian ciprian martyr ſuffered martyrdome name chriſt martyr ſuffered yeare long yeare long tormented healed agayne brought forth freſhe martyr beleued ye payne martyrdom ſhould deſeruing merite inough onely deſerue heauen themſelues make ſatiſfaction ſinnes men thereto gaue pardon merites enſample pope doctrine forgaue ſinnes men openly denyed chriſt wrote vnto ciprian ſhoulde receaue thoſe men denyed chriſt congregation agayne ſatiſfaction merites whiche pride ciprian wrote called deuils martyr deuilles martyr god thoſe martyr fayth without fayth beleued mercy geuen chriſtes bloudſhedding would haue ſent mē thether would haue ſuffered owne martyrdome loue neighbour onely ſerue thē teſtifie truth god ſauiour ieſu vnto worlde ſaue leaſt way ſome wete elect whoſe ſake paule ſuffereth thing winne heauē worke worldly purpoſe muſt doe good workes loue reward get rewarde heauen euen ſo worke heauen hyer place heauen get rewarde muſt woorke yt loue neighbour becauſe brother price chriſtes bloude becauſe chriſt hath deſerued deſireth rewarde great heauen beleue ſinnes forgeuen receaued ſcripture teſtifieth vnto enheritaunce heauē chriſtes merites ſame loue chriſt brother ſake thyng ſakes onely thinking heauen worke brethren neede ſuffer themſelues aboue might comfort ſoule remē braunce heauen wretchednes ſhall haue ende ſhall haue thouſand folde pleaſures rewardes heauen merites doynges deſerue nothyng chriſte hath deſerued v deſeruings geuen v freely chriſtes hath yt loue hath right faith hath yt faith hath right loue cā loue neighbour chriſtes ſake except firſt beleue haue receaued ſuch mercy chriſt beleue haue receaued ſuch mercy chriſt muſt loue neighbour ſake ſeing ſo inſtantly deſireth alleageth iames iames 〈◊〉 aunſwered mammon auguſtine anſwereth hym iames expoundeth himſelfe ſaith firſt chapter god begatte v owne wyth worde truth worde truth promiſes mercy forgeueneſſe sauiour ieſus begat v gaue v life made v new creature thorow faſt faith iames goeth rebuketh opinion iames • eproueth ſel •• ••• te true liuely ſayth falſe fayth thinke inough ſaued beleue one god chriſt borne virgine thouſand thing man may beleue yet beleue chriſt ſaued ſinne thorow iames ſpeaketh another faith beginning appeareth enſample deuils haue faith ſaith yea deuilles haue faith repent euil beleue chriſt ſaued thorow cā loue god worke wil loue paule ſpeaketh fayth chriſtes bloude ſaued thereby worketh immediatly thorough loue benefite receaued iames beginning ſpeaketh fayth bydeth trying ſaying trying faith worketh ca • ſeth pacience faith deuilles bide trying woorke god becauſe loue like maner fayth woorke oportunitie ſerueth cā iuſtifie fayth repent thinke themſelues without ſinne except mā feele daunger chriſt hath deliuered hym loue worke therfore iames ſayth right ſuch fayth woorke iuſtifie man paule ſaith faith onely iuſtifieth iames man iuſtified woorkes fayth onely great differēce betwene paules onely iames onely paules onely vnderſtand faith iuſtifieth harte god without helpe workes yea yer worke muſt receaue life thorow faith worke wi • h yer worke iames onely thys wiſe vnderſtand faith doth ſo iuſtifie nothyng iuſtifieth workes iuſtifie ſaue fayth deedes iuſtifie alſo faith iuſtifieth hart god deedes worlde onely maketh ſeene ye may ſee ſcripture paul ſayth rom iiij abrahā rom 4 haue woorkes hath whereof reioyce god abrahā receaued thoſe promiſes deſeruing ben abrahās prayſe god thou mayſt ſee text neither god ſhewed abrahā mercy grace onely geuen hym dutie deſeruyng abraham receaued mercy ſhewed hym frely fayth deſeruynges ſeed promiſed thou mayſt ſee geneſis goſpell iohn iohn 8 chriſt teſtifieth abraham ſaw day reioyced ioy doubt wrought god prayſe glory mercy ſame mayſt thou ſee iames ſayth abraham offered ſonne ſo scripture fulfilled abraham beleued rekened righteouſneſſe thereby made god frend fulfilled god nay fulfilled god many yeares god frend many yeares euen firſt appointement made betwene god hym abraham receaued abrahā beleued god promiſes therefore iuſtified promiſes mercy beleued truſted god went wrought fayth fulfilled v ſee hart iames ſaith wil ſhew thee faith workes aungell ſaid abrahā know thou dreadeſt god knew v ſpake whiche ſee nought abraham men ſaue workes workes ment iames verely workes mercy brother ſiſter lacke rayment ſuſtenaunce ye moued compaſſion feele diſeaſes fayth haue ye fayth ſure hee ſeeth hys neighbour neceſſitie hath compaſſion hath fayth feeleth mercy chriſt feele mercyfull agayne thankefull looke workes ſpiritualitie onely iuſtified workes worlde alſo god haue chriſtēdome rule viij hundred yeares onely annointed head ſo haue onely bene kyng emperour haue power hand haue bene doer onely leders thoſe ſhadowes haue name prince haue led whether would haue brethed braynes lyſted haue wrought world peace vnitie euery man wellfare become alone well eaſe onely free onely libertie onely haue thyng onely nought therefore onely laye mēs backes beare nought thē ſelues good woorkes wrought fayth gaue theyr good landes finde poore thē deuoure alſo alone workes preach onely papiſtes preach workes profitable ſelues profitable wherbey raigne men cōſciences god offer geue prayed deliuered purgatory redeme ſinne worſhyp ceremony ſhryuen ſo forth come ſelfe ſayth firſt fayth firſt iuſtifying geuen v without deſeruyng god thanked would fayne would deſcribe meaneth ſecond iuſtifying know whē haue receaued mercy forgeueneſſe chriſt frely go powre ſame vpon neighbour dauid loſt fayth hee dauid tyndall committed adultery tyndall therfore could continue ſinnne repēted aſſoone fault told reconciled fayth onely dedes ſayd haue mercy lord thy great mercy multitude thy mercy put away pſal 51 ſinne agayne make heare ioy gladneſſe bone whiche thou haſt broken may reioyce let heare thy voyce ſinne forgeuen ſafe reioyce afterward knowledgeth god deliteth ſacrifices haue offended god muſt returne qui • kly repentaunce call vpon god heare v chriſt sauiours ſake ſinnes troubled ſpirite broken hart whiche god requireth peace made prayeth boldly familiarly god would good sion ieruſalem ſaith laſt god hath forgeuen v mercy hath done v good euill ſhall offer ſacrifice thankes hym agayne dedes thankeſgeuyng haue ſinned go repentyng hart vnto chriſtes bloud waſh thorough fayth dedes thankes geuyng god helpe neighbour nede neighbour eche owe v much agayne nede teſtament forgeueneſſe ſinnes built vppon fayth chriſtes bloud workes wil runne pope forgeueneſſe poenae culpae merites doth pope chriſtes poena culpa chriſt hath promiſed merites repent beleue geuen vnto pope ſell abſolutiōs ye oft abſolue without ioynyng penaūce muſt haue purpoſe good woorkes ye ſay cōdition ſet haue receaued hād god mercy ſo muſt ſhewe mercy neyghbours ye mercy hee hath receaued receaue mercy popiſh repēt hart therfore cā fele mercy fayth bryngeth therfore mercyfull neighbour doe woorkes ſakes faine ſorow ſinne euer continue ſo morne mornyng laugh yer midday agayne imagine popiſh deedes make ſatiſfaction god make idole finally good workes workes ſelues iuſtifie geue almes ſuch like iuſtifie ſelues manifeſt good taught god thē well loue god chriſt neighbour chriſtes ſake euen ſo euill vayne glorie falſe fayth wickedly haue exāples phariſeis ſo man muſt good yer good ſo purpoſe thē one purpoſe good others euill ſo muſt good yer good purpoſe come loue law god conſent therto haue written thyne hart profeſſe ſo thou art ready thyne accorde without compulſion righteous graunt loue may called righteouſneſſe god paſſiue lyfe quickeneſſe ſoule paſſiue loueth hys neighbour chriſts ſake ſame righteousand ſo farre forth man loueth law god ſo farre forth righteous ſo much hee lacketh loue toward hys neighbour example chriſt ſo much lacketh righteouſneſſe thyng maketh man loue law god doth make man righteous iuſtifieth effectiuely actually maketh hym alyue woorkeman cauſe efficient maketh man loue verely dedes folow ſpryng loue good neither preachyng law quickeneth hart gal iij cauſeth wrath rom iiij vttereth ſinne onely rom iij therfore ſayth paule righteouſnes ſpryngeth deedes law hart iewes pope meane contrary deedes law ſpryng righteouſneſſe hart good father pronounceth law child ſhall go ſchole ſayth nay killeth hart luſtes ſo hath power loue maketh hart aliue loue verely fayre promiſes loue kyndneſſe ſhall haue gentle ſcholemaſter ſhal play inough ſhall haue many gaye thynges ſo forth workes procede loue nothyngeuen ſo preachyng fayth doth worke loue ſoules make alyue draw harte god mercy haue chriſt doth make v loue onely onely bringeth ſpirite life ſoules therfore ſayth paule iuſtified fayth grace without dedes yer dedes come fayth onely bringeth ſpirite lyfe deliuereth ſoules feare dānation law euer maketh peace betwen god v oft variaunce betwene v finally whē peace made betwene god v forgeuen fayth chriſtes bloud fayth chriſt maketh ſmall workes acceptable begyn loue law neuer nearer except fayth went v ſupply lacke full loue haue promiſes litle haue takē woorth accepted till come agayne frailtie hath ouerthrowen v feare damnation inuaded conſciēces vtterly loſt fayth bye helpe v vp agayne promiſed ſoeuer repent euill come right way agayne ſhalbe forgeuen chriſtes ſake whē fallen teſtament made workes come ſhal ſaue v therfore workes repentaūce sacramētes neuer quiet cōſciences deliuer v feare damnation laſt temptation tribulation aduerſities periſhed dayly except fayth went v deliuer v haue promiſes god aſſiſte v cloth v fede v fight v rid v handes enemyes thus righteous ☞ righteous lyueth • aith liueth euer fayth euen fayth fayth ſoone deliuered one temptation ſet fight againſt ouercome thorow fayth ſcripture ſayth bleſſed man whoſe tranſgreſſion forgeuen ſinnes hid vnto lord reckoneth vnrighteouſnes onely righteouſnes cā ſinne hath nought himſelfe make amendes forgeueneſſe ſinne ſaith onely bringeth farforth vn •• ghteous faith chriſtes bloud doth onely iuſtifie v faith onely iuſtifieth v actiuely el nothing partie farforth haue ſinned ſinne ſinne ſhal ſinne ſo farforth muſt faith chriſtes bloud iuſtifie v onely el nothing loue righteous ſo farforth thou loueſt make righteous make peace beleue chriſtes bloud repēting hart make righteous onely makyng peace ſatiſfaction godwarde thus becauſe termes darcke expert exerciſed alway ſet meaning wyth cleare enſamples reporting ſelues vnto harte conſciences men blaſphemous wordes luther ſeme ſignifie iohn baptiſte lady ſinners tyndall iohn baptiſte ſayde chriſt mat 3 neede baptiſed tyndall thee commeſt thou wherof iohn confeſſe nede waſhed purged chriſt holynes good deedes iohn ſaide beholde ye lambe god taketh away ſinne ye iohn baptiſt lady alſo ſinners looked redemptiō chriſt worlde ſorte ſinnes taken away time part chriſts bloud dyed ſinners onely iohn came reſtore thyng ſayth chriſt came enterprete law god truely proue fleſhe ſinners ſend thē chriſt paul doth beginning ye romanes lawe coulde vnderſtand ſpirituall requireth v woulde ſo diſpute imperfectneſſe lady deedes dyd chriſt rebuke iohn 2 ought rather haue honoured mother make ſecke three dayes chriſoſtomus dare ſay chriſoſtomus lady taken little vayne glory ioked promiſes ſhould come bleſſe beleued ſaued chriſt graunt lady iohn baptiſte iſaac iacob ioſeph neuer chriſt without ſinne moſes many like neuer conſent ſinne follow holy ghoſt beginning neuer later folowed ſpirite wrought beſt yet chaunces met way temptation made woorkes come ſometimes vnperfectly paſſe potter hath craft neuer ſo wel meteth chaunce maketh faſhion pot miſſe thinke perfecteſt haue enſamples ſome compelled ſay paul good would euill would would ſweare booke lady bene let ſlip hard appoſed preſent death eye ſhe would haue denyed ſomethinges ſhe knew true ye ſhe preſerued grace ſhe though ſhe kept grace ye outwarde deede yet ſuch wickednes fleſhe ſhe ſinne grace ſhe knew meeke beleue chriſt haue forgeuen preſerued ſhould bud forth iohn euangeliſt holy euer iohn baptiſt ſayd 1 iohn 1 ſay haue ſinne deceaue ſelues compareth fayth deedes together fayth ſhoulde workes vnder law ſtand better ſeruice right deedes yes deedes examined lawe therfore inough onely thē loue muſt wyth great loue chriſt fayth vnder law receaue good deede nede faith vnder lawe therfore ſhe neuer ſo feeble ſhe ſhall receaue according truth promiſer thing coulde aſke god right becauſe beleue tyndall ʋerely promiſeth tyndall may bolde aſke right dutie good obligation ferman ſayd workes good inough thē god hath choſē tyndall ſure vntrue tyndall beſt good inough though god forgeueth euill hys mercy ye repentaunce hart endeth ſchole doctrine contrary vnto ſcripture god remitteth ſinne hys choſen people becauſe hath choſen thē mercy towardnes blinde • ond reaſoning one ſaying god ſaw peter ſhould repent iudas woulde diſpaire therefore choſe peter god choſe peter becauſe repent choſe iudas repented much knowledged ſinne brought money agayne blindneſſe god wrought nothing repentaunce peter sayde chriſt peter luke 22 ſhould falle ſayd prayed ſhoulde holpe vppe agayne chriſt prayed ſtrong prayer peter helpe hym vp agayne ſuffered ſtrong death thereto death committed vnto father ſaying haue kept thy name depart iohn 17 keepe euill peter good hart god loued lawe beleued chriſt ſpirite god neuer left falle peter ſinned malice frailtie ſodaine difference betwene peter fall fall iudas feare death goodneſſe god wrought repentaunce meanes brought vp againe chriſtes requeſte iudas neuer good came chriſt loue doctrine couetouſneſſe euer beleue chriſt iudas nature birth iudas heyre wrath god whome deuill wrought blinded hart ignoraunce ignorannce blindnes grew grew age fell deeper deeper therein thereby iudas periſhed deſperatiō wrought wickedneſſe deuilles periſhed therin frō ignoraunce god purged peter mercy gaue light ſpirite gouerne towardneſſe peter hys owne byrth mercy haue birth chriſtes death proue god chuſeth goodnes towardnes good towardnes haue endeuour altogether blinde caryed away deuill till deuill caſt robbed towardnes adam made child wrath god adam nature made child ſinne ſo ſinne naturally ſinne nature though would well fleſh yet ſinneth naturally neither ceaſeth ſinne ſo farforth kept vnder violence euen ſo harte ſinned naturally full luſt conſent vnto fleſhe deuill poſſeſſing harte keeping light grace good towardneſſe endeuour haue hate ſinne long loue good towardnes haue vnto god hate ignoraunt therof deſire witte ſeeth long ſigh witte knoweth mā take thought loſſe wotteth good endeuour turkes child iewes child pope infantes haue taught falſhead onely like perſwaſions worldly reaſon iuſtified workes therefore rom 9 paule ſaith running willing mercy god man called choſen grace firſt grace firſt fayth firſt iuſtifiyng geuen v freely ſayth would faine wete ſtand doctrine whether meane thyng choſyng haue god ſpirite geuen fayth ſee mercy layd vp haue ſinnes forgeuen without deſeruyng preparyng ſelf god ſee onely theſe ſaued chriſtes death ſhould come thether god worketh diuers make v call vpō truſt mercy god choſe ſhew mercy vnto v ſhould beleue prouided actually wrought bringyng thether day make ſee receaue mercy layd vp ſtore world made xij chapt •… yt xij chaffyng himſelf heape lye vpon lye vttereth feleable blindneſſe axeth queſtion wherfore ſerueth exhortatiōs vnto faith hearer haue libertie frewill whiche together god frewill grace man may labour ſubmitte rebellion reaſon vnto obediēce faith credence worde god wherof ye ſee beſides graunt reaſon rebelleth agaynſt fayth cō trary doctrine firſt booke ſhall compell witte beleue whiche much ſay carte muſt draw horſes ſonne beget father authoritie church greater thē god word wil teach wit lead foloweth naturally ſo ſoeuer witte iudgeth good euill loueth hateth witte ſee leade ſtraight foloweth witte blynde leade amiſſe foloweth cleane yt way witte leadeth loue god worde beleue hate iudge falſe vanitie might haue wiſelier ſpoken maner wherfore ſerueth preachyng fayth wit haue power draw loue whiche wit iudgeth true good nought teach wit better ſhall alter turne good immediatly blindneſſe cauſe ali euil light cauſe good ſo fayth right hart conſent vnto euill folow luſtes fleſh pope fayth doth concluſion hath halfe doſē tymes boke more wittes captiuated may compell witte captiuate beleue mā luſteth ʋerely like wittes captiuitie vauntage tangled holy father ſophiſtrie doctrine owne feelyng profeſſion hart popiſh haue yelded thē ſelues folow luſtes fleſh compel witte abſteine frō looking ye truth leſt ſhe ſhould vnquiet draw podell filthy voluptuouſneſſe prety example carte ouerladen goyng vp hill draweth horſes backe ☞ tough mire maketh ſtand ſtill carter deuill whiche driueth thē euer whiſtelleth vnto biddeth captiuate vnderſtādyng vnto profitable doctrine ſhal haue perſecution ſhal reigne kynges enioy pleaſures world owne xiij chapter xiij hee ſayth clergie burneth man though pope firſt foūd law though preacher babled euery sermon burne theſe heretickes burne haue argument conuince though compelled kyng emperour ſweare ſhall ſo yer crowne hee bringeth prouiſions kyng henry v aſke king henry v whether right heyre vnto england held hee land ſworde heathen tyraunt agaynſt right prelate leſt ſhould haue leyſure hearken vnto truth ſent fraunce occupie mynde warre led hym aſke whether king hēry 4 vſurper ye crowne father ſlew leige kyng true inheritour vnto crowne therefore ſet vp byſhops falſe kyng mainteine theyr falſhead aſke whether wicked deede folowed deſtruction comminaltie quenchyng noble bloud xiiij chapter xiiij affirmeth martine luther ſayth lawfull reſiſte ☜ turke wonder hee ſhameth ſo lye ſeyng martine hath turk reſiſted written ſingular treatiſe contrary beſides many workes proueth lawfull inuade v xvi chapter xvi alledgeth councels aſke whether councels haue authoritie make article faith god worde yea thynges improued god word alledgeth auguſtine hierome cypriane let put workes vnion doctor good booke engliſh proſperus damned vnion doctours becauſe doctours agaynſt alledgeth martyr let ſhew one take calfe labour end biddeth beware thē liue well wiſe though whiche lyue euill teach amiſſe true ☜ ſureſt ſide tyndall appoſed doctrine yer hee went ouer ſee ſayde ſweare ment harme tyndall ſware neither man required othe tyndall ſweareth ſweareth whō • e truſteth ſaued hee neuer ment yet meaneth harme ſuffer god hath prepared leyd backe bryng brethrē vnto light sauiour ieſus pope thorough falſhead corruptyng ſuch poetes ye ready vnto thyng vauntage leadeth darkeneſſe death tyndall doth knowe auguſtine hierome proue holy scripture confeſsiō neceſſitie vnto ſaluation tyndall falſe ye meane eareconfeſſion alledge ye tyndall place ye know hierome ſtories conuerſation eare confeſſion eraſmus came vp vſe farre meruell tyndal denieth purgatory purgatory except entend go hell tyndall entendeth purge tyndall vnto vttermoſt power hopeth death end finiſh hys purgation purgyng commit god take findeth cōmeth meane tyme take thought therefore preſent wherewith saintes purged taught ſo tyndall marueleth ſecret pilles take purge ſelues whiche onely purge croſſe chriſt alſo bye theyr purgatory therof pope groat vj penny xviij chapter clergie doth nothyng vnto heretikes holy doctours dyd clergy tyndall yes ye put priſons tyndall diote handle faſhion temporall tyraū te diſpute ſecretly come light ye ſlea thē note rebukyng god worde ſo old holy doctours man ſlea father ye care man touche one though haue neuer ſo great occaſion geuen ye curſe ſubmitte ſelfe vnto puniſhmēt ye leaue vnto temporall power whome ye haue hyred ye ſpoyle goodes hangman ſo muſt loſe life geuyng one blowe cheke saint paule gaue two heretickes vnto deuill whiche tormented theyr fleſhe whiche ſmall puniſhement haply ſlew tyndall expounder scripture like hugo charenſis expoſideth tyndall haereticum hominem deuita take hereticke lyfe read payne corinthian paule dyd excommunicate byſhops burne excommunicated gaue sathan ſlea fleſhe ſaue hee aſhamed hym ſelfe repented ſaw offence ſo earneſtly taken ſo abhorred ye becauſe ye haue power deliuer sathan blynde theyr myndes ye deliuer thē fire deſtroy fleſh ſeene aſhes ¶ finis ¶ practiſe papiſticall prelate made wylliam tyndall ¶ yeare lorde 1530 ¶ william tyndall chriſtian reader olde scribe phariſeis darckned scripture wyth tradition falſe interpretacions wicked perſwaſions fleſhly wiſdome ſhut vp kingdome heauen god word people coulde enter vnto knowledge true way chriſt complayneth goſpell math x iij math 23 ſat harte men falſe doctrine ſtead god hys word ſlew ſoules people deuoure bodyes robbe worldly ſubſtaunce chriſt iohn baptiſte reſtored scripture agayne vnto true vnderſtanding vttered falſehead improued tradicions confounded falſe interpretation cleare euident textes power holy ghoſt brought iuggling hypocriſie light thē gat vnto elder people perſwaded ſaying man ſurely deuill hys myracles deuill doubt theſe good workes old practiſe phariſeis newly practiſed pope prelate doth healing people yea preaching againſt couetouſnes cloke bring hym vnto hys purpoſe hath gottē diſciples ynow may riſe againſt emperour make hymſelfe kyng ſhall romaynes come take land v cary away people put na • ion realme ſo ſhall loſe haue moſt part liues therto take heede therefore betimes remedy yer go ſo far ye able reſiſte hym elder people rich wordly prefermentes le •• e true chriſtianitie welthy though maner fauoured chriſt y• leaſt way indifferent greatly caryng whether god deuil raigned ſo might bide authoritie feared immediatly herode loſſe kingdome wiſe men aſked new borne king iewed conſpired scribe phariſeis againſt chriſt tooke braught vnto pilate ſaying jew •• 〈◊〉 accu • ed chriſt haue • ounde fellow peruerting people forbidding pay tribute vnto ceſar ſaying king mouyng people galile vnto place pilate though likewiſe indifferent put feare loſſe office thorow ſuch perſwaſions ſlew innocent chriſt deede scribe phariſeis liues blynde guide vnto deſtruction chriſt apoſtles procured vengeaunce god lighten vpō ſelues bare witnes vnto truth poured hys wrath among thēſelues roſe againſt emperour romaynes came according blyndly propheſied ſlew moſt part caryed ye reſt captiue nacions put nacions realme whoſe fault inſurrection againſt emperour miſchiefe followed chriſtes apoſtles falſely accuſed hand nay chriſt taught ſhoulde geue ceſar pertayned vnto ceſar god belonged god euē ſhould geue ceſar lawfull bodely ſeruice god hart ſhould loue god law repent euill come receaue mercy let wrath god taken apoſtles apoſtles 〈…〉 •… taught ſoules ſhould obey hyer power temporall ruler obſtinate malice ſo hardened har • coulde repent raylyng vppon open manifeſt coulde improue reſiſting holy ghoſt ſleying preacher righteouſnes brought wrath god vpō thē cauſe vtter deſtruction euen ſo scribe phariſes hypocriſie diſcloſed falſhead ſo brought light lō ger hid get thē vnto elder people lordes gentleman temporall officer loue worlde practiſe prelate theſe dayes vnto whoſoeuer great wyth kyng vnto kyngs grace himſelfe ſame enſample wyth ſame perſwaſions caſt like feare loſing worldly dominion rore vnto ſaying ye negligent care nothing ot haue good ſport heretickes rayle v geue thē ſpace till growen vnto multitude ye ſhall ſee preach faſt againſt moue people agaynſt beſte thruſte downe alſo ſhall cry hauocke make gene • ation se • thou ſeeſt new old teſtament alſo officer iewes called elder people becauſe thou mayſt well thinke ouer old men nigh could vnto age men naturally obeye vnto age doth god commaūde geue honour honour aged ſaying leu • xix riſe vp horehead reuerence face old man alſo experience thing coldneſſe without whiche ye aged experience hard rule well age thē youth ouerſear dyd put hys handes vnto plow god worde fed chriſtes flocke tended thē onely without lookyng vnto buſineſſe world officer choſe called deacon deacon greke miniſter engliſh miniſter almes people vnto poore nedy cōgregation chriſt loue maketh euery man gift good primitiue church choſe deacon miniſter y• poore commō vnto neceſſitie neighbour wherfore loue god beyng yet hoate harte men rich ſubſtaūce worldes goodes brought aboundaunce great plentie vnto ſuſtentation poore deliuered vnto hāds deacon vnto helpe deacōs widowes lx yeare widowes old holy vertuous deſtitute frendes choſen tende wayte vpon ſicke waſh saint fete came one congregation vnto whether buſineſſe feare perſecution common goodes thoſe common goodes churche offered ſuccour poore grew church ſo excedyngly • reat feruēt charitie primatiue church ſome congregation ſo much ſufficient mayntaine hoſt men ſo much tyrauntes oft tymes perſecute chriſten thoſe common goodes thou ſeeſt life laurence deacon rome moreouer couetouſnes prelate decay chriſtē dome couetouſnes yt prelate decay chriſtendome ye encreaſing kingdome mahomete encreaſing kyngdome mahomete firſt ſpringing empyre mahomete emperours kynges great lordes chriſtendome geuen treaſure ſo mightely vnto church great victory deathes ſucceſſours able maintaine battell againſt saracenes turkes world yet ſuch captiuitie coulde make theyr ſubiectes ſweare bookes worth rayſe vp tax pleaſure ſo certayne writer ſtories ſayth▪ prelate gaped whē laye mē would take warre vppon agaynſt turkes laye men looked prelate woulde lay money make warre withall ſpend worſe vſe moſt part wont ſpending money proud clergie ſpent treaſure 〈◊〉 y• • oore gotten almoſe bloude martyr vppon goodly plate great veſſeles golde ſiluer wythout care thinges come deſpiſing god worſhipped belly ſake onely alſo mā moreouer cuſtome euē ſaith auctor aſke byſhopprike worth yea leaue worſe better kepe vnion ſame tyme iſacius deputie emperour came iſacius rome confirme pope ſea election cō firmed emperour emperours auctoritie ye election pope thē nothing worth except bene confirmed emperour founde ſo great treaſure church saint iohn lateran diſdayne ſhould haue ſuch treaſure ſtore helpe emperour warres againſt ye turkes •… ng ſoldiars lacked wage tooke away violence againſt wyll note treaſure ye byſhops rome thys tyme ye prelate exiled ſome payde owne mē warre one part tooke part vnto ſelfe ſent third part vnto emperour muſt needes haue bene great treaſure one church ¶ meanes prelate fell chriſt office byſhop roume beginning man coueted byſhop rome y• primatiue church daū gerous office man durſt take vpō hym ſaue onely loued chriſt better thē owne life chriſt ſaith man might diſciple except ready forſake life euen ſo might officer ſure woulde coſt lyfe one time another bearing record vnto truth multitude chriſten encreaſed many great men receaued y• faith landes rente well goodes geuen vnto maintenaunce well clergie poore becauſe gaue firſt entry chriſtes churche tythes payde ye miniſters tythes prieſtes yet ſaue certaine countryes much geue almes offeringes landes tithe alſo byſhops made ſubſtitutes vnder helpe called prieſt kept name byſhop vnto themſelues deacon ſprang miſchiefe thorow hand corruption churche came firſt deacon went thing miniſtred vnto ye clergie miniſtred vnto poore fauoure great ſmall byſhops office began haue reſt honorable deacon thorow fauour money purchaſed prefermēt giftes climed vp therunto lightly hath olde abbotes treaſure ſuccedeth v ye meanes practiſe acquintaunce ye worlde ſubtile worldly wiſe olde byſhops leſſe learned god woorde prelate come frō ſtuardſhips gentleman houſes ſurueying great men landes lordes ſecretes kinges counſels embaſſidourſhip warre miniſtring worldly matter ye worldly miſchiefe yet come thence receaue bide ſtill yea haue enacted playne parliament muſt byde prelate muſt bide ſtill courte courte ſtill el may haue pluralitie benefice litle litle enhaunſed thēſelues attery aduaunced thēſelues fauour defender truſting vnto worldly wiſdome thē vnto doctrine chriſt ye wiſdome god vnto defēce man god plow tayle looked backe plow went awry faith wax ed feble faintie loue waxed colde scripture waxed darcke chriſt ſeene ye moūt prelate waxed riche diſputed ſhoulde higheſt moſes therefore byſhops would haue god vppon earth might ſee therupon begā diſpute ſhould greateſt ¶ byſhop rome became greater called hymſelfe pope quod worldly wiſdome ieruſalem y• fir • ſea • ou • 〈◊〉 byſhop hieruſalē muſt greateſt ytwas chriſtes ſeat et factū eſt ſo came paſſe • ſeaſon concluſion great citie much rich byſhoppe euer greater felowes alexandre egipte antioch grece greater neighbour thoſe decaying conſtantinople rome waxed conſtantinople rome great ſtroue ſhoulde greater cōſtātinople ſayd emperour ought greateſt ſeat chiefeſt byſhop emperour lay moſt conſtantinople becauſe ſuppoſe nigh middes empyre therfore muſt greateſt ſayde byſhop conſtātinople nay quod ye byſhop h •• rome come y• chifeſt citie rome though ye emperour lye nener ſo much conſtātinople yet called emperour rome rome head empyre wherefore right muſt father watē rome ſeate mother wickedneſſe thus whether chalēged • itle auctoritie god man peter pouling one ſo might greateſt great interceſſion made vnto emperours party vayne great ceaſon ye emperours ſtopped • are ſuch ambitious requeſtes long tyme till ye laſt came emperour called phoca lay long italye phoca ſoft man pray prelate whoſe tyme boniface iij pope boniface thirde byſhop rome man ambitious greedy vppon byſhop ſhould call prieſtes hys dioceſe charge euery man ſhould put away wife vnder chaſtitie prieſtes came vp payne excommunication tyranny though great reſiſtaunce made againſt yet brought paſſe began great earth called hymſelfe papa wyth interpretation father father pope exalted hys throne aboue fellowes vnitie ought among brother diuiſion church chriſtes church brake deuiſion began betwene v ye grekes grekes ſuppoſe yt tyme one halfe chriſtendome pope ſince exhorteth vnitie aunſwere raigne ouer brother violence breaketh vnitie vnder grekes vnder pope tyranny tyranny wherunto calleth vnder colour vnitie henceforth helpe hys byſhoppes wereſworne true ligemen vnto hym beforetyme admitted theyr byſhopprikes emperours kinges beganne lay baite catch whole empyre handes alſo meanes pope inuaded empyre ſame ſeaſon mahomete mahomet pope began one tyme auctor ſect turckes saracenes beganne aſſoone got much people vnto hym wyles fayned myracles inuaded empyre rome thoſe quarter looke buſie mahomete thoſe parry ſo buſie pope theſe quarter inuade empyre helpe ſworne byſhoppes preached none god pope emperour occupyed farre reſiſting mahomete within yeares kynges italy thē vexed holy father couetous ambicion gregory third ioyned gregory pope came vp french mē cō tinueth eſtate ſtill amitie frenchman called helpe whoſe power gatte al haue alſo maintaine vnto day man ſince tyme hether diſpleaſed pope neuer ſo little immediatly curſſed excommunicate proclaymed right enheritour lawfull holde abſolued lordes ſubiectes allegeaunce ſent bleſſing vnto french king remiſſion ſinnes go conquere land pope french kyng alway deuiding ſpoyle betwene byſhops ſerued god belye preaching pope might power ſo thynges bynde looſe wreſtyng scripture ſerue purpoſe corruptyng lawes god man proue godhead came pope zacharias firſt pope zacharias firſt hildericus whoſe tyme hildericus k fraunce man gouerned hys realme oft chaunceth debite perſons preache one pipine pipinns lord owne ſworne ſubiect pipine ſent holy byſhop pope zacharias ſhould helpe make kyng fraunce would defender italy pope put downe right french kyng ſet vppe pipine maner ſcalled horſes one claw zacharias aunſwered hee woorthy kyng ruled realme tooke labour idle ſhadow went vp downe nought ſo vpon lord fraūce kyng fraunce made monke perſuaſions prelate conſented vnto pipine thruſt downe right king vnto ſworne made monke hym lordes alſo pipine tooke diſpenſations othes holy father forſworne thus holy father pope crept vp conſciences men hys falſe interpretation byndyng looſyng good viij hundred yeares agone came pope stephanus ſecond whoſe hand eſtulphus pope steuen ſecond eſtulphus kyng lumbardy kyng lombardy would fayne haue ſcratched ſomwhat thought holy father gathered taſt ready raked much vnto thē new kyng pipine fraunce warned duty ſeruice promiſed mindfull old frendſhyp hopyng part praye came ſuccour pope hee ſubdued kyng lambardy hee gaue vnto holy father rather pope aduaunced peter yt hungry begger great prouinces countreys lombardy italy ile corſica many great city ſome pertayned vnto emperour beyng thē conſtantinople yet emperour ſent vnto kyng pipine ſhould geue townes vnto pope pipine aunſwered came ſame intent enhaunce holy father holy father receaued thus empire deuided two partes pope french kyng partyng one halfe betwene emperour decayed pope grew pope grew ſo ſect mahomete grew meanes mahomet waxed great emperour halfe empire loſt able defend ſelfe agaynſt infidel pope would ſuffer helpe hence come two cauſes one leſt emperour ſhould recouer empyre agayne becauſe prelate greekes would ſubmitte ſelues vnto godhead prelate theſe quarter world done pipine raigned ſonne carolus magnus great charles call charle mayne knew god pope way heauen pope pleaſure pope ſerued twoo purpoſes one diſpence whatſoeuer pope become great god y• earth miſchief ſtabliſhed empyre helpe without fauour hee wiſt would ſo great god holy father become ready thoſe dayes pope stephen latter dayes fell variaunce deſiderius deſiderius kyng lombardy archbyſhop rauen • stephen ſucceded adriā y• firſt pope adrian firſt deſiderius k lō bardy would fayne haue made peace pope adrian would ſhortly vpon brother charlemayne raigned half dominion fraunce dyed whoſe wife feare charles fled ij ſonnes vnto deſiderius king lombardy ſuccour defiderius glad comming truſting meanes theſe two child obtaine fauour among many frenchman ſo able reſiſt charles hee would medle bryng italy vnto right emperour agayne would haue pope adrian ſhould haue annoynted kynges father roome adrian refuſed ſaw charles mighty mete purpoſe wyly deſiderius thought kepe pope purpoſed emperour ſelfe right emperour emperor rome ſelfe though gaue name ſeaſon till conuenient tyme came deſiderius warred vppon pope iuriſdiction adrian ſent charles charles came army draue deſiderius hys ſonne ſonne fled vnto right emperour conſtantinople charles pope deuyded kyngdome charles pope deuided kyngdome lombardy lombardy betwene thē charles came rome pope ſworne together ſoeuer ſhould enemy vnto one ſhould enemy alſo vnto adrian gathered councell pope gathered councell gaue vnto charles emp emperour rome like ſeruice done vnto •… ne • e empyre pope made •• appoyntmēt made betwene emperoures conſtantinople rome place aſſigned farre border either empire ſhuld reach thus one empyre made twayne therfore empire cōſtantinople lacke helpe ſhortly ſubdued turkes ſayd leo alſo called charles moſt chriſten kyng moſt chriſten kyng becauſe hys good ſeruice title kynges fraunce vſe vnto day though many bee neuer ſo vnchriſtened laſt leo called kyng defender defender faith fayth pope clemens calleth duke bu • lder eldeſt ſonne yt holy ſea rome eldeſt ſonne holy ſeate vertue propertie man know ſaue hee hath bene • yte pickequar • cruell vnrighteous bloudſhedder father ſitteth holy ſea aboue ſeuen hundred chriſtian kyng yeares chriſtē kyng fight pope moſt chriſten moſt fighteth ſleath moſt men pleaſure charles great conquerour lyfe charles ſay great tyraunt ouercame many natiōs ſword turke compelleth v vnto fayth ſo cōpelled thē violence vnto faith chriſt ſay ſtories ala chriſtes fayth whereunto charles cō pelled • men obedience pope holy ghoſt onely draweth men harte thorough preachyng worde truth holy liuyng accordyng therto knew vnto pope hee ſubdued vnto ſuperſtitious idolatrie whiche vſe cleane contrary vnto scripture moreouer requeſt great deſyre mother hee maryed daughter deſiderius kyng lombardy one yeare vnto practiſe great diſpleaſure mother put away agayne without falſe ſutiltie pope thou mayſt ſure neither without diſpenſation howe could charles haue made warre pope pleaſure deſiderius father haue thruſt hym kingdome baniſhed ſonne euer deuiding kingdome betwene pope long ſhe bene wife therfore pope authoritie bynding loſyng loſed pope diſpenſer breaker bondes matrimonie bondes matrimony hath many ſence dayly doth lyke purpoſes entent would ſword frenche kyng put kyngdome lombardy ſomewhat nye way reaſon whoſe king hys fatherhode could raygne alone aſſigne ſell byſhopprikes italy luſted pleaſure ſayd charles alſo kept iiij concubine charles filthy whoremonger lay two daughter therto though wiſt howe yt vnknowne yet luſtes greater thē great charles would wete yet refrayne beyond ſaying yt old age whore ſo bewitched ryng pearle wotte imagerie grauen therein went ſa • te dogge bitche charles hath hys whore ca •• ed hym dotehead beſide ſelfe whole mynde ſo much whē whore dead could departe dead corp cauſed enba •… ed caryed whether ſoeuer went ſo al world wondered till laſt lordes accombred carying place place aſhamed emperour •• pe mouth ſo old man ſo great emperour ſuch moſt chriſten kyng whoſe dedes euery man eye ſet ſhould dote dead whore toke counſell ſhould ye cauſe cōcluded muſt nedes enchauntement thē went vnto cophyne opened ſought found ring finger one lordes tooke put owne finger whē ring commaunded burye regardyng longer neuertheleſſe caſt phantaſie vnto lord began dote faſt ido • yng emperour ſo might neuer ſight charles muſt lord alſo charles muſt priuey vnto vntill lord perceauyng came becauſe enchaunted ring payne tediouſneſſe tooke caſt well acon douchland ryng well emperour coulde neuer depart towne • ayd place ring caſt though foule marreſſe yet built goodly monaſtery worſhip lady thether brought reliques whence coulde gette pardōs ſanctifie ye place make haunted lyeth saint right chriſtes ʋicar much pope made lecherous emperour saint great turcke mahomete ſaue holines might canoniſed saint fayne hys life abiding ſo continually hotte bathe ſakes • e charlemayne lewes ye mylde lewes milde emperour patient man another phoca another pray pope ſo meke ſofte ſcarcely coulde angry thing holy father ſeene water ſpyed complexion choſe steuen 4 name pope without pope steuen iiij knowledge bad neyther good morrow good euen god ſpeede matter againſt owne graunt fraunce peaced crowned hym emperour paſſed tyme ſeaſon became familiar together choſe paſchalis pope pope paſchale ſame maner paſchalis ſent immediatly legate vnto emperour ſofte lewes excuſing hymſelfe ſaying faulte clergie commō people drawne thereto violence againſt emperour content bad pope hee abuſed emperour ſhould ſo olde ordinaunce ought kept ſoftneſſe lewes much care priſoned owne ſonne helpe pope gregory fourth man dayes pope neuer regarded emperours pope ſetteth • emperour clergie rome ſue emperour either election confirmation pope ouer lewes neuer emperour chriſtendome power able owne might correct pope neyther kyng coulde correct outragious vice ſpiritualtie realme time lewes left three ſonnes among deuided ye realme fraūce douchland ſame pride diſdayne one ſhould haue fell together ſay eares ech deſtroying others power ſo fraunce afterwarde might great thyng thē pope raigned italy alone •… ne care emperour ſo much nicholaus firſt decreed pope nicholaus firſt ſecular prince emperour ſhould haue ought counſels clergie adrian ſecōd pope adrian ſecond choſen pope emperours deputie rome ſpokē matter emperours embaſſadours diſdained anſwered reſiſte rage people prayed cōtent ſalute pope adrian thyrde pope adrian third decreed ſhould abide tarie emperours confirmation authoritie chuſing pope pope onely ſhould call general counſel emperour emperour would preſume yt counſell ſhould none effect though prelate chriſtēdome though ſoeuer god word mighty beaſt waxed vertue pope power • y• emperour periſhed together began raygne alone tyme hetherto periſhed power emperours vertue pope ſayth platina ye lyfe pope ſince tyme none emperour might ſo pope vertue lewes empyre fraunce douchlād deuided betwene three ſonnes ſayde fought one another deſtroyed ſtrength empyre fraunce tyme pope haue bene onely bloud ſhede •• aboue vij c peates aboue vij hundred yeares thou ſhalt reade pope haue led liues bloudſhedding ſo much thou conſider ſtories well thou ſhalt eaſely perceaue hath bene flayne cauſe farre aboue xl hūdred thouſand men beſides hath bene prince chriſtēdome hath bene buſied combred great part life matter either warres begunne ſetting eyther ceaſing ſciſmes diuiſion hath bene amōg clergie ſhould pope ſtriuing chriſt • dome hath bene troubled wyth pope cauſes byſhops ſhould greateſt betwene byſhop yorke canterbury england betwene byſhops england wale wherof chronicle full reforming fryer monkes ſleying vttered falſe hypocriſie wyth god worde emperour downe man chriſtendome power feared euery nacion fell vppon landes variaunce betwene thēſelues dane came england vexed engliſhmen dwelt ſpite harte euen ſo came ſtraunge nacions whoſe name ſcarce heard theſe quarter ʋandales hunnes vandales hunnes gothes gothes ran thorowout chriſtendome c thouſands together ſubdued landes dwelt therin • gre inhabitours thou mayſt ſee douchland diuers nacions incloſed ye middes lande ſtraunge tongue douchmen vnderſtande rule continued well viij ix ſcore two hundred yeares ſpiritualtie obe • ed gat victory wicked ſoeuer ceaſon whoſoeuer wan mayſtrye hym ſpiritualtie receaued crowned kyng claue whatſoeuer tyraunt robbed hys life moſt part thereof muſt deale among hys death feare purgatory ſpiritualtie ceaſon preached pope mightely building abbeyes built abbayes recreation quyetnes ſhrining alway ſaintes shrining ſaintes purchaſed priuileges fought liberty diſputed pope power howſoeuer liued l yeare whē liues forgotten reſiſted thē whatſoeuer miſchief went hym noted chronicle cruell tyraunt ye whatſoeuer miſfortune chaunced hys poſteritie noted alſo though god plagued becauſe forefather diſobedient vnto holy church euer put ſtories vttered wickednes tyme falſe prophetes ariſe church way gathered reliques frō whence coulde get fayned myracles gaue thēſelues vnto poetry ſhut vp ſcripture ſo tyme chriſt ſpeaketh math xxiiij falſe prophetes ſhould ariſe ſhew myracles wonder deceaue electe bene poſſible finally thys buſie worlde kynges lumbardy gatte little might came vp agayne diuers tymes emperours though great might one beringarius kyng lumbardy began meddle beringarius holy father buſines wherfore ye poge fled vnto ottho kyng ye saxon tyme gotten might brought italy againſt beringarium ottho ottho ouercame beringarium made emperour labour thus came empyre firſt vnto douchlande ottho receaued empyre one pope iohn ſay thys pope iohn xij othe ottho promiſe ſweare vnto lord iohn father oth emperour made pope ſonne holy ghoſt wod croſſe maketh liuing theſe reliques saintes come rome god helpe exalte holy church rome gouernour ſame vnto power neyther ſhalt thou loſe lyfe member honour thou haſt counſell conſent ſetting worke moreouer wyll make rome conſtitution ordinaunce thing pertayneth vnto thee vnto romaine thy counſell ſo euer • diſſimulation y• pope callyng poſſeſſions peter poſſeſſions landes saint peter commeth vnto hand deliuer thee vnto whoſoeuer ſhall commit rule italy make hym ſweare ſhall helpe thee defende landes saint peter vnto power gregory fift got laſt long gaped pope gregory fi • made ordinaunce chuſing ye emperour ſtabliſhe withall vi lordes almany iij election emperour apperteyneth lordes germany ſpiritualtie iij temporaltie kyng bohem vij odde man ʋmpere ſhould • huſe euer ſende hym pope receaue othe crowned neuertheleſſe pope keepe emperour far ſendeth hym hys coronation home ofttymes much leuer ſhould come nearer meeke ſpryted man leuer liue ſolitarie alone haue holineſſe ſeene ¶ proper ſimilitude deſcribe holy father ſe holy father came vp marke example iuytree firſt ſpringeth y• earth iuytree ſpringeth crepeth along yt groūd till finde great tree ioyneth ſelfe neath alow vnto body tree creepeth vp litle litle fayre ſoftly begynnyng yet thynne ſmall maner y• pope ſpring vp hys great auctoritie burthen perceaued ſemeth glorious garniſhe tree wyntre beare tempeſtes weather meane ſeaſon thruſteth rootes yt barck tree hold faſt ceaſſeth clyme vp till top aboue ſendeth hys braunches long braunches tree ouergroweth waxeth great heauy thicke ſucketh moyſture ſo ſore tree braunches choketh ſtif • eth foule ſtinckyng iuye waxeth mighty ſtōpe tree becommeth ſete neſt vncleane byrdes blind oules whiche hauke darke dare come light euen ſo byſhop rome called pope begynnyng crope long vppon earth euery man trode vpon world aſſoone came chriſten emperour ioyned ſelfe vnto hys feete kiſſed crope vp litle beggyng nowe priuilege citie finde poore people neceſſary miniſters god word chuſing pope biſhoppes perteyned vnto emperour kinges hee entitled emperour choſing pope biſhops promoted ſpiritualty vertue learning fauour great men cōmended flater get frendes defender almes congregation fode patrimony almes geuen vnto poore become peter patrimony poore neceſſary preacher called peter patrimony peter reutes peter landes peter right caſt vayne feare heatheniſh ſuperſtitiouſneſſe harte mē man ſhould dare meddle ſoeuer came handes feare saint peter though miniſtred neuer ſo euil ſhould thinke none almes geue becauſe much already ſhould yet geue peter ſomewhat nabucodoneſſer gaue god beel purchaſſe aduocate dani xiiij interceſſor peter peter ſhould firſt knocke let thē thus flateryng fayning vayne ſuperſtition vnder name peter crept vp faſtened pope firſt gat aboue biſhops aboue emperour rootes hart emperour ſword clame vp aboue felow byſhops brought vnder feete ſubdued thē emperours ſword euen ſo ſutiltie helpe ſworne ſaythfull clame aboue emperour ſubdued hym alſo made ſ • oupe vnto feete kiſſe thē yea pope coeleſtinus crowned emperour henry fift holdyng ye crown lucifer betwene feete put crowne ſmote note deuiliſh •… nable pride feete agayne ſaying might make emperours put downe agayne made conſtitution •… e •… e pope lay man ſhould medle matter councels witte pope onely ſhould call councell emperour ſhould defēd pope prouided allway councel ſhould one pope townes pope power greater emperours vnder pretence pope createth ſhauelyngs dignity condemnyng ſome hereſie hee called generall councell made one patriarcke cardinall legate primate archbyſhop biſhop another deane another arch deacon ſo forth ſee pope played qualis pater talis filius good naturall child emperour ſo dyd braunches member byſhops play euery kyngdome dukedome lordſhyp ſo much heyres came vp hold landes take thē chief lordes emperour ſworne pope euen ſo euery kyng ſworne byſhops prelate realme chiefeſt parlamentes yea theyr money ſworne come vp rule together thus pope father pope order compared chriſtes hypocrite hath falſehode guile peruerted order worlde turned rootes tree vpward hath put downe kyngdome chriſt ſet vp kyngdome deuil whoſe ʋicare hath put downe miniſters chriſt hath ſet vp miniſters sathan diſguiſed yet name garmentes lyke vnto aungels light miniſters righteouſnes chriſtes kyngdome world iohn xviij pope kyngdome world chriſt neither iudge diuider world luke xij chriſt • pope compared together pope iudgeth deuideth world taketh empyre kyngdomes geueth luſteth chriſt ſayth math v bleſſed poore ſpirite ſo firſt ſtep kyngdome chriſt humbleneſſe humilitie thou canſt finde thyne hart ſeruice vnto mē ſuffer men treade thee pope ſayth bleſſed proude hygh mynded clyme ſubdue vnder mayntaine right ſuch ſuffer man ſo yeſterday taken dongehill promoted day prince preached reaſons peter y• greateſt authoritie geuen hym chriſt chriſt rome yer peter came thether came euer thether paule many authoritie bynde loſe el conuert people peter alſo apoſtle went ſrom place place paule dyd paule ordeyned byſhoppes euery place teach people ſo doubt peter might thoſe byſhops chalenge authoritie peter well rome ſay peter firſt ſeate antioche alſo legendes peter ſeate antioch firſt dyd runne rome leauing mā behynde hym teach people antioch god forbid myght byſhop chalenge peter authoritie haply ſay ſooner thē proue peter dyed rome therefore authoritie greateſt rule chriſtes power ſo full hieruſalem hath chriſtes inuiſible kyngdōe place chriſtes power goſpel chriſtes goſpell power full authoritie well one place finally get authoritie whence ſo euer cā ſnatch ioyne paule peter owne lawes diſtinctio xxij ſaying authoritie paul called helpe peter paule cleane agaynſt themſelues ſay awne lawe preſence ſuperior power inferior ceaſeth none peter preſence greater power leſſer doth 〈◊〉 greater paule rule peter preſēt paule ſubiect without authoritie chriſt preſent bodely preacheth himſelfe apoſtles geue vp authoritie holde peace ſit downe hys feete become ſcholers harkē wherfore ioyne paule wyth peter chalenge ſuperioritie well authoritie paule peter make paule fellow equall wyth peter thus falſe peter paule made equal felow peter greater felowes yt blinde owles care houle ſeyng night day light god worde ſhut vp man ſpye moreouer terme peter ſeat iuggle paſe infinite ſaying peter ſeat chiefe ſeat peter ſeat tell wiſt ye ye ſhould ſoone ſinagoge land nay verely moſes came neuer moſes ſeat moſes lawe doctrine euē ſo peter peter ſeate peter doctrine peter keyes one thyng ſeat peter doctrine goſpell chriſt peter taught ſame doctrine peter keyes ſo peter ſeat peter keyes peter doctrine one thyng peter doctrine paules doctrine doctrine xij apoſtles indifferently taught one thing wherefore followeth peter keyes peter ſeat keyes ſeat paule alſo xij apoſtles nothing ſaue goſpell chriſt thus peter doctrine better paules one thing euen ſo peter ſeat greater hyer holier thē ſeat xij peter ſeat nowe peter ſeate chriſtes goſpell chriſts ſeat chriſtes goſpel apoſtles ſat day ſitteth al onely ye preach chriſt truely wherfore antichriſt preacheth peter doctrine chriſtes goſpell ſo ſitteth peter ſeat ſeat sathan pope ſitteth th • deuils ſeate whoſe ʋicare whoſe vicar ſeat owne lawes ceremony falſe doctrine wherunto compelleth men violence ſworde clame purgatory ladder ſayd text whatſoeuer purgatory thou bindeſt earth c purgatory ſayth earth wherefore lord neuertheleſſe pope ſayth purgatory • • arth proue purgatory ſo cā proue ſhould earth might well element ſpere fire vnder mone well earth bynde loſe haue aboue betwene man man diſpence teſtamēts ouer men teſtamentes alter pope altereth mēs willes teſtamēts pleaſure thou makeſt hoſpitall ſhortly make colledge prieſtes place religion luſteth thē maner monkes fryer like draffe tooke diſpenſations hym ordinaunces theyr olde foūders becauſe thought prayed diſtributed theyr ſoules inough bring purgatory thruſt thē theyr beadrolles tooke dayly moe moe true scripture equall authoritie scripture muſt beleued wel ſcripture vnder payne dānation ſay truth dependeth truth ſcripture true becauſe ſcripture teſtifieth vnto v truely contrary truth ſcripture ſcripture inough ſo ſay owne head erre reaſon like though young mōkes newly profeſſed ſhould ſimilitude come rule order ordinaunces olde founder would go kepe old cankerd monkes ſhould cal backe vnto corrupt falſe maner vſed ſaying ye erre onely teach profeſſion obey elder accordyng vnto rule order ordinaunces founder ſhall ſay teach ſhall old monkes ſay lye vnto ye ought therfore beleue v bid yoūg monkes ſhall aunſwere ſee ye lye cleane contrary vnto written rule ordinaunces old monkes ſhall ſay ye doctrine papiſtes vſed thoſe dayes vnderſtand except expounde vnto neither yet know rule except ye beleue cā lye vnto ye know theſe rule ordinaunces elder tell ſo tell theſe rule ordinaunces ye ſure vndoubtedly ſo except ye beleue vndoubtedly lye wherfore ye ſure rule ordinaunces ye muſt firſt beleue lye leaue ſuch imagination diſputations therfore laye rule ordinaunces handes looke make erre come tell captiuate wittes beleue lye vnto ye vnderſtand rule • ordinaunces euen ſo thou ſay doctour sanctus whoſe holyneſſe man may deny ſo euer ſayth ſaue certaine place among ſo many lye ſayd true like maner ſoeuer defendeth hys saintes traditiōs decree priuileges made sainte alſo labour remembraunce one holy church cauſe yt tone cauſe tother ſaying iugglinge breake youres belong hid ſhall ſerue turne bring game vnto handes man ſhall know commeth aſſoone kyng richard gone ireland ſubdue theſe rebellion trayterous practiſe byſhop came againe preuē ted kyng tooke vp power agaynſt hym tooke priſoner put downe death moſt cruelly crowned erle darbye kyng mercifull chriſt bloud hath coronacion coſt england care cauſes muſt auenged worthy bee kyng auenge quarels kyngs receaue kyngdome beaſt ſweare worſhip hym maintayne hys throne thē whē erle darbye king henry fourth crowned prelate tooke hys ☜ papiſtes ſtyrers vppe warres ſheders bloud ſworde ſonnes henry fift hym kynges ſwordes ſince abuſed ſhed chriſtē bloud pleaſure coupled cauſe vnto kynges cauſe made treaſō beleue chriſt ſcripture teacheth reſiſte byſhops thruſt kinges priſons ſo new inuention euen olde practiſe though haue done theyr buſie cure hide ſciēce conueyaunce ſhould eſpyed kyng henry syr tho ſaith dialoge quod quod quod frende foreſayd duke gloceſter noble mā great clarcke ſo wiſe coulde ſpye falſe myracles diſcloſe iudge true hatefull ſcience vnto ſpiritualtie abhorred amongeſt necromancye clergy cannot abyde iudge talſe miracle witchcrafte thyng wherfore man lawe dare well ſay worthy dye ſecretly poſſible good common wealth ſee falſe myracles thyrdly withſtand fraūce kyngdome caterpillar ende ¶ crafte pope keepeth emperour downe marke practiſe moſt practiſe prelate holy prelate empyre tranſlated vnto germaynes though ye emperour fallē downe kyſſed pope feete become ſworne ſeruaunt yet much ſtrife open warre ofttymes betwene pope emperours pope haue put downe many good emperours helpe byſhoppes euery ſecretly perſwaded lordes forſake emperours take diſpenſations yt pope othes contrarywiſe emperours haue depoſed diuerſe pope haue depoſed emperours lykewiſe emperours haue depoſed pope pope requeſt cardinalles great prelate whoſe helpe onely able el verely though kynges chriſtened ſworne depoſe one pope hys ſeat fauour prelate therto might haply ſecrete practiſe put owne ſeates meane tyme pope therfore ſure ſelfe feare daunger emperour neuer ſo mighty ye emperour ſhould ſee hys dayly open paſtimes made frendſhip amitie wyth ʋenecians one ſide let thē come certaine city emperours italy french kyng ſide let alſo vp certayne city poſſeſſions emperours hymſelfe middes ſhut emperour commyng rome euer ſent coronation home made man may rebuke pope miſchief doth law man ſhould rebuke pope ſoeuer miſchief ſaying pope aboue iudge ouer none ouer therfore forbad law diſtinctio xl si papa ſaying though pope proued negligent ſelfe alſo ſoule health brother ſlacke workes ſpeachleſſe concernyng good draw wt example innumerable people hell puniſhed diuers tormētes euerlaſting yet ſee mortall man preſume rebuke hys faultes ſhall iudge men man antichriſt antichriſt haue life tried god word venetian ketch holy father townes poſſeſſions venetian whether warre haue bought layd morgage pope may geue take agayne hys pleaſure vnto thē old pope hath geuen mariage ſome daughter vnto duke venice holy father ſuccedeth whē ſeeth ſeaſon ſendeth agayne ſaying lawfull lay men withhold peter patrimonie alledge bought ſo forth fatherhode aunſwereth old pope none authoritie make ſuch cheuiſaūce peter inheritaūce could haue vſe life long muſt needes returne vnto ſucceſſour agayne vppon interditeth curſeth thē blacke coales downe pit hell venicians knowing holy father practiſe nyeneſſe dwell farre wiſer cold countreys perceauyng alſo colour chaungeth curſing ʋenetians • • e pope curſing bleſſing ſincke meate digeſteth well eraſmus ſayth ſhyte eaſily reuerence holy courſe ſpeake therfore feare interdiction excommunication holy father rayſeth vp power able make italy agaynſt ſendeth thē sochenars come helpe yet ſtrong inough ſendeth vnto biſhops fraūce warning ſeate decay long proſper therfore put kyng remembraunce called •… oſt chriſtian kyng deſire doe ſomewhat title agaynſt diſobedient rebellion vnto moſt holy ſea rome mother holy church tyme frenchman come holy father euer frenchmē gaping italy bryng empire home agayne fraunce y• moſt holy ʋicare bringeth whole power agaynſt power venicians old frēdes sochenars yet ſtrōge inough thē ſendeth byſhops england helpe god engliſhmē moue▪ kyng ſomewhat holy church puttyng remembraūce holdeth crown othe many cappes mainteinaunce haue bene euer ſent practiſe pope kinges prince vnto forefather honour vnto may eaſely get great honour happly excellent title take holy father part beſides hee ſhall purchaſe remiſſion ſynnes muſt peace appointementes made betwene v pope breaker peace fraunce broken kyng muſt take diſpēſation othe king fraunce attempt nothing italy vntil haue ſēt ambaſſadours haue made perpetuall peace kyng sacrament body sauiour broke betwene cōfirme appointment ſuppoſe breaking ſignifieth appointement ſhall long abuſe ſacrament endure greate deale flower would make ſo many hoſtes call thē ſingyng loues hath bene brokē dayes betwen chriſten prince called confirme promiſes haue long bene kept vſe bleſſed ſacrament prince none know chriſt ordeined perpetuall memory body broken ſinnes vpon croſſe repent ſhould receaue oft eate forgeueneſſe miſdedes faith kynges earth breake sacrament betwene thē ſay wiſe body sauiour broken croſſe ſinne repent haue good harte y• ſacrament ſhould broken betwene kinges prince would fayne keepe law broke vnto danmation breake othe terrible othe nede take hede make lawfully made breake care othe whiche make wedlocke ſo care ſoeuer nede pope hath wil ſend emperour come helpe italy feare leſt would take ſelfe ſoeuer conquered frenchman pope would haue emperour content admitte ſeruice kyng hath graunted take holy father part pretence cloke outward muſt kyng chalenge right fraunce ayde kyng hys right muſt common milked till blede agayne thē kyng ſeruice pope hath deſireth italy muſt make peace frēchmen agayn immediatly fraunce gether troden vnder foote remayne alwaye meane ſtate ſtrōg inough match emperour keepe downe mighty oppreſſing pope prelate bryng peace ſend immediatly frier foreſt frier foreſt vicar croiden ʋicare croyden preach kyng lordes preacher roareth crieth vnto though halowed houndes maketh exclamation ſaying ala ye ſpare ſtudie necromācy ſelf one haue heard named tyme paſſe ouer ſilence holy frier obſeruauntes caryed fayned letter trye true paſſe ouer ſilence alſo howbeit ſuch tēptations fayned profers inough moue thē neuer would haue thought amyſſe yea cōfeſſion mē ſhrine thē ſelues thoughtes neuer went outward deede whē great man put death confeſſour entreateth penaunce enioyned concerning ſhall ſay cō meth vnto place execution coulde geſſe practiſe yt might make men eares glow ſubtile counſell ſubtile practiſe prelate ſayde two prelate fayne ſiege bolen make pretence gather afiftene warre betwene kyng fraunce englād thā betwene mās head hath luſt ſleepe hys pyllow ſiege yet coſt many man lyues yea ſome great men thereto knew fayning kynges grace went ouer wyth ten thouſand men conquere fraunce ſpent haply hundred thouſand pounde ſaued fourth part dandy prat gathered home v vi hundred two ſuch fayned viages coulde haply rehearſe paſſe ouer diuerſe cauſes many engliſhe man loſt hys bene cales antwarpe cales time pope taking part french king warre emperour laſt pope taken cardinall heard wrote vnto emperour ſhould make hym pope gotten aū ſwere pleaſed according vnto deſeruinges toward emperour waxed furious mad ſought meanes diſpleaſe emperour imagined diuorcement betwene king queene wrote ſharpely vnto emperor manacing letter woulde make pope woulde make ſuch ruffling betweene ruffelar chriſten prince dred yeare make emperour repent yea though ſhould coſte whole realme england lord ieſus ſhield fierce wrath god vpon v pride arrogancie cardinall wolſey miſſhapen monſter ſhoulde ſpring dunghill ſuch height dread god man layd part ſhould ſo malepart onely defye vtterly maieſtie ſo mighty emperour whoſe authoritie chriſt apoſtles obeyed taught obey threatening damnation would ſhould alſo ſet ſo little whole realme england hath beſtowed ſo great coſt ſhed ſo much bloud exalt maintaine ſuch proud churliſh vnthankfull hypocrite ſhould care deſtroy vtterly ſatiſfying vilanous luſtes ¶ putting downe cardinall wolſey concerning cardinal putting cardinall wolſey great traytor downe conſider many thinges firſt neuer heard read man ſo great traytor ſo eaſely put death naturall diſpoſition inclination man yt chief ſtudy yea felicitie inward ioy hath euer bene exerciſe aungels wit lord lincolne wone praiſe driuing ſuch driſtes beguile men binde whole world wherefore none otherwiſe indge c token euident vnto whomſoeuer hath natural wit alſo nothing ſaue caſt olde practiſe ſo god wrapped owne wile wiſt way emperour preuailed al cardinal treaſon french child might come home learned alſo necromancie would iopardous yeare treaſon cardinall wolſey cō mitted treaſon agaynſt emperour wrought againſt emperour yt mony borowed common leaſt riſing ſhould againſt thought vndoe deſteny policy went put downe himſelfe vnder colour proceſſe tragedy well declareth ſet vp roome miniſter forth fight againſt god begun chiefeſt secretary one nothing inferiour vnto maſter lying faining bearing two face one hode whelpe goeth kinde ſyre chiefeſt ſtale wherewith cardinall caught kinges grace whome called vnto confirmation al entended perſuade ſaying like grace learned man knoweth alſo lay man wherefore cardinall wolſey preferred chauncelour ſay otherwiſe parcialitie vswarde ſecretary yet muſt firſt deſerue wyth writing againſt martin agaynſt obedience mammon come proctour purgatorye write againſt y• ſupplicatiō beggers blinde world withall many quarrel picked treaſon layd cardinall charge cardinall might ſpeake kinges grace broad ſeale fette away high treaſon layd hys charge breathed heard ſay kinges face french pockes hypocrices treaſon wrought ſpoke ought worthy traytour done called parliament though golden world ſhould come againe wherin ought take benefice churchewardens haue bene accuſtomed gather tithe geue pa •• reaſonable ſtipend geue • poore handes name pariſh deliuer preacher god word dwellyng preſēt ſufficient liuing deuide reſt among ye poore people king bound maintaine order reſiſt except open tyraunt appele conſciences kinges grace lordes aunſwer geue come chriſt ye laſt iudgement robbing ſo many ſoules ſo many pariſhes god word holding euery man ſo many chaplaynes houſes wyth plurality benefice robbing prince haue herein much aunſwere ſo many poore needy due dayly foode whoſe need lacke ſuccour cryeth god continually vengeaunce againſt ſee daily thouſand miſfortunes fall theyr wiues child let read exodus deutronomie ſee finde yea ſhall ſo many chaplaines firſt ſlay theyr ſoules defile wiues daughter cauſe miſchiefe whence commeth miſchief • ʋerily hand god auenge wantonneſſe great men walke without feare god folowing ye ſteps hye prelate contrary vnto profeſſion auenge alſo yt wrong blaſphemies ſubtil perſecuting word martin luther vttered abhominations pope clergy god worde diuers bookes come england cardinall thought finde remedy againſt well enough ſent rome vaine title defender fayth ʋicar defēder fayth croydon preached kynges grace would loſe london xx mile round neyther maruell hath coſt london xl mile able make think houre beſide effuſion innocēt bloud offred vnto idoll dayly offred therto glorious name come holy father title defē dour fayth came frō rome cardinall brought vnto kinges grace greenwich though king already read yet againſt morning lordes gentleman could ſo ſhort ſpace gathered together ſent come receaue honour morning cardinall gat backſide frier obſeruantes part popiſhe vayne glorious maner cardinal wolſey gentils went round welcommed rome repreſenting pope perſon part met halfe way part court gate laſt king grace ſelf met hall brought vp great chamber ſeate prepared hye kinges grace cardinal bull read ſo much wiſe onely men meane vnderſtanding laughed vaine pomp ſcorne far vnlike receauing cardinal hatte whē ruffian brought vnto weſtminſter vnder cloke clothed meſſenger cardinal hat rich aray ſent backe douer againe appoynted biſhop canterbury meete company lordes gentles wotte oft ere came falſeſt vaineſt cardinall euer weſtminſter ſet cupborde taper ſo greateſt duke lande muſt make curteſie thereto yea empty ſeat away ſhortly lacke authoritie god worde martin muſt condemned authoritie king kinges grace claw pope againe muſt make booke proue would haue ſtabliſhed lacke ſcripture yea contrary opē ſcripture made mighty reaſon prelate chirch erreth y• pope biſhops chirch church church cannot erre therfore right ought beleeue without ſcripture yea though ſcripture contrary wherefore god offended ſuch blaſphemy make enemy feele woulde ſee open ſcripture practiſe liuings doings cleane contrary vnto ſcripture vnto liuing chriſt apoſtles viij hundred yeares hath poured wrath vppon v hath ſnared wiſe world ſubtlety owne wittes moreouer marten luther marten luther ſubmitted ſelf king henry viij ſubmitted himſelfe epiſtle let grace conſider aunſwer gaue agayne glory yt great prayſe become grace gaue cardinall goodly actes benefites common wealth whole realme ſhould feele among blaſphemies proued lyer dialogue ſayth none v dare abide fayth vnto death ſhortly thereafter god proue hath euer bene falſe lyar gaue ſtrength vnto ſeruaunt sir thomas hitton confeſſe sir thomas hittō vnto death faith holy ſonne ieſus thomas biſſhops canterbury rocheſter dieted tormented ſecreatly murthered maydſtone moſt cruelly beſech king moſt noble grace therefore conſider wayes cardinall holy biſhops haue lead ſince firſt king ſee wherunto al pride pompe vaine boaſt cardinall come god hath reſiſted prelate theyr wile wee hauing nothing haue medled yet matter haue ſpent prelats cauſes chriſtendome euen vnto vtter beggering ſelues haue gotten nothing rebuke ſhame hate among nation mocke ſcorne thereto whome haue moſt holpen frenchman ſaying late dayes made play diſguiſing paris emperour daunſed pope daunce paris french king weried k england ſitting hye bentch looking aſked daunſed aunſwered ſate pay ambaſſadors goe betwene entreat peace biſhops euer chief though make goodly oration peace openly deceaue lay men yet ſecreatly biſſhops ſame countrie caſt bone way peace vntill peace profite let coſt enſamples bible let remember well obedience 〈◊〉 chriſten man written three yeares booke toward iij yeares agone preuent al occaſions carnall beaſtes ſeeke fleſhly liberty ſent forth true obedience bedlem mad affirme good yt naturall cauſe euill darkenes procede light lying ſhould grounded truth verity rather cleane contrary light deſtroyeth darkenes veritie reproueth maner lying neuertheleſſe ſeyng hath pleaſed god ſend vnto engliſh men euen many vnfaynedly deſire scripture mother toūg cōſidering euery place falſe teacher blind leader ye ſhould deceaued man ſuppoſed neceſſary prepare cauſe edition pathway pathway scripture ye might walke ſurely euer know true frō falſe aboue put remembraunce certaine pointes ye well vnderſtand theſe wordes meane old teſtament new teſtament law goſpell moſes chriſt nature grace workyng beleuing dedes faith leſt aſcribe one belongeth make chriſt moſes goſpell law deſpiſe grace robbe fayth fal meke learnyng idle deſpitions brawlyng ſcoldyng
