publiſhed apoſtles throughout world chriſt right dauid hee hath fought ſinne death deuil ouercome wherby men bondage ſinne woūded death ouercome deuill without owne merites deſeruinges loſed iuſtified reſtored life ſaued brought libertie reconciled vnto fauour god ſet one agayne whiche tydinges many beleue laude prayſe thanke god glad ſyng daunce ioy euangelion goſpell euangeliō called newe teſtamēt ſay ſuch ioyfull tydinges called y• new teſtament becauſe mā whē ſhall dye appointeth good dealt diſtributed death among whiche nameth bee heyres euen ſo chriſt hys death commaūded appointed ſuch euangelion goſpell tydynges ſhould declared throughout world therewith geue vnto repent beleue goodes ſay lyfe wherewith hee ſwalowed deuoured vp death hys righteouſnes wherewith baniſhed ſinne ſaluatiō wherwith ouercame eternall damnation cā greater comfort happen ſinner penitent thē promiſes goſpell wretched man knoweth ſelfe wrapped ſinne daūger death hell heare ioyous thyng ſuch glad comfortable tydinges chriſt glad laugh frō low bottome hart hee beleue tydinges true goſpell promiſed god old teſtamēt prophet ſtrēgth ſuch ſayth god promiſed euangelion old teſtament prophetes paul ſayth rom 1 choſē preach god euāgeliō promiſed prophetes scripture treate ſonne borne ſede dauid gene iij god ſayth serpent wil put hatred betwen thee woman betwen thy ſeede ſede ſelfe ſede ſhall treade thy head vnder foote chriſt chriſt hath ouer▪ throwen ye deuill hys power womās ſeede hath troden vnder foote deuils head ſay ſinne death hell power without ſeede man anoyde ſinne death hell euerlaſting damnation agayne gene xxij god promiſed abraham ſaying thy ſeede ſhall generation earth bleſſed chriſt ſeede abraham ſayth paule gala iij hath bleſſed world goſpell chriſt remaineth curſe fell adam ſoone ſinned ſo bō dage vnder damnation ſinne death hell againſt curſe bleſſeth goſpell world aſmuch cryeth opēly vnto knowledge ſinnes repēt ſaying ſoeuer beleueth ſede abraham ſhalbe bleſſed ſhal deliuered ſinne death hell ſhall hence forth continue righteous ſaued euer chriſt hym ſelfe ſayth xj iohn beleueth ſhall neuer dye law ſayth iohn geuē moſes grace verity ieſus 〈◊〉 geuen moſes grace truth ieſus chriſt chriſt law whoſe miniſter moſes geuen bryng v vnto knowledge ſelues might thereby feele perceaue nature law cōdemneth v deedes called paule ij cor iij miniſtration death killeth conſciences driueth v deſperation lawe requireth v whiche impoſſible nature much requireth v vnpoſſible nature requireth v deedes whole man requireth perfect loue low bottome grounde hart well thinges whiche ſuffer thinges ſayth iohn ſame place grace veritie geuē v chriſt law hath paſſed vpō law hath condemned v chriſt graunteth v free pardon v condemned v death nature haue chriſt grace ſay fauour promiſes life mercy pardon freely ye merites chriſt chriſt haue veritie truth god ſake fulfilleth promiſes beleue therfore y• goſpell miniſtration life paule calleth fore rehearſed place cor ij miniſtration ſpirite righteouſnes goſpell beleeue promiſes receaue ſpirit life iuſtified bloud chriſt thyngs wherof law condemned v receaue loue vnto law power fulfill grow therein dayly chriſt written fore rehearſed ioh whoſe aboundaunce fulnes haue receaued grace grace fauour fauour ſay fauour god hath ſonne chriſt geueth vnto v fauour good wil al giftes grace father ſonnes affirmeth paule ſaying whiche loued v beloued creation y• world y• chriſt bringeth loue god vnto v owne holy woorkes chriſt made chriſt god mercy ſtoole ſo mercy commeth god chriſt lord ouer called scripture god mercy ſtole ſoeuer therfore flyeth chriſt neither heare receaue god thyng ſaue mercy old teſtamēt many promiſes nothyng el euāgelion goſpel ſaue thoſe yt beleued thē frō yt vengeaunce law new teſtament oft made mention law cōdemne beleue promiſes moreouer law goſpell may neuer ſeparate goſpel promiſes ſerue troubled conſciences brought deſperation feele paynes hell death vnder law captiuitie bondage vnder law dedes muſt haue law condemne myne vnperfectnes neuer ſo perfect yet damnable ſinne compared law whiche requireth ground bottome myne hart muſt therefore haue alwayes law ſight may meke law muſt euer ſight make v humble ſpirited goſpel alſo • yes comfort v ſpirite giue god laude prayſe aſcribyng righteouſnes ſelfe al vnrighteouſnes ſinne muſt alſo haue promiſes myne eye diſpayre promiſes ſee mercy fauour good god vpon bloud hys ſonne chriſt hath made ſatiſfaction myne vnperfectnes fulfilled could may ye perceaue two maner people ſore deceaued firſt two maner people deceaued thoſe iuſtifie thēſelues thſe workes thoſe blinde opinion faith vtterly per • ert liuely fayth whiche iuſtifie ſelues outward dedes abſtayne outwardly frō law forbiddeth outwardly law commaundeth compare ſelues open ſinners reſpect iuſtifie ſelues condemning open ſinners ſet vayle moyſes face ſee law requireth loue bottome hart loue onely fulfilling law dyd would condemne neighbour loue hydeth multitude ſinnes ſayth peter firſt epiſtle loue deepe bottome grounde myne hart condemne neither recken ſinnes ſuffer weakenes infirmitie mother weakenes ſonne vntill grow vp perfect man thoſe alſo deceaued feare god geue ſelues vnto maner vice ful conſent full delectation hauyng reſpect law god vnder whoſe vengeaunce locked vp captiuitic ſay god mercyfull chriſt dyed v ſuppoſing ſuch dreaming imaginatiō fayth ſo greatly cōmended holy scripture nay faith rather foliſh blind opinion ſpringing owne corrupt nature geuē ſpirite god rather ſpirite deuill whoſe fayth dayes popiſh compare make equall vnto beſt truſt confidence belefe repenting ſoule haue bloud sauiour ieſus vnto owne confuſion ſhame vtteryng true faith ſayth apoſtle paule gift god geuē ſinners law hath paſſed vppon hath brought conſciences vnto brim deſperation ſorowes hell haue right faith conſēt law righteous good iuſtifie god made hath right fayth deliteth law althogh weaknes fulfill ſame law haue delectation law notwithſtanding cā fulfill would weakenes abhorre ſoeuer law forbiddeth though wayes auoyde great ſorrow becauſe fulfill god law ſpirite cryeth god night day ſtrength helpe teares ſayth paul expreſſed toung thinges belefe popiſh father ſo magnifie ſtrong faith hath none experience firſt ſay whiche iuſtifieth ſelfe outward iuſtifieth ſelfe reiecteth yt law priuiſes deedes conſenteth law inward neither hath delectation therin ye would rather ſuch law iuſtifieth god hateth tyraunt neither careth promiſes owne ſtrength ſauiour ſelfe wiſe glorifieth god though ſeme outward ſecond ſay ſenſuall perſon voluptuous ſwyne voluptuous perſon neither feareth god law neither thankefull promiſes mercy ſet foorth chriſt beleue right chriſten man conſenteth law righteous iuſtifieth true chriſtian god law affirmeth god righteous iuſt author law beleueth promiſes god iuſtifieth god iudgyng true beleuyng fulfill promiſes law condemneth ſelfe dedes geueth prayſe god beleueth promiſes aſcribeth truth god thus euery iuſtifieth god prayſeth god nature fall adam child wrath heyres vengeaunce god byrth yea conceptiō haue felowſhip damned deuils vnder power darkenes rule sathan yet mother wombes though ſhewe forth frutes ſinne ſoone borne yet full naturall poyſon whereof ſinnefull deedes ſpryng ſinne outwardes neuer ſo young ſoone able woorke occaſion geuen nature ſinne nature serpent ſtynge serpent yet young yet vnbrought forth full poyſon proper ſimilitude afterward tyme come occaſion geuen bryng foorth frutes therof adder tode ſnake hated man euill hath done poyſon hurt ſo hated god naturall poyſon cōceaued borne v outward euill euil venemous worme doth maketh serpent becauſe venemous worme doth euill poyſoneth frute maketh tree euill becauſe euill tree therfore bryngeth foorth euill frute ſeaſon frute euen ſo euill dedes make vsfirſt euill though ignorance blindnes euill workyng hardeneth v euill maketh v worſe worſe becauſe nature euill therefore thinke euill vnder vengeaūce vnder law conuict eternal damnation law contrary god thynges conſent tende grace ſay fauour plucked frō adam graffed chriſt grace plucked adā ground euill graffed chriſt roote goodnes chriſt god loued v elect choſen world began reſerued v vnto knowledge ſonne holy goſpell goſpell preached v openeth harte geueth v grace beleue putteth ſpirite chriſt v know father moſt mercyfull conſent law lone inwardly hart deſire fulfill ſorrow becauſe ſinne frailtie neuer ſo much ſufficient till ſtrength bee geuen v bloud chriſt hath made ſatiſfaction reſt bloud chriſt hath obteyned bloud ieſus hath obtained al thinges v god thyngs v god chriſt ſatiſfaction redemer deliuerer ſauiour vengeaunce wrath obſerue marke paules peter iohns epiſtles goſpell chriſt vnto v faith ſaued onely beleuyng promiſes though fayth neuer without loue good workes yet ſauing imputed neither loue vnto good workes vnto faith onely loue woorkes vnder law requireth perfection ground fountayne hart damneth imperfectnes fayth vnder promiſes damne geue pardō grace mercy fauour ſoeuer contayned promiſes sundry ſortes righteouſnes righteouſnes diuers blynd reaſō imaguieth many maner righteouſneſſes righteouſnes workes ſayd hart way felt law ſpirituall fulfilled bottome hart iuſt miniſtration▪ maner lawes obſeruyng worldlye purpoſe owne profite loue vnto neighbour without reſpect morall vertues wherein philoſophers put felicity bleſſednes whiche nothyng ſight god reſpect lyfe come like maner iuſtifying ceremony whiche ſome imagine owne ſelues ſome counterfaite ſaying blynd reaſō ſuch holy perſons dyd thus thus holy men therfore ſo likewiſe ſhall pleaſe god haue none aūſwere god pleaſeth iewes ſeke righteouſnes ceremony god gaue vnto iuſtifie deſcribe paynt chriſt vnto thē iewes teſtifieth paule ſaying haue affection god knowledge go ſtabliſh owne iuſtice obedient iuſtice righteouſneſſe commeth god forgeueneſſe ſinne chriſtes bloud vnto repent beleue cauſe verely mās ſenſuall reaſon perceaue vertue chriſtes bloud except man caſt away owne imagination reaſon perceaue god vnderſtand vertue power bloud chriſt full righteouſnes law fulfilled ground hart neither peter paule life perfectly vnto vttermoſt could perfecter ſighed ſo farreforth bleſſed chriſt hungred thyrſted paule thyrſt conſented law god ought ſo found luſt member cōtrary luſt deſire mynde letted therefore cryed ſaying oh wretched man ſhall deliuer body death thankes bee god ieſus chriſt righteouſnes god value beleue promiſes god law hath confounded conſcience temporall law ofttymes condenmeth thefe murtherer bringeth execution ſo ſeeth nothyng preſent death commeth good tydinges charter frō kyng deliuereth hym likewiſe god law hath brought ſinner knowledge himſelfe hath confounded conſcience opened vnto wrath vengeaunce god commeth good tydinges euangelion ſheweth vnto promiſes god chriſt chriſt hath purchaſed pardon hath ſatiſfied law peaſed wrath god poore ſinner beleueth laudeth thāketh god chriſt breaketh exceedyng inward ioy gladnes hath eſcaped ſo great wrath ſo heauy vengeaunce ſo fearefull ſo euerlaſtyng death henceforth hūgred thurſt righteouſnes might fulfill law mourneth continually commendyng hys weakenes vnto god bloud sauiour chriſt ieſus ſhall ye ſee compendiouſly playnly ſet order practiſe euery thyng afore rehearſed fall adam hath made v adam fall brought v bondage deuill heyres vengeaunce wrath god heyres eternall damnatiō hath brought v captiuitie bondage vnder deuill deuill lord ruler head gouernour prince yea god locked knit faſter vnto deuill could hundred thouſand chaines bynde man vnto poſt ʋnto deuils conſent harte myndes might power ſtrēgth luſt ſo law deuill written well hart member runne headlong deuill full ſeale whole ſwyng power haue ſtone caſt vp ayre cōmeth downe naturally owne ſelfe violence ſwyng owne wayght poyſon deadly venemous hate hateth natural corruption myndes adam heyres playnly ſ •• forth man hys enemy howe great malice mynde inwardly ſlea murther violence rage yea feruent luſt commit aduoutrie fornication ſuch like vncleannes pleaſure delectation inwardly ſerueth glotton belly diligence deceaue buſily ſeke thinges world ſoeuer doe thinke imaginne abhominable ſight god referre nothyng vnto honour god neither law written member harte neither power v folow god ſtone aſcende vpward hys owne ſelfe beſide ſlepe ſo depe blindnes cā neither ſee feele miſery thraldome wretchednes till moſes come wake v publiſh law heare law truly preached ought loue honour god ſtrength might low bottome hart becauſe hath created v heauen earth ſakes made v lord therof neighbour yea enemy ſelues inwardly grounde hart becauſe god hath made likeneſſe owne image ſonnes well chriſt hath bought bloud made heyres euerlaſtyng lyfe well v ought ſoeuer god biddeth abſteine ſoeuer god forbiddeth loue mekenes feruent burnyng luſt center hart begynneth conſcience rage againſt law againſt god ſea neuer ſo great tempeſt ſo vnquiet poſſible naturall mā cōſent law ſhould good god ſhould righteous maketh law much contrary vnto hys nature damneth cā neither ſheweth fetch helpe preacheth mercy onely ſetteth mā variaunce god witneſſeth paule rom iiij prouoketh hym ſtyrreth hym rayle god blaſpheme cruell tyraunt poſſible man regeneratiō thinke wel god mā till borne agayne thinke god righteous make hym ſo poyſon nature either pleaſure ſinne man geue law impoſſible cōſent witte reaſon beyng ſo faſt glued yea nayled chayned vnto deuill neither creature louſe bondes ſaue bloud chriſt onely captiuitie bondage whence chriſt deliuered v redemed louſed v bloud death pacience ſuffering rebuke wronges prayer faſtynges mekenes fulfillyng vttermoſt point law peaſed wrath god brought fauour god v agayne obteined god ſhould loue v firſt father mercyfull father conſider infirmity weakenes wil geue v ſpirite agayn taken away fall adam rule gouerne ſtrength v breake bondes sathan wherein ſo ſtraite bounde chriſt thus wiſe preached promiſes rehearſed contained prophetes pſalmes diuers place fiue bookes moſes preachyng called goſpell glad tydinges hart elect • euē melt preachyng god mercy chriſtes kyndnes harte elect choſē begyn waxe ſoft melt bounteous mercy god kyndnes ſhewed chriſt euangelion preached ſpirite god entreth god hath ordeined appoynted vnto eternall lyfe openeth inward eye worketh ſuch belefe wofull conſciences feele taſt ſwete thyng bitter death chriſt mercyfull louing god chriſtes purchaſyng merites begin loue gayne conſent law god good ought ſo god righteous made deſire fulfill law euen ſicke man deſireth whole hungred thirſt righteouſnes ſtrength fulfill law perfectly omit leaue vndone ſeke god honour meekeneſſe euer condemnyng vnperfectnes deedes law chriſt ſtandeth v double ſtede v ſerueth two maner wiſe firſt redemer deliuerer reconciler mediator interceſſor aduocate chriſt • e •• nothyng vndone might ſaluation atturney ſoliciter hope comfort ſhield protectiō defender ſtrēgth health ſatiſfaction ſaluation bloud death euer dyd chriſt ſelf bloud ſhedyng dyd doth good ſeruice though ſelfe done god great myne hath huſband wiues chriſt purchaſing secondaryly ouercome loue kindnes ſeke god chriſten man nature haue chriſt exāple counterfeit ſaith chriſt example v goodnes chriſt ſelfe iohn haue geuen example euā geliſt ſayth wilbe great among ſhalbe ſeruaunt miniſter ſonne man came miniſter miniſtred vnto paule ſayth counterfeit chriſt peter ſayth chriſt dyed left example folow hys ſteppes ſoeuer therefore fayth faith receiueth god thorough chriſtes bloud muſt beſtowe neighbour though enemyes hath receaued god chriſts bloud deſeruyng ſame muſt loue ſhed euery whit beſtow neighbour vnto profite yea though enemyes fayth receaue god loue ſhed agayne muſt frely example chriſt without reſpect ſaue neighbour wealth onely neither looke reward earth yet heauen deſeruyng merites deedes frier preach though know good deedes rewarded lyfe lyfe come pure loue muſt beſtow ſelues haue able euen enemyes bryng god conſideryng nothyng wealth chriſt dyd chriſt dyd hys chriſt dyd good deedes merite heauē ready frely ſakes deedes obteyne heauen therby bene madnes heauē ready heyre therof inheritaunce dyd frely ſakes conſideryng nothyng wealth bryng fauour god v agayne v god naturall ſonne father heyre doth father becauſe would heyre already byrth father gaue yer hee borne lother ſhould go without ſelfe hath wit pure loue doth doth aſke doth thing doth aunſwereth father bade father pleaſeth father bond ſeruauntes worke hyre child loue father hath already doth chriſten man frely doth conſidereth nothyng god neighbour wealth onely liue chaſte obteine heauen therby ſhould doe wrong bloud chriſt chriſtes bloud hath obteined chriſtes merites haue made heyre therof doore way thether wardes neither loke higher roume heauē thē ſhal haue liue wedlocke thē whore ſtewes ſhe repēt pride lucifer frely wayte euangelion auoyde trouble world occaſions might plucke ſerue brother euen one hand helpeth one member becauſe one feeleth others grief payne one payne ſoeuer done leſt v whether good bad done chriſt ſoeuer done brother chriſten mā ſame done neither doth brother payne greue leſſe myne owne neither reioyſe leſſe wealth mine loue hym well aſmuch ſelfe law cōmaundeth ſo ſayth paule let hym reioyſeth reioyſe lord ſay chriſt whiche lord ouer creature • merites obteined heauē hygher place wherein might reioyſe beſides lord ſee ye nature law nature euangelion law byndeth goſpel louſeth men law key byndeth damneth men euangelion keye loſeth agayne law goeth euangelion foloweth preacher preacheth law byndeth conſciences preacheth goſpell looſeth agayn theſe two ſalues meane law goſpell vſeth god preacher heale cure ſinners law driueth force law diſeaſe maketh appeare ſharpe ſalue freatyng corſey killeth dead fleſh louſeth draweth ſores rootes corruption pulleth man truſt confidence hath ſelfe owne workes merites deſeruinges ceremony robbeth righteouſneſſe maketh poore killeth ſendeth hym downe hell bryngeth vtter deſperation prepareth ye way lord written iohn baptiſt poſſible chriſt ſhould come man long truſteth ſelf worldly thyng hath righteouſneſſe rich holy workes commeth euā gelion gentle paſter ſoupleth ſwageth woundes cōſcience bringeth health bringeth ſpirite god loſeth bondes sathā coupleth v god ſtrong fayth feruent loue bondes ſtrong deuill world creature loſe poore vpriſing ſinner feeleth ſuch ioy goſpell thinketh it▪ impoſſible god ſhould forſake hym wretched ſinner feeleth ſo great mercy loue kyndnes god ſure hym ſelfe poſſible god ſhould forſake withdraw hys mercy loue hym boldly cryeth paul ſaying ſhall ſeparate v loue god loueth v withall ſay ſhall make beleue god loueth shall tribulation anguiſh perſecution shal hūger nakednes shal ſword nay ſure neither death lyfe neither aungell neither rule power neither preſent thynges thinges come neither hygh low neither creature able ſeparate v loue god chriſt ieſu lord ſuch tribulation chriſten man perceaueth god father loueth hym euen loued chriſt ſhed bloud croſſe finally bond deuill wrought maner euill wickednes hell ſake reward ſinne becauſe heyre hell byrth bondage deuill dyd euill could none otherwiſe ſinne nature euen ſo ſince coupled god chriſtes bloud well heauens ſake yet reward wel doyng becauſe heyre heauen grace chriſtes purchaſyng haue ſpirite god good frely ſo nature good tree bryngeth forth good frute euill tree euill frute frutes ſhal ye know tree mās dedes declare within make neither good bad though created new ſpirite doctrine chriſt waxe perfecter alwaye woorkyng accordyng doctrine blynd woorkes owne imagining muſt firſt euill yer doe euill serpent firſt poyſoned yer poyſon muſt alſo good yer good fire muſt firſt hoate yer heate thyng take example thoſe blynd deaffe cured goſpell could ſee heare till chriſt geuen ſight hearyng thoſe ſicke could dedes whole man till chriſt geuen health man good ſoule till chriſt haue loſed hym bondes sathan haue geuē wherewith good yea firſt haue powred hym ſelfe good thing ſhedeth forth afterward whatſoeuer owne ſinne whatſoeuer aboue chriſtes gift purches doyng ſynne v 〈◊〉 ſelues▪ goodnes chriſt working bought father dearely bloud yea moſt bitter death gaue lyfe ſoeuer good thyng v geuen v frely without deſeruyng merites chriſtes bloudes ſake deſire folow yt god gift chriſtes bloud hate deuils whereunto ſo faſt locked could loue alſo gift chriſtes bloud vnto belongeth prayſe honour good dedes vnto v deedes v three maner ſeruice firſt certifie v workes certifie v euerlaſtyng • nheritaunce • ill ſinne v releue neceſſitie neighbour heyres euerlaſtyng life ſpirite god whiche earneſt therof v harte conſent vnto law god haue power mēbers though imperfectly ſecondarily tame fleſhe therewith kill ſinne remayneth yet v waxe dayly perfecter perfecter ſpirite therewith kepe luſtes choke word god ſowen v quench giftes working ſpirite loſe ſpirite agayne thirdly dutie vnto neighbour therewith helpe neceſſitie vnto cō fort alſo draw mē vnto honoryng prayſing god whoſoeuer excelleth giftes grace belōg brother much ſelues giftes grace let ſame thinke geuen hym much hys brother ſeruice owne ſelfe much loue whiche god hath weake vnto vnto god geueth ſuch giftes withdraweth ought hath hys neighbour neede robbeth hys neighbour thefe proude giftes god thinketh hym ſelfe reaſon better feeble neighbour rather truth knowledgeth hym ſelfe ſeruaunt vnto hys poore neighbour reaſon ſame hath lucifer ſpirite hym chriſtes theſe thynges know firſt law naturall right equitie haue one god put hope truſt hym loue hart ſoule might power neither moue hart hand commaundemēt becauſe hath firſt created v nought heauē earth ſakes afterward marred ſelfe ſinne forgaue v created v agayne bloud beloued ſonne haue name one god feare reuerence diſhonour ſwearyng therby light trifle vanitie call recorde confirming wickedneſſe falſhead ought diſhonour god whiche breakyng hys lawes vnto hurt neighbour aſmuch lord god double poſſeſſiō creation redemption therfore ought ſayd neither moue hart hand without commaūdement right haue nedefull holy dayes come together learne holydayes neceſſary come together learne chriſtes law haue v ruled alſo promiſes mercy whiche haue v truſt vnto geue god thankes together mercy commit infirmity hym sauiour ieſus reconſile ſelues vnto hym eche ought betweene brother brother requireth purpoſe ſuch lyke viſite ſicke nedy redreſſe peace vnitie holy dayes ordeined onely ſo farforth kept holy frō maner workes may conueniently ſpared tyme till done lawfully worke right obey father mother maſter lord prince kyng ordinaunces world bodely ghoſtly god ruleth v miniſtreth frely benefites vnto v loue benefites receaue feare power haue ouer v puniſh v treſpaſſe law good order farre yet worldly power ruler obeyed onely worldly ruler obayed ſo far forth • lawes impugne god lawes commaūdements repugne againſt commaundement god thē hoo wherefore muſt haue god commaundement euer harte hygher law interpret inferiour obey nothyng agaynſt belefe one god agaynſt fayth hope truſt onely agaynſt loue god wherby doe leaue vndone thyng ſake nothyng man cōmaundement agaynſt reuerence name god make deſpiſed leſſe feared ſet obey nothyng hynderaunce knowledge bleſſed doctrine god whoſe ſeruaūt holy day notwithſtandyng though ruler god hath ſet ouer v commaunde though ruler appointed god oppreſſe v yet may auenge god roome v agaynſt god v open wrong oppreſſe v cruel tyranny yet becauſe god rowme may auēge ſelues proceſſe order god law lawes mā made authoritie god law whiche alſo god law euer hygher power remittyng vengeaunce vnto god meane ſeaſō ſuffer vntill houre come ſide know man ought loue neighbour equally muſt loue neighbour ſelf fully well hym ſelfe becauſe neighbour neuer ſo ſimple equally created god full redemed bloud ſauiour ieſu chriſt commaundement loue ſpring theſe kill thy neighbour defile wife beare falſe witneſſe agaynſt hym finally onely theſe thynges deede couete thyne harte houſe wife manſeruaunt maydeſeruaunt oxe aſſe ſoeuer theſe lawes pertaynyng vnto neighboure fulfilled ſight god ſaue loue loueth hys neighbour kepeth commaundemēt defile thy neighbour wife though hee neuer touch neuer ſee thinke vpon commaundement though thy neighbour wife neuer ſo fayre thou haue neuer ſo great oportunitie geuen thee ſhe contēt happly prouoke thee putiphers wife ioſeph yet ſee thou loue thy neighbor ſo well loue thou finde thine hart yt wickednes euē ſo truſteth thing ſaue god onely ſonne ieſus chriſt kepeth cō maundemēt ſight god hath truſt creature whether heauen earth ſaue god ſonne ieſus cā ſee cauſe loue god hart c neither abſteine diſhonoryng name keepe holy day loue doctrine obey louing ly yt ruler world cauſe loue neighbour ſelfe abſteine hurtyng hym may get profite hym ſaue ſelfe harmeles likewiſe againſt law loue thy neighbour thy ſelfe may obey worldly power ought man cōmaundemēt vnto hurt neighbour hath deſerued though turke know cōtrary law vnto nature dānation haue law writtē harte though neuer committe dedes meanes bee ſaued damnation repentaūce toward law fayth chriſtes bloud inward baptiſme ſoules waſhyng dippyng bodyes yt water outward ſigne plungyng body vnder baptiſme ſignifieth repent profeſſe new life water ſignifieth repent profeſſe fight againſt ſinne luſtes kill euery day helpe god diligence folowyng doctrine chriſt leadyng ſpirite beleue waſhed naturall damnation borne wrath law frō infirmity weakeneſſes remayne v haue geuen conſent vnto law yelded oure ſelfe ſcholers thereof imperfectneſſe deedes done cold loue actuall ſinne ſhall chaunce v enforce contrary euer fight thereagaynſt hope ſinne thus repentaunce fayth begyn baptiſme firſt profeſſing lawes god cōtinue vnto liues end grow grow ſpirite perfecter greater repentaūce ſtrōger faith thus ſpirit doctrine god part repentaūce fayth part beget v new chriſt euen ſo make v grow waxe perfect ſaue v vnto ende neuer leaue v vntill perfecter greter repentante ſtronger fayth ſinne put cleane purified full formed faſhioned ſimilitude lickenes perfectnes sauiour ieſus whoſe gift finally know yt ſoeuer good thyng v ſame yt gift grace therfore deſeruyng though many thing geuen god diligence workyng lawes chaſtiſing bodyes praying thē beleuyng promiſes el ſhould geuen v yet working deſerueth y• gift workes deſerue yt giftes grace thē diligēce marchaūt ſeekyng good ſhyppe bringeth good ſafe lād though ſuch diligēce doth thē helpe therto whē beleue god might tempt god true abyde promiſe helpe v performe alone ſtrength paſt theſe thynges ſay know haue ſcripture vnlocked opened thee ſo thou wilt go read thou canſt vnderſtād theſe thinges ignoraūt haue scripture locked vp ſo ye thou readeſt blinder thou art contrarietie thou findeſt tāgled art thou principle ſcripture perfectly learned • y• reſt eaſie therin canſt thou adde gloſe one place ſerue therfore becauſe neuer taught profeſſion baptiſme remaine alwayes vnlearned well ſpiritualtie great clergy high ſcholes ſay lay people becauſe lay vnlearned people taught theſe firſt principle profeſſiō therfore read ſcripture vnderſtand delite therin gret pillers holy church haue nailed vaile falſe gloſes moſes face corrupt true vnderſtanding law come therfore barke ſay yt ſcripture maketh heretickes poſſible vnderſtand engliſh becauſe thē ſelues latin pure malice cā haue ſlea brother faith haue ſauiour therwt vtter bloudy woluiſh tyrāny within whoſe diſciples herewith reader cōmitted vnto grace ſauiour ieſus vnto whō god father thorough hym prayſe euer euer amen expoſition firſt epiſtle iohn ſet forth william tyndall yeare lord 1531 septemb except man haue profeſsion baptiſme hart vnderſtand scripture ¶ prologue man meanes read except firſt taught letter croſſerowwe muſt firſt learne profeſſion baptiſme euen ſo vnpoſſible man whatſoeuer degree name bee vnderſtande ought scripture vnto honour god health ſoule except firſt taught profeſſion baptiſme haue alſo written hart profeſſion ſtandeth ij thinges profeſſion baptiſme one knowledge god vnderſtanding ſpiritually chriſt expoundeth math v vj vij ſo roote life lawes loue thy lord god thyne hart thy ſoule thy might thy neighbour thy ſelfe ſake loue onely fulfilling law paule teacheth whatſoeuer deed loue ſame fulfilleth law ſight god know promiſes goſpell mercy sauiour chriſt vnderſtanding alſo purely without leuen mercifulleſt faſhiō scripture ſoundeth al fatherly loue kindenes god vnto repent toward law beleue chriſt haue profeſſion written thyne hart cōſent vnto law righteous good loue thyne hart ſubmit thy ſelfe thereunto learne rule ſquare al thy deedes therby thē beleue chriſt ſinnes ieſu chriſtes ſake hys death paſſion clearely forgeuen ſake thy ſinnes thou diddeſt knowledge profeſſion forgeeuen thee clearly poena culpa vſe pope termes none ſatiſfaction godwarde chriſtes bloud euen ſo ſinne knowledge eyther chaunce ignoraunce infirmitie negligence prouoked ouercome fleſh forgeuen v like wiſe poena culpa repentaunce fayth chriſt without ſatiſfaction workes godwarde notwithſtanding ſonnes one god ſeruauntes one chriſt muſt agree among ſelues hath offended muſt meekly knowledge fault euery chriſten man muſt reconcile himſelfe vnto brother offer himſelf make amendes vnto vtmoſt poure haue wherewith aſke forgeueneſſe chriſts ſake bound forgeue neither reconſiling himſelf vnto brother may man firſt receiued vnto profeſſion chriſtes fayth continue therin receaued againe open offence put thereout man loue neighbour well himſelf ſory hath hurt except ſhould offer himſelf make amendes muſt henceforth walke right penaunce repentaunce ſinne amendemēt lyfe life penaunce ye haue ſo called doctrine chriſt euery man tame fleſh prayer faſting continuall meditation chriſtes penaunce paſſions v holy ſaintes ſuch abſtinence kinde liuing euery man thincketh moſt meete lyfe muſt tend ende came fleſh ſerue neighbour cōplexion yonger confeſſing infirmity elder diſcreter better learned aſking aduiſe holeſome counſell repreſſing diſeaſes tame fleſhe ſerue thy neighbour without ſuperſtious minde godward ſatiſfactiō fayth chriſtes bloud repentaūt hart onely ſatiſfaction cā make towarde god ſaue fayth chriſtes bloud repenting hart outwarde deedes referred vnto god ſeruice owne perſon helpe make better therewith wyth neuer ſo perfect done loue ſatiſfie law preſente time dutie vnto neighbour tame owne fleſh make ſatiſfaction god ſinne paſt ſinne committed muſt god forgeue freely fatherly loue chriſtes ſake god viſiteth v ſicknes pouertie whatſoeuer aduerſitie doth tyrannous minde ſatiſfy luſt ſuffering euyll make ſatiſfaction ſinne paſt repent ſory fatherly loue make father loue correcteth child v know ſelues feele mercy tame fleſh keepe v ſinning againe naturall father puniſheth child becauſe delighteth tormenting take ſatiſfactiō ſinne paſt firſt teacheth kindly ſuffreth forgeueth twiſe laſt ſeeth body ſo wanton childe continue right way rage wild luſtes beateth ſubdue fleſhe onely tame doctrine y• father may haue due courſe hart childe ſhoulde choked luſtes euen ſo god child god louyng father careth v gētlye correcteth v keepe v right way haue profeſſed law thē faith sauiour bee negligent tame hys fleſh prayer faſting good dedes doctrine chriſt wil ſurely ſcourge bring right way agayne keepe doctrine ſoules health periſh taketh mercy v thinketh ſinne paſt repent full conuerted ablolueth v poena culpa chriſtes ſake mighty mercyfull chriſtes ſake pope money beſides hath promiſed mercyfully ſo ¶ knowledge baptiſme key light scripture againe knoweth letter well ſpell perfectly read diligent hee whiche hath cleare eye without impediment let vnderſtand baptiſme vnderſtād law goſpell walketh therto light open day ſee attende take heede euen ſo ſo euer hath profeſſion baptiſme written hart vnderſtand ſcripture exerciſe ſelfe therein compare one place marke maner ſpeach aſke meaning ſentence better exerciſed doctrine ſhould key light scripture taught baptized lack age deferred vnto yeares diſcretion key bindeth looſeth locketh vnlocketh conſcience ſinners euen ſo leſſon vnderſtād onely key openeth ye ſcripture euen whole ſcripture ſelfe gathered together narrow compaſſe brought compendiouſnes til thou taught leſſon thine hart feele ſweetneſſe scripture locked ſhut vp thee ſo darke thou couldeſt vnderſtande though peter paule chriſt himſelfe expound vnto thee blinde man ſee though thou ſet candle ſhewedſt sunne poyntedſt thy finger vnto thou wouldeſt haue looke vppon baptized ala howe scripture locked vp ou • vnderſtandyng one hyeſt loweſt euer taught profeſſion meaning thereof therfore remayne blinde generally well great rabines hye learning ſeeme haue lay people yea ſo much blind great clerkes lay people great number caught naught al wrong taught doctrine baptiſme corrupt vnto l • uen falſe gloſes ere come read ſcripture light bring vnderſtand ſcripture withall vtter darkneſſe contrary vnto ſcripture deuill vnto chriſt reaſon wherof scripture locked vp become ſo darke vnto grope dore finde way become maze vnto wander nuſt ſay led robin goodfellow come right way though turne cappes brightnes thereof hath blinded eye malice ſo though beleue scripture falſe yet taught god wander • leane way perſecute right vnderſtanding therof beleeue true playne ſenſe ſpeaketh becomme tu • nagaine lane vnto goe thorough make iij line agree together finally ſentences scripture nothing riddle vnto thē • caſt blind man doth crow expound geſſe hundred doctoures hundred wayes one man xx ſermons alleadging one texte xx faſhions hauing ſure doctrine cleaue vnto lacke righte knowledge profeſſion oure baptiſme ¶ hath profeſsion baptiſme written hart hereticke concluſion euer creepeth long grounde neuer clymeth fall hygh euen ſo man hath profeſſion vnderſtandeth profeſſiō baptiſme hereticke baptiſme written hart ſtomble scripture fall vnto hereſies become maker diuiſion ſettes defender wilde vayne opinion whole onely cauſe hereſies ſectes pride law god truly interpreted robbeth whoſe harte written maketh bare iob thyngs wherof man moued pride ſide haue vtterly forſaken ſelues hyghe learnyng wiſedome become ſeruauntes chriſt onely whiche hath bought scripture teacheth low lynes hateth prid▪ thē bloud haue promiſed harte vnfaynedly folow hym take onely author religiō doctrine onely wiſedome learning mainteine word deede keepe pure builde ſtraunge doctrine therupon hygheſt neuer felow brother felowſhyp scripture maketh heretikes waxe euer lawer lower euery day ſeruaunt vnto weaker brother example image chriſt commaundemēt ordinaunce fayned wordes pope hee ſayd becauſe ſay scripture maketh men heretickes corrupteth falſe opinion contrarie vnto profeſſiō baptiſme light wherewith ſhould expounde scripture turned darkenes harte doore scripture locked welles ſtopped vp yer come therfore becauſe darknes cōprehend light scripture writtē iohn light ſhyned darknes god lighten harte read scripture vayne darknes could comprehēd turne blynd ridles read without vnderſtandyng lay men lady mattines marlynes prophecy euer myndes vppon hereſies come place ſoū deth like reſt wring wonderfull expoſitions ſtabliſhe hereſies tale boy would fayne haue eaten paſtie lampreſe durſt vnto belle ſang vnto sit downe iacke boy eate lamprey ſtabliſhe waueryng conſcience withall great blyndnes ſay begynning together whole ſcripture falſe litterall ſence killeth ſoule whiche peſtilent hereſie proue abuſe text paule ſaying letter killeth becauſe text become ridle vnto vnderſtode law condemneth driue v faith chriſtes death paule word letter vnderſtode law giuen moyſes condēne conſciences rob righteouſnes compell vnto promiſes mercy chriſt hereſie ſpringeth scripture darknes sunne darke cloude ſpringeth blynde harte hypocrite couereth face hereſy ſpringeth hart hypocrite scripture blyndeth eye behold bright beames scripture whole ſumme together harte taught appoyntment made betwene god v chriſtes bloud whē baptiſed kay open scripture light ſee perceiue true meaning scripture ſhould eaſie vnderſtand becauſe taught profeſſiō cauſe scripture ſo darke ſo farre paſſyng capacitie cauſe expoſitions hereſies becauſe wrong taught corrupt wt falſe opiniōs hand made heretickes yer come scripture haue corrupt v taſt ſicke maketh holeſome well ſeaſoned meate bitter ſoūd faith ſhal eaſely attaine true ſēce ſcripture weriſh vnſauery neuertheles yet scripture abydeth pure ſelfe bright ſo ſounde faith ſhall perceiue iudgemēt hereticke corrupt expoſitions whole man doth feele euen ſmelling meate taſt ſicke infected scripture ſhal euer improue hereſies falſe expoſitions scripture purgeth ſelfe euen water yeare caſteth filthynes vnto ſides true ye ſee authoritie paule 2 timo 3 ſaying scripture giuen god inſpiration good teach improue ſo foorth example chriſt apoſtles confounded iewes ſame scripture whiche corrupt vnderſtode amiſſe darknes ye ſee example v alſo haue manifeſtly improued hypocrite hū dre h textes corrupt proue falſe opinion brought beſides scripture haue driuē fled openly confeſſe vnto ſhame haue scripture ſing ſong ſay receaued mouth apoſtles ʋnto whiche ſtopping oyſter aunſwere groſly ſeyng papiſts vnwritten berities credited aunſwered foole would truſt tell money abſent hath pyked purſe face euen ſo ſithe ye haue corrupt open scripture eye takē maner ye cā denie madde beleue hath lyen xv c yeares ye ſay rottē mawes ſhould holeſome v ye haue chewed mingled poyſon ſpetel ye beare v hand perſwade v thinke ye ſophiſtry beleue ye ſhould miniſter ſecrete tradition without grounde truly ſee miniſter open scripture falſly ye bewyche wittes poetry beleue ye ſhould miniſter ſecret tradition profite wee ſee corrupt open scripture loſſe ſoules profite nay hundreth tymes likely y• ye ſhould falſe ſecret thing thē open therefore sacramentes whiche scripture teſtifieth chriſt ſelfe ordeined muſt haue eye vnto hand ye miniſter papiſt 〈…〉 haue corrupted ſcriptures abuſed ſacramentes wee reſtore scripture vnto right vnderſtandyng falſe gloſes euen ſo deliuer sacramentes ceremony vnto right vſe abuſe muſt scripture corrupt mā commeth therto meke ſprite ſekyng onely faſhion ſelfe lyke chriſt accordyng profeſſion vowe baptiſme contrarywiſe hee ſhall finde myghtie power god alter hym chaunge hym inner man litle litle proceſſe vntill full ſhappen image sauiour knowledge loue truth power worke therafter finally much scripture light life god elect mightie power wherewith god createth thē ſcripture life god elect ſhapeth ſimilitude likenes faſhion chriſt therfore ſuſtenaunce comfort ſtrength courage may ſtād faſt endure meryly beare ſoules health wherewith luſtes fleſh ſubdued killed ſpirite mollified made ſoft receiue print image sauiour ieſu much scripture ſo pure ſelfe cā corrupt man wicked onely infect hand yer come corrupt hereſies bryng much complaynt hypocrite scripture maketh heretickes vayne fayned reaſons wherewith would hypocrite ſay ſcripture maketh heretiques proue laye people ought read scripture falſe wicked frute roten tree therefore faythfull ſeruauntes chriſt faythfull miniſters diſpēſers doctrine true harted toward brother haue giuen ſelues vp hand god put ſelues ieoperdy al perſecutiō lyfe deſpiſed haue tranſlated scripture purely good conſciēce ſubmittyng ſelues deſiryng amend trāſlation pleaſe thē trāſlate themſelues beſt maner yea let ſow gloſes many thinke make cleaue thereto put men tranſlation way tranſlation ſcripture ſufficiēt onely muſt well taught people may haue true ſēce howbeit though god hath ſo wrought great part tranſlated yet inough father mother haue begotten child brought world except care bryng vp till helpe ſelfe euen ſo inough haue tranſlated though ye whole scripture vulgare common toung except alſo brought agayne light vnderſtād expell darke cloude hypocrite haue ſpread ouer face ye ſcripture blind right ſenſe true meanyng thereof introduction made bring true vnderſtanding ſcripture therfore diuers introduction ordeyned teach profeſſiō baptiſme onely light scripture one vppon epiſtle paule romains called pathway scripture ſame cauſe haue taken hand interpret epiſtle iohn euangeliſt edifie lay mā teach read scripture ſeke therein may haue aunſwere hypocrite ſtop theyr mouthes firſt vnderſtand epiſtles apoſtles wrote goſpell chriſt though goſpell bee epiſtle called goſpell ſay glad tydinges becauſe open preachyng chriſt epiſtle becauſe ſent letter bill abſent ¶ begynneth firſt epiſtle iohn chapter 1 begynnynge declare 〈◊〉 ▪ ioh 1 wee vnto haue heard haue ſeene eye looked vppon handes haue handled worde lyfe lyfe appeared haue ſene beare witneſſe ſhewe vnto euerlaſtynge lyfe father appeared vnto v iohn ſayth thyng iohn witneſſeth chriſt god begynnyng euerlaſtyng lyfe father witneſſeth chriſt god doth begynnyng goſpel ſaying word thyng begynnyng thyng god thyng god thinges made whē ſayth heard ſaw eye hand handled chriſt man hym teſtifieth chriſt man alſo doth begynning goſpell ſaying word thyng made fleſh became man thus haue playne opē wordes manifeſt article fayth sauiour chriſt god man article ſoeuer onely beleueth chriſt ſonne god alſo man hath euerlaſting life beleueth alſo beleueth ſame ſonne god hath euerlaſting lyfe ſhall neuer come condemnation written iohn gaue power ſonnes god beleued name iohn iij beleueth ſonne hath euerlaſtyng life litle ſayd chapter beleueth hym ſhall condēned beleue wordes article yt eatyng chriſtes fleſh drinkyng bloud ſpoken iohn vj word ſpeake ſpirite lyfe fleſh profiteth meanyng ye fleſhly eatyng body fleſhly drinkyng beleue chriſt hys bloud therefore great difference betwene beleuing god chriſt god mā beleue god chriſt god man promiſes mercy hym firſt cō mune good bad vnto deuils thereto called fayth beleue hyſtory ſecōd proper vnto ſonnes god lyfe written righteous liueth beleue chriſt god man put truſt hope confidēce fayth puttyng hys truſt confidēce whole hope goodnes mercy helpe god aduerſities bodely ghoſtly temptation euen ſinne hell depe ſo euer fallen therin feeleth hys diſeaſe long health euen ſo impoſſible man beleue chriſts bloud except moſes haue hym firſt cure law haue moſes robbed hym righteouſnes cōdemned vnto euerlaſtyng death haue ſhewed hym vnder dānation birth adā deedes appeare neuer ſo holy yet damnable ſinne becauſe cā referre nothyng vnto glory god ſeke thē ſelues theyr owne profite honour glory repentaunce toward law muſt go belefe repenteth cōſenteth vnto life ſinne hath part fayth iohn calleth chriſt euerlaſtyng life father hee ſignifieth chriſt lyfe epiſtle firſt alſo goſpel ſaying chriſt life lyfe vntill receaue lyfe chriſt fayth dead dead ſaith iohn iij beleueth ſonne ſee lyfe wrath god abydeth vppon wrath heyres byrth ſayth paule ephe ij whiche nature child wrath wrath ignoraunt vntil law publiſhed walke quyetly luſtes loue god wickedly ſhould content therwith mainteine v therin cōtrary vnto godly righteous nature aſſoone lawe whoſe nature vtter ſinne rom iij ſet man variaunce god preached thē firſt awake dreame ſee law cōdemneth v damnatiō haue law ſo contrary vnto nature grudge agaynſt god therto young child agaynſt elder firſt commaūde count god cruell tyraūt becauſe law cōdemneth v thyng loue loue fulfill chriſt preached chriſt god ſake receiueth v mercy forgiueth v paſt hencefoorth rekeneth vnto v corrupt poyſoned nature taketh v ſonnes putteth v vnder grace mercy promiſeth iudge v rigorouſnes law nourture v mercy patiēce father moſt mercyful onely ſubmit ſubmit ſelues chriſt knowledge weakenes great mercy receaue v ſelues vnto doctrine learne kepe lawes yea therto conſider mekenes ſoeuer chaunceth neuer taketh away hys mercy till caſt yoke profeſſion firſt runne away vtter defiaunce neuer come ſchole ſtubburne hard harte mollifie waxe ſoft confidēce hope haue chriſt kindnes go god boldly vnto father receaue life ſay loue vnto god vnto law alſo whiche haue ſeene heard declare vnto ye may haue felowſhyppe v felowſhyppe may father ſonne ieſus chriſt theſe thynges write vnto ioye may full bryng vnto felowſhyp touch ſtone true doctrine preacher god chriſt beleue chriſt finall intent scripture giuen god vnto man onely thyng true preacher ſeke wherby ye ſhall euer know diſcerne true word god falſe counterfayted doctrine vayne tradition true preacher wylie hypocrite preache vnto ſayth iohn yt euerlaſtyng lyfe haue heard hearyng receaued fayth ſure draw v felowſhyp ye haue damned deuils ſinnefull luſtes ignoraunce god ſeeke ſayth paul ij cor xij loue modeſt charitable maner paules doctrine ſelues god therfore wold haue felowes equall v build vpon foundation layd apoſtles prophetes chriſt▪ ieſus make houſhold god euer ye felowes brother coupled together one ſpirit one fayth one hope might haue felowſhip thereby god become ſonnes heyres ieſus chriſt beyng brother coheyres make ioy ful glad tydinges aungell ſayd vnto ſhepheardes luke ij behold ſhew great ioye ſhalbe vnto people sauiour borne vnto day whiche chriſt lord theſe tydinges bryng worde god onely receaued ſpirit mouth ſonne true meſſengers preach ſelues chriſt paule preached chriſt hym ſelfe lord v ſeruauntes hys ſake loue ſelues ſeke vnto v wile robbed ye haue ſhould exalte ſelues ouer ſeparate ſelues frō make ſelues ſeuerall kyngdome free frāke raygnyng ouer heathen tyrauntes holdyng bondage ſerue lucre luſtes tanglyng conſcience doctrine man whiche draweth god chriſt fearing bugge excommunication agaynſte god word ſerued ſhakyng ſword tydinges whiche haue heard hym declare vnto god lyght hym darknes ſay haue felowſhyp hym yet walke darkenes lye truth walke light light haue felowſhyp together bloud chriſt ſonne clenſeth v ſinne deuill darknes lye ſo god light truth onely god light ſo deuill darkenes darknes falſhead conſentyng wickednes hym brightnes light word doctrine c xix pſalme ſayth thy worde lanterne vnto feete light pathes chriſte light lightneth men apoſtles called light world becauſe doctrine knowe truth light ye darkenes ſayth paule epheſ v light lord walke therfore child good workes frutes lyght lyght good workes called frutes light lyue ignoraūce called darknes ſayth afterward hateth brother walketh darknes light glorious goſpell chriſte dyd ſhyne hart could hate brother walking vnderſtande conſenting working walkyng darknes light walke darcknes conſent worke wickednes ſay haue felowſhip god ly haue felowſhip knowe conſent profeſſe doctrine harte commaundementes god bee written harte member practiſe thē ſhew fruite whether light darknes hart appeare yt walking though member neuer ſo dead vnto vertue yet ſoules knowledge truth conſent vnto righteouſnes haue ſprite life v paule ſayth rom viij ſpirite yt wee haue ſpirite god v rayſe v vp ieſus chriſt rayſed vp ieſus death thē wil yt raiſed vp ieſus frō death quicken mortall body reaſō ſpirit dwelleth poſſible knoweth truth conſenteth thereto continue ſinne finally haue light hart walke therein haue fellowſhip god ſonnes heires purged ſinne chriſtes bloud ſay haue ſinne deceaue ſelues trueth v think ſinne v hee ſayth hee hath ſinne deceaueth ſelfe beguiled blinde light god word v eyther folow ſinne beaſtes without conſciēce ſee groſſe ſinnes murther theft adultery yet haue hanged vayle falſe gloſes vpon moſes face ſee brightnes law requireth v pure hart god great loue vnto neighbour ſauiour ieſus ceaſeth condemne v ſinners knowledge ſinnes faythfull iuſt forgeeue v ſinnes clenſe v vnrigh teouſnes confeſſe ſinnes confeſſe ſinnes god true fayth repentaunce forgeue v preiſtes eare though tradition reſtored vnto right vſe dā nable harte god true repentaunce faſt beleife faythfull forgeue purge v becauſe mercifull truth promiſe promiſed abraham ſeede worlde ſhould bleſſed curſe ſinne hath ſinners wee ſinners yea el chriſt dyed vayne salomon ſayth 3 reg 8 man ſinneth agaynſt god paule proueth authoritie scripture vnto romaine ſinners without exception ſcripture witneſſeth damnable ſinners nature ſinne corrupt poyſoned nature though begō healed yet neuer whole vntil houre death cauſe beſt fruites growe weedes among neither deed ſo perfect could amended blind bungler wondreth glorious woorkes cunning workeman yt hath cleare iudgement perceaueth vnpoſſible make woorke coulde bee nothing ſo well done may amēded made better law requireth workes v higheſt degree perfection faith ſayth workes although commaundeth v diligently worke deſpiſeth none faith chriſt accompted v righteouſnes god commaūdeth faith ſaith hee rekened hym hys righteouſnes confirmyng ſaying teſtimonie prophet dauid 32 pſalme ſaying bleſſed man vnto whō god imputeth rekeneth ſinne ſay man although ſinner yet god layeth charge faithes ſake xi hee ſayth come grace cōmeth work grace grace worſhyp ſpirite therefore whoſoeuer woorſhyppeth god workes referreth woorkes god ſacrifice vnto hym appeaſe god ſpirite muſt worſhipped yt ſpirite hym though hee delited worke woorkes ſake ſame maketh god image idoll image ſeruer wicked idolater euer blynd heathen ſerueth god imagination owne hart abhominable vnto god thou ſeeſt many place god defieth ſacrifice child iſraell ſayd imagination whoſoeuer ſuppoſeth candle ſtickyng image puttyng peny boxe popiſh workes goyng pilgrimage faſtyng wolward goyng barefoote goyng crowchyng knelyng paine taking ſacrifice vnto god though delited geſtures iack nape blind hee gropeth way none god worſhyp loue hym hys mercy loue beſtow al work god worſhip vpon neighbour ſake vpon tamyng fleſh ſinne agayne ſhould chiefeſt care chriſten man whyle chriſt careth paſt cōmitted already whether profeſſion condition peace made betwen god v chriſtes bloud theſe law ſet v vnto whiche conſent ſubmit ſelues ſcholers thereof onely foreſinnes forgiuen poena culpa holy father licence euer alſo infirmity weaknes proneſſe readynes motion vnto ſinne pardoned taken aworth tranſlated frō vnder damnation law damneth well thoſe infirmity ſinne ſpringeth putteth v vnder grace rom 7 ſhall henceforth long forſake profeſſiō iudged rigorouſnes law chaſtiſed amiſe child vnder law god chriſt pardon god doth pardon forgeue ſinnes whatſoeuer chriſtes ſake infirmity reaſō cannot eſcape ſhal thē ſinne foloweth muſt likewiſe pardon actuall ſinne whiche compelled thoſe infirmity ſpite harte agaynſt ſpirite thou pardon ſickneſſe ſicke muſt thou pardō deed doth • eueth vndone reaſon ſickneſſe madnes mad man pardoned vnder law murther madneſſe may ſlayne agayne child within certaine age vnder law flayeth theues ye right hang though ſteale popiſhe pardoning thys doth paule rom 7 ſo confirme world cannot quitch againſt ſaying conſent vnto law god good fayne would yet haue alwayes power ſo find thing fleſh rehelling agaynſt minde leading captine ſinne ſo cannot wold doe compelled doe would ſayth woulde ſinne dwelleth doth ſayth ſhall deliuer body deathe bound priſoner agaynſt thankes god ſaith chriſtes victory ieſus chriſt lorde hath conquered ouercome ſinne death hell hath put damnation law way vnto profeſſe law beleue vnder lawe learne faſſhion deedes like vnder damnation lawe ſhoulde damned though deedes perfect law requireth though frailty time breake child vnder law ſteale vnder damnation though ſteale graffed chriſt follow hys doctrine vnder law learne onely deliuered feare euerlaſting death hell threatenings law yt people cuſtome became law biſhops little little gat whole handes biſhops ſawe got ſimple people vnder pope hys ſhauelyngs haue abuſed penaunce ſuch humble obedience beganne ſet vp creſtes raigne ouer prince enioyne ſore penaunce ſmall trifle namely ought done agaynſte pleaſure beate ſome ſore ſpared ſolde penaunce ritch ouerladed poore vntill tyranny waxed ſo grenous people woulde beare holy father rome rather vſurped rome violence geuen prerogatiue ſell whome would purgatorye ſacrament penaunce de •… nition penaunce made papiſtes thus deſcribe contrition confeſſion satiſfaction contrition ſorow thy ſinnes confeſſion god whome thou haſt offended tell thy ſinnes prieſtes eare satiſfaction certaine deedes enioyned buy thy ſinnes theyr deſcription haue cleane excluded fayth ſatiſfaction chriſtes bloud onely bringeth life ſpirite life righteouſnes without impoſſible pleaſe god heb 11 whoſe ſtead haue put fayth chiefeſt part penaunce preſumption owne work lacke truſt chriſtes bloud contrition fruitleſſe ſorrow yt reſpect hell maketh v hate law ſtill conſequently god made true contrition annexed fayth ſorrow reſpect law vnto conſent good loue therfore mourne partly becauſe haue offended partly becauſe lacke power fulfill would theſe thynges true prelate know open hyſtories well whē noone sunne flat south deliteth reſiſt holy ghoſt perſecute preacher thynges whiche well loued knowe true would preache ſame ſelues lyue therafter hereof ye may ſee woorkes tame workes make ſatiſfaction onely faith chriſtes bloud fleſh onely ſatiſfactiō god except make image ſelues image ſeruaunts hereof ye may ſee open penaunce came eare cōfeſſion ſatiſfaction workes purgatorie pardon put ſatiſfaction chriſtes bloud yt way compelled cōfeſſe open ſinnes take open penaunce euē ſo compelled confeſſe ſecrete ſinnes take ſecret penaūce made marchaūdiſe open penaūce ſo ſecret thē practiſe marcheūdiſe pope clergy would receaue ſuch pardon fayned purgatory receaued fayned pardō turnyng bindyng loſing preaching god word vnto byeng ſellyng ſinne money ſince tyme hetherto worſe people better prelate cō tent euer reſiſtyng ſhould made better bleſſed couetouſnes proude deſire honour falſe preſumption vowes religion workes ſpranke wicked vowes religion vow make ſatiſfaction ſinne hygher heauen ſtede lyfe penaunce chriſt taught v goſpell tame fleſh crucifie member henceforth ſhuld walke wayes god law ſinne ſpeake worſhyppyng worſhyppyng saintes saintes praying vnto make aduocates well nye aboue chriſt together though require long diſputation yet bright day know ye truth faſtyng euens kepyng holy dayes going bare foote ſtickyng vp cādels bright day worſhypping obtaine fauour giuyng ſo coſtly iewels offeryng box clothyng image pope clergy ſetteth vp idolatry ſhooyng ſiluer ſhoes ouche chriſtall myddes ſtroke lippes eye ignoraūt man would ſtroke yolig childrens heades entice bryng rocke ſlepe ignoraunce like ſeruice playne idolatrie cōmaundement heare iſraell lord thy god one god god hebrew called el elohim plurall nū ber ſtrength might cō maundement heare iſraell harken voyce god mighty power helpe v thy power might thy ſworde ſhield one none might helpe hurt ſaue one whiche together thyne thy commaundemēt thou wilt heare bi voyce might world borowed hym lend might agaynſt contrary promiſes keepe therfore commaundementes ſhall kepe thee thou haue broken haue lent power agaynſt thee repent come agayne vnto thy profeſſion returne agayne vnto mercy fetch power home agayne lent vexe thee becauſe thou forſookeſt hym brakeſt commaundementes feare creature falſe feare ye cauſe idolatrie moreouer baptiſed chriſt haue profeſſed good euil auenge ſelues muſt good euill many v come vnto ſuch perfection prouoked temptation deſire vengeaunce haue compaſſion mekely pray ſlay v wicked thyng popiſh imaginatio •• thinke saintes plague v becauſe thē ſuch ſuperſtitious honour whiche diſhonour ſhame verely popiſh imagination euē deſcribe saintes nature prelate meeke lowly till would loft play tormentours honour whatſoeuer commaunde earneſtly whiche god ſelfe hath commaunded feare aboue god hym ſelfe ſelfe king raigneth hath receaued power prayed himſelfe whenſoeuer elect cal ought name ſēdeth help euē yt power hath receaued yea ere aſke ſendeth ſpirit hart moue aſke gift deſire ought name grace ſtate grace doctours haue doctrine know man ſtate grace wherfore manifeſt kepe god cōmaūdementes ſtate grace vngratiouſnes doctours know whether ſtate grace doctours kepe men cōmaūdements ergo mēs commaundemētes certifie ſtate grace though thou haue deuotion ſticke vp candle poſt ſo forth yet thou canſt neuer ſure thereby thou art good neighbour may aſſured ſtate grace fauour god come euen ſo many antichriſtes come already whereby know laſt houre went v none v bene v continued v fortuned might appeare v houre taken tyme houre laſt houre much ſay laſt tyme though apoſtles might wonderfull kyndes hypocriſie ſay falſhead cloked vnder contrary pretence teſtifieth paule alſo peter whiche antichriſt began antichriſt apoſtles ſue doctrine among doctrine apoſtles preachyng many thynges apoſtles dyd addyng euer ſomwhat owne weed might euer grow vp together corne iohn gathered ſigne laſt day drew nye though could ſure long therto antichriſt one firſt ſeeth light commeth preacheth chriſt ſeeketh glory chriſtes goſpell worldings loue goſpell ſo longes bryngeth gayne hee e • pyeth glory cleane vnto preachyng thē getteth cōtrary partie profeſſeth hym ſelfe open enemy hee diſguiſe ſelfe hide angle poyſoned hereſie vnder bayte true doctrine apoſtles cleare eyed eſpied antichriſt put hym flight weeded doctrine quickly whē charitie waxed cold preacher began ſeke ſelues admit glory honour rich antichriſt diſguiſed papiſtes poudred doctrine chriſt wt theyr dregge • ſelfe faſhion true apoſtle preached chriſt wylyly bryngyng tradition darkē doctrine chriſt ſet vp innumerable ceremony sacramentes imagerie giuyng ſignifications firſt laſt ſignifications layd part preached worke holy deede iuſtifie put away ſinne ſaue ſoule men ſhould put truſt woorkes agayne falſhead diſcloſed ſlayne ſpirite antichriſt hath bene long among v mouth chriſt old doctrine proceded chriſtes mouth paule ſayth whē antichriſt vttered thē commeth end ye haue anoyntyng holy knowe thyng write vnto though ye knewe truth vnto know lye truth chriſt scripture called chriſt onely called holy holy becauſe onely ſanctifieth haloweth v called chriſt ſay annoynted becauſe preacher yet make hys preachyng ſpryng hart ſower make corne grow ſay man ſhall receaue ſoweth word onely committeth growyng god whoſe ſpirite bretheth hee liſteth maketh grounde whoſe hart luſteth fruteful chooſeth pleaſure cauſe knowen vnto man lyer denyeth ieſus chriſt ſame antichriſt denyeth father ſonne aſmuch antichriſt chriſt antichriſt two contrary ſtudy antichriſt quēch name chriſt pope ſectes antichriſt preach chriſt ſay agayne thee pelagius whoſe doctrine pope defendeth hygheſt degree antichriſt heretickes ʋerely syr pope ſeketh hym ſelfe heretickes dyd abuſeth name chriſt gather offeringes tithe rētes name beſtow vnto owne honour chriſtes pope captiuateth vnderſtandyng mē ſuperſtitious rite ceremony bryng conſcience people captiuitie vnder hym ſuperſtitious feare though ſuch authoritie giuen hym chriſt euery ſillable hath ſoūde though made purpoſe expoundeth falſly fleſhly therwith iuggleth bewitcheth eares people maketh owne poſſeſſion beleue hym luſteth though made matter whether hee preached true falſe ſo beleue biddeth textes ſhew dutie putteth way textes therto ſet conſciences libertie chriſt proue ſaluation chriſt onely pelagius hereſie pelagius hee preacheth iuſtifying workes whiche denying chriſt preacheth falſe bynding loſing eare confeſſion whiche truſt confidence chriſtes bloud ſhedyng preacheth falſe penaūce dedes tame fleſh ſinne make ſatiſfaction redeme ſinne paſt cā ſaue denying chriſt whiche onely redemption ſinne maketh workes ceremonyes wont ligne remembraunces thinges beleued done image ſeruice vnto god hys saintes whiche ſpirites purchaſe merites ſoeuer blynd ſoule imagineth whiche denying chriſt thou wilt receaue annoyntyng grace mercy whence ſaue hym longer chriſt vnto thee chriſt called ieſus sauiour ieſus chriſtus called chriſtus kyng annoynted ouer men muſt hold whoſe benefite muſt haue called emanuel god v emanuel onely maketh god god ſtrength power ſword ſhield ſhortly father called sanctus holy haloweth ſanctifieth sanctus bleſſeth natiōs theſe name euer name hypocriſie ſome time call thomas curteis churle call curate whiche thomas curteiſe churle care pariſhes wolfe flocke byſhops ouerſears ſo ouer ſee ſuffer nought proſperous ſaue owne cōmō wealth ſome call ſelues dead dead men liue voluptuouſnes ſome call ſelues poore without hauing poore mē thing proper yet lyue aboundance ſhaue diſguiſe ſelues garmentes ornamentes ſignifie euer contrary thyng nay chriſt hypocrite diſguiſed chriſt diſguiſed perſon playeth part play repreſenteth perſon ſtate alway name ſignifieth euer sauiour euer annyonteth grace euer maketh god v euer ſāctifieth neither ſaue ſanctifie frō ſinne annointe grace ſet god one men theſe thynges name ſignifie doth euer vnto haue truſt confidence bloud aſſone without certaintie litle child abide hym hee ſhall appeare may haue confidence bee made aſhamed hym hys commyng ij thinges marked muſt cleaue doctrine apoſtles one cleaue vnto chriſt doctrine apoſtles built v vpon ſhall bolde ſure ſelues comming ſeruaunt maiſters abſence doth onely maiſters commaū dements cannot confounded comming home againe folow men doctrine bold yea ſhould aſhamed teacher vnto whome thē ſhall ſay whē boaſt thē ſelues yt haue bene vicarsa fore ſaying hypocrite teacher falſe doctrine know depart ye haue wrought wickednes vnder name haue brought damnable ſectes haue taught thing ſcripture maketh mentiō reſurrectiō comming againe chriſt men go come ſhall receiue rewardes together cōmaunded looke euery houre day done ſoules frō departing body vnto day doth scripture make mentiō ſaue onley reſt ye lord faith muſt beleue reſurrectiō curious vnderſtand ſtate ſoules departed dowherfore determineth ought ſtate departed doth teach preſumptuous imagination owne braine neither doctrine article fayth god doth ſecreat layd vp treaſury god ought patient certefied ſcripture dye fayth reſt ought ſearch ſecret thē ſearch ye houre reſurrection whiche god hath put onely owne power remember whole nature mā poyſoned infected ſinne ye whole life ſinne muſt mortefied roote al ſinne firſt vice infect would wiſe god hath taught v ye ſee eue would haue ben god knowledge good bad therefore hath god hid many thinges power commaunded ſhall ſearch none ſecrets hath opened ſcripture mortefy poyſon poyſons deſire appeare wiſe aſhamed ignoraunt thing wherfore violently make member dead naturall luſt conſent cuſtome ſinne quickeneth purgeth holeſome penaunce chriſtes doctrine make ſerue law outward beare holeſome frute loue vnto profect neighbour according chriſtes loue theſe two pointes beleue ſūme god law chriſt loue thy neighbour theſe two poyntes interpretyng expoundyng lawes ſo whatſoeuer edifieth faith loue kept lōg ſo doth whatſoeuer hurteth faith loue bee broken immediatly though kyng emperour pope aūgell commaunde indifferent thynges neither helpe hurt fayth loue whole hand father mother maſter lord prince ſinne agaynſt god ouerlade backes may well chriſtes bloud onely thy ſoule ſaued lacke onely dāned howe loue breaketh law take loue breaketh law example good law mē come church sondayes heare god worde receaue sacrament body bloud chriſt remembraūce benefites ſo ſtrengthen thy ſoule walke loue loue neighbour ſake c yet father mother requireth helpe bee ſicke breake good commaundement dutie myne elder neighbour thus lawes vnder loue giue roome loue loue interpreteth yea breaketh time though god hymſelfe cōmaunde loue lord ouer al lawes ye know appeared take away ſinnes ſinne chriſt dyed alone purchaſſe pardon foreſinnes alſo ſ • ay ſinne life ſinne member baptiſed name chriſt ſayth paule rom 6 baptiſed dye hym baptiſed dye chriſt concernyng ſinne concernyng ſinne reſurrection dyeth ſo baptiſme ſhould walke new life ſinne mē bers crucified pertayneth vnto lyfe ſinne chriſt ſinne therbe wilfull ſinne fayth hym quicke member fayth grow hym euery man therefore hath true fayth chriſt purgeth hym ſelfe pure abyde ſinne al ſinne haue neither ſene knowen ſinne chriſt ſtocke ſo none ye quicke member lyue grow hym fayth giue ſelues ſinne haue neither ſene knowē felt fayth y• mercy hym holy father forbiddeth filthynes pope doctrine matrimonie giueth diſciples licence holy bleſſing kepe whore plurality vnions totquots robbe pariſhes hath neither ſene knowen chriſt haue diſciples conſent vnto iniquitie know cā truly deſcribe vnto v foloweth preachyng hypocriſie litle child let man beguile worketh righteouſnes righteous righteous iudge men deedes true fayth procedeth good workes whoſoeuer hath light god ſoule let rayle bleſſed bloud take ʋicares antichriſt ſinneth deuill deuill ſinneth begynneth cauſe appeared ſonne god euen deſtroy woorkes deuill borne god ſinne ſeede abideth ſinne becauſe borne god hereby ſonnes god knowen alſo ſonnes deuill god deuill two contrary father two contrary fountaines two contrary cauſes one goodnes euil euill borne deuill firſt euil byrth yer euil yer man euill outward purpoſe conceaued euill firſt man firſt euil mynde cōſented vnto ſo euil hart yer wrought euill yer conceiued euill hys hart borne deuil receaued ſeede nature reaſon nature ſeede byrth worketh euill naturally cā chriſt ſaith iohn 8 ye father deuill therefore luſtes father ſide good firſt borne god receaue mā firſt good nature ſeede reaſon nature ſeede firſt good yer good yt ſame rule chriſt cōtrary deuill came deſtroy workes deuill v giue v new byrth new nature ſow new ſeede v ſhould reaſō byrth ſinne ſeede byrth wete ſpirite god liuely ſeede word ſowen harte kepeth hart conſent ſinne ſeede deuill holdeth harte conſent good cōtrary vnto pope two pope doctrine poyntes one ſayth good deedes make v firſt good teacheth v beleue chriſtes bloud waſhed made firſt good ſayth god choſeth v firſt good qualites property enforcement good endeuour frewill good endeuour deuill poſſeſſeth whole hart conſent good finally great difference faythful vnfaithfull ſinne diuerſly betwene ſinne beleue chriſt vnfaynedly ſinne beleue beleue ſinne purpoſe cōſent wickedneſſe good caſtyng compaſſyng afore hand without grudge cōſcience bryng purpoſe ye ſee hypocrite haue vexed chriſtendome xx yeares bryng little luſt effect father conceiued miſchief viij hundreth yeares ago ſonnes conſent vnto ſame haue power depart therefrom therfore ſinne deuiliſhe vnder damnation law beleueth ſinne doth purpoſe conſenteth vnto life ſinne infirmitie chaūce ſome great temptation hath ouercome therefore ſinne veniall vnder mercy grace though murther theft adulterie vnder dānation law father ſhall ſcourge hym caſt hym away damne hym marke ſinne saule dauid saule euer excuſed ſinne could perſecute god dauid confeſſed ſinne great repentaūce firſt warnyng whenſoeuer forgot ſelfe worke righteouſnes god hee loueth brother tydinges ye heard begynnyg ſhould loue one cain deuill ſlew brother wherefore ſlew deedes euill hys brother righteous maruell brother thoughe worlde hate law righteouſnes loue one chriſt loued v hath law liuyng hart tyme bringeth forth frutes therof ſame god deuill whoſe byrth property ſame ye ſee deſcribed cain reſiſted god perſecuted childrē god belefe workes therof ye ſee cain brother abell ſo ſhall euer continue betwene child god deuill vnto worldes ende wonder therefore thoughe worlde hate know tranſlated death life becauſe loue brother loueth brother abydeth death hate theyr brother murtherers ye know murtherer hath eternall lyfe abydyng hym thou loue thy brother chriſt art ready ſuffer chriſt dyd thee thou art ſure thereby thou art ſonne god heyre life deliuered frō death damnation haue chriſten men ſignes know whether ſtate grace ſide hath power loue brother may ſure ſtate death damnation let euery man looke vpō hart ſure hateth brother hath ſlayne hym god murtherer murtherers ſhal obteine kingdome god gala 5 caines brother deuils child heyres death euer vnder damnation compare regiment ſpiritualtie haue temperall ſword handes aboue viij hundreth yeares vnto doctrine iohn iudge whether haue led v truely ſteppes chriſtes doctrine hereby aſſured loue becauſe hee left lyfe v therfore ought leaue lyues brother hath ſubſtaunce worlde ſeith brother haue neede ſhutteth vp compaſſion frō dwelleth loue god hym felt loue chriſtes death would ſure ſet hart fire loue hym agayne brother ſake ſhould neuer ceaſe ſ • ay reſiſting member vntill could onely wel content brother proſperous ſtate alſo vntill could bleſſe whe •• curſe v pray perſecute v ſuffer death thē teſtifie worde muſt recompence euill goodnes ſoules health vnto loue ouercome wynne vnto chriſt euery chriſten man ought haue rule profeſſion eye learne hee ſhould loue brother chriſt dyd hym depart lyfe brother example farre good ſcholers finde harte certefie harte fayth chriſt loue god neighbour ſake vnfayned true child hypocrite bold cōſcience god good • orkes declare good ſayth peter meaneth 2 pet 1 biddeth v miniſter fayth vertue godly liuing accuſe v ſinne tranſgreſſiō within hart god ſo feare rodde dare bolde draw backe ſtand aloo • e let childe haue neuer ſo mercifull father yet breake father cō maundementes though vnder damnatiō yet euer child rebuked laſſhed rod reaſon wherof neuer bold father preſence yt childe kepeth father commaū dements ſure himſelfe bolde father preſence ſpeake aſke miniſter well get good degree great confidēce fayth chriſt ieſu ſayth paule 1 tim 3 worketh bold god man hys conſcience accuſeth hym within neither haue wee ought wyte hym withall caſt teeth without ſight woorkes iacob apoſtle ſee thy fayth iaco 2 ſhalt thou euer ſure bold god man harte condemne v god greater hart knoweth thyng conſcience accuſe v ſinne god ſo great ſo mightie hid dearely beloued harte condemne v truſt godward whatſoeuer wee aſke ſhall receaue becauſe keepe commaundementes thynges whiche pleaſaunt ſight kepyng commaundementes maketh man ſee fayth bee bold therein fayth without conſcience ſinne goeth god boldly ſtrong mighty prayer coniure god hys mercyes therewith obtayneth ſoeuer hee aſketh promiſes text ſayth becauſe kepe commaundementes yea verely hys commaundemētes make v bold keepyng men tradition domine ceremony make v bold god certifie conſcience faith vnfayned thou ſhalt know ſprynkling thy ſelfe holy water kyſſing pax takyng aſſhes though thou annoynted oyle thames ſtrete thy fayth ſure thou couldeſt finde thyne hart beſtowe lyfe goodes vpon thy neighbour iuſt cauſe haſt proued art thou ſure thou loueſt chriſt feeleſt thou haſt thy truſt bloud commaundemēt wee beleue ſonne ieſus chriſt loue one another gaue commaundement fayth firſt alſo roote fayth roote commaundementes commaundementes fayth ſpryngeth loue loue workes breake commaundemēt ſinne agaynſt loue loued done ſinne agaynſt loue ſinne agaynſt fayth earneſtly full truſt remembred mercy chriſt hath ſhewed muſt haue loued wherefore haue broken commaundement way bee reſtored agayne thē go repētaunce vnto fayth agayne aſke mercy chriſtes ſake aſſoone haue receaued faith ſinne forgiuen wee ſhall immediatly loue commaundemēt agayne loue receaue power worke keepeth commaundemētes abideth hym hereby ioyned together ſeparated preſence one vttereth preſence whether ſoeuer thou firſt ſeeſt ſee fire ſure loue god loue neighbour ſeperable ſome thyng doth burne ſmell burnyng certified fire euen ſo loue god cauſe loue neighbour loue toward neighbour effect loue god theſe two loues euer inſeperable ſo whether ſoeuer feele firſt ſame certifieth iohn calleth loue mās neighbour deedes loue hebrue ſpeach helpe neede deede declareth man within neither loue god fayth ſene world ſaue thorough workes workes doth chriſt commaunde v iudge mā haue euill workes workes ſet forth 〈◊〉 declare faith continueth therin loueth god knoweth god though call hym ſelfe maſter doctour god vicare neither vnderſtandeth god word high diuinitie hys preachyng hypocrite falſe prophet lyer though hys preachyng pleaſe world neuer ſo well neuertheleſſe man certified loueth god yer come worke teſtimonie ſpirite giuē earneſt ſpirite ſayth paule rom viij teſtifieth vnto ſpirite ſonnes god teſtifieth beleue god thorough fayth ſonnes certifieth loue god fayth loue inſeparable ſpirite thorough fayth certifieth conſcience ſinnes forgiuē receaued vnder grace made ſonne god beloued god thē naturally myne hart breaketh loue god agayne ſeke vtter loue god ſome pleaſure becauſe neither ſeruice pleaſure vnto owne perſon neighbour ſet god ſeruice pleaſure chriſt becauſe brother bought chriſts doe good neighbour god good ſeruice bloud conſent vnto law loue yer come dede long dede whē loue neighbour deede accordyng law ſure loue hym truly el examined loue law might deceaued ſome loue neighbour pleaſure profite glorie doyng ſeruice onely ſpiritualtie loue v bleſſed loue buſie cure keepe v darkenes loue ſigne man hateth god hys neighbour therto loueth ſelfe onely god law ſhould abſteine myne owne pleaſure profite three witneſſes chriſt three witneſſes water bloud ſpirite ordeined sacrament baptiſme hys witneſſe vnto v ordeined sacramēt bloud witnes vnto v powreth ſpirite hart teſtifie make feele teſtimonie thoſe two sacramēts true teſtimonie theſe three foloweth haue euerlaſtyng life ſonne god theſe iij one full witnes ſufficiēt moſt law requireth whiche ſayth ij iij moſt one full ſufficient witnes godward chriſts name falſe fayth thine owne fayning saint whiteward thine imageſeruice ſeruyng cheeſe though ſhe bodely thyng like diſputatiō ſaintes worſhip saintes imageſeruice obtaine temporal thinges euen ſo worſhip god iewes turned ſacrifices vnto imageſeruice whiche giuen thē god ſignes moue ſerue god ſpirite euen maſſe pope vſeth damnable idolatrie ſo haue sacramentes exāple let v quickly paule caſt corinthian kept father wife warned would amend el ſuffer greuous ſinne paſſed vpō ſuch among v vnrebuked fall conſtancie profeſſiō laughe haue delectation cōſent vnto ſinne come paſſe throughout chriſtendome ten thouſand tymes abhominable ſinned ſelues beſt man world hateth ſinne might tyme throughe • rayltie fleſh drawne ſinne altogether deuiliſh ſure token ſpirit chriſt v profeſſion baptiſme written hart laughe man ſinnes though ſelues abſteine ſhame feare hell ſo euer imagination ſo blind ſee ſinne v outward deedes penaunce diſcipline vſed primatiue church enioyned frayle perſons could rule ſelues vnder authority curate ſad diſcrete mē pariſh releſſe part tyme neceſſitie required ſawe perſon ſo growne perfectnes neded ſee wherto come maner holy father rome diſpenſeth withall together ſee biſhops officer authoritie curate pariſh become ten pariſhes round one learned diſcret helpe thē deuil hath great ſwynge among v byſhops officer dwell ſo farre muſt abuſe v within dioceſe whole land finde ſhift pope dwelleth deuill hell muſt thus mocke v ſtroke thinke ye hath sathan among v becauſe hipocrites loue way truth pretendyng contrarie begyn ſayd cō fiteor deſcription partes maſſe knowledged ſelues ſinners prieſt prayed generall eſtates degree encreaſe grace eſpecially neede required vnto whiche prayer people harkened ſayd amen goſpell glad tydinges forgiuenes ſinnes preached ſtyre fayth sacrament miniſtred confirmation fayth goſpell teſtament made betwene god v forgiuenes ſinnes chriſtes bloud repē taunce faith ye ſee bargaynes ſigne therof made either clapping hādes bowyng peny groate peece gold giuing ſome earneſt ſhewed truſe made ſlewe beaſtes confirmation men departed euery man buſines full certified ſinnes forgiuen armed remembraunce chriſtes paſſion death mortifieng fleſh day theſe neither sacrament neither ceremony maſſe imageſeruice god holy dedes make ſatiſfaction ſinnes purchaſe ſuch worldly thinges goſpell teacheth v diſpiſe compare vſe maſſe ſee whether maſſe become moſt damnable idolatrie image ſeruice euer world neuer reconcile ſelues vnto abhominable vſe maſſe brother haue offended receaue vnto maſſe open ſinners couetous extorcioners adulter backbiter common whore whore keper whiche haue part chriſt yt scripture ye ſuch ſuffred ſay maſſe vſe ſpeake ye ſuch cōpelled ſword take paſtors curate ſoules ſo hardy rebuke neither repeut confeſſe ſinnes promiſe amendement ſubmit ſelues holeſome iniunctiōs aduoyding ſuch ſinnes tamyng fleſh ſay confiteor knowledge ſelues ſinners latin neuer repent engliſh prieſt prayeth latin ſaith euermore ſtill maſſe ſay though ſing ſtreine throate cry • onde vnto yet long man woteth prayeth whether bleſſe curſe doute ſpechles ſo part abide fruteleſſe vntaught pray vnto god goſpell ſong ſayd latine onely preachyng repentaūce toward law fayth toward chriſt therfore abide euer faythles without ſtudieng amēd liuinges ceremony maſſe haue imagination holy ſeruice vnto god receaueth hand hath great delectation purchaſe great fauour god great men world giftes preſētes ſo much y• prieſt ſayd maſſe without thoſe veſtimentes left ceremony vndone onely ieſus chriſt petitioner receiuyng grace none able geue influence grace therfore beſtow part goodes intent man ſhould ſay helpe ſoule therein truſt onely promiſe god beleueth baptiſed ſhalbe whiche fayth ſuch workes good accordyng wordes lord mat xxv hongry thou gaueſt eate foloweth ye haue done leaſt brethrē ye haue done c euer ſhould cōſider true ſentēce good worke maketh good man fayth iuſtifieth thee bringeth remiſſion compendious declaration iuſtification fayth ſinnes ſetteth thee ſtate grace workes getteth thee power worke yer thou couldeſt worke thou wilt go backe agayne thou art reconciled reſtored grace woorkes required yet reconcilyng grace benefite workes folow cleane contrary forgeuenes thy ſinnes reſtoryng fauour deſerue workes folow though whē kyng ſentence ſimilitude earthly kyng pardonyng condemned perſon death geuen vpō murtherer hath pardoned hym requeſt ſome frendes workes required hencefoorth kepe kynges lawes continue grace fauour ſtandeth yet benefite lyfe procedeth deſeruyng workes folow kynges goodnes fauour frēdes yea benefite gift life deſerue workes folow though father chaſtiſe child yet child leſſe bounde obey father father
