buried namely honour hope reſurrection therefore committed care deare executours ſonne wife wiſt would part ſufficiēt leaue nothyng vſe countrey vndone abuſe beſt awyng great part goodes yet lyued vppon poore thankefull mercy receiued without bying ſellyng god without byndyng thoſe poore vnto appointed one muſt pray one helpe prayer god hath bound v already one pray one helpe hath helped v paciently abidyng bleſſynges god hath appoynted vnto maner good workes truſtyng faythfully promiſe thanking ye may ſee wordes bloud chriſt reward promiſed hys woorkes goodnes workes though done dutie aſſigned writyng vnto part ſhould diſtrubuted geuyng reſt hys executours ſtrife ſhould whiche executours right heyres left thē theſe thing ſay ſignes euident true chriſtian feareth pope purgatory onely good chriſten mā alſo perfect chriſten man ſuch one needed agaſt deſperate feare paynfull paynes purgatory whiche ſo feareth fayne vtterly abhorre death ſeyng chriſt longer thy lord hath brought thee thether art excluded ſatiſfaction muſt ſatiſfie thy ſelfe alone ſufferyng payne onely el taryeng ſatiſfieng ſhall neuer ſatiſfie inough ſelues gapyng pope pardon whiche haue ſo great doubtes daungers mynde intent graunter purchaſer yer truly obteyned due circumſtaūces much leſſe certitude haue authoritie paule thriſted diſſolued chriſt stephen deſired chriſt take ſpirite prophetes alſo deſired god take ſoules saintes went luſty courage death neither fearyng teachyng v feare ſuch crudelitie hath churche gotten authoritie binde v beyng ſo perfite hauyng ſuch fayth goodnes god father lorde chriſt make ſuch perfitues fayth hereſies greateſt salomō ſaith xxx prouerbes three thing inſaciable fourth ſayth neuer inough fift called dame anarice greedy gutte meltyng couetouſnes pretely deſcribed maw wyde throate gapyng mouth rauenyng teeth beſt ſhe eateth hongryer ſhe vnquiet euill neuer reſt blynd monſter ſurmiſyng beaſt fearyng fall euery leafe quid non mortalia pectora cogis auri ſacrafames doth holy hunger compell loue world inordinatly committe might deuils belye full truth ſhould haue audience wordes conſtcued right takē ſame ſence ment though ſeme impoſſible haply might place ſoules might kept ſpace taught inſtruct yet ſhould fitch iayle iangle ſuch faſhions fayne playne impoſſible repugnaunt scripture man trāſlated veterly kyngdome sathan ſo confirmed grace ſinne ſo burnyng loue luſt plucked god beyng partaker v promiſes god vnder commaundemētes could god graunteth thynges faythfull denyed hym deepe innocencie hys moſt kynde father hath left mercy vnpromiſed aſkyng thereto name ſonne ieſus child harte luſt whiche lord hath left mercy vndeſerued v namely god hath ſworne put righteouſnes v father mercy hath ſlayne moſt deare ſonne ieſus confirme hys othe finally ſeyng chriſtes loue taketh beſt nothing may wel vnderſtanded circumſtances declaryng ſence ment ought haue interpreted charitably ought bene founde doubtefull ſeemyng ſound amyſſe moreouer thyng ben therin could haue ben taken well yet part bene haue interprete ſpoken idlenes head reaſon ſickeneſſe much man vertuous wiſe well learned good fame report ſounde fayth whyle lyue ſay ſuſpect lyue doyng ſo much worſſe bee thought feared hys doctrine hee lyue miſtruſted owne part conſciēces teſtifyeng held doctrine thē true ſeyng neither ſpake wrote agaynſt brought hym examinatiō beſides ſome mery felowes thinke ought firſt haue ſent wyt whether would haue reuoked yet ſo deſpitefully burnt dead body could aunſwere ſelfe interprete wordes therof ſeme worke vertuous godly whiche ſo bee thinke worſſe bycauſe dead body burnt aſhes rather learne know great deſyre hypocrite haue finde one craft daſe truth cauſe counted hereſie ſimple vnlearned people whiche ſo ignoraunt ſpye theyr ſutteltie muſt nedes hereſie toucheth papiſtes burne quicke dead touch roten ſores thyng rotten byle wil haue ſo ſoeuer ſay nay onely eternall god muſt prayed night day amende whoſe power onely lyeth alſo graunt thē earneſtly thirſt true doctrine contained ſweete pure fountaines hys scripture pathes direct wayes amen endeth expoſition maſter tracy obligation ſayd couenaūt kepe minde teſtifie earneſt thyng wherby god chalenged people required kepyng lawes fayth truſt onely thyng helpe ſuccour nedeful neceſſarie man wherby cō demned diſobediēt rebellious puniſhed whereby alſo godly chalenged hym theyr god father helpe ſuccour neede miniſter thyngs vnto accordyng promiſes though ſeale couenaunt written fleſh female yet ſerued womankynd bound god truſt kepe lawes well dyd men child womankynd circumciſed fleſh yet helpe ſigne written male louyng god law truſtyng wholly hym truly circumciſed hart ſoule god mayde child beleuyng louyng god wherunto outward circumciſion bounde truly circumciſed god euen ſo male hauyng fleſhe circumciſed yet beleuyng louyng god whereunto outward circumciſion bounde vncircumciſed god god bounde good right therby puniſh ſo neither circumciſion vncircumciſed ought worth paule ſayth rom 2 ſaue keping law rom 2 circumciſion helpe keepe law ſo ſerueth nought condemne womankind vncircumciſed good caſe male circumciſed euen ſo infātes yt maydēs dyed vncircumciſed good caſe infantes male whiche dyed circumciſed good caſe ſame rule men child dyed eight day el let tell couenaūt made betwene god abraham ſaued manchilde ſoone borne yea ſoone lyfe mother wombe couenaunt god would god abrahās ſeede went ouer frute ſoone life thē reaſon couenaunt muſt nedes pertayne male ſoone female wherfore couenaunt muſt needes ſaue male vnto eight day couenaunt ruler ſhoulde ſlay male onely frēdes circumciſe circumciſion ſaued teſtify couenaunt onely foloweth infantes dye vnbaptiſed v chriſten would baptiſe due tyme teach beleue chriſt good caſe theſe dye baptiſed couenaunt made god promiſe recheth abraham poſteritie faith abraham went ouer ſeede ſone life ſigne put euen ſo muſt needes couenaunt made beleue chriſtes bloud go ouer ſede ſoone hath lyfe mother wombe ſigne put couenaunt onely ſigne ſaueth v though ſigne commaunded put due tyme ſtyrre vp fayth couenaunt ſaueth v ſtede baptiſme v circumciſiō iewes circūciſion came baptiſme wher receaued religiō chriſt made partaker paſſion member churche whereby bounde beleue chriſt father hym remiſſion ſinnes kepe law chriſt loue eche loued v whereby thus beleue loue callyng god father ſhall receaue remiſſion ſinnes merites ieſu chriſt hys ſonne hath promiſed baptiſme bounde god god v bond ſeale couenaūt writtē fleſh ſeale writting god chalengeth faith loue vnder payne iuſt damnation beleue loue chalenge aboue rehearſed mercy ſoeuer neede el god muſt vntrue god god hath bound v chriſten men receaue ſigne infirmity ſake witnes betwene hym v alſo put ſigne vpon childrē bindyng v appointed time ſhal ſeme v moſt conuenient bring knowledge god father chriſt dutie god law circūciſed fleſh hart hath part god good promiſes euen ſo bee baptiſed fleſhe hart hath part chriſtes bloud circumciſed hart fleſhe part god good promiſes euen ſo turke vnbaptiſed becauſe either knoweth ought haue cannot tyrā nie beleue chriſt loue chriſt taught hath part chriſtes bloud though outward circumciſion whiche god chalengeth ſeruice yea whether would whiche taught beleue god ſeede abraham ſhould come bleſſe world loue law certified immediatly father ſay affliction muſt reſo •• chriſt father haue ſinned agaynſt thee thy godly holy righteous law agaynſt brother ought right loue thy ſake well ſelfe forgeue father thy ſonne ieſus chriſtes ſake accordyng thy moſt mercyfull promiſes teſtament aſke brother forgiuenes peace meane made already make power ſuch ſatiſfaction hym ſhall ſeme right eye reaſonable congregatiō ſhall aſſigne faythfull men thereunto appointed congregation ſuch agree vpon endeuour ſelf ſo helpe thy grace ſubmit ſelfe muſt ordered congregation wholeſome ordinaunce cō gregation accordyng doctrine thy ſonne ieſus faithful apoſtles none name onely name ieſus chriſt commeth ſaluation actes 4 giuen vnder heauen wherby ſhalbe ſaued onely name ieſus hereof ye ſee sacramēt abſolutiō ſinnes often receiue truly taught vnderſtand receiued right hereof ye ſee alſo hebrues nature sacramēt • ppe • lord wrote ſtories couenaūts ſignes giuyng ſignes ſuch name could keepe mynde ſo god father dyd follow example people followyng hym commaunded hys sacramentes ceremony firſt ordeined god kepe hys couenantes promiſes remē braunce promiſes couenaunts prophecy written geſtures ſignes ceremony geuyng name could kepe couenauntes mynde euen ſo chriſt wrote couenaunt body bloud bread wine geuyng thē name ought keepe couenaunt remembraunce hereof ye ſee sacrament sacramentes ſtories keepe chriſtes couenaunts memory bodyes ſtories onely none vertue thē thē teſtifie exhibite ſenſes vnderſtanding couenauntes promiſes made chriſts bloud ye ſee sacramēts ceremony rightly vnderſtād cleane vnprofitable circumciſiō fleſh circumciſio without fayth auayled noching harte ſtill vncircumciſed hating law god beleuyng owne imagination circumciſed damnation baptiſed fleſhe baptiſme wt fayth auayleth nothyng onely hart ſtill vncleane neither beleuyng chriſt forgeuenes ſinnes neither louyng neighbour chriſtes ſake baptiſed alſo vnto greater damnatiō though god haue right al mē becauſe hath created made mā yet ſuch perſons reaſon ſigne badge owne cō ſent graunt promiſe hath right callyng keepyng law truſt hym onely damne bicauſe know duety might would ſigne mouyng giuyng occaſiō aſke rather yet euē ſo come sacrament purpoſe ordeined inſtituted ſay ſeke abſotion ſinnes ſet purpoſe ſinne nigh 〈…〉 cal 〈◊〉 ye benefite paſſiō chriſt yt meditatiō weaken fleſh ſtrēgth ſpirite agaynſt giue thankes agayne ſay call mynde much hee bounde loue neighbour helpe neede 〈◊〉 infirmitie forgeue 〈◊〉 haue offended deſire forgeuenes promiſing amēde whereunto chriſt bindeth wilbe partaker bloud ſuch thus prepared come greater damnation paſſe ouer ſilence wicked 〈◊〉 damnable doctrine theſe ſeruauntes mammon whiche lucre peruert true vſe sacrament hide people theyr gayne teachyng ſacrifice inſtituted god helpe ſoules dead purgatorie wil make men rich bring ſuch promotion chriſt neuer promiſed diſciples forbad ſay sacrament baptiſme sacrament chriſtes body bloud neceſſary needed baptiſme inough baptiſme receiuyng religiō couenauntes made ſhall ſhall haue baptiſme ſigne wherby god hath right v god chriſt wherby euery man hath right call dueties rebuke neither ſaluation ſo greatly ſtandeth sacrament could ſaued without preachyng word onely neuertheleſſe god hath written haue benefites kept memorie glorie benefite namely benefite benefites wherin sacrament baptiſme worketh v onely pith ſaluation reſteth therfore though effect ſignified baptiſme though baptiſed beleue yt death chriſt dye mortifieng fleſh yet doth sacrament sacrament body bloud chriſt worketh v yt rehearſing couenaūt breakyng bread powryng wine much lyuely expreſſe whole ſtorie kept better memorie dayly repeatyng therof hath might vehemencie heale conſcience ſtong freſh ſinne nature mā ſo weake ſo feble ſo frayle ſinne mā liueth ſinneth marke 10 ſo fallen law looketh vpon ſo terrible law driueth ſinner deſperatiō countenaunce ſo thundereth hys eares dare abide turneth backe go enemie ſtill aſſayleth ſide deuill enemy man perſuade god hath caſt away ſaying god haue power kepe law thou haſt breakeſt ergo thou art caſt away damned creature hell gapeth ſetteth opē mouth deuoure fleſh alſo wreſtleth fleſh enemy man ſpirit kepe take priſoner ſtoppe mouth crie vpon ſhe might ſinne pleaſure without feare careles ſwyne conſent vnto impe •… ent wilfull ſinner feeleth wrath god law ſinne feele theſe thinges neither hypocrite haue put viſard face law make looke ſuch coūtenaunce pleaſeth thē poore folkes haue eye open conſent fayne would law feele expreſſed toung neither liuyng man feeleth vertue power bloud chriſt whiche hath firſt felt ſtrong paynes hell seyng mā ſo ſicke law fleſh deuill three great enemyes vnto man ſo prone ready fall ſo cruelly inuaded whē hath ſinned feende fleſh law oft put flight feared made runne away father therfore hath god mercy infinite pitie bottomleſſe compaſſion ſet vp sacrament sacramentes chiefly ordeined god ſigne high hill whence may ſene euery ſide farre neare call againe fled runne away sacramēt clocketh henne doth chicken together vnder wynges mercy god hath cōmaunded sacramentes dayly vſe cauſe hath commaunded sacrament continuall vſe put mynde mercy layd vp chriſtes bloud witneſſe teſtifie vnto ſeale therof sacrament doth much vehemētly print lyuely fayth make ſinke hart bare wordes onely man ſure heareth ſeeth feeleth ſmelleth taſteth heareth onely wordes teſtament sacrament chriſtes body bloud 〈…〉 promiſes ſpoken ouer bread body ſhalbe broken bloud ſhalbe ſhed confirme kē chriſtes promiſe ſaluation death faith much sacrament ſene eye bread broken wine poured looked yet taſt ſmell ye ſee man maketh promiſe light wordes betwene ſelues departed hee promiſe made beginneth doubt whether ſpake earneſtly mocked doubteth whether remember promiſe bide man ſpeaketh aduiſement deliberation wordes thē credible yet ſweare confirmeth thyng yet ſtrake handes geue earneſt call record ſhall make bide promiſe though ſuch man could compell would deny young mā breake ryng betwene mayde doth fact teſtifie make preſumption men hart meant wordes ſpake manoha sampſones father iudi 13 much v loued v would haue v fayne come mercyfull v frēdes old tyme fell roſe agayne god ſo vſed iewes ceremonyes firſt giuen came v euen ſuch faſhions vſed among ſelues promiſes couenauntes chriſt neither yet redemption fulfilled night scripture prophecy fulfilled thē redemed chriſt dyed morow vayne falſe apoſtles euangeliſtes preache hys body breakyng bloud ſheddyng vnder note worthy true argument followyng pontius pylate perſecution cayphas anna bee redemption moreouer breakyng deuidyng sacrament body among apoſtles body abode ſtill alyue pouryng sacrament bloud pot cup cup mouthes belyes diſciples hee blede freſh morow though blede nothyng verely much eaſely ſacrificed night breakyng diuidyng bread pouring wyne morow sacrament night doubt deſcription paſſiō come memorial paſſiō paſt inſtituted maner sacrament taught hys diſciples alſo vnderſtode riſen agayne neuer capacitie vnderſtand hym ſpake death imagined carnally chriſt iewes yet chriſt ſhould neuer dye dyd concernyng godhead ſhould lyue euer bodily doth concernyng reſurrection wherfore ſeyng doctor doctor one accorde call sacrament ſacrifice one accorde cal sacrament ſo earneſtly ſacrifice cannot otherwiſe vnderſtand ſo ſay vſe scripture onely becauſe memoriall ſacrifice death blouſheddyng ſhould right offē ded papiſtes ſhould indifferent iudgementes proteſtants vnderſtand doctours ſame maner whē call body bloud ſo call vſe scripture becauſe onely memoriall body bloud concernyng tranſubſtantiation tranſubciatiō worde vſed among olde doctours thinke ſuch ſpeech among old doctours though came vnderſtode thē amiſſe harte groſſe buſiyng thē ſelues much worldly buſines bread wyne onely bread wine till wordes teſtament bee rehearſed ouer ceaſſe bread wyne harte true beleuers hart theſe word ſpoken thinketh onely vppon couenaunt made body bloud chriſt fayth eateth hys body drinketh bloud though eye ſences perceaue nothyng bread wyne man ſometyme ſeeketh text bible ſeeth paper iuke figure letter yet hart thinketh thyng thē wordes ſence text therof doubt came vp tranſubſtantiation falſe vnderſtandyng another thyng none thoſe wicked heretickes denied chriſt god denyed chriſt bee man haue body ſaue phātaſticall body dyd caſt true beleuers teth effectual good argument time fayth chriſtes body preſent sacrament euery thing like would haue done opinion thē bene generall article fayth neither hereſie pope confirming tranſubſtantiatiō purchaſe hys gayne ouerthrow right vſe chriſtes sacrament diuerſitie opinion diſputyng matter till pope gathered councell confirme tranſubſtāciation wherfore moſt likely opinion came vp thē latter dayes furthermore law prophetes chriſt dyd yet bring v beleue god father remiſſiō ſinnes bryng v vnto whiche immediatly foloweth belefe loue neighbour hys ſake loued v wherfore chriſt put bodilie preſence sacrament would ſhould beleue done onely bring v fayth fayth leſſe opinion moſt ſtrong neither ſo cruelly perſecuted iew turke thē moſt feruently defend opiniō true fayth maketh man loue hys brother opinion maketh hate ſlay brother better beleue chriſt opinion murther feare loſyng haue gotten opinion item opiniō ſtede commō perſuaſion papiſtes teachyng v beleue chriſt teach v ſerue chriſte bodily ſeruice thing nought el idolatry preach ceremony maſſe ſeruice god reaſon bodily workes obtayne forgeuenes ſinnes therby deſerue merite therewith yet chriſt ſpiritual ſubſtaunce father hauyng alſo ſpirituall body father worſhypped ſpirite onely ſeruice ſpirite onely beleue hym remiſſiō ſinne call vpon hym giue hym thankes loue neighbour ſake workes done ſerue man bryng poynt put truſt chriſt good acceptable god done purpoſe idolatry imageſeruice make god idole bodily image agayne ſeyng fayth teſtament chriſtes bloud lyfe righteous begynnyng world end much sacramēt inſtituted onely bryng lyfe thinke body preſēt sacramēt haue preaching confirmation sacrament obtayned lyfe ſtedfaſt fayth chriſtes bloud dayly vſe sacrament hardned therein loue ſpringeth thereof reaſonable cauſe haue contrary part whiche beleue body preſent bread turned body fleſh bone • ſinewes nayles put croſſe length quantitie cannot tell rayle v heretickes hate perſecute ſlay v moſt cruelly enemyes chriſt ſayth qui contra non eſt mecum eſt marke 9 agaynſt beleue chriſt papiſtes cruell perſecut • r remiſſiō ſinnes ſake loue foe chriſtes enemy ergo chriſtes ſide ſhould boaſt ſelues chriſtes trendes ſlay thē fayth chriſtes bloud father thorough god ſeruice ſpirite ſo haue whiche beleue bodily preſence cor 13 man giftes god giue man charitie loue neighbour helpeth giftes remiſſiō chriſtes bloud alſo giuen hym god bryng hym loue hys neighbour thing mā hath man hath nothyng phil 2 ſwetely phil 2 vehemently cōiureth draw one way one accorde one mynde ſentence nothyng ſtrife vayne glory ſay hate diſdayne one another affectiō ſelfe ſeme glorious ech preferre mekenes haue opinion ſuſpect feare ſinne forgiuen onely chriſtes ſake againe duety loue neighbour leſſe chriſt loued v wherfore let v procede forth rule exhort ech truſt chriſt loue ech chriſt dyd agree let v bewiſe onely feruēt called body ſame maner becauſe ſigne body theſe like exāples moue third part affirme bound beleue bread body chriſte though ſo called bread tranſubſtantiated body thē thing rehearſed called tranſubſtantiated thing called aunſwere though obiectiō made yt papiſtes memoriall thynges whoſe name beare yet wil follow ſhould bee ſo sacrament gaue ſuch name power make thynges ſo chriſt god hath power make body euery thyng euery aunſwere god cannot make aunſwere yu former obiection euery creature god neither cā bee proued leſſe repugnaunce creature ſhould bee euery ſhould god moreouer though god appeared iacob pitched ſtone end called god face yet bene bound beleue bene face god iacob done almightynes god ſtandeth hee able fooliſh leude thoughtes may imagme becauſe power heè doth hath made naught bryng naught agayne includeth cōtrarie truth veritie god hath put creature becauſe thynges impoſſible man creature thinke ſhuld done therfore called lord almighty becauſe braule ſuch poſſibilitie impoſſibilitie luſt sophiſters alſo deſire deuill quench profeſſion baptiſme wipe image chriſt harte thyng endeleſſe therfore compte wickednes wade forth giue ſeeke occaſion perpetually ſcold negatiue may man hold till proue affirmatiue moreouer bread body chriſt whether abidyng body ſtill tranſubſtantiated enioy glorye ſoule chriſt alſo godhead ſemeth impoſſible auoyded chriſt made man dyed alſo bread whiche ſemeth ſome great inconuenience howbeit great proclamation bread alſo high power prieſtes aboue aūgels admit alſo anoide braulyng one reaſō haue vnto cleaue ſomewhat chriſt cup folow body alſo neither graunt body bread vnder forme bread folow ſoule ther chriſt made ye bread sacrament body onely wherefore bread ſimilitude bloud bound ought affirme yt bloud preſēt inſtitute wyne sacramēt bloud onely happely red wyne yt louely repreſēt wine ſimilitude doth repreſēt body ſo boūd ought affirme body preſent ye ſay chriſt ſo mighty though ſtode mortall diſciples eye yet able make ye ſame body yt ſame time sacrament immortall vnder euery litle peece bread sacramēt though greater thē mote ſonne lōg great thicke ſtode hee wereſo mighty mighty make bloud bee alone body alone hys bloud body ſoule ech alone death body lay ſepulchre finally chriſt ſaid bloud ſhalbe ſhed ergo true bloud ſhed bloud hayles bloud many place men ſay bloud ſhed ergo bloud loue neighbour ought denty beare ech lōg opiniō plaine wicked falſe idolatrie cōtrary ſaluation chriſt agaynſt opē manifeſt doctrine chriſt apoſtles contrary generall article fayth generall churche chriſt confirmed open scripture whiche article neuer true church land diſſenteth many textes scripture therefore diuerſly expounded holy doctours takē cōtrary ſēces whē text hath cōtrary hart imagine yea yet dead though hipocrites make haue ſworne looke mās helpe bringeth god helpe death vna ſalus victis nullam ſperare ſalutem looke man helpe bringeth helpe god ſeeme ouercome eye hipocrites yea ſhall make god cary thicke thinne truethes ſake ſpite enemy trueth falleth heare till houre come conſlancie ſtāding pacience ſuffering houre come neceſſitie caryeth v hence though willing willing haue reward thanke feare threatning therfore neither ouercome ſweete wordes twayne hipocrites ſhall aſſayle neither let perſwaſions worldly wiſedome beare rule hart though frendes axōs hold sacrament george ioye would haue put foorth treatiſe matter haue ſtopt hym yet doe get money wotte beleue wold make many reaſōs litle ſeruyng purpoſe mynde nothyng put forth till heare ſhal haue ſpede would haue right vſe preached preſence indifferēt tyndall •… beareth wt tyme thyng till matter might reaſoned peace layſure party required ſhew phraſes scripture let talke beleue yt god euery hurteth mā worſhyp within hart ſpirite verity euē ſo beleue body chriſt euery though proued hurteth man worſhippeth vbiquetie proued hym ſaue fayth hys goſpell perceiue minde beit god ſhew otherwiſe free moueth geſſed long ago god would ſend daſing head ſpiritualtie catched thē ſelues owne ſubtiltie truſt come paſſe thinketh ſmel counſayle takē litle profites time come muſt vnderſtand pure hart loue truth aduenge thē eating whore fleſh ſpoyle pope churche▪ onely y• praye ſpoyle ther ſelues eate whore fleſh ſuck marow bone wherfore cleaue faſt rocke helpe god commit end thing hym god ſhall call may vſe wiſedome worldly farre perceiue glory god may come therof refuſe euer among thruſt worldly wiſedome ſo farre may ſerue god glorie may vſed scripture may bee mother toung learning ſet vp ʋniuerſities ought required contrary glory god hys chriſt thē ſtand faſt commit ſelfe god bee ouercome men perſuaſions happely ſhal ſay ſee way bryng truth brother iacob beloued hart lyueth haue ſo good hope truſt whō myne hart reioyſeth ſoule comforteth ſelfe thouſand part ſo much learnyng giftes el haue wil crepe alow ground low wa • kyng walke thoſe thinges conſcience may feele imagination brayne feare boldnes open neceſſary thing pronounce define hyd ſecretes thynges neither helpe hinder whether ſo vnitie ſeditious opinion ſo much ſure know yet thinges may abyde layſure wil deferre ſay till agree thinke text requireth ſenſe vnderſtandyng yea ſure part good hold contrary yet thyng maketh matter laugh let paſſe referre thyng men ſticke ſtifly ſtubburnely earneſt neceſſary thynges truſt ye perſuaded euē ſo call god vpright handlyng tranſlation tyndall recorde againſt ye day ſhall appeare lord ieſus geue recknyng doings neuer altered one ſillable god word agaynſt cōſcience would day earth whether pleaſure honour rich might geuen moreouer take god recorde conſcience deſire god ſelfe world without whiche keepe hys lawes finally gift could helpe hand ayde nede required promiſe would farre commit end god ſoule faynt though body wery god hath made euill fauoured world without grace ſight mē ſpechles rude dull ſlow witted parte ſhalbe ſupply lacketh low hart maketh man hygh god remembryng lowlynes hart ſhall make hygh god euen ſo mekenes wordes ſhal make authoritie glory age ſinke harte men nature geueth age authoritie mekenes glory youth geueth meekenes glory youth thē honour aboundaunce loue maketh excede bablyng syr concernyng purgatory many thing demaunded may ſay erre ſpiritualtie hath ſo le • haue taught beleue preached ſuch thynges god word alledged thouſād textes reaſon textes beleued taught finde thē lyers textes meane ſuch thynges therfore beleue longer taught beleue ſuch thing howbeit ready beleue haue way proue without profe purgatory hath profe scripture beleue thē haue founde ſo many lye c perceiue wherin may helpe ſtill doyng ſomewhat let v haue word myne vttermoſt lord london hath ſeruaūt called iohn tiſen red beard blacke reddiſh head ſcholler ſeue antwerpe came among engliſhmen whether hee gone embaſſadour ſecret wote mighty god iacob ſupplant enemy geue fauour ioſeph wiſedome ſpirite stephen hart mouth teach lippes ſhall ſay aunſwere thynges god deſpayre ourſelues truſt glory amen william tyndall ¶ hope redemption nigh ¶ letter written 1533 moneth january whiche letter although pretende name iacob yet vnderſtand good reader written deede iohn frith aboue told thee profe euidence whereof read frithes booke sacrament thou ſhalt finde certeine place epiſtle repeted word word beginning teſtimonie aboue appeareth end william tindal workes newly imprinted accordyng firſt copy himſelfe ſet forth god name bleſſed euer amen ☞ foloweth ſhort pithy treatiſe touching lordes supper compiled ſome gather william tyndall becauſe methode phraſe agree tyme writyng concurrent thy inſtruction learnyng gentle reader haue annexed workes le • church god ſhould want paineful trauels godly men whoſe onely care endeuour aduaunce glory god ſaluation chriſtes flocke committed charge supper lord true meanyng vi iohn xi firſt epiſtle cor incidently expoſition supper confuted letter maſter agaynſt iohn frith anno 1533 v day aprill chriſt ſawe thoſe glottons ſeekyng theyr bellyes flockyng ſo faſt vnto wō ted maner occaſion taken teach preach vnto thing moued ſayd ʋerely verely ſay vnto ye iohn 6 ſeeke becauſe ye haue ſene miracle becauſe ye haue eaten loaues well filled commen world onely fill men bellyes fede ſatiſfie ſoules ye take great paine folow meate bellyes oh ſloughardes worke take paynes labour rather get meate ſhall neuer periſh meate ye haue ſought hetherto periſheth bellyes meate ſhall giue ſpirituall may periſh abideth euer giuyng lyfe euerlaſtyng father hath conſigned confirmed aſſured teſtimonie bee aſſured ſauyng health earneſt peny euerlaſtyng life iewes vnderſtode iewes wer blynd ignorant vnderſtode wordes chriſt chriſt meant biddyng woorke labour meate ſhould neuer periſhe aſked hym ſhal might worke workes god ſuppoſing ſpoken ſome outward woorke required wherfore ieſus aū ſwered ſaying euē worke god beleue truſt whō father hath ſent lo may ye ſee true worke acceptable god worke god requireth v euen beleue chriſt alſo cō ſider agayn meate bad prepare ſeeke ſaying worke take paynes ſeeke meate c thou ſhalt ſee none meate belief chriſt wherfore cōcludeth meate ſo oft mencioned fayth whiche meate • ayth prophet abacuk 2 iuſt liueth fayth therfore meate whiche chriſt prepareth dreſſeth ſo purely poulderyng ſpicyng ſpirituall allegory chapter folowyng giue v euerlaſtyng life ſayd iewes vnto hym iewes deſire ſig • e token whereby might beleue chriſt token doeſt thou whereby might know ſhould beleue thee ſomwhat might beleue thee thyng workeſt thou might know thee god thou knoweſt well inough father eate bread māna deſerte written hee gaue bread aboue ieſus aunſwered ʋerely verely ſay vnto moſes gaue ye bread heauē pſal 7 though fell downe ayre yet heauēly foode dyd feede belly bread god deſcended heauen father giueth refreſheth ſoule ſo aboundauntly geueth life vn world iewes vnderſtode ſaying whiche nought elles declaryng goſpell eatyng bread hee meant belefe goſpell ſayd syr giue v bread euermore ieſus ſayd vnto thē chriſt required iewes haue fayth truſt hym bread life ſo commeth ſhall hunger ſo beleueth ſhal neuer thyrſt iewes hard chriſt ſay bread deſcended heauē ſhould giue lyfe world deſired haue bread giuen euer ieſus perceiuing vnderſtode ſence goſpel expoū ded chriſt explaneth ſheweth ſelfe iewes vnto ſo liuely bread giueth life world ſaying bread life ſo commeth ſay ſo graffed ioyned faith ſhall neuer hunger ſo beleueth ſatiſfied fayth therefore ſtancheth hunger thyrſt ſoule fayth therfore chriſt filleth hungry harte ſo cā deſire none fayth onely apprehē deth chriſt hys benefites we▪ eate drinke fayth ſay beleue fleſh body haue bene broken bloud ſhed ſinnes ſoules ſatiſfied iuſtified ouer foloweth haue told becauſe ye looke vppon beleue ye offended ſayd commeth ſhall neither hunger thyrſt ſeyng ſelues beyng preſent yet hungry thyrſtie chriſt rebuketh incredulitie lacke fayth iewes commeth becauſe ye haue ſene bodily eye yet ſee beleue ſpeake ſuch ſight commyng ſight fayth ſo hath ſhall haue none deſire ſhall ſeeke night loue would lay grief ſhal runne wandering ſeke dead ſtockes ſtones certified • ayth hee ſhall cleaue coupled fayth vnto ſpouſe liuely foode onely treaſure ſoule neuer thyrſt light fayth ye haue ye beleue truſt wherfore ye vnderſtand bread meate ſoules ſay faith hope cauſe blyndnes father draw come vnto chriſt ſay ouer hardly father hath drawne knowledge el ye receiued father giueth muſt come vnto caſt mā commeth come downe frō heauen whiche ye attribute vnto vnto eche man verely man accordyng nature haue ſpeciall proper much obediēt father one chriſte came heauē earth fulfill father oft reſiſteth repugneth god ſo doth mine neuer therfore come downe doe hath ſent witte ſay father yt hath ſent hath giuē lee • e none muſt rayſe hym vp agayne laſt day playne ſent ſo ſeeth know ſonne beleueth ſhall haue lyfe euerlalaſtyng ſhall ſtyrre hym vp ye laſt day may ye ſee meate ſpeaketh god ſent ſonne world might liue thorough liueth eate fleſh drinke bloud eate fleſh drinke bloud y• beleueth chriſtes death remiſſiō ſinnes ſame cateth y• fleſhe drinketh bloud chriſt beleue body crucified bloud ſhed ſinnes theſe clea • e vnto gracious fauour could cleane thus vnto except knew therfore added ſaying euery man ſeeth ſonne ſay vnderſtandeth wherfore ſonne ſent world beleueth ſhall haue euerlaſtyng lyfe appeared carnall cauſe ye iewes murmur iewes chriſt taken much vpon ſelfe ſay bread lyfe come downe frō heauen giue life world wherfore fleſh ſay iewes murmured • maruelled ſheweth owne dreame text folowyng whiche ſhall touch anone murmured ſaying chriſt bread come heauen ſaying ieſus ioſephes ſonne whoſe father mother know well inough ſayth come heauen ieſus aūſwered ſaying murmour chriſt reproueth murmuryng iewes among ſelues heard ye told euen father giueth come vnbelefe wherof foloweth falſe vnderſtanding wordes ſpiritually ſpoken compelleth tell one thyng thē twiſe therfore mā may come onely earneſt peny pledge▪ saluatiō vnleſſe father ſent draw whō draweth vnto ioyneth vnto fayth ſhall ſtyrre vp laſt day wonder ye take wordes ſo ſtraungely beleuyng ſome hard r • dels darke parable ſay nothyng el thē written owne prophetes eſay ieremy ſaying eſay 54 ierem 31 ſhall taught lord sith euē prophetes teſtifie knowledge giuē father ſpokē playnly ſay father giueth commeth man may come except father draw yet haue manifeſtly ſo hath heard father learned iohn 6 commeth vnto onely anker ſaluation man hath ſene father leſt peradnenture ye miſtake theſe wordes heare learne though pertemed outward ſenſes rather mynde inward illuminyng ſoule man euer ſaw father although worke ſecretly vpon hart ſo ſo euer hee willeth muſt heare learne man ſay ſeeth ſent god ſayd ſelfe ſeeth father therfore ſay vnto verely beleue hope chriſt haue euerlaſtyng life verely playnly yt ſo beleueth truſteth hath life euerlaſting haue ye yt ſumme doctrine euē goſpel ye whole tale legacy meſſage wherfore ſent world vnderſtandyng ſcriptures 1 cor 11 vnderſtode ſhort ſentence ſo beleueth hath life euerlaſtyng knowne paule apoſtles preached eſpecially paul yeare halfe amōg corinthiās determinyng neither preſumyng haue knowē thyng preached ſelfe ſaith ieſus chriſt crucified vnderſtand point ſhould neuer haue thus blaſphemed chriſt ſufficiēt scripture neither haue ſo belyed euāgeliſtes holy apoſtles ſay wrote thinges neceſſary ſaluation left thing neceſſitie beleued makyng god holy teſtamēt inſufficient vnperfite firſt reueled vnto father written oft ſence moyſes prophetes laſt written holy euangeliſtes apoſtles mocker turne iohn agayne let mocke ſtill lye y• bread life ſaith chriſt mā denyeth y• father elder eate manna deſert yet dead eateth bread ſay beleueth hath life euerlaſtyng liuely bread come heauen ſo eate faith ſhal neuer eating bread chriſt onely beleue chriſtes • eath dye therfore noted diligently y• chriſt meaneth euery mā may ſee y• eating bread none thyng belefe ſelf offred vp ſinnes whiche faith onely iuſtifieth v whiche ſentence declare playnly would haue noted diligently repeteth yet agayn ſaying yt liuely bread come frō heauē ſo eateth bread ſhall liue euerlaſtingly put cleare doubt ſhall ſhew wordes matter wayes muſt sauiour redemer world giue life ſo oft rehearſed therfore take good heede bread bread ſignifieth ſheweth chriſtes •… eſh ſpeake ſo much ſhall giue myne owne fleſh muſt lay forth pay life y• world manifeſt ſhould ſuffer death fleſh redēptiō geue v life euerlaſtyng thus may ye ſee chriſtes fleſhe chriſtes fleſh ſpirituall foode ou • ſoules called bread ſpirituall foode meate ſoules whē ſoules fayth ſee god father haue ſpared onely ſo deare beloued ſonne haue deliuered ſuffer ignominious ſo paynefull death reſtore v lyfe thē haue eaten fleſh dronken bloud aſſured firmely fauour god ſatiſfied certified ſaluation communication ſayd bread whiche ſhall geue fleſh whiche ſhall pay lyfe world yet carnall iewes neuer wiſer obſtinate wilfull blyndnes iewes vnbelief ſturdy hatred would ſuffer ſpirituall ſence mynde chriſtes wordes enter theyr harte could ſee chriſtes fleſh broken crucified bodely eaten ſhould ſaluation ſpiritual meate ſoules bee fed certified mercy god forgiuenes ſinnes thorough paſſion eatyng fleſhe teeth malice iewes toward sauiour chriſt ignoraunt therfore fleſhly fierce full indignatiō ſtriuyng one agaynſt ſaying may felow geue v fleſh eate ſtoke faſt yet fleſhe eye thoſe fleſhly iewes wherfore maruell though abhorred bodely eatyng thereof although fleſhly papiſtes beyng iewes carnall carnal papiſtes ceaſſe ſtill offer hym hebr 10 opinion yet abhorre neither ceaſſe dayly crucifie offer vp agayne euer offred paule teſtifieth euen ſith chriſt came teache take away doubt breake ſtrife might wordes otherwiſe declared hath expounde haue ſoluted queſtion ſaying ſo ment meaneth would haue bene conuayed conuerſed iugglers ſleighly conuaye woordes ſingyng loafe el thomiſticall papiſtes thomiſtes y• ſchole doctours ſay bene inuiſible dimenſioned body vnder fourme bread tranſubſtantiated like thomiſticall myſtery wyne tranſubſtantiated hys bloud ſo ſhould eate fleſh drinke bloud owne carnall vnderſtanding yet forme put away grudge ſtomacke ſith iohn vnderſtode maiſters minde tooke vpon hym write wordes would leaue sermon vnto world read might haue deliuered v frō doubt chriſt would ſo ſatiſfie theyr queſtion aunſwered ʋerely verely ſay vnto except ye eate fleſhe ſonne man drinke bloud ye ſhall haue life ſelues eateth fleſh drinketh bloud hath lyfe euerlaſting chriſt ſaiyng y• hys fleſh meate doth ſay bread ſhalbe tranſubſta •• ated hys fleſh ſhall ſtyrre vp laſt day fleſh meate bloud drinke ſaith bread ſhalbe tranſubſtanciated conuerted body yet wyne bloud cō ferre ſaying purpoſe begynnyng worke meate ſhould neuer periſh tellyng beleue hym god hath ſent worke god ſo beleueth hym ſhould neuer thyrſt hunger haue lyfe euerlaſtyng conferre alſo chriſtes wordes ſpirituall carnall foloweth ſhalt ſee playne wordes vnderſtand ſpiritually belefe fleſh crucified bloud ſhed belefe bee promiſed euerlaſtyng lyfe hym ſelfe ſaying ſo beleueth hath life euerlaſtyng therfore queſtiō may man giue v fleſh eate ſoluted euen gaue body broken bloud ſhed eate drinke deede whē beleue ſtedfaſtly hee dyed remiſſion ſinnes auſten tertullian witneſſe maketh argument agaynſt young man becauſe iewes maruelle • ſaying fleſh meate bloud drinke dore vyne therefore text ſayth fleſh c muſt vnderſtand litterall ſence wirte euē carnall iewes vnderſtode murmuring beyng offended goyng wayes frō chriſt ſo carnall vnderſtandyng therof textes dore declareth hys ignoraunce wilfull blyndnes c muſt vnderſtand allegory ſpituall ſence becauſe hearer maruelled nothyng maner ſpeach loe chriſten reader haſt thou • aſt great tunne full more miſchief pernicious peruertyng god holy worde thou ſeiſt falſely peſtilently deſtroy pure ſence god worde ſo doth hee place hys bookes firſt ſayth marueiled chriſtes ſaying fleſh meate c ſo neither ſuch worde text except reporteth scripture vntruly expounde murmurabant ideſt mirabantur murmured ſay marueiled expoū deth oportet ideſt expedit conuenit muſt dye behoueth dye ſay expedient good cōgruence ſhould dye c thus poete may make man ſignifie aſſe blacke white blere ſimple eye yet lordly more firſt reaſon cōfute • pleaſure let v graunt murmured much ſay meruayled becauſe perchaunce one may folow aſke whether chriſtes diſciples apoſtles heard • im vnderſtode ſayd doore vyne hee ſayd fleſh c ſay nay iohn 6 10 15 scripture playne agaynſt ſay yea yes yea doe aſke hym whether diſciples apoſtles thus hearyng vnderſtandyng hys woordes theſe three chapter wondered meruayled ſayth murmu • ed hath text maiſters ſpeech thinke ye muſt aunſwere may ye ſee whether old holy vpholder pope churche brought euen taken owne trappe diſciples apoſtles chriſtes diſciples murmured hys ſaying neither murmured mer • ayled yet offended wt maiſter chriſtes wordes maner ſpeech w •… ainted ſuch thynges ſpiritually vnderſtand becauſe ye ſay • vnderſtode • allegory 〈◊〉 •• perceiued well hee meant hys materiall • ody bee eaten teeth meant 〈◊〉 ſelfe beleued god man hauing fleſh bloud yet • ſonne liuyng god belefe gathered hys ſpirituall ſayinges hym ſelfe expounded wordes ſaying fleſh profiteth nothyng meanyng eaten ſpirite giueth life wordes ſpeake vnto ſpirite lyfe ſo ſo beleue fleſh crucified broken bloud ſhed ſinnes eateth fleſh drinketh bloud hath lyfe euerlaſtyng lyfe abacuk 2 wherewith righteous lyue euen fayth ſecond argument text thus wiſely proued vnderſtand litterall ſence carnall iewes allegorike ſpirituall ſenſe chriſt apoſtles whole ſūme more confutation young mā ſtandeth vpon argument 〈◊〉 poſſe ad eſſe witte god may erg • done chriſt may make body many place ergo many place maner argumentation falſe naught euery ſophiſter euery man hath witte perceiueth like argument god may confutation ij argument ſhew truth call repentaunce paul perſecutyng church ergo conuerted god god may let run indurate hart pharao laſt take open ſoden vengeaunce vppon perſecutyng hys worde burnyng poore member ergo done already chriſt god may doe thing yet falſefye hys holy scripture muſt firſte proue v expreſſe wordes holy scripture hys owne vnwritten dreames chriſtes body many place place though reaſon reach yet fayth meaſured directed worde fayth reach receiue hold faſt becauſe poſſible god impoſſible reaſon bicauſe written woorde fayth ſayth whē read god wordes mo xx place contrary body ſhould muſt giue v leue beleue vnwritten vanity verity ſhould ſay layſure mayſt thou ſee chriſten reader wherefore would ſo fayne make thee beleue apoſtles left certeine thynges vnwritten neceſſitie beleued euē ſtabliſh pope kyngdome ſtandeth more vnwritten vanity preſence chriſtes body makyng therof bread purgatory inuocation saintes worſhyppyng ſtones ſtockes pilgrimage halowyng bowes belle crepyng croſſe c ye beleue ſo euer fayne without scripture cā poete faine church thē chriſtes great ſette • orth vnwritten • ities ye muſt beleue ſo euer teacheth hath fained cā erre though ye ſee erre fight agaynſt ſelfe thouſand rymes yea tell blacke white good bad deuill god yet muſt ye beleue el burned heretikes let v returne purpoſe diſpute god almighty abſolute although ye pope da • e • ot take vppon hym god▪ yet cō tented named taken halfe god power god may body great folie leſſe preſumption ſith pope whiche whole god halfe god owne decree haue decreed man diſpute power chriſten reader thou content know god wil word power one repugne neither willeth may thing includyng repugnaunce imperfection ſhould derogate miniſh hurt glory name glory godhead bee preſent fill place eſſencially preſently almightie power glory denyed creature ſelfe ſaying prophet giue glory eſay 42 creature therfore ſyth māhead creature cā haue glory onely whiche appropried godhead attribute manhode propertie whiche onely appropried hys godhead confounde nature chriſt thing ſo euer euery ſayd maner muſt nedes infinite without begynnyng end muſt one alone almightie whiche property onely appropried chriſt • touchyng manhode occupieth one • one place hys godhead place iohn 14 iohn 10 hebr 11 vnto glorious maieſtie godhead wherefore chriſtes body may many place chriſt ſelfe ſaying concerning manhoo • leſſe father touchyng godhead father one thyng paule recityng pſalme affirmeth chriſt concernyng manhode leſſe god leſſe aungels ſome text hath playne thinges imagineth fayneth poſſible god poſſible god make acreature equall vnto ſelfe includeth repugnaūce derogateth glory god promiſed ſwore nation ſhould bleſſed death promiſed ſeede chriſt god determined decreed world made ergo chriſt muſt needes haue dyed expoūde word oportet mynſeth ſo neceſſary contrary impoſſible except would make god lyer impoſſible paule concludeth chriſt hebr 9 muſt nedes haue dyed vſyng latine terme neceſſe saying ſo euer chriſtes muſt nedes dye god ſo promiſed teſtamēt muſt death teſtament maker go betwene el teſtament ratified ſure righteouſnes remiſſion ſinnes chriſtes bloud new teſtament whereof mediatour ergo teſtament maker muſt nedes haue died wreſt therfore word oportet though ye finde poteſt oportet ſome corrupt copy vnto vnſauery ſence let oportet ſignifie muſt behoueth hym dye tooke mortall nature ye ſame decreed coūcel himſelfe ſaying oportet exaltari filium hominis c iohn 2 12 behoueth ſonne mā muſt dye euery one beleueth periſh c may ye ſee alſo yt impoſſible god breake promiſe impoſſible god god may foūd •… veritie found contrary deedes wordes ſaue hath damned damne hee hath ſaued wherefore thynges imagined more brayne poſſible god ſayth chriſt power let lyfe take agayne therfore haue dyed neceſſitie wōder ſcholemaiſter ſayled ſo cunnyng maketh ſelfe therin graū teth affirmeth true neceſſary decreed woorkes god forſight prouidence ſtādeth right wel free libertie would haue beleued chriſt talked hym ſoeuer hee ſaid ſayth laſt god would cell hee would make ech bodyes two meanyng young man body fiften place would beleue werable make wordes true body twayne neuer would ſo much aſke hym whether hee would glorifie firſt ſure glorified vnglorified ſayd able • may ye ſee • eruēt fayth old man hath earneſt mynde beleue chriſtes woordes hee told pray chriſt neuer told ſaid neuer would would ye haſty beleue told praye tell v ſpake hym beare ye recorde bryng falſe ſhrew ſelfe teſtify thyng yet doctrine muſt ye make v miracle confirme tale ere bound beleue yet admit argument god may make body many place ergo ſo syr ye buſie god almightye power buſely deale withall god almighty power haue taken great burden vppon weake ſhoulders ye haue ouerladen ſelfe harneſſe weapon young dauid likely preuayle agaynſt ſling ſtone god hath infatuated high ſubtill wiſedome crafty conueyaunce ſpyed god hath ſent church mete couer ſuch cup euē ſuch defender ye take vppon ſelfe ſhall let theyr whole cauſe fall flatte myer vnto ſhames vtter cōfuſion god therfore prayſed euer amen ſayth though ſemeth repugnaunt one body bee two place yet god ſeeth make ſtand together well inough man doth ſcoffe matter old eyen ſpectacles ſeeth farre god ſight preuey councel knoweth belike ſome ſecret reuelation god ſeeth one body many place includyng repugnaunce worde hath hee none scripture thē one body al place implyeth firſt repugnaunce matter • ayth repugnaūt reaſon ſight reaſon world ſhould made nothyng virgin ſhould bryng forth child yet ſee written wordes faith god ſpake brought ſo paſſe thē implyeth repugnaunce fayth reacheth receiueth ſtedfaſtly know yt voyce herd man whiche ſayd place scripture body ſhould haue ben cōtained vnder forme bread ſo many place earth alſo abidyng yet ſtill heauen ʋerely would haue beleued ſoone firmely god bleſſed declared scripture therfore euen yet ſhew v one ſentence truly taken part cā many contrary muſt giue place vnwrittē verity authority antichriſtes ſinagoge vnto yt ſcripture forſaken hee laſt ſhame inough cōpelled flee proued ſtarke lye deuelry ſayth hee ye wot well many good folke haue vſed matter many good fruitefull example god workes onely miracle writtē scripture vnde verſus one pray ye alſo done commō courſe nature earth done common trauc • leth poetrie courſe nature ſo miracle ſome thynges made alſo man hand one face beholded diuers glaſſes euery peece one glaſſe broken twenty c lorde ponti • icall poete playeth part bicauſe ſaith ſee many face many glaſſes therefore may one body many place though euery ſhadow ſimilitude repreſenting body bodely ſubſtaūce aſke hee ſeeth hys owne face ſo many glaſſes whether thoſe face appeare glaſſes owne face hauing bodely ſubſtaunce ſkynne fleſhe bone hath face hath mouth noſe eyen c wherewith faceth v truth thus falſely lye face more ſimilitude face glaſſe proueth face ſubſtaunce deede one body many place ſelfe beareth many face one hode accordyng purpoſe euē face thoſe ſo many voyces ſownes ſimilitudes multiplied ayre betwene glaſſes obiect body philoſopher proueth naturall reaſon bodyes chriſtes body would make thee beleue bread ſo many place bread broken eaten supper moniſheth putteth v • ayth muſt eate drinke chriſtes body blo • ſpiritually remembraunce death ſo exciteth v thankes giuyng lande prayſe benefite redemption thus wee haue chriſt preſent inward eye ſight fayth eate body drinke hys bloud beleue ſurely hys bodye crucified ſinnes hys bloud ſhed ſaluation laſt note chriſten reader third booke confutation tyndall ccxlix ſide proue iohns goſpell vnperfit inſufficient leauing ſo neceſſary point faith calleth laſt supper chriſt maūdy ſayth iohn ſpeake nothyng writeth againſt hym ſelfe sacramēt ſee againe theſe letter agaynſt frith ſelfe bringeth iohn vj chap impugne frithes writyng make sacrament euē thus fleſh verely meate bloud drinke belike man ouer ſhotte hym ſelfe foule young man cauſing put ſpectacles poore better wiſely old eyen vpō iohns goſpel finde thing written would haue made one vnwritten verity yet looke narowly hee ſhall eſpy ſelf hath proued v scripture xxxvij leafe dialogue quoth quoth lady perpetuall virginitie expoundyng non cog • oſco id eſt non cognoſcam whiche written vnwritten veritie hee numbereth litle among vnwrittē vanity thus may ye ſee vpholder vnwritten verity old holy vpholder pope church hys woordes fight agaynſt ſelfe confuſion findyng v forth vnwritten written vanity verity ſhould ſay returne vnto expoſition iohn iewes would vnderſtand ſpirituall ſaying eating chriſtes fleſh drinkyng hys bloud ſo oft ſo playnely declared gaue ſtrong ſtripe made blynd ſo deſerued ſuch ſecrete iudgementes god addyng vnto hys ſayinges thus ſo eateth fleſh drinketh bloud abideth theſe wordes ſpoken vnto theſe vnbeleuers farther obſtinatiō vnto faithfull theyr better inſtruction gather contrary ſay ſo eateth fleſhe drinketh bloud abydeth ioyne foreſayd ſentence except abacuk 2 ye eate fleſh ſonne mā drinke hys bloud ye haue lyfe let neuer fal frō thy minde chriſten reader faith lyfe fayth y• life righteous righteous chriſt lyuyng bread thou eateſt ſay whō thou beleueſt papiſtes take eatyng drinkyng bodely eate naturall body chriſt vnder forme bread drinke hys bloud vnder forme wyne thē muſt young child neuer came god borde departed laye men neuer drancke hys 1 iohn 4 bloud damned loue abyde god hee v loue foloweth faith order vnderſtanding order ſucceſſion tyme thou lookeſt vpon ſelfe giftes fruites principally faith wherby cleaue god goodnes mercy abide god god v declare wordes folowyng ſaying liuyng father fayth eate drinke chriſt ſo abydeth v hym ſent ſo liue father euen ſo eateth ſhall lyue bycauſe ſake father ſent whoſe thinges obey ſonne euen ſoverely muſt eate beleue forme faſhion exāple mortifying fleſh chaunging liuing el eate vayne diſſemble theyr belief come redeme yt world onely alſo chaunge theyr lyfe chriſten religion fayth lyfe correſpondēt therefore beleue ſhall trāſforme life example doctrine man traditiōs bread yt came frō heauē effect ſelfe declareth whō ſo eateth ſhall lyue euer yt eateth bodely bread lyueth euer ye may ſee father yt eate mā na yet dead therfore materiall bread bodely foode may geue life eternall theſe wordes onely offende hated chriſt alſo ſome hys diſciples offended ſayd text merueyled trifleth truth ſaid hard ſaying may theſe diſciples yet ſtoke leſſe chriſtes viſible fleſhe barke wordes iewes doth beleuing haue ſpoken naturall body eaten teth offence chriſt ſeyng ſayd doth iewes alſo diſciples chriſte offended wordes offend ye ſay ye ſee ſonne mā aſcend thether offend eate fleſh ſhal much offend eate body ſhalbe gone ſight aſcended heauen ſittyng right hand father vntill come wēt iudgement might chriſt haue inſtructed diſciples truth eatyng fleſh forme bread ben meaning left neuer perplexitie doubt ſought wayes ſimilitudes familiar exāples teath playnly neuer ſpake ſo hard parable perceiued • eble ignoraunce anone helpte declared yea ſometymes preuented aſkyng owne declaration thinke ye ſo yes verely came teach v leaue v doubt ignoraunce eſpecially chief pointe ſaluation ſtādeth belefe death ſinnes wherefore put doubt concerning eatyng fleſh drinkyng hys bloud ſhould giue euerlaſtyng lyfe tooke body eaten teeth hee ſayd ſpirite giueth chriſt doth playnly ſhew ſpirituall eatyng fleſhly eatyng body profiteth lyfe fleſh profiteth nothyng eaten ye meane ſo carnally ſpirituall meate heare ſpeake ſpirite draweth harte men faith ſo refreſheth ghoſtly ye therefore carnall thinke ſpeake fleſh eaten bodely ſo profiteth nothing long ye without vnderſtādyng ſpirite tell giueth lyfe fleſhe profiteth nothyng eate beleue ſhalbe crucified ſuffer redemption world profiteth ye thus beleue eate ye fleſhe drinke bloud ye beleue ſuffer ſinnes veritie hath ſpoken theſe woordes fleſh profiteth nothyng therefore falſe iewes diſciples murmured diſputed hys fleſh ſhould eaten offeryng thereof ſinnes chriſt ment therfore ſure anker hold v agaynſt obiections papiſtes eatyng chriſtes body ſay forme bread chriſt ſayd fleſh profiteth eating chriſtes fleſh profited nothyng nothyng meaning eate bodely key ſolueth al argumentes openeth way ſhewe v falſe abhominable blaſphemous lye vppon chriſtes wordes vttereth ſleigh iuggling ouer bread mainteine antichriſtes kyngdome therewith thus chriſt declared taught bodely eatyng materiall body eatyng ſpirite fayth added ſaying wordes wordes chriſte ſpirit life ſpeake vnto ſpirite lyfe ſay matter haue ſpoken ſo many wordes muſt ſpiritually vnderſtand giue life euerlaſtyng wherfore cauſe ye vnderſtād ye beleue lo concluſion sermon chriſt god man ſet fleſh receiued fayth ſhould broken ſuffer ſinnes could eate ſpiritually bycauſe beleued wherefore many diſciples fell frō walked ſayd twelue ye go away symon peter aunſwered lord ſhal go thou haſt wordes euerlaſtyng life beleue ſure thou art chriſt ſonne liuyng god manifeſt peter felowes vnderſtode eatyng drinkyng chriſt perfitely taught ſtode belefe chriſt aūſwere teſtifieth matter ſtand vpon ſo deepe miracle papiſtes fayne without word god comprehended vnder common ſenſes ſhould eate hys body beyng vnder forme bread long depe thicke brode hanged vpon croſſe beyng yet feble fayth confirmed holy ghoſt muſt nedes haue woundered ſtoned ſtaggerde haue bene inquiſitiue ſo ſtraunge chriſtes diſciples vnderſtode chriſt ſpeake ſpiritually beleued matter neither doubted marueiled murmured thyng offended maner ſpech yt ſlipt away aunſwered euer obey cōmmaūding thē muſt needes folow theſe wordes cō ſecratiō houſeled vnconſecrated bread el eaten leſt wiſe part ere chriſt conſecrated yea foloweth chriſtes handes • mouthes chriſt conſecrated ſo haue conſecrated whē diſciples handes mouthes rather theyr bellyes manifeſt chriſt conſecrated chriſt conſecrated bread deliuered apoſtles eate bread deliuered diſciples bad eate diſtributed eaten ſhould haue aſked hym sacrament religion aunſwere chriſt ſayd body whiche broken thyng ye true meanyng ſignificatiō sacrament body bloud chriſt remembraunce ſay ſo oft ye celebrate one ſaw body broken bread yet ſuffered bread broken denided peeces euery one twelue takyng eatyng peece hee ſayd body c ſith ſticke ſo faſt litteral ſenſe vpon theſe wordes body c aſke more litterall ſenſe • loſt hym thyng hee ſheweth v firſt worde pronoune demonſtratiue hoc engliſhe ye ſhew v thē bread ſo bread chriſtes body chriſtes body bread ſaying litterall ſenſe hygh hereſie ſaying burned lord cobham alſo aſke whether chriſt ſpeakyng theſe wordes body c bread hand wherwith houſeled diſciples deliuered commaunded eate order woordes text playnly proue declared marke 14 marke telleth grammarian teach thē lay old eyen ſpectacles chriſtes wordes ſpoken cup luke 22 luke paul ſaying cup newe teſtament bloude 1 cor 11 ſhed chriſt calleth wyne cup ſelfe cuppe whiche euery man knoweth ſay conuerted turned body bread tranſubſtantiated body farre lo ſtraunge thomiſticall ſenſe flat letter ye ſo addictt letter fray ye commō people litteral ſenſe bugge tellyng thē letter ſlayeth neither letter ſpirite may bridle hold ſtiffe necked heades alſo ye ſhall vnderſtand chriſt iohn 6 rebuked iewes theyr litterall ſenſe carnall vnderſtandyng ſpirituall woordes ſaying fleſh profiteth supper eatyng paſſelambe lyke circumciſiō people iſraell rekened god people ſeueral gē tile ſo baptiſme rekened bee conſigned vnto chriſtes church ſeuerall frō iewes paynyms c paſſeouer ſay ſolēne feaſt yearely eatyng paſſelambe outward token perſeueraunce religion remembraunce paſſage egypt lande chanaan ſo eatyng lordes supper whiche chriſt luke 12 1 cor 5 paule called paſſeouer token perſeueraunce chriſten profeſſion baptiſme alſo thankes giuyng ioyfull remēbraunce redemption frō ſinne death exod 12 hell chriſtes death figure supper new paſſeouer thus written ye entred land whiche lord god ſhall giue accordyng promiſe ye ſhall kepe ceremonie child aſke religion ye ſhall aunſwere ſacrifice paſſyng ouer lord lord paſſed foorth houſes child iſraell egypt ſmityng egyptiās deliuering houſes eatyng therfore paſſe lambe figure lordes supper▪ whiche figure houre come y• would ceaſſe giue place vnto veritie ſhadow vaniſh away preſence body ſayd thus feruent deſire long eate luke 22 paſſeouer ere ſuffer agayne let v compare figure truth old paſſeouer new diligētly conſider propertie ſpeakyng either thē let v expende ſucceſſion imitation paſchall lambe eaten sacrament inſtituted tyme new ſucceding old mediatour chriſt betwen ſitting supper celebrating preſence put old bryng new either ſuch like compoſition wordes ſuch affinitie proportiō ſpech ſuch ſimilitude propertie new ſo correſpōdyng thynges old old declareth new wherfore inſtituted vſe therof begyn circumciſion twoo thynges conſidered sacramentes figure baptiſme ye ſhall vn derſtand ſuch rite sacramētes two thinges conſidered wit thyng ſigne thyng thynge wherfore ſigne inſtituted ſignifie circumciſion thyng couenaunt people god ſigne cuttyng foreſkinne preuy mēber paſſeouer thing remē preſent faithfull vnto worldes end hee ſayd vnto hys diſciples goe scripture many ſhewe chriſt touchyng natural body gone actes 2 hence goe father leaue world ſhall world ye ſhall abyde ſtill world father come thee poore men haue ye euer ſhall ye alwayes haue whē aſcended vnto heauē behold hym ſaw cloude take hys body theyr ſyght faſtnyng eye two men clothed white ſayd vnto ye men galile wherefore ſtand ye thus lookyng vp heauen ieſus taken vp heauen whiche ſhall ſo come agayne euen ye haue ſene going hence would flitte frō chriſt aſcē ded heauen hys litterall playne ſenſe theſe ſo playne wordes ſufficient trow chriſten man certifie hys conſcience chriſt went way bodely aſcendyng heauen whē told diſciples ſo oft bodely departyng maruelous heauy ſad ʋnto whō chriſt ſayd becauſe told iohn 14 16 go hence harte full heauines beleued hym haue ſpokē bodely abſence would neuer haue ſo mourned goyng away becauſe ſo vnderſtode ſo meane wordes ſowned added ſhould haue ſayd ye neuer ſo heauy heauely ſo euer ye take goyng hence yet tell truth expedient goe hence ſhould go hence comforter ſhould come vnto go hence ſhall chriſt •• playne wordes declareth bodely departure world ſend vnto agayne ſame chap come father come world ſhall leaue world agayne go father miſtery thinke ye ſhould theſe ſo manifeſt woordes ſpeake darke parable dyd meane otherwiſe thē ſpake dyd vnderſtand goyng hence ſo oftē repeted tary ſtill dyd meane forſakyng leauyng world inuiſible beyng ſtill world body ſurely meant faithfully playnly wordes ſowned euen ſo dyd hys diſciples without maruelyng vnderſtand aunſwered ſaying lo ſpeakeſt thou apertly neither ſpeakeſt thou prouerbe darke prouerbe ſubtile ridle bene meant goyng hence haue • aryed ſtill forſakyng world abyde ſtill world going hence father bodely aſcention inuiſible would intrepret plaine ſentence thus go hence ſaye tary ſtill forſake world goe father ſay inuiſible yet abyde ſtill world bodely concernyng godhead euer father place neuer ſpake ſuch woordes chriſt ſayd death chriſt playnlye ſhewed vnto diſciples muſt depart world father heauen hand vnto diſciples agaynē forſake world go father ye ſhall tary ſtill world expound ſakyng world tary ſtill bodely inuiſible lyke expoſition interprete tarying ſtill diſciples tyme gone hence bodely viſible chriſt dyd ſet theſe contraryes one agaynſt declare ech tary ſtill dyd fayning chriſt body inuiſible many place thē ſo great yet ſo litle place decerned ſenſes glorified vnglorified paſſible impaſſible wote neare imagine make maker without woorde yea cleane agaynſt wordes holy scripture ſurely imagination ſo ſaying bryng freſh hereſie great heretike marcian ſaid 〈◊〉 marc •… chriſt tooke phantaſticall body ſo neither verely borne ſuffered roſe aſcended verely neither man hereſie tertulian confuteth chriſt toke verely nature ſuch paſſible mortall body beare v ſaue without maner ſynne ſuch body ſuffered verely roſe agayne death ſuch glorified body immortall poore would tarye ſome rich went theyr way dronken full poore departed hungry dry whiche token equall diſtribution bread drinke rich contemned poore ſo became ſclaū derous giltie body bloud chriſt honour agayn body though diuers member diuers office yet diſcorde among euery member bee neuer ſo low vyle yet doth miniſter ſerue together hold vp helpe whole body conſideratiō theſe cōpariſons ſo eloquently ſo plenteouſly ſo liuely doth paule ſet forth xij chap mā cā deſire bryng v conſideration diſcretion body chriſt congregation without whiche conſideration diſcretion thruſt ſelues come alledgeth hym belyeth decolamp • dius zuingitus tertulian chriſoſtome auſten falſely ſometyme addyng wordes ſometyme takyng away theyr ſentēces ſaying playne falſe hee belyeth man departed firſt incomparable learnyng verye ſpirituall iudgement would ſuffer hym ignoraunt vnderſtandyng theſe old holy doctours dare ſay vnder ſtode well couſcience faythfulnes would ſuffer hym falſely peruert belyeth peruerteth chriſt paule holy scripture mā thus dealt theſe doctours ſayinges luther agaynſt cōtende matter would haue left vntold hym chriſtē reader put thee loke epiſtle reader doubt haue theſe doctours wordes latine engliſhe firſt heare tertulian thou muſt firſt vnderſtād hereticke called marcion ſaying chriſt tooke hym body man imagiued phantaſticall body put lyſted ſo haue ben borne verely virgine mary yet haue ſuffered verely death c agaynſt thus writeth tertulian hys fourth booke profeſſus ita que ſe concupiſcentia concupiſſe tertulian edere paſcha vt ſuum acceptum panem diſtributum diſcipulis corpus ſuuni illum fecit hoc eſt corpus meum dicendo id eſt figura corporis mei figura autem non fuiſſet niſi veritatis eſſet corpus caeterū vacuum re quod eſt phantaſma figuram capere non poſſet whiche wordes thus engliſh ſpoken chriſt whiche acknowledgyng hym ſelfe feruent deſire longed eate paſſeouer bread taken diſtributyng diſciples made body ſaying wor • e tertulian body ſay figure body figure bene none except body voyde thyng phantaſie receaue figure playne body old holy doctour much ſay figure ſigne repreſenteth ſignifieth body alſo thus ſayeth auſten lex dicit non eſſe manducandū ſanguinem quod anima ſit ſanguis quod lex dicit ſanguis auſtē cap xij againſt • dim • nt eſt anima eſſe poſitum dicimus ſicut alia multa penè omnia scripturarum illarum sacramenta ſignis figuris plenum futurae predicationis quae iam per dominum noſtrum ieſum chriſtum declarata eſt c poſſum etiam interpretari praeceptum illud ſigno eſſe poſitum non enim dubitauit dominus dicere hoc eſt corpus meum quum ſignum daret corporis ſui sic eſt enim ſanguis anima quomodo petra erat chriſtus nec tamen quum haec diceret ait petra ſignificabat chriſtum ſed ait petra erat chriſtus quae rurſus ne carnaliter acciperetur ſpiritualem illam vocat id eſt ſpiritualiter intelligi docet whiche woordes thus engliſh law ſayeth bloud ſhould gene 6 leui 7 deut 12 eatē becauſe life bloud precepte lawe bycauſe bloud lyfe affirme ſet like many almoſt innumerable ſacramentes thoſe scripture full ſignes figure preachyng come whiche declared lord ieſu chriſt c may interprete precept bee layed ſigne lord doubted ſay body hee gaue ſigne body euen ſo bloud lyfe ſtone chriſt auſten calleth sacrament ſigne body yet ſayd theſe wordes ſayd ſtone ſignified chriſt ſayd ſtone chriſt whiche leſt ſhould taken carnally hee calleth ſpirituall ſay teacheth bee vnderſtand ſpiritually more litteral ſenſe materiall meate ſhall ye heare chriſoſtome hom • 83 operiti • imperfect • nihil ſenſibile tradidit chriſtus licet dederit panem vinum non quod panis vinum non ſint ſenſibilia ſed quod illis mentem haerere noluit nam ſuum corpus quod eſt panis vitae ſubuehit dicens hoc eſt corpus meum perinde ac dicat hoc licet panis ſit ſignificat tamen tibi corpus thus engliſhe chriſt geuyng bread wyne gaue ſenſible thyng bread wine ſenſible would mynde ſticke ſtill hee lifted v vp hys bodye chriſoſtome calleth ſacramēt ſigne chriſtes body bread lyfe ſaying body though ſhould ſay though bread yet ſignifieth vnto thee body iudge thou chriſtē reader whether reporteth right mā alledgeth theſe holy doctours haue ye pure vnderſtandyng confutatiō papiſtes gloſes wordes lordes ſupper confirmed old holy doctours body much ſay ſignifieth body bloud ſignifieth bloud yet neuer ſuch maner ſpeaking ſcripture ſay conuerted tranſubſtanciated conteined thyng conuerted chaunged kepyng ſtill forme quality quantity c ſay body papiſtes wre • ters peruerters ſcriptures ſay bread conuerted body bread abydyng ſtill faſhion taſt colour waight c chriſt hee conuerted water wyne dyd leaue fourme colour taſt ſtill water ſo bene chaungyng let couetous conuerters choppe chaunge bread wyne till feele ſee taſt neither bread wyne beleue ſo bryng word god falſe iugglyng feele finger ende ſee halfe eye taſt toūgs end know wyttes vnderſtandyng ſo manifeſtly perceiued openly long agoe antichriſtes chriſt apoſtles warned v come laſt tyme ſay conuerſion papiſtes ſay trā ſubſtantion done miracle made miracle muſt euery one hee ſay maſſe make v many miracle markes more churche oue great miracle chriſts body ſhould come ſo ſodenly inuiſible ſo oft heauen ſuch miracle worde god neuer knew ſo great body ſhould conteyned ſo litle place one body ſhould ſo many place two bodyes one place eaten neither cater feelyng body eaten ſufferyng feelyng teeth eater many moe maruelous like miracle rather abſurdities bread wyne muſt forme colour taſt wayght broken c yet neither bread wyne belefe except burned thē bycauſe beleue iugglyng caſtes miſchieuous miracle maker cruell conuerters bloudy butcher hearke chriſten reader ſhall learne thee knowe chriſtes playne true miracle ſleighty iuggling theſe crafty cōneyers chriſt would neuer haue done miracle men beleued hym onely hys woordes hee ſayd firſt theſe wordes body mā doubted man vnbeleue wherfore theſe wordes muſt needes bee playne ſingle pure without miracle theſe iij braunches thre dayes without ſubtile tranſubſtantiation ſuch inſenſible conuerſion falſe miracle true miracle done let forth glory god chriſt wrought miracle glory god declare hym ſelfe god man ſo chriſtes miracle cōprehended vnder man ſences commō wyttes bryng ſuch knowledge vnto vnderſtā dyng chaunged water wyne miracle firſt receiued ſight open eye taſted mouth ſo conuayed vnto vnderſtandyng though chriſt dyd miracle declare h • ſelfe god man neither ſee taſt miracle yet heare ſee read ſo vnderſtād miracle done chriſt whē reſtored ſight blynd healed lame clenſed leproſe reared dead ſeen heard ſo comprehended vnder moſt ſwete ſenſes enemyes compelled coufeſſe miracle miracle maker make dayly ſo oft ſo many ſo farre cleare poynt miracle matter neither ſhalbe cōtained comprehē ded 〈…〉 vnder fiue wittes rather delude deceyue ſight taſt feelyng hearyng ſmellyng ye fayth vnderſtandyng beware therefore theſe miſchieuous miracle maker theyr owne glory profite kill thee thou beleueſt lye beware ſay thoſe marchauntes ſell ware ſuffer thee ſee taſt touch ſhewe white thou muſt beleue blacke geue 〈…〉 bread thou muſt beleue without word flocke certeyne dayes diſcretion zeale godward come together celebrate lordes supper aſſemble curate good doctrine al ſuch miniſters haue cure ſoules vſe flocke would propone declare firſt texte paule examination greatly offended committed ye ſtockes ſitten long tyme almoſt pined hunger would declare laſt deſired ye schoolemaſter towne might brought vnto tyme one leonard coxe man well learned aſſone came vnto frith latyn tongue began bewaile captiuitie ſchoole maſter ouercome eloquence onely take pitie compaſſion vpon alſo began loue embrace ſuch excellent witt diſpoſition vnlooked eſpecially ſuche ſtate myſery afterward conferring togither vpon many thinges touching ʋniuerſities schooles tonges fell frō latyn tongue greeke wherein frith ſo inflame loue ſayd ſchoole maſter towardes brought merueilous admiration eſpecially ſchoolemaſter hard ſo promptly hart reheareſe homer verſes firſt booke iliades wher vpon ſchoolemaſter went ſpeede vnto ye magiſtrates greuouſly cōplayning iniury ſhewe vnto ſo excellent innocent yong man ſo helpe ſayde ſchoolemaſter ſaid frith freely ſet libertie ſauetie cātynued long great hatred deadly perſute sir thomas tyme chauncelor england perſecuted land sea beſettyng wayes hauens porte yea promyſing great rewardes man could bring hym newes tydinges hym thus frith euery part beſet trouble knowing way turne hym ſought ſome place vnto whoſe name william holt taylour feyning bare great frendſhip vnto ſo ſlattered himſelfe vtterly voyde ſuſpicious nature began communicate vnto secretes among entred longe diſcourſe ſacrament falſe brother booke departed praye long watched forth caried ſayde book • vnto sir thomas reioyced litle hauing thereof forthwith whetted wittes cauled ſpirites togither meaning refute opinion contrary booke could doe yet attempted doe aſmuch might laſt wrote booke agaynſt copie whereof came frithes handes although priſoner tower deſtitute bookes conference yet aunſwered omitting nothing man coulde deſire perfect abſolute handeling matter beſide theſe cōmendations afore ſayde learned yong man alſo frendly prudent moderation vttering trueth ioyned learned godlines vertue hath alwayes ſo much preuayled church chriſt without good giftes knowledge neuer ſo great greatly profite oftentimes doe much hurt matter neceſſitie moue contend ready graunt thinges quietnes ſake ſufficiently vnderſtandyng ſcriptures time long • ſelfe writyng vpon xviij article many pointes goſpels scripture diſcuſſed diligētly clearely vnderſtand haue bene tymes paſt addeth furthermore diuerſe place
