ſaythe deny hell •… ſuche feare god 〈◊〉 cō maundements come hys probation nothyng ſayd whych paul confyrmeth damp • ton chryſt ieſu walke fleſh ſprite whych thorow chryſte wythoute ſpotte wrynkle blame ſo though raſtel appeare hymſelfe conclude lyke ſage philoſopher yet anſwer cō cludeth lyke ignorante sophyſter mē may ſée foloweth paule fryth ſay hel contrarywiſe foloweth heauē good euil ſo is▪ hell good euill heauen raſtelles chryſten men whych contynue ſtyll ſynne ergo heauen deuil theyr father yet heauen chryſte hys electe haue declared chryſtes elect ſynners ſynners nowe bycauſe ſhoulde miſtake tertes iohn whych alleaged wyll ſhew commyt ſynne whych dyd alſo fufficiently touch anſwer agaynſt raſtels dialoge euen two leaues frō ende yet wyll touche agayne bycauſe ſhall thyncke woulde leade ignorance darkneſſe two partes faythfull two partes man outwarde man inward man man whych rebell eche agaynſte contynuall ſtryfe haue diuers name ſerypture one called inward man heart mynde wyll ſpryte called outward man rebellyous membres bodye ſynne fleſhe theſe faythfull man kéepe contynuall warre allbeit one ſubdued taken pryſonner yet neuer conſenteth hys ennemy leaue neyther make peace wyth hym wyll laboure wyll call thynketh wyll helpe hym deliuered hys ennemie warreth vppon hym freſhe tyme faithfull man brought knowledge god beléeueth chryſt hath mynde renued ſpryte god conſenteth lawe god good ryghteous holy beginneth loue lawe hath deſire fulfill lawe god deſpyſe hys heauenly father looke howe much loueth lawe countyng ryghtwiſe holye euen ſo muche doth hate ſynne whych howe inward mā reſiſteth aſſaultes outward man lawe forbiddeth abhoreth hys heart inward man albeit outwarde man rebellious membres time beſéege take hym captyue vnder ſynne yet doth inward man conſent thys ſynne good lawe naught whych forbyddeth neyther dothe heart delighte thys ſame ſynne neyther delyght ſuche ſynne bycauſe ſpirite god teſtyfieth vnto hym abhomynable ſyghte god fyghteth inwarde man agaynſte outwarde wyth faythe prayer almoſe déedes faſtyng laboureth faithful man feareth god diſpleaſure ſubdue membres lamenting hath bene ouercome bycauſe feareth diſpleaſe god hys father deſyreth bloud hys ſonne chriſte forgeue whych paſt hys diligence taketh tamyng hys membres recompēce towards god ſinne paſte ſubdue fleſhe yt ſynne thys rebellion paule rom 7 ſaying dyd good thing rom 7 whych would euill whych hated fulfil yt good lawe god hys hart inwarde man deſyred dyd euill touchyng hys fleſhe outwarde man whych hated ſo ſynned hys outwarde man howe thys true committeth ſynne deuill god committeth ſynne paule god yes verely committeth ſynne wyth membres outwarde man yet ſinned ſaythe doe thyng hate mā may cōmit ſinne yet ſinne doe ſynne dwelleth euen lykewyſe faythfull folowers chriſt commit ſynne hate fortune entangled wyth ſynne doe paule ſaith ſynne dwelleth god hathe left exerciſe left yt philiſtians exerciſe nurtoure child iſraell remnauntes sinneremaineth oure outward membres exerciſe inward mā reſiſting ſinne ſinne fortune anye time looke aloft begin raigne ſendeth ſome croſſe aduerſitie ſickneſſe helpe ſuppreſſe thus ſhall long liue deade oure member rebell néedeth neyther purgatorie anye croſſe outwarde man turned vanitie inwarde iohn 15 mā euer pure thorow beléeuing worde god neuer conſented ſinne néedeth nother purgatorie world world come ſubduing outward man therfore lyfe ſhall neuer haue purgatorie marke well ſay reade againe ſhall reade ſhall vnderſtande hathe eares let hym heare ſeconde erroure raſtell layeth charge wold bring people belefe repentance man helpeth remiſſion ſinne prouing ſecond error againſt raſtel taketh ſo great paynes raſtell almoſte beſydes hym ſelfe ſaith would make men frith beléeue forceth whether ſinne ſo brother raſtel verely becauſe allege iohn raſtelwold faine canel cannot tell paule erechiell hieremie quenche hotte fire purgatorie allege aucthorities proue good woorks whervnto anſwer nothing purpoſe prouyng good workes doth neither make purgatorie againſt coulde haue alleaged thoſe textes entended ſelfe proue ſhoulde doe good woorkes neuer knewe chriſten man denie touchyng matter nothyng purpoſe well mighte haue improued bicauſe bryng textes proue father heauē god proue whych neuer manne doubted notwithſtanding raſtel indifferent eye ſpake ſufficiently good woorkes 34 argument againſt hys dialoge let men read place iudge raſtel taketh matter gréeuouſly attempt allege howe iohn paul ſend v chriſt raſtell adde know take away ſinne chriſte becauſe adde worde therfore thinketh cleane deſtroy frith meane put away ſinne chriſte repentance whereunto aunſwere added thys woorde naught authoritie iohn ſaith walke lighte lyght haue felowſhip eche bloud ieſu chriſte hys ſonne purifyeth v frō ſinne wherupon ſay v lyght hys bloud ſufficient chriſten men whych continue ſtill ſinne walke darkeneſſe theyr father deuill muſte ſome meanes ſuche dwell lyght chriſt hys bloud onlye ſufficiēt founde elſe ſhall neuer enter kingdome heauen bicauſe ſhort let raſtell note fynde two manner repentance one without faith two maner repentance ſuche repentaunce iudas raſtels chriſten men continue ſtill ſinne haue latter ende dothe rather purchace halter remiſſion ſinnes repentance foloweth iuſtification remiſſiō ſinnes floriſhing frute faith true repē tance floriſhing frute faith faith perceiue fauor kindneſſe louing father hath ſhewed v ſonne chryſt ieſu hathe reconcyled v vnto hymſelfe bloude hys ſonne thē begin loue hate body ſinne lamēt ſory membres ſo fraile fulfil lawe god ſo mourning bewayling infirmitie cauſeth v abſtaine bothe meat drinke worldly pleaſures pure faſting pure faſting talke vnderſtande thys repentaunce commeth purge ſinnes cōmitted taketh occaſyon ſinnes committed knowe poyſon remained oure ſleſhe ſéeketh meanes make v hate body ſinne ſubdue wyth manner work god hathe appoynted entente ſhould time come diſpleaſe god moſte merciful father gentleneſſe ſo often pardoneth forgeueth v haue touched maner repentaunce finde ſcripture helpeth ſhoulde ſinne raſtell dreameth wot expreſſe vttermoſt meane repentāce liuely declared example repentaunce marke example man build houſe dothe coſt muche labor money haue layde ſure foundation tempeſt commeth hys houſe dothe fall ſory repente hathe ſo fooliſhly beſtowed money labor wtſtanding thys great ſorow repentance ſet vp houſe againe whych fallen taketh occaſion ruine houſe teache owner witte againſte time buildeth againe may make ſure foundation euen ſo though thou repent neuer ſo much get remiſſion ſinnes paſt muſte pardoned onely faithe chriſtes bloude neuertheleſſe dothe teache thée witte learne thée tame thy body ſubdue caſt lowe foūdacion time thou mayſte better reſiſte aſſaultes deuill worlde fleſhe doth frith teach repentaunce let worlde take chryſtes ſhéepe doe heare voyce ¶ third errour raſtell layeth againſt would make men beleue need penaunce ſatiſfaction ſinnes every childe may aunſwer thys euer read perceaue wrote repentaunce take repentaunce ſorow mourning followeth crime euen ſo call penaunce good workes enſue repentaunce theſe good woorks folow mortifie member good workes mortify membres exerciſe v god commaundementes ſinne get remiſſion ſinne paſt call repentaunce yet neyther deſtroy ſorowing ſinne good workes falſly reporteth v teach ought done fruites fayth mortifie member profitable neighbour teſtinony vnto v good workes fruites fayth child heauenly father example ſay neither ſunne moone iuſtiūe v purchaſe remiſſion ſinnes yet woulde raſtell ſhould ſay deny deſtroy ſunne moone ſay without haue light without touching ſolution penaunce taking largeſt ſignification good workes taking paynes ſatiſfaction ſinnes muſt tell againe two manner ſatiſfactions one god neighbour god two maner ſatiſfactions world make ſatiſfaction one crime inſomuch euery graſſe ground mā holy euer paule peter ſhoulde pray vnto god theyr life long one crime yet could make ſatiſfaction onely bloud chriſt hath made ful ſatiſfaction vnto god ſuch crime heb 7 el hebr 7 none remedye wee ſhould periſh ſatiſfaction neighbour haue offended satiſfactiō neighbour bound pacifie two agrée lawes realme determine betwéene v defamed bound pacifie hym reſtore hym hys good name againe haue murdered man lawes realme muſt dye pacifie neighbour common wealth yet ſure raſtell ſo childiſh thincke thys ciuyle ſatiſfaction verye ſatiſfaction pacifieth god wrath breaking law thou murther man ſhould dye hundred time yet except thou haue ſatiſfaction chriſtes bloud thou ſhalt damned thereto ſo ſpake tēporall paine inſtituted god intent ſhould ſatiſfye god wrath therby plaine booke raſtell could ſée ¶ fourth errour layeth agaynſt would perſwade people good work ar nothing auailable come fourthe errour raſtell vntruly reporteth would perſuade people good woorkes done man thys worlde nothing auayleable vnto doth hurt hindraunce vnto man though neuer none becauſe ſay iuſtifie god therfore thinketh men would vnderſtand wiſely doth argue thing auayleable muſt deſire put hys ſpectacles looke agayne vppon booke ſhall finde theſe woordes peraduenture good workes done thou wilt aunſwere vnto ſhall good déedes aunſwere yes thou wilt aunſwere wherefore aunſwere thou muſt becauſe god hath commaunded thē aunſwere thou art lyuing thys worlde men haſt conuerſation therfore hath god appoynted thée thou ſhalt profite thy neighbour taming thy fleſh paule teſtifieth ephe 2 worke chriſt ieſu epheſ 2 vnto good woorkes woorkes god hath prepared ſhoulde walke theſe woorkes god would haue v vnfaithfull might ſée godly vertuous conuerſation faythfull therby compelled glorifie father heauen math 5 ſo profitable vnto thy neighbour good workes profitable neighbour alſo teſtimony child god alſo teſtimony vnto thée man may know thou art right ſonne thy heauē ly father chriſt vnto thy neighbour teacheth ought theſe woorkes without hauyng reſpect eyther heauen hell attending charitie wealth neighbour c wonder raſtell aſhamed ſay would make beleue auaylable therfore good reader note wordes firſt ſay muſt becauſe god hath commaūded auaylable kéepe commaundements god ſecondaryly ſay profite neyghbour auaylable thirdly ſay tame fleſh auailable fourthly ſay glory god auailable fiftly ſay teſtimony doth mē may know yt yt ſonne god auaylable belyke raſtell coū teth nothing auailable iuſtifieth god ſay ſonne auaylable becauſe iuſtifieth fire auaylable eye bycauſe iuſtifieth c raſtell ſayth make wonder worke yt scripture alledgeth certaine textes yt ought good workes neuer denyed thereupon would conclude woorkes ſaue iuſtifie playeth ball luſtly ouer corde god would ſtode poſt right way hytte ſo full made ball reboūd ouer agayne backward alledgyng purpoſe paule ſayth ephe 2 hath cleane loſt game ephe 2 wordes theſe grace ſaued fayth iuſtified grace fayth whiche ſelues gift god gift god woorkes man ſhould glorifie hym ſelfe workes created god chriſt ieſu whiche god hath prepared ſhould walke becauſe would haue latter ende text ſerue hys purpoſe whiche teacheth good workes neuer denyed hée bryngeth thyng whiche cleane confuteth opiniō opinion place hath laboured proue ſaued good workes marke alledgeth paule grace ſaued fayth gift god workes man ſhould glorifie ſelfe paule ſaith plainly ſaluatiō workes ſo hath raſtell caſt raſtell hath ouerthrowē hath built ſet vp built may likened ſhrewde cowe whiche ſhe hath geuen large meſſe milke turneth downe hele thus haue aunſwered much raſtels treatiſe could get whiche may come handes ſhall diligence diſcloſe hys diſceite ſo god geue leaue kéepe court hym ſhall wynne litle except conuey balles craftly yet truth ſay play euen hand maner man bound poſt ſo well beſtow play libertie may haue ſuch bookes neceſſary neither yet penne inke ne paper onely ſecretly ſo continuall feare lefetenaūt kéeper leſt ſhould eſpy ſuch thyng therfore litle meruell though woorke vnperfite ſoeuer heare ihon frith ſtreightly kept keyes ryng doore ſtrayte much cōueyed way notable thyng bene mynde cleane loſt therfore beſech thée good reader count thyng borne ſeaſon many cauſes haue perfeite forme ſhape pardon rudenes imperfection ¶ finis iohn frithes iudgement vpon maſter william tracyes teſtament 1531 ¶ iohn frith christian reader nothyng world ſo firme ſtable godly may vndermined frowardlye wreſted mē ſpecially voyd charitie euident william tracyes teſtamēt laſt left agaynſt many men long continuaunce haue blaſphemouſly barked whether godly zeale daſing brayne let mē iudge dare boldly profeſſe godly ſayinges vngodly hād led thyng ſo iuſtly aſcribe vnto ignoraunce vnto rancour vnto fury almoſt ſayd conferred thing vnto rule charitie enuyeth whiche puffed vp whiche ſtyrred vengeaunce thinketh none euill ſuffereth thing beleueth thyngs truſteth thing beareth thyngs would ſo heddely haue cōdēned thoſe thynges whiche might haue bene full deuoutly expounded howbeit haue onely attēpted thyng haue proceeded vnto ſuch madnes haue taken vppon ſtryue dead folkes moſt common ieſt euery mās mouth maker teſtament departed buryed tooke vp hys body burnt thing declared furye although felt fire therfore hūbly require moſt redoubted prince withall noble preſent aſſembly euen thyngs right depende iudgement euen ſo would diſcret aduiſe cure diſeaſe ponderyng thynges equall ballaunce ſhall enormous facte looked vppon worthy correction condition common wealth ſhalbe quyet marke therefore thynges ſo cruelly condemne maſter tracie name god amen william tracie todyngton countie gloceter eſquier make teſtamēt laſt hereafter foloweth c reſt whiche teſtament ſhall fynde woorkes william tyndall fol 429 iohn frith maruell ſomwhat improue mynde ſo intoxicate nothyng note blacke coale yet may eſtabliſhed teſtimony scripture fayth ſure perſuaſion mynde god hys goodneſſe towardes v wheras ſure perſuaſion mynde doubtyng miſtruſt douteth like floude ſea toſſed wyndes caried violence let man thinke ſhal obtaine thing god ia therfore auſten ſayth doubt ſhalbe holy ſéede furthermore wheras looketh grace merites chriſt obtaine remiſſion ſinnes ſurely faythful ſaying worthy cōmended euen ſame peter profeſſed actes xv hee ſayth vnto hym prophetes beare witnes name many beleue hym ſhall receiue remiſſiō ſinnes moreouer truſteth chriſt haue reſurrectiō body ſoule haue cauſe blame hym thus doth paule argue chriſt riſen ſhall alſo ryſe chriſt riſen ſhall riſe chriſt riſen ſoule leſt hell therfore ſhall alſo riſe whō chriſt ſhall bryng hym immortall body ſoule 1 cor 15 therfore doth righteouſly godly deduce reſurrectiō chriſtes father hath geuē v thinges el ſhould ſome gather woordes hee ſhould recount ſoule mortall whiche thyng iudgement ſuttelly gathered either truly charitably ſeyng neuer chriſten man euer ſo thought paganes godly zeale brotherly loue whiche cauſed ſo ſurmiſe good man would dreame ſuch thyng pray ſhould ſay ſoule doth verely riſe chriſt riſing filth ſinne doth enter body new conuerſation life whiche ſhall leade together without poſſibilitie ſinnyng ſay alſo god certaine phraſe scripture ariſeth openeth vnto v hys power preſence may ſay ſame thing ſoule meane ſeaſon ſemeth lye ſecret ſhal expreſſe vnto v chriſt power preſence takyng agayne naturall body ſhould ye condemne theſe thynges man receiue venome thoſe wordes except hee haue ſuch ſpyderous nature turne hony combe perilous poyſon therfore let v looke reſidue maſter tracie touching wealth ſoule c frith héere onely cleaueth god hys mercye ſurely perſuaded according teſtimony peter ſo euer beléeueth hym thorowe hys name ſhall receyue remiſſyon ſynnes act 15 paule alſo affirmeth ſo euer truſteth ſhall cōfounded ro 10 denye thys moſte true vnderſtande fayth formed wyth hope charitie yt apoſtle calleth faith worketh charitie gal 5 ſith theſe thing may expounded ſo purely forſoothe vttereth owne enuie woulde otherwiſe wreſt mynde maker thys teſtament touchyng addition particle wtout mannes worke woorkes ſéemeth reſpect vnto thys ſaying peter whych declareth none name vnder heauen geuen vnto men whych ſhoulde ſaued act 4 beſides paule committeth power ſanctifying chriſt heb 2 ſayth bothe ſanctifyeth ſay chriſte ſanctified ſay faithfull one god ſurely labored precel eche loue charitie ſhould condempne innocent ſhoulde rather meaſure hys wordes rule charitie ſo muche thyng firſt ſight appeare wycked yet ſhoulde take beſt ſenſe iudging wickedly oure brother referring ſecreate iudgemente vnto chriſte whych diſceyued thoughe diſceiued pretence charitie yet therein may reioyſe therfore would lothe condempne innocent lette v paſſe theſe thing ſée foloweth maſter tracie ground beleefe one god c frith looke ſo ſowerly good brother rather giue hym great thankes ſyth hathe opened vnto ſuche proper diſtinction whiche may eſcape ſcholaſticall ſnares maſes deſerueth name mid dealer god became man make men god cā right called mid dealer betwéene god man god man therefore ſithe haue ſuche mid dealer poyntes hath proued infirmitie ſauing ſinne exalted aboue heauens ſitteth right hande god hath thyngs obtayned nexte power vnto whoſe emperie thing depende lette v come wyth ſure confidence vnto throne grace heb 4 calleth peticioners whyche receyue grace able empreſſe power therof man dothe god diſtribute wyth hys finger ſay ſpirite god thorowe chriſte maruell angrye hathe done ſuch great pleaſure howe doe aſcribe condemnation rather vnto canoniſtes vnto deuines godly deuines wold neuer dote ſo farre condemne ſo proper ſayings peraduenture myght moue theyr pacience diſtribute portion hys goodes entent anye man ſhould ſay doe weale hys ſoule ſo ſore afraide youre market afraid ye haue ſalues inoughe ſouple ſore ye knowe bounde vnder payne dampnation diſtribute goodes faſhion thoſe holy father ſhreud cauſe cō tinuing long penurie ſcant lefte theyr departing halfe pennie thou wilt peraduenture ſay ſhall ſuffer gréenous paine purgatorie ſo yet may quēched leſſe coſt labor pope pardon ready hand bothe crime paine remytted verily ſuch plentie place canne ſcantly beléeue liueth anye man worth halfe peny ſure ſome pardones ſtore thys man innumerable notwithſtanding diſtribution neceſſitie vnto dampned profiteth nothing dampned ſure ſaluation ye ſo hot againſt thys man hys goodes owne power ſhall giue reckoning vnto god vnto héere maye ſée howe light iudgement haue condempned theſe thing nowe let v ponder reſidue maſter tracie touching burying body c frith hath offēded rehearſeth nothing woords auſtine improue theſe thinges reproue auſtine himſelfe finde meanes allow auſten charitably expound woordes admit ſame fauour vnto brother eſpecially ſéeing charitie requireth beſides man deny theſe thinges true although auſtines auctoritie reputation theſe thinges ſo great value god chriſt euill prouided martyres whoſe body commonly caſt conſumed fire wild beaſtes notwithſtanding would afrayde ſay thing worſe burning theyr body tearing péeces therefore charitable towards brother ponder woordes rather saint auſtines ſomewhat iuſtly tracie touching diſtribution temporall good purpoſe c frith man doubteth fayth roote trée quickning power good fruites ſpring therfore neceſſary fayth preſent el ſhould looke good workes vayne without fayth impoſſible pleaſe god heb 11 inſomuch auſtine called thoſe woorkes done fayth ſwift running way moreouer merite cannot properly aſcribed vnto workes doth euangeliſt teach v ſaying whē ye haue done thing commaunded ſay vnprofitable ſeruaunts haue done duety luke 17 ſaying doth maner feare v putting confidence workes ſo glorious pride hygh minde excluded merite harke auſtine ſayth death lorde merite without merite long mercifull lorde fayleth c death lorde profite except receaue fayth therfore rekoneth right wel faith chriſt merite meane fayth worketh charitie ſay fayth formed hope charitie dead hiſtoricall fayth deuils haue tremble iam 2 furthermore auſtine iudgeth merite expreſſeth theſe woordes marke pſalme proud head receiue crowne ſayth redéemed thy life corruption crowneth thée ſayth pſalme hereuppon woulde man ſay crowneth thée merites graunt vertue hath done haue deſerued fréely geuen geue care rather pleaſure thine owne ſaying euery man lyer heare god ſayth crowneth thée compaſſion mercy mercy crowneth thée compaſſion crowneth thée thou waſt worthye ſhoulde call thée whome ſhould iuſtifie called thée whome ſhoulde glorifie iuſtifieth thée remnantes ſaued election grace fauour rom 11 grace thē woorkes grace grace rom 4 vnto hym worketh rewarde imputed grace duety rom 4 apoſtle ſayth grace duety crowneth thée compaſſion mercy thy merites haue procéeded god ſayth vnto thée boult thy good merites thou ſhalte finde giftes righteouſneſſe god meaning righteouſneſſe whereby himſelfe right wiſe righteouſnes wherewith iuſtifieth whome maketh rightwiſe wicked theſe auſtines wordes finallye let moue addeth good woorke maketh good man rather good man maketh woorke good man eyther good euyll euill good euill according chriſtes teſtimonye rotten trée beareth good fruite math 7 agayne ſayeth howe ſay well ſéeing ſelues euill math 12 good ſhall alſo bring foorth good fruite ſeaſon howbeit fruite maketh man good except man firſt good bring foorth good fruite trée knowne fruite therfore fayth quickening roote muſt euer goe whyche wicked maketh v ryghtwiſe good thing workes coulde neuer bring paſſe thys fountayne ſpryng thoſe good woorkes iuſtifie v mē ſaye declare v verye rightwiſe god verely iuſtified roote fayth ſearcheth hart therefore iuſt iudge doth inwardly iuſtifie condemne geuing ſentence according fayth men muſt looke woorkes theyr ſight cannot enter hart therfore firſt geue iudgement woorkes many time deceaued vnder cloke hypocriſie may ſée nothyng good man may expounde well albeit child world wile deceiue thē ſelues enteryng ſo preſumptuouſly god iudgement ſéeke doubt none go ye therfore let charitie guide god charitie though lawyer hart would breake yet muſt néedes iudge chriſtē man ſaith nothyng scripture confirmeth verely iudgement cauſe came ſeaſon euē vngraciouſly vnto canoniſtes cleane ignoraūt scripture therfore condemne thinges read law wherfore renounce ſentence appeale vnto deuines ſoone knowe voyce theyr ſhepheard gladly admitte thoſe thynges allowed scripture whereunto accuſtomed ¶ finis ¶ letter iohn frith wrote vnto faythfull folowers chriſtes goſpell whyles priſoner tower london worde god anno xxxij ¶ grace peace god father sauiour christe ieſu loue lord vnfaynedly amen bee expreſſed dearely beloued lord ioy comfort myhart perceiue woorde god hath wrought continually worketh among ſo finde iohn 2 ſmal number walkyng yt wayes lord accordyng gaue v iohn 15 commaundement willyng ſhould loue ech loued v haue experience fayth teſtifie rom 12 without ſimulation ye loue word toung onely worke veritie iohn 3 triall faythfull hart aduenture onely ayde ſuccour meanes whiche without daunger may admitted vnto v alſo perſonally viſite poore oppreſſed ſée nothyng lackyng vnto thē haue ghoſtly comfort bodely ſuſtenaunce notwith ſtādyng ſtrayte inhibition terrible manacyng theſe worldly ruler euen ready abyde extreme ieoperdies tyraūts imagine euidence haue prepared ſelues croſſe chriſt accordyng vnto councell wiſe man ſayth ſonne thou ſhalt enter way lord prepare thy ſelfe vnto tribulation euidence ye haue caſt accomptes haue wherewith finiſh tower ye haue begon builde doubt luke 14 whiche hath begon worke ſhall glory accō pliſh phil 1 ſame euē vnto commyng lord ſhal giue vnto euery man accordyng déedes albeit god ſecret iudgementes rom 21 time kéepe rod ſome enſue ſteppes yet let ſurely reken vppon doubt whiche deuoutly lyue chriſt muſt ſuffer 2 ti 3 perſecution lord loueth heb 12 correcteth ſcourgeth euery child receaueth child father chaſtiſeth ye vnder correction partaker thē ye baſtardes child neuertheles may ſuppoſe moſt louyng father ſhould becauſe reioiſeth bloud puniſhment doth ſingular profite may partaker holynes remnaunt ſinne whiche frayltie mēbers rebell agaynſt ſpirite cauſing workes go vnparfectly forwardes may ſomedel ſuppreſſed leſt ſhould ſubdue v reigne ouer v haue ſufficiently declared epiſtle booke whiche intreateth purgatory remit thē deſire inſtructed matter theſe thynges god geuen ſpeculation hath pleaſed hym put vre practiſe vpon euer thought yet doe thinke walke god word would coſt life one tyme albeit kynges grace ſhould take fauour ſuffer bloudy edomites haue pleaſures vpon yet thinke eſcaped god hath onely differred ſeaſon intent ſhould woorke ſomewhat hath appointed ſo vſe vnto glory beſeche faythfull follower lord arme ſelues ſame ſuppoſition markyng thē ſelues ſigne croſſe croſſe ſuperſtitious multitude doth rather croſſe token euer readye willingly receaue croſſe ſhall pleaſe god lay vpon day cōmeth counte cleare wonne geuyng thankes lord hath kept commeth ſhall nothing diſmay new thing euē ye haue continually looked cor 10and doubt god faythfull ſhall ſuffer tempted aboue ye able beare ſhall euer ſend ſome occaſion ye ſhall ſtand ſtedfaſt either ſhall blind eye enemy diminiſh theyr tyrannous power el hath ſuffred theyr beſt dragon hath caſt whole floudde water ſhall cauſe euen earth open hir mouth ſwalow vp apoc 12so faith full careful eaſe v time vexation ſhould heauy v ſhall ſend ioſeph againſt ye ſhall come egypt yea ſhal ſo prouide ye ſhall haue hundred father one hūdred mother one hundred houſes one thys lyfe haue proued experience marke 1and life euerlaſting ioy wyth chriſt sauiour withſtandyng ſith ſtedfaſtnes commeth ſelues auſten ſayth neuer man ſo weake frayle greateſt offender euer lyued euery man hys owne nature ſhould frayle committe great enormity except kept ſpirite power god beſeche brother lord ieſu chriſte loue hys rom 15 ſpirite pray may veſſels laude prayſe tyme ſoeuer pleaſeth hym call vpon v ephe 1the father glory giue v ſpirite wiſedome vnderſtandyng knowledge lighten eye mynde may know hys wayes prayſing lord eternally pleaſe brother write vnto v ſuch doubtes peraduenture may founde bookes ſhould acceptable vnto v truſt vnfrutefull endeuour ſelfe ſatiſfie thē poyntes god grace committe gouerned defended euer amen iohn frith priſoner ieſu chriſt tymes abydyng pleaſure treatiſe made ſayd iohn frith while priſoner tower london anno xxxij called myrrour glaſſe know thy ſelfe deſired faith full frende ſo much bound might lawfully haue commaunded would make litle treatiſe might ſomewhat inſtructed knowe himſelfe ſo geue god thanckes benefites hath ſo aboundantly poured vpon thing tooke vpon gladly partly fulfill right wiſe requeſt truſt ſhall great profite chriſtes flocke partly declare thinke ſelfe herein may men ſée haue receaued god ought beſtow talent cō mitted vnto note well cauſe ſay wiſe man salomon vaiuerſa vanitas omnis homo viuens euery mā eccle 1 liuing nothing vanitie alſo prophet dauid confirmeth pſal 62 ſaying men liuing pondered one ballance vanitie hanged ballaunce agaynſt eccle 5 ſhould quite way downe heauier example man prayſe foole thinke note witte good profounde perſon déede foole thē euē ſo ūth mā doth prayſe commende rich honour beautie ſtrength ſuch vaine tranſitorie thing dreame vaniſhe lyke flower fielde man ſhoulde haue moſte néede foloweth well hymſelfe vayne thoſe thyngs whych vanitie poſſyble thou ſhuldeſt haue al theſe thing hundreth yeare continually wythout trouble aduerſitie neuer man yet vaine dreame compared vnto euerlaſting lyfe whych prepared chriſtes electe faythfull follower fleſh hay hys glory lyke flower hay witheredeſay 40 flower fallen god worde endure euer heb 9therfore let wyſe man reioyſe wiſedom neither ye ſtrong man hys ſtrengthe ryche hys rich reioyſeth let hym reioyſe lord whome honor ſentence ſcrypture eſtablyſheth ſo clerely man may diſſent truthe ſame salomon ſaythe feare prouer 1 lord beginning wiſedome nowe feare lorde knoweth himſelfe ſcripture teacheth perceiue rom 8 imperfection nature ſubiect vnto corruption voide ſtableneſſe perceiue rom 7 math 25 vnſtableneſſe fleſh prone ſynne rebellyous rightwyſeneſſe dwelleth goodneſſe perceiue poyſon old ſerpent hell ſynne whych lyeth hidde wythin vnto whych prepared paine intollerable ſhall haue none occaſion feare god rather aduaunce ſelfe equall •• yth god eſay 14 daniell 〈◊〉 actes 12 lucifer nabuchodonozor herode ſuch haue done ſore chaſtened theyr follye haſt thou vain man wherof thou maiſte reioyſe ſcrypture teſtifieth euery good perſecte gifte commeth aboue father lyght wyth whome rom 3 • 1 tranſmutation whether outward giftes inward pertaining eyther y• body ſoule good come aboue father lyght thou behold math 6 proportion thy body ſtature beauty thou ſhalt eaſily perceiue cometh god euen word chriſte whych exhorteth v carefull none v math 5 thoughe neuer ſo carefull adde one ſtature eyther make one white heare blacke touching wiſedome eloquence long lyfe victory glory ſuch ſcripture teſtifieth come god oure ſelues iames ſaythe iames 1 lacke wiſedom let hym aſke god giueth abundantly euident salomon whych god deſired wiſedome iudge betwéene 〈◊〉 kinge 3 good euill lorde made hym aunſwere becauſe aſked thing long lyfe ryches deſtruction hys ennemyes rather wiſedom diſcerne iudgement behold haue geuen vnto thée heart full wiſedome vnderſtanding ſo muche none thée hathe bene like vnto thée neyther yet thée ſhall like vnto thée beſides haue giuen thée rich glory furthermore moſte gloryous giftes concerning oure ſoules come god euen méere mercye fauoure whych ſheweth v chriſt chriſt predeſtination election vocatiō iuſtification albeit wyth hys painted more miſte poetrie craftye conueyance doe caſt miſte eye might wander oute right way endeuoring hym ſelfe inſtructe god hathe predeſtinate choſen v beginnyng worlde becauſe knewe ſhould good workes yet ſet vpon cādel ſhall ſhine ſo bright ſo clerely diſpel miſt vaine poetrie ſhall plainely perceiue hym daunſing naked nette whiche notwithſtanding thinketh daunſing net thinketh hym ſelfe inuiſible iohn 15 himſelfe go inuiſible although ſcriptures inoughe bothe tit 3 rom 11 proue ſame true yet wil let paſſe alleage auſtine candell ſpeake whiche ſhall diſcloſe hys iuggling vtter hys ignorance auſtine ſaythe ſome man affirme god dyd chuſe v becauſe ſawe ſhould good workes chriſt ſayeth ſo ſayeth ye haue choſen haue choſē ſayeth choſen v becauſe ſawe ſhoulde doe good woorkes ſhoulde alſo haue ſéene ſhould firſte haue choſen hym contrary woordes chriſt minde euangeliſte héere may ſée howe euidently auſtine confuteth more poetrie openeth hys ſerpentine deceite finally paule ſaythe epheſ 2 ephe 2 ſaued thorowe grace commeth oure ſelues gifte god commeth workes leaſt man ſhould boſte himſelf word might aſhamed heare lucian neither regarding god man auſtine addeth thus much vnto non erit gratia vllo modo niſi fuerit gratuita omni modo ſay cā wiſe grace fauoure except alwayes frée therfore may conclude neyther workes going work comming frée fauor god thys ſure yt whome ſoeuer chuſeth ſaueth mercy whome repelleth ſecrete vnſearchable iudgement condemneth chuſeth one repelleth enquire ſaythe auſtine thou wilte erre ſo muche paule coulde attaine rom 11 knowledge therof cried oute depth rich wiſedome knowledge god howe vnſearchable hys iudgementes incomprehenſible way leuer loude lye farre erre let god alone hys ſecretes acknowledge hys ignorance thing ſhorte paule ſaythe haſt thou thou haſt receiued thou haſt receiued whye doſt thou auaunce thy ſelfe though thou hadſt receiued may conclude goodneſſe commeth god ſinne miſchéefe oure owne poyſoned nature ſo muche may ſay prophet daniel tibi domine gloria nobis autem confuſio faciei lord glory vnto thée vnto v ſhame cōfuſion ſo reioyſeth may 1 cor 1 reioyſe lord ſecond chapiter intent god geueth v theſe giftes rather charge carefull burthen pleaſure reioyce like many member oure body euery member 1 cor 11 hathe offyce appoynted vnto hym muſt doe hys owne wealth ſauegard preſeruation whole body ſo muche moſte honeſt member muſt ſerue vileſt neceſſitie hande woulde ſerue • lowe belly ſhould bothe periſhe together euen ſo hathe god appoynted giftes diſtributed world vnto v whych ſhoulde one body euery nation hathe néede euery occupation néede euery man néede hys neighboure ſo plain denyed neuertheleſſe ſpecially touche matter becauſe woulde haue ſo rooted might endeuoure youre ſelues fulfill towards eche god haue opened eye thy mynde haue geuen thée ſpirituall wiſedome thorough knowledge word boaſt thy ſelfe rather feare tremble chargeable office committed vnto thée whiche thou fulfill lyke coſt thée thy life one tyme much trouble perſecution thou fulfill ſhal office thy damnation 1 cor 9 paule ſayth wo preach prophet ezechiel ezech 23 god ſaith ſay vnto wicked ſhall dye death thou ſhew hym wicked ſhall dye iniquitie ſhal require bloud thy hand peraduenture diuines would expounde theſe textes onely vpon ſent haue cure ſoules wherunto anſwere euery man whiche hath light god worde reuelated vnto hym ſent ſoeuer ſéeth neceſſitie hath cure neighbour ſoule example god haue geuen ſight perceiue blynde man goyng way ready lacke ſight fall pytte wherein lyke periſh bounde god commaundement guide hym till hee paſt ieopardy el periſh might haue deliuered hym bloud ſhalbe required hand lykewiſe perceiue neighbour lyke periſh lacke chriſtes doctrine boūd inſtruct hym knowledge god hath geuen mee el hys bloud ſhalbe required hand paraduenture ſay ready one appoynted obiection watch pitte therefore man fall ſhall make good therfore diſcharged néede take thought wherunto aunſwere would glad solution ſo notwithſtandyng perceaue watchman ſléepe runne yt ale houſe make good cheare gone countrey whorehunting thorough necligence eſpy neighbour daunger pitte neuertheleſſe bounde leade hym thinke god hath ſent tyme ſaue ſoule frō periſhyng law god nature byndeth therto chargeth loue neighbour ſelfe doe vnto hym would done thinke mā caſe would haue hys neighbour helpe hym therfore math 7 bound helpe neighbour lyke ieopardy euen thus art thou bound geue good counſell hym lacketh diſtribute ſoeuer talent thou haſt receiued god vnto profite thy neighbour moreouer beſides ye auoyde ſolution yet deſire note text ſelfe alleged doth condemne vayne obiection wordes theſe ezech iij ſay vnto wicked ſhall dye death thou ſhewe wicked ſhall die iniquitie ſhall require bloud thy hande marke pray prophet ſaith obiect ſhould ſhewe wicked iniquitie doth ſo ſhall periſh wicked hym ſelfe ſaued bicauſe faut told take charge teach contrarywiſe ye wicked ſhall periſhe iniquitie ſaith god prophet ezechiel bloud ſhall required hand ſhould haue inſtructed truthe god haue geuen thée faythe rom 11 chriſtes bloude proude feare ſith god hathe ſpared naturall braunches meane 2 pet 2 iewes hys elect people ſith ſpared angel ſinned hath caſt hell reſerued vnto iudgement ſithe ſpared olde worlde ouerwhelmed water deliueryng noe preacher righteouſnes take héede leſt alſo ſpare thée truth fayth preſent ſinne imputed faith thy power gift god therfore thou 1 cor 12 vnkynde endeuour thy ſelfe walke innocently bryng forth fruites fayth feared thyne vnkyndneſſe god math 3 take thée hyer vyneyard whiche ſhall reſtore fruite due ſeaſō ſhall thyne end worſe thy begynnyng let v therfore feare tremblyng ſéeke health make ſtable vocation electiō math 21 math 12 phil 2 2 pet 1 mortifiyng member man ſinne exerciſing ſelues chriſtes preceptes may child father heauen felow heyers sauiour brother chriſt ieſu god haue geuen thée rich math 5 thou mayſt thincke hath committed vnto thée thine owne vſe hath made thée ſtuard ouer deſtribute profite commontie indéede thou art verye owner god owner whiche ſayth prophet agge golde mine ſiluer agge 2 mine hath committed ceaſon thy hande ſée whether thou wilt faythfull diſtributing thys wicked mammon according luke 16 commaundementes ſo thou mayſt well note parable riche man whych clothed ſilke fared delicately worlde buryed hell wheruppon gregory noteth damned becauſe deſpoiled man becauſe diſtribute yt proceſſe y• text doth alſo well declare wherefore muſt geue accompts geuē v haue litle cauſe glory rather feare tremble count moſt happy leaſt committed god accomptes muſt made deluded although world may blinded god haue geuen thée thy perfite limmes member gette ſome occupation woorke wyth thyne owne handes thy member whole perfite may miniſter theyr neceſſitie lacke theyr member acceptable ſight god contrarye ſo deteſtable thou withdraw thy member ayding thy neighboures thou ſhalt god recounted théefe murtherer therfore affirme holy hypocrite idle bellyed monkes chanons prieſtes whether regulare ſeculare laboure preache god woorde théeues alſo murtherers maintaine ſtrong member idleneſſe ought labour profite theyr neyghboures theyr perfite member might miniſter vnto neceſſitie lacke theyr member eye muſt miniſter fruite ſight vnto féete handes member lacke el ieoperdie periſhe euery pit eye giltie deſtrution withdrawing office may eſtabliſh wordes paule ſayth epheſ 4 dyd ſteale let hym ſteale rather laboure wyth hys owne handes may haue diſtribute lacke ſome doctoures well expounde certaine perſons walked inordinately would worke themſelues though ſturdye lubber liued men charitie thing apoſtle calleth theft exhorteth woorke theyr hand may helpe themſelues becauſe ſome perſons féele ſelues gréeued becauſe giltie content allow expoſition alledge text wiſe man ſhall onely allow ſentence alſo bite better ſayth panis egentium vita pauperis eccl 34 eſt qui autem defraudat eum homo ſanguinis eſt ſay bread néedy life poore defraudeth murtherer text holdeth noſes ſo hard grindſtone clean diſfigureth theyr face proueth byſhops abbotes ſpirituall poſſeſſionaries double theues murtherers concerning body beſides murdering ſoule lacke god worde neyther preache ſuffer doe purely perſecute put vnto moſt cruell death firſte théeues murtherers becauſe diſtribute appoynted faythfull forefather entent ſhould haue bene miniſtred vnto poore ſéemed vertuous beſtow vpon hawkes houndes horſes c vpon gorgious apparell delicate fare glad yt poore whē may get ſcrappes may haue ſo much pigge ſow ſcant fether gooſe may diſpend foure v thouſand markes yeare would thinke much gaue xx noble vnto poore notwythſtanding owner vnder god together miniſters lyuyng deduct apoſtle ſayth hauing theyr foode clothes couer ought therewith content 1 tim 6 thus defraude poor theyr bread ſo théeues becauſe bread theyr life aforeſayd text teſtifieth defraudeth hym onely théefe alſo murtherer thinke beſtow well beſtowe buildyng palace pleaſure yet therin much reproued old doctour ſayth poynt worſe deuill deuill would haue chriſt ſhould haue turned ſtones bréede might haue ſuckored y• poore theſe builder turne bread ſtones beſtow y• good ſhould geuen poore ſuſtenaunce vpon heape ſtones obiect obiection neuer without euaſions ſhould diſtribute among poore accordyng bounde within would ſpent good ſhould come man know become fareth better whereunto solution aunſwere déede ye wiſe ſith ye go correct chriſt fet hym ſchole learne hym beſt folye meddle chriſtes minde commaūdement ſhould diſtribute eccle 4 withhold ſayth prophet wo couple eſay 5 knit houſes together whiche thinke may iuſtly verified vpon neuertheleſſe dare ſay byſhop may diſpende foure thouſād marke would vnto poore dioces diſtribute euery yeare one halfe geuyng vnto one man xl ſhillyng lendyng xx noble ſet vp occupation ſo geue lende ſéeth néede ſhould within v vj yeares make floriſhyng dioces thinke verely face ſhould alowed god builded thouſand abbayes god commaundement ought firſt done much acceptable workes procede imagination fooliſh phantaſies beſides théeues murtherers withdrawyng theyr perfite mēbers labour wherby might miniſter vnto neighbour neceſſity ſpeake many occupied preachyng god woorde withdrawe member ſuccouryng poore neighbour théeues becauſe ſuccour called lyfe murtherers kéepyng beggyng order frier would thinke exempt becauſe haue receiued rente diſtributed notwithſtandyng ponder texte well ſhall finde cōdemned déepe enter euery mās houſe vnſhamefaſted beggyng polle ſo nye maner leaue nothing behind poore ſicke lame créeple blynd maymed pooreſt deſolate widowe fayre flatteryng wil ſo deceiue ſure either money ware deare brethrē mayntayne ye ſuch murtherers leſt ye bee partaker ſinnes rather folow counſell apoſtle chargeth v ye name lorde ieſu chriſt withdraw ſelues euery brother walketh inordinatly worketh byddeth hee 2 theſſ 3 worke ſhould eate obiect liue contemplation ſtudy scripture ſay ought let holy worke chriſt ſayd marye choſen beſt part whiche ſhould taken thereunto may make ſame aūſwere holy father abbot siluane made siluane abbot holy man hauyng many monkes vnder whō cauſed prayer whiche nothyng ſo lōg monkes vſe dayes whiche thinke many wordes heard lyke dyd phariſeis chriſt rebuked cauſed ſay labour theyr lyuyng accordyng mynde paule vppon tyme came religious man hys abbay ſawe monkes working aſked abbot whye ſo vſed gaue ſelues holye contemplation ſéeing marie choſen beſt part abbot made fewe wordes gaue monke boke ſent ſell occupied ſtudie contemplation dinner time ye abbot called monk meat let hym ſit contemplation noone began ware hūgry came againe abbot siluane aſked whether monkes yet dined anſwered yes called quod monke dine wyth ʋerily ſayd abbot thought bene ſpirituall néeded meate nay quod monke ſo ſpirituall feruent contemplation muſt néedes eate ʋerely ſayde abbot muſte alſo néedes worke mary hathe néede martha monke heard repented fell worke dyd woulde god aunſwer would cauſe religious euen ſo doe fall worke might ſuccoure theyr néedie neighboures touching theyr ſtudie ſcripture auſtine ſayeth ſhalt thou better learne vnderſtande ſcipture going fulfill thou readeſt thou goe aboute fulfill ſaythe muſt thou worke thy handes dothe paule teache thée haue compiled whole booke god haue appoynted finiſhe ſet forthe ſhalbe rule perfection vnto oure religious haue vſed hundreth yeare third chapter concluſion treatiſe fleſh ſhould reioyce feare tremble giftes receiueth maiſte thou perceiue man liueth maye feare tremble moſte may feare whome moſt committed ſhall muche required muche bounde thanke god thing oure ſelues haue noughte ſinne vanitie thorowe gracious fauoure haue goodneſſe ſith goodneſſe commeth hym muſte agayne thanckefull vnto kéepe hys commaundements el may feare leaſt take hys gift v ſhall receiue greater dampnation thou haue receiued knowledge hys woord geue hym thanks faithful miniſter thereof elſe ſhall deliuer thée vnto thyne owne fantaſticall imagination caſt thée headlong heape hereſies ſhall bring thée vtter deſtruction geue thée faith hys worde geue thanks bring forth fruites therof due ſeaſon el take away thée ſende thée finall deſperation geue thée rich geue hym thankes diſtribute according god commaundement elſe ſhall take thée loue thée either théeues water death thy cattell blaſting thy fruites ſuch ſcourges cauſe thée loue hym becauſe wolde eſai 5 ierem 7 alienate thine heart ſay wil loue thée make thée put thine whole truſt theſe tranſitorie thing ier • 12 hate thée ſende thée great proſperitie encreaſe plenteouſly geue thée thy heauen thys worlde vnto thine euerlaſting dampnation lyfe come therefore feare take good héede while thou haſt leaſure thou aſke honoure praiſe thankes anſwere honor praiſe thankes nothing el fulfilling hys commaūdementes thou aſke commaundementes touching beſtowing thy goodes anſwer cōmaundemēts thou beſtowe woorkes mercye ſhall laye thy charge daye iudgement ſhal aſke whether haue fedde hungrie geuen drinke thirſtie whether haue builded abbayes chauntries ſhall aſke whether haue harbored harborleſſe clothed naked whether haue gilded image geuen cope church ſhall aſke whether haue viſited ſicke gone priſoners whether haue gone pilgrimage walſingham canterburye thys affirme vnto thée thou builde thouſand cloiſters giue many cope chalice church viſiteſt pilgrimage worlde eſpieſt ſéeſt poore man whome thou mighteſt help periſhing lack one grote theſe thing whereon thou haſt beſtowed ſo muche money ſhall able helpe thée therefore take good héede ſay ye warned god haue geuen thée thy perfite limmes member geue thankes vſe tamyng thy body profite thy neighbour el god loue thée ſend thée ſome mayne miſchief take thée thy negligence none vſing ſo extremely imputed vnto thée hate thée ſhal kéepe thē whole ſounde thée none vſing may thy greater damnation therfore beware feare geuing thankes according hys commaundementes hys creature much bounde hath geuen v perfite member better v haue limmes woorke diſtributing ſhould diſtribute vnto v holy thing geue thē •… 2 take yea much bound vnto although haue made v imperfect mutilate ierem 18 handes yet haue done v whatſoeuer pleaſed euen haue made v vileſt creature vpon earth haue read ſhepheard kéeping ſhéepe field eſpyed foule toade wel marked conferred ſhape nature vnto himſelfe hys nature fell wéeping cryed piteouſly laſt came byſhop riding right royally whē ſaw ſhepheard ſo ſore lamenting reynde hys horſe aſked cauſe great wayling aunſwered ſhepheard ʋerely ſir wéepe mine vnkindnes toward almightie god haue geuen thākes god many thynges yet neuer ſo kind ſince borne thanke thing ſayd byſhop syr quod ſée foule tode yes quod biſhop purpoſe ʋerely ſayd ſhep hearde creature god well god might haue made euen ſuch foule vnreaſonable beaſt pleaſed yet hath done ſo mercy goodnes hath made reaſonable creature owne ſhape likenes yet neuer ſo kynde thancke made ſo vile creature thing greatly bewayle mine vnkindeneſſe tauſeth thus wéepe wyth yt biſhop departed truſt learned thereafter beſéeth god may ſo faythfull folowers sauiour chriſt ieſu prayſe honour glory euer amen myrrour lookyng glaſſe wherin may beholde sacrament baptiſme deſcribed anno xxxiij iohn frith conſideryng manifold lamentable errours wherewith ignoraunt people onely alſo learned ſéeme haue bene ſeduced long touchyng bleſſed sacrament baptiſme thought expedient therin write mynde truſtyng meanes bryng agayn blynde harte many vnto right way doubt iohn 10 1 cor 2 elect choſē god know ſhepheardes voyce haue ſpirite iudge thynges ſhall god elect perceiue eaſely ſpirituall meaning sacramentes eaſely perceiue whether conformable maſters voyce ſhall hereby bee moniſhed leaue wanderyng darke lothſome wayes leade vnto death walke without ſtumblyng walking truth bringeth reſt conſcience phil 4 papiſtes groſſe vnderſtanding baptiſme condemne infantes vnbap • ized comfortable light bringeth conſciences reſt ſuch peace paſſeth vnderſtandyng one errour put ſo great confidence outward ſigne without diſcretion condēne infantes whiche dye baptiſed vnto euer laſtyng payne cleaue ſo ſtrongly vnto weake ceremony thinke dronken prieſt leaue word volo ſay ye credo ſay externall ſignes ſpiritual • ſenſe taught beleued blinde papiſtes ye forget put ſpittell ſalt ye childes mouth ye child chriſtened yea ſo much giue thereunto beggerly ſalt ſay ſpill ſalt chriſtendome vſe alſo ſweare saying ſalt chriſtendome ala blyndneſſe theſe two errours principall entend tyme confute fallen grounded theſe muſt néedes decay firſt muſt marke thrée thynges euery sacrament three thinges ought cōſidered euery sacrament conſidered ſigne ſignification fayth whiche geuen vnto wordes god ſigne baptiſme ploungyng downe materiall water liftyng vp agayne whiche outward badge knowen number profeſſe chriſt theyr redemer sauiour outward ſigne doth neither outwarde ſignes neyther miniſter vnto v god ſpirit grace geue v ſpirite god neither yet grace fauour god thorough waſhyng water ſpirite grace geuē ſhould folow ſoeuer baptiſed water ſhould receiue precious gift ſo wherfore muſt néedes conclude outward ſigne power influence hath bryngeth ſpirite fauour god euery man receiueth treaſure baptiſme euidēt put caſe iew infidell marke well example ſhould ſay dyd beleue beleued déede vpō wordes baptiſed déede man cā iudge hart muſt receiue vnto baptiſme confeſſe fayth mouth albeit hart farre thence miſcreant thus baptiſed hath receiued outward ſigne sacrament aſwell moſt faythfull man beleuyng howbeit neither receiueth ſpirite god neither receiueth ſigne ſacrament outwardly ſignificatiō inwardly hart receaueth damnation yet grace rather condemnation wherefore euident exterior ſigne giueth gift whiche alſo certaine sacramentes yea sacrament altare whiche may called double sacrament onely remembraunce naturall body chriſte broken hys note bloud ſhed redemption euangeliſtes teſtifie alſo ſpirituall body whiche congregation faythfull paul teſtifieth ſaying bread breake partaking ſay partaker body chriſt ſayth hée though many yet one bread one body receiuyng sacrament giueth v ſpirite god neither yet fauor wicked receiueth well ye good howbeit receiuyng theyr dānation wherfore foloweth outwarde ſigne giueth mā grace moreouer ſpirite god grace bounde vnto sacramentes ſpirite god bounde outwarde ſignes ſacramētes ye sacramēts miniſtred muſt ye ſpirit grace waite miniſtred ſhuld neither ſpirit grace falſe cornelius houſhold receiued ye holy ghoſt baptiſed ſo much actes 10 peter ſayd may man forbyd theſe ſhould baptiſed water whiche haue receiued holy ghoſt well ſo commaunded baptiſed name lord may ſée ſpirite god lighteth god ſpirite bounde place neither boūde thing yea example doth well declare vnto v sacramentes geuen outward witneſſe vnto cōgregation grace whiche geuen priuatly vnto euery man baptiſme giuen congregation vnto hym receiue hath either profeſſed religion chriſt el hath word promiſe whiche promeſſe infidel muſt firſt beleue chriſt receiue baptiſme •… ge fayth 〈…〉 〈◊〉 knowen ſenſible congregatiō chriſt cauſe baptiſe one come vnto age diſcretiō axe hym whether beleue aunſwere yea deſire baptiſme baptiſed ſo require faith hym baptiſed whiche gift god commeth grace ſo outward ſigne hys inuiſible fayth whiche giuen hym god infant brought vnto baptiſme frendes offer vp willyng ſanctifie fulfill commaundement ordinaunce god enquire frendes congregatiō whether theyr child baptiſed haue aunſwered yea thē receiueth baptiſme alſo went promiſe god hee grace reputeth infantes leſſe congregation infantes hebrues thorough baptiſme doth congregation receiue whiche firſt receiued thorough grace promiſe thus may ſée baptiſme bryngeth grace doth teſtifie vnto congregation baptiſed ſuch grace geuen hym ſo baptiſme sacrament deſinition baptiſme ſigne holy thyng euē token grace frée mercy whiche geuen hym viſible example inuiſible grace whiche done geuen circumciſion thing rom 〈◊〉 outward fleſh iew hid within circumciſion hart cutting carnall deſires true circumciſion circumciſion price god wyth gentile iob circumciſed like maner may ſay baptiſme chriſten man waſhed wyth water neither baptiſme outwarde fleſh baptiſme god alloweth baptiſed ſpiritually hart ſubdue wéed braunches ſinne raigne mortall body bring thē bōdage vnder ye baptiſme ſigne many doubt thus ſpiritually baptized although theyr body touch water gentile thus ſpiritually circumciſed yet neuer cutte foreſkinne theyr priuy member furthermore child vncircumciſion people deſcribed paule 6 ye romaine plunged bodily watēr euen rom 6 ſo dead buried chriſte ſinne lifted water euen ſo riſen chriſte oure ſinnes mighte héereafter walke newe conuerſation lyfe theſe two thing plunged dipping water liftyng vp agayne intantes ſignifieth water lifte vp againe doe ſignifie repreſent whole pith effect baptiſme mortification olde adam riſing vp new man y• old adam verely euē naturall inheritaunce planted thorough adam fall v vnfaythfull angrie enuious couetous ſlouthfull proud vngodly theſe ſuche vſes wherewith oure nature venemed ought withall diligence cutte mortifie may daily pacient liberall mercifull according oure baptiſme doth ſignifie ſo much whole courſe man life continuall baptiſme chriſten mannes lyfe nothing el ſaue continuall baptiſme whych begon dipped water put continuall vre exerciſe long infection ſinne remaineth oure bodyes whych neuer vtterly vanquiſhed vntill houre death great golias ſlayn wyth hys owne ſweard deathe whych power ſinne gate euerlaſting lyfe opened vnto v thus paule vnderſtand galat 3 ſaythe ye baptiſed galat 3 chriſt haue put chriſte haue promiſed dye wyth chriſte touching youre ſinnes worldly deſires paſſed become new mē creature member chriſt haue promiſed vnto congregation repreſented baptiſme ala déede fulfil promiſe rather sacrament promiſeth cauſe called paule fountaine new byrth regeneration tit iij bicauſe ſignifieth déede renounce vtterly tit 3 baptiſme fountaine new byrth forſake old life purge mē bers frō workes iniquitie thorough ye vertue ye holy ghoſt water fire doth clenſe body euen ſo doth purifie hart vncleaneſſe yea commō phraſe scripture cal holy ghoſt water fire becauſe theſe two elementes expreſſe ſo liuely hys purgyng operation haue expounded ſignification ſignification baptiſme ſay baniſhyng old mā puttyng new acquired onely fayth baptiſme ſignificatiō may obtaine onely fayth thou baptiſed thouſād time water haue fayth auayleth thée towardes god doth gooſe ſhe ducketh ſelfe vnder water therefore thou wilt obtaine profite baptiſme thou muſt haue fayth thou muſt bee ſurely perſuaded thou art newly borne agayne water onely water holy ghoſt iohn iij thou art▪ become ye iohn 3 child god thy ſinnes imputed thée forgeuē ye bloud paſſion chriſt according vnto promiſe god fayth haue neither ye deuils neither yet wicked diſtruſtyng god promiſes diſpayre wicked wicked cā beleue ye remiſſiō ſinnes fall vnto vtter deſperation make god lyer much thē beleue teſtimony gaue ſonne teſtimony beleue hym haue euerlaſtyng lyfe iohn v deuils iohn 5 beleue haue promiſe made vnto thus chriſtes bloud ſtrēgth baptiſme chriſtes bloud wherof baptiſme hath full ſtrength vigour regenerate made one father firſt naturall byrth child wrath epheſ ij enemyes god rom vj rom 5 finally baptiſme ordinaunce inſtitute god practiſe man imagination put vſe chriſtes time reſurrection commaunded miniſtred vnto beleeue whether iewes gentile chriſt matthew laſt ſayth apoſtles go ye teach nation baptizing name father sonne math 28 holy ghoſt wherfore although ſéeme neuer ſo exterior thing yet ought great cauſes sacramēt baptiſme ſhold bee great reuerence price much reuerence becauſe commaūded god done beſide outward ſigne witneſſe vnto cōgregation inuiſible promiſe geuen grace vnto euery priuate man doth congregation receiue hym openly coūted one thē firſt receiued faith grace promiſe putteth v alſo remembraūce aduertiſing kyndneſſe god promiſe baptiſme may learne dye mortifie rebellyng member otherwiſe gyueth grace nether hath ſecret vertue haue ſufficiently proued therfore ſore blame ſo vnaduiſedly condemneth theſe infātes iudgyng brother god hand yea peraduenture baptiſed chriſtes bloud god election vnknowen man endeuour ſelfe ouerthrow vtterly put ſecond errour whiche hath long raigned ſeduced many ſo ſtrongly ſticke vnto weake ceremony concerning ceremony baptiſme yea muſt behaue ſelues wiſely charitie teacheth v ſéekyng profite many may ſaued muſt cō ſider sundry ſortes mē haue conuerſation withall diuerſly affected haue conuerſation men world moſt part know god young ſome weake ſome peruerſe ſome ſtiffenecked obdurate vnto young ceremony although noyſome vnto fayth contrary word god yet hard finde ſuch good expedient ceremony ſome ſortes guide vnto knowledge god milke leade young tenderly perfite knowledge god ſecond ſort weake vnto thynges behoueth v haue reſpect beare infirmity charitie ſake actes xv dyd paule circumciſe timothe yea ſake hée actes 15 leuer captiue libertie neuer eate fleſh drinke wyne thē offende one thyrde kynd men perfite meane ſo perfit cleane without ſinne hauyng remnauntes old adā aſſailyng ſuch none onely chriſt call thē perfection man perfite haue perfit knowledge vſe thynges whiche know ſoeuer woū dyng cōſcience ſinneth againſt god woundeth man conſciēce 1 cor 8 fourth kynde ſelfe willed obſtinate put confidence ſuch indifferent thynges thinke néedefull vnto ſaluation obſtinate put truſt indifferent put confidēce ſhould hurte vnquiet conſcience thorowe negligence otherwiſe thinge vndone ſo ſhoulde occaſion plucke v chriſte inſtitute meane bring v vnto therfore seniours miniſters together heare god worde receyue ſacramentes geue god thankes done may returne vnto houſes buſineſſe aſwell day thinketh man ſinneth worketh holy daye weake ignoraunt ought better inſtruct ſo leaue holde obſtinate perſeuer hys ſentence god deuill maketh ſinne ſuch god leaueth frée accordyng thys enſample would ceremony altered becauſe haue ſayd people ſéeke health vilany chriſtes bloude concerning godfather godmother promiſe theyr godchild ſhall mortifie roote ſinne ſpringeth body ſubdue theyr luſtes vnder lawe god promiſe alſo inſtructe bryng vp theyr godchild fayth chriſt office inſtruct child kéepe ſcripture word god beare hand hereſie ala long wyll lacke vnderſtanding perceyue yet would kéepe darcknes becauſe ſhoulde eſpye theyr priuy practiſe ſleightly conueyaunce ſo mad bleſſed worde made euill good make good euyll thynke thys holſome medicine healeth infirmity chaūged ſuch nature poyſon ye ſo ſimple childiſhe ſurmiſe godly doctrine diſcloſeth hipocriſie confoundeth hereſies ſhould make erre fall hereſies pray god geue eye ſée eares heare open harte may perceyue pleaſure ſurely ignorauncie ſhall excuſe ezechiell ezech 3 30 ſpeakyng perſon god ſayth vnto ye curate thou ſonne mā haue made thee ouerſear vnto ye houſe iſrael thou ſhalt heare worde mouth ſhalt ſhewe ſay vnto wicked thou ſhalt ſurely die thou ſhew hym exhort turn frō wicked way may lyue ſhall dye wickednes require bloude thy hande yea righteous turn righteouſnes iniquitie ſhall die although thou ſhewe hym ſhall die hys ſin wyll require bloude thy hand take hede curate vnto charge let man excuſe himſelfe thorough ignoraunce finis antitheſis wherin compared together chriſtes actes pope gathered iohn frith annexed vnto reuelation antichriſt tranſlated 1529 ¶ antitheſis haue annexed ſome tyme tranſfigured aungell light therefore great thyng miniſters take vpon ſimilitude though miniſters iuſtice whoſe ende ſhalbe accordyng workes chriſten men ſhould marke ſuch flye away thē ſuch ſerue chriſt owne bellyes ſweete preachynges flattering wordes deceaue harte innocētes euen iannes iambres 2 timb 3 exod 8 withſtode moſes euen ſo theſe reſiſte truth men corrupt myndes lewed concernyng fayth ſhall preuayle lenger madneſſe ſhalbe vttered vnto mē thus people blynded fallyng vnbelefe deceaued thorough ſleghty conueyaunce antichriſt adherent saint iohn ſaid iohn 4 many fruite fruite maketh trée good trée maketh fruite good although know trée good hys fruite iudge nothing outward operation yet god ſéeth quicknes roote tyme god hath appointed ſhall bring forth fruite approueth ye trée good although ſéeme dead vnto v trée fayth mother good workes euer worketh charitie ſéeth occaſion pope byſhops ſay fruite maketh trée good cleane contrary scripture reaſon thus turne trées rootes vpwarde affirme fayth ſpringeth made good workes contrary euē man would ſay fruite bringeth forth maketh good trée contrary madnes woulde make men beleue ſhoulde longe continue ye mā temple god 1 cor 3 77 chriſtes apoſtle paule ſayth ought thinke god actes 17 like gold ſiluer kar • ed ſtones ſuch thyng man imagineth pope adherentes ſay lyke ſtocke ſtone cauſeth men make image hym though god commaunded contrary ſaying thou ſhalt make grauen image neither maner ſimilitude exod 20 thoſe thynges whiche heauē aboue earth beneath neither thoſe thynges whiche water vnder earth peter thou art symon ſonne iona thou ſhalt iohn 1 called cephas enterpreted ſignifieth ſtone iohn ſayth goſpell pope ſayth cephas ſignifieth dist xxij ca ſacroſancta head gathereth head byſhops doth playnly contrary goſpell whiche expoundeth cephas bee ſtone impudencie thinke would ſay alſo aſſe man thought get auauntage infinite thynges wherein hee contrarieth chriſt ſo much diligētly examined thinke word chriſt ſpake hath taught made law agaynſt howbeit auoyde tediouſnes ſhall leaue vnto owne iudgement ſoone ſearched eſpyed iudge chriſtē reader theſe thing ſimple eye parcially addict one iudge scripture knowledge truth god word doth alow auoydyng doctrine ſpringeth sathan aſhamed confeſſe poore chriſt take thy head theſe rauenous wolues ſhall cōfeſſe thée agayn math 10 father aungelles heauen ſhalt thou bee inheritour ieſu chriſte faythfull ſonne thy father whiche heauen glory eternally amen ¶ endeth antitheſis betwene chriſte pope booke made iohn frith priſoner tower loue lord vnfaynedly amen chaunced beyng theſe party company chriſten brother commē dable conuerſation ſober behauiour might better byſhop many weare miter rule paule regarded election 1 timo 3 tit 1this brother much communication deſired know mynde touchyng sacrament body bloud ſauiour chriſt thing opened vnto hym accordyng gift god geuen firſt proued vnto hym order iohn frith kepeth ſhewyng mynde sacrament body bloud chriſt article fayth neceſſary beleued vnder payne damnation declared chriſt naturall body euen myne ſauyng ſinne could bee two place thē myne cā thirdly ſhewed neceſſarie wordes ſhould ſo vnderſtand ſound might phraſe scripture innumerable ſhewed certaine phraſes maner ſpeakynges well vſed engliſh toung finally recited maner might receiue according chriſtes inſtitutiō fearyng froward alteration prieſts vſe contrary firſt forme inſtitution ſufficiently publiſhed occaſiō moued iohn frith write sacrament mynde hee deſired entitle ſūme wordes write hym becauſe ſeemed ouerlong well reteined memorie albeit loth take matter hand yet fulfill inſtant interceſsion tooke vpon touche terrible tragedie wrote treatiſe whiche beſide paynfull impriſonmēt like purchaſe moſt cruell death ready glad receiue ſpirite inward man although fleſhe frayle ſoeuer ſhall pleaſe god lay vpon notwithſtā dyng ſay truth wrote intēt ſhould haue ben publiſhed would haue touched matter earneſtly haue written well ſpirituall eating drinking neceſsitie dyd carnall ſo neceſſarie treatiſe made expedient men albeit ſufficient tooke hand inſtruct knew ſpirituall neceſſarie eatyng ſpirituall eatyng sacrament fayth drinkyng body bloud receiued teth bellye eares faith onely neded inſtructiō outward eating whiche thing therfore onely declared cōmon abroad many mēs mouthes ſo much whiche late hath buſied hym ſelfe medle ſuch matter zeale define hath ſore labored confute ſome mē thinke aſhamed part cauſe doth ſo diligently ſuppreſſe woorke whiche printed ſelfe ſaw worke print lord wincheſters houſe vpon stephen day laſt paſt neither neither frēdes could make might attaine copie onely one written copie whiche ſeemed drawen great haſt notwithſtandyng well iudge cauſe ſhould bee boke kept ſo ſecret right ſure neuer touched foundation treatiſe builded vpon therefore ſith foundation ſtandeth ſo ſure inuincible el thinke verely would ſore haue laboured haue vndermined thereupon builde litle alſo declare ordinaūce ſlender breake downe although ſet vppon woorſe foundation ¶ foundation litle treatiſe article fayth neceſſary beleued vnder payne damnation sacrament ſhould naturall body chriſt thyng proued maner firſte muſt acknowledge sacrament naturall body chriſt article fayth neceſſary beleued vpon payne damnation article fayth ſaue v bound beleue vnder paine eternal damnation ſhould beleue hys naturall body fleſh bloud naturally bread wine ſhould ſaue ſeyng many beleue receiue damnation preſence bread ſaue preſence hart faith bloud hath waſhed ſinnes pacified yt father wrath toward agayne doe beleue bodely preſence bread wyne ſhall damne abſence hart thorough vnbelefe would obiect obiection though truth abſēce bread could damne v yet bounde beleue becauſe god word beleueth much lyeth maketh god lyer therfore obſtinate mynde beleue hys word may occaſion damnation may anſwere solution beleue god worde knowledge true diſſent whether true ſence take ſence ye take ſay agayne though ye haue appeareth vnto euident wordes chriſt therefore conſiſte barke letter yet compelled conferring ſcriptures together within letter ſearche mynde sauiour ſpake wordes ſay thirdly obſtinate mynde defendeth cauſe obſtinately obſtinate defendyng cauſe worthy reprehention whether true falſe euer reprehended ſatiſfie cōſciēces cō pelled place scripture reaſons doctours ſo iudge euen ſo ought iudge partie defende ſentence obſtinacie ye reaſon foundation iohn frithes firſt treatiſe vppon sacrament scripture cauſe ſo take ſo ought nether partie diſpiſe eche ſéeketh glory god true vnderſtā ding scripture foundation firſt treatiſe hath left vnſhakē great argumēt y• true el hys pregnant wit could haue paſſed ſo cleane ouer would haue aſſayled ſome ſophiſticall cauillation hys painted poetrie might ſo haue coulered leſt might make ye ignoraunt ſome appearance truth hath done agaynſt reſidue firſt treatiſe neuertheleſſe true ſhall ſo proued firſt none article fayth neceſſary beleued vnder payne damnation may thus bee confirmed ſame article fayth beleue naturall body chriſt fayth ſhall ſaue v whiche ſaued olde father chriſtes incarnation bounde vnder payne damnation beleeue pointe therefore ſhall followe bounde therto vnder payne damnation firſte part myne argument proued aguſtine ad durdamū dare boldly ſay almoſt c place thinke propoſitiō doth oftē inculcate thē y• ſame fayth ſaued v ſaued father ſecond part manifeſt ſame fayth ſaueth v ſaued father néedeth probation coulde beleue ye thyng neuer ſaide done without word could haue fayth vppon truth theſe two party muſt concluſion nedes folow notwithſtanding dyd eate chriſtes bodye dranke hys bloud ſpiritually although • ad hym preſent téeth ye ſpirituall eating fayth body bloud ſaued well ſoone forefather adam tranſgreſſed adam god precept fallen vnder condemnation moſt mercyfull father hys gracious fauour gaue hym promiſe health comfort whereby many beleued ſaued thrauldome tranſgreſſion worde promiſe ſhal put enmitie betwene thée woman betwene thy ſéede ſéede ſéede ſhall gene 3 treade thée head thou ſhalt treade hele thys promiſe knowledge chriſte ſhould become ſéede true would fulfill hys promiſe vnto hartely longed ſéede ſo eate body drinke bloud knowledging father eate body chriſt dronke bloud wyth infinite thankes chriſt ſhould ſinnes take y• perfect nature couenant would god good abraham abraham gene 12 agayne promiſed kéepe preceptes walke wayes god gaue ſacrament circumciſion called couenaunt circumciſion sacrament god couenaſit made abraham thing notwithſtanding couenaunt déede although ſo called onely ſigne token • acrament memoryall couenaunt betwene god hym might expounde matter men eye ſée god promiſed ſonne whē wife paſt childe bearing alſo olde neuertheleſſe doubted god worde ſurely beleued promiſed able performe recounted vnto hym righteouſnes abrahā fayth dyd eate drinke chriſtes body bloudthis abraham eate body drinke hys bloud fayth beleuing verely chriſt ſhould take nature ſpring ſéede touching fleſhe alſo ſhoulde ſuffer death redéeme v iohn 8and chriſte teſtifieth hartely deſired ſée day chriſt ſawe reioyſed ſawe fayth day chriſt ſay thoſe thinges ſhoulde chaunce hym playnely reuelated vnto albeit dead many hū dred yeares actually fulfilled reuelated vnto ye world fayth ſaued yet neuer eate fleſhe téeth neuer beleued bread ſhoulde bodye wyne hys bloud therfore ſith alſo ſaued without fayth ye ſame fayth ſhall ſaue v ſaued hym thinke ſhall alſo ſaued ſpirituall eating drinkyng chriſt ſhall ſaue v eate ſpiritually dyd although wee neuer beleue bread body furthermore mercifull moſes whiche brought child iſraell egypt wildernes obtayned god prayer manna heauē féede people alſo water ſtone refreſhe comfort thē manna water euen manna iſraelites ſame sacramēt v ſame thyng vnto bread wyne v saint auſten ſayeth quicun que manna chriſtum intellexerunt eundem quem no cibum ſpiritualem manducauerunt auguſt de vtilitate poenicentiaequicunque autem de māna ſolam ſaturitatemquè ſinerunt manducabant mortui ſunt sic etiam eundē potū petra enim erat chriſtus ſay many manna vnderſtoode chriſt eate ſame ſpirituall meate doe many fought onely fill belly manna father vnfaythfull eate dead likewiſe y• ſame drinke ſtone chriſt may gather auſten manna vnto ye bread v likewiſe water wyne v whiche anone ſhall appeare playnly aug ſuper ioan tract 26 auſten ſayth manducauit moſes manna māducauit aaron manducauit phinees manducauerunt ibi multi qui deo placuerūt mortui non ſunt quare quia viſibilem cibum ſpiritualiter intellexerunt ſpiritualiter eſurierunt ſpiritualiter guſtauerunt vt ſpiritualiter ſatiarentur omnes eandem eſcam ſpiritualem manducauerunt omnes eūdem potum ſpiritualem biberunt ſpiritualem vti que eandem nam corporalem alteram quia illi manna no aliud ſpiritualem vero eandem quam no ʋt omnes eundem potum spiritualem biberunt aliud illi aliud no ſed specie viſibili quod tamen hoc idem ſignificaret virtute spirituali quomodo eundem potum bibebant inquit apoſtolusa goodly ſaying auguſtine de ſpirituali ſequenti petra petra autem erat chriſtus ſay moſes alſo dyd eate manna aaron phinées dyd eate many dyd eate whiche pleaſed god dead wherefore becauſe vnderſtode viſible meate ſpiritually ſpiritually hungred taſted ſpiritually might ſpiritually repleniſhed dyd eate ye ſame ſpirituall meate dranke ſpirituall drinke euen ſame ſpirituall meate albeit bodely meate dyd eate manna eate thyng dyd eate ſame ſpirituall dyd drinke ſame ſpirituall drinke drāke one thyng outward apparence neuertheleſſe dyd ſignifie ſame thyng ſpiritually dranke ſame drinke ſayth apoſtle dranke ye ſpirituall ſtone folowyng ſtone chriſt thereunto beda added theſe wordesbeda ſuter father neuer beleued yet dyd eate chriſt fayth manna expreſly manna leſſe frute manna ceaſſed eate sacramēt fayth ſpiritually eate body chriſt cand albeit manna sacrament v eate euen ſame ſpirituall beleuyng manna came heauen comforted bodyes ſo ſhould sauiour chriſt promiſed god ye father come downe heauen ſtrength ſoules euerlaſtyng life redeming ſinne death reſurrection cauſe ſhould accompt sacramēt chriſtes naturall body groſſe imaginatiōand likewiſe eate chriſt fayth come sacrament expreſſely ye sacrament leſſe fruite haue receaued ſacramēt néede make naturall body manna might much better vnderſtand ſpiritually outwarde man doth eate materiall breade comforteth bodie ſo doth inwarde man fayth eate y• bodye chriſte beleuyng bread broken ſo chriſtes bodye broken croſſe ſinnes whiche comforteth ſoules vnto life euerlaſting ye fayth ſaue without beleuyng manna altered bodie euen ſo doth thys fayth ſaue v although beleue ſubſtaunce bread turned hys naturall bodye ſame fayth excuſe beleue pointes contayned ſcripture although vndoubted verity yet may ſaued without caſe y• neuer heard heare vnderſtand comprehēd feare vnderſtād yet reaſon texte miſconſtrue bohemes muſt beleue article fayth vpon payne damnation perill wordes chriſt 6 chapter iohn theſe ſay may bee done without ieoperdie damnatiō euery text onely one veritie ſpoken yet ſome textes whiche catholicke doctours expounded vj vij ſondry faſhions therfore beleue theſe article crede perill ſo haue probable reaſon diſſent returne purpoſe examine authority auſten beda alledged ſhall eſpy beſide probation foreſayd propoſition opē miſtery matter haue eyen ſée auſten ſayth old father differ touchyng ye bodely meate dyd eate manna bread albeit varyed ye outward appearaunce yet neuertheleſſe ſpiritually dyd ſignifie one thyng manna bread ſignifie chriſt ſo eate one ſpiritual meate ſay eate thing ſignifieth repreſenteth vnto v one ſpirituall meate ſoules whiche chriſt beda doth playnly call māna bread ſignes ſaying behold ſignes altered yet ye fayth abideth one ſignes ſignifie thing ſelfe ſignifie ye ſigne thyng differeth frō thyng ſelfe doth ſignifie repreſent alepole ale ſelfe doth ſignifie repreſent thou wilt obiecte agaynſt faith ſufficient néedeth inſtitutiō sacrament aunſwere sacramentes inſtituted thrée cauſes firſt aſſigned auſten ſayth maner aug contra faustum lib 19 cap 11 nullum autem nomen religionis ſeu verum ſeu falſum coagulari homines poſſunt niſi ſignaculorum ſeu sacramentorum viſibilium conſortio colligantur quorum sacramentorum vi inenarrabiliter valet plurimum et ideo contempta ſacrilegos facit impie quippe contemnitur ſine qua perfici nō potest pieta ſay men ioyned kynde religion whether true falſe except knit felowſhip ſome viſible token sacramentes power sacramentes ſuch efficacie expreſſed thre cauſes ye sacramentes inſtitutedand therfore maketh deſpiſe abhorred wickednes deſpiſe thyng without whiche godlynes brought paſſe thus appeareth neceſſitie y• firſt cauſe firſt neceſſity congregation ſeuered multitude men muſt néedes haue ſigne tokē sacrament common badge may knowe eche difference betwene ſigne badge sacrament sacrament ſignifieth holy thyng ſigne badge doth ſignifie wordly thing auſten ſaythauguſt ad marcellinū ſignes referred holye thynges called sacramentes ſecond cauſe inſtitution sacramentesthe ſecond cauſe inſtitution may meane bryng v vnto fayth imprint déeper v doth cuſtomably moue man beleue perceiueth thyng expreſſed diuerſe ſenſes example promiſe mā mete day appoynted ſomewhat truſt word notwithſtandyng truſteth ſo much vnto dyd promiſe hym word alſo clap hādes hold vp finger coūteth promiſe ſtrong faythfull bare word becauſe moueth moe ſenſes word doth onely certifie thing vnto mā ſenſe hearyng whē promiſe immediatly hold vp finger onely certifie ſenſe hearing alſo ſight hee perceiueth fact confirmeth word clapyng handes hee perceiueth ſight féelyng beſide worde fulfill promiſe lykewiſe sacrament chriſt promiſed would geue body ſlayne ſinnes eſtabliſh fayth promiſe dyd inſtitute sacrament called body entent ye name ſelfe might put remē braūce ment brake bread ſignifying vnto outwardly euen ſame thyng wordes proteſted euē wordes informed hearyng entended ſo ſo breaking bread informed eye ſight would fulfil promiſe dyd diſtribute amōg imprint matter déepely ſignifying therby euen bread deuided among ſo ſhould body frute paſſion diſtributed vnto many beleued wordes diligently chriſt ſet forth ye sacrament hys body bloud might outward ſigne aſſure fayth true body crucified ſinnesfinally cauſed thē eate nothyng ſhould lackyng confirme neceſſary point faith thē ſignifiyng therby verely felt breade within ſo ſure ſhould hys body thorough fayth euen bread doth nouriſhe body ſo doth fayth hys body breaking nouriſh ſoule vnto euerlaſting life mercifull sauior knoweth frailtie weakenes eſtabliſh ſtrēgth fayth body breaking bloud ſheding ſhoteanker laſt refuge without ſhould periſhe thyrd cauſe inſtitution sacramentesthe third cauſe inſtitution profit commeth haue receiued theſe bleſſed tydinges worde health loue publiſhe felicitie falſe brother ioh frith mette falſe brother pretend haue knowledge déede pykethankes prouiding bellye prepare ye therfore clokes weather waxeth cloudy rayne like followe meane falſe excuſes power ouer corruptible bodye put death muſt yet ye length periſh ſelfe truſt lord ſhall ſuffer 2 cor 10 tēpted aboue may beare according ye ſprite ſhall poure vppon ſhall alſo ſende exhortation ſtand gredely theſe newe named brother writeit ſecretly ſpread abroade name great antiquitie although liſte ieſte frith called brethrē ere biſhops called lordes ye name geuen chriſt ſaying math brethrē auncient name ſcripture xxiij ye brother luke y• xxij confirme brother name cōtinued apoſtles name nouriſheth loue amitie glad heare gredy affection writing ſpreading abroade worde amos 8 god
