knowledge ſelues ſinners word god puttyng goodes body ieoperdy ſoule health though byſhops call hereſie heretickes hunges yet know goſpell lyuyng god health ſaluation beleue rom 1 name doth nothing offēde v though call hereſie thouſand tymes paule teſtifieth phariſeis prieſtes counted actes 24 church hys tyme dyd ſo call therefore foreceth though ruling rowmes vſe ſame name young mā ſay hath lately made diuers thynges yet runne hoker moker ſo cloſe amōg brother commeth copy abroad aunſwere ſurely frith ſpynne thinke mā hateth idle wherfore ſuch thynges able doe ſhalbe diligēt long god lendeth lyfe ye thinke buſie may rid ſooner euen ſhéepe butcher ioh frith feared death handes ready bound looketh euen grace butcher whē ſhall ſhed bloud euen ſo bounde byſhops pleaſures euer lookyng day death ſo much playne worde ſent chauncelour lō ſayd ſhould coſt beſt bloud body whiche would gladly ſhed morow ſo might open kyngs grace eyen verely maruell thing runne hoker moker hyd ſith mought haue ſuch ſtore copyes concernyng thyng whiche moſt deſired haue ben kept ſecret ſhould lacke copye thoſe thynges moſt would haue publiſhed hereof ye may ſure care frith wiſheth workes ſeene though byſhops england looke euer wrote rather would glad ye ſo dyd ſparkle grace breaſtes truſt ſhould bee occaſion ſomewhat kyndle may conſider know ſelues whiche firſt poynt wiſedome would god mercy ſayth ſith nothing refrayne ſtudie deuiſing compaſsyng euill vngracious writyng would could keepe ſo ſecretly neuer man ſhould ſee ſuch ſo farre corrupted neuer would cured cāker poſſible hym hath eyen ſéeth hys brother whiche frith lacketh ſight ieoperdie periſhing perillous pit hee muſt come hym guide hym till ſeeth brother peril ieoperdy muſt warn therof paſt ieoperdye leſt wiſe come yet call crye vnto hym cauſe hym choſe better way except hart bee cankered contagion ſuch hatered reioyſe neighbour deſtruction euē ſo poſſible v whiche haue receiued knowledge god word muſt cry cal leaue perillous pathes owne fooliſh phantaſies doe onely lord cō maundeth deut 12 neither addyng thyng diminiſhyng therfore vntill ſée ſome meanes founde whiche reaſonable reformation may one partio ſufficient note earneſt zeale frith inſtruction poore commōs inſure neither ceaſe ſpeake worde god boyleth body like feruēt fire néedes haue iſſue breaketh occaſion geuē hath bene offered offered ſhall offered graunt word god meane ye text scripture may go abroad engliſh toung nation haue tounges brother offer made clergie io frith william tyndall haue done promiſe write wil graunt condition haue breath ſhew wordes scripture doth many ſo leſt ſaue ſome lacke paule ſayth contagion hereſie creepeth lyke canker canker corrupteth body turneth whole party ſame deadly ſicknes ſo doth theſe hereſies creepe forth among good ſimple ſoules till laſt almoſt paſt remedy true ſaying maketh frith well agaynſt owne purpoſe déede contagion began ſpring euen paules tyme ſo much galathians maner wholy ſeduced doctrine ſayd theſſalonians miſtery iniquitie euē 2 theſ 2 beginneth worke iohn teſtifieth ready many 1 iohn 4 antichriſtes riſen hys dayes alſo paul propheſied ſhold folow tyme actes 20actes 20 ſaying take ye héede ſelues flocke ouer whiche holy ghoſt hath put ouerſéers féede congregation god whiche purchaſed owne bloud prop • eſie paule • latter timesfor know wel departyng ſhall enter greuous wolues among ſhall ſpare flocke euen ſelues ſhall ariſe men ſpeaking peruerſe thing draw diſciples thē therfore watch c canker began ſpread congregatiō dyd full ſore noy body ſo much within iiij c yeare many ſectes ſcattered euery coſt notwithſtandyng faythfull father diligently ſubdued ſworde god word silueſterbut ſurely ſince silueſter receiued ſuch poſſeſſions hath canker ſo créept ye church hath almoſt left neuer ſounde member ciſtercenſis writeth 8 booke day hee receiued reuenues voyce heard ye ayre cry ouer court whiche ſayd day venime ſhed ye church godwhen corruption entred ye church tyme byſhop gredy take cure honour profite onely carefull charge biſhoprickes wer gredely ſought ye primitiue church charge lordſhip lyke coſt lyfe one tyme therefore man would take bare ſuch loue zeale god flocke could content ſhed bloud made ſo honorable profitable worſt learnyng lyuyng moſt laboured vertuous wold entangle ſelues vayne pride world weare thrée crownes goldmath 27 mark 15 iohn 19 chriſt dyd weare one thorne concluſion came ſo farre ſoeuer would geue moſt money beſt could flatter prince knew wel good men abhorre preheminence gote beſt byſhoprike ſtead god word publiſhed commaundements made lawes haue vnder made mē beleue could erre ſoeuer dyd ſayd euen rowmes ſtede moſes aaron eliazer ioſue calib fayth full folke came herode anna cayphas pylate iudas whiche put chriſt death great alteration church ſithen time chriſt hys apoſtlesso ſtede chriſt peter paule iames iohn faythfull folowers chriſt haue ye pope cardinal archbyſhops byſhops proude prelate proctour malitious miniſters maſters deuill notwithſtandyng tranſforme ſelues lykenes1 cor 11 though miniſters righteouſnes whoſe end ſhalbe accordyng workes litle flock left corruptedso body cankered long agone left certaine ſmall member whiche god puiſſaunt power hath reſerued vncorrupted becauſe ſée cankered owne fleſh pure anger burne leſt cōtinued might ſéeme ſome deformitie owne cankered carkaſe comparyng theſe whole member ſcabed body teacheth leaues ſhortly al poyſon wickleff oecolampadius huſkyn tyndall zwynglius haue taught bookes cōcerning bleſſed sacrament aulter onely affirmyng breade ſtill luther doth alſo theſe beaſtes ſayth nothing el ſame syr thomas ſaith theſe dregges hath dronken wickleffe oecolampadius tyndall zwinglius ſo hath argueth beſide iiij maner folke metely well perceyued knowen god hath part hys open vengeaunce declared frith luther pricke run ſcripture god neither affirme deny thyng becauſe luther ſo ſayth becauſe scripture god doth ſo conclude determine take luther ſuch author thinke hee erre thinke verely may erre doth erre certayne poyntes although ſuch concerne ſaluation damnation theſe bleſſed god theſe ye call heretickes agrée right well likewiſe alow thing becauſe wickleffe oecolampadius tyndall zwinglius ſo ſay cauſe ſée place purely expoūde scripture proceſſe text doth fauour ſentence ſay affyrme bread ſtill luther doth ſame ſay agayne becauſe luther ſo ſayth becauſe cā proue wordes true ſcripture reaſon nature doctor paule calleth bread ſaying bread whiche 1 cor 10 breake fellowſhip body chriſt though paule calleth sacrament bread many yet one body one bread many partaker one bread againe ſayth often ye eate thys bread 1 cor 11 drinke thys cuppe ſhall ſhewe lordes death vntill come alſo luke calleth bread actes ſaying continued fellowſhip actes 2 apoſtles breaking bread prayer alſo chriſt called cuppe fruite vyne ſaying ſhall hence forth drinke fruite vyne vntill luke 22 drink new kingdome father furthermore nature doth teach y• bread nature ſayth bread sacrament wine continue nature bread mouleth kept long yea wormes bréede poore mouſe runne away deſire meate dinner euident inough remayneth bread alſo wine reſerued would waxe ſower wyne waxe ſowre kept lōg confeſſe ſelues therefore houſell laye people one kinde onely becauſe wine continue reſerued haue ready hand whē nede ſurely remayned bread could mould waxe full wormes euē ſo remained wine could waxe ſower therefore falſe doctrine prelate ſo long haue publiſhed finally remayneth bread might proued doctor proue bread remayneth sacrament authoritie many doctor call bread wine chriſt apoſtles though ſome ſophiſters would wraſt ſayings expound phantaſie yet ſhall alleage one doctor alſo pope rome maketh ſo plaine v ſhall compelled ſhame hold tongue pope gelaſius writeth thys maner certe ſacramenta gelaſius pope contra eutych neſtorium quae ſumimus corporis ſanguinis christi diuine re ſunt propterea per illa participes facti ſumus diuinae naturae tamē nō deſinit eſſe ſubstantia vel panis vini ſed permanent ſuae proprietate naturae et certe imago ſimilitudo corporis ſanguinis christi actione misteriorum celebrantur ſay surely ſacramentes body bloud chriſt godly thing therfore made partaker godly nature yet doth ceaſe ſaying gelaſius pope ſubſtance nature bread wine continue propertie owne nature ſurely image ſimilitude body bloud chriſt celebrated acte myſteries thys ſure olde doctrine auoyde therefore scripture nature father conclude remaineth ſubſtaunce nature bread wine ye ſay affyrme nothing el dare ſay ye vntruely report v ſhewe bread ye ſay méetely well knowen maner folke god hath part open vengeance declared aunſwere maſter wickliffe wickleffe noted liuing man onely moſt famous doctrine alſo ſincere life conuerſation wickleffe buried xv yeare brentneuertheleſſe declare malicious mindes vengeable harte men ſay xv yeare buryed tooke hym vp burnt hym facte declared furye although felt fire math 10but bleſſed god hath geuen ſuch tyrantes power ouer thys corruptible body malach 2for ſoule ye binde burne god may bleſſe curſe curſe bleſſe oecolampadiusand oecolampadius whō alſo call huſkyn moſt aduerſaries haue euer commended conuerſation godly life god appoynted hys tyme gaue place vnto nature euery mā muſt dyed canker tyndalland tyndall truſt liueth well content ſuch poore apoſtles life god gaue hys ſonne chriſt hys faythfull miniſters thys world ſure ſo many mite ye yearely poundes although ſure hys learning iudgement scripture worthy bee promoted biſhops england receaued letter hym written ſince chriſtmas wherein among matter writeth thus call god recorde agaynſt day ſhall appeare lorde ieſus geue reckoning doings neuer altered one tyndall declareth innocency ſillable god worde agaynſt conſcience would doe thys day earth whether honour pleaſure rich might geuen moreouer take god recorde conſcience deſire god ſelfe thys world without kéepe hys lawes c iudge chriſtē reader whether theſe word ſpoken faythfull clere innocent hart hys behauiour ſuch ſure man cā reproue hym ſinne howbeit mā innocent god beholdeth hart zwingliusfinally zwinglius man ſuch learning grauitie beſide eloquence thinke man chriſtendome might haue compared hym notwithſtanding ſlaine battell defending hys citie zwinglius ſlayne iuſt righteous cauſe common wealth agaynſt aſſaulte wicked enemy whiche cauſe moſt righteous hys maſterſhip meane vengeaunce god declared hym euill perſon becauſe ſlaine may ſay nay ſhew euident example contrary ſometyme god geueth victorye agaynſt haue moſt righteous cauſe euident booke iudges iudic 20where child iſraell gathered together puniſhe ye ſhamefull ſodomitrie tribe beniamin number 25 thouſand iſraelites 400 thouſand fighting men came silo aſked god ſhould theyr captaine agaynſt beniamin note child iſraell fought god commaundement righteous cauſe yet twiſe ouerthrowenand 25 thouſand ſlue iſraelites 12 thouſand one day fledde child iſraell vnto lord silo made great lamentation hym euen vntill night aſked hym counſell ſaying ſhall go fight agaynſt tribe beniamin brother god ſayd vnto yes goe vp ſight agaynſt thē went next day fought agaynſt ſlaine agayne iſraelites 18 thouſand men came backe agayne vnto houſe god ſat wept lord faſted day vntill euen aſked hym agayn whether ſhould fight agaynſt theyr brother god ſayd vnto yes morrow deliuer handes next day ye tribe beniamin vtterly deſtroyed ſauyng 600 men hid thē ſelues wildernes euident child iſraell loſte victorye twiſe yet notwithſtanding iuſt cauſe fought god commaundement beſides iudas machabeus ſlaine righteous cauſe manifeſt firſt booke machabées1 macha 3 therfore euident argument vengeance god ſlaine battell righteous cauſe therefore thinketh thys man malaparte ſo bluntly enter god iudgement geue ſentence matter called counſell thus haue ſufficiently touched hys preface thoſe pointes ye afterward touched largely haue willingly paſſed becauſe ſhall touch thē earneſtly hereafter let v ſée heproueth ¶ y great wonder ſee vppon light ſleight occaſiōs fallē vnto theſe abhominable hereſies denieth cā ſay nay sauiour ſayd ſelfe fleſhe verely meate bloud verely drinke denieth alſo chriſt ſelfe laſt supper takyng bread bleſſed handes bleſſed ſayd vnto diſciples take eate body ſhalbe geuen likewiſe gaue thē chalice bleſſyng conſecracion ſayd vnto chalice bloud new teſtament ſhalbe ſhed many ye remembrance ¶ great wonder ſee frith ignoraunt proctour playne textes ſcripture iudgmēt might wel perceiue y• chriſt ſpake theſe wordes fleſh verely meate bloud verely drinke ſpake nothing ye ſacramēt inſtitute vntill laſt ſupper theſe wordes ſpokē ye iewes long ment ye carnall eatyng drynking bodye bloud ſpirituall eating done fayth tothe bellye wherof auſtyn chriſte ſpake carnall eating ſpirituall catyng ſayth ſayth vppon goſpell iohn prepareſt thou tothe bellye beleue thou haſt eaten ye chriſtes word muſt vnderſtāded ſpiritually calleth hys fleſhe meat becauſe meate eating diſgetting bodye doth ſtrengthen theſe corruptible mēbres ſo likewiſe doth chriſtes fleſhe beleuing taketh ſinne vpon ſelfe ſuffered death deliuer v ſtrengthen immortall ſoule likewiſe drinke dronken doth comfort quicken frayle nature likewiſe doth chriſtes bloud drinkyng bowelles ſoule beleuing remembring ſhed ſinnes comfort quicken ſoule vnto euerlaſting lyfe eating drinking ye ſpeaketh place papiſtes doe falſly alledge text ſo may perceaue text following ſayth eateth body drinketh bloud dwelleth poſſible vnderſtād ſacrament falſe ſay ye eateth ſacrament body drinketh ſacrament bloud dwelleth chriſt chriſt hym ſome man receiueth vnto condemnation thus doth saint auſten expound ſayinge hoc eſt enim aug iohā tract 26 chriſtum manducare illo manere illum manentem ſe habere eating chriſt dwell haue dwelling v ye ſo euer dwelleth chriſt beleue chriſt dwell chriſt ye ſay beleueth y• ſēt god ſaue v ſinnes doth verely eate drinke body bloud although neuer receiued ſacrament ye ſpirituall eating neceſſary y• ſhal ſaued man cōmeth god wtout eating chriſt beleuing hym ſo denye chriſt ſpeaketh theſe wordes ſurely ment ſpiritually saint auſten declareth place playnely proueth touching ye wordes ye math 26 chriſt ſpake vnto hys diſciples laſt supper deny y• ſayd ſo y• ſo fleſhly ment ye falſly faine vtterly deny ſay ye wordes alſo ſprite life ſpiritually vnderſtāded ye called body certaine iohn 6 iohn 15 propertie euen cauled ſelf vyne diſciples dery vine braunches cauled himſelfe iohn 10 dore ye ſo dede certaine property ſimilytudes mā ſome propertie ſayeth neighhours horſſe horſſe mine vp downe meaning euery thing ſo like lyke iacob builded aulter gene 35 gene 32 cauled houſe god iacob called ye place wraſtled aungell face god paſcall lambe cauled paſſing lord broken potſherd cauled hieruſalem ieremy 19 ſo dede certaine ſimilitudes property name itſelf might put men remēbraunce ment thing ſufficiently declared firſt treatiſe muſt nedes confeſſe beleue body bloud dede haue playne wordes ſauiour ſelfe vpon ſide ground foundacion fayth true ſo haue ye wordes god ſay frith broken potſherd hieruſalem chriſt ſtone chriſt vine dore yet yf ſhould beleue thinke dede theſe thing ſpirituall neuertheleſſe deceiued though ſo ſayd yet ſay hys woordes ſpiritually bee vnderſtanded ſay flye fayth playne open ſcriptures allegory deſtroy true ſence letter aū ſwere ſome textes scripture onely vnderſtand letter paule ſayeth chriſt rom 4 died ſinnes aroſe agayne iuſtification ſome textes onely vnderſtand ſpiritually way allegory paule ſayth chriſt ſtone chriſt ſayth ſelfe 1 cor 10 iohn 15 iohn 10 vyne doore ſome muſt vnderſtand litterally ſpiritually god ſayd egipt cauled ſonne although literally fulfilled childrē iſraell whē brought oſea 17 egipt great power wonder yet alſo ment verified chriſt hymſelfe ſpirituall ſonne cauled egipt ye death herod agayne ſpiritually fulfilled math 2 v whiche chriſtes bloud deliuered frō egypt ſinne power pharao y• scripture ſpeaketh diuerſly hath diuers ſenſes deuil ſay text ſcripture body onely ſpiritually vnderſtand litterally ye doth auſten alſo cōfirme writeth vnto adamantus ſayth theſe ſentenſes ſcripture chriſte ſtone bloude ſoule body figuratiuelie bee vnderſtande ſay ſpiritually waye allegorie thus haue saint auguſtin wholly ſide whiche thing ſhall yet heare plainly appeare example bridegromes ring well alow take bleſſed ſacrament beleft v token memoriall chriſt dede ſay hole ſubſtaunce ſame token memoriall owne bleſſed bodie ſo ſay mocker trifler chriſt hath left v better token man would haue v take therin fareth like man whō bridgrome deliuered goodly gold ryng riche rubie therein deliuer bride tokē thē would like falſe ſhrewe keepe away gold ring geue bride ſtede therof proper ring riſhe tell bridgrome would ſend better el like one bridgrome geuē ſuch ryng golde hys bride token tell plaine make beleue ring coper braſſe miniſhe bridgromes thanke right glad ye ye admit myne example graunt ſacrament frith left token memoriall chriſt déede ſay whole ſubſtaunce ſame token memoriall owne bleſſed bodye ſoner ſayd proued auſten ſheweth cōtrary partly touched ſhalbe declared plainelye ſay fare like falſe ſhrew would kepe gold ring ye bride geue ring riſhe tell golde ring copper braſſe miniſh bridegromes thanke aunſwere aunſwere more triflyng denye ring moſt fine gold ſet rich rubyes gotten ryng meane sacrament onely moſt perfite token memoriall bridgromes benefites vnfayned fauour partie alſo partie euchariſtia euchariſtia ſay thankes geuyng gracious giftes ſhe vndoubtedly knowledgeth ſelfe haue receiued verely bread broken among ſo verely chriſtes body brokē ſinnes verely receiue bread bellye thorough eating ſo verely receiue frute death ſoules beleuyng hym therefore right cauſe ſhould come table lord aſſemble supper valure bread wyne meate eaten entent geue hym thankes commonly among thē ineſtimable goodnes procéede vnto purpoſe man would come vnto bryde tel goodly gold ryng owne bridgrome fleſh bloud bone thē thinke ſhe haue wytte ſhe hath cheke mate might aunſwere mocked ſayd leſſe ſhe might beleue ſay owne bridgrome ſhould ſhe néede remēbraūce hym ſhould hee geue remembraunce remembraunce preſuppoſeth thyng abſent therefore remembraunce hym preſent maruell therfore much hee afearde affirme theſe wordes chriſt body bloud muſt needes vnderſtand waye ſimilitude allegorye woordes bee vyne doore nowe wottes well though ſome wordes ſpoken mouth chriſt vnderſtand onely way ſimilitude allegory yet foloweth thereupon euery like word chriſt orher place allegory ſuch ſhift cauillation wicked arrians vſed tooke frō chriſtes perſon omnipotent godhead graunt arrians erred ſayth though ſome frith place word taken figuratiuely foloweth therfore euery place ſhould likewiſe taken one queſtion muſt aſke maſterſhyp doth know worde text scripture muſt taken figuratiuely way ſimilitude hee calleth neceſſary allegory thinke though ſome men may aſſigne good cauſes euidences firſt knowledge textes scripture textes conferred certeine place ye scripture muſt vnderſtand ſpiritually vnto wil ſtand litterall ſence thē thinke muſt néedes takē ſpiritually figuratiuely infinite textes scripture ſée thomas felt chriſt woūds put finger ſide called hym lord god text ſcripture repugneth vnto ſame may well ſtand together thinketh foly affirme worde god text ſhould taken figuratiuely way allegory matter proceſſe scripture ſtand litterall ſenſe ſhall hereafter appeare therfore neceſſitie compelleth v expounde figuratiuely doth alſo auſten holy doctours hereafter ſhall playnly appeare euery man finde new fonde phantaſie vppon text holy scripture may haue hys owne mynde taken hys owne expoſition beleued agaynſt expoſitions olde cunnynge doctours saintes thē may ſurely ſee article chriſten faith cā ſtand eudure lōg alledgeth hierome ſayth expoſition interpretours cō ſent common catholicke church ſtrength euery man might beleued could bryng ſome textes scripture hym expounded pleaſed hym ſelfe could ſayth holy man bryng new ſect alſo ſay scripture mā true chriſtē mā mēber church kepeth ij coates good faith ſayth way alowed able ſelfe find xv new ſectes one fore noone peter ſayth scripture expounded appetite frith priuate perſon euē geuen ſpirite god man muſt declared ſame ſpirite therefore man beleued bryngeth hys owne iudgement onely vpon ſentēce scripture man ſhalbe beleued bringyng mynde phantaſie wil beleued let bryng either playne texte ſhal expounde firſt el leſt muſt bryng ſuch ſentēce ſtand proceſſe scripture hierome alowed agaynſt determination counſell malta ſith alone great multitude onely becauſe brought euidēt ſcripture whiche tyme ſentence none remembred yet brought could auoyde likewiſe except bryng euidēt ſcripture ſhal expoūd deſire beleued ſayth good fayth able find xv new ſectes one fore noone may thāke god hath ſuch pregnaunt wytte yet truſt pretely •… ypped ſhould find one peril damnatiō therin would wt plaine text cōfute ſhould able auoyde ouer circumſtaunces place goſpel whiche sauiour ſpeaketh sacrament may well make open difference ſpeche matter thoſe hee ſpake thoſe allegorye ſo ſpake hee playnly meanyng ſpake body hys bloud beſide allegoryes lord ſayd vyne ſaid dore none heard thyng marueiled therof becauſe perceyued well ment materiall vyne deede doore neither ſayd hys fleſh meate bloud drinke ſhould ſaued dyd eate fleſh drinke bloud ſuch wonder ther could abyde wherefore becauſe perceyued well hys wordes manner circumſtaunces chriſt ſpake fleſhe bloud dede openly knowen confeſſed frith iohn 6 among learned men 6 chapter ioh chriſt ſpake one worde concerning ſacrament body bloud whiche tyme yet inſtitute ſpake ſpirituall eating drinking body bloud ſoules fayth body bloud haue touched circumſtances place dede proue fleſhly minded vnderſtode ſpirituall wordes ſauiour chriſt therfore wō dered murmured inſomuch chriſt ſayd vnto thē doth offend ſay ye ſhall ſee ſonne man aſcending thether addeth auſten ſhall note ſaying auſten know ment geue fleſh eate wt teth ſhall aſcende hole chriſt addeth ſpirite quickeneth fleſhe profiteth nothing word ſpeake ſpirite lyfe ſay ſayth auſten ſpiritually vnderſtand chriſt ſayth fleſhe profiteth nothing meaning owne fleſh auſten ſayth meaneth fleſhe chriſt profiteth nothyng doth profite profiteth vnderſtode hym ye ſay profiteth eaten doth much profit ſlayne thorough ſheding bloud wrath god father pacified ſinnes forgeuen wher maſterſhip ſayth people perceiued well ment therfore wondred ſo ſore could abide becauſe perceiued well wordes māner circūſtances meaning wil ſay vnderſtood hym ſay vnto frith vſeth wordes without alledgyng authority naye yea thē would thinke beleued ſone ſurely ye reaſon withſtanding thankes god able bring auctorite iudg betwene v whoſe iudgment truſt maſterſhip admit auctor auſten whiche ſayth diſcipuli enim eius qui eum ſequebantur augustinus ſermone ad infantes expauerunt exhorruerunt ſermonem non intelligentes ſay diſciples followed hym aſtonied abhored wordes vnderſtode becauſe maſterſhip ſhal thinke ouerſhot felfe ſpake wiſt ſhall allege hym ſaying ſame wordes place cum diceret niſi quis manducauerit carnem c illi non intelligentes augu 54 dixerunt ad inuicem durus eſt hic ſermo quis poteſt eum audire chriſt ſayd except man eate fleſh drinke bloud ſhal iewes vnderſtode chriſt carnally ſpiritually meant haue lyfe becauſe vnderſtode ſayd ech hard ſaying heare thus truſt geue place although yet leaſt vnto auſten receiue truth ſo plainely proued maſterſhip allegeth text ſacrament except eate fleſh drinke bloude could ſaued fallen errour pope nocent ſemeth fallen error pope innocent likewiſe vnderſtanding text vpon ſacrament doth cauſed yong child infantes receiue ſacrament though bene damned died receiued carnall minde many mo buſhoppes great bohemes diſprayſeth yet expoundeth text doo afterward loked ſpiritually vpon matter confeſſed ignorance truſt ſhew auſtens minde vppon text ſhall helpe expoſition matter auſten third boke de doctrina chriſtiana 16 aug lib 3 de doctrina chriſtiana chapiter teaching ſhall know trope figure allegory phraſes ſcripture ſayth si autem flagitium aut facinus iubere videntur figuratiua locutio eſt niſi māducaueritis inquit carnē filij hominis et biberitis eius ſanguinem habebitis uitam vobis facinus vel flagitium videtur iubere figura eſt ergo precipiēs paſſionis dominicae eſſe commicandum et ſuauiter atque vtiliter memoria recondendum quod pro nobis caro eius crucifixa vul nerata ſit ſay ſoeuer ſcripture chriſt ſemeth commaund foule wicked thing muſt text taken figuratiuely phraſe allegorie manner ſpeaking muſt vnderſtand ſpiritually letter except ſayth chriſt ye eate fleſh ſonne man drinke bloud ye ſhall haue life ſemeth ſayth auſten auguſtine ſheweth plainly chriſtes woordes figuratiue ſpech commaūde foule wicked thing therfore figure commaunding v partaker paſſion ſweetlye profitablye print mynde fleſhe crucified wounded v truth thankes god doth auſten declare vnto v thing beſide opening text againſt more mynde doth plainely ſhew thought wordes chriſtes ſupper ſith called foule wicked thing eate fleſhe may ſoone perceiue thought foule wicked thing eate body ſeing body fleſh conſequently ſhall follow y• eyther worde eate chriſt ſayd take eate muſt taken ſpiritually el ſaying chriſt bodie muſt figuratiuely ſpokē worde eate taken letter déede eate bred therfore muſt néedes folowe ſentence body muſt bee figuratiuely ſpoken el auſten approued place thing byſhops thinke ſay nay beſides auſten ſayth quando loquebatur dominus noster ieſus augustinus ſermone ad infantes christus de corpore ſuo niſi inquit quis manducauerit carnem meam • iberit ſanguinem meum non habebit ſevitam caro enim mea vere est cibus ſanguis meus vere est potus intellectus ſpiritualis credentem ſaluum facit quia litera occidit ſpiritus est qui viuificat ſay lord ieſus chriſt ſpake hys body except quod man eate fleſhe drinke bloud ſhall haue life hym ſelf fleſh meat bloud drinke ſpirituall vnderſtandyng ſaueth hym beleueth letter killeth ſpirite quickneth may playnly perceaue thys texte muſt onely taken ſpiritually ſayth take letter kylleth profiteth nothyng therfore wonder haue bene led ſo long thys groſſe errour thys ſaying doth y• famous clarke origine confirme ſaying agnoſce quod figurae ſunt quae voluminibus domini origi leu ho 7 ſcriptae ſunt ideo tanquam ſpirituales non tanquam carnales examinate intelligite quae dicuntur si enim ſecūdum literam ſequaris hoc ipſum quod dictum est niſi manducaueritis carnem c occidit haec litera ſay marke ye figure written scripture god therefore examine ſpirituall men carnall vnderſtand thoſe thinges ſpoken thou followe letter chriſtes wordes ſpirituall carnall thys thyng ſpoken except ye eate fleſhe ſonne man drinke hys bloud haue life thys letter kylleth ala deare brother ſhould man offended thys doctrine ſith approued ſo plainly ſuch auncient holy father againe auſten ſayth qui manducat auguſti ſermo eirca ſacra feria paſcha carnem meam bibit meum ſanguinem manet ego illo hoc est ergo manducare illam eſcam illum bibere potum christo manere illum manentem ſe habere ac per hoc quinō manet christo quo non manet christus proculdubio non manducat eius carnem nec bibit ſanguinem etiam ſi tantaerei ſacramentum ad iudicium ſibi mā ducet bibit ſay eateth fleſh drynketh bloud abydeth hym thys eating drinkyng chriſt therfore eatyng meate drinkyng bloud abyde chriſt haue hym abyding v therefore abydeth chriſt chriſt abydeth without doubt eateth hys fleſh drinketh hys bloud although eate drinke ſacrament ſo great thyng vnto hys damnation euen y• ſame wordes hath bede vppon corinthian 1 cor 10 thys one place ſufficient idem beda ſuper 1 cor 10 proue purpoſe though ſayd one word doth playnly determine abydeth chriſt ſay ye wicked vnfaythfull doth eate hys fleſh drinke hys wicked eate fleſhe chriſt bloud although eate drinke sacrament ſo great thyng ſo muſt néedes follow sacrament naturall body chriſt vnfaythfull ſhould eate hys fleſh ſeing eateth ſacrament hys body doth auſten denye wherfore muſt néedes followe onely token remembrance ſigne hys body breakyng repreſentation hys paſſion might kéepe hys facte memory rom 5 geue thankes tender loue kindenes hys enemyes tooke vpon hym ſuffer moſt vyle death reconcile v vnto hys father make v hys frendes thys ſaying hath auſten place alſo writeth thys maner qui non manet quo ego non maneo non ſe august de ciuitat dei li 21 ca 25 dicat aut existimet manducare corpus meum aut bibere ſanguinē meum non aque manent christo qui non ſunt eius membra non ſunt autem membra christi qui ſe faciunt mēbra meretricis ſay abydeth abyde let hym ſay thynke eateth body drinketh bloud abyde chriſt member hys mē bers make ſelues mē bers harlot theſe alſo wordes bede playne proued agayne authoritie auſten bede beda ſuper 1 cor 6 wicked vnfaythfull member chriſt doe eate hys body drinke hys bloud ſacrament figure token memoriall breaking chriſtes body ſheding hys bloud yet eate ſacrament well wherefore muſt néedes graunt sacrament ye naturall body chriſt figure tokē memoriall therof good chriſten people count thys new learning firmed ſuch olde doctor faythfull father inough chriſten man loued contention becauſe ſo many ſophiſters y• world care ſay ſo holde theyr peace muſt néedes ſet ſome bulwarke thys holy doctor helpe defend hym el ſhortly ouerrunne hym make hym hereticke therefore alleage hys maſter ambroſe saint ambroſe ſayth non iste panis ambroſ de ſacra lib 5 cap 4 est qui vadit corpus ſed ille panis vitae aeternae qui animae nostrae ſubstantiam fulſcit thys bread goeth bodye bread euerlaſting life whiche vpboldeth ſubſtance ſoule furthermore great clerke proſper confirmeth ſame ſaying qui diſcordat christo nec carnem christi proſp libro ſententiarū ſent 339 manducat nec ſanguinem bibit etiamſi tamtae rei ſacramentum ad iudicium ſuae praeſumptionis quotidie indifferenter accipiat diſcordeth chriſt doth neyther eate hys fleſhe drinke hys bloud although receaue indifferētly euery day ſacrament ſo great thing vnto condemnation hys preſumption theſe alſo wordes bede vpon xj chapter idem beda ſuper 1 cor 11 firſt epiſtle corinthian may ſée auſtens minde onely alſo ſaying many moe therefore truſt good vnto hym ye condemne theſe holy father wrongfully puniſhed condemne thē muſt poore frith content beare burthen ¶ mynde expoſition old doctours vppon wordes chriſtes maundey ſayth chriſte ment plaine literal ſece hearer tyme expoſitours ſince chriſtē people beſide xv c yeare would haue taken onely litterall ſence beyng ſo ſtraunge maruelous might ſeme impoſsible decline letter allegory ſuch thynges beyng hee ſayth deede ſo many farre nomber mo touchyng ye hearer frith deceiued vnderſtode meane many tooke wordes fleſhly aunſwere chriſt murmured wordes ſpirite lyfe auſten ſayth ſpiritually bee vnderſtand fleſhly declared expoſitours thinke hath one old father certaine new felowes dominie thomas decam ſuch hath olde author maintaine hys quareling papiſtry whiche haue made pope god haue ſhewed auſten maketh full v ſo old father occolāpadius hath well declared booke quid veteres ſenſerint de sacramēto euchariſtiae ſome ſayinges ſhall alledge anone ſay chriſten people haue ſo beleued 1500 yeares falſe doubt people thought holy auſten faithful father taught ſaid make v notwithſtā dyng déede ſith prelate haue bene made lordes haue ſet vp lawes decrées contrary prerogatiue prince lyke moſt ſutle traytours haue made mē beleue may make lawes bynde men conſciences obey lawes god lawes blindyng ye people eye papiſtes haue corrupted scripture aduaunced ſelues aboue kinges ruler two thrée textes wrongfully wreſted aduaunce pride ought obey kyngs prince ſubiect lawes chriſt apoſtles euē vnto ye death sith tyme ſay haue made men beleue liſt made article faith pleaſure one article muſt ye church erre grounde doctrine truth article nowe ſufficiently knowen quéene katherine kyng henry wife erre ſhe haue erred ſpeake cruelly become article fayth ye pope article fayth made pope rome muſt y• head ye church ʋicare chriſt god law article fayth ſoeuer hee byndeth earth bounde heauen ſo much curſe wrongfully yet ye muſt feared infinite ſuch crede bleſſed bee god hath geuen ſome light prince hart hath lately put foorth booke called glaſſe truth whiche proueth many theſe article fooliſhe phantaſies euen owne doctours ſo truſt ſhalbe proued poynt sacrament though beleue article contayned crede ſufficient ſaluation article fayth article crede ye xij article wher ſufficient ſaluatiō therefore may thinke lye without ieoperdye damnation neuertheleſſe ſeing maſterſhip ſaith make ſay cleane contrarie olde father make againſt leſt wiſe neceſſary one v ſhould proue purpoſe indeede poynt would loke haue vauntage thinketh men ſoner frith allegeth authority proue hys doctrine true beleue hym great man poore man therfore néede proue part true proue well content therfore geue eare deare reader iudge betwéene v firſt wil begin tertulian tertul lib 2 contra marcionē becauſe moſt antiquitie tertulian ſpeakyng chriſt ſayth nec panem reprobauit quo ipſum corpus ſuum repreſentat ſay chriſt ſelfe reproue diſcommend bread whereby doth repreſent hys body vnderſtandyng thys place muſt knowe hereticke called marcion dyd reproue creature ſaid maner creature euill thys thyng doth tertulian improue sacrament ſayth chriſt dyd reproue diſcōmend bread whereby doth repreſent hys body though ſhoulde ſaye chriſt counted bread euill woulde haue left sacrament repreſent hys body meaning ſacrament ſigne token memoriall hys body body ſelfe thys hys minde doth playnly appeare hys fourth booke hée ſayth tertul lib 4 contra marcionē christus acceptum panem distributū diſcipulis corpus ſuum illud fecit hoc eſt corpus meum dicendo id eſt figura corporis mei figura autem non fuiſſet niſi veritatis eſſet corpus caeterum vacuares quod eſt phantaſma figuram capere non poſſet ſay chriſt taking bread diſtributing vnto hys diſciples made hys body ſaying thys body ſay figure body ſay figure body bodye thys bread coulde haue bene figure except chriſt true bodye vaine thyng phantaſie take figure vnderſtāding thys place muſt marke thys hereticke marcion agaynſt thys author writeth dyd hold opinion chriſt naturall body phantaſticall body thys opinion doth thys doctor improue ſacramēt ye altar ſaying ſacrament figure hys body ergo chriſt true body phā taſticall bodie vaine thing phantaſie cā take figure lo doth olde father long auſten hierome expound theſe wordes chriſt body ſay figure body therfore blame call new learning becauſe ſhall temerarious preſumption reiecte olde father ſhall eſtabliſhe wordes auſtē commendeth chriſtes merue lous pacience ſuffering ſo long ye traitor iudas though bene good man yet ignorant wicked thoughtes adhibuit inquit ad conuiuium quo corporis august prafa pſal 3 ſanguinis ſui figuram diſcipulis commendauit ac tradidit ſay admitted hym ſayth auſtē vnto maundye wherein take deliuer vnto diſciples ye figure body bloud doth holy father auſten call figure body ſure chriſt deliuered deſciples figure hys body man ſo childiſhe knoweth figure thing thing ſelfe example figure chriſt chriſt hym ſelfe figure peter peter ſelfe yet neuertheleſſe cōmonly call thoſe figure name thing repreſent may ſay ſée ye figure peter peter chriſt deliuered ye keyes kingdome heauen yet foole would thinke figure peter ſelfe repreſētatiō beſides auſten ſayth non hoc corpus quod videtis eſtis manducaturi nec bibituri august ſuper pſal 98 illum ſanguinem quem effuſuri ſunt qui crucifigent sacramentū aliquod vobis commendaui ſpiritualiter intellectum viuificat vos ſay ſhall eate body ſee drinke bloud crucifie ſhall ſhed haue geuen certayne ſacrament vnto ſpiritually vnderſtād quickeneth thinges bee playnly ſpoken furthermore auſten ſayth sepe auſten ad bonifaciū epist 23 loquimu • vt paſcha appropinquāte craſtinam vel perendinam domini paſſionem dicamus cum ille ante tam multos annos paſſus ſit nec omnino niſi ſemel illa paſsio facta ſit nempe ipſo die dominico dicimus bodie dominus reſurrexit cum ex quo ſurrexit tot anni tranſierunt quare nemo tam ineptus eſt vt no loquentes arguat eſſe mentitos quia iſtos dy ſecundum illorum quibus haec geſt ſunt ſimilitudinem nuncupamus vt dicatur ipſe dy qui non ſit ipſe ſed reuolutione temporum ſimilis eius dicatur illo die fieri propter sacramenti celebrationem quod nō illo die ſed iam olim factū est nonne ſemel immolatus eſt chriſtus ſcipſo tamen sacramento nō ſolum per annuas paſcha ſolennitates ſed omni die pro populis immolatur nec vti que mentitur qui interrogatus reſponderit eū immolari si enim sacramenta quādam ſimilitudinē earū rerū quarū ſunt sacramenta non haberent omnino sacramēta non eſſent ex hac autem ſimilitudine plerū que etiam ipſarū rerū nomina accipiunt sicut ergo ſecundū quendam modū sacrum mentū corporis chriſti corpus chriſti eſt sacramentum ſanguinis chriſti ſanguis chriſti eſt sacramentum fidei ſides est nihileſt autem aliud credere q fidem habere ac per hoc eum respōdetur paruulus credere qui fidei nō dum habet effectum reſpondetur fidem habere propter fidei sacramentum et conuertere ſe ad deum propter conuerſionis sacramentum quia ipſa reſponſio pertinet ad celebrationem sacramenti sicut de ipſo baptiſmo apoſtolus conſepulti inquit ſu mu christo per baptiſmum mortem non ait ſepulturam ſignificamus ſed prorſus ait conſepulti ſumus sacramentū ergo tantae rei non niſi eiuſdem rei vocabulo nuncupauit ſay often vſe ſay caſter draweth nye morow next day lordes paſſion yet many yeares ſith ſuffered paſſiō neuer done vppon sonday ſay day lorde dyd riſe agayne yet many yeares ſince hee roſe man ſo fooliſh reproue v lyers ſo ſaying becauſe name theſe dayes ſimilitude thoſe whiche theſe thynges done ſo called ſame day whiche ſame reuolution tyme like named done ſame day celebration sacrament kéepyng memoriall thyng done whiche done day ſacrament memoriall chriſtes death done lōg agone chriſt crucified owne perſon yet myſterye whiche remembraunce paſſion crucified people onely euery feaſt eaſter euery day neither doth lye aſked aunſwereth crucified sacramentes certayne ſimilitudes thoſe thynges whereof sacramentes ſhould sacrament ſimilitude moſt part take name thynges therefore certaine maner sacrament ſacrament chriſtes body bloud maner chriſtes body bloud chriſtes body chriſtes body sacrament chriſtes bloud chriſtes bloud ſo sacrament fayth faith thing beleue haue fayth therfore mā aunſwereth infant beleueth hath effect fayth aūſwereth hath fayth sacramēt fayth turneth ſelfe god sacrament conuertion aunſwere ſelfe perteineth vnto miniſtryng sacrament apoſtle writeth baptiſme buried ſayth chriſt baptiſme vnto death ſayth ſignifie burying vtterly ſayth buryed called therfore sacrament ſo great thyng euen name yt thing ſelfe c man would auoyde cōtention looke ſoberly thoſe woordes auſten hee ſhall ſoone perceiue myſtery matter euen next good friday ſhalbe called good friday next called day chriſt ſuffered hys paſſion yet ſo good friday paſt lōg ſ •• hen day chriſtes paſſion yet ſhall ſuffer death agayne vpon day hee dyed immortall euen ſo sacramēt called chriſtes body day day dyed onely remembraūce thereof ſo sacrament naturall body onely remembraunce body breakyng bloud ſheddyng likewiſe next eaſter day ſhalbe called day reſurrection ſame day chriſt dyd riſe remembraunce ſame euen ſo sacrament called body body déede onely remē braūce ſame furthermore euē prieſt doth offer hym ſay crucifie hym maſſe euē ſo sacrament body maſſe doth onely repreſent hys frith writeth maſſe according cōmon opiniō time paſſion ſo doth sacrament repreſent body yet though maſſe doth repreſent crucifying may truly ſay crucified euen ſo though sacramēt ſignifie repreſent body yet may truly ſay body ſo verely ſayth sacramentes haue certaine ſimilitude thoſe thinges wherof sacrament ſimilitude moſt part take name thynges bleſſed god whiche hath ſo clearely diſcuſſed matter faythfull father notwithſtandyng hée doth yet expreſſe playnly ſaying certaine maner sacramēt chriſtes body chriſtes body behold deare certaine maner sacrament chriſtes bodye chriſtes body brother ſayth certaine maner sacrament chriſtes body may ſoone know neuer ment ſhould naturall body déede onely token memoriall kéepe memorie death body ſo noriſhe fayth beſides ſimilitude alledgeth baptiſme doth wholy expound matter ſayth hée ye apoſtle ſayth ſignifie burying ſayth buryed yet déede baptiſme doth ſignifie thereupon auſten addeth hée called sacrament ſo great thyng euen name thyng ſelfe lykewiſe sacrament finally ſhort paſſe ouer many place haue gathered holy father touch one auſten ſayth non enim dominus dubitauit dicere hoc eſt corpus meum cum auguſt contra adamā tum cap 12 daret ſignum corporis ſui et eodem capite exponit sic eſt enim ſanguis anima quomodo petra erat christus nec tamen petra ait ſignificabat chriſtum ſed ait petra erat chriſtus ſay lord doubted ſay body gaue ſigne chriſte gaue diſciples ſigne body body ſame chapiter expoundeth truly ſo bloud ſoule chriſt ye ſtone yet apoſtle ſayth ſtone dyd ſignifie chriſt ſayth ſtone chriſt auſten ſayth playnely chriſt called ſigne body body chapter doth cōpare theſe thrée textes ſcripture body bloud ſoule chriſt ſtone declareth one phraſe expounded one faſſhion man ſo mad ſay chriſt naturall ſtone except naturall foole whoſe iudgment nede greatly regard therfore may well conclude ſacrament naturall body cauled body ſimilitude hath wherein ſignifieth repreſenteth body ſacrament ſo great thing called euen name thing ſelfe auſten ſayd immediately proufe inough conclude ye olde father holde ſame opiniō would ſurmiſe ſeing haue auſten ſo playne v chiefeſt among would ſur miſe ſay diſſented great mattter faythful father neuertheleſſe dare let ſtand poſt alone leſt ye diſpiſe therfore ſhew ye minde certaine alſo firſt maiſter ambroſe ambroſe wrighting vpon epiſtle paule corinthian ambroſi ſuper illud mortem domini annū • ia xi chapter ſayth quia enim morte domini liberati ſumus huius rei memoris edendo potando carnem ſanguinem que pro nobis oblata ſunt ſignificamus ſay becauſe deliuered death lord mindfull thinge meaning ſacrament ſignyfie • fleſhe bloud offered v doth ambroſe ſay inough mē ſophiſters would content reaſon ſayth eating drinking ſacrament chriſtes body ſignifie repreſent fleſh bloud sauiour ieſus withſtanding becauſe ſo ſlippery ſhall bynde lytle better man wordes ambroſe ſayth sed forte dice ſpeciem ſanguinis non video sed habet ambroſi de ſacra lib 4 cap 4 ſimilitudinis sicut enim mortis ſimilitudinem ſumpſiſti ita etiam ſimilitudinem precioſi ſanguinis bibis ſay peraduenture thou wilt ſay ſene appearaunce bloud hath ſimilitude euen thou haſt taken ſimilitude death euen ſo thou drinkeſt ſimilitude precious bloud may ſee ye conferring theſe two ſacramentes ambroſe iudged ſayth euen thou haſt taken ſimilitude death ſacramēt baptiſme ſo dooſt thou drink ſimilitude precious bloud ſacrament altar yet auſten ſayd apoſtle ſayth ſignifie burning ſayth buried likewiſe chriſt ſayd ſignifieth body body calling ſacrament ſigne token memoriall ſo great thing euen ye name thing ſelfe thus doth ambroſe choke ſophiſters neuertheleſſe alleage one place ambroſe ambroſi libro 4 de sacramen cap 5 ſaith dicit ſacerdos fac nobis inquit hanc oblationē ſcriptā rationabilē quod eſt figura corporis domini noſtri ieſu chriſti ye prieſt ſayth make v oblation acceptable c figure body lord sacrament figure chriſtes body ieſu chriſt cauleth plainly figure chriſtes body thing auoyde therfore geue prayſe vnto god let truth ſprede ſo plainely teſtified theſe holy father let v ſee hierome ſayth hierome writyng vpon eccleſiaſte ſayth thys maner caro domini hieroni ſuper eccle cap 3 verus cibus est ſanguis eius verus potus eſt hoc ſolum habemus praeſenti ſaeculo bonū ſi veſcamur carne eius cruore que potemur non ſolum mysterio ſed • tiam ſcripturarum lectione verus enim cibus potus qui ex verbo dei ſumitur ſcientia ſcripturarum est ſay fleſh lord meate hys bloud drinke onely pleaſure profite haue thys worlde may eate hys fleſhe drinke hys bloud onely myſterye alſo readyng scripture meate drink taken god worde knowledge scripture may ye ſée saint hieromes minde wordes firſt ſayth eate hys fleſhe drinke hys bloud myſterye ſacrament hys remembraunce memoriall eate fleſh chriſt drinke hys bloud myſtery hys paſſion addeth eate hys fleſh drinke hys bloud reading knowledge scripture calleth meate drinke yet ſure ye ſo groſſe thinke letter read turned naturall fleſhe bloud likewiſe neceſſary bread ſhoulde turned hys body ye letter ſcripture turned hys fleſhe neuertheleſſe • ayth may well eate hys body receauing ſacrament eate hys fleſhe reading letter scripture beſides hierome calleth vnderſtanding scripture meate drinke muſt néedes vnderſtand myſtery vnder ſtandyng scripture meate drinke ſpirituall ſenſe neither materiall meate drinke receaued mouth téeth ſpirituall meate drinke ſo called ſimilitude propertie becauſe meate drink comfort body outward man ſo doth readyng knowledge scripture comfort ſoule inward man likewiſe chriſtes body called meate drinke muſt néedes vnderſtand myſterye ſpirituall ſenſe hierome called chriſtes body materiall meate drinke hys body materiall meate drinke receaued mouth téeth ſpirituall meate drinke ſo called ſimilitude propertie becauſe meate drinke comforteth body ſo doth fayth hys body breaking bloudſheding refreſhe ſoule vnto lyfe euerlaſtyng vſe cuſtomably dayly ſpeach ſay childe ſetteth hys mynde delight ſport playe meate drinke thys childe playe alſo ſay mā loueth well hawking hunting meate drinke man hawke hunt man doubteth figuratiue ſpeach therefore wonder ſo blinde thys one poynt chriſtes body alſo take wordes figuratiuely theſe olde doctor dyd agayne hierome ſayth postq mysticum paſcha fuerat impletum agni carnes cum apostolis comederat aſſumit panem qui comfortat cor hominis ad verum paſchae hieronimus ſuper math 26 tranſgreditur ſacramentum vt quomodo praefiguratione eius melchiſedech ſummi dei ſacerdos vinum panem offerens fecerat ipſe quoquè viritatem corporis ſanguinis repraeſentaret ſay myſtical eaſter lambe fulfilled chriſt eaten lambes fleſhe apoſtles tooke bread comforteth hart man paſſeth true ſacrament eaſter lābe melchiſedech brought forth bread wyne figuryng hym ſo might likewyſe repreſent truth hys body bloud doth hierome ſpeake maner tertullian dyd chriſt bread wyne dyd repreſent truth hys body except true body beno figure ſame true body coulde leaue figure repreſent vnto v vayne thyng phā taſie haue figure repreſented example ſhould man make figure hys dreame repreſent vnto memorye chriſt hath left v figure repreſentation hys bodye bread wyne therefore followeth true bodye hieromes mynde doth manifeſtly appeare ye word beda doth copiouſly ſet thys ſaying hierome beda ſuper luke 22 writeth thys maner finitis paſchae veteris ſolennijs quae commemorationem antique de aegypto liberationis agebantur tranſit ad nouum quod ſuae redemptionis memoriam eccleſia frequentare deſiderat vt videlicet pro carne agni vel ſanguine ſuae carnis ſanguiniſ que ſacramentum panis ac vini figura ſubstituens ipſum ſe eſſe monstraret cui inrauit dominus non poenitebit eum tu e ſacerdos aeternum ſecundum ordinem melchiſedech frangit autēipſe panem quem porrigit vt ostendat corporis ſui fractionem nō ſine ſua ſponte futuram c et paulò poſt similiter calicem poſtquam coenauit dedit eis quia ergo panis carnem confirmat vinum vero ſanguinem operatur carne hic ad corpus christi myſtice illud refertur ad ſanguinem ſay ſolemnitie olde eaſter lambe finiſhed obſerued remembraunce olde deliueraunce egypt goeth vnto new church gladly obſerueth remembraunce hys redemption ſtead fleſhe bloud lambe might inſtitute ordayne sacrament hys fleſhe bloud figure bread wyne ſo declare hym ſelfe ſame vnto lord ſware repent thou art perpetuall prieſt order melchiſedech hym ſelfe brake bread hee gaue ſhewe breakyng hys body ſhould done without hys c little lykewyſe gaue cuppe ſupped becauſe bread doth bread wi •• e miſtically referred body bloud chriſt confirme ſtrength fleſhe wyne worketh bloude fleſhe therefore bread myſtically referred vnto bodye chriſt wyne referred vnto hys bloud may note firſt lambe remembraunce theyr deliueraunce egypt yet lambe deliuered ſo sacrament remembrance redemption yet sacrament redéemed v beſides ſayth chriſt ſtead fleſhe bloud lambe dyd inſtitute sacrament hys fleſh bloud figure bread wyne marke well ſayth ſtead lambes fleſhe bloud dyd inſtitute hys owne fleſhe bloud ſayth dyd inſtitute sacrament hys fleſhe bloud thyng sacrament verely sacrament ſigne holy thyng differēce betwene ſigne sacrament ſigne referred vnto worldly thyng sacrament vnto ſpirituall holy thyng auſten ſayth signa ad marcellum cum ad re dininas pertinēt ſacramenta appellantur ſay signes pertain vnto godly thing called ſacramentes therefore beda ſayth inſtitute ſacrament hys fleſhe bloud figure bread wyne much ſay auſtens definition dyd inſtitute figure hys holy ſleſhe bloud figure bread wyne ſay bread wyne ſhoulde bread wyne repreſent vnto v fleſh bloud chriſt figure ſigne repreſentyng hys holy fleſhe bloud vnto v perpetuall remembrance afterwarde hee declareth propertie bread called body wyne bloud ſauyng hée ſpeaketh ſo darkely plainly ſaith bread myſtically referred vnto bodye chriſt becauſe bread doth ſtrength fleſhe ſo chriſtes bodye whiche figured bread doth ſtrength yt ſoule fayth hys death ſo doth clerely proue purpoſe let v ſée chriſoſtome chriſoſto ſuper math 26 ſayth ſhall deſcribe v faith ould grecyās doubt loſt true fayth ſo euer world goo dayes chriſoſtome ſayth manner si enim mortuus ieſus non eſt cuius ſignum et ſimbolum hoc ſacrificium eſt vides quantū ei ſtudiū fuerit vt ſemper memoria teneamus pro nobis ipſū mortuū fuiſſe ſay ieſus haue died whoſe memoriall ſigne yt ſacrifice thou ſéeſt diligence gaue ſhould continuallye kéepe memory died v may ſée chriſoſtome calleth sacramēt ſimbolū ſignū ſay memoriall ſigne chriſte inſtitute kéepe death perpetuall remembraunce one thing thou muſt beware el thou art deceiued calleth alſo ſacrifice thou muſt wiſely vnderſtād hym sacrifice ſacrifice chriſtes body thē muſt chriſtes body ſlayne agayne thing god forbyd therfore thou muſt vnderſtand calleth ſacrifice meaneth remē braunce holy ſacrifice chriſtes body offered ye croſſe ſacrifiſed ſeing immortall notwithſtanding prelate heare chriſtes body repreſent ſignifie chriſoſt ſuper furthermore chriſoſtome ſayth ipſe quo que bibit ex eo ne auditis verbis illis dicerent quid igitur ſanguinem bibimus math 〈◊〉 carnem comedimus ac ideo perturbarentur nam quando prius de verba fecit multi ſolummodo propter verba ſcandalum paſsi ſunt neigitur tunc id quo que accideret primus ipſe hoc fecit vt trāquillo animo ad cōmunicationem miſteriorum induceret ſay alſo dranke leſt whē heard woordes ſhould ſay thē drinke bloud eate fleſh ſo ſhould troubled hée ſpake thoſe thyngs many offended woordes becauſe ſhould alſo chaunce hym ſelfe dranke firſt might cauſe come without feare partaking thoſe miſteries chriſoſtome noteth ye chriſt dranke chriſt drinkyng cup dyd ſhewe miſtery naturall carnall bloud draw groſſe vnderſtādyng wordes drinkyng teſtifie vnto natural bloud naturall fleſh déede onely memorial repreſentations body bloud therfore called thē miſteries ſay ſacramentes place sacrament miſtery one thyng notwithſtā dyng ſometyme word miſtery commō large ſignifying worde sacrament haue ſhewed sacrament ſigne holy thyng ſelfe repreſēteth albeit ſome tyme beare name thyng ſelfe image peter peter ſelfe yet beareth name chriſoſtome ſayth caro non prodeſt quicq hoc eſt ſecundum spiritum verba super ioh cap 6 ho •… 46 mea audienda ſunt qui ſecundum carnem audit nihil lucratur nihil vtilitatis accipit et paulò poſt quid eſt autē carnalit er intelligere ſimpliciter vtres dicuntur ne que aliud quippiam excogitare miſteria omnia interioribus oculis conſid • rāda ſunt hoc eſt spiritualiter ſay fleſh profiteth nothing wordes muſt vnderſtād ſpirit vnderſtādeth yt fleſh wynneth nothyng taketh profit litle meaneth vnderſtand fleſh carnally verely miſteryes muſt conſidered ſpiritually take thynges ſimply ſpoken thinke thyng miſteries sacramentes muſt conſidered inward eye ſay ſpiritually expoundeth ſelfe maner interiores autem oculus vt panem viderint creaturas tranſuolant non de illo pane piſtore cocto cogitāt ſed de eo qui dixit ſe panē vitae qu • per miſticum panē ſignificatur ſay inward eye ſoone plaine ſaying chriſoſtome ſée bread paſſe ouer creature thinke bread baken baker hym called ſelfe bread lyfe conclude one aſſent notwithſtādyng yet alledge mo old doctours ſo hence forward may aſhamed call new learnyng fulgentius ſayth illis enim carnalibus • u • pentius 〈◊〉 lib de 〈◊〉 tempore legis victimis ſignificatio fuit carnis chriſti quam pro peccatis noſtris ipſe ſine peccato fuerat oblaturus ſanguinis quem erat effuſurus remiſsionem peccatorum noſtrorum • ſto autem ſacrificio gratiarum actio que commemoratio eſt carnis chriſti quam pronobis obtulit ſanguinis quem pro nobis idem deus effudit ſay theſe carnall ſacrifices time law ſignification fleſh chriſt without ſinne ſhould offer ſinnes bloud ſhould ſhed remiſſion ſinnes ſacrifice sacrament chriſtes body thankes seuyng thākes geuyng remembraunce fleſh chriſt whiche hee offered v bloud ſame god ſhed v firſt note calleth ſacrifice notwithſtādyng remē braūce ſacrifice offered croſſe proued chriſoſtome hée playnly calleth thankes geuyng remembraunce chriſtes fleſh bloud ſo concludeth v neuertheleſſe becauſe sophiſters wold ſoone thinke auoyde place alledge one ſaying ſame author whiche ſhall neuer able auoyde fulgentius ſaith haymo teſtifieth hic calix nouum teſtamentū eſt fulgentius id eſt hic calix quem vobis trado nouum teſtamentum ſignificat ſay cup chalice new teſtament cup chalice cup new teſtamēt much cup ſignifieth new teſtament deliuer doth ſignifie new teſtamēt place doth playnly ſhew mynde whiche anoyded euen cup new teſtament ſo bread body cup doth ſignifie new teſtament therefore may conclude breade doth ſignifie body euſebius ſayth quia corpus aſſū ptum ablaturus erat ex ocul • noſtris euſebius ſideribus allaturus neceſſarium erat vt nobis hac die ſacramentum corporis ſanguinis conſecraret vt colleretur iugiter per miſterium quod ſemel offerabatur precium ta ſay becauſe would take away eye body toke cary heauen neceſſary time ſhould conſecrate v ſacrament body bloud offerd price redemption might continually honored miſtery conſecrate thing aply conſecrat vnto holy vſe may ſee ye calleth ſacrament body bloud body caried vp heauen alſo calleth miſtery whiche inough ſee alſo druthmarius expoundeth theſe wordes body druthmarius manner hoc eſt corpus meum miſterio ſay body miſtery thinke know miſtery meaneth chriſt crucified euery day miſtery ſay euery day death repreſēted ſacramentes remembraunce maſſe chriſtes paſſion miſtery ſay maſſe doth repreſent paſſion vnderſtanding theſe wordes controuerſie ſacrament sacrament body aulter body well chriſtes body euen body ſo chriſtes man ſay naturall bodie déede onely figure ſigne memoriall repreſentation body wherfore muſt alſo followe onlye figure ſigne memoriall repreſentation chriſtes body firſt part argumēt may thus proued auſten wryting ſermon ſayth manner corpus ergo chriſti ſi vultis intelligere apoſtolum audite dicē tem auguſtinus ſermone ad •… fantes vos estis corpus chriſti mēbra 1 cor 12 si ergo eſtis corpus chriſti et membra miſterium vestrumque mēſa dominipoſitum est miſterium domini accipitis ad id quod eſtis amen reſpondetis reſpondendo ſubſcribitis ſay yf vnderſtand body chriſt heare ye apoſtle ſayth ye body chriſt member 1 cor 12 therfore ye body chriſt member miſterie put vpon lordes table yereceiue miſterie lord vnto ye aunſwere amen aunſwering ſubſcribe vnto may ſée ſacrament alſo body yet naturall body onely body miſterie ſay figure ſigne memorial repreſentation body bread made many graines cornes ſo though many one bread one body propertie ſimilitude cauled body beareth name thing doth repreſent ſignifie agayne auſten ſayth quia christus paſſus est pro nobis commenda aug ſermo de ſacraferia paſcha uit nobis iſto ſacramento corpus et ſanguinem ſuum quod etiam fecit no ipſos nam et no ipſius corpus facti ſumus per miſericordiam ipſius quod accipimus no ſumus et poſtea dicit iā nomine chriſti tanquam ad calicem domi ni veniſtis ibi vos eſtis menſa ibi vos estis calice becauſe chriſt hath ſuffered v hath betaken vnto v ſacrament bodie bloud hath alſo made euen ſelues alſo made body mercy euen ſame thing receiue ſayth yt name chriſt ye come man would ſay chalice lord ye vpon table ye yt may ſee y• sacrament body chalice may ſée ſacrament body yet naturall body onely miſtery ſayd furthermore auſten ſayth hūc itaque cibum potum ſocietatem vult intellegi corporis membrorum ſuorum auguſt de ſacra feria paſcha quod eſt ſancta eccleſia praedeſtinatis et vocatis et iuſtificatis et gloriſicatis ſanctis fidelibus eius huius rei ſacramē tum alicubi quotidie alicubi certis inter vallis dierū dominico preparatur de menſa domini ſumitur quibuſdā ad vitam quibuſdam ad exitium re vero ipſa cuius eſt omni homini ad vitam nulli ad exitium quicūque cius particeps fuerit ſay meat drinke ſhould vnderſtād felowſhip body mē bers holy church predeſtinate called iuſtified glorified ſaintes faythfull ſacrament thing prepared ſome place dayly ſome place certaine appoynted dayes ye sonday receiued auſten calleth name sacramēt meanyng figure ſigne token chriſtes body •… table lord ſome vnto life ſome vnto deſtruction thing ſelfe whoſe ſacrament receiued men vnto life man deſtruction ſo euer partaker doth auſten firſt ſay thys ſacrament fellowſhip hys bodye member yet naturall bodye ſayd ſayth sacrament thys thyng receaued ſome vnto life ſaluation ſome vnto death damnation faythfull vnfaythfull may receiue ſacrament ſayth thing ſelfe whoſe ſacrament receiued men vnto lyfe man vnto deſtruction ſo euer partaker ſaying muſt nedes follow onely ſaythfull eate chriſtes body vnfaithfull eate receiued mā vnto deſtruction muſt alſo follow ſacrament chriſtes body déede onely myſterye ſacrament w •… ked vnfaythfull receaue body chriſt yet receaue sacramēt dā nation naturall bodye ſhould follow y• vnfaithfull ſhould receiue bodye contrarye minde auſten againſt truth thus haue ſufficiently proued firſt parte argument ſacrament body well chriſtes proue ſecond part plainely although inough declared ready haue eares euen bodye ſo chriſtes fyrſt ſhall vnderſtand wyne whiche called chriſtes bloud admixed water doth ſignifie people redemed sacrament body ſo chriſtes hys bloud ſo ye head chriſt without hys bodye faythfull people body without hys head nowe wyne • conſecrated turned bodely chriſtes bloud note well argument alſo ne • eſſarye water admixed bodely turned bloud faythfull people one conſecration muſt follow one operatiō lyke reaſon muſt followe lyke myſtery whatſoeuer ſignified water concerning faythfull people taken ſpiritually therefore whatſoeuer ſpoken bloud wine muſt alſo néedes taken ſpiritually thys reaſon myne made one bartram vppon 700 yeares bartram ſince thys matter firſt diſputation whereupon inſtance great charles emperor made booke profeſſing euen ſame thyng proueth sacrament chriſtes naturall bodye muſt rather ioyned v ioyned hym myſtery knot perfite charitie young man perceaueth well inough allegorie vſed ſome place cauſe ſufficient leaue proper ſignifications god word euery place ſeeke allegorie forſake playne common ſenſe confeſſeth would ſo ſaue neceſſitie becauſe ſayth cōmon literall ſenſe impoſſible thing ſaith ment therby cā true witte body chriſt ſacrament becauſe ſacrament many diuers place maundy witte handes chriſt euery apoſtles mouthes time glorified ſayth chriſtes body glorified could two place owne yet goeth ſayth whē glorified proueth ſaying saint auſten whoſe wordes bodye chriſt aroſe muſt one place c hetherto hath reaſoned reaſonably beginneth • rith decline dignitie diuinitie dirtie dregges vayne ſophiſtrye ſay muſt neceſſitie ſéeke allegorie becauſe literall ſenſe impoſſible cā true meaning ſtand proceſſe scripture textes doe neceſſitis conſtrayne conſtrue ſpiritually catcheth thys worde thys worde impoſſible captious sophiſter driue awaye ſtrength proofe make leaue ye literall ſenſe wherin proofe ſhoulde ſtand ſend ſéeke allegorye might ſtand reaſon driue away ye fayth deare brother ſith ſpeak impoſſibilitie reaſon impoſſibilitie ſtand textes scripture ye may ſée yt thys royall reaſō worth ruſh thē would fayne know place auſten ſo ſayth thing although harde tell ſith haue hys bookes looke yet thanke god memorye ſo bad cā ſhew hym ſhall finde becauſe thinke hee accuſtomed pope lawes saint auſtens better acquainted pope lawes auſtens workes workes ſith hee become prelate proctour patrone ſay ſhall fayle find hys lawes de conſecratione hee would wreſt word auſten ſayth bodye chriſt aroſe muſt néedes bee one place ſaying might meane hys body myght diuers place muſte one place ſay ſome one place ſpeaketh ſayth nothyng ſacrament ſayth hys body roſe muſt néedes one place poſſibilitie moe thys ſeemeth ſome goodly gloſe yet ſhall proue vayne euaſion man woulde ſaye king grace body muſt one place woulde expound ye notwithſtādyng hys wordes hys grace body might two place thinke mē myght ſoone iudge delighted delaye myght ſay néede bee determine muſt one place except thought deede y• myght moe onely one though men myght ſo argue men word yet auſtens word thys muſt néedes follow bringeth god would contrary antitheſis ſaying corpus quo reſurrexit vno loco eſſe oportet veritas ad hi • r • nimum autem eius vbi que diffuſa eſt ſay hys body wherein roſe muſt one place hys truth diſperſed place plainly concludeth cōtrary antitheſis chriſtes body occupieth one place onely hys truth diſperſed place ſo muſt hys body néedes one place onely example man ſhoulde ſay kyng hys grace bodye muſt needes one place hys power throughout hys realme mā doubteth ſaying one place meaneth one place onely therefore though ſome place ye worde muſt doth ſignifie ſuch neceſſitie excludeth poſſibilitie yet thys place doth ſo ſignifie contrary antitheſis doth euidently expreſſe ye ſay ſpeaketh nothing ſacrament would ye ſhould ſticke ſtill ſaying thys playne ſpeaketh naturall body therefore hee ſpeake ye ſacrament haue concluded ſacrament hys naturall body contrary whereof would haue mē beleue thus haue ſhewed euidence ſhall finde wordes auſten alſo haue rightly alleaged notwithſtandyng ſith maketh ſo much hys paynted ſheth ſhall alleage hym authoritye chriſtes naturall body one place onely thyng proued doth vtterly conclude yt sacramēt naturall body memoriall repreſentation ſame firſt let v ſée auſtens mynde auſten writyng vnto dardanus doth playnly proue naturall august ad bardanū body chriſt muſt néedes one place alſo yt ſoule bée one place occaſiō epiſtle dardanus dyd write vnto auſten expoſitiō thoſe wordes chriſt ſpake vn theefe ſaying day ſhalt thou wt paradiſe wiſt ſhould vnderſtād whether chriſt mēt théefe ſhould paradiſe chriſtes ſoule body godhead thereupon auſten writeth touchyng chriſtes body day ſepulchre ſaith chriſt ment thys worde paradiſe paradiſe although gardē buryed chriſt ſayth ment place ioy ſayth auſten hys ſepulchre chriſtes ſoule day hel man ſay paradiſe wherefore ſayth auſten text muſt néedes bee vnderſtand chriſt ſpake godhead marke argument auſten ye ſhall ſée purpoſe playnly proued ſeing erpoundeth text vpō chriſtes godhead becauſe manhode touching body graue touchyng ſoule hell may ſoone perceiue auſten thought whileſt body ye graue paradiſe becauſe ſoule hell could paradiſe alſo therfore ver • fieth text vppon diuinitie thought chriſtes body ſoule might haue bene diuerſe place hee would haue ſayd text muſt néedes vnderſtand diuinitie might full well yea much better haue ben vnderſtand manhode marke well place doth determine doubt matter notwithſtandyng faythfull father leaueth auſten laboureth proue chriſtes body might ino place one matter faſhion alſo taketh away ſuch ſonde imagination would cauſe men ſurmiſe chriſtes body ſhould moe place one ſaith cauendum eſt ne diuinitatem aſtruamus hominis vt veritatē auſer amus corporis non eſt autem conſequens vt quod deo est ſit vbi que nam de nobis veraciſſime scriptura dicit quod illo viuimus mouemur ſumus nec tamē ſicut ille vbi que ſumus ſed aliter homo ille deo quoniā aliter deus illo homine proprio quodam ſingulari modo ʋna enim perſona deus homo est vtrum que eſt vnus christus ieſus vib que per id quod deus eſt coelo autem per id quod homo ſay muſt beware doe ſo affirme diuinitie man take away truth body foloweth thyng whiche god ſhould euery place god scripture doth truly teſtifie v lyue moue hym yet euery place howbeit man godhead hee euery place touchyng manhode hee heauen néede make theſe woordes antitheſis becauſe hee thought verely though hys godhead euery place yet manhode heauen onely yet holy doctour goeth ſo may aſhamed augustin ibide • party ſayth secundum hominem namque terra erat non coelo vbi nunc eſt quando dicebat nemo aſcendit coelū niſi qui deſcendit de coelo filius hominis qui eſt coelo ſay touching manhod earth heauen ſayd man aſcendeth heauen ye deſcended heauen ſonne man heauē truſt content let truth ſpred ſure poſſible auoyde ſayeth touching manhode earth heauen ſpake thoſe wordes ſo proued mo place onely one place el yf auſten thought ye could haue bene mo place one body might haue ſayd earth heauen man might ſone haue deluded hym haue ſayde auſten tell may euery place ſo thinke auſtens mynde take away ye truth naturall body make phantaſticall body hereſie god deliuer faythfull beſides auſten doth ſaye chriſtum dominum nostrum vnigenitum dei • ilium equalē patri eundemque hominis auſtens wordes touching godhed place touching manhode onlye heauen yea onely heauen touching meaſure nature condicion qualitye naturall body one certaine place heauen many place thus much proued auſten thys truth onely proued auſtens authoritie alſo ye noble clerke fulgentius writeth maner ʋnus idem que homo fulgentius localis ex homine qui est deus immenſus ex patre vnus idem que ſecundum bumanam ſubstātiam abſens coelo cum eſſet terra derelinquens terram cum aſcendiſſet coelum secundum •• inam vero immenſam que ſubstantiam nec coelū dimittens cum de coelo deſcendit nec terram deſerens cum ad coelum aſcendit quod ipſius domini certiſſimo ſermone poteſt cognoſci qui vt localem ostenderet ſuam humanitatem dicit diſcipulis ſuis aſcendo ad patrem meum patrem veſtrum deum meum deum veſtrum de lazaro quo que cum dixiſſet lazarus mortuus eſt adiunxit dicens gaudeo propter vos vt credatis quoniā non erā ibi immenſitatem vero ſuae di • initatis oſtendens diſcipulis dicit ecce ego vobiſcum ſum vſque ad conſummationem ſ • culi quomodo autem aſcendit coelum niſi quia localis verus eſt homo aut quomodo adeſt fidelibus ſuis niſi quia idē immenſus verus deus eſt ſay ſame one man locall ſay conteined one place touchyng manhode alſo god vnmeaſurable father ſame one man touchyng ſubſtaunce manhode abſent heauen hee earth forſakyng earth aſcended heauen touchyng godly vnmeaſurable ſubſtaunce neither forſoke heauen whē deſcended heauē forſoke earth aſcēded vnto heauen may knowen moſt ſure word lord ſhew humanitie locall ſay contained one place onely dyd ſay vnto diſciples aſcēd vnto father father god god lazarus alſo hee ſayd lazarus dead hee ſaid glad ſakes may beleue agayne ſhewyng vnmeaſurableneſſe godhead chriſt aſcended heauen becauſe locall man ſayd vnto diſciples behold vnto worldes ende dyd aſcende heauen becauſe locall man preſent vnto faythfull becauſe vnmeaſurable god may conclude authority doctour alſo chriſtes body onely one place ſaith chriſt touchyng manhood locall ſay conteined one place onely hee proueth scripture euen chriſtes owne woordes true conſcience doth teſtifie ſo euer men ſhall iudge muſt néedes folow naturall body sacrament authoritie ſure man auoyde ſo playne natural reaſōs worthy reaſonyng firſt body chriſt vnglorified could ij place owne becauſe naturall body examine cōpariſon betwen ij bodyes chriſt wold tell would eche bodyes fiftene place would beleue hym would neuer aſke hym whether would firſt glorifie ſure glorified vnglorified ſayd hee able matter impoſsible god truth chriſt ſo ſayd ſo ſaying ſo mēt doubt frith able ſo déede ſo groſſely ment ye ſhall neuer proue déede ſo meant hys owne body naturall ſhould haue continued sacrament meate ſoule fayth body eatyng may well eaten faith although remayne heauen preſent mouthes ſay ſo ment thē wold neuer haue geuē v ſuch scripture dyd ſay groſſe imagination may ſtād proceſſe scripture whiche receiued ſhall appeare certaine textes 1 firſt sauiour ſayth ye fleſh profiteth nothyng waight fleſh profiteth nothing thoſe woordes doth compell v vnderſtād matter ſpiritually ſhort ſentence leſſe plucked backe frō carnall eatyng thē nichodemus ſhould dreame carnall regeneratiō chriſt ſayd vnto hym ſoeuer yt fleſh fleſh playne concluſion chriſt ſayd fleſh profiteth nothyng hee ment euen hys fleſhe chriſt profiteth much eaten fayth fleſh could profite vnderſtode hym eatē téeth albeit doth much profite bee ſlayne redemption eaten thorough fayth whiche thyng may although natural fleſh ye ſacrament may well beleue hym though heauen earth sacrament myne eye chriſt ſpake theſe woordes owne body playne auſtens wordes writyng vppon ſame place therefore ſayth august tract ſuper 6 〈◊〉 muſt vnderſtand ſpiritually addeth thou vnderſtand ſpiritually ſpirite lyfe though thou vnderſtād thē carnally yet neuertheles ſpirite lyfe vnto thée ſpirite lyfe vnderſtandeſt ſpiritually thoſe thing haue ſpoken alſo athanaſius ſayth spiritus est qui viuificat caro nō prodest quic que verba athanaſius 3 lib qui dix verb quae ego locutus ſum ſpiritus ſunt vita nam hoc loco vtrumquè de ſeipſo dicit carnem ſpiritum spiritū ab eo quod eſt ſecundum carnem distinxit vt non ſolum viſibile ſed etiam inuiſibile quod ipſo erat credentes diſcant quod ea quae dicit nō ſunt carnalia ſed ſpiritualia quod enim comedētibus ſuffeciſſet corpus vt totius mundi alimonia fiat sed ea propter meminit aſcenſus filij hominis coelum vt illos corporali cogitatione auelleret posthac diſcant carnem dictam cibum coelestem ſuperne veniētem ſpiritualem alimoniam quā ipſe det nā quae locutus ſum inquit vobis spiritus ſunt vita ſay ſpirite quickeneth fleſhe profiteth nothyng wordes whiche ſpeake vnto ſpirite lyfe place alſo hee meaneth owne fleſhe owne ſpirite deuided ſpirite fleſh might know fayth onely ye viſible part alſo ye viſible part ye hym alſo wordes ſpake carnall ſpirituall body ſhold haue ſuffiſed haue ben meate yt world euē therfore dyd make mention aſcenſion ſonne man heauē might withdraw frō bodley imagination might hereafter learne fleſh called heauenly meate cō meth aboue ſpiritual meate whiche hee would geue ſayth chriſt wordes haue ſpokē vnto ſpirite lyfe may ſée chriſt ſpake owne fleſhe ment playnly dyd nothyng profite infidelles dyd vnderſtād hym el geueth life receiued faythfull myſterie bartram ſayth l •… ram myſterie body bloud ſpiritual operation geueth bread wyne sacrament called myſteries lyfe without whiche operation thoſe myſteries nothyng profite ſurely ſayth hee may féede body ſoule féede 2 beſides scripture ſayth entreth ye mouth doth defile man chriſt ſayth caſt forth draught ſame reaſon foloweth doth ſanctifie make man holy sacrament entreth mouth therfore doth folow ſelfe doth ſāctifie make holy text ſhould folow two inconueniences sacrament naturall body chriſt firſt ſhould folow body sacrament body chriſt natural body thē note inconueniences muſt folow chriſt ſhould ſanctifie faythfull becauſe entreth yt mouth agayne ſhould folow body chriſt ſhould caſt draught whiche thyng abominable wherefore muſt néedes folow sacrament hys naturall body 3 furthermore chriſt would ſuffer deuoute woman loue ſought hym hys ſepulture touch hys naturall body becauſe ſhe lacked poynt fayth dyd count hym equall hys father much ſhall follow wicked may eate body chriſt wicked haue fayth loue towardes hym ſhall ſuffered eate hys fleſhe theyr téeth ſwallowe vncleane bodyes much touch hym yet notwithſtandyng receaue eate sacrament wherupon ſhould follow ſacrament hys naturall body ſhould deede eate hys body thyng may counted blaſphemye agaynſt god moreouer chriſt ſayth eateth fleſhe drinketh bloud dwelleth hym wicked eate sacramēt yet dwell chriſt know right well wicked doe eate sacrament yet neither dwell chriſt chriſt wherefore muſt followe sacrament fleſhe chriſt ſurely excuſe blaſphemye ſo directly contrary chriſtes wordes auoyde theſe textes chriſt ſpeaketh vnto hys diſciples ſaying yet little iohn 6 depart hym ſent agayne expedient iohn 6 depart excepte departe comforter ſhall come vnto agayn ſayth forſake world go iohn 6 math 26 mark 14 iohn 12 father ſhort ſaith poore men ye ſhall euer haue ſhall euer haue know right well hys godhead place touchyng hys godhead hee forſooke world aſcended vnto father wherfore muſt nedes follow forſooke touching hys fleſhe manhode thereto agréeth expoſitions auſten fulgentius alleaged yea al old faithful father haue forſaken world touching preſence hys naturall fleſhe manhode doctor define ment hys naturall fleſhe ſhoulde preſent sacrament bee eaten téeth therfore though chriſt ſo tell yet muſt take hym hee meaneth el begyled ye thinke god maye fulfill verifye thynges accordyng letter ſpeaketh may call obedient mā bernard doth hys monk adam may ſay doth right way ſo ſimply receaue thyng may put texte scripture warneth v wiſe serpentes text following ſufficient biddeth v ſimple doues doth maſterſhip graunt neceſſary allegorye whē paul ſayth chriſt ſtone whē chriſt ſayth doore ſcripture ſayth hee twaine ſyth god ſo ſayth able ſo make therfore reaſon ſhall nede none allegorye ſcripture moſt ſimple fooliſh may counted moſt faythfull ſo ſhall néede faythfull father expoūd text ſhall moſt merite beleue letter thys denye god coulde haue done ſo intended ſpake wordes ye ſcripture ſtandyng doth thinke doe example thinke god bloud hys ſonne chriſt myght haue ſaued men faythfull vnfaythfull ſo intended ſo pleaſed hym scripture god may thing yet ſo cānot denye hys truth neither reſtore virginitie c iohn 3 ſtandyng ſay hee doe impoſſible hym might make hys ſonne lyer ſayth beleueth damned againe beleueth ſhall ſée life wrath god abydeth vpon hym euen impoſſible ſtand proceſſe scripture wherin god hath declared vnfaythfull ſhoulde ſaued although god might haue done firſt ſo would likewiſe impoſſible scripture ſtanding naturall body chriſt ſhoulde preſent naturall body chriſt preſent teeth sacrament téeth sacrament fayth néedeth haue hym preſent bread may wel eate drinke fayth ſay beleue hym though preſent sacrament hanging croſſe 1 becauſe ſay naturall reaſons worth reaſoning alledge ſome moe ſée ſay firſt argumēts proue chriſtes naturall body sacramēt body bloud euery ſacrament ſigne holy thyng ſacrament altar ſacrament faythfull mē confeſſe ergo muſt follow ſacrament altar ſigne holy thyng ſigne holy thyng holy thyng ſelfe doth ſignifie repreſent ſhoulde feare call bread figure ſay ſacrament holy body lord sauiour 2 beſides woulde know neceſſitie profite hys fleſhe muſt preſent ſacrament preſence hys fleſhe profite v doth remēbrance hys body thys remembraunce may well done ſacramēt though hys bodye preſent therefore • ith god nature make nought vayne followeth cōſequently yt naturall fleſh onely memoriall therof 3 furthermore end finall cauſe thyng euer better thoſe thynges prouided end houſe better lyme ſtone timber prouided houſe ende finall cauſe ſacrament remembraunce chriſtes body thereupon muſt followe ſacrament hys naturall bodye remembraunce chriſtes body ſhould better hys body ſelfe thyng abhorred faythfull men 4 fondnes fayne ſoule otherwiſe eate angel heauen meate ioy delectation haue god glory euen ſo doth ſoule vpon earth eate fayth body chriſt heauen deliteth reioyceth while ioyfull eatyng chriſt • fayth vnderſtandeth fayth chriſt hath taken ſinnes vpon pacified father wrath neyther neceſſarie cauſe fleſh ſhould preſent man may well loue reioyce thing preſent though preſent hym manner 5 moreouer bread chriſtes body euen ye breaking ye bread death body breaking bread maundy death chriſtes body onely repreſentatiō • ſame al minde fayth doth ſpirituallye behold death euen likewiſe naturall bread body lord ſacrament ſigne memoriall repreſentation ſame albeit moniſion therof ye mynde fayth doth ſpiritually behold body ſurely therof man faythfull ſprite god worketh hart ſwéetely communion 6 finally lawfull eate drinke bloud onely man alſo brute beaſte apoſtels ſelues moued ye rule charitie inſtitute y• mē ſhould abſtayne bloud ſomewhat ſau • ring infirmitie y• iewes apoſtles orde •… e ſhould abſteine frō bloud meaning natural bloud apoſtels taught ye ſacrament fleſhe bloud eaten dronke téeth mouth faythfull vnfaythfull could haue bene greater occaſion haue excluded iewes chriſtes fayth euen thinke apoſtles would haue bene ſcrupulous haue dronkē bloud ſeing ſo playne agaynſt moſes lawe vnderſtand hym ſo groſſely ye peter cloth ſent actes 10 downe heauen manner beaſtes forbidden ye law commaunded ſlay eate aunſwered god wyne sacrament naturall bloud forbid neuer eate vncleane thing meaning therby neuer eate thing forbidden law wherof muſt néedes follow either neuer recei • ed ſacramēt whiche playne falſe elles hee ſpiritually vnderſtode wordes chriſtes maundie ye falſlye fayne plainely forbidden law eate drinke maner bloud know obiection one reaſon haue count inſoluble • e godes grace ſhall ſone auoyde reaſon paule ſayth eateth drinketh ſacrament vnworthely ſhall gilty body bloud lord ſay ſhould gilty lord body bloud receiue vnworthely except body bloud lord argument ſay weake ſlender ſhew solution many example may diſſolued deſpiſeth kinges ſeale letter offendeth agaynſt owne perſon yet letter ſeale owne perſon violently plucketh downe grace armes breaketh broade ſeale furious minde violence committeth treaſon againſt owne perſon yet armes pull downe violently kynges armes treaſon agaynſt hys owne perſon yet armes kinges perſon broad ſeale owne perſon clippeth king coyne committeth treaſon againſt ye kynges perſon common wealth yet mony neither grace perſon common wealth therfore argumēt weake ſlender euen man doth offende againſt prince perſon diſpiſing armes ſeale letter doth man offend agaynſt chriſtes body bloud abuſing ſacrament body bloud although preſent ye kinges perſon preſent armes ſeale letter beſides paule ſaith euery man prayeth prophecieth couered hed ſhameth hed hed chriſt ſhall therfore imagin chriſt naturallye euery man hed argument cōcludeth ſoth prety phantaſie finally auſten negligent hearyng word god great offēce ſayth y• doth leſſe ſinne negligently heareth ye worde god doth whiche vnworthely receiueth ye ſacrament chriſtes body bloud true reaſon worth riſhe chriſtes naturall body ye word preached men knowe yet ſinneth leſſe negligently heareth doth vnworthely receiueth ſacrament thus ſee inſoluble argument eaſely diſſolued ¶ muſt yong man conſider againe ſelfe confeſſeth cauſe ſelfe ſayth chriſt ſo ſaying ſo meane becauſe ſhould haue ment ſo impoſſible god bring meaning ſay chriſtes body might two place therfore proue thing impoſſible god doe el confeſſeth god onely ſayd alſo mēt dede yet ouer chriſt neuer ſayd yet doubtted nothing • ut able doe el ſ • could doe god almighty would myre wt ſopheſtrie wile would frith winne ſpores diſcant theſe wordes impoſſible would haue made men beleue
