ment could becauſe could reaſon ment impoſſible becauſe reaſon could reache diſputeth lyke maner ſophiſtication cōcluding confeſſe impoſſible becauſe god ſhould haue ment impoſſible god bring meaning deare bretheren quarelyng brabler babelyng ſufficiently diſcuſed ready ment impoſſible god bring ſo ment meant impoſſible ſtand proceſſe ſcripture haue receyued ſaye ouer though poſſible god haue done pleaſed hym yet ſcripture thus ſtanding impoſſible muſt make ſonne lyar ſay ſo ment letter ſtandeth would thē haue geuen v ſcripture would haue ſayd muſt depart ſent textes rehearſed ſayth ſumwhat y• could doe god almighty ſay ſhame prelate haue gotten ſuch ignorant procture defend ignoraūt proctor clergy ſure ſelues could haue ſayd much better el ſhould inſtructe leade right way ſelues ſo rude vnlearned ſhould know meaneth ye god almightie peece firſt article crede ſhould ſhip haue haue ſure flight thinketh god cauled almighty becauſe thing indéed • ſhould follow almightye thinges god almighty yet cannot doe thynges ſaue vnfaythfull reſtore virginitie violate ſayth thomas alſo remember hierome writyng virginitie vnto paule euſtochium ſinne ſayth dunce deny hym ſelfe ſayth paule 2 timo 2 man leraning alow • thē might god almightye becauſe ſomewhat yt doe acuſtomed ſcripture know called almightye becauſe doe thing becauſe god ſaid bee almighty becauſe ſupenour power aboue hym wil ſuperiour power aboue hym may doe wyll pleaſure doe may bring paſſe power able reſiſt hym hath pleaſure make hys ſonne lyer make hys ſcripture falſe dede may doe yet notwithſtanding abideth almighty hee may doe hee touching reaſon repugnaunce ſayth many thynges may ſeme repugnaunt thinges god ſeeth make ſtād together well inough addeth ſuch blynd reaſons repugnaūce induce many men great errour ſome aſcribyng thyng vnto deſtiny without power mās frewill ſome geuing man owne foreſight prouidence god becauſe poore blynd reaſon man ſee ſo farre perceiue god preſcience man frewill ſtand together ſeeme clearely repugnaunt hys digreſſion man fréewill frith greatly wraſtle hym thys one thyng may ſay ſonne god deliuer v frée iohn 8 2 cor 3 ſpirite god fréedome meane freedome doe freedome ſinne may bee ſeruauntes righteouſnes haue rom 6 ſpirite chriſt ſay auſten freewill wretched cā nought ſinne aug de ſpiritu litera touching ſuch textes repungnancy ſo diffuſe man reaſon light hys vnderſtanding attayne ſet together beſte make none article fayth thinke many neceſſary vnto ſaluation contayned article creede many neceſſary ſaluation crede thinke euery man beleueth beſech lay bigger burthen vpō v thoſe faythfull father dyd thought ſufficient ſure ſhould haue fewer heretikes neuer heard hereticke euer helde agaynſt article crede ye defame thys name onely put death becauſe ſay bound beleue euery poynt lawes tyrannye clergie allowe maintayne thyng true bleſſed god meetely well knowen already el many moe bene dead ere thys day wot well many good folke haue vſed matter many fruitfull example one face beholden diuers glaſſes euery peece one glaſſe broken twentie one word cōming whole hūdreth eares ſight one little eye preſent beholding whole great countrey thouſand ſuch maruells moe ſuch thoſe ſee dayly done therfore maruell ſhall yet neuer able thys younge man ſelfe geue ſuch reaſon meane maye bee done may haue ſuch repugnancy layd agaynſt ſhall fayne concluſion chiefe moſte euident reaſon ſaye cauſe thoſe thynges becauſe god hath ſo cauſed bee done almighty hym ſelfe may doe hym lyſt touching example doth alledge may ſoone frith make aūſwere like matter make cleane agaynſte hym make hym glaſſe graunt good example euen glaſſe doth repreſent face man ſo doth sacrament repreſent body bloud chriſt like euery péece glaſſe doth repreſēt glaſſe repreſenteth face face one face ſo doth euery péece sacramēt repreſent one body chriſt euery mā knoweth right well though ye glaſſe repreſent face yet ſubſtaunce glaſſe face neither face glaſſe euen ſo though sacrament doe repreſent body chriſt yet ſubſtaunce body chriſt sacrament face glaſſe sacrament hys body glaſſe face neither body ye sacrament face glaſſe thus exā ple maketh well v one word comming whole hundreth eares ſay worde ſounde qualitie ſubſtaunce therfore nothyng purpoſe likened chriſts body ſubſtaūce concernyng ſight litle eye ſay though eye diſcry ſée whole countrey yet whole coūtrey eye countrey knowen ye ſight eye though countrey ſo death chriſt hys bodye breakyng bloude ſhedyng chriſtes deathe body breakyng knowen sacrament yet naturall body chriſt knowen sacrament though naturall body thus exāples make nothyng hym rather much agaynſt hym hee ſayth young man hym ſelfe geue hym reaſō meane may done may ſay vnto hys maſterſhyp whē ſeuen yeare yonger day would haue bene aſhamed could haue geuen euident reaſon auſtens oxford ye whole ʋniuerſitie albeit vouchſafe ſpend labour paper ariſtotles doctrine yet haue ſo much touched hys example may werye alſo ſee ſhoulde repugnaunt one body may power god two place two bodyes may bee together one place poynte thinke young mā denieth beyng body two place againſt nature scripture frith cā alow two bodyes ſhould bee one place ſéemeth reaſonable haue good experience though body cā two place tower would haue frith ſpeaketh mer • ly beſide yet bleſſed god one place without cōpany meane one proper ſeueral place may two body deny till haue layſure proue yet length ſure proue ſhall worth poodyng pricke ſure muſt bee ratione poroſitatis vt igne ferro nam penetrationem dimenſionum nunq probabit neare laſt reaſon whiche proueth impoſsible body chriſt bee two place cā ſayth ſhew reaſon ſhould many place place wherefore muſt conclude many place maruelous concluded argument ſure euery childe may ſoone ſee conſequēt cā neuer folow vpon theſe two premiſſes antecedent made reaſon compiled treatiſe regard frith cauillations ſutle sophiſters thought sophiſters ſhould haue medled meate neuertheleſſe ſith nowe perceiue principally pouryng ſéekyng ſome pray ſet teeth woorke booke haue ſomewhat prouided haue brought ſuch hard bone buſie may chaunce choke thē yet argument ſo feble fayneth firſt part lyſt conſider ſenſe mynde bee curious ſay ſhew reaſon hée ſhould bee many place thus vnderſtand wyſe men reaſon cauſe ſhold many place muſt becauſe y• body ſo annexed godhead euery place godhead ſay muſt cauſe reaſon beyng many place neither man el iuſtly aſſigne maior firſt propoſition thus vnderſtand doth cō cluſion folowe directly ſhould ye cauſe muſt nedes graunt cauſe proued falſe scripture muſt néedes graunt thyng whiche ſo foloweth cauſe muſt néedes falſe ſo purpoſe proued concluded example aſtronomers ſay naturall aſtronomers ſay naturall courſe sunne weſt eaſt courſe sunne frō weaſt eaſt mā ſhould aſke cauſe ſée hym dayly take cōtrary courſe eaſt weaſt agaynſt hys nature aunſwere becauſe hygheſt ſphere whoſe courſe eaſt weaſt ſwift mouyng doth violently drawe inferior ſpheres hym cauſe alleage man aſſigne ſith cā proue ſenſe falſe ſcripture auſten scripture ſayth ye ſphere faſtened hebr viij chap auſten expoundyng text improueth aſtronomers whiche affirme moueth ſith ſay cauſe proued falſe ſcripture muſt néedes graūt thyng whiche foloweth cauſe muſt néedes falſe ſo may conclude againſt naturall courſe sunne frō weaſt eaſt aſtronomers ſay contrary concluſiō agaynſt aſtronomers eaſt weſt lykewiſe ſith cauſe chriſtes body ſhould many place aſſigned learned men becauſe hys body ſo annexed godhead euery place alſo place man aſſigne cauſe proued falſe scripture woman mark 14 ſought chriſt graue aungell gaue aunſwere hée body bene euery place aungell lyed alſo chriſt ſayd vnto diſciples luke 16 lazarus died bethania lazarus dead glad iohn 11 ſakes may beleue becauſe hys body euery place godhead chriſt ſayd truly ſaid therfore ſith ſayd cauſe aſſigned yet proued falſe scripture chriſtes body one place onely muſt néedes graūt thyng whiche foloweth cauſe muſt alſo néedes falſe ſo may cōclude againſt thē ye chriſts body one place onely may ſée conſequent foloweth premiſſes conclude ſhewe reaſon ſhould many place wonne might conclude therupon could many place though poſſible god make body two place able tell wherby ſhewe reaſon far conclude ſhewed frith immediatly though bare wordes ye toke hard conclude thyng yet haue declared ſo farre cō cluded cā auoyde ſayth though ſhew reaſon yet wonne nought thinke woulde angrye ſhould ſo aunſwere ſurely good caſe inough ſay thus néede neuer ſhew cauſe reaſon ſoeuer papiſtes ſay muſt ſtand reaſon ſo ſay church erre ſo teach contrary thynges yet good inough whē ſée mā make scripture agrée doctrine ſay theyr doctrine true inough man vnderſtand scripture though ſcripture ſeme neuer ſo repugnant v yet god ſeeth well inough ſay ſet together poſſible god make agree though cānot tell doctrine hath longe inough deceaued v men haue ſeene long ſpectacles yet thankes god begin ſee owne eye touching thys matter poſſible god poſſible ſufficiently declared al liſte loke beit though bounden content yet proue god may make body chriſt place becauſe yong mā coupleth propoſition ſo doe proue therefore god cā make body many place place almightie therefore thing good man hys olde frith dreame agayne thinketh god called almightie becauſe thinges dede ſhould followe almightye harpeth vppon falſe ſtring thynges ſaue vnfaithfull reſtore virginitie violated hee ſinne denye ſelfe thys man learning allowed myght god called almighty becauſe ſome doe accuſtomed ſcripture know called almighty becauſe thynges becauſe ſuperiour power aboue hym may doe hee hys pleaſure may bring paſſe hath wilpleaſure power make hys ſōne lyer make hys scripture falſe yet notwithſtandyng abydeth almighty may euen impoſſible ſtand proceſſe scripture wherin god hath declared vnfaythfull ſhoulde bee ſaued although ye firſt god might haue done ſo would likewiſe impoſſible scripture ſtanding naturall body chriſt ſhoulde bee preſent teeth sacrament fayth needeth haue hym preſent bread may well eate drink fayth ſay beléefe hym though continue ſtill heauen though preſent sacrament hangyng croſſe yet hys maſterſhip hath left one thyng vnproued euen pith hys purpoſe though hee proued hee hath god hys almightynes ſaith god may thyngs doth proue hath ſo done myght make chriſtes body many place place sacrament yet forgotte proue god hath ſo done therfore albeit dyd graunt hym myght ſo yet thereof doth followe hath ſo done déede god may many thynges doth therefore hys argumēt doth proue hys purpoſe thinke god hath ſo done well pleaſed put hym payne proue anone ye ſhall ſee hym ſo intangled brier ſhall witte become yet thys young man goeth proue poynt ſcripture except graūt point true ſayth el make angell lyer ſayd alſo el make though chriſtes body aſcenſion goe vp cloud heauen earth onely hid ſelf cloud playeth bo peepe taried beneath ſtill end forgetteth ſelfe ſo foule young ſophiſter would dare ſay haue bene full ſore aſhamed ſo haue ouerſeene ſelfe oxford peruiſe ye wotte well thing ſayth muſt therfore proue body chriſt euery place meane god could make textes bringeth proofe ſay place two thinges diſputed betwene one frith whether god make body two thinges diſputed betwen frith chriſt many place sacrament thereto hys maſterſhip ſayth ye god almightye may thing ſay nay affirme god called almightie becauſe may thing becauſe may ſay make hys ſonne lyer hys ſcripture falſe yet abydeth almightye thyng thys whether haue done albeit graunt hym poſſible yet neuer y• nere except cā proue hath done deede el thinke god hath ſo done ſayd god doe many thinges doth ye controuerſie thys doubt reſolued angell scripture graunteth hym ſelfe proueth place thereof • olloweth god hath done although poſſible ſo hys maſterſhip poynt ſhould graūt neuer ſo poſſible yet ſcripture proue ſo deede neuer neare hys purpoſe much thys euē ſayd poſſible ſtand proceſſe scripture haue receaued hys maſterſhip hath graunted hym ſelfe may ſure would haue done hee coulde otherwyſe auoyde may ſee ſore haue ouerſéene ſelfe god forbid man ſhould prone ready beleue yong man greate matter becauſe ſayth beginning bring men concord quietnes conſcience bringeth men worſt kinde quietnes may deuiſed telleth v doth euery man matter may without perell beleue way liſt euery man may euery matter without counſell ſone ſet hym ſelf reſt liſt take way beleue liſt ſelfe care way bene ſure paule would neuer haue ſhewed many perill ſicknes death lacke diſcerning reuerently body lord ſacrament came receiue hym chriſt ſhould depart world go father gaue frith deſciples commaundement iohn 15 ſhould loue ech ſaying ſhall men knowe ye chriſtes badge loue diſciples loue ech haue loued rule charitie wolde haue broken notwithſtanding often ieopardie among faythfull folke ſacrament vnitie thing conſidered thought neceſſarie aduertiſe party ſaue rule charitie proued ye firſt chapter treatiſe ſacrament naturall body none article fayth neceſſary beleued vpon payne damnation article fayth neceſſary beleued vnder payne damnatiō therfore blame would contencious matter ſith article fayth may lawfully diſſent without ieoperdye néede breake rule charitye rather receiue like pore brother example thinke mariage betwéene moſt redoubted prince quéene katerine lawfull may ſtand y• lawes god ſome thinke vnlawfull ought diſanulled ſhould matter breake rule charitie euery man hate neighbour would thinke doth greatly blame ieoperdie condemnation ſay proued ye firſt chapter againſt maketh buſines improueth whereby may ſoone gather true el ſith maſterſhip ſo laboureth theſe pointes would haue left y• vntouched may ſure concorde woulde bring vnto touching quietnes conſcience haue knowne manye haue ſore bene combred among certaine maſter arte died oxford confeſſed vpon death bed wept lying bed hundreth nyghtes within one yeares ſpace becauſe coulde beleue knowne bene neceſſarye article comfort quietnes ſhould haue bene vnto hym furthermore euery man ſo quiet ſelfe imagineth many thinke ſelues ſmall fooles haue receiued ſome fooliſh ſuperſtition eyther owne imagination beleuing goſſepes goſpel olde wiues tale thinke contrary deadly ſinne vtterly forbidden chriſtes goſpell example know houſe religion wherein perſon thinketh deadly ſinne go ouer superſtition ſtrawe lye croſſe pauement paynted picture image grauen dead man graue tread vpon although ſhould goe forelong vayne ſuperſtition wherewith conſcience combred corrupted may wéeded word god ſhewing hym none article fayth ſo thinke tell hym forbidden ſcripture ſinne albeit conſcience ſo cankerd ruſt rubbed yet god grace ſome hath enfecte ſame may come agayne god word cured full well ſhoulde neuer haue bene able quiet thēſelues likewiſe ſome beleue ſuperſtitious harte haue informed theſe quiet thēſelues becauſe beleue ye haue fet doctrine ſcripture proued ſelues perceiue ſcripture ſayth ſo content thinke contrary iudge ſinne touching paule ſuerely ye take hym wrong ſhew proceſſe taketh vnderſtode becauſe poſſible finiſhe fewe word ſhall deferre vnto ye bokes ende ſhall declare hym large facion ſay may beleue liſt body lord dede tell v truth ſuch fayth impoſſible true god ſelfe neuer bring make body yf man take bare wordes frith chriſt ſimplicitie deceiued thinke body ye man may iudge error god onely muſt iudge condemnation ſacrament preſent téeth eate dare ſay ſinneth therein referre matter vnto god iudgement yet without doubt dare ſay deceaued example man deceaued literall ſenſe would think frith haſty iudge men ſhould preach fiſhes saint fraunces becauſe chriſt bad diſciples goe preach creature yet would thinke yt ſinned therein referre hym vnto god iudgment yet wene euery woman hath wit ſay deceiued ſure olde holy doctours beleued chriſtes body bloud ſo taught beleue bookes playnly doth apere thought eyther could ther dede would good world haue written haue done would thoſe holy men wene haue taught men bound beleue body bloud chriſt thē ſelues thought bound woulde make men honoure worſhip thing body bloud chriſt ſelues thought geare childiſh ſpeake old doctours faythfull frith father ſo taught thought ye fayne falſe auſten haue ſhewed maketh wholly v beſides none old father call sacrament miſterie miſticall meate whiche eaten tooth bely eares fayth touchyng honour worſhyp done vnto ſay playne idolatry ſay falſely reporteth honor worſhip ſacrament plaine idolatry old holy doctours neuer taught men worſhip neither cā alledge one place would haue men worſhyp sacrament peraduenture may alledge certaine new fellowes purpoſe dunce dorbell durand ſuch draffe doctrine haue drenched world damnable idolatrie ſpeake old holy father doctor auſtē ambroſe hierom cyprian cirille chriſoſtome fulgentius ſuch theſe ſay teach mē worſhyp dare abide point ſo ſure vſe contrary argument naturall body preſent holy father named taken text letter onely ſpiritually woorkes olde holy father haue taught worſhip ſacrament would haue taught men worſhyp neuer taught men worſhyp sacrament therfore foloweth tooke text letter onely ſpiritually prouoke ſéeke proofe purpoſe neuertheleſſe deny y• theſe holy doctor diuers place call body chriſt paule ſo likewiſe ſay alſo body eaten yet meane eaten fayth ſay beleuing yt body brokē v haue body memory note ☜ maundy meate eate therfore hath name body becauſe name ſelfe ſhould put v remembraunce body body chiefly eaten euen fayth meate mouth ſo alſo vnderſtand yet one great pleaſure doth v putteth v libertie may without perill damnatiō beleue witte bleſſed sacrament whole ſubſtance bread wine tranſmuted chaunged body bloud chriſt may without perill damnation beleue thus ſelfe graunteth may graunteth hee may alſo without perill damnation beleue ſelfe lieth hee ſayth truth beleefe impoſſible beleuing thys poynt ſelf damnable damnable frith thinke chriſt ſtone vine becauſe litterall ſenſe ſo ſayth beleue ought preach fiſhes goe chriſten ye belle inſure worſe miſchiefe enſued thys beléefe ſelfe would neuer haue ſpoken agaynſt followeth vppon damnable idolatry beléefe thys body mē fall downe worſhip thinking pleaſe god damnably ſinne agaynſt hym thys ſay cauſe ſo earneſtly write agaynſt martin luther ſayth yt natural body chriſt preſent ye ſacramēt wold haue worſhipped auoyde idolatry committed part germanes thinke naturall body preſent sacrament take woordes fleſhly martine taught none worſhyp y• martine forbyddeth hys wordes workes ſo bleſſed god auoyde ieoperdy thyng alſo graunt publiſh one propoſition ought bee worſhypped promiſe neuer write agaynſt ieoperdy taken away cōtent maſterſhyp thinke lye meane ſeaſō muſt thinke ye fill world damnable idolatry thus haue alſo aūſwere vnto ye concluſion alledge kynges grace booke ſay way hurt lōg onely beleue bare wordes text fraunces dyd whē preached fiſhes occaſion thoſe wordes ye fall worſhypping ſay way vndoubted damnation ſo great ieoperdy way none though déede yet doe ſinne worſhyp commaunded worſhyp sacrament commit damnable idolatry ¶ conſecration sacrament nowe quietnes euery mās conſcience young man biddeth euery mā bold whether bleſſed sacrament conſecrate vnconſecrate though moſt eſpecially ſpeaketh wyne yet ſpeaketh byddeth v care take vnbleſſed becauſe prieſt hee ſayth deceiue v take v profit chriſtes inſtitution whether hee alter woordes leaue vnſayd wonderful doctrine young man wotte well prieſt hurt v ouerſight malice fault vpon owne partie perfection lacketh prieſtes part great mercy god truſt owne goodnes ſupplyeth therfore holy chriſoſtome ſayth man take harme ſelfe ſee thyng diſordered owne ſelfe prieſt chriſtes inſtitution broken wittyngly receiue vnbleſſed vnconſecrated care whether chriſtes inſtitutiō kept obſerued rekon good without make ſelues partaker fault leeſe profit sacramēt receiue damnation prieſtes fault owne thought turke wold frith haue wreſted man woordes ſo vnfaythfully hee leaueth pith matter wordes theſe ſhew meanes ye ſhall euer receiue accordyng chriſtes inſtitution although prieſt would withdraw firſt ye néede haue reſpect vnto prieſts wordes miniſtreth meane may receaue ye ſacrament according chriſtes inſtitution though miniſter negligent ye remember intēt chriſt dyd inſtitute sacrament know put v remembraunce hys body breakyng bloud ſhedding might geue hym thankes bee ſure fayth accordyng promiſes ſure bread eatyng ſay ye remember thyng intent onely prieſt ſpeaketh thoſe wordes prieſt leaue thoſe wordes part therof hurt haue ready effect final purpoſe ye ſhould ſpeake agayne ſhould wholy alter yet cā deceiue ye ſure lyer though ſée prieſt bryng wyne conſecrated yet neuer ſticke ſurely ſhall certifie conſcience outward worthy receauer ſacrament may conſecrate ſame ſelfe ſenſes though conſecrate ſo thou conſecrate thy ſelfe ſay ſo thou know ment therby geue hym thankes though hee made thouſand bleſſynges ouer ſo ſay euer cōſecrated hys hart beleueth though prieſt conſecrate contrarywiſe conſecrate neuer ſo much thy conſecration bye helpeth thée riſhe except thou know meant therby beleue geuyng thankes hys body breakyng bloudſhedyng profite thée ſay ſee thyng diſordered prieſt chriſtes inſtitution broken wyttingly receiue make ſelues partaker cryme aunſwer reformation thereof laye handes ſayd frith truth ſith written priuate perſons may reforme matter reformation therof reſteth onely ye hand prince parlament ye erroure conſiſteth miſordering matter one prieſt rather doctrine ſauing ſuch god hath lightened theſe priuate perſons ſay y• doctrine ſhould ſoner occaſion inſurrection labour eſhew quieting chriſtes doctrine therefore ſith waye wood ſauing vpright auoyde perylous path ye ſée chriſtes inſtitution broken one kinde left vnto laye people ye pertaker thereof beit beleife taketh better bare bread wine maketh litell matter conſecrated ſauing better conſecrated euer noyous receiueth hauing conſcience combred ſuch execrable hereſie well appeareth putteth difference betwene body lord bleſſed ſacrament comon bread eateth dinner rather eſtemeth leſſe one yet thinke begyn lack prieſt bleſſe ſelfe hee careth ſayth whether bleſſed reacon thē bread frith wine ſhew declaring minde paule vppon ſacrament concluſion boke meane ſeaſon ſay belyeth bleſſinges conſecracion profit right conſecratiō hym receaueth sacrament fayth chriſtes death except conſecrate ſelfe fayth chriſtes bloud geuing prayſe thankes ineſtimable goodnes enemy recōciled vnto father death conſecration muſt ſet haue profit death ye ſacrament repreſenteth vnto ſelfe thus conſecrate ſhal ſure ye fruite death ſay agayne ye prieſtes doe vſe conſecrate helpeth poore comens riſhe conſecracion ſhould ſtand preaching vnto death chriſt hath deliuered thē egipt ſinne ye fiery fornace pharao deuill wagging finger popiſh conſecration latine worth riſh ouer ſaying vj vij wordes latten helpeth nothing beleue ye meanes wordes know ſayth touching common bread eate dynner whether haue prieſt bleſſe hart finger hartly geue god thankes haue hundreth prieſtes bleſſe yet excuſed therby except bleſſe ſelfe profiteth vnbleſſed bleſſe • elfe care byſhops proctour tell bleſſyng meaneth prieſt prate long vnderſtand profiteth nothing good fayth wene biſhops proctour wote bleſſing meaneth therefore deare bretheren hearken bleſſe god geue prayſe thankes benefites bleſſe king prince ☜ thanke kindnes pray god may long raigne laude god wealth comens bleſſe man neighbour pray good bleſſe breade bleſſyng meate geue god thankes bleſſe ſelfe geue god thankes benefites haue receiued pray god infinite goodnes increaſe thoſe giftes hath geuen finiſhe worke hath begone vnto laud prayſe touching fleſhe fulfill ſpare ſcurge cut burne onely may honour glory forme bleſſing wag two finger ouer alacke bleſſing byſhops ignorant thoſe good faythfull folke haue grace ſparcle reaſon heades verely thinke neuer ſo farre ouerſeene article truth wherof god hath ſelfe teſtified many open miracle euer teſtified one beleue thys younge mā vpō barren reaſons againſt fayth reaſon old holy writer good chriſten people xv c yeares miracle maruell neither may make frith ſooner beleue chriſt told v ſuch deluſions ſhoulde come y• poſſible y• elect math 24 ſhould deceaued paule exhorteth v beware ſuch ſignes wonder therefore 〈◊〉 theſſ 2 moſes teacheth heare ſuch wonder ſtraight deutro 13 looke doctrine annexed teach referre honor god creature teach noghyng ſtand god worde ſay god teach ſuch thynges ſtand hys word determine done deuill delude people damnable idolatrye paule barnabas preached liſtra done miracle among people actes 24 ranne would haue done ſacrifice vnto apoſtles ranne among tare clothes cry vnto ſyrs euen corruptible men ye preach vnto ſhould leaue thys vayne ſuperſtition worſhip liuing god made heauen earth ſea c apoſtles refuſed ſuch honour worſhip therefore ſure would ſuffer image haue ſee miracle done may iudge true miracle falſe image perceaue bringeth men worſhipping ſelf contrary facte doctrine apoſtles would receaue ſelues muſt néedes conclude deluſion done deuill deceaue v bryng wrath god vppon v euen ſo ſay ſacrament ſith miracle done make mē thinke otherwiſe scripture cauſe men worſhip doubt done deuill delude people thou wilt peraduenture ſay god ſuffer hym abuſe ſacrament hys body bloud yes verely god ſuffer doth ſuffer ſee whether faythfull abide hys worde maruell therof god ſuffered hym take vp naturall body hys ſonne chriſt ſet math 4 pinnacle temple tooke hym vp agayne lead hym exceding mountaine therfore thinke hath power ouer sacrament ouer chriſtes owne body therfore whē tell loe falſe ante chriſtes chriſt loe chriſt chriſt prophecied loe thys altar loe beleue neuertheleſſe ſhould graunt ye miracle done aſcribed vnto ſacramēt true miracle done god ſelfe doubt ſome true yet thereupon doth followe ſacrament ſhould naturall body chriſt haue euident ſtoryes certayne perſons haue bene deliuered bodely diſeaſes sacrament baptiſme yet y• water holy ghoſt thyng ſelfe whereof ſacrament ſhadow peter hath actes 4 healed many yet ſhadow peter owne perſon read alſo napkin handkerchers caryed paule vnto ſicke poſſeſſed actes 12 vncleane ſpirites receaued theyr health yet neuertheleſſe madneſſe thinke ye paules body bene actually naturally thoſe thynges therefore thys weake reaſon iudge miracle ye preſence chriſtes body ſurely might aſhamed make ſo ſlender reaſons god may worke miracle many thinges hys naturall body touchyng olde doctor fayne make truth opinion ſay hath bene beleued good chriſten people xv c yeares ſufficiētly declared proued poynt olde poetrie ¶ barnes graciouſly eſcape more hand alſo frier barnes albeit ye wote well many thinges brother yong man ſecte yet ſore abhorreth hereſie el lyeth ſelfe laſt wrote letter wherin writeth laye hereſie wrōgfully hys charge ſhew eth ſelfe ſo ſore greued therewith ſayth reproch make booke againſt wherin profeſſe proteſt fayth concerning bleſſed ſacrament meane ſeaſon well contenteth frier barnes man age ripe diſcretion doctor diuinitie thoſe thinges better learned young man abhorreth yongmans hereſie poynt well liketh many maſterſhyppe frith prayſeth doctour barnes worſe men may like matter many poyntes doth condemne damnable doctrine hys booke appeareth therfore ſuch credence muſt geuen hym much leſſe geuen peraduēture wil ſay y• bée beleued point although erre vnto aunſwere conſent vnto would well apayd promiſe wright ☜ sacrament may worſhypped matter agrée ought worſhiped yea bleſſed god call heretickes ſo v auoyde idolatry ſo great daunger daylye commit therfore alowe learning content diſſent let worſhiped thinke perillpaſt ſith agrée poynt doubt ſhall ſone agrée reſidue admitte ech faythfull brother maſterſhip ſayeth wrot letter proteſting lay y• hereſie wrongfully charge thinke wiſdom twiſe haue written haue come tell plainely told hym ye papiſtes ſay promiſe couenaunt kept hereticke conſpired death withſtanding ſafe conduyte minded haue murthered cauſe compelled kéepe ſelfe ſecreatly alſo priuely departe realme bleſſed god haue ſufficienly publiſhed purpoſe fully addict mind prelate kill burne faſt aunſwere againſt w tyndall ſay might lawfully haue burnte hym mē may ſée perciable addict prelate prone ye fulfill pleaſures contrary prince prerogatiue royall thankes bee god whiche gaue ſuch grace ſight ſoueraigne ſhortly withdrewe power el feared would haue proceded agaynſt grace prerogatiue thyng whether treaſon let men define dare ſay printed publiſhed prince great diſhonour learned man may tyme come truſt hys grace ſafeconduite come grace inſtaūce requeſt ſith onely ſpiritually whiche profeſſion reſiſte hys prerogatiue alſo laye man promoted ſuch preheminence popiſh malicious tyraunt hys grace goodnes dare preſume ſo depreſſe hys prerogatiue onely ſay alſo publiſhe print notwithſtanding grace ſafe conduite might lawfully haue burnt hym would ſay vnto doth booke hee forfayted ſafeconduite therby fallen enemyes handes whereunto aunſwere ſaying vayne gloſe ſelfe dyd read ſafeconduite came vnto hym onely one condition annexed vnto condition conteined barnes ſafe cō duite came feaſt chriſtmaſſe next inſueing ſhould haue frée libertie departe pleaſure condition know fulfilled ſhould hée forfayte ſafeconduite m▪ hath learned maſters prelate whoſe proctour depreſſe prince prerogatiue men ought kéepe promiſe heretickes ſo ſafe conduite could ſaue hym though kynges grace might promiſe licence made heretickes kyng without conſent prelate kept obſerued admitte man go come fréely grace realme muſt haue leaue prelate el might lay hereſie agaynſt perſon ſo ſlay hym cōtrary kyngs ſafeconduite thyng wiſe men know preiudiciall grace prerogatiue royall yet ſure y• tyme hys beyng cā accuſe hym one cryme albeit vnto ſhame ſay hee forfaited ſafe conduite theſe wordes ben extreme worthy haue bene looked vpon although bene written ſome preſumptuous prelate lay man ſo hyghly promoted prince ſhould ſpeake alſo cauſe openlye publiſhed among grace common reiect eſtimation hys royall power doth mynde deſerue correction notwithſtandyng leaue iudgement determination vnto diſcretion grace honorable counſell holy prayer deuote young man newe chriſt teacheth make receiuyng bleſſed sacrament congregation would geue paryng peare hys prayer though better pullyng away true fayth therefro doth beit hys prayer ſo deuiſed penned paynted layſure ſtudy truſt euery good chriſten woman maketh much better prayer tyme houſell fayth • ull affection god good inſpiration ſodenly frith vnmete maſter teach v ſhould pray receiuyng bleſſed sacrament wil knowledge take chriſtes bleſſed body nothyng bare bread ſo litle eſteme receiuyng bleſſed sacrament forceth litle whether bleſſed diſcōmendeth prayer ſayth vnméete maſter frith teach men pray ſeing take away true faith ſayth euery woman make better ſhe receiueth sacrament would god euery woman ſo well learned could teach v ſurely intended preſcribe men prayer modeſty meeke ſpirite iohn frith onely hoped helpe ignoraunt might either ſpeake thoſe wordes el takyng occaſion ſay ſome ye laude prayſe god fayth call true fayth muſt néedes improue ſtand true text scripture playnly appeareth chriſtes body eaten fayth teeth fayth chriſtes bloud exhorte men teach eate hys body fayth téeth hauyng hys death continual remembraunce digeſtyng bowel theyr ſoule becauſe ſo ſore improue prayer conclude aunſwere agaynſt write agayne let men iudge v bleſſed thou moſt deare mercyfull prayer made iohn▪ frith ſayd receauyng communion father whiche thy tender fauour benignity notwithſtāding greuous enormity committed agaynſt thée vouchſauedſt ſende thyne owne onely deare ſonne ſuffer moſt vyle death redemption bleſſed thou chriſt ieſu lord sauiour whiche thyne aboundaunt pitie conſideryng miſerable eſtate willingly tookeſt vppon thée haue thy moſt innocent body broken bloud ſhed purge v waſh v laden iniquitie certifie v thereof haſt left v onely thy word may inſtructe harte alſo viſible token certifie euen outward ſēſes great benefite ſhould doubt body fruite thy paſſion faith ſurely bread whiche ſenſes know haue v bleſſed alſo godly good prayer ſpirite veritie whiche ſent frō god father sauiour chriſt ieſu lightē darke ignoraunce leade v fayth knowledge hym whiche veritie strength beſeech thée frayle nature increaſe fayth may prayſe god moſt mercyfull father chriſt hys ſonne sauiour redemer amen paſcall lambe ſacrament compared togither ſhall ſhortly expreſſe paſchall lambe ſacrament cō pared togither pith matter borow figure paſcall lambe pointes ſo lyke offeryng paſcall lambe ſigniſie offering chriſtes body playne paul ſayth chriſt paſchall lambe offered vp v 1 cor 5 child iſraell ſad heuye ſore oppreſſion vnder power pharao myracles ſhewed ye worſe handeled god ſent vnto moyſes yt euery houſhold ſhould kill lambe ſacrifice vnto god ſhould eate ſtaues handes loynes girded ſhowes féete euē mē yt going haſty iorney lambe muſt eate haſtely maner eatyng paſchal lambe make mery maundye becauſe ſhould ſay could bee mery oppreſſion could lambe helpe added glad tydynges vnio ſayd paſſing lord night ſhall paſſe ſlay ye firſt begotten land egipt ſhall deliuer bondage bring ye land hée hath promiſed vnto yourfathers marke proceſſe conueyaunce matter euen likewiſe ſacrament apoſtels ſad heauie maner inſtitution sacrament iohn 16 partlye cōſidering ye bondage ſinne wherwith opreſſed partly becauſe hee told muſt departe frō whō put hope deliueraunce heauynes chriſt thought cōfort thē geue ſeale deliueraunce toke hande bread bleſſed inſtitution sacrament brake gaue diſciples ſaying body ſhalbe geuen night ſhall y• power pharao ye diuell diſtroyed morow ſhall deliuered egypt ye place ſinne ſhall take iourney towardes heauenly manſion prepared god loue cō pare togeather 1 paſchall lābe inſtituted eaten night child compariſon paſchall lambe chriſtes supper iſraell indeede deliuered egipt likewiſe ſacrament inſtituted eatē yt night deliuered ſinnes 2 paſcall lambe lambe deede ſo ſacrament bread déede 3 paſcall lambe cauled paſſing ye lord deſtroyed power pharao deliuered thē ſacrament called body ye lord whiche deſtroyed ye power deuill deliuered v 4 ¶ many eate paſcall lambe fayth mery gaue god greate thankes ſure next day deliuered egipt many eate ſacrament fayth mery gaue god great thākes ſure next day deliuered frō ſinne 5 eate paſcall lambe fayth could merye ſo ſure deliueraunce power pharao y• eate sacrament fayth could mery ſure deliueraunce power deuill 6 beleued worde lord eate paſſing lord ſhould deliuer thē lambe beleeue word lord eate ye body lord ſhould geuen deliuerance bread y• thing doth man moſte eate yt moſt hath memory moſt reuolueth mynd appeareth chriſt iohn 4 haue meate eate yt ye know 7 beléeued ye next day deliuered egipt eate ye paſſing ye lord although eate lambe y• beleued next day deliuered ſinne dyd eate body lorde although eate breade 8 child iſraell deliuered egypt notwithſtanding euery yeare eate ye lambe kéepe facte perpetuall remembraunce euen ſo chriſt bought redemed v offered ſacrificed though ye ſacrament therof daylye broken amonge v kéepe benefite continuall memorye 9 many dyd eate ye paſchall lambe fayth beleued god word touching deliueraunce egypt ſure deliueraunce fayth ſure lambe eating many doe eate ſacrament fayth beleeue god word touching deliueraūce frō ſinne ſure deliueraunce fayth ſure bread eating 10 many eate paſchall lambe magnifie theyr god teſtifying onely god almighty people ſticking hym deliuered power daunger many eate thys ſacrament doe magnifie god teſtifying god almighty people ſticking deliuered hys power danger 11 iſraelites deliuered frō egypt eate neuertheleſſe paſchall lambe ſtill called paſſing becauſe ye remēbraunce paſſing ye lord hartely reioyced offering hym ſacrifice acknowledgyng wt infinite thākes fellowſhip thē ſuch mercifull god chriſtes electe deliuered frō ſinne eate neuertheleſſe ſacramēt ſtill called hys body dyed deliueraunce hartely reioyce offering hym ſacrifice prayſe knowledging infinite thākes fellowſhip thē haue ſuch mercifull god 12 paſchall lābe deliueraunce yearely eaten brought much myrth ioye vnto eate fayth father felt pharao hys fury yet deliuered knew right well except god mercy wonderful power ſo deliuered ſhoulde alſo ſelues haue bond land egypt vnder wicked prince pharao bondage greatly reioyced bee rid already thanked god highly becauſe found thē ſelues plenteous land god prouided ſacrament deliueraunce yearely dayly eaten bringeth much myrth ioye vnto v eate fayth apoſtles yet deliuered know right well except god hys mercye ye bloud hys ſonne ſo deliuered v ſhoulde alſo ſelues haue bonde egypt place ſinne vnder yt wicked prince deuill bōdage greatly reioyce rid already thanke god highly becauſe finde ſelues ye ſtate grace haue receaued faith firſt fruites taſte ſpirite teſtifyeth vnto v y• childrē god ¶ thys maundy remēbraunce paule receaued maū dy remē braūce paule receaued lord deliuered corinthian lorde deliuered corinthian xi chapter though borrowe one propertie ſimilitude ſacrament x chapter minde maketh neither v againſt v albeit ſome thinke maketh whole expoſition chriſtes wordes body minde 1 cor 10 deceaued ye occaſion paule ſpake x chapter thys corinthian knowledge meates indifferent whether offered idole meate worſe might lawfully eate whether ſolde thē shamble ſet dyned ſupped vnfaithfull man houſe aſking queſtions except ſome man tell god hath ordeyned meates indifferent offered idoll ſhould eate offendyng conſcience ſo tolde albeit el frée thing indifferent thys knowledge becauſe annexed charitie occaſion great offending reaſon thereof ſatte downe among gentile feaſtes eate honor idol ſo onely wound conſcience weake brethrē alſo committed idolatry déede therfore paule ſaid vnto thē paule deare beloued flée worſhipping idol ſpeake vnto ☜ haue diſcretiō iudge ye ſay ye cup bleſſing bleſſe fellowſhip bloud chriſt bread breake fellowſhip bodye chriſt though many yet one bread one body much partaker one bread chriſt call ſelfe bread chriſt called hym ſelf bread paule calleth v bread bread bodye paule calleth v bread bread body may take paule thys place ſhould directly expound chriſtes minde expoſition chriſtes wordes ſayd body ſhould fellowſhip hys body ſome ſay ſeeking key place paule locke ſelues ſo faſte finde way chriſt ſpake thoſe wordes owne body ſhould geuen v wordes paule bee vnderſtād fellowſhip chriſtes body congregation geuē v ſo ment paule ſayth ment owne bodye paule calleth bread body certaine propertie euen ſo doth chriſt call body certaine property ye bread broken chriſtes owne body ſignifying bread broken ſo ſhould hys body broken v diſtributed vnto hys diſciples hys owne bodye ſignifying verely y• bread diſtributed vnto ſo verely ſhould death body fruit paſſion bee diſtributed faythfull folke bread ſtrengtheneth bodyes hys body ſignifying bodyes ſtrengthened comforted bread ſo ſoules yt fayth hys body breaking likewyſe wine ſo diſtributed ſo comforteth v maketh v mery furthermore bread wine haue propertie bread called body called body bread made one bread many graines cornes body ſignifying though bee many made one bread ſay one body wine made one wine many grape bodye ſignifying though many yet chriſt chriſt made one body member ech thys thyng paule chriſt agrée paul calleth bread body v bread becauſe thys propertie made one many euen ſo doth chriſt call hys body becauſe proporties rehearſed furthermore thys agrée paules wordes muſt taken ſpiritually thinke man ſo mad iudge breade body deede although muſt vnderſtand sacrament ſpiritually el receaue comfort propertie repreſenteth body euen ſo muſt chriſtes wordes vnderſtand ſpiritually thoſe property repreſenteth body come together receaue thys bread receauing congregation doe openly teſtifie receaue one body profeſſing one god one fayth one baptiſme body chriſt broken bloud ſhed remiſſion ſinnes ſith ſo may company fit congregation fellowſhip offer vnto idol eate thē paule ſayth ye cā drinke paule cup lorde cup deuils ye partaker table lord table deuills would ſhould haue fellowſhip deuills heathen offered vnto idolls fellowſhip deuils becauſe eate deuills body dranke deuils bloud becauſe beleued put confidence idoll deuill god fayth ceremony gaue hartye thākes god feaſt kept came one place brought meate idoll offered offering gaue vnto deuill godly honour ſat eate offering together geuing prayſe thankes vnto god one body one fellowſhip yt deuill teſtify eating offering idole doth paule reprehend corinthian bearyng gentile companye eating idole know meate like meate therefore thought ſelues frée eate leaue perceiued gentile offered theyr meate idolies congregregation fellowſhip deuiles gathered meat ſake thanke prayſe idole god whō confidēce aſſembled dyd eate openly teſtifie yt al one body profeſſing one fayth god idole paule rebuked becauſe yt eating place fellowſhip teſtefied openly deuils body reioyſed idole god whō fayth confidence therfore fayth paule cā drinke cup lord teſtifying hym god onely haue truſt affiaunce cup deuill teſtifiyng yt idole bée god refuge may note meate drynke cup lord drinke cup deuill vnderſtand eatyng place fellowſhyp thenyt cōmon meate eatyng place elles myght lawfully haue dronkē deuils cup one day cup lord next day hys diſciples verely meate eatyng place felowſhip dyd teſtifie openly vnto men god whoſe cuppe dranke eate felowſhyp ſo eating prayſed honored idole therfore truſt lyuing god bloud ſonne chriſt might eate lykewiſe ſacrament bread eatyng place felowſhyp receiued common bread ʋerely bread yt eatyng place felowſhyp doth teſtifie openly vnto men god whoſe cup drinke eate felowſhip put afſiaūce hym bloud hys ſonne chriſt ieſu geuyng god honour infinite thankes great loue wherwith loued v teſtified bloud hys ſonne whiche ſhed ſinnes place felowſhyp may mā eate drinke v fayth knowledgeth ſame god doe example mā well beloued among hys neyghbours albeit haue ſome enemyes long abſent hys frendes ſtraunge countrey come home neighbour proper example loued hym would greatly reioyſe peraduenture would bye capon péece meate geue hym wellcom home get ſome honeſt man houſe tauerne make good cheare together teſtifie openly welcome home yt banket reioyſe cōming home ſay banket meale banket hys enemy may loth come becauſe reioyſe comming home therfore make good chere among thē teſtifiing welcome home rather abhorreth meate drinke yt eaten becauſe hart doth fauour perſon whoſe ſake prepared notwithſtanding capon legge reſerued one enemy afterward geuen banket done might lawfully eate bare meate ſuch eateth home likewiſe ye enemy chriſt beléeue haue remiſſion ſinnes bloudſheding reioyce enemyes chriſt reioyce chriſtes bloud ſhedding body breaking therfore make good chere among thē reſerued maundy may lawfully eate bread louers preſēt rather come thether geue welcome home meate eate welcome home meate anye enemy fortune eate onely meat welcome home reioyce comming home likewiſe faythfull preſent rather come thether reioyce ye faith body breaking thē breaking eating bread meate vnfaythfull fortune eate onely bread body breaking reioyce bodie breaking peraduenture ſome ſuppoſe cōtrary ſelf ſayd yt meate yt eaten ye gentile feaſt meate yt eaten neighbor welcome home thē bread eaten receiuyng ſacrament body bloud chriſt ſay mās enemye eateth onely faythfull vnfaythfull eate alike meate ye welcome home lykewiſe vnfaythfull eateth onely breade body bloud chriſt may theſe wordes ſtand together aunſwere eate ouely bread meate yt profiteth indeede eate hinderaunce euen owne damnation eate yt fellowſhip yt gentile onlye eate meate profite eating theyr meate facte dyd openly teſtyfye honoured yt idole god although hart otherwiſe wherein 1 cor 8 committed idolatry beſides wounded cōſciences weake brother ſo ſinned againſt god beſides enuyeth hys neighbour commeth banket eateth onely ye meate profiteth hym notwithſtandyng hys owne hart eateth rancor malice mynde great greuaūce ſéeth ſo reioyſe hys owne companion alſo theſe man enemyes doth purchaſe hym ſelfe hatred becauſe fact hee teſtifieth hee loueth although hart otherwiſe god ſhalbe condemned hee hateth brother murtherer furthermore 1 iohn 3 vnfaithfull commeth maū dy vnfaythfull wicked eate owne damnation eateth onely yt bread profiteth hym notwithſtādyng eateth beſide owne damnation becauſe beleueth body sauiour whiche sacrament repreſenteth brokē hys ſinnes bloud ſhed waſhe away compelled doe ſtop chateryng mouthes sophiſters albeit ſober bad inough haue ſayd eate onely bread body broken c right well vnderſtand contrary antitheſie know meant onely ſhould eate bread nothyng el onely bread meant worde onely hee ſhould eate bread without body ſo lykewiſe exāples thus haue ſufficiently declared paules mynde 10 chapter xj chapter paule maketh much mencion maundye dyſcribeth 1 cor 11 yt vttermoſt frſt ſaith ye come together one place man eate lord ſupper euery man beginnyth afore eate owne ſupper one hungry dronken haue ye houſes eate drinke el deſpiſe ye congregation god ſhame haue ſhall ſaye vnto ſhall prayſe prayſe paule inſtruct according chriſtes mynde yt corinthian ſhould come togither eate lordes ſupper whiche lyeth ſo much carnall eatyng ſpiritual true eating sacrament ſpirituall eating ſame greatly deſired eaten hunger body hū ger faithfull hart gredy publiſhe prayſe lord geue hym harty thankes moue ſame many praiſe might geuen vnto moſt mercyful father loue ſhewed v bloud owne moſt deare ſonne chriſt ieſu wherewith waſhed ſinnes ſurely ſealed vnto euerlaſtyng lyfe ſuch hūger dyd chriſt eate paſchall lambe ſaying hys diſciples haue wardly deſired eate luke 22 eaſter lāde ſuffer chriſtes inward deſire fill hys belly diſciples hee ſpirituall hūger prayſe father theyr bodely deliueraūce land egypt ſpecially alter paſichall lambe memory carnall deliueraunce maundy myrth thākeſgeuyng ſpirituall deliueraunce bondage ſinne ſo much chriſt knewe father pleaſure ſhould ſuffer ſinnes wherin honor glory prayſe ſhould publiſhed pleaſure vnto hym declare vnto diſciples great benefite vnto father prayſe glory ſo inſtitute ſhould come together breake bread remēbraunce body breakyng bloud ſhedyng ſhuld eate together reioyſing ech declaryng hys benefites corinthian fallen hunger came together maner comming corinthian together intent god prayſe ſhould bee publiſhed middeſt congregatiō came féede fleſh make carnal cheare ſo much yt rich would haue meate drinke inough take ſuch aboundaunce yt would dronke ſo made owne per lordes paule ſaith eate onely bread meate body breaking haue ſaid poore ſay meate eate aſhamed hungry ſo could reioyſe prayſe lord reaſon delicate fare riche occaſion poore lament pouertie thus rich dyd neither prayſe god ſelues ſuffered poore doe occaſion hynder ſhould haue brought theyr meate drinke haue deuided poore brother might haue mery together ſo haue geuen occaſion mery reioyſe lorde thankes geuyng neither luſt prayſe god comfort neighbour fayth féeble charitie cold regard fill body féede fleſh ſo deſpiſed yt poore cō gregation god ſhould haue honoured yt ſpirite fauour god ſhewed indifferently vnto y• bloud hys ſonne chriſt paule perceiued thus fleſhly mynded mynde vnto ſpirituall maundy chiefly ſhuld ther bee aduertiſed hée reproueth thē ſore rehearſing yt wordes chriſt gaue vnto receiued lord lord ieſus ſame night hee betrayed tooke bread thanked brake ſaid take ye eate ye bodye broken ye remembraunce ſame maner hee tooke cup ſupper done ſaying cuppe new teſtament bloud doe ye ofte ye drinke remembraunce oft ye ſhall eate bread drinke cup ye ſhall ſhew lordes death til come though hée ſhould ſay ye corinthian much blame whiche supper ſéeke foode fleſh inſtitute chriſt chriſt inſtitute sacrament intent noriſhe belly ſtrēghten hart ſoule god may know chriſt ſo meant calleth hys body geuen ſo name ſelfe might teſtifie vnto ſupper ſhould eate body whiche geuen digeſtyng bowel ſoule bread breakyng diſtributyng doth repreſent body breakyng diſtributyng therof vnto faythful bée ſo meaneth euident wordes folowyng ſay remembrance mee likewyſe cuppe finally concludyng paule ſayth often ye ſhall eate bread drinke cuppe ſacrament ordained feede ſoules bodyes place felowſhyp ye ſhall ſhew yt lordes death vntill hée come prayſing lord death ſonne exhortyng doe ſame reioyſing hym infinite thākes therfore ye blame whiche ſéeke onely féede belly thyng onely inſtitute féede ſoule theruppon foloweth wherfore ſoeuer doth eate bread drinke cup vnworthely gilty body bloud lorde eateth bread vnworthely regardeth worthy vnworthy eating chriſtes body purpoſe chriſt dydinſtitute cōmeth ſpirituall hūger eate fayth body bread repreſenteth breaking diſſtributing commeth mery hart geuing god harty thankes deliueraunce ſinne doe much eate hart yt death body doe bread mouth ſith corinthyans onlye ſéeke belly fleſh forgat god honour prayſe inſtituted y• thākes ſhould geuen remembrance body breaking v eate god diſhonour neighboures hinderaunce owne condemnation ſo lacke fayth giltye chriſtes body fayth ſhould chiefely haue eaten ſoules health therefore followeth ❀ let man therfore examyne ſelfe ſo let eate bread drinke cuppe proue examine man owne ſelfethis prouing examinyng man ſelfe firſt thinke ſelfe luſt deſire cōmeth vnto maundy eate bread whether ſure child god faith chriſt whether cōſcience beare witneſſe chriſtes body broken whether luſt yt hath prayſe god thanke hym faythfull hart middes bretheren driue hym thether warde el whether yt meates ſake kéepe cuſtome better away eateth drinketh vnworthely eateth drinketh owne damnation becaufe maketh differēce lordes body ſayd regardeth purpoſe inſtituted putteth difference betwene eating eating eating doth onely ſerue bellye eating inſtituted ordayned ſerue ſoule inward man therfore abuſeth fleſh eateth drinketh owne damnation commeth vnworthelye maundye ſacrament chriſtes body eaten ye body lord eaten carnally téeth bellye ſpiritually hart faith ʋpon followeth text allegeth wreſteth purpoſe cauſe many weake ſicke among many ſléepe yf truely iudged ſelues ſhould haue béene indged iudged lorde chaſtened becauſe ſhould bée damned wich world wherfore bretheren whē ye come togither eate tary one yf man hunger let eate home ye come togither vnto condemnation cauſe lacke good examinyng ſelues meaning paules formet wordes touched many weake ſicke fayth many ſléepe haue loſt fayth chriſtes bloud lacke remembraunce body breaking bloud ſhedding yea onely many weake ſicke euen ſtriken bodelye diſeaſes abuſing ye ſacrament body eating bread téeth body hart minde peraduenture ſome ſlayne ſtroke god truely iudged examined thē ſelues intent came thither inſtituted ſhould haue béene ſo iudged chaſtened lorde lorde doth chaſten bring v vnto repentaunce mortifie rebellious mēbers may remember hym ye may ſhortly perceyue mynde paule epitome ſhort rehearſall booke ſhewing poyntes frith diſſenteth prelate ſhort theſe thrée poyntes frith diſſenteth epitome whole booke frō prelate taketh vpon hym proctor 1 prelate beléeue sacrament remaineth bread opiniō prelate turned naturall body chriſt fleſhe bloud bone frith ſayth article crede therefore let opiniō frith beléeue thinketh remayneth bread ſtill proueth thrée maner wayes firſt ye ſcripture paule whiche calleth bread ſaying 1 cor 1 •… bread breake fellowſhip body chriſt though bee many yet one body one bread many partaker one bread againe ſayth often ye eate thys bread drinke thys cup ſhall 1 cor 11 ſhew lordes death vntil come alſo luke calleth bread ſaying actes continued fellowſhip apoſtles actes 2 breaking bread prayer alſo chriſt called cup fruite math 26 marke 14 luke 22 vyne ſaying ſhall hence forward drinke fruite vyne vntill drinke new kingdome father furthermore nature doth teache nature teacheth bread wyne sacrament bread wine cō tinue nature bread mouldeth kept long yea wormes bréede poore mouſe runne away eate euidence inough remayneth bread alſo wine reſerued would waxe ſower confeſſe ſelues therefore houſell lay people one kinde onely becauſe wine continue reſerued haue ready hand néede ſurely remayned bread could mould waxe full wormes euen ſo remayned wine could waxe ſower therefore falſe doctrine prelate ſo lōg haue taught publiſhed finally ye remayneth bread might proued authoritie olde doctours proue bread sacramēt many doctor call bread wine euen chriſt hys apoſtles though ſome ſophiſters would wreſt ſaying expoūd owne phantaſie yet ſhall alleage thē one doctor pope maketh ſo playne v ſhall neuer bee able auoyde pope gelaſius writeth thys maner certe ſacramenta quae ſumimus gelaſius concilio ro corporis ſanguinis christi diuinae re ſunt propter quod per eadem diuinae efficimur conſortes naturae et tamen non deſinit eſſe ſubstantia vel natura panis vini ſed permanet ſuae proproprietate naturae et certe imago ſimilitudo corporis ſanguinis christi actione mysteriorum celebrantur ſay surely sacrament body bloud chriſt receaue godly thing therefore made partaker godly nature yet doth ceaſe bee ſubſtance nature bread wine continue propertie owne nature ſurely image ſimilitude body bloud celebrated acte myſteryes thys ſure man auoyde ſo wreſt men ſhall ſoone eſpye hys folly therefore may conclude remayneth ſubſtaunce nature bread wine ſecond poynt wherin frith diſſenteth prelate proctor prelate beléeue hys fleſhe preſent téeth fayth prelate eate ſacrament wicked eate hys body frith ſayth article opiniō iohn frith créede therefore hée reckoneth hee ieoperdy though hee beleeue hee thinketh fleſhe preſent vnto téeth receaue sacrament hys fleſh onely one place yt hée proueth yt authoritie auſten ad dardanum alſo authoritie fulgentius ad thraſuuandum lib 20 appeareth yt booke frith ſayth wicked eate hys fleſhe although receaue ſacrament hée proueth scripture doctor good reaſon grounded vpon ſcriptures scripture hée eateth iohn 6▪ chriſtes body hath euerlaſting life wicked hath euerlaſting life ergo wicked eate body agayne scripture ſayth hée eateth chriſtes fleſhe drinketh hys bloud abydeth chriſt chriſt hym yt wicked abyde chriſt chriſt ergo wicked eate hys fleſhe drinke hys bloud thys may alſo bée confirmed august ſerm de ſacra fe paſſch • good authoritie auſten ſayth hée abydeth chriſt chriſt abydeth without doubt hée eateth hys fleſhe drinketh hys bloud although hée eate drinke ſacrament ſo great thing vnto hys damnation euen ſame wordes hath beda vpon x chapter firſt beda epiſtle corinthian agayne auſten ſayth hée abydeth abyde aug de ciuitate dei libro 21 cap 25 let hym ſay thinke hée eateth body drinketh bloud euē ſame wordes hath beda vpon vi chapter firſt epiſtle corinthian euen ye ſame ſentēce hath ambroſe proſper beda vpon xi chapter firſt epiſtle corinthian finally thys may bée proued good reaſon grounded vpon ſcripture chriſt would ſuffer mary though ſhée loued hym well touch hym becauſe ſhée lacked one poynt fayth dyd beléeue hée equall father therfore reaſon muſt follow hée wicked eate chriſtes body ſuffer wicked neither haue good faith loue towards hym touch hym eate vncleane bodyes ſith thys proued true wicked eate hys body muſt alſo thereof néedes followe ſacrament hys naturall bodye doe eate ſacrament mē know beſides faythfull doe eate chriſtes body téeth therefore muſt followe wicked doe eate téeth antecedent firſt part reaſon prooued wordes chriſt ſayth fleſh profiteth nothyng iohn 6 meaning doth profite vnderſtoode hym ſay profiteth nothyng bée eaten carnally téeth belly vnderſtoode hym el profiteth much bée eaten ſpiritually ſay beléeue hys body breakyng bloud ſhedding ſinnes purged thus doth origene auſten beda chryſoſtome athanaſius expound appeareth booke therfore frith ſayth onely faythfull onely faythfull eate chriſtes body drinke bloud men eate hys body téeth mouth fayth hart digeſt ye bowells ſoules beléeuing broken croſſe waſhe away ſinnes wicked eate hys body onely bread damnation becauſe eate hym ſpiritually becauſe beléeue hys bodye breaking bloud ſhedding ❀ third point wherin frith diſſenteth prelate proctoure 3 prelate beléeue men ought worſhip ſacramēt fayth prelate frith ſayth nay affirmeth idolatry worſhip hée ſayth chriſt apoſtles taught v ſo doe neither holy father ſo teach v frith ſayth author thys opiniō frith worſhipping child perdition haue ouerwhelmed world ſinne neuertheleſſe muſt receaue reuerently becauſe doctrine bringeth v preacheth chriſtes death vnto v deſcribeth eye euen faythfull preacher worde doth inſtill v eares hearing ſupplyeth roome preacher euident woordes auſten ſayth paulus quamuis portaret farcinam corporis quod aggrauat animā potuit tamen ſignificando predicare dominum ieſum chriſtum aliter per linguam ſuam aliter per epiſtolam aliter per ſacramentum corporis chriſti fay though paule bere burthen body doth honorate ſoule yet able ſignifiyng preach ye lord ieſus chriſt one way tonge way epiſtle way ſacrament chriſtes body c people vnderſtanding fignification wordes ſpake heare glorious goſpell god reading piſtle vnderſtoode minde receiued word ſoules health ſo miniſtration ſacrament might ſée eye thing heard read ſo haue ſences occupied miſtery might earneſtly print minde example prophet hieremie hieruſalem tyme sedechias king iewes propheſyed ierem 27 preached vnto yt ſhould takē priſoners nabugodoneſar king babilon iewes angry woulde beléeue wordes therfore made chayne fetter wood put neke propheſied agayne preached ſhould taken priſoners led captiue babilon wordes certifie eares yt ſhould ſubdued ſo chayne dyd repreſent captiuitie euen eye whiche thyng vehemently woorke bare wordes could doe euen ſo sacrament likewiſe woordes dyd inſtill eares body geuen miniſtration sacrament doth lyuely expreſſe death paſſion chriſt v bloud ſhed remiſſion ſinnes euen ſo myniſtration ſacrament expreſſe ye ſame thing vnto ſight doth effectuouſly moue bare wordes might doe make v attent vnto thing may wholye geue thankes vnto god prayſe bounteous benefites therfore ſeyng preacher expreſſing vnto ſight ye ſame thing ye wordes doe eares repreſēt muſt receyue reuerence ſober behauiour aduertiſing yt thing repreſenteth vnto euen ye ſame honour dew vnto geuen vnto ſcripture word god vnto yt muſt man deuoutlye geue eare reuerently take booke hys hande yea kiſſe yt booke doctrine ſake learenth thereout bée cōmended neuertheleſſe ſhould goe ſence hys booke men might well thinke childiſhe ſhould knéele downe pray booke dyd commyt playne idolatrye conſider deare bretheren ſay auoyde ieoperdye thing auoyded care touching preſence body though beléeue hys naturall fleſh déede onely miſterye haue taught yt ieoperdye paſt foole would bee contētious thing long cōmeth hurt therbye germanes beléeue preſence body worſhyp playnly teach contrary poynt thankes god call heretickes agrée fulwell onely auoyde idolatry deſire ¶ concluſion treatiſe nowe deare brother beſéech mercy yt ye looke chriſt ieſu accepte worke ſingle eye contentious hart neceſſitie hath compelled write becauſe informed lord wincheſter credible perſōs meanes firſt treatiſe offended many men thing may well true ſlender inſtruct haue ſince ſeene albe 〈◊〉 ſufficient vſe whō firſt deliuered therfore thought onely expedient alſo neceſſary inſtruct truth might ſée plaine euidence thyng wherein offended worke ſhal eſpye blaſphemyes venemous toūges flaunder onelye publiſh truth euen truth ſelfe ſhame ſay yt affirme bee onely bread nothing el ſay ſo ſay beſide ſubſtaunce bread ye ſacrament chriſtes body bloud ye iuye hanging tauerne doore bare iuye beſide ſubſtaunce sament beſide ſubſtaunce bread chriſtes body bloud iuye ſigne ſignifieth wine bee ſold ſacrament ſignifieth vnto v poynteth eye verely bread broken ſo verely chriſtes body broken ſinnes bread diſtributed vnto v ſo body fruite hys paſſion diſtributed vnto faythfull bread comforteth body ſo doth ye fayth chriſtes death comfort ſoules ſurely haue bread eate mouth téeth know ſenſes haue within v partaker therof néede doubte hys body bloude thorough fayth wee ſure ſure bread ſufficiently declared booke diſhonour sacramēt geue honour due vnto godagayne may perceyue wickedly report v affirme diſhonour whiche geue right honour ought haue doe playnly diſhonour whiche geue vnto honor onely due vnto god geue ſame honour geue vnto holy scripture word god becauſe expreſſeth vnto ſenſes death sauiour doth déepely print within v therefore call holy sacrament call god word holy scripture receiue sacrament great reuerence euen reuerently read heare preached holy word god cō teineth health ſoules graunt body preſent bread word verely receiued eaten faith ſhould knéele downe pray vnto holy scripture men might coūt v fooles might lawfully ſay doe honour ſcripture meanes rather diſhonour right honour thyng vſe intent inſtituted god hee abuſeth purpoſe doth déede diſhonour lykewiſe sacrament inſtituted kéepe memory death chriſt doe otherwiſe honour doe holy scripture vnto yt may wiſe make prayer ſay ſhould vtterly diſhonour auoyde therfore poynt idolatry ſafe finally ſay ſpeake frith ſheweth hee thinketh sacrament well faythfully whiche ſay goe body receiue body chriſt ſpeake vilanouſly wickedly whiche ſay onely receiue bread ſigne hys body ſo ſaying declare infidelitie faythful reckon hée euill reported reputed traytour iudas mē ſhould ſay hym hée dyd onely receiue sacrament alſo thyng whiche sacrament doth ſignifie albeit hée onely eateth bread ſacrament hys mouth téeth yet hys hart fayth inwardly hée eateth thyng ſelfe sacramēt outwardly doth repreſent ſpryng maner ſpeakynges olde father doe ſometyme vſe firſt ſight mought ſéeme contrary ſenſes bée well pondered may ſoone bée ſéene ſhould taken many time ſpeake sacramēt outward eating apply vnto ye sacrament outward eatyng fruite condition inward eatyng thyng ſelſe becauſe faythful man ſo ioyntly ioyned one neuer without godhead ſo ioyned māhode chriſt make one perſonas example mary named mother god yet ſhe mother hys godhead part onely called god becauſe ſhe mother touching māhode godhead ſo annexed māhode make one perſon therfore ſhée called mother god whiche déede bée wiſely weyed ſhalbée founde bée abuſed ſpeach yet neuertheleſſe may well bée vſed men vnverſtand ment thereby thorough vſe ſpeach men ſhoulde fall ſuch errour woulde affirme ladye bée déede mother godhead thē neceſſitie ſhould compell v make diſtinction betwéene nature godhead nature hys manhode ſo expoūde matter vnto bryng home agayne right vnderſtanding conſtrayned doe sacrament becauſe miſconſtrue ſayinges scripture doctours notwithſtandyng man vnderſtand ſay well many ſuch maner ſpeaches contayned scripture chriſt ſayth ioh 3 ſhall noman aſcend heauen hée diſcendeth heauen ſonne man heauen text doth ſay ſonne man heauen hée ſpake theſe wordes vnto nicodemus earth thing wiſe men cōſent bée vnderſtanded propter vnitatem perſonae ſay vnitie perſon albeit godhed euery place time yet manhode hée called ſonne man heauen time yet chriſt ſayde heauen vnitie perſon godhed heauen becauſe godhed manhode made one perſon therefore aſcribed vnto yt manhode onely verified vppon godhed auguſtine ad dardanum auguſt doth diligently declare likewiſe ſacrament baptiſme becauſe inwarde working baptiſme holy ghoſt euer annexed faithfull vnto outwarde ceremony therefore ſometime fruite inwarde baptiſme aſcribed vnto outward worke ſo ſcripture vſeth ſpeake outward baptiſme though inwarde ſay ſprite god therfore paul ſaith buried chriſt thorough baptiſme yet auguſtine auguſtinus ad bonifacium expoundeth yt outward baptiſme doth ſignifie buriall agayne paule ſayth many baptiſed haue put chriſt vppō yet déede outward baptiſme doth ſignifie wée haue put chriſt vppon v inwarde baptiſme water life ſpirite god wée haue déede put vpon v liue hée v notwithſtanding falſe outwarde baptiſme receiue fayth vnto bare ſigne whereof get profite damnation may euidently perceiue ſometyme ſcripture aſcribed vnto inwarde worke ceremony onely true outwarde veritie place ſhall expounde olde doctoures ſéeme contrary ſentēce therefore marke well thus haue mynde farther vppon sacrament bodye bloud chriſt wherein recken haue béene long repeating one thing ſo often ſhall pray pardon ſurely mée thought coulde bée ſhorter worlde ſuch dayes ſome woulde heare ſome doe heare therfore compelled ſo oftē repeate thing wiſe man woulde vnderſtand halfe wordes ¶ praye chriſten reader worde god may encreaſe god may bee glorified thorough bondes amen article wherfore iohn frith dyed whiche hee wrote newgate 23 day iune yeare lord 1533 doubt deare brother doth ſome deale vexe ſée one part haue wordes fréely ſpeake lifte bée put ſilence bée heard indifferently referre matter god whiche ſhortly ſhall iudge faſhiō meane reaſon ſhall rehearſe vnto article condemned ¶ examined two article theſe firſte whether thought firſt article purgatory purge ſoule preſent lyfe ſayd thought none man made two partes body ſoule body purged yt croſſe chriſt hée layeth vpon euery child hée receaueth affliction worldly oppreſſion perſecution impriſonment c death finiſheth ſinne yt ſoule purged word god receaue thorough fayth vnto health ſaluatiō body ſoule know thyrd part wherof made would alſo gladly graunt thyrd purgatory ſeyng know none ſuch muſt deny pope purgatory neuertheles count neither part neceſſary article faith neceſſarely bée beléeued vnder payne damnation whether bée ſuch purgatory ſecond article whether ſecond article thought sacrament aulter body chriſt ſayd yea yt thought chriſtes body alſo bodye paule ſayth 1 cor 10 chapter made one bread many graynes body ſignifying though bée many yet one body likewiſe wyne made one wyne many grape agayne broken chriſtes body ſignifying body ſhould bée broken ſay ſuffer death redeme v iniquity diſtributed chriſtes body ſignifying verely sacrament diſtributed vnto v ſo verely chriſtes body frute paſſiō diſtributed vnto faithfull men receaued chriſtes body ſignifying verely outward man receaueth sacrament téeth mouth ſo verely doth inward man fayth receaue chriſtes body frute paſſion ſure bread hée eateth well ſayd thinke queſtion naturall body fleſh bloud really contained vnder sacramēt actually preſent beſide ſimilitudes ſaid ſo thinke notwithſtandyng aunſwere would ſhould counte make ſaying whiche negatiue article fayth euen ſaye ought make neceſſary article yt fayth part yt affirmatiue ſay agayne make none neceſſarye article fayth parte leaue indifferent men iudge therein god ſhall open hart ſide condemne deſpiſe nouriſh thynges brotherly loue beare others inſirmities text auguſtine alleged agaynſt mee auguſtines text yt sacramēt chriſt borne owne handes whereunto ſayd yt auguſtine doth full well expoūd ſelfe place hēe ſayeth ferebatur tanq manibus ſuis hee horne certeine maner owne handes hée ſayth certeine maner ye may ſoone perceaue hée meaneth howbeit auguſtin thus expounded himſelfe yet hée ſayth ad bonifacium yt sacrament thyng hath ſimilitude propertie thyng whiche ſignifieth cauſe hath many tymes yt name yt thyng ſignifieth ſo hée ſayth yt bare himſelf becauſe hée bare yt sacramēt body bloud ſo earneſtly expreſſe ſelfe nothyng might doe read ye place auguſtine ad bonifacium alleage laſt booke ye ſhall ſoone ſée aunſwered place alleaged chriſoſtome firſt bluſh chriſoſtomus ſéemeth make well bée well wayed maketh much leſſe wéene wordes theſe doeſt thou ſee bread wine chriſoſtomes wordes doe depart thee draught meates doe god forbid waxe commeth fier nothing ſub ſtaunce remayneth aboūdeth ſo lykewiſe thinke myſteries cōſumed ſubſtaunce body theſe wordes expounded wordes ſame doctour chriſoſtome whiche homilie ſayth maner inwarde eye ſoone ſee bread flye ouer creature thinke bread baken baker bread euerlaſtyng life whiche ſignified myſticall bread conferre theſe place togither ſhall perceaue laſt expoūdeth firſt clearely firſt hée ſayth wilt thou ſée bread wyne aunſwere ſecond nay inward eye ſoone ſée ye bread thinke yt thyng ſelf yt ſignified therby ſo hée ſéeth ſéeth ſéeth outward carnall eyen inward eyen ſéeth ſay regarde bread thinke euen commonly ſay play game negligētly truth ſée doe meanyng myndes vppon thing ſée outward eyen lykewiſe may aū ſwere next part ſayth doe depart thée draught meates doe nay forſooth ſayd meates doe onely come nouriſh yt body depart draught meate expoſition chriſoſto text yt receaue ſpirituall meate receaued fayth noriſheth v euerlaſtyngly body ſoule neuer entreth draught euē outwarde eyen doe ſée bread yet outward eyen doe regarde thinke vpō likewiſe outward man digeſteth bread caſteth draught yet inward man doth regarde thinke vppon thinketh thyng ſelfe ſignified bread therfore ſayd chriſoſtome euen litle wordes whiche true meaning chriſo ſtomes wordes alleaged lift vp minde harte ſayd hée whereby hée moniſheth v looke vppon conſider thoſe heauenly thinges repreſented ſignified bread wyne marke bread wyne ſelfe ſay vnto chriſoſtomes mynde example hée playnly ſhewith remaneth bread wyne deny example place proueth yt ye ſhall think yt bread wine onely thyng whiche ſignified ye may euidently perceiue wordes folowyng hée ſaith thinke miſteries cōſumed ſubſtance body nowe whether chriſoſtome thought remained bread solution wayes ſhall purpoſe bée proued firſt hée thought remained ſtill bread wyne haue purpoſe thought bread wyne remayned chaūged bread wyne neither myſteries sacramentes body bloud chriſt neither bée myſtery sacrament finally hée ſpeake ye outward appearaunce bread know concluſion remaineth ſtill conſumed ſubſtaunce body therfore hée muſt néedes bée vnderſtanded take thinke many men wonder dye article ſeyng neceſſary article fayth graunt neyther parte article neceſſary bée beléeued vnder payne damnation leaue thyng indifferent thynke therein god ſhall inſtill euery man mynde neyther parte condemne matter receiue eche brotherly loue reſeruing eche others infirmitie god cauſe death thys becauſe conſcience abiure beholde cauſe mi deathe ſweare prelate opinion ſacrament ſubſtaunce bread wine verely chaunged fleſhe bloud ſauiour ieſus chriſt vndoubted article fayth neceſſary bée beléeued vnder payne damnation though opinion indéede true thing neither proue true ſcripture doctours yet coulde conſcience note graunt ſhoulde bée article fayth neceſſary bée beléeued c many verity yet may bée ſuch article fayth true lay yrons wrote howbeit would haue receaue thys truth article fayth may thinke contrary without ieopardy damnation ¶ cauſe beleeue opinion tranſmutation 1 firſt becauſe thinke verely three cauſes falſe neither hée proued ſcripture faythfull doctours bée well pondered 2 ſecond cauſe thys becauſe bynde congregation chriſt mine example admitte neceſſarye article beſide oure creede ſpecially none ſuch bée prooued true scripture ſay church caule compell v receaue ſuch article bée neceſſitie vnder payne damnation 3 thirde cauſe becauſe dare bée ſo preſumptuous entering god iudgement make prelate pointe neceſſary article fayth ſhould damnably condemne germanes almaines infinite moe déede doe beléeue thinke ſubſtaūce bread wine chaunged ſubſtaūce chriſtes naturall body ſurely bée ſo fooliſhe hardy condemne ſuch infinite number prelate pleaſures thus germaynes almaynes luther ſide alſo oecolampadius doe wholy approue matter ſurely thinke man hath pure conſcience hée thinke dye righteouſly tranſubſtantiation ſhould bée neceſſary article faith thinke man ſay good conſcience although true déede iohn frith exact diligent table wherby may readely turne ſpeciall matter common ſchooles firſt man aunſwered barnes scripture stafford forme bacheler diuinitie diſputation merueilous ſight great blynde doctours ioyfull godly ſpirited thus barnes reading diſputation preachyng became famous mightie scripture preaching euer agaynſt byſhops hipocrites yet ſée inward outwarde idolatry taught maintayned vntill good maiſter bilney conuerted vnto chriſt firſt sermō benet colledge ſhewed thēſelues flocked togither open ſight ye schooles open sermōs mary auſtens diſputations conferred continually togither houſe reſorted moſt commonly vnto white horſe deſpite viij tragedy continued cambridge preaching one agaynſt trying god trueth vntill within vj dayes shroftyde ſent downe sergeaunt armes called gibſon ſodainely areſted doctour barnes openly conuocation aduiſe thée thou ſhalt haue thy learning tried vttermoſt thou ſhalt haue lawe barnes requyred hym might haue iuſtice equitie foorthwyth ſhould haue gone tower gardiner foxe became ſuertyes night morning came agayne yorke place gardiner foxe forthwith cōmitted ye sergeaunt armes bryng chapter houſe weſtminſter byſhoppes abbot weſtminſter cauled iſlip ſoone sergeaunt preſented barnes ſayd byſhoppes abbot▪ firſt ſweare layd article vnto hym aunſwered like maner hefore aunſwered cardinall offred vnto booke probation aſked whether ſelfe ſayd yea ſhewe • vnto tooke ſaying ſhould haue la •… ſure preſent diſpute hym demaunded whether wou •… ſubſcribe article ſubſcribed willingly committe • fléete warden fléete commaunded man ſhoulde ſpeak • hym saterday folowing agayne brought chapt •… houſe weſtminſter remayned almoſt whole day late eu • ning cauled demaunded whether woulde abi •… burne great agonye thought rather burne abiur •… ſent agayne haue counſaile gardiner foxe perſwaded rather abiure burne becauſe ſayde ſhould doe good tyme come diuers perſwaſions mightie ſight reaſon fleſhe ʋpon knéelyng vpon knées conſented abiure abiuration put hand abiured written ſubſcribed owne hand yet would ſcarcely receiue boſome church termed put othe charged execute doe fulfill commaunded promiſed ſo doe commaunded warden fléete carye v ſtiliard like trouble vnto fleete whence came kéepe cloſe priſoners morning prouide v faggot doctour barnes iiij ſtilliard men readely done next day viij clocke morning tyme knight marſhall billes gleues tipſtaues could make cōmaunded bring frō meane tyme barnes made ſtrong chriſt got fauour learned chriſt forreine prince germany great luther melanction pomeran iuſtus ionas hegendorphinus aepimus duke saxon king denmarke king denmarke yt time stokeſley ſent lubeckes embaſſadour king hēry eight time remayned lay lubeckes chauncelour stiliard syr thomas chauncelour would fayne haue entrapped king would let cromwell great deare frende ere went lubeckes diſputed biſhops realme defence trueth ſo departed agayne without reſtreynt lubeckes went agayne whittembergh duke saxſon luther remayned ſet forth workes print begonne thence ſhortly returned agayne england tyme quéene anne boleyn continued faythfull preacher citie london time ſhée remained quéene well enterteyned promoted meane lord cromwell ſent ambaſſadour k hēry viij duke cleue mariage yt lady anne cleue betwéene king well excepted ambaſſade doinges vntill tyme stephen gardiner came fraunce came neither stephen gardyner author miſchiefe decay religion england religion proſpered quéenes maieſtie cromwell preacher mariage lady anne cleue neuer ceaſed vntill graffed mariage ſtocke occaſion whereof began bloudy broyle long diſſolution yt ſayd mariage betwéene king hēry yt viij yt lady anne cleue yt ſayd doctour barnes two brethrē felow preacher named iherome garret apprehended caried kynges maieſtie hampton court examined kynges maieſtie ſéeking meanes barnes ſafetie bring wincheſter agréed wincheſters requeſt graunted leaue goe home byſhop conferre hym ſo happened agréeing gardiner comparteners ſought ſubtile meanes entangle intrappe farther daunger long brought paſſe certayne complayntes made king enioyned preach iij sermōs next eaſter folowing spittle beſide london sermon beſides reporter thither ſent stephen gardiner byſhop wincheſter preſent ſitting wyth maior either beare recorde recantation el phariſeys came chriſt trippe talke ſpoken thing awry aforeſayd thrée preached sermon among barnes preaching firſt sermō hée ſéeing stephen gardiner preſent humbly deſired face audience forgéeue forgaue hym hold •… vp hand ſayd gardiner thereupō helde vp finger yet notwithſtāding meanes yt ſaid reporter iij immediatly preached ſent hampton court thence caryed tower syr iohn goſtwyke remayned vntill xxx day iuly next folowing thē enſued proceſſe againſt kynges counſaile parliament gardiner confeſſed himſelfe priuy among reſt whereupon aforeſayd thrée saintes true martyr xxx day iuly comming aūſwere yet knowing cauſe cōdemnation without publique hearing drawen herdelles tower smithfield preparing ſelues fier ſtake diuerſe ſondry exhortation amongeſt whome doctour barnes firſt beganne proteſtation folowing come hither burned heretike ſhall heare beliefe wereby ſhall perceaue erronious opinions▪ holde god take record neuer knowledge taught erronious doctrine onely thoſe thinges scripture leade vnto ſermons neuer mainteyned errour neither moued gaue occaſiō inſurrection although haue béene ſlaundered preache lady saffron bagge vtterly proteſt god neuer ment preached ſtudy diligence hath beene vtterly confound confute men doctrine anabaptiſtes denie sauiour chriſt tooke fleſhe bleſſed virgine mary ſectes deteſt abhorre deede place hath beene burned ſome neuer fauoured mainteyned diligence ſtudie euermore ſet forth glory god obedience ſoueraigne lord king true ſincere religion chriſt harken fayth beléeue holy bleſſed trinitie three perſons one god created made world bleſſed trinitie ſent downe ſecond perſon ieſu chriſt wombe moſt bleſſed pureſt virgin mary heare beare recorde doe vtterlye condemne abhominable deteſtable opinion ye anabaptiſtes ſay chriſt tooke fleſhe bleſſed virgine beléeue without conſent man power conceaued holy ghoſt tooke fleſhe ſuffered hunger thirſt colde paſſions body ſinne except according ſaying peter made thing like bretheren except ſinne doe beléeue liued among v preached taught father ſuffered moſt cruell bitter death mankinde doe beléeue death paſſion ſufficient price ranſōe ſinne world beléeue death ouercame deuill ſinne death hell none ſatiſfaction vnto father death paſſion onely worke man deſerue thing god onely paſſion touching iuſtification knowledge beſt worke euer vnpure vnperfect withall caſt abroad handes deſired god forgeue treſpaſces although perchaūce ſaid know nothing yet doe confeſſe thoughtes cogitation innumerable wherefore ſaid beſéech lorde enter iudgmēt according ſaying prophet dauid non intres iuditium cum ſeruo tuo domine place si iniquitates obſeruaueris domine quis ſuſtinebit lord thou ſtraightly marke inniquitie able abide thy iudgment wherefore truſt good worke euer onely ye death chriſt doe doubt inherite ye kingdome heauen take ſpeake againſt good workes bée done verely doe ſhall neuer come kingdome god muſt doe becauſe commaūded v god ſhewe ſet forth profeſſion deſerue merite onely death chriſt beléeue holy church cōpany doe profeſſe chriſt haue ſuffered confeſſed name sayntes doe la • de prayſe god heauen mannes tongue expreſſe alwayes haue ſpoken reuerently saintes prayſed aſmuch ſcripture willed doe lady ſay ſhée vergyn immaculate vndefiled ſhée moſt pureſt virgin euer god created veſſell god elected whome ieſus chriſt ſhould borne ſhriefe ſomwhat ſtayeing haſtening make ende turned people deſired men forgeue ſaid euell tyme vnaduiſedly wherby offended man geuen occaſion euell would forgeue amende euell tooke beare witnes deteſted abhorred euill opinion doctrine againſt word god dyed fayth ieſus chriſt doubted ſaued thoſe wordes deſired pray turned put clothes made ready fyre patientlye ſuffered bitter cruell martirdome death lyke dyd companiōs ſuffered yeare lorde 1541 supplication vnto gracious prince king henry viij ¶ grace peace god father sauiour ieſus chriſt moſt noble excellent grace euer amen complaynt doctour barnes made k henry viij agaynſt lordly byſhops prelate englād moſt hūble wiſe cōplaineth vnto grace continuall oratour robert barnes intollerable iniuries wronges oppreſſions wherwith certaine byſhops realme vexe haue vexed contrary vnto worde god ownelawes doctor onely alſo true preacher profeſſors ſame condemning
