heretickes whiche thing able proue scripture god yet ſhall would pleaſe grace indifferently according office wherein god hath ſet heare ſmall well great ſuſtaine poore orator agaynſt violence ſtrength god take recorde right ſory make thys complaint vnto grace againſt could coniecture meane cauſe redreſſe intollerable oppreſſions wherewith dayly oppreſſe poore true ſubiectes ſo ſore ſo violently without doubt grace ſée ſhortly remedy god muſt néedes puniſhe doe beléeue euer hée ſuffer long ſo great tyranny againſt worde ſo violent oppreſſion true chriſten mē doe vſe name chriſt hys holy church verely wée doe read memoryes father haue left v euer people vnder ſo great tyranny poore ſubiectes bée vnto thē ſo farre come ſoeuer hée bée hye lowe poore riche wiſe fooliſhe tyrannous gouerment byſhops england ſpeaketh agaynſt vicious liuing hée either made traytor vnto grace hereticke agaynſt holy church though king god may moſt excellent grace perfectlye know call remembraunce thoſe good men haue doe maruelous court byſhops court man founde innocent haue wherein neuer man accuſed hereſie hée learned learned found gilty maruelous court ye neuer hath innocentes court within realme may ſay thys againe mā ſpeak god law right conſcience agaynſt thys damnable tyranny little ſtick make heretick helpe colour maintaine oppreſſion adde treaſon againſt grace though hée bée neuer ſo true ſubiect vnlikly make reſiſtaunce thinke euill vnto grace pleaſe grace let v conſider ende vncharitable vnrighteous accuſation byſhops yea rather ye diuell inuented firſt bée men ye preach diſpute put forth writing ſoeuer agaynſt clergye thoughe ſame neuer ſo wicked yet finde fault therewith thing towching thē though bée neuer ſo blaſphemous againſt god ye bloud chriſt holy worde moued therewt example thereof ſo playne yt néedeth proufe grace may ſée blaſphemous rubrikes allow againſt yt bloud chriſt ſhamefull abhominable pardōs tollerate admyt diſputations doe mayntaine proue yt pope god man hauing theſe wordes pope neyther god man whether ye pope vi cap quo ver 〈◊〉 papa diſt xl ca si papa ſinne man condemne pope though hée bring innumerable ſoules hell occaſion agayne let v conſider mā ſpeake agaynſt cloked ipocriſie againſt neuer ſo litle thing yt longeth abhominations ſhoulde diſcloſed ſhall euydently whoſoeuer ſpeake agaynſt preache agaynſt abuſes abhominations •… ſt nedes bee caught moſte ſhamefully cruelly hādled tormented perceaue ſcripture place maiſterſhip excuſe world ſaue hée muſt eyther open ſhame cruell death playne cruelnes ſerueth ende ſhould ſaye yf man wyll take hād preache verety true goſpel maiſter chriſt purely wherby thoſe winning ſhould deminyſhed wherwith mayntayne honour dignity worldly promotion delicious lyuing gorgious apparel ſūptuous pallaces lordſhips breifly thing vſe paſtime pleaſure ſhould bée manifeſt mē ye get theſe thinges falſe fayned holynes deceyuing robbing people goodes alſo ye dyſpendyng bée abhomynable contrary ordynance worde god rather ſhould come paſſe leuer power potentae maye hinder gayne profites clergy gather ſtrēgth togither oppreſſe vyolēce many wil hold wt learning bée hée king duke lorde baron knight man womā childe practiſe euident ſée goe make inſurrection yt mayntayning world ly pompe pride true preacher hée entendeth mayntayne yt falſe preacher perſecuter ſo true preacher ſufferer nothing bring light moſt glorious heauenly word god hath béene darkened kept vnder ſuffering perſecution nature worde perſecuting maketh ſtryuyng yf bée bée true preacher god fighting worlde ſuffereth child worlde enioye theſe worldly thinges withſtandyng aſhamed thus falſly laye preacher charge becauſe would make grace mayntayne maliciouſnes vnder pretence treaſon myght execute tyranny hart hée would bee traytour mayntaine traytour agaynſt moſt excellent noble grace thinke mā yea know ſurely man doe without great diſpleaſure eternall god paule cōmaundeth ſtraightly vnto chriſtians bee obedient thinges manner let euery man ſubmyt rom 13 himſelfe auctoryte higher power whoſoeuer reſiſteth power reſiſteth yt ordinaunce god reſiſt ſhall receiue ſelues damnation alſo peter confirmeth ſaying submit ſelues vnto manner 1 pet 2 ordinaunce mā yt lord ſake whether vnto king vnto chiefe head eyther vnto duke vnto ſent hym puniſhment euell doer prayſe ye doe well wherfore ſcriptures common toung teach obediēce ruler mouer ſedition euery man ſcriptures would god iudge euery man doctrine queſtion preacher therof eyther would could make cauſe bée made inſurrection againſt prince ſéeyng ſelfe ſame ſcriptures ſtraytely commaundeth ſubiectes bée obedient vnto prince paule witneſſeth ſaying warne ſayth hée ſubmit ſelues prynces power obey officer cā preach goſpell chriſt ye cauſe inſurrection exhort men thys doctrine cauſe inſurrection diſobedience againſt prince let v goe conſider preacher onely haue preached word god marke euer occaſion diſobedience rebellion agaynſt prince firſt call mind ye old prophet prophet euer ſtyrred vp people agaynſt prince ſingle eye iudge thē eyther priuely apertly ſturred vp people agaynſt prince looke chriſt hée ſubmitted hym ſelf ye hye power payde chriſt ſubmitted himſelfe higher power hée tribute hée frée cauſed peter likewyſe pay suffered hée pacience puniſhmentes prince yea death moſt cruell although hym open wrong could finde gilty cauſe looke alſo apoſtles taught wrote doctrine apoſtles obeyed prince chriſt liuing followed hys ſteppes euer ſturred occaſion people agaynſt prince yea themſelues obeyed prince although moſt part tyrauntes infidel conſider likewyſe thoſe doctor purely ſincerely hath hādled true preacher teach obedience prince worde god either preaching writing euer theyr meanes inſurrection diſobedience riſe among people agaynſt prince ſhall rather finde haue béen ready lay downe owne heades ſuffer pacience whatſoeuer tyranny power woulde miniſter vnto geuing people example doe ſame conclude neither scripture neither practiſe preacher thereof teacheth affyrmeth ye people may diſobey prince ordinaūces contrarywyſe teacheth obedience bée done vnto playne thoſe byſhops rather papiſtes doe falſely accuſe thoſe true preacher ſubiectes thyng woulde appeare euery man ſight violence word god kept vnder ye doctrine doe preach teach none concerning thys matter god take recorde bookes writinges euer wrote made onely allow fauour whiche furthereth thys doctrine chriſt thys ſure myne aduerſaries rather aduerſaryes chriſtes doctrine muſt beare mée witneſſe wée haue bréefly touched doctrine true preacher preach people worde writing practiſe let v ſomewhat touch ye doctrine practiſe pope papiſticall biſhops let euery man ſéeke ye heretickes traytors prince firſt preacher onely worde god preacheth teacheth men obey prince ordinaunces according wordes peter 6 lib 1 titulo 33 de matori obedientiae cap solite pope papiſticall biſhops contrary vnto minde facte saint peter expoundeth peter wordes ſaying peter meaned hym ſelfe ſucceſſors pope falſifyath scripture hys ſubiectes falſe interpretatiō excludeth ſelfe hys frō obedience prince yet ſo content craftely drawing ſubiectes obedience prince ſayth alſo ye wordes peter ſpoken cōmaundement counſell crafte prince eſpye hys falſehode conſcience goe reproue papiſtes teach diſobedience prince falſe preacher maintainer hym lightly withdraweth ye harte common prince affirming cōmaundement god bée counſell leaſt wyſe authoritie bée ſufficient diſpence ye cōmaundementes god thus people ignoraunt becauſe lacke ye word god iudge euery doctrine delude wittes man perceaueth crafte loue hée hath god hys commaundementes exhorteth people iudge doctrine thoſe papiſtes worde god anone lay hereſie vnto hys charge laying thē god doctrine papiſt lawe ſaying man may iudge pope mā alſo may géeue ſentence aboue hys iudgement hée ſhall diſt xl c si papa 9 q 6 ca cuncta 30 q 1 cap ideo permit iudge men vpon earth item ſeate rome géeueth ſtrength might lawes ſubiecte none item ſubiectes may bée diſobedient lordes 6 lib 2 de ſen iudic hee may depoſe kinges item hée hath authoritie breake othes bondes obligation 15 q 6 cap alius made betwéene man hye lowe degrée item pope hath power interprete declare lay forth 26 q capit quotiens holy ſcripture hys ſuffer man expound contrary hys pleaſure item pope god vpon 6 de cōc preb ca ad apostolatus verb continetur diſt 40 cap si papa earth ouer heauenly earthly ghoſtly worldly hée hys owne man may ſay hym dooſt thou item though pope ſo euill hée lead innumerable mē great heapes hell yet ſhall man reproue therefore ¶ ſytten conſciences men theſe ſhameleſſe doings papiſtes ſuch like abhominable doctrine excluded mē frō ye ſcriptures vnlawfull thing haue mother tonge leſt ſhould eſpye diſceatfulnes mē paſt ſhame without feare god man ſpared put executiō theſe abhominable doctrine inſomuch depoſed openly prince emperours yea aſſoyled ſubiectes obedience commaundement god regarded wordes ſhould better appeare men ſhall recite ſome practiſes autēticke crownycles af owne lawe ¶ zacharias depoſe king • 5 quest 6 alius item fraunce onely iniquitie alſo becauſe vnprofitable ſo greate power ſet • ſhamefull arrogā cie tyranny pope •• éede pipinum emperours father aſſoyle fraunce othe alleagyaunce made • nto olde king thing holy church rome doth oftimes hir auctorite c ¶ would god grace earneſtly would looke lawe leaſt ſuffer géeue worde god ye handes ſubiectes compare obedience theſe men preache practice fayne would know hath depoſed king ſyth chriſtes paſſion ſauīg onelye bée kinges felowes yea cōtroulers ſauing ſubtile crafte antychriſt warne men heretykes caſt antichriſt traytours meane ſeaſon men ſtand lokeing fhr traytours commeth hée playeth parte open traytour ſauing onely hée coloureth name calleth himſelfe true byſhop ready accuſe mē treaſō might eſcape hymſelfe hée ſure hée wil neuer accuſe none ſpeake againſt auctorite prince man doe beginne open mouth declare hee hath temporall power rageth hée cryeth treaſon treaſon let v returne lawe ſée proue god word ſtandeth true ſubiection reſonable pope pope take vpon depoſition kinges god lawe ſubiectes ſhall depoſe king example maſter chriſt apoſtles ſcripture haue helpe dare bée ſo bolde depoſe king ordayned god yea holy worde hauing example ſcripture aboue god bleſſed worde ſay king wicked man aunſwere crownicles geue contrary witneſſe ye good man ryght ſimple becauſe hée ſimple therefore pipinus ye rule vnder thought ſelf better worthy rule king ſo wrote byſhop chaplayne vnto pope deſireth hym geue ſentēce whether better worthy bee king paynes labour hée labour could doe nothing pope make pipinum frend truſting meanes haue helpe hym agaynſt emperour whō hée béene variance gaue ſētēce depoſed made hym monke falſhod ſhould bée perceiued fained ye king béene mōke afore called samuell proue good cronicles let noble grace conſider right onely depoſe ſuche king alſo make mōke thus haue done wt noble kinges doubt ſame worſe attempt doe vnto grace diſpleaſe leaſt doe vttermoſte let hole rable thē tell grace true preacher chriſtes goſpell dyd ſuch déede officer hath néede bée afrayde chriſtes goſpell yet preacher thereof theſe preuye traytours man bée wary let v graunt ye kyng wicked man scripture commaundeth v obey ought depoſe king though wicked wicked prince geueth v none auctoritye depoſe owne gloſe teſtifyeth vpon text subdeti eſtote wicked herode yet iohn ſuffered death vnder hym wyckedder thē pilate yet chriſt put hym downe crucified vnder hym bréeflye ye prince good apoſtles dayes yet depoſed none god worde owne learnynge practiſe maiſter chriſte holy apoſtels openly agaynſt moreouer owne gloſe ſayth 1 pet 2 depoſed becauſe vnſufficient becauſe hée wanton lecherous wéemen lordes bee afrayde vengeaūce god leaſt take litle ſhame worlde vnto haue ſo long tyme ſo great tyranny defended theſe lawes bée ſo openly agaynſt god ordinaunce agaynſt god word agaynſt common ordinaunce cōſent world haue done great iniury noble prince intollerable ſubduyng noble bloud oppreſſion true ſubiectes deſtruction common wealthes finally euerlaſtyng damnation many chriſtened ſoule tell fayth doe beléeue liuyng god mighty puniſh enemy beléeue ſay vnto deuiſe auoyde hys vengeaunce bée ſo openly contrary hys woorde aunſwere thinke make hym thinke hée ſuffer worde heard let godly word bee deſpiſed thinke bée ſufficient ſay bée lawes holy churche thinke hee bee thus taught tyme plucke hym downe ſet vp nay lordes hée childe ſhall finde childes game thus trifle playe hys holy word hys bleſſed ordinaūce yea deſpiſing maker heauen earth say ye ye able learnyng defende matter neither afore god yet afore noble chriſt apoſtles ouerthrowers pope doctrine prince afore man learnyng bee true prince whiche way ſoeuer turne maſter chriſt bleſſed apoſtles bee agaynſt openly accuſe bée cōtrary worde theyr déede aunſwere aunſwere hold peace ſpeake helpe litle crye old maner hereſie hereſie traytour traytour crye agaynſt ſelues thoſe thynges chriſt apoſtles doe accuſe doe thinke ordinaunce god ſhal depoſe kyng bycauſe hée lyueth aduoultry lecherous man thinke lawfull cauſe doe preach opēly doe lay kynges charge ſuffer bee kynges lyue aduoultry doe put lawes executiō ſay bée lawes holy church therby may depoſe prince wil put execution much better bée biſhop prieſt thē kyng duke may lyue whoredome vngracious lyuyng yea deſtruction many men ſoules yet mā ſo hardy reproue law doth openly commaunde theſe wordes pope doe draw dist ul si papa hym innumerable people heape deuill hell puniſhed euer yet ſhal mortall man preſume reproue hys ſinnes hée muſt iudge men may bée iudged man c lykewiſe haue de hereticis cū ex iniuncto et ſieut law decretals lay mā may reproue prieſt c thinke theſe lawes bée deuill tell deuil wil reproue yea alſo depoſe prince neither bée depoſed yet reproued mortall man thinke ſelues god ye depoſe kynges fornication would handle kyng dauid kyng salomon would depoſe bycauſe aduoutry dauid salomon nathan doe prophet nathan durſt doe briefly ye bée content kyng ſhall depoſe fornication ſhall ſhortly bee rydde moſt part let v come herode herode kept brother wife would depoſe hym therefore doe iohn durſt doe hée durſt doe reproue hys vice dare depoſe hym let v go forth law authoritie ye pope ſet pipinum rowme rather let kyngdome chooſe thē king maſter chriſt ſayd hys kyngdome world bée aboue kinges world onely depoſe alſo ſet new pleaſure moreouer authoritie pope diſpence realme othe law ſayth holy church rome wont ſo doe pray hath ſhe learned ſame wont hath geuen authoritie pope diſpēce ye othe obedience ſubiectes make prince ſhée diſcharge v obedience owe prince law god standeth alſo yt law nature yea doe turkes infidel faythfully obey prince prince power god depoſe power dipēce lawe peter learneth actuum 5 yt bound obeye god lawe man litle regarde peter ſaying wherfore ſay owne 23 q 5 regū officium lawe whoſe wordes bée theſe muſt kéepe vnto prince power fayth reuerence c lordes fidem oportet come deſpenſation othe ſay non oportet bound obedient prince deſpence v cā diſpence v othe ſeing againſt god lawe may men ſée teacher haue béene alſo bée toward god holy apoſtles towarde noble prince ye thing may bée clearely knowne ſhall reſyte practyſe chronicle make mention 1366 time edward iij pope ʋrban dyd depoſe perſe king spaine becauſe hée vicious liuer ſet hys ſtede one henry baſtarde thinke ſtandeth thys facte chriſtes doctrine byſhops captaynes rebelles againſt prince v preach goſpell hath gone doe prince ſuch villanye doe déede laye blame v doe remember dayes henry iiij captayne church called richard scroupe archbiſhop yorke dyd gather hoſte men waged battell againſt hys kyng god defender hys ruler gaue king victorye cauſed ye traytor bée beheaded forefather deuiliſhe crafte made people beléeue falſe chronicle euery ſtroke géeuē biſhops necke kyng receaued god neck king afterward ſtricken ſicknes made hys ſubiectes beléeue ye god puniſhmēt becauſe hee killed byſhop thus content fayned hys death hée dyd miracle thys toe much bée traytors king alſo faine god bée diſpleaſed king puniſhing treaſon finally make hym ſaint alſo god done miracle defending hys treaſon poſſible inuent peſtilent doctrine thys god ruler deſpiſed hereby open treaſon maintained thinke god ſhewe miracle fortifie theſe thynges doubt prouerbe true ſuch lippes ſuch lectuſe ſuch ſaintes ſuch miracle many thinges bée ſayd paſſe ouer ſure doe remember obediently kynge iohn cruelly handled clergy droue king iohn kingdome originall ſtrife becauſe iiij biſhops england variaunce kinges grace becauſe hée required dymie pyed mō kes england maintaine hys warre agaynſt iriſhe men would géeue hym none wherfore ye king ſped well ireland hée reuenged ye monkes tooke euery place certayne yt thing forefather maintainer deuiliſhe doctrine wrote vnto god yt pope cauſed firſt excommunicate kyng afterward interdicte land gaue french kinges ſonne maintayned father naturall king compelled flée wale tarye till ye time hée content make agréement holy idoll pope cōditions ye agréement hée ſhould firſt géeue xl marke iiij byſhops make reſtitution pyed monkes agayne alſo ſhould géeue pandolphus pope legate great ſumme money finally hée ſhould bée bound géeue yearely pope rome certayne great ſumme money hée hys ſucceſſors ſhoulde receaue land pope holde ſée ferme vnto thys father ſet hādes ſeales binding ſelues tompell kynge iohn poyſoned king kéepe thys contracte yet ſo content afterward found meanes good kyng poyſoned traytorous monke swineſted becauſe ſhould ſay hée would make halfepeny loafe worth xx ſhillinges hée liued yeare whiche abhominable hypocriſie word holy monke moued went confeſſed hym ſelfe abbot would poyſon king thys one deuill good holy traytor abſolued holy murtherer déede done thys holy murtherer founded v maſſes euer bleſſed obedience holy church would cry would yaulpe wée ſuch ennemy true man theefe handled gentleman dogge faſhion call v poore men traytors meane ſeaſon bring king kingdome ſeruitude bondage treaſon bée treaſon bring ſo honourable kinge hys lande ſuch bondage compell hym receiue naturall frée kingdome ſuch vyllayne lymme ye deuell bée ſaid thought defend matter haue onely done wrong kinge vnto yongeſt childe ye lyeth cradell ye meanes bonde thinke ſufficient ſay déede firſt child theſe father haue alwayes alowed acte hath béene blaſed blowen preached cryed bookes full matter many true man bloud hath béene ſhed ſpeaking agaynſt thys yet neuer none ye euer preach againſt damnable facte full conſent full agréement worde déede wrytyng haue alowed treaſon therfore take auctors well forefather would ſpeake dampnable inſtitute maſſes willing traytor murtherer neuer learninge could allow remedy hée dye agaynſt king maintayning treaſon muſt néedes bée ſaynt maſſes bleſſinges myracles wil helpe theſe bée commaundement geue liſt pore men muſt bée accuſed inſurrection treaſon muſt bere al blame muſt bée driuen ye realme muſt bée burned god knoweth people vnder heauen abhorreth earneſter hart reſiſteth diligenly doth preach agaynſt diſobedience doe yea dare ſay boldely let bookes bée ſerched written 500 year ſhall declare auctorite prince true obedience towarde hym one litle bookes ſhall doe bee condemned hereſy helpe v may preach may wryte may doe maye ſweare againſt prince alſo aſſoyle men obedience towardes prince may compell prince bée ſworne yet child obedience good chriſten men ye dye doctrine remedy muſt bée ſaintes rather fayle ye ſhall doe myracles proue tell holy ſaynt legend ſtory germaine one ye pope saintes cronicles maketh mencyon hys name ye call ſ germayne chaunced ye tyme king ʋortiger came england place king lay deſired hym company lodging king becauſe hée kept cōmō inne would receiue hym hée departed angerly went kinges neteherdes houſe deſired lodginge meate drinke hym companye neteherde contēt lodge hée ſayd hée meate hym ſauyng yong calfe ſtode ſuckyng damme crybbe byſhop commaunded calfe bée ſlayne bée dreſt brought worthy miracle pope saintes afore hym hée company eate vp commaunded bone calfe bée gathered togither put calues ſkinne agayne bée layde cribbe damme ye calfe ſtarte vp aliue agayne next day byſhop went king ʋortiger reprooued merueilous ſtraightly becauſe hée would lodge hym ſayde hée vnworthey bée kyng depoſed saint cowheard ſet vp kyngdome kyng therefore depoſed hym made neteherde kyng hys ſtede neteherde ye cronicles maketh menſion came afterward many king writen one called petrus de netalibus writeth liues ſaintes thinke man binde mée proue thing lye yet muſt bee preached taught church muſt bée writtē holy ſaints liues hée muſt bée ſaynt becauſe hée depoſed king ſet neteherde theſe ſhamefull abhominable thinges doe prayſe alowe meane ſeaſon condemne v heretickes traytours chaunce moued abhomynablenes doctrine geue one euyll worde world rekoneth v vncharitable parte take god recorde afore whome ſhall bée ſaued damned though haue done mée ſhamefull wronge intollerable violēce yet owne perſons neuer diſpleaſed angry agaynſt horrible deuyll ye dwelleth cauſer auctor mayntayner ſuch abhominable doctrine againſt god bleſſed worde agaynſt hym ſay quarell agaynſt hym doe ſtriue truth let men take wordes abhominable thinke ſo ſhamfully depoſe prince ſo rebuke ſo handle compell bée ſworne holde land bée miniſters greate diſhonour liuyng god blaſpheming bleſſed worde great diſpight noble potentate ye remember iuſt li ij de ſen iud ca ad apost facte declared lawe noble emperour friderike wretch innocent fourth thing pope ye reaſō certayne complaintes made fridericke emperour depoſed emperours enemyes cited emperour appeare rome becauſe emperour would appeare curſed hym booke bell candell afterwarde depoſed hym commaunded electours choſe cauſe lawe briefely text declareth certayne artycles agaynſt emperour bée theſe firſt article alleged againſt friderike emperour hée ſworne kéepe peace ye church rome oth hée brake ſayth ye pope ſecond hee done ſacrilege takyng 22 gallyes laden holy ſpiritual prelate would haue gone ye councell gathered agaynſt emperour lugdune third becauſe ye emperour accuſed certaine article hereſye bée ſet fourth becauſe hee payed annuall pencyon kingdome sicill sicill pope calleth ſpirituall patrimony peter ſpace ix yeares theſe ſame thinges dyd hée depoſe ye emperour pryuate hym hys dignity aſſoyleth hys ſubiectes othe obedience commaundeth euery man obey hym men ye eyther gaue hym councell helpe fauour bée excommunicate curſed facte déede doctrine learning bée promoted doctours vnto learnyng ſworne theſe bookes bée read openly vnyuerſities marke v twayne bée traytours eyther doe depoſe emperours king ſuch trifle yea alſo make note difference betweene papiſtes proteſtantes lawe thereof ſwere vnto compell ſwere vnto el ſpeake agaynſt ſay ye doe wronge god bleſſed ordynaunce noble potentate fyrſte ye ought bée vnder vnder doe repreue god worde vnlawfull factes depoſe though bée infydelles heretickes haue none authoritye ye ſée howe maſter chriſt hys bleſſed apoſtles vſe ſelues towarde vnbeléeuyng prince neither depoſed yet cauſed bee ſworne vnto matter depoſe emperour bicauſe hée layeth handes carnall cardinall paule peter holy college yet laying handes mā depoſed hée kéepe peace ſufficiēt cauſe depoſe hym owne law teſtifieth otherwiſe holy church xxxiij q q inter haec god hath ſworde ſpirituall ſword whiche ſhe doth kill quicken lykewiſe xxiij q viij conuenter place bleſſed ambroſe ſayth willyngly neuer forſake bee cōpelled may reſiſt may ſorow may wéepe may wayle agaynſt weapon agaynſt ſouldiers agaynſt gothans teares weapon ſuch thynges bée defence prieſt otherwiſe ought may reſiſt c bleſſed ambroſe durſt depoſe emperour neither laying hand yet hereſie neither defendyng liberty holy church ambroſe ſimple foole knew liberty church ment yet holy ſpirituall fleſhe cardinal worth therfore hée could nothing wéepe wayle hée béene halfe ſo wiſe read certaine biſhop saliſbury hée done hauty mynde loftie courage byſhop matter tyme kyng richard ſecond chaūced baker london beare horſebread baſket came ſeruaunt byſhop saliſbury tooke violence loafe frō hym baker aſked hée dyd ſo hée made hym none aunſwere brake head pore felow cryed helpe againſt violence whereby people moued ſtrete come kéepe kinges peace ſo byſhops ſeruaunt compelled flye houſe neuertheleſſe people moued great violence cauſed conſtable come take hym bryng priſon anone maior shriues came pacified multitude ſo departed byſhops ſeruaunt hurt notwithſtandyng byſhop pacience biſhops ſoone turned wrath saliſbury archbyſhop yorke ſo moued citie makyng aſaute biſhops houſe made ſuch cōplaynt kynges grace hée put maior shriues ſet knight called syr edward rule yt citie done horſeloafe ſhall mā ſay pacience theſe ſpiritual men doe open violence breake kynges peace robbe men goodes yea kynges chamber alſo kynges hygh ſtrete great diſdayne iuſtice rebuke kyng great diſpeaſure ſubiectes yet packe matter ſo bée white ſonnes men muſt ſuffer beléeue none otherwiſe haue witched worlde men could neither heare ſée bée ſhamefull fact tell ſhamefull becommed great deale better haue puniſhed ſeruaūt example neuer wont ſpirituall churche yet accuſe men inſurrection dare ſay rebellion realme v c yeares kyng diſpleaſed begynnyng doe read time kyng henry ſecond hée required ſpirituall henry ſecond byſhops none ſhould departe yt land ſhould finde hym ſureties ſhould purchaſe nothyng hurt kyngs perſon realme ſpirite ſpirituall father would agrée rather founde meanes pope alexander alexander thyrd thyrd whiche vſurper ſea rome condemned article hereſie afterward one biſhops agaynſt dyed ſuch lyke article mo declared ſtynkyng martyr holy martyr wil ſpeake time bée obedience prince intende true occaſions matter ſtyrre vp inſurrection agaynſte prince purpoſe betray realmes ye beſt obedient child euer makyng diſſention debate ſtrife ſettyng men togither eares aſſoylyng men othe towarde prince may cauſe inſurrection treaſon ye maſter maſters beſt conueyers iugglers true engliſhe hart would thinke kynges requeſt godly lawfull learnyng able defende contrary standeth fidelity owe toward prince yea truth owe father mother brother ſiſterne coūtrey men doth othe made prince bynde v yet agrée bookes muſt rather bee fulfilled contrary doctrine men muſt bée cōdēned heretickes ſpeaketh agaynſt thē beleeue mortall enemy reken bee haue wel deſerued ſhould bée could ſo ſet matter mē ſhould ſpytte vſe ſelfe charitable toward matter béene ſo haynouſly ſo violently hādled would haue geuen one ill woorde let man require ſhould vnto ſuch abhominable deteſtable deuill hath brought wicked ſhamefull learnyng maners put cappe make low curteſie geue fayre wordes ſay god geue good morow ſyr deuill fare glad welfare proſperity lordſhip doth rule graciouſly men prayſeth doubte god ſhall proſper ſay let man require bée ſo taken mortall enemy wherſoeuer doe finde hym whether hée bée lord byſhop ſauing peraduenture ſpye hym dwelling byſhoppe wyll hādle ſo rough wordes weaknes certayne men would founde place vncharitable recited name innocent bloud haue ſhed time ſpeaking againſt vnlawfull doctrine ala fault coulde ye ſinde good mayſter bylney whō ye haue caſt away ſo violently dare maſter bylney ſay one among knew hym muſt commende prayſe vertuous lyuinge though founde litle faulte thinke hée aliue ſhould faulte ala would caſt away ſo cruelly ſo good man ſo true mā god kyng returne agayne purpoſe ſhewe example haue learned taught ſet king kingdomes togither ye eares maintenance dignity doctrine pope ʋrban vj choſē yeare lord 1378 iohan froſ croni ſuis ſedition violence romaine would haue cardinall fraunce becauſe woulde pope ſhoulde bee reſident rome ʋrban ſay deuiſing mayntaine ſecte part agaynſt aduerſary called clement whoſe ſide ye kyng fraūce helde ſent kyng england ed 3 well content frenche kyng certayne bulles contaynyng cleane remiſſion poena culpa would wage battayle againſt kyng fraunce againſt clementes ſide becauſe kyng lord pope clemēt againſt pope ʋrbane ʋrbane againſt clement eche defiyng curſing ſhoulde bée willinger take battayle hée ſent commaundement byſhops rayſe ſpiritualtie taxe pay ſouldiours wyth moreouer becauſe duke lancaſter tytle kyngdome caſtell helde clementes ſide therefore ye pope graunted part money ſhould alſo bée deliuered hym hée would wage battayle agaynſt ye kyng caſtell promyſing hym alſo hée would ſtyrre kyng portyngale alſo varyaunce ſayde kyng caſtelll warre agaynſt ſayd kyng mayntaynyng warre hée would graūt yt kyng portyngale demy ſpiritualty thorow realme much gathered portyngale ſtories maketh menſion london dioceſe gathered tūne golde whole realme england gathered xxv c frankes whiche make engliſhe money cc lxxvij vij c lxxvij 〈◊〉 becauſe money gathered ye ſpiritualitie diligence therefore pope ordayned henry spenſer byſhop norwych bée chiefe captayne warre euer pope coulde brynge matter paſſe ſent ye king lordes byſhoppes xxx bulles laſt thys foreſayd byſhop norwyche ſent foorth greate number men wage church duke lankeſter likewiſe agaynſt kyng caſtell theyr oth geuen fight agaynſt man countrey helde pope ʋrban chronicle ſaith pope ʋrban would haue made peace betwene frēch king laſt thinke pope ſtyrres vp procurer warre deſtruction people countreys pretie practiſe ſet men together eares make beleeue woulde make peace fyrſt muſt haue cleane remiſſion fight thā wée ſhall bée curſſed blacke potte wée make peace becauſe pope hath hys purpoſe goodly packyng ſpirituall men goodly obedience taught toward prince bée men ſoules well fed wyth thys doctrine bée theſe good father thus watcheth nyght daye yt cure charge haue men ſoules marke charitable liberall holy father bée diſtributing chriſtes merites euery man fighteth cauſe ſhall haue cleane remiſſion pena culpa muſt néedes bée childe ſaluation let chriſt ſay doe hée holye church hath ſo determined man ſhoulde doubt bée xxx bulles graunted vnder leade church rome diſt xix si ro enim vero nul ifaſ ca sic omnes erre ſpirituall lawe ſayth ſea rome doth approue muſt néedes bée allowed ſhe reproueth muſt bée ſtrength likewiſe place muſt decrées ſea rome bée accepted though ſpoken godly voyce peter hymſelfe agaynſt theſe thinges dare ſpeake would fayne bee taken chriſten man yet muſte bee ſo bolde ſpeake one worde truth deuill himſelfe hath blowen theſe preſumptuous voyces yet mē muſt ſet life ſoule theſe wordes bée xxx bulles leade confirme matter weightye thynge kyng iohn naturall prince ſhoulde haue pyed mōkes defēce realme ſmall ſumme money neuer bull gette yet one byſhop englād preach ſide cc pound gathered one lent greate deale maintainaūce ye pope holy fleſh marueilous ſubiectiō ſhould ſuffer ſelues ſo lightly bée moued geue onely ſo greate ſūme money alſo ſend forth defence ſuch wicked perſon naturall brother kinſemen countreymen dare ſay conſcience fiue hūdred yeares ſuch ſumme money ſo lightly graunted cauſe neuer ſo great vnto right naturall lege lord ye doe beléeue kynges grace ſame day ſhould deſire ye ſpirituality halfe ſumme dare ſay ready ſpiritualtie helpe pope wold neuer graūt good ſhoulde bée found one diuine england holy pope churche could would proue good diuinitie kyng might take ſpiritualitie bounde geue ala ſhall ſay beléeue doe want wordes ye ſettyng matter natural affectiō naturall loue fidelitie truth hart men ought haue beare toward naturall prince toward natiue countrey toward father mother toward wiues childrē yea toward liues god infinite goodneſſe hath geuen v noble prince maintaynyng defence theſe thynges toward hym haue litle none affection vnto idole rome ready geue body goodes geue better content merueilous poueryſhyng realme ſende ſo many thouſandes receiue nothyng agayne deceitfull bulles ſhéepes ſkynnes litle péece leade yea worſt make men beléeue ſaluation dyd hange dare ſay boldly poore men bée condē ned heretickes alſo traytours againſt kyng béen realme england ſtād ſo good condition men béene bounde ſtill conſcience profite england hath goſpell obey wretched idole durſt haue kept ye innumerable ſumme money within realme ye yearely ſucked adder godly learnyng inſtructed conſcience let liberaries bée ſought englād ſhall one booke writtē iiij c yeares admitted church rome ſpiritualtie founde doth teach obedience fidelitie toward prince deliuereth realme bondage wicked sathan pope el able ſatiſfie quiete man conſcience within realme yet dare ſay hée englād cā reproue learnyng doctrine maſter chriſt el holy apoſtles yea mē haue ſtudyed deuiſed might bryng mighty prince noble realme vnder ye féete deuill could bée nothyng handled ſo ſecretly within realme either pleaſaunt profitable pope know byſhops england ſworne reuelate matter may bee wel proued ſhamefull trayterous oth contrary god law man law order nature haue vi lib ij tit de iure iurando c ego epiſcopus made falſe man pope wordes othe written owne law theſe byſhop n frō houre forth ſhalbe faithfull peter holy othe byſhops made pope church rome lord pope ſucceſſours lawfully entryng popedome ſhall conſent counſell déede hée ſhoulde loſe either lyfe lymme hée ſhould bée taken euill trap councell ſhall bée ſhewed vnto either hym ſelfe el letter legate ſhall open man hys hurt damage ſhall helpe defend mayntaine papacie church rome rule holy father ſauyng myne order agaynſt men liuyng ſhall come councell ſoeuer bée called onles bée lawfully let pope legate ſhall honorablye entreate goyng commyng neceſſities ſhall helpe ſhall viſite yearely either myne owne proper perſon el ſome ſure meſſenger ſea rome onles bée diſpenſed helpe god holy euangeliſt hath béene wonderous packing vſed hath coſt many thouſand men liues ere ſpiritualitie brought paſſe ſhould bée ſworne pope owe none obedience man onely matter hath béene wonderous craftely conueyed beginnyng biſhops ſworne ſo ſtraitely vnto pope doe read tyme iſidorus decretis gregoris mi noris c nomine gregory thyrd yeare lord vij c lix othe ſweare kéepe fayth holy church abide vnity ſame conſent man pleaſure contrary promiſe alſo ſéeke profites church rome byſhops lyue agaynſt olde ſtatutes holy father ſhould haue conuerſation rather forbidde coulde el trewly ſhewe pope othe cōtinued pope chaungeth biſhops oth oftē maketh profite great many yeares tyll mortall hatred ſprang betwene emperour pope confirming byſhops many byſhops confirmed pope ſweare othe haue firſt written othe gregory maketh mention ſufficient becauſe byſhops bounde betray prince reuelate counſelles pope thing ye pope muſt néedes know el hee coulde bring paſſe purpoſe ſay coulde bée lord ouer worlde cauſe emperours kynges fetch confirmation knéele downe kiſſe féete hée broght paſſe hée procéeded farther firſte kynges hee brought wt violence vnder pope foote byſhops bee ſworne maintaine adding thinges byſhops othe maintayning worldly honour dignitie ſhall afterward appeare firſt wée wyll examine othe ſtandeth god worde true obedience prince pray tell scripture el example mayſter chriſt holy apoſtles haue takē doctrine learne ſwere saint peter el church rome el pope néede ſweare saint peter ye cā neither doe hym good fidelitie yet hurt falſhode othes taken hée othe made vnto might bée ſure true helpe ſuccour hym ſweareth agaynſt men could hurte hym saint peter hath none enymies though hée yet hée afearde neyther helpe hym deliuer hym hée néede verytie good peter muſt ſtand fore frunt make men afrayde make men beléeue frendes god knoweth neyther fauour perſon lrarnyng lyuyng peter perſon nette necke thinke would bid hym walke beggar called heretik doe ſweare folowe hys lyuing preach teach doctrine maketh nothing purpoſe therefore ſwerre onely peter name wherein wyll bée faythfull peter mayntane worldly honour dignity rich know well hée ſayth hée hath forſaken theſe thinges chriſtes ſake theſe thinges thinke hée require none othe wherfore néedes bée faythfull ſworne vnto peter muſte bée mayntayning defending ſpirituall thynges preaching chriſtes goſpell purely ſincerely mynyſtring truelye inſtitution maſter chriſt ye bleſſed ſacramentes holy church vertuous lyuyng geuing example holy church chriſte bée othe truely periured worthy weare paper doe reken ſelues hye honorable goe aboute ſuch ſimple thinges theſe bée therfore haue applyed ſelues holy workes byſhops greater matter chriſtening belle halowing church bleſſing candels conſecrating holy oyle halowing chaleſies veſtementes aulters geuing 40 dayes pardon receiueth bleſſings ſtreate ſome viſyte holy ſaintes ſuch like greate matter partayneth nothing othe wherefore doe recken ye true forme othe haue byſhops ye bée periured abiured call againſt god agaynſt peter againſt prince foloweth holy church rome néedeth good doe ye holy church rome profyte ſweare requeſt holy ſcripture ſhoulde ſweare thinke ſhe compell othe bée true muſt ſhee néedes ſue periurie breake othe marke ye church rome ſet othe better perſon pope wherefore muſt néedes followe ye pope vnder ye church leſſe church hed church except make hym third perſon neither pertayneth peter yet holy churche thyng ſelfe law ſayth neither god prohe vi ca quoni verbo papa man middle betwéene much ſay learnyng deuill hym ſelfe meaneth ſweare onely holy churche rome bée traytours holy church conſtātinople el holy churche england doe thinke church holy tell v meane ſéemeth marueilous thyng alſo ſpeciall thyng make ſuch othe onely holy church rome naming none church rather ſworne kéepe féede noriſh bée true owne church haue taken cure charge peter commaundeth sée 1 pe • 5 féede chriſtes flocke among theſe haue taken name lyuyng dignitie called byſhop wincheſter london lyncolne theſe fed theſe bée forgotten othe theſe litle regarde mayntayne holy churche rome geueth neuer peny robbeth church muſt bée ſtraitly ſworne antichriſt muſt haue cloke treaſon hée bée traytour hée bée excuſed byſhop fiſher otherwiſe called b rocheſter anſwered hee ſworn yt pope therefore hee woulde ſweare ye kinges ſupremacye hée ſworne ſhall tell doe take truth ſweare betray kil ſlay member church ſauyng thoſe liueth whoredome miſchief vſed rome ſhould bee bounde ſéeke rome chriſtened men thoſe doth liue liuyng holy church thinke ſhould finde yea vnto thoſe would thinke ſcorne bée ſworne ergo muſt folow ſworne worſt ſort rome holy churche rome taken ſuch ſorte liueth agaynſt god agaynſt bleſſed worde agaynſt liuyng holy apoſties agaynſt cōditiōs holy mother ye church could ſay whoredome oppreſſion sodomytrie murther pōpe pride ſumma ſummarum maner miſchief toung cā tell hart thinke ſay ſo men would reken vncharitable vehement neuertheleſſe worlde knoweth doe recken ſelfe vertue oth boūde men vnto ſuch déede liueth vngracious maner yet bée faithfull true vnto agaynſt men yea dare ſay conſcience true deſcription leudnes byſhops rome cōdemned ſuch miſchief would neuer haue deſired aſſiſtence el haue thought neceſſary haue required othe veritie bée naught haue néede mayntainers miſchief alſo ſuſpect bée true except made othe yea ſcarſly onles déede tyme place conuenient doe betray prince ye cauſe othe profite hath kyng bée reported practiſe euer came othe foloweth lord commeth pope name lord pope would gladly learne pope hath got dignitie lord thyng litle regarded lordes byſhops bryng ſuch worldly dignitie yea ſay trifle mocke men ſpeaking agaynſt truth durſt much time paſt would burne litle trifle beſt lord england dare ſay hath coſt many man lyfe euer brought pope lordſhyp bleſſed peter whoſe ſucceſſour pope boaſteth ſelfe bée knew nothing lordſhyp bée ſayth vnto hys felowes 1 pet 5 ſhall exerciſe lordſhyp ouer congregation likewiſe paule durſt take vppon 2 cor 8 commaunde lord collection bée made poore men mekely deſires thē without lordſhyp alſo place let 1 cor 4 man iudge v miniſters chriſt bleſſed paule rekeneth ſelfe miniſter ſeruaunt yet ye day hath béene ſo good lord pope maſter chriſt came teach peter paule learned diſciples math 20 vſe thē ſelues lordes ſeruauntes marke occaſion hée bée two newe diſciples brought vnto old beyng yet perfite thought ſcorne theſe two ſhould ſit aboue ye one right hand left hād maſter chriſt reproueth proude ſtomacke ſtraitely ſaying ye prince ruler infidel hath power ouer ſubiectes ſo ſhal ye hée bée greateſt amōg ſhal bée leaſt maſter chriſt learneth none hypocriſie ſhold bée called leſt name bée greateſt déede hée doctrine ſhalbée expreſſed déedes lord pope calleth ſelfe woordes ſeruaunt ſeruauntes déede hée wil bée lord ouer lord seruus ſeruorum yea lordes byſhops bée ſworne hym vnto lord wil reken ſelues periured burne take pope ſeruaunt marueilous hypocriſie pope monſtrous hipocrite bée called ſeruaunt ſeruauntes yet deſire bée taken lord kyng ouer kynges yea vnto bée byſhops ſworne becauſe wil bée obedient prince conſciences rypped ſhould finde mā ſit kyng loſell pope poore men muſt bée cō demned reprouyng ʋerely becauſe lord haue ſworne hym agaynſt prince true ſubiectes howe ſtandeth othe toward prince bée ſworne pope onely lorde alſo contrary yea worlde greateſt mortall ennemy prince hath dare ſay good minde clement pope bare vnto kyng henry viij wretched clemēt could drowne noble prince one worde ſhoulde bée longe vndone ſine clementia common ſayinge went hamburgh caytyfe hath al onely excōmunicated noble prince alſo geuen away kingdome facte muſt defende ſworne ye pope yea dare ſay conuenient occaſion would declare fidelitie doe iudge factes haue done kinges tymes paſt whenſoeuer power might bring paſſe ye haue conceiued agaynſt prince thinke iudge myſſe el doe wrong let bée put proofe ſhall ſée heape holy factes ye bring chronicle bookes bée lauded prayſed hyely haue ſo faythfully ſtucke vnto dā nable idole rome yea dare ſay béene hereſie within two yeares haue written ſayd thus much agaynſt lymme deuyll prince ſide ye worlde teſtefye wherefore thinke put tryall othe howe doth ſtand allegyance toward prince bee ſworne pope owne lawe ſayth lege man make none 6 lib 2 de ſenten et iudicata ca pastoralis verbo homo que othe fydelytye none man owne kinge moreouer doe remēber othe made vnto prince wherein doe renounce clauſes wordes ſentences made vnto pope may bée hurtfull preiudiciall highnes agréeth theſe ij othes may ſet togither well cā know way excuſe byſhops periurie auoyde periury truth kinges grace councell conſidering othe made pope bée periudiciall regall power cauſeth othe afterwarde made vnto reuoke thoſe thinges haue afore ſworne ye pope declare grace counſell reckon othe made ye pope bée againſt therfore maketh reuoke name naming ſame othe alſo ſame pope may clearely perceiue prince doth ſuſpect byſhops aſſoyled oth towarde prince neuer othe made pope othe making déede pope meaning none betray ye king realme therfore ſoone variance betwéene ye king yt pope thē firſt aſſoyled allegyance dew vnto king abſolucion blaſen blowen preached taught throughout world dores poſtes muſt bée decked paper bulles diſcharge helpe prince could neuer bée diſcharged hereticall trayterous othe made vnto pope agaynſt prince neither peter paule helpe key ye open locke lord god haue beene blynded thus trayterouſly handle naturall prince caterpiller come bée lorde hath brought kinges vnder hys féete ſpeake god willyng peculiar treatyſe foloweth ſucceſſours lawfully regularly entryng lawe reade owne di 23 qui epiſcepus ex conſilio 4 cartha bookes law thinketh bée byſhops made wherein finde among good thinges hée ſhoulde bée chaſte lyuyng méeke gentle ſpeake mercyful wel learned yt new olde teſtamēt ye ſhoulde forbyd maryage ſhould blame eating fleſhe ſhould alſo beléeue maner ſynnes well actuall original bée clerely forgeuē baptyſme many theſe thing pope holines indewed many hée aloweth owne bookes déedes wil teſtelie wherfore recken othe doth meane law yet ye lawe bleſſed paule writeth recken vertue 1 timo 3 tit 1 othe haue béene bound one pope 400 yeares ſo muſt folowe haue lawes bleſſed paule ſpeaketh councell charthaginence choſe pope farre men recken common experience practice bée theſe primis hee ſhall bée able lawfull pope bée pope muſt bée vēgeable tyraūt neuer kéepeing peace wayes warryng defence yée call peter patrimonye ſuffer prince dwell reſt hym ſnatch poſſeſſions vnholy church rome ſet prince together eares tyll bée weary take ye matter hande neuer make ende tyll partyes hath geuen ſome poſſeſſiōs holy fatherhed aſſoyle ſoules hath bene ſlayne packyng hée pope wickednes deſcribed large dare moſte boldelye leaſt ſhame depoſe prince without cauſe hée beſt able bée pope trayne craft ſubtyltye bring vnder hym byſhop ſpirituall perſon inuent newe clauſein othe hée bée alowed afore moreouer hée ye kéepeth feweſt woman hath moſt wote hée holyeſt apte bée head church hée ye moſt tyranouſly burne mē preaching ye goſpel hée hym ſelfe take labour therein item burne prieſtes ye mary wiues hée hym ſelfe liue myſchefe whordome yea ſuch abhominablenes man may honeſtye ſpeake knowe meane man ſay hath good teſtimony afore ſpirituality hée lawfull man office furthermore hée whore clement pope ſonne curtiſan ſonne holy father finde meanes 12 men forſwere ſelfe hée lawfully borne holy clement dyd fitte father ſuch child finally hée ye geue moſt mony bye ye greateſt part cardinales hys ſyde hée beſt worthy bée called pope ſit peter ſtoole bée vnknowen ye thomas woulcy holy piller church woulde haue béene pope whē clement choſen offer reſonable peny clement daſſhed hym conſayte 20000 li hée offered ſo hée iudged beſt worthy entered lawfully regularly vnto biſhops bée ſworne obedient becauſe haue ſuch head bee member coulde el kingdome ſtand pope ſhoulde bee choſen paules rule ye vayne trompery ye clergie clearly ouerthrowne one ſhould bee choſen rule bleſſed paule el lyuynge theſe newe heretykes bée ſimple poore care dignityes neuer ſwere fyght would rather mary wyfe owne take men alwayes ſtudying preaching god worde ſéeking onely honour god profyt neighbour bée ſubiect obedient thinges deſiring none exception prince man ſay ſhoulde bée vnlawfull eligible hée able deſtroy ye whole kingdome ye papiſtes worthy receiue othe lordes ye byſhops gladly periured ſuch mās ſake able deſtroy ye whole church rome vnto byſhops haue béene ſworne foloweth othe ſhall conſent counſell déede ſhoulde loſe eyther lyfe member ſhoulde bée taken trapped euill meane néede ſweare thus vnto charitie •… deth men thinke well one another pope doth order charitie binde thus vſe ſelfe towarde men ſay neither hurt harme neither intrappe betraye men muſt bée betrayde crafte ſubtiltie vndone mayntenaunce thys one wretched perſon truth neuer man ſpake againſt popet deſtroyde betrayde popet hath blaſphemed betrayde poteſtates yet neuer againſt hym becauſe ſworne hym kéepe othe bée right wrong laſt othe hath béene newely made added thys clauſe man ſhould lay violent bandes vpon wyſe wrong ſhoulde bee done vnto maner colour part newly brought ſince fleſhe pope much holy tyme paſt hath beene fleſhe pope hath béene ſo holy man might touch harlottes chriſten men muſt patiently ſuffer iniuries wrōges head forſweare point mayntaine himſelfe power againſt men neare apoſtles liuing chriſten men well iudge foloweth othe counſell ſhal bée ſhewed vnto mée either theyr letter meſſengers ſhal open man hurte damage let prince beware whan pope ſendeth coūſelles vnto meaning betraye worlde knoweth pope doth litle regarde beggar worlde doth handle emperours kyngs duke doth handle muſt let deſtroye pope counſell may ſhewe man kyng becauſe ſworne pope ſay othe made vnto prince wherein ſweare ſhall faithfull true beare vnto aboue creature loue fauour lyue dye hym open vnto maner counſelles may bée hurtful vnto grace well knowne pope hath pope doth practiſe counſailes againſt honourable ſtate prince done dayly doth handle ſuch coū ſelles bée againſt prince honour conſeruation yet may neyther tell prince let becauſe ſworn pope ſworne prince tell thyng opened vnto prince pope handeled counſell agaynſt prince thing take recorde noble grace whether ſay true falſe yet muſt bee accuſed treaſon becauſe ſworne pope true kyng foloweth ſhall helpe defend mayntaine papiſtry rome againſt men ſauing myne order new othe oure dayes made added regalles saint peter mē bée contained prince muſt néedes defend becauſe ye bée ſworne pope forſworn prince othe prince defend wit reaſon againſt men muſt forſake one practiſe hath béene alwayes forſake prince ſticke pope othe made prince haue béene oftentimes aſſoiled lawe ſayth 〈◊〉 queſt vi c alius church rome wont ſo doe othe made vnto ye pope abſolution neither heauen earth neither euer ſpecially bee noted practiſe prelate ſuch doyngs holy father rome rebellion agaynſte prince hee woulde geue abſolution matter agaynſt popedome neuer abſolutiō might bee obteyned redde heard ſéene could bée diſpenſation let mée bée reported ye bookes euer written bulles euer graunted experience euer vſed bée found falſe let mée bée blamed yet ſure many mē recken ſpeake vncharitably would faine learne ye charitable mē england engliſh wordes coulde declare intollerable ſubtile treaſon thus long ſhamefully vſed againſt prince neceſſary bée knowne compelled violēce declare confeſſion learning cauſe mē hath béene aſhamed report would wretch poore ſimple worme hable kill catte though woulde doe vttermoſt make inſurrection againſt noble mighty prince god knoweth doe honour worſhip loue fauour vttermoſt power hart ſatiſfied becauſe ſpeake afore god let bée mercifull vnto mée true ſo true mine hart poſſible mée ſo earneſtly write agaynſt thē whome doe recken handle vnfaythfully vntruely wyth theyr prince yea againſt god lawe man lawe truth ſuffer god grace maner wronges iniuries ſclaunders bée called hereticke agaynſt god traytour againſt prince liueth ſay hée lieth wil bée able ſo proue may bée reported workes déedes conuer ſation liuing thinge euer vnto purpoſe byſhoppes doth ſweare one othe pope contrary prince yet bée takē good faithfull child poore man muſt bee condemned woorkes hereſy mā reade vnder payne treaſon becauſe write againſt periurie towarde prince commeth peter pope regales theſe regalles ſworne defende ſeing neuer kyng fiſher worlde knoweth regalia belongeth kinges like power kynges rather peter acquaynted hys nettes regalles ſworne defend peter net fiſherie thinges hee hadand vſed neuer regalles theſe thinges maintayne holy church rome therefore ye ſweare maintayne meane ſentence sauing mine order ſay ſauing kinges pleaſure gloſe ſayth may defend ʋerbe ſalue ordine theſe thinges weapon oh lord god vnſhamefulneſſe thus delude wordes whole worlde men knoweth pope hath néede helpe men ſooner armes call armes harneys bylles glaues ſwordes gunnes ſuch thyngs doe remember ſoone byſhop norwiche henry spenſer armes defende pope vrbane foly recite example yeare lord 1164 controuerſie betwéen kynges grace byſhops england certaine prerogatiues belō gyng kyng wherfore king theſe article bee graunted none hereſie required othe confirmation byſhops concernyng thoſe article prerogatiues aunſwere made biſhops thoſe prerogatiues cum omnibus prauitatibus regio ſcripto contentis none effect ſtrength bicauſe forbyd appele court rome onles king gaue licence bicauſe byſhop might goe pope callyng realme without kynges aſſent bicauſe clerkes ſhould bée conuented criminall cauſes afore temporall iudge bicauſe prelate abyde vſe obedience prince kyng would heare matter cōcernyng tythes ſpirituall cauſes bicauſe agaynſt ſea rome dignitie ſame byſhop ſhould bée conuē ted afore ye kyng briefly would bée vnder kyng addition ſhould bée ſet vnto saluo honore dei eccleſie romane ordine noſtro bée vnder grace ſauyng honour god churche rome order cauſe dyd except theſe thynges ſelues graunt kynges receiued authority power haue beene leade blynde guydes church church receiueth authoritie chriſt onely wherefore conclude kyng commaunde ouer byſhops abſolue iudge tythes church neither yet forbyd byſhoppes handlyng ſpirituall cauſe marueilous blyndneſſe obſtinacie agaynſte theyr prince make agaynſt god honour obey king king power immediatly god aſhamed ſay kynges face power pray whether kynges byſhops byſhops kynges ſhal finde god long admitted kynges biſhop take hym thought doth holy ghoſt commaūde ſhould honour kynges alſo 1 pet 2 place let men bée vnder high power power rom 13 god hée reſiſteth power reſiſteth god ordinaunce bleſſed paule ſayth kynges power god byſhops furthermore reaſon defende pope prerogatiue agaynſt defendeth pope agaynſt hys ſoueraigne lorde lady vnnaturall ſubiect prince prince nearer naturall vnto wretch pope thyng ye maketh marueile ſweare pope sauyng order much ſay ſhall vſe weapon el ſhall bée ready obedient thynges ſhall ſweare kyng sauyng sauyng order hath two ſignifications order much ſay haue authoritie confirme kynges bée felowes neither bée obedient vnto yet aunſwere iuſtice clearely bée exempted medle excepte geue ſome worldly promotion would vſe ſelfe vnchatariblye agaynſt haue handled doubtles could make ſome thyng ſhold dipleaſe would cry would handle poore wretch halfe ſo much agaynſt let paſſe god hath preſerued mée hitherto infinite mercy agaynſt inſaciable malice doubt hée ſhall doe ſame ſtill returne othe foloweth ſhall come synode called vnles ſhall bée lawfully let doe pope hold councell whē pleaſeth hym ſweare compell pope call councell ſeyng hath béene ſo often ſo inſtantly required many noble prince chriſtendome yea ſeyng chriſtendome doth require great ſightes order bée taken ſet higheſt article faith vnto ſworne bicauſe agaynſt holy popet rome generall councell hée know muſt néedes folow ouer ſtreight reformation therfore coū ſell ſay come bée lawfully let foloweth ſhal honourably entreate pope legate going comming neceſſitie ſhal helpe pray ſée prouide well hée goe begging peter ſée alſo neither preach teach pyll poull miſchiefe vnſhamefaſtnes becauſe ſworne maintayne foloweth ſhall viſite yearely ſelfe ſome meſſenger pope rome vnles bée diſpenced pray pertaineth office byſhop yearely viſite rome chriſt moſt apoſtles neuer rome yet méetely good chriſten men reade tradition turke certayne muſt yearly viſite mahomet thinke vi lib de maioritate obedientia dilecti filij de iure iurando ca ego verbe ſingulis haue taken cuſtome owne law ſaith vnto clauſe muſt theſe biſhops bée boūde bée immediatly vnderneth pope ſuch ſweare othe kyng immediatly take byſhopprick holde onely grace wherefore doe ſweare againſt owne lawe alſo againſt othe made prince moreouer know olde cuſtome dayes kyng henry ſecond byſhop ſhoulde goe realme without kinges licence bound kéepe cuſtome anſwere pope hath diſpenſed prelate obeye pope prince bounde kéepe obedience towarde actes prince maketh moreouer meruaile ſore ſo ſtraitly ſworne ſo long tyme neuer one euer went dayes rome diſcharge othe becauſe diſpenſed good leaue othe firſt ſéeing entende kéepe afterwarde diſpence forſothe pope coulde bynde come rome hys pleaſure betraye kyng counſelles othe newly made haue ſworne laſte added pope bée ſide ye mountaines ſhall viſite euery yeare hée bée beyond moūtaines euery three yeares one knew practiſe circumſtaū ce factes ye hath béene done would litle ſuſpect additiō truth miſchieuous abhominable treaſon agaynſt prince chaunced emperour el temporall prince neare vnto rome fall variaunce pope dyd ye pope ſtraight runne fraunce ſay ſide mountaines muſt viſite hym yearely bicauſe god diſtreſſe hath conceiued deadly hatered agaynſt prince bring paſſe without helpe counſell wherefore muſt come yearely alſo hée muſt know betraying deuiliſh practiſe prelate prince mynded whether hée bée addicted contrary parte hée bée muſt betraye counſell yearely bicauſe pope ſide mountaines hée bée rome hath prince neckes vnder hys gyrdell ſufficient come euery thyrd yeare cā one commyng deuiſe much treaſon prince ſhall auoyde fiue yeares belongeth vnto biſhop pope ſide byſhoppes ſweare viſite pope yerely moūtaines beyonde ye bée bounde god law yearely viſite pope muſt viſite ſoeuer hée bée though hée either god deuill bée bounde god law preſumption bynde yea ouerſight let ſelfe thus bée bounde wickednes ſo ſtraitely kéepe othe boūde scripture againſt obedience made prince whiche commaunded god word pray example hath either hée bleſſed peter bynde vertue othe apoſtles yearely viſite rome world may perceiue othe inuented inſaciable couetouſnes pope haue toward honour dignity well declared theſe wordes foloweth othe poſſeſſions pope taketh ſure order byſhops owne gayne church ſhal ſell geue lay morgage make feoffement meanes alienate ſame without counſell ye pope pray tell one thing doe ſweare ſhall neither bye yet receiue poſſeſſions church ſhall neither pill poull ſhaue encreaſe poſſeſſions church truth fiſh commeth nette come one within cloukes neuer cōmeth agayne thoughe kyng realme ſhould ſtand neuer ſo great néede receiue lande alwayes ready agaynſt othe ſay thus bicauſe would ye ſhould ſell alienate poſſeſſions churche bicauſe ſée nothyng maintained onely miſcheuous pompe pride owne • ij queſt ij c quatu de reditibus c moseſt law commaundeth fourth part ſpiritual goodes ſhould bée diſtributed among poore men cauſe bée called bona pauperum litle part world teſtifie wherfore doe ſweare alienate goodes without pope licence pope gaue kyng ſubiectes commeth hée bée ſo neare counſell alienating king thruſt whiche hath deſerued beſt bée counſell doe remember law xij queſt ij c non liciat papa doth forbid pope wiſe ſor neceſſitie ſhould alienate goodes church except bée old houſes whiche bée kept without great charge owne law agaynſt ſweare muſt néedes bée periured alienate goodes pope licence decrée agaynſt curſeth wherfore put othe ſeyng alienate goodes conſent yet without foloweth new othe decrées ordinaunces ſentences diſpoſions reſeruations prouiſions commaundementes apoſtolike power obſerue ſhall cauſe men obſerue theſe thing added idole brought ſo highe man durſte wynche agaynſt hym hée might ſaye doe would lawe commaundeth man ſo hardye aſke hym hée doth ſo began decrées ordinance depocytions diſpoſycyons vi tit iiij ca ad apost verbo conti • etur reſeruations prouyſions like ſhamefulnes ſor ſpring remedy muſt contynue becauſe ſworne kéepe ſelfe compel men alſo kéepe kéepinge part othe ſpringeth ſentence foloweth heretykes ſyſmatikes rebelles towardes ſayd lorde ye pope power ſhall perſecute withſtand cauſe hath made clauſe mainteyneth pope pompe glory yt geueth libertie ſay doe hee liſt v poore men ſo great heretykes neuer bée proued euer ſpake agaynſt god king yet bée heretikes forſooth becauſe byſhops ſworne pope decrées condemneth heretikes ſpeaketh againſt holynes though hée bée holy horſe hée ſayth hym ſelfe lawe hée nedeth bée holy hym ſelfe ſufficient hée ſytteth holy ſeat theſe wordes doubteth diſt xl ca non no hée holy ye exalted ſo great dignitie whō though good workes owne merites wantinge yet thoſe good workes ſufficyent done predeceſſours ʋpon gloſa verbo quis texte gloſe ſayth bée openly knowen pope bée aduoulterer murderer yet ought hée bée accuſed c poore men ſuffre ſuch myſcheuous vyces wherefore muſt bée heretikes becauſe lord ye byſhops ſworne perſecute v neuertheles preacher doctrine chriſte muſt nedes bee heretickes ſaid doctrine agaynſt pope ſo preach agaynſt pope therfore heretickes truſt god grace kinges lordes byſhops wyll bée ſo hard poynt othe haue béene becauſe mē may nowe come aunſwere surely bée many clauſes laſt othe added bée cleare iniury vnto prince againſt god lawe man lawe yet byſhops ſwere yea worſt accuſe men treaſon rebelliō mā ſworne treaſon rebellion onely ¶ wherfore moſt gracious prince mekenes lowlynes due ſoe noble prince alſo writer petitiō kynges grace doth béecome true ſubiecte doe lowly méekely require deſire grace iudge betwéene byſhops whiche v treweſt faythfulleſt god grace ſpeake onelye thoſe hath alſo would nowe durſte defende pope lawes agaynſt make ſupplication agaynſt haue declared learning doctrine haue taught wrytten factes déedes haue done agaynſt god grace require ſay vttermoſt proue elles gracious fauour bere preſente offer ſelfe proue thē lyars vnder maner payne grace ſhal aſſigne agaynſt haue declared learnyng doctrine theyr churche alſo brought example factes déedes whiche haue put theyr doctrine exerciſe nowe bée gréeued thinke thē ſelues wrongfully handled mée require grace indifferētly graciouſly thing doubt grace doth knowe heauēly father doth require preſerue highnes honor dignite amen cauſe condemnation moſte gracious prince ye grace ſhoulde knowe cauſe hereſye byſhops agaynſt ye ſo vncharitablye ſo cruelly hath caſt away therefore haue ſet ye article ye layde agaynſt layd agaynſt bée reported owne actes bookes article doubtles vncharitably falſly gathered agaynſt ſermon ye made cābridge edwardes churrh 〈◊〉 1525 die 14 de •… bris wherfore beſéech grace méekenes lowlynes bée gracious lord prince ſuffer thus ſhamefully cruelly agaynſt law conſcience vtterly bée vndone caſt away moſt highe goodnes ſuffer come mine aunſwere iuſtifie cauſe gracious commaundement bée puniſhed right conſcience thou beléeue thou art firſt article boūd ſerue god morow chriſtmas day eaſter day whitſonday holynes one day art thou faythfull chriſtean man ſuperſticious paule galat 5 againſt thée ſaying doe obſerue dayes yeares monthes tydes vnto faythfull chriſtean man euery day ought bée chriſtmas day eaſter day whitſonday holy dayes ordeined thinge father conſidering thou diddeſt obſerue yea thou wouldeſt neuer obſerue lefte thy iudgmēt becauſe thou art geuen ſo much worldly buſineſſes cauſe haue aſſigned thee certaine dayes come certayn dayes come ye church pray togither heare worde god togither receaue bleſſed ſacramēt togither faulte fynde article becauſe one day ſelfe higher better ſay one daye holyer pray ye cauſe nature one day wherby ſhould bée holyer becauſe ſay halowe remembraunce chriſtes birthe chriſtes reſurrection one day thing ſay muſt doe euery daye chriſte euery day borne euery day ryſen euery day aſcended vp muſt beléeue euery day ſtedfaſtly muſt ſanctifie harte dayly one day ¶ vary thing ſay bound ſanctifie one chriſtmas day yeare ſuperſticiouſnes hereſy ſay condemne one day ſet one daye onely bound euery daye briefely lord rocheſter alowed article ſaying would byſhop rocheſters great deepe iudgement condemne hereſy c li great ſūme money foliſhely ſayde quod hée preach afore butcher cambryge ſay butcher ſermon ye moſt parte ye vniuerſity byſhop bathe aſked whether mighte labour holy dayes ſéeing written thou ſhalt obſerue thy holy day let v playe iewes aunſwered chriſten men bounde abſtayne bodely labour commaundement ſo geuen iewes bound abſtayne bodely labour commaundement kinges grace councell lorde cardinall wold doe againſt god cōmaundement counſell waye damnation cauſe men carye ſtuffe holy day daye ſo euer bée whan remoue reaſon lordes aſtonied wiſt ſay loth cōdemne lord cardinal grace ſeing ſo holy prelate chriſtes church facte coulde deneye wherfore ye laſt lorde rocheſter remembred hym ſelfe obiected byſhop rocheſter agaynſt byſhop wincheſter maner goodly reaſon make like reaſon byſhop wincheſter ſuffered ye ſtues ergo ſtues bée lawfull reaſon ineruayled much perceyued lawfull noble prince carye ſtuffe holy day agaynſt ye word god harlot ye ſtnes liue open whordome againſt worde god yet lord byſhops greate charitie innumerable ſpirituall treaſure ſuffereth agaynſt conſcience bée done briefely longe recite vncharitable maner dyd vſe yet earneſtly muſt bée condemned poore man heretyke recyte ſaying doctours ye men may ſée ſhamefully haue erred saynt gallat 4 hierome ſayth therfore bée certine dayes aſſigned ſhould come togither daye whiche come togither holyer dayes bée like dayes bee alyke equall chriſt alonely crucified paraſceden riſen onlye ſonday day reſurrection alwayes alwayes may eate lordes fleſhe c hierome ſayth ye ſelfe word ye ſpake theſe wordes moued ſpeake god doth knowe alſo auguſtine ſayth muſt obſerue ſabboth day ye epist c xix ſhould recken ſelfe labour thinge doe worke well muſte haue intention euerlaſting reſt wherfore muſt obſerue holy day corporall idlenes vnto letter ſpiritually muſt reſt vyces concupiſences wherfore among ten commaundementes ſabboth daye alonely commaunded bée figuratiuely obſerued c alſo tertullyan carnall aduerſus iudeos circumciſion put away extincted time likewiſe obſeruation ſabboth day declared bée tyme muſt kéepe ye ſabboth day alonely ſeuenth day tymes eſay ſayth c lorde rocheſter ſayde fyrſte vnderſtode tertulian ſecōdarily hée heretike paſſe ouer myne aūſwere lordly worde hée could none otherwiſe ſaue honour yet ſtādeth ſcripture faſt hierome auguſtine alſo owne law whoſe wordes theſe come vnto certaine men bée euill conſec diſt iij cap peruenit ſpirite haue ſowen certaine euill thinges among contrary holy faith ſo doe forbid men ſhould worke sabboth day whiche men thyng ſhall call preacher antichriſt antichriſt ſhall make sabboth day sonday bée kept maner worke c law clearely declareth bée antichriſtes ſayd haue great marueile byſhop bathe beyng ſo mighty lord condemning heretickes learned law ſeyng owne facultie dare mā preach ye truth ſecond article goſpell god eſpeciall bée féeble fearefull truſt yea pray god may ſhortly come falſe manifeſt errours may bée plainely ſhewed bée certaine men like conditioned dogges bee man theyr countryman loue know ſay thing agaynſt cry hereticke hereticke ad ignem ad ignem theſe bée dogges feare true preacher hereſie finde article doe thinke doe féele prayer bée heards doubtles bée many ſhamefull errours manifeſtly opened thoſe dayes béene hereſie haue touched wee make nowe dayes many thyrd article martyr truſt wée ſhall haue many moe ſhortly viritie coulde neuer bée preached playnely perſecution follow lord bathe inquire mée reckoned martyr burnte bruſelles anſwered knewe cauſe wherefore died reckoned many men bée martyr perſecuted dyed worde god hée ſaide hée woulde make mée frye thinke holy prelate charitable argument refell myne aunſwere ſtrongeſt argument euer vſed paraduenture may ſée day argument may bée made againſt theſe lawes theſe lawyer theſe iiij article iuſticiares ſay man may lawfully aſke owne good afore god forgeue layd iudge contende iudgement haue deſtroyed patience deuotion faith chriſten people article hangeth alſo ye nexte pleading iudgement fifth article manifeſtly againſt goſpell luk 12 homo quis conſtituit iudicē contrary paule iam omnino delictum eſt c myne aduerſaries moſt vncharitably layde theſe two article againſt mée though condempned lawemaker lawe execution thereof whan onely ſpake agaynſt lawfull chriſten man demaunde debt order law lawfull vexe ſue vncharitably thoſe whō ſuch neceſſitie make payment rather ſhall periſh dye priſon whiche thyng agaynſt charitie therfore ſinfull vnchariblenes ſome mē rather ſéeke vengeaunce brother right helpe lawe ſpeake againſt lawyer againſt pleading iuſtly forme lawe onely againſt thoſe taught men bounde proſicute vttermoſt lawe vnder paine deadly ſinne man neuer ſo poore vnlike pay debte againſt theſe two perſons ſpake againſt none neuer mine intent forbid ſuing lawe doe know well maieſtratus god ergo muſt néedes followe lawes hauing probable reaſons nature made conſerue common wealth muſt alſo bée allowed god lawes bée parte power inſtituted god moreouer paule doth appeale emperour alſo par litis hée coulde doe ſuing ſimpliciter forbidden alſo good lawes bée god gift wherfore muſt néedes followe wée may lawfully vſe men may miſuſe cunning beautie ſo may mē alſo miſuſe excellent gift lawes lawes bée euill becauſe wée vſe intent ordayned man doubteth vſing god creature muſt bée epykya meane meaſure order ſo man may therby deſtroy neighbour againſt order charitie guide ruler vſing creature men make rumour whole countrey trifle el mā ſue neighbour able meanes paye hys debte ſo vtterly vndoe hym take none ende extremitie lawe ſay maner ſutes doe become chriſten men vbi tranſgreditur equitatis et charitatis limites men may clearely perceiue theſe onely word intent ſhall rehearſe occaſion moued mée ſpeake lawyer ſueters cauſe thys poore man dead made poore man executour bequethed churche cambridge kettell worth ij iiij kettel extreme law extreme iuſtice afterwarde required churche warden executour beyng poore man able geue bequeſt tyme therefore hée deſired church warden longer reſpite hée could heard church warden would haue vttermoſt law ſued fore commiſſary laſt condemned vnto priſon hée lay neither able pay dette helpe wife child bicauſe might doe ſomthing ye church warden therefore poore man wife came wéeping waylyng deſiring way charitie ſpeake church wardē bée good poore huſband wherby moued ſend frend name called ihon drake mā well knowē cambridge vnto ſpake maner countreyman ſory heare vncharitable demeanour hath béene wt mee poore woman wéepyng waylyng cry howe haue vndone poore huſband miſerable child haue one bitte bread towardes foode neither ſhée able labour wherefore marueile ſore wil bée ſo extreme vnto poore men god viſited pouertie proue charity mercy haue chriſtes hand whiche ſo extreme vnto poore neighbour hée hath bought precious bloud ʋnto hée made aunſwere maner thyng pertained hym vnto church wherfore euill counſell doctours law hée ſayd doctours law ſay muſt ſue therefore vnder payne deadly ſinne wrong learne ſo many wordes hym betwéene concernyng maner next day preached reaſon ſelfe ſame mā ſtoode afore ye church brought remembraunce caſe hée commoned bicauſe clearely cōuerted hym therfore recited caſe parable man knew meant hée thyng moued god knoweth ſpeake ſuters whiche thinke caſe chriſten man alow therefore ſay myne article theſe lawyer vtterly ſinne among ſayth paule 1 cor 6 bicauſe goe law one rather ſuffer wrōg rather ſuffer ye ſelues bée robbed alſo maſter ſayth man ſue lawe math 5 take thy coate thée let haue thy cloke alſo may ſay theſe wordes wherfore written doe condemne ſuing caſe holy ghoſt ſhould bée learned maſter chriſt paule ſpeaketh agaynſt ſuters man denye text ſo cleare ſuyng bée vnlawfull bée vnlawfull againſt ſpeake poore man wife child deſtroyed charitable wayes taken poore man whereby hée might make reſtitution learning ſaith summum ius ſumma iniuria est wherefore bée iudged chriſten men ought caſe géeue frende counſell ſue whether bée worthy bée condemned ſpiritualtie forbiddeth prieſtes ſue cauſa ſanguinis et tamen non dāpnāt leges athanaſius hereticke becauſe counſell frende brother rather ſuffer wrong vndoe whole houſholde naughtie leude kettel let v ſée holy doctours hath written ouer theſe place ſcripture doth erpounde firſt athanaſius text saint paule bryng vtterly ſinne among ſay condemnation ignomynie doe exerciſe iudicials among wherefore doe rather ſuffer wrong alſo ſaint hierome ſinne vnto hiere ad cor 6 doe againſt cōmaū demēt chriſt haue iudgementes among ought alwayes kéepe peace yea though loſſe temporall good wherefore doe rather ſuffer wronge ye ought commaundement theſe doctours wyll deſtroy iudicialles onely vncharitable ſutes goſpell example lorde patiently ſuffer doe contrary onely ſuffer doe wrong vnto doe wronge c marke hierome calleth precepte commaundement counſell alſo calleth ſinne doe againſt cōmaundement likewiſe haymo ſaith offence ſinne haymo ad cor 6 haue iudicials accuſation engendreth ſtrife ſtrife engendreth diſcorde diſcorde engendreth hatred leaſt paraduenture woulde ſay ſinne require mine owne therefore ſayth apoſtle truely ſinne vnto doe againſt cōmaundement luke 6 lord ſayth taketh away thy good aſke againe wherefore doe rather ſuffer loſſe ye might fulfill commaundement lord c marke hée calleth commaundement god ſinne aſke owne contention haue ſayde mine article holy ſcripture alſo holy doctours ſay came doctour bee counſell ye condemne hereſie lawe knew ſayde lawe condemned thys epiniō declared thoſe ſcriptures bée counſels denyed ſayd knew ſuch lawe ſodainely doctour steuen byſhop wincheſter ſhewed mée lawe whoſe wordes bée theſe illud euangelij ſi quis abstulerit c 14 queſt 1 ita non eſt precipientis ſed exhortantis let euery chriſten man iudge whether theſe wordes theyr lawe bée ſufficient auctoritie refell holy wordes scripture came doctour wolmā hée brought texte thy brother doe offende thée tell church ſayd hée tell church aunſwered place made purpoſe aleaging saint auguſtine mée ſpeaketh crymes ſhould bée reprooued congregation correction temporall ſworde alſo foloweth hée heare ye church coūte hym heathē publican vttermoſt payne chriſt aſſigneth ye payne temporall lawe aunſwere hée ſore moued ſayd abide ſhould burnt ſharp ſentence ſo greate man hée apppelles ioly wyſe felowe ſayd vnderſtoode myne anſwere ſo well contēt mee ſhomaker ne ſutor vltra crepidam neuertheles let hym burne many yet playne haue ſpoken neuer worde holy ſcripture holy doctours ſay ſame ſentence wordes wherefore ſée condemne article hereſye yea dare ſaye recken none hereſy condēne mée article wyll neuer beléeue yet neuer beléeue one man may ſixte article lawe god byſhop 2 3 cyties yea whole coūtrey contrarye paule ſayth haue left thée behynde ſet tit 1 euery citye byſhop finde one place ſcripture ye bée called epiſcopi ſhal finde diuers place bée called perſoiteri ¶ brought afore lorde cardinall galary cardinall doctour barnes reaſoned togither hée reade myne article tyll hée came hée ſtopped ſayde touched hym therefore hée aſked thought wronge one byſhop ſhoulde haue ſo many cityes vnderneath hym vnto anſwered could therefore heretick farther goe paules texte ſet euery cytye byſhop aſked hée mée thought vnright ſéeing ordinaunce church one byſhop ſhould haue ſo many city aunſwered ye knew none ordinaunce ye church concerning thinge paules ſayinge onelye neuertheles ſée contrary cuſtome practiſe world know originall thereof ſayde hée ye ſigmētū apoſtles tyme dyuers city ſome 7 myle ſome vj myle long ouer ſet one byſhop ſubbards alſo likewiſe byſhop hath one citye cathedrall churche country ſubbards vnto thought farre fetched durſt denye becauſe ſo greate auctorite ſo holy father ſo greate fayned ſut •… thynge 〈◊〉 ſhoulde bee heretick deuine dare ſay holynes could neuer proue ſcripture yet auctorite doctours yet practiſe apoſtles yet muſt bée true becauſe piller church hath ſpoken let v ſée ye doctours ſay myne article athanaſius doth athanaſius declare text apoſtle haue left thée behinde c hée woulde commit vnto one bythop whole ylde hée inioyne euery cytye ſhoulde haue proper paſtor ſuppoſing ye meanes ſhoulde diligently ouer ſée people alſo ye labour ſhould bée eaſye beare c alſo chriſoſtome chriſoſtome ſame texte hée would ye whole countrey ſhoulde bée permitted vnto one man hée enioyned vnto euery mā cure ye meanes hée knew labour ſhoulde bée eayſye ſubiectes ſhould bée diligēce gouerned teacher diſtract ye gouerning many church cure charge one church onely c mée thinketh theſe bée plaine wordes able moue man ſpeak aſmuche graunte may haue theſe city yet make none hereſy lord cardinall graunted agaynſt hym againſt bée god poore man muſt bée heretike remedy haue ſo able ſay nay ſcripture yet god hymſelfe bée proued ſcripture vij article man churche ſhoulde haue ſo greate temporall poſſeſſions ſay ſo great poſſeſſions could kepe ſo many ſeruantes ſo many dogges ſo many horſes 40 50 maintayne ſo great pompe pride liue ſo deliciouſly hereſye fynde hereſye ſpeake againſt horſes houndes abhominable lyuing doubtles ſay myght haue poſſeſſions onely ſpake againſt ſuperfluouſnes abuſe ye world wondereth miſchiefe worlde vſed ye clerely openly knowen doe abuſe goodes church yet muſt bée cō demned heretyke ſpeaking againſt ala doe thinke god ſuffer violence doe vſe agaynſt poore men ſtād ye daunger proue godly maieſty ſhall iudge matter béetwéene mée dare truſt hym sure viij article law god haue iuriſdiction ſeculer yet chalēge power haue doe put vſe muſt ſay iewes ſayde may kill man article dyd byte bée content office byſhop bée alſo kynges howe ſtandeth god lawe othe haue declared noble prince doubt hée put tryall haue many yeres condemned officicers bee byſhops hangman god amende many poore man deliuered hym temporall power put death knew nothing cauſe hée would ye yée ſhoulde put hym death ſelfe anſwered yée might kyll man yt alwayes hangman ſay bée ſucceſſours ix article chriſt apoſtles ſée folow none iudas beare purſe haue money ſo great poſſeſſions ſure c would ſpeake agaynſt dare one loſſe promotion article ouercome witnes world may well condemne hereſie true pater noſter iudas ſolde •… ter ſell often hée commeth handes would yée coulde proue mée lyer folowed apoſtles ſauing iudas onely yea woulde yée certayne pointes good iudas béene better medled againſt mée theſe matter compelled ſpeake many thinges would ſhame worlde neuer haue ſpoken haue ſo take make beſt greateſt phariſie x article church ſure pricke theſe wordes hée knoweth bée true though hée ſay contrary doe well know article ſpeake becauſe doctour rydle tyme graunted maiſter doctour butte houſe byſhoppes cleane order therefore ſay know theſe ordynary byſhops prelate xj article doe followe falſe prophet balaam woulde curſe people prouiſion god compelled bleſſe ſay teach liue well though thēſelues liue moſt miſcheuouſly ſo aſſes ride vpō common people haue liues abhominaiton haynous hereſie ſpeaketh againſt holy father bée almoſt holy balaams aſſe ſpeake worde god good purpoſe ſo doe neuer graunt offende caulling ordinary byſhops ſhoulde haue called inordinate butcher compared balaam owne lawe 2 queſt 7 secuti ſunt cap no ſi 2 q 7 secuti ſunt cap no ſi liuing worlde knoweth coulde tell many holy pointes byſhops liuinge kéeping men wiues daughter ſhoulde bée reckened vncharitable may doe breaking holy charitie ſet vp idoll deceaue ye xij article people withall whiche called baall peor baall phegor interpretated gaſping lawes conſtitutions gaſpe gape maintayne theyr worldly honour cauſe v ſacrifice fayre woman carnall affection ſwéete wordes ſo god iſraell forgotten thus ſwéete wordes benediction deceiue ſimple theſe bée ye falſe maiſters saint peter ſpeaketh theſe 2 pet 2 bée fountaines without water geue good doctrine people hereſie becauſe cōpare lawes baall looke whether interpretation worde doe agrée wyth nature lawes doe lawes miniſh auctoritie prince lordes exalte onely call gaſping idoll let article ſtand till able proue hereſie ſell v ſell people ſell holy order ſell xiij article church halowing better marchandiſe chepeſide wilte thou knowe price church halowing leſſe xl ſhillinges ſell pardon remiſſiōs ſinnes opēly cow oxe ſolde neuer graunt without money suffragan ely aſke maiſter iohn purgolde xl offring halowing edwardes cā brige yea hée woulde doe ſo good chepe quoth hée becauſe goddaughter buryed churchyarde may bée proued example ynough bryng yée forth one church englande haue halowed without money without hope money graunt concluſion falſe pardon worlde knoweth handlyng pope pardon hath beene beſt marchaundiſe england dare ſay beſt marchaundiſe worlde handle maruaylous blindnes great preſumption ſo cruelly handle mée theſe article middell haue puniſhed mée ſpeaking agaynſte muſt néedes hereticke dare ſay one among ſo ſhameles ye dare come forth day proue theſe article hereſie agaynſt mee doubtles long liue reſtored name fame againe haue violently taken away mée bée vnto deuill peſtilence require nothing good name fame haue right ought charitie reſtore mée though neuer required thinke haue puniſhed mée inough ſpeaking fooliſhe worde twayne againſt wilte thou know benediction xiiij article worth rather géeue thée benediction one halfepeny ſore hereſie ryde thorowe ſtréetes townes bleſſing man ſtone neuer géeue halfepenye man childe nowe come pardon wherby xv article ſay haue power ſende hundreth ſoules heauen may ſo doe without reſpect may likewiſe
