ſende 100 hell foloweth text quodcunque ligaueris ſo euer thou byndeſt ſore hereſye ſay may rule matter iudgment marueylous texte quodcunque ligaueris bindeth hell loſeth heauen openeth men purſes cofers earth depoſeth prince interditeth landes looſeth man coote yea often tymes loſeth man wife yea horſe carte done texte quodcunque ligaueris merueilous text hath ſo greate power know ſuch bible abhominable heare howe xvj article preach teach may abſolue poena culpa ſure impoſſible vnderſtand make looke owne ſcholaſticall doctours learneth boldlye keyes church hath none auctorite ouer ſinne yet ouer eternall payne onely hath auctorite chaunge euerlaſting payne vnto temporall payne pope may chaūge take away pleaſure amōg temporall paynes reken purgatory ye greatteſt ouer yt pope hath full power owne doctrine looke alexander de hale alexander dun bonauenture iiij ſent dun bonauenture 4 booke ſentences condemne mée muſt fyriſt condemne owne doctrine cauſe forbid v ſhoulde diſcuſſe xvij article greate power becauſe would make mē fooles holde v ignoraunce owne ſcholemen ſay pope power ſo greate man may diſcuſſe alſo lawe cō maundeth mā bée ſo hardy pope may bee conptrolled man aſke ye pope lord doe ſo put caſe lye yet farre hereſie yet lordes ſay ſhall bée heretyke ſay becauſe haue ſo ſay yea thou béeſt ſo content yu ſhalt bée burnt mary thank hartely lord pro bona veſtra informacione haue lawe moſte abhominable contrarye god lawe xviij article charitie excommunicate people 4 tymes yeare ſay thoſe men raiſe rent houſe muſt vnderſtand béelong church béelong vnto ye church thou maiſt raiſe euery moneth ons man ſhall curſe thée alſo curſe bée buried pariſhe church ye muſt bée vnderſtāded bée rich men bée poore may bée buried amōg frier byſhop bath ſayd ther ſuch maner curſe men ye world knoweth contrary ouer red theſe article booke generall curſe belongeth ſaynt benet church cambrige marke myne owne hand yet byſhop aſhamed denye becauſe muſte bée heretyke remedye holy father hath ſo determined haue myters glyſtering xix article precious ſtones haue gloues catching colde ye middeſt ceremony haue rynges ouches ceremony ſo many ye manner nothing el church iewyſhe maners wyll make hereſy becauſe ſpeake againſt dānable pompous myters thinke ſuch ornamentes bée condemned euen among heathen men ſay among chriſtean men man may ſpeake agaynſt pompe prelate dare ſay neuer god among heathen men euer delighted ſuch ornamentes yet ſerue god heauen thē poore brother chriſt hath redéemed precious bloud dyeth priſon openly ſtreate hangeth ſelfe neceſſitie yet wil beſtow hym ſo much one precious ſtones tell one byſhop euer brake myter helping poore man neuer man neceſſitye england ye world may ſée bée theſe thinges bée ſenſible inough theſe myters tell xx article whence come except take iewes byſhops take ye iewes let alſo take theyr ſacrifices oblation offer calues lambes dyd haue nothing doe wee bée chriſten men iewes pray tell mée byſhops myters cō meth iewes yée finde one pricke holy ſcripture myters mayſter inſtitute byſhops paule ſetteth office alſo ornamēt yet ſpeaketh neuer worde myters dare boldelye ſay ye bée put ye tryall ſhall bée fayne rūne olde lawe bée heretyke condemned clearely myters ſayde deuyll proue bée chriſtes inſtitution heretyke inough praye let mée ſo long bée taken chriſtean man bée cō tent truely doe yée wronge theſe myters 2 horne cā xxi article tell ſhould ſignifye except horne falſe prophet whome ſpoken 3 king theſe horne ſhalt yu blowe afore thée syria ſo dyd hée mocke ringes ornamentes eccleſiaſticall ceremonyes wil com byſhops vſe vayne fooliſh ceremony ſaying bée byſhops olde lawe haue nothing defende rynges ornamentes ceremony tyranny wherefore mayntaine theſe depoſe kynges prince interdite landes burne man wyfe chylde haue done haue defended deuelyſh token prid doctours wolde fauour proude token expound beſt haue declared two horne myters dyd ſygnify new olde teſtament ſhould learned ſaw expoſition agrée thyng man bée leſſe learned thē bée ſpeake great many wherefore thought vaine expoſition therfore compared two horne myter meaneth two horne falſe prophet bicauſe know falſe prophet ſayde vnto kyng hée ſhoulde theſe two horne blow afore syria yet hée lyed kyng firſt mā ſlayne likewiſe ſay vnto kynges folowe coūſell mayntaine authoritie bée ruled thē ſhal ouercome enemy ſinne death hell yet saluo ordine veſtro lye haue word god wherefore muſt falſe prophetes haue cōpared ſimilitude myters two horne falſe prophetes bée falſe proue yet make none hereticke muſt make thoſe men heretickes haue compared forkes myters new old teſtamentes true apoſtles haue made greater lye haue done neuer able proue proue ſaying true ye ſtād scripture el wil taken hereticke haue baculum paſtoralem xxij article take ſhéepe like ſhepheardes hooke intricate manifold crooked turneth alwayes ſo may bee called maſe hath neither begynnyng endyng like knocke ſwine woules head take ſhéepe haue alſo pyllers pollaxes ceremony whiche doubt bée tryfles thynges naught pray cauſe call ſtaffe ſhepheardes ſtaffe helpe man comfort man lift vp man haue ſtriken downe kynges kyngdomes knocked head duke earles call ſhepheardes ſtaffe ſpace ſhepheardes meanyng byſhops croſier ſtaffe ſtaffe foote come agayne ſtaffe turneth wyndeth alwayes inward neuer outward ſignifying ſoeuer hée bée cōmeth within daū ger hée ſhall neuer come agayne expoſition déedes doe declare let thē bée examined haue doe let v ſée haue eſcaped ſhepheardes hooke theſe bée article whiche muſt néedes bée hereticke neuertheles world may ſée ſhamefully haue erred agaynſt holyneſſes ſaying truth lord cardinal reaſoned article hée paſſed ouer ſauyng ſixte article hée aſke thought good reaſonable hée ſhould lay downe pyllers pollaxes coyne hereſie ſo abhominable made aunſwere cardinall wolſey lyked well hys pyllers pollaxes thought well done ſayd hée thinke better honour dignitie coyne pyllers pollaxes geue money v vj beggers mayntaine common wealth doe doe recken quoth hée common wealth better fiue ſixe beggers aunſwere reckened honour god ſalnation ſoule alſo comfort poore brother coyned giuē almes common wealth dyd hange grace knew common wealth afore bee grace muſt bée whē grace gone pyllers pollaxes came ſhould alſo goe away notwithſtandyng common wealth ſuch condition néede might grace ſo lōg vſe thyng ſtede ſo longe common wealth néeded notwithſtandyng ſayd thus much ſay sermon agaynſt onely damned sermon gorgious pompe pride exteriour ornament ſayd well ſay well well ſayd ſure theſe wordes made hereticke theſe wordes béene therein myne aduerſaryes durſt neuer haue ſhewed face againſt knew wel could neuer bée indifferently heard got victory thē muſt byſhops lord cardinall haue layd downe gorgious ornamentes rather burne xx ſuch heretickes ye world knoweth god mighty hath hée ſhewed power dare ſay neuer intented thing liues thē deſtroy yet god mercy hath ſaued agaynſt violence vnto godly wiſedome cauſe onely knowen byſhop london tunſtall byſhop londō intelligence barnes become called tunſtall departyng priſon ſayd vnto ſubſtā ciall man dead dare ſay conſcience recken ſuch hereticke would haue killed ſelfe voice wēt yet would hée haue done gladly charitie ſayd hée amſterdame neuer béene life god knoweth yet countrey x yeares certaine men ſpeake ſayd hée hée fained certaine wordes ſhould ſay added thereunto lorde cardinall would haue agayne ſhould coſt great ſumme money howe much doe clearely remember haue marueile lorde aſhamed thus ſhamefully thus lordly lye though hée might doe authoritie lord cardinall hée would ſpende ſo much money haue mée againe haue great maruaile make ſaye mée ſimple poore wreatch worth man money worlde ſauing tenth peny geue mée burne mée deſtroy mée ſo greatly profite whē dead sunne moone ſtarres element water fire yea alſo ſtones ſhall defende cauſe agaynſt rather veritie ſhould periſhe bée ſo charitable doe good good counſayle geuen byſhops workes ſpende money ſo well haue priſoners poore men inough land let beſtowe money mée doe promiſe preſent writing faith owe chriſt ieſus fidelitie owe prince bée bounde noble prince maner hys lawe good conſcience right ſhall doe mée violence wronge diſc •… ſſe diſpute theſe article haue written holy worde god chriſtes holy ſcripture mée ſoone may know preſent ſelf vnto moſt noble prince offring ſelfe grace either proue theſe thinges god worde againſt el ſuffer grace pleaſure father heauē preſerue honour amen refuſe condition ſay neyther good charitable dare ſay deſire chriſten man prieſtes doe mumble rore dyriges maſſes xxiij article church churchyardes theyr founder curious ſpeake theyr wordes diſtinctly enſure prayer ſhall doe good onely acceptatio diuina article byſhops make much perceiued gathered without ſētence ſaying men ſhould make prayer ſuch fayth ſuch deuotion god might accept ſo idlely without deuotion bable ſay dyriges alonely vondage cuſtome deuotion brought laying apoſtle mée ſayth let peticions prayer appeare god alſo hée aſketh let phil 4 iaco 1 aſke faith nothing doubting prayer acceptable xxiiij article god except bée fetched fyre aulter article alſo gathered without ſentence aduerſaries greatly care made ſuch article pertayned learning edifiing therefore neuer erred ſo much thoſe article agaynſt byſhops great diligence part gathered true ſentences myne owne wordes though thoſe thinges left vncharitably thoſe wordes made declaration alſo probation ſaying haue alſo lefte article euill layd myne aduerſaryes onely adding article thye laid againſt mée men may ſée yt worſt againſt mée men may thinke wil neither lay beſt yet truth agaynſt mée article dyd thus preach men ſhould peticiō prayer put good workes good déedes merites lord doe faſte doe pray theife charitie world defire god bée mercifull vnto ſhoulde deſire father heauen bée mercifull vnto alonely chriſtes merites ye thing wherby wée prayer accepted ſight father iohn 14 prooue brought certayne scripture whatſoeuer yée ſhall aſke father name hée ſhall geue alſo figure ye old law ſacrifice done ye fire taken aulter ſay chriſt aulter thys myne aduerſaries vnderſtoode maruayle article doth amonge hereticall article thinke doe recken hereſie hee praye thrée eſtates xxv article holy churche neyther made hée prayer ye beginning ſermon according olde cuſtome laſt ende true knowledge chriſten men making prayer lady ſoules gurgatory grace expedient byſhops indifferency charitie woulde haue béene aſhamed ſuch article ſhoulde haue béene brought afore thē purpoſe hereſie pray thrée eſtates holy church yet graunt prayde true chriſtē mē men might come true knowledge church contayned bée vncharitable men without cōſideration bée ſo blinded worldly honour pray ladye ſoules purgatory hereſy apoſtles heretykes pray ſermons liberty holye churche may wiſe bee impugned lady yet ye ſoules purgatorye praying grace expedient preacher bound doe openly mée thinketh theſe article god gaue mée greate grace durſt ſo boldelye reproue abhominable liuing fearing daunger ſhould come thereof leue men iudgement dare boldelye ſay ye ſpoken tentymes aſmuch againſt ye auctorite noble prince agaynſt noble duke lordes taken power ſpirituall temporall geuen idle byſhops béene faythfull chriſten man defended ye liberty holy church god ſend grace ſpace conuert amen whole diſputation betweene byſhops doctour barnes moſt honorable gracious prince haue ſhewed grace article myne aduerſaries vncharitablie hath layd agaynſt whiche though greate many wordes ſayinges yet neuertheleſſe left thoſe thing make declaration probation wordes alſo mollifying temperatyng thoſe thinges ſéemed bée ſomewhat hardly ſpokē agaynſt byſhops whiche thinges longe recite vnto noble grace god iudge alſo conſcience wordes déedes maner liuyng conuerſation neuer intende ſpeake agaynſt byſhops el man liuing conuerſation agaynſt bleſſed word god holy doctrine chriſtes churche truth great clerke church auncient learned father cry vpō pryde lewde lyuyng byſhops god cccc yeares wrote thyng hée complained vehemently agaynſt liuing ſpiritualtie let bookes bée brought foorth proue whether ſaying truth ala pituous caſe yea alſo agaynſt law conſcience poore man ſhalbée thus violently caſt away ſpeaking agaynſt theſe vice béene damned almightie god hys holy creature yea byſhops ſelues worlde muſt graunt doe liue euill yea rather worſe ſpeake oh lord god loue vertue ſhamefaſtnes chriſten men ought haue iuſtice ſhalbée thus ſhamefully caſt awaye ſpeakyng thynge euery chriſten man bounde ſpeake doe ſo lyue beyng preacher verity muſt bée condemned ſpeakyng agaynſt moſt gracious mightie prince god hath ſet grace ſame honour dignitie god ordinaunce ought defende thoſe men oppreſſed wrongfully wherefore humbly méekely lowlynes reuerence beſéech grace miniſter vnto gracious iuſtice let bée heard indifferently whether iuſtifie cauſe learnyng iuſtifie grace miniſter iuſtice earneſt petition made doctour barnes refuſe maner payne ſhal bée due trāſgreſſiō wherfore one agayne méekenes lowlynes way charitie chriſtes name ſwéete bloud ſake hée hath ſhed grace yea alſo ye vertue auctoritie heauē ly god hath deliuered doe require deſire grace audience iuſtice parētes bée naturall ſubiectes borne great many v hath dyed grace quarell yet none v ready doe grace ſeruice bodyes bloud ſhall become trewe ſubiectes doe noble prince wherfore thyrdely name name al rebuked méekenes reuerence béeſeche grace gracious audience fauorable iuſtice thing truſt grace denye yet take diſpleaſure poore ſubiect thus requiring haue none prince lorde ſéeke vnto earth vnto grace onelye come charitable ende myne aduerſaries wherefore compelled extreme violence thus complayne vnto grace name fame eſtemacion thinges belong honeſt poore man world takē wrōgfully mée hereby haue bene ye ſpace 9 10 yeres ſmale tyme compelled liue miſery obloquy wherfore moſt gracious prince lamentably cry call vnto grace gracious audience indifferent iuſtice long proceſſe troble grace tell vncharitable hand lyng cardynall byſhops apoynted hym dyd vſe mée wil make vnto grace ſhort ſomme neare call remembraunce yeare lorde 1525 yt 24 day december dyd make 1525 ſermon requeſt pariſh edwardes church cambrige ſermon dyd myne aduerſaries gather theſe article knew offered ſelfe preach agayne ſonday folowing declare ſelfe meanyng clearely doctour rydley doctour preſton chaplens kynſmen yt byſhop london foūd meanes yt ʋicechaūcelour doct batnes inhibited preachyng inhibet preach could neuer know reaſonable cauſe alonely hée ſayde ſhoulde bée profyt holde peace ſo content tyll laſt theſe foreſayd doctours one maſter tyrell gathered writyng certayne article preſented vicechauncelour ſent mée aſked mée ſayd thoſe article aunſwered none myne certayne wordes ſentences ſpokē left yt ſhould make declaratiō wherefore ſayd none myne would bée reported audience hée ſayde ſhould take hede denied brouht wytnes agaynſt thē muſt nedes dye aunſwered witnes ſhoulde bée falſe neuer ſpake ſayde hée could proue negatiue aunſwered woulde proue yt witnes falſe ſo euer hée hée ſayd whether popiſh law tyrannous true falſe muſt ſuffer witnes come agaynſt mée lawe ſayd yt piteous caſe lawe might condemne chriſt hée ſayd yt ſhoulde remember mée matter ſo daungerous ſo haynous lawe might haue counſell aunſwered ſayd well let god helpe knoweth thing vniuerſite ſcholes doores ſhut faſt man wt parte alone aduerſaries parte doctour rydly doctour watſon doctour preſton doctour law whoſe name haue forgotten alſo one maſter fooke mayſter tyrel appoynted amonge bée preſenter theſe article nowe ʋicechauncelour hée coulde haue mée cō munication béetwéene v bée aſked mée would doe anſwered hée ſhould goe way ſet hym downe heare complaint would make ſuch aunſwere god ſhould put mynde hée required mée inſtantly caſt ſelfe away hée went ſet hym downe called ſoone came ſtoode forth tyrell preſented roule certayne article hée doctour barnes accuſed contention ſedition hereſie ſayd gathered ſermon yt ſome ſayde hée contentious ſome ſedicious ſome ſklaunderous ſome hereticall hée thus ſpoken ſayd hym good tyrell wyll preſent theſe article hereſye word ſpake yt vicechauncelour mée good mayſter doctour let paſſe wyll bée content ſubmyt ſelfe ſayd ſo euer haue ſpoken againſt god word againſt expoſition holy doctours bée content bée reformed ſubmyt ſelfe doctour rydlye doctour watſon content except ſhould adde vnto offended lawes church ſtopped ſayde large knewe ment lawes church doctour lawe wherefore iudged ſufficient mée bée reported god worde expoſicion holy doctours facultie thē ʋicechauncellour rekened ſufficiēt mée could agree great ſpace thing wherefore ſayd woulde agrée maner lawes yt gaynſt god worde aguſtine hierome yet againſt none foure doctours reſt yt day poynt handeled tyme whole body yt vniuerſitie gathered togither knocked ſchoole doores ſaid would heare examination ſéeing matter manifeſt theſe perſōs ſhould take auctorite onely determine ſuch cauſes ʋicechauncelour ſent bedell doore requiring bée content moued knocked ſorer roſe ʋicechauncelour went hym ſelfe dore gaue good faire word hée coulde concluſion woulde departe except might heare matter iudged ſayd apertained learning body vniuerſitie yt ʋicechauncelour came backe agayne vnto bodye ʋniuerſitie ſtirred vp v ſayde wée muſt geue ouer matter vniuerſitie rumour ſo departed wée ſunder thē within two thrée dayes cauled clare hall yt ʋicechauncelours chamber alſo foreſayde doctours gathered agaynſt mée entreate mée good wordes bée cōtent bee ordered maſter ʋicechauncelours councell require maſter ʋicechauncelour woulde indifferently heare mee myne aduerſaries togither ſayde thing agaynſt learning woulde bée ordered maſter ʋicechaūcelours cōmaūdement thē ſayd done profyt mayſter ʋicechaūcelour ſit iudgmēt ſayd frends woulde bée lothe matter ſhoulde bée heard iudgemēt came witnes againſt mée ſure would thē loſt aunſwered witnes ſoeuer ſhould come proue thoſe article layde againſt mée would proue falſe preached openly many learned men ſermon doubted would teſtify truth partyes aunſwere yee may note courſe yt pope lawe made mée thre witneſſes came agaynſt mée would thrée twenty helpe mée yt courſe lawe ſayde pitious caſe yt man ſhall bée reported indifferently audience ſeing ʋniuerſite 2 3 falſe witneſſes wherefore woulde abide daū ger let myne aduerſaries doe vttermoſt ſhall thus dye muſt bée content ſayd better maſter chriſt many wordes vſed many daungerous wayes ſhewed mée haue withdrawen mée purpoſe ſtād faſt required mée goe backe chā ber communed togither ſecretly alone yt laſt ſent vnto mée ʋicechauncelour intreated mée ſore bée content ordinaunce cō ſcience hée could perceiue frendes intended ſaue name fame could doe lawe ſo daungerous onles would followe counſell aſked ʋicechaūcelour would ſhould doe truely ſaid theſe article falſely vncharitably layde vnto mée hée aunſwered ſhould bée ieoperdy ſubtile craftie popiſhe chauncelour ye matter therfore ſhould bée contēted graunt thē vnto yt would agree wiſe wherfore deſired hym depart agayne vnto thē would come make reſonable aunſwer came making proteſtation firſt right worſhipful maiſters truſt bee frend •• haue ſo proteſtation much charity caſt mée away onles perceiue great faute obſtinacy mée truſt ſhall fynde neuer intende ſpeake yet boe agaynſt chriſts holy doctrine notwithſtanding ſeing yt lawe ſo daungerous ʋicechauncelour haue tolde mée therfore rather put ſelfe vnto charitie ſtande yt daunger lawe purpoſe two theſe article layd vnto mée thus aunſwer theſe article doe ſtande neuer mine neuer barnes anſwere article alleaged againſt intended ſpeake bee written neuertheles doe graunt yt bée many word alſo great many ſētēces ye ſpeake wherfore doe ſubmit ſelf vnto deſiring charitably deale wt mée take wordes yt worſt ſence made mée bée ſworne ſtande ye ʋicechauncelours determination ſtopped great ye laſt graunted abide determinatiō agaynſt learning charitie vpon ʋicechauncelour aſſoyled mée ſaid ab excōmunicacione iuris note crafti • willy fox ſtanding vnknowen vnto mée notary make inſtrament agreementes know yt dealt mée frendes priuate perſons inſtrument made notary afterward preſē ted vnto court witnes againſt mée brought béefore byſhops thus talking yt ʋicechauncelours chamber ʋniuerſitie gathered togither ſo ye bodye yt ʋniuerſitie ſent vp certayne mayſters bachelours diuinity yt ʋicechauncelour requiring myght bée admytted examination mée muth heard mée preach aunſwere made agayne ſuche matter hand deale mée frendlye deuiſe ende moſte profite reaſon congregation compelled departe ſonder tyme ſo reſted ye matter ſtill ſpace moneth tyme doctour watſon doctour preſton agréement ʋicechauncelour wente wrote reuocation made euery article ſelfe making reuocation graunt yt article layde againſt mée addyng alſo note moſt falſe • euiliſhe practiſe popiſhe cleargie euery article béecauſe ſome men ſo vnderſtode mée therefore ſhould reuoke article fyrſt article ſayde mynde hierome yt dayes lyke vertue added ye certaine men take mée ye would haue holy dayes therefore muſt reuoke article hereſye item ſpoken myns article agaynſt gorgious pompe pride ſpirituall ornamentes ad • e yt certayne men dyd take ſayinge would haue halowed chalice veſtimentes yet ornameutes yt church therefore muſt reuoke article hereſy ſo euery one article coulde expounde word euell ſentence el malice make miſcheuous ſedicious ſaying layd mée would haue reuoke though béene ſaying meaning neuer article either hereticall ſedicious contentious blaſphemous el pij auribus offenſinus moreouer yt ſame place good frende wrote ſame reuocation priuely faſt mée hée wright doctour preſton man yet aliue nowe thing wrytyng cauled chambre eyght tenne yt beſt learned men yt god helpe true preacher ſtyrreth vp ſome good men cambryge bée yet aliue farre know ſauing maſter george stafforde maſter bylney theſe aſked counſell thought beſt doe ſeing reuocation ſo vncharitably made thinges falſly layde vnto charge myne article yet could bée charitably taken alſo concluded neither right conſcience ſhould agrée reuocation wherfore afterward ʋicechauncelour called agayne afore doctour rydley doctour watſon doctour preſton maſter tyrell deliuered mée reuocation chambre ſhould rede openly yt ſonday folowing edwardes church ſhould ſaye neyther leſſe therin cruell mercyleſſe papiſtes written yea ſhould alſo promyſe afterward called forth hygher power ſpirituall bée content ſuffer payne punyſhment hée ſhoulde lay vnto mée would agrée wiſe determination conſent theſe condicions neyther agréeable learning yet ſtanding charitie certayne article condemned hereſie true iohns goſpell charity would ſhould bee blamed thing neuer ſpake thought alonely malicious perſons dyd take ſayinges falſe meaninges wherefore greate tragedy among thē ſome ſayde periured yt reaſon ſworne abide determination yt ʋicechauncelour parte rekened oth bound mée reaſon ſo vncharitably made promyſe doe yea ye ʋicechauncelour hym ſelfe thought extreme ye many word ye cōgregation diſſolued ſhould make aunſwere within eyght dayes would meane ſeaſon maſter tyrell ride london founde ye meanes reaſon hée could obtayne mynd ʋniuerſitie ſayd would appaele vicechauncelour ye whole body ʋniuerſitie cardinal ſent downe doctour capon ſergeant armes called gybſō areſt mée ʋniuerſitie barnes areſted sergeaunt armes appere grace counſell brought ʋp london ye tweſday afore ſhroue sondaye wedenſday night brought afore cardinall hys gallery weſtmynſter take red article quietly tyl came 6 hée ſtopped aſked mée byſhop might haue city thē one aunſwered yt byſhop inſtituted inſtructe teach cytie therfore hée might haue much vnderneth hée able preach teach mée thought paule agrée commaūdyng timothe ſet euery cytie byſhop wherefore knew none order ſayde hée paules dayes citie 6 7 myles long beſide ſubburbes whole cytye one byſhop likewiſe byſhop one cathedrall ſée reſedue countrey ſubburbes vnto ſayde nothyng hée woulde heare mée returned read forth ye article till came xxij article hée founde pyllers cardinall greatly delighted eſtemed croſſes pollaxes pollaxes hée ſtopped great diſputation mée haue written afore article ye laſt wée came ſo farre ſayde theſe article vncharitably gathered sermonde hée ſayd defamed hereſie anſwered ſayde truſt good mā knoweth ſuſpect mée hée ſayde doe knowe rumour bée brought afore v hereſie aunſwered rumour ſcattered mine aduerſaries malice occaſion haue geuē ſayd beléeue bée true purge ſelfe anſwered wyll bée bounde brynge vnto grace xx honeſt men well learned good name fame ſhall depoſe mée worthy infamy hée ſayde bring mée vi x doctours diuinitie wil ſweare neyther giltie yet worthy bée ſuſpected aunſwered poſſible bryng ſo many doctours mée ſéeing two sermonde belonged byſhops wherefore ſuppoſed woulde teſtifie wyth mée woulde brynge many honeſt men ſhoulde bée required ſhoulde bée well learned better teſtifie wyth mée ſayde woulde helpe muſt bée péeres ye forme law ſayd ye impoſſible ſayd hée muſt bée burned anſwered truſted nothyng el haue grace fauour hys hand hée ſayde hée ſworne mayntayne lawes y• church therfore hée muſt follow ye forme lawe wherefore ſhoulde take deliberation ſelfe whether woulde ſtande courſe lawe el ſubmit ſelfe grace becauſe ſubmitted ſelfe ʋicechauncelour thereby circunuented therefore thought would bée ſo haſty ſubmitting ſelf therefore aunſwered woulde ſubmit ſelfe grace thing coulde proued agaynſt mée ſpoken contrary learning ſayd ſubmiſſion woulde graunt much communication hée concluded wyth mée ſayd foole coulde perceiue good hée vnto mée wherefore ſéeing woulde bée reported déedes therefore hée ſigned xv xvi doctoures ſayde hée ſhoulde ye nexte day heare mée ſo nexte day thurſeday feſtigam sonday brought chapterhouſe weſtminſter maner examinatiō weſtminſter ſate ye byſhop bathe principall iudge byſhop ſaint aſſe abbot weſtminſter abbot burye doctour quarton doctour allen doctour stephen ſecretary many moe knew ſayd byſhop bathe syr defamed hereſie denyed ſame hée ſayde yée doe ſée multitude people gathered heare examination whiche muſt riſe ſome fame ſayde knewe cauſe gathering knewe neuer man brought man wyth mée ſauing childe xiij yeares ſayde hée dyd neuer heare man accuſed hereſie ſayde men may ſay pleaſures let matter mée long faultles ſayde hée wée doe beléeue faultles yet muſt purge ſelfe declare innocency anſwered content woulde bée reported men euer knew mée heard mée well ſayde hée wel ſaid ſayde hée bée certayne article deliuered vnto v agaynſt ſay deſire know myne accuſers nay ſayde ye may note crafty iugglyng papiſtes hée wée procéede forme lawe wherefore ſay theſe article aunſwered vncharitably gathered agaynſt mée wherefore deliuer certayne article court ſubſcribed mine owne hande ſoone woulde nowe come daunger wiſt muſt néedes purge ſelfe requeſt el reuoke thinges laide againſt mée though béene myne el muſt néedes dye theyr lawe thyng neyther knew ſuſpected thys innocēt ſooner trapped condemned among papiſtes hath béene cauſe maner men whatſoeuer came afore neuer ſo good innocent muſt néedes bée heretykes good vnto ſeldome déedes hath declared come purpoſe enquired diuers queſtions mée nothing perteyning vnto mine article whether man might ſweare whether lord cardinall myne ordinarye iudge wyth lyke captious interogations laſt came firſt article inquyred mée dayes alyke ſayde mynde hierome dayes equall aſked mée wée ſhoulde kéepe holy dayes ſayde yes matter wée great diſputation till laſt lord rocheſter came hée aſked mée commaundement sabatum ſanctifices ceremoniall morall precepte anſwered ceremoniall alleaging mée auguſtine thā epiſt c xix ſayd hee learned alwayes aſked mée queſtion aſſoyled ſo neyther woulde coulde abiecte thyng agaynſt mée commaūded alwayes ſtand parte layde heades togither till inuented captious queſtion called agayne myne anſwere geuen cōmaunded backe agayn thus continued thrée dayes ſpace notary wrote reuocation article tyme myne aunſwere heard thyrde day noone iij ye clocke greate long rolle offered vnto read word word ſtode commaundement geuen ye byſhop bath▪ ſhould ſpeake one word afore people leſſe thē written rolle hée would handle well inough required firſt ſée writtē rolle would graūt vnto aunſwere made would read written well good ſhould ſtand ieoperdy deſired know condemned article hereſie ſayd yea aſked thē ſayd would tell writtē aunſwered ala lordes ye truth iudgement haue ſpoken nothyng ſtandeth auguſtine hierome doctours holye churche wherfore ſhall chaunce thus bée cōdēned bée taught wherein tell ſhould preach tyme come byſhop bathe aunſwered ſhoulde take care preachyng hée would prouide ſhould alonly aunſwere would read rolle deſired doctour barnes forbydden preachyng would firſt pointe finger wold ſpeake article condemned hereſie would bée bounde proue true auguſtine el hierome would bée takē hereticke ſaid byſhop bathe auguſtine hierome ſhould ſtād determination church ʋnto ſayd church ſo determined auguſtine hierome church determined agaynſt would ſuſpect well ſayth hée ſtand vnto doe contēt alonely tell v whether read rolle ſayd lordes beſéech way charitie chriſtes ſake deale charitablye doe wrong paule ſayeth haue power geuen edifiyng deſtruction ʋery well ſayd byſhop bath ye néede feare bée note tyranny papiſtes many witneſſes ſhould oppreſſe wrongfully ſayd hée tell v whether read rolle thyrd tyme laſt ſayd graūt except may firſt ſée doe ſhall pleaſe ſat ſtill wone looking biſhop bath commaunded departe aſide tooke counſell togithers laſt called agayne ſayd syr ye ſhall haue man ſhall read vnto afore well ſaid content ſo one notary lay mā aſſigned vnto departed litle aſide hée began read yeare lord ſuch day moneth one doct barnes conuented byſhops weſtminſter certeine article gathered sermonde hée preached cambridge whiche ſome bée ſclaunderous ſome bée erronious ſome bée contentious ſome bée ſeditious ſome bée fooliſhe ſome bée hereticall hée came worde hereticall aſked hym hereticall hée anſwered mée agayne yée haue heard lordes ſayth make anſwere ala ſayd ſhall bée thus condē ned hereticke tell myne hereſie ſayd hée belongeth ſpeake vnto well ſaid read went agayne byſhops • ell downe knées deſired better paſſion chriſt would ſhewe vnto whiche article condemned hereſie would bée taught ſhould handle forme law byſhop bath aūſwered ſayd ſhould choſe whether would read ye rolle el bée burned ye one ſhould doe thē ſayd ieſus haue mercy wil ſurely read leſt ſo deliuered againe doctours cryed vppon one ſhoulde remember ſelfe caſt ſelfe awaye manner read rolle ſaid ſmall thing neuer worſe mā ſhould ſée lord cardinall ſhould bée good gracious vnto would ſpeake ſo ſuppoſed déede would haue required grace deſeruyng haue read rolle afore ye face world ſhould ſéeme haue victory agaynſt thing greatly regarde déede knowen beene ſo miſchieuous poyſon tyranny cruelnes founde afterward would neuer haue read haue dyed god bryngeth thinges paſſe pleaſure vpon opinion reaſon theyr good wordes pituous ſpake vnto mée graunted reade roolle woulde haue read byſhoppe bathe ſayd late ſo great diſputation betwéene vppon matter till doctour quarton ſayd lorde late one ſeſſion tyme one iudgement byſhop bathe lord forgéeue ſought ye meanes ye hée could vſed maner cruelnes haue deſtroyed mée neuertheles ye laſt hée deliuered mée y• roole reade thē ye people y• ſtoode called heare ye iij dayes man ſuffered heare one worde ſpake commaundement geuen mée red adding nothing ſaying one word might make myne excuſe ſuppoſing ſhould haue founde byſhoppes better commaunded ſubſcribe make croſſe note croſſing toſſing y• papiſtes vſe commaunded goe knéele downe byſhop bathe require abſolution hym hée woulde aſſoyle mée except woulde firſt ſweare woulde fulfill penaunce hée ſhoulde enioyne mée ſweare yet ſuſpectinge • e men ſome cromme charitie within ſworne enioyned hée mée ſhould returne nyght agayne pryſon nexte day faſtingam sonday ſhould doe open penaunce paules worlde ſhoulde thynke marueylous haynous heretyke cardinall came next day ye pompe pride hée could make paules church bring mée poore ſoule conſayte moreouer commaunded come ye byſhops london abbot dwelling london dyd weare miter ſo much prior mary ſpittell moncke thinke tower hill alſo myters ſet matter forth world ſhould perfectly know perceiue ſpirituall father determined matter ſubſtancially byſhop rocheſter muſt preach ſame day glori • u aſſembly papiſtes ſermon agaynſt lutherians though cōuicted one truth afore god farre thoſe thinges man could bée ſauing tyrāt perſecutour god worde gorgyous faſing myters croſtaues abbotts prior done blinde people outface mée god amend thinges amyſſe béene well content haue ſuffered theſe thinges ſo might haue come charitable end muſt returne agayne priſon remayne tyll lord cardinal farther pleaſure pleaſure abide fyrſt laſt▪ 2 yeares thrée quarter yet could neuer bée poynt thē ſent vnto y• byſhop london certayne worſhipfull men cardinall put matter hym cyty lōdon whoſe name bée theſe mayſter lambert hath béene maior raynold hath béene ſhreue palmer petyt iones pernell deſyred theſe men way charitie goe byſhop london deſire bée good gracious vnto mée offended would bée glad make amends aſmuch hée ſhould reaſonably require mée deſiring hym ſhew thē hée would charitie require doe bée bound vnto hym ye would kéepe dyd aunſwer ye hym bée men aliue moſt part tell amongſt maiſter petit ſayd vnto byſhop ala lorde petuous caſe man come daunger lawe remedy helpe hym yes ſayd • byſhop ſayd maiſter petyt yong man hath good frendes would bée right lothe haue caſt away wherefore bée remedy deuiſe wil bée bound byſhop aſtonyed ſayde laſt hée would ſpeake lorde cardinal mée theſe mē offered goe bée bounde mée hée ſayde ſhould néede neuertheles hée ſpake ſo vnto departed god ſaue ſuch ſpeaking whē came home one durſt geue mée ſo much bread meat hée durſt geue dog yet ſpeake one word mée immediatelye byſhop founde ye meanes ſent northāpton remayne perpetuall priſon thus moſt gracious prince haue handled poore oratour beſeche highnes bée good gracious vnto mée iudge bée charitable dealyng thus cōdemne mée heretyke ſhew mee poynt wherefore euen violent tyrannye compeil mée doe confeſſe el bée put death bée yet ye come forth proue theſe article hereſye refuſe ſuffer payne grace ſhall iudge worthy thus lord ieſus chriſte preſerue noble grace euermore amen onely fayth iuſtifieth god grace doe take vppon heare diſputation probation article groūd holy scripture lordes biſhops condēne afore read maner doe thynges pleaſeth vnderſtand crye hereſy hereſie hereticke hereticke hée ought bée heard matter bée condemned church holy father long cuſtomes maner lawes vnto grace fauour make aūſwere would know theſe thing haue reckened ouercome chriſt holy worde ſet holy ghoſt ſchole ſhould bée heards doe require name chriſt alſo bryng holy worde holy father haue vnderſtand god worde doe therfore though heare yet muſt néedes heare holy scripture chriſt nothing el sauiour redéemer iuſtifier perfect peace maker betwene god man teſtimony dyd ye aungell geue theſe wordes hée ſhall ſaue people theyr ſinnes alſo paule chriſt math 1 1 cor 2 made righteouſnes ſatiſfaction redemption moreouer eſay 53 prophet witneſſeth ſame ſaying wretchednes people haue ſtriken haue chriſt property wil truly cōfeſſe chriſt muſt graūt harte chriſt iuſtice redemption chriſt wiſedome holynes alonely purchaſer grace alonly ye peace maker betwéene god man briefely goodnes haue ye hym ſake onely haue néede nothyng towardes ſaluation hym onely wée deſire ſaluatiō ſatiſfactiō helpe creature eyther heauenly earthly onely saint peter actes 4 ſayth name geuen vnto men wherein muſt bée ſaued alſo paule ſayth hym actes 13 beléeue iuſtified thynges moreouer iohn witneſſeth 1 iohn 2 ſame theſe wordes hée hath obtained grace ſinnes place ſent 1 iohn 4 ſonne make agréement ſinnes lordes haue chriſt nature full whole hée ye denyeth thyng part theſe thyngs taketh part applyeth geueth ye glory thē perſon chriſt onely ſame mā robbeth chriſt honour denyeth chriſt antichriſt wherfore lordes firſt ſay vnto propertyes chriſt graunt thē poynte proue fayth ieſus chriſt onely iuſtifieth afore god secondarily denye ſure leuer deny créede thē graūt thē auoyde bée antichriſtes whō iohn ſpeaketh haue tryed ſpirites bée 1 iohn 4 god deny chriſt deny nature propertie chriſt graunt ye name deny vertue graunt hée deſcended heauen deny profite thereof hée deſcended health denye yet créede graunt hée borne denye purpoſe graunt papiſtes deniyng onely fayth iuſtifie denye nature chriſt riſſen frō death deny profit therof hée roſe iuſtifie v graūt hée sauiour deny alonely yt ſauiour pray wherfore hée borne iuſtifie v part redéeme v part doe ſatiſfaction part ſinnes ſo ye muſt ſet payr old ſhoes lompe bread cheeſe louſie gray coate make ſatiſfactiō yt part say geue fully alonely one chriſt thē deny chriſt holy ghoſt iohn doth declare bée contrary chriſt may alſo bée proued playne scripture holy ghoſt man heauen earth neither vnder earth able open booke looke ye booke till lambe came vnto ſeniours ſpake maner thou apoc 5 art worthy take yt booke open ſeales therof thou waſt killed haſt redéemed v thy bloud ſay lordes heauen none founde neither aungels yet chriſt onely hath wrought redēption ſeniours worthy open booke chriſt onely finde could finde ſet helper chriſt whō ſet alone pray tel v bée ſhall bée world knoweth hée good workes whēce come good workes whether heauen earth frō vnder earth theſe place aungels ſeniours ſought haue founde could finde let paſſe praye lay good workes title bryng ioyne lābe openyng booke ſeniours haue layd lābe alonely worthy opē booke becauſe hée ſlayne redéemed precious bloud cauſe laye good workes lābe hath alonely dyed v lambe hath alonely ſhed bloud v lambe hath alonly redéemed v theſe thing hath chriſt onely redemer iuſtifier hée done alone theſe bée ſufficient hath hée alone made ſatiſfaction alonely worthy redéemer iuſtifier moreouer bée heauen confeſſe lambe alonely worthy redéeme bée workes better cā workes helpe lambe alonely worthy redéeme moreouer ſeniours fall downe lambe geuyng alonely prayſe ſhall good workes ſtande vp lambe bée better ſeniours let v proue thyng open scripture paule tooke ſo great labour proue article hée neuer tooke becauſe hée would make playne ſtoppe mouthes agayneſayers helpe haue ſpirite god neuertheles god fauour doe beſt confounde crooked enemyes chriſtes bloud thoughe make frendes yet leſt ſo handle ſhall bée aſhamed openly ſo ſpeake agaynſt haue done longe tyme ſo handle god helpe world ſhal know glory chriſtes name hym bée alſo ſo high promoted worlde bée higher yet deſerue chriſt worſt men let v goe purpoſe paule ſayth men bée ſinners wante glory god iuſtified fréely grace thorough rom 3 redemption chriſt ieſu men haue ſinned yea iuſtified fréely ſhall ſinner doe good workes hée deſerue bée iuſtified call fréely bée deſeruing leſſe fréely call grace bée part work grace saint paule ſayth grace grace rom 11 bée euaſion wordes bée ſo playne bring helpe workes ſo much redēption fréely yet grace concerning part commeth work partly workes doe deſtroy saint paule whole diſputation hée faith workes iuſtifieth contendeth agaynſt workes clearely excludeth workes iuſtification bryngeth grace onely nowe excluded whole contention bée brought parte cauſe open wordes hée ſayth thy reioyſing excluded lawe lawe workes nay lawe fayth doe iudge therfore man iuſtified fayth without yt workes lawe heare gloriation workes excluded rom 3 yet boaſte workes heare playnely paules ſentence iudgeth clearely wyth fayth agaynſt workes bée auoyded cleare bée aunſwere thys paules propoſition hée tooke prooue faith onely iuſtifieth loſt labour paule proue workes helpe iuſtification iewes graunt required workes might bée clearely excluded chriſtened content receiue chriſt ſauiour onely alonely contentation ſo much gloryed agaynſt gentile maner workes diſpiſed people vnworthy bée iuſtified paraduenture wyll bée crafty ſubtile euaſion ſayde paule condemneth workes olde lawe workes newe lawe nowe ſatiſfied conſcience thinke haue well aſſoyled paules argumēt thinke ſufficient auoyde saint paule hath takē ſo great labour prooue cauſe thinke ſhall bée thus diſcharged afore god doe goe boldly ſtraite iudgement god euaſion doubt ſhall finde paule ſtifly ſtrongly againſt newe workes euer hée agaynſt iewes theyr olde workes hée condemne work law inſtituted mouth god beſt workes euer thinke thoſe workes haue inuented ſhalbe alowed briefely workes good woorkes co • teyned law god doe excogitate bée good bée olde lawe olde lawe ergo hée ſpeaketh maner workes lawe includeth workes euer god inſtituted higheſt beſt moſt perfection workes bée opera decalogi workes ten commaundementes theſe bée workes olde lawe iuſtifie owne ſaying nowe workes haue nowe lawe theſe better theſe mayſter chriſt ſheweth fulfilling ij theſe commaundementes bée workes included workes bée newe lawe commaunded olde paraduenture ſay thoſe workes chriſt ſpeaketh v math bée newe lawe olde chriſt ſayth ſay vnto calleth brother foole looketh woman deſire ſuch like doth offend theſe ſéeme bée workes chriſt moyſes ergo bée work newe lawe cō maunded olde againſt thē diſputeth paule ſay yée aunſwere maiſter chriſt doth reprooue yt falſe interpretation scribe pharyſies ſet lawe hée teacheth newe workes geuer newe lawe saint iohn ſayth lawe geuen thorough iohn 1 moyſes grace veritie came ieſus chriſt hée géeuer grace mercy prophetes teſtifieth moyſes therfore purchace v fauour hée dyed croſſe ſo chriſt ſuffered ſinnes moyſes hée commaundeth v doe doe chriſt ſayth hange thou beléeue thou haue done thée thée mée purpoſe chriſt ſay doth interprete declare olde lawe agaynſt scribe pharyſes learned lawe fulfilled content wyth outwarde workes iuſtification falſe doctrine doth mayſter chriſt reprooue ſayth lawe doth require pure cleane hart haue hys workes fulfilled hart alonely wyth hand ſéete toothe nayle pharyſes ſayth teacheth mayſter chriſt teacheth new workes alonely expreſſeth vertue olde lawe thus doth holy doctours declare v chapiter math ſpecially auguſtine wherfore place cā bée auguſt ſer domini de monte exod xx leuit xix prooued bée certayne workes new law ueuer commaunded olde moreouer looke olde lawe whether theſe thinges bée forbidden commaunded ſhall finde wordes law chriſtes expoſition doth agrée mayſter teacheth newe thyng yet newe workes graunt bée certayne workes new lawe bée olde yet haue cā prooue thoſe ſhall iuſtifie bée goodneſſe workes workes olde lawe god honour goodnes good workes profite neighbour goodnes work haue yet graunt iuſtifie ſhall newe workes iuſtifie bleſſed saint paule diſputeth agaynſt chriſtened workes galat 2 olde lawe alſo newe yet concludeth hee chriſt alonely iuſtifier marke argument righteouſnes cōmeth law chriſt dead vayne hée woulde ſay lawe helpe iuſtifie opinion iewes chriſt alonely iuſtifier hée iuſtifier alonely bée dead vayne paule proue conſequent maner eyther chriſt doth thys thyng alone el hée dead vayne hée haue helper thys muſt néedes bée meaning hys argument take argument paule likewiſe diſpute agaynſt newe woorkes newe woorkes doe helpe iuſtifie chriſt deade vayne chriſt dead vayne ergo new workes doe helpe iuſtify firſt part paules ſecond graunt therfore third muſt •• edes folow let v ſée paule proueth prepoſition example olde lawe though hée diſputed alonely agaynſt work ould lawe holy excellent patriarch abraham whō maner workes coulde iuſtifye fayth onely thynke yt paule doth ſpeake workes ould rom 4 lawe nay doubtles could abrahā doe yt work lawe lawe geuē 400 30 yeares wherefore paule conſtrayneth galat 3 conclude maner good workes though bée ſoe good abraham workes helpe iuſtificacion note alſo paules argument abrahā inſtified ſo many yeares yt lawe geuen ergo ſaith hée lawe doth iuſtifie like wiſe diſpute agaynſt newe workes men ſufficiently perfectly iuſtifyed alonely fayth afore new workes geuen preached ergo workes yt new lawe doth iuſtifie neceſſitie anticedent proue thus abraham iſaac iacob iohn baptiſt holy prophetes perfectly iuſtified afore new workes take new workes ſpoken ergo men ſufficiently iuſtified alonely fayth saint paules argument conclude ſo muſt mine alſo wherefore ſay ſtandeth holy paule ſtifly ſtrongly mée againſt ſayth bée fréely alonely iuſtified fayth without maner work let v ſée ambroſe ſayth text iuſtified fréely nothing ambro ad rom 3 nothing deſeruing alonely fayth iuſtified gift god c ye men working nothing nothing deſeruyng iuſtified fayth onely yea fréely wonte cry sola ſola ſola onely onely onely haue helpe haue alſo gratis ſaye fréely alſo dono dei ſay gyft god nihill operantes much working nothing theſe word doe exclude workes alowe fayth onely tell word doe graūt theſe wordes bée content alſo bring origyne ſame text whoſe word bée theſe orig ad ro lib iij cap iij paule ſayth iuſtification fayth alonely ſufficient man doe beléeue onely hée iuſtified though bée workes done hym fayth théefe fayth onely alone iuſtifieth iuſtified without workes lawe lorde aſke hée done looke workes accepte onely cōfeſſing chriſt foloweth wherfore man iuſtied fayth ʋnto concerning iuſtification workes ye law helpe nothing c ſay origine ſayth men bée iuſtified though doe good workes workes doe help nothing iuſtification fayth onelye bée theſe plaine word graunt theſe wordes aſke haue alſo sola ſola ſola ye néede cry sola alſo origine bringeth opē example théefe man deny haue leſſe good work théefe neither good god man yt ye worlde may ſée new opinion ſéeing ſcripture alſo holy doctours doth teach alſo paule 9 chapter bringeth gentyle rom 9 knoweth nothing god hath done good work cō trary blaſphemed god name hath alwayes lyued idolatrye béene vtter enemy vnto al goodnes hée bringeth alſo iewe full good workes law hath alſo great zeale vnto god workes yea paule beareth hym witnes briefelye hée bringeth ſuch iewe man complaine full good workes yea take beſt iewes togither madnes paule ſpeake damnable rom 10 iewes open wretch damned iudgment lawe good workes yet paule doth exclude repelleth clearely iuſtifycation good zeale good workes concludeth playne wordes gentyl full damnable wordes neither zeale loue vnto goodnes iuſtified fayth onely theſe bée paules wordes rom 9 ſay gentils folowed righteouſnes haue obtayned righteouſnes meane ye righteouſnes cōmeth faith ſraell foloweth lawe righteouſnes could attayne vnto righteouſnes wherefore becauſe hée ſought fayth workes lawe bée theſe playne wordes gentile folowed righteouſnes minde therunto iuſtified fréely fayth sola fides fayth moreouer iew neuer attayne ſaluation faith chriſt reprooued zeale loue ſtudye good workes merueylous thing yes verely ſo merueilous ſhall neuer vnderſtand without beléeue peraduenture ſhall bée ſayd good woorks iewes dyd profite thē becauſe faith faith would haue holpen iuſtificatiō make anſwere trouth good workes profyte iewes lacke fayth falſe workes ſhould haue holpen iuſtification fayth paule proueth clerely good workes helpe nothynge iuſtification euell workes let iuſtification yt commeth fayth hée proued example gentyll good workes damnable workes yet iuſtified fayth moreouer iewe yt zeale god manner good workes wt thing world cā deuiſe yea alſo paule ſpeaketh iewes yt chriſtened could helpe wherfore maner work whether bée fayth faith helpe iuſtifye neuertheleſſe workes hath glory reward glory prayſe iuſtificacion belongeth chriſt onely alſo paule proueth playnely theſe wordes workes haue place rom 4 iuſtification worketh rewarde geuen fauour duetye hym worketh beleueth hym iuſtifieth fayth accompted righteouſnes wicked man fayth coūted righteouſnes thinke theſe wordes bée opēly agaynſt workes sayth hée yt iuſtification imputed vnto yt worketh alonly beléeueth hym ye iuſtifieth ye wicked mā pray good work doth wicked mā marke alſo hée ſayth righteouſnes imputed vnto ergo deſerued deſerued imputed fauour muſt bée geuen duety thinke sola fides onely fayth know bée workes fayth doe iuſtifie paule excludeth workes clearely ergo fayth alone remaineth peraduenture ſay ye workes fayth doe iuſtifie neuertheleſſe méekenes lowlynes auoyding boaſt goodnes wil geue yt glory fayth vnto yt principal thyng without workes helpe notwithſtāding workes bée good helpe iuſtification thoughe méekenes know damnable hipocriſie yea god intollerable men cā proue scripture workes worthy glorye iuſtification open lyeng fayth geue yet ſay hée worthy workes bée worthy parte fayth bée worthy alone confeſſe openly gene workes prayſe faith prayſe ſay one thyng mouth thinke hart god ſearcheth priuities harte hath required ſuch méekenes praye workes helpe iuſtification leſſe bée neyther done yet thought iuſtified wicked mā thinketh nothing good work theſe méeke lye deſerue none aunſwere wherefore let v heare holy doctours ſay texte hym worketh c saint ambroſe ſayth maner ambroſi ſo decréed god ye lawe grace god ſhould require vnto ſaluation alonely fayth thyng hée prooueth example prophet ſaying bleſſed man god doth impute iuſtification without workes hée ſayth bée bleſſed god hath determined without labour without maner obſeruation alonely faith ſhal bée iuſtified god bleſſed whoſe ſinnes bée forgeuē clearly bleſſed vnto without labour without worke iniquitios remitted ſinnes bée couered maner workes required alonely ſhould beleeue c bée theſe wordes playne god hath decréed hée ſhall require nothyng iuſtification fayth hée bleſſed god imputeth iuſtification without manner work without maner obſeruations alſo ſinnes bée couered sola fides iuſtificat maner work penaūcered alonely beléeue haue sola fides tantum fides ſay ambroſe ſpeaketh alonely workes law maner work maner obſeruations yea alſo penaunce peraduēture wetherall bee ſayd great doctour ſayd ambroſe dyd vnderſtād young child newly baptiſed fayth ſhould ſaue alonely without workes thinke likely aunſwere great doctour diuinitie great dun man ſo great preacher paule ambroſe wel auoyded clerkely made aunſwere epiſtle written paule romanes men child alſo wordes scripture ſpeake man childe ambroſe ſayth bleſſed man aunſwere hée litle moued ſware bleſſed god let ambroſe auguſtine ſay hée would neuer beléeue workes dyd helpe iuſtificatiō lordly word prelate pyller chriſtes churche medlyng ſuch mad men yet peraduenture ſay take péece doctour much maketh purpoſe notwithſtandyng hée ſayth otherwiſe place doe bryng yet doctour thus auoyded cā deny ſaying vppon place scripture doth agrée scripture el hée doth expounde scripture euill wherfore muſt aunſwere ſaying doctour place place layd agaynſt ye place whereby place muſt bée expounded dare deny place deny place ſame authoritie bée holy doctours clearely gone neuertheles holy scripture ſtandeth openly agaynſt deny haue cauſe ſuſpect wherefore take héede doe yet peraduenture ye ſay vnderſtand ambroſe holy doctours lord rocheſter ſayd howe vnderſtode tertullian hée none euaſion ſaue honour inough ſo ſay muſt proue mē muſt iudge betwéene haue tranſlated great many ſayinges engliſh let men iudge whether vnderſtand go ye latin let v ſée ſenſe cā take lordes remember god alyue whoſe cauſe defende afore dare well ſay already confounded conſcience wherfore doubt terrible vengeaunce han geth ouer repēt whē cōmeth cōmeth ſharpely ye able defend thing cā proue opēly holy ſcripture say conſcience murmour grudge neuer bée ſatiſfied mēs dreames yet tyranny thinke lawes inuentiōs bée ſufficient rule chriſten men liue ſaue conſcience therby thinke cauſe ſufficiently proued haue compelled poore men violēce graūt may deſtroy scripture receiue alonely tyranny lordes matter righted iudgemēt maſter chriſt plainly ſhewe ſayth alonely hath vertue righteous man lyueth fayth workes iuſtifie bringeth abacuk ſaying faith law ſhal righteous mā lyue hée addeth well afore god afore man peraduenture ſhalbe reckened righteous ſticke lawe afore god c haue sola onely alſo holy iuſtification afore god iudgemēt men iudgementes wherfore glory much cā good workes alonely iuſtifie alſo bée valure damnable ſinne bée fayth farre helping iuſtification thys aug prolo pſal 31 doth auguſtine witneſſe theſe wordes thoſe ſame workes bée done afore fayth though ſéeme vnto men laudable yet vayne doe iudge great ſtrength ſwift running way wherfore let man coūt good workes fayth faith good work intention maketh good worke fayth doth guide thee intētion c auguſtine condemneth good workes without fayth ſinne good workes afore fayth ſayth bée nothing worth vain thinges way ſuch thynges helpe iuſtification marke alſo good intention wherupon boaſt doe ſo many good workes helpe hée blynde knoweth doe though ſtand well owne conceite fayth guide thinges afore fayth blindnes ſoone fayth commeth hée doth iuſtifie alſo maketh work good afore ſinne let v ſée saint barnarde ſayth good workes doe abhorre ſayth hée whatſoeuer thyng mée except paraduēture barnar ſuper ſer lxvq myne god hath made hys grace hath hée iuſtified mée fréely hath hée deliuered mée bondage ſinne thou haſt choſē ſayth chriſt haue choſen thée found merites thée might moue choſe thée preuented thy merites wherefore thus faith haue maryed thée vnto woorkes law haue maryed alſo iuſtice iuſtice lawe iuſtice fayth remayneth thou doeſt iudge ryght iudgment betwéene thée mée geue thou iudgment wherein haue maried thée open thy merites dyd come betwéene pleaſure c barnarde doth deſpiſe hys good workes taketh hym onely grace ſtycke partly good workes onelye grace barnarde good workes ſtycke marke barnarde god child fréely grace bée workes doe helpe leſſe hée chriſtened man hée workes new law workes newe law call thinke yes yet hée ſayth ye merites goodnes fréely choſen wherfore hée prouoked ſuch iudge righteouſly betwéene god hath preuēted goodnes owne hys owne pleaſure hée finde goodnes preuenteth goodnes haue clearely good workes ye law morall good woorkes fayne doe nothing helpe iuſtificatiō afore god bée preuēted iuſtification alſo well proued saint auguſtines ſayinge wherfore theſe thinges conſidered declared aug deſpiri lit c • ▪ xij ſtrength hath pleaſed god geue v doe gather man bée iuſtified preceptes good liuing lawe workes ye law fayth letter ſpirite merites workes frée grace man bee iuſtified ye lawe workes law faith chriſtes bloud c merites workes frée grace call frée grace without al thing ſauyng gra • e call workes y• workes helpe nothing workes helpe would hée ſay workes workes onelye part workes part faith hée excludeth workes fully onely agayne ſame thing purchaſeth v remiſſion ſinnes doth alſo purchaſe iuſtificatiō iuſtificatiō nothing remiſſion ſins fayth purchaſeth v remiſſiō ergo faith ar iuſtified nowe fayth doth purchaſe remiſſion ſinnes well proued article fayth credo remiſſionem peccatorum beléeue remiſſion ſinnes haue remiſſion fayth fayth deceiueth mée doe beléeue onely becauſe woulde haue remiſſion ſinnes néedeth beléeue remiſſion ſinnes may deſerue workes alſo mayſter chriſt declareth openly ye manner work ſo euer bée iuſtifye afore god theſe bée wordes whē luke 17 haue done thinges bée commaunded yet ſaye wee vnprofitable ſeruauntes bée vnprofitable bée iuſtified bée iuſtified haue done thinges bée iuſtified doe maner nothing ſpecially thoſe thinges bée commaunded wherefore playne ye workes helpe v iuſtification whē haue done thing yet vnprofitable let v proue open example put caſe lordes vnto ſpeake noble prince would call ſay lordes ſo hath pleaſed v cal vnto ſpiritual dignitie byſhops make counſell lordes realme alſo parlamēt wold know hath deſerued reckeneth hym ſelfe worthy deſeruing le dignity ſay aunſwere kynges grace one amonge dare ſo bolde ſay kinges grace hath geuen vnto hym fréely hée hath done king ſo faythfull ſeruice boūd geue vnto yea deſeruinge one ſo proude ſay thinke ye king grace woulde laye charge hée done halfe duetie rather bound doe ten tymes much yet kinges grace boūd geue hym byſſhopricke hée done duetye good workes faythfull ſeruice bée able deſerue byſhopryke kinges grace bée able workes deſerue heauen iuſtification good workes deſerue remiſſion ſinne king kynges haue aunſwered kinges grace come diſpute god iuſtification workes yet ſhall bée farre vnlike wherfore conclud theſe ſcriptures theſe doctours fayth haue chriſt ieſus bleſſed bloude doth onely ſufficiently iuſtifie v béefore god without helpe workes though ye ſcripture bee thing el holle probacion article alonely perfect commēdation prayſe chriſt bleſſed merites hée hath deſerued v yet paſſe ouer bryng moe place ye cōtēt theſe ſcriptures wyll bée ſatiſfied yet content geue al onely glory god though brought newe teſtament yea chriſt hym ſelfe could ſatiſfie hee yet though heauen earth creature therin nothyng el probation article would helpe wherefore let ſuch infidel paſſe leue iudgement god alonely certifieng one thyng infallible day ſhall come ſhall repent yea ſorer either write thinke beléeue leſt pricke holy article vnto purpoſe true way iuſtification maner iuſtification firſt commeth god loue chriſte ieſus alonely mere mercy geueth v fréely gift fayth wherby doe beleeue god holy word ſticke faſt vnto promiſes god beléeue though heauen earth ſhould periſh come nought yet god ſhall bée founde true promiſes faythes ſake bée elect child god ſuch fayth men fides hiſtorica dreame beléeue one god beléeue hée eternall beléeue alſo hée made worlde naught yea beléeue goſpell true thing god ſpeaketh muſt bée true fulfilled ſuch thynges ſay fayth wée bée iuſtified deuils infidel haue fayth • alſo wée may attayne theſe thynges ſtrength reaſon fayth ſhall iuſtifie v muſt bée maner ſtrength muſt come heauen ſtrength reaſon muſt alſo make mée beléeue fides iuſtificans god maker heauen earth alonely father alſo father yea thorow fauour chriſt hath purchaſed mée whiche fauour neither heauen earth tribulation perſecution death hell deuide mée ſticke rom 8 faſt hée alonely father alſo mercifull father yea vnto mée mercifull ſo mercifull hée impute ſinnes vnto mée though bée neuer ſo great ſo long hang bleſſed bloud chriſt ieſus ſinne malice frailtie pleaſure hée alſo lyberall father yea vnto mée liberall alonely promiſe mée thynges alſo géeue whether bée neceſſary body ye ſoule hée alſo alonely lyberall myghty performe thynges hée promyſeth vnto mée briefely fayth maketh mée hang clearely god bleſſed promyſes made chriſt ſwéete precious bloud feare death affliction perſecution tribulation deſpiſe theſe thynges alonely theſe deſpiſe alſo myne lyfe chriſtes ſake finally fleſhely beaſt maketh frutes fayth mée ſpirituall man damnable child maketh mée heauenly ſonne ſeruaunt deuill maketh mée frée mā god deliuered lawe ſinne death deuill myſerie might hurt mée lordes fayth doth iuſtifie wée preach becauſe geuen heauen harte ſpirite god therfore bée idle thing muſt néedes maner thing ye bée honour god alſo profite neighbour ſo much tymes neceſſary muſt néedes worke well alſo bryng forth good workes may bée profite helping man theſe workes bée done iuſtifie man iuſt man muſt néedes doe vnto profite alonely men profites euen maiſter chriſt ſuffered hunger thyrſte perſecution tooke great labour preaching worde yea alſo ſuffered death theſe thinges ſay hée profite himſelfe merites profite likewiſe doth iuſt man workes good trée tyme yeare bryngeth exāple fayth bryngeth forth good workes forth good apple make hym good hée good afore yet apple profite vnto men notwithſtanding ye good nature hym muſte néedes bring forth likewiſe iuſt man muſt néedes doe good workes bée iuſtified alonely ſerue brother hée hath néede concerning iuſtification wherfore haue true cauſe iuſtification fayth alonely alſo true way maner doynge good workes man doe good workes iuſtified man maiſter chriſt ſayth eyther math 7 make trée good fruite good el trée euill fruit euill good trée muſt néedes bring forth good fruite badde euyll fruite let mée aunſwere scripture reaſons bring prooue workes doe iuſtifie firſt commeth fleſhly dampnable reaſon ſhée solution argumentes scripture ſayth wée bée iuſtified alonely fayth néede wée doe good workes néede wée crucifie mortifie fleſhe theſe wil profite v wée ſhall bée ſaued though wée doe none thē thus blinde reaſon diſpute saint paule hée proued rom 6 god mercy deliuered v fréely damnable bondage law anone hée iudged might hée would hée lōger vnder law paule aū ſwereth y• wée obey vnto y• workes ſinne ſeruauntes ſinne obey workes iuſtice ſeruauntes iuſtice truely haue ſame fayth iuſtifieth v ſhall deſire doe none workes thoſe belong iuſtification workes doe iuſtifie muſt néedes theſe workes true frutes iuſtificatiō cauſe iuſtification good workes frutes true fayth therfore thoſe men doe good workes becauſe iuſtified onely fayth bée childrē god child iuſtificafition liuyng ſpirite god none authour ilnes ſinne hée crieth harte abbapater ſure euident token true child god would bée gladder doe good workes becauſe iuſtified fréely therfore ſhould alſo bée moued fréely workes purpoſe profite alonely doe ye wil mercyfull god ye hath ſo fréely iuſtified thē alſo profite neighbour whō bound ſerue true charitie take example théefe condemned right law good example bée hanged king grace mercy doth fréely deliuer gallowes geueth pardon théefe thus deliuered kéepe hym ſelfe true man doe thoſe workes belong true man doe falleth agayne ſtelyng becauſe kyng pardoned hym ſo fréely reckeneth kyng ſo mercyfull hée hāg théeues deliuer mercy without deſeruing thinke wil ye king bée mercifull vnto théefe hée cōmeth againe ye gallowes nay truely hée deliuered cauſe kéepe hym ſelfe true man commeth lord rocheſter hée ſayth fayth doth begyn iuſtification v workes doe performe make perfite recite owne wordes per fidem initiari dicitur iuſticia ſolum non •• ti 2 autem conſummari nam conſummata ſticia non aliter quam ex operibus natis lucem editis acquir • poteſt opera conſummatè iuſtificant fides primum choat c chriſtened man would thinke byſhop would byſhop rocheſters vayne diſtinction thus trifle play god holy word god worde ſo playne man auoyde fayth iuſtifieth alonely commeth lord rocheſter litle • ayne diſtinction inuented owne brayne without authoritie scripture clearely auoyde scripture whole diſputation paule lord ſay conſcience doe recken auoyde vengeaūce god ſith thus trifle deſpiſe god holy word thinke vayne diſtinctiō bée alowed afore ieſus chriſt whoſe glorye wée doe cōtēde ſtriue afore doe handle matter doe thinke verely owne conſcience doth ſore accuſe thus blaſphemyng holy worde god wherefore lord chriſtes ſake remember bée aged ſhall long tary theſe vayne diſtinctiōs haue inuented pleaſure men great peruertyng god holy word ſhall bée euerlaſtyng damnation leſt wayes feare ye terrible vengeaūce god remēber ſhame ye world thinke men bée ſo mad ſo vnlearned bée deceiued triflyng diſtinction ſeyng worde god ſo playne agaynſt doth paule ſay ephe 2 iuſtification alonely fayth workes auoyde ſame non ex operibus workes workes doe make iuſtification perfite saint paules wordes true alſo paule ſayth bée childrē god fayth bée childrē alſo heyres imperfection finde childrē heyres chriſtē mē deſire haue fayth onely ſay fayth doth begyn iuſtification beſide know well paule doth proue whole epiſtles romanes alſo galathians fayth doth iuſtifie yea contention agaynſt workes bryng workes make iuſtification perfect paule hath excluded moreouer iewes againſt whoſe work paule diſputeth bryng diſtinction thē briefely ſay doctours haue recited ſay sola fides onely fayth doth iuſtifie doubtles ſatiſfie men diſtinction worthy aunſwere damnable reaſon made open playne lye thou ſayſt workes doe iuſtifie yet helpe iuſtification fayth onely ergo thou deſtroyeſt good workes wilt man ſhall worke well alonely beléeue aūſwere ſhame good workes bee done although iuſtifie men might well bée aſhamed theſe open lye tell one learned euer ſay teach men ſhould doe good workes many bée ſay workes iuſtifie paule ſcholers mā denyeth good workes marueile doe workes father whiche lyer murtherer begynnyng pray cōſequent owne logike work doe iuſtifie ergo wee néede doe deſpiſe bée valure take like conſequent ſay kinges grace doth iuſtifie ergo deſpiſe ergo hée longer kyng alſo sunne moone doe iuſtifie ergo deſtroy ſuch damnable lye muſt paul néedes ſuffer whē hée proued fayth onely iuſtifie came ouerthwarte father ſayd ergo thou deſtroyeſt law thou teacheſt iuſtifieth god forbid ſayth paule doe learne rom 3 waye fulfill law faith whereby law alonely fulfilled without whiche workes law bée ſinne doe likewiſe teach true way wherby good workes muſt done firſt man faith bée iuſtified iuſt man muſt néedes doe good workes whiche afore ſinne bée good yea eatyng drinkyng ſléeping good beſide theſe haue certayne ſcriptures firſt iames whoſe wordes bee theſe wilt thou iam 2 vnderſtand thou vayne man fayth without déedes dead abraham father iuſtified dedes hée offered ſōne iſaac aulter lykewiſe rahab harlot iuſtified ſhe receiued meſſengers ſent way auguſtine doth declare diuers place yt bleſſed paule iames ſemed aug 83 queſt c 76 bée contrary matter therefore aguſtine willing ſaue eſtimacion epiſtle doth declare paule doth ſpeake workes goe béefore fayth iames ſpeaketh workes folow fayth yet aguſtine bée compelled wordes epiſtle graunt ye workes doe iuſtifie reaſon saint paules worde • bée ſo appartly vehemently contrary wherefore ſéeing ſheweth controuerſy two place ye ſcripture ſtandeth reaſon learning ſame place ſéemeth bée féebleſt alſo darkeſt ſhould bée expounded declared part ſcripture clereſt moſt autorite truth auctoritie paule hath alwayes church god béene eſtimacion ſtrength euer epiſtle though epiſtle hath bene receyued eſpecially cauſe yt ſpeake ſcripture article iuſtifycation ſo playnely plenteouſlye handled bleſſed paule muſt euery learned man graunt wherfore ſtandeth reaſon lerning ſaying saint iames muſt néedes bée reduced brought vnto bleſſed paules meaning paule vnto iames ſaying therefore much bleſſed paule alſo saint iames meaning good workes ſhould bée done ye bée chriſtē men ſhould bée idle doe good becauſe childrē grace ſhould rather lyuynge expreſſe outwardlye goodnes receiued grace bleſſed paule ſayth geue rom 6 membres bée ſeruantes vnto righteouſnes afore ſeruauntes vnto vncleanes cauſe ſay iames ſaying muſt néedes bée vnderſtanded bée wrytten agaynſt thoſe men boſted ſelues idle vayne opinion thought thē ſelues haue reckened bée good fayth iames proue fayth idle thing none effect doth declare clerely ye brought forth time place conuenient good work therefore hée cauleth deade fayth hée bryngeth alſo naked brother fayth bryngeth forth fruite fayth iuſtifieth yet fruite doth iuſtifie wich hath néede clothing vnto theſe men yt boaſted fayth hath compaſſion neceſſitie wherefore hée concludeth ye haue true fayth therefore hée ſayth vnto ſhew vnto mée thy fayth without workes ſhall ſhew vnto thée workes fayth heare playne iames would fayth dead fayth valure ye hath workes workes ſhoulde declare ſhew outwarde fayth workes ſhould bée outward declaration teſtimonie ye inwarde iuſtification receiued fayth ye workes may take away ſynne el bée ſatiſfaction part ſynne belongeth onely chriſt bleſſed iohn 1 iohn 2 ſayth alſo paule hée hath appered al put ſinne flight offering vp hym ſelfe iames meaning hebr 9 declared foloweth thou ſéeſt ſayth hée fayth wrought abraham déedes ye déedes fayth made perfect marke fayth wrought hys déedes fayth becauſe lyuyng fayth brought forth wrought ye high worke oblation alſo fayth perfect déedes fayth declared great teſtimonye afore worlde ye lyuyng perfect right ſhapen faith abraham yt inward fayth declared afore god fayth iuſtifieth god good wordes declare iuſtification yt worlde outward workes afore worlde bée good iuſtified thus faith made perfect afore god man vnto doe agrée yt fayth alonely iuſtifieth god whiche tyme place doth worke well yea liuyng thing god bée dead idle man yet doe geue fayth chriſtes bloud glory belongeth onely ſay iuſtificatiō remiſſiō ſinnes ſatiſfieng god wrath takyng awaye euerlaſtyng vengeaunce purchaſing mercy fulfillyng law like thing glorye theſe ſay belongeth chriſt onely pertakers fayth chriſtes bloud onely worke receyueth promiſe made chriſtes bloud fayth onely take example god ſayth abraham thy ſeede ſhall bleſſe people abraham workes doe nothyng receiuyng bleſſing yet make hang ſéede hée beléeueth god ſticketh faſt fayth promiſe thinketh god ſhall bée true though hée bée lyer ſo hée partaker bleſſing made yt ſéede note alſo bleſſing promiſed abraham ſéede abraham workes ergo abraham bleſſed becauſe hée hangeth ſéede workes alſo bleſſed paule doth driue ſore argument gala 3 agaynſt workes much scripture ſayth ſemine non ſeminibus quaſi multis ſed vno workes doe helpe leſſe iuſtificatiō muſt néedes promiſe bée made pertaine many one onely ye ſore agaynſte bleſſed paule wherefore conclude glory prayſe iuſtification belongeth onely fayth chriſtes bloud workes wiſe notwithſtādyng doe alſo laude prayſe good workes doe teach diligently doe good workes much god maker hath commaunded yea alſo profite neighbour good workes furthermore men blaſphemeth veritie might bée moued vertuous liuyng conuerſatiō holy religiō chriſt theſe cauſes moe ſay doe teach good mē liue wel vertuouſly yea alſo wée teach reward good workes remiſſion ſinnes good workes ſhall haue reward god ſcripture teſtifieth remiſſion ſinnes yet iuſtication rewarde wherfore ſaying iames muſt néedes bée verified againſt thē boaſted ſelues vayne fayth indéede idle opinion true fayth worke thorough charitie therfore iames diſputeth well agaynſt fayth dead fayth co •• helpe helpeth deuill thing iames maketh nothing agaynſt mée rather wyth mée alſo haue scripture god iuſtified heare rom 2 lawe doe law ſhalbée iuſtified texte glory cry opera opera workes workes yee would conſider mynde paule ſhould well perceaue hée meaneth workes might deſerue iuſtification coulde hée haue concluded thys agaynſte iewes workes lawe vttermoſt yet iuſtified wherefore paule meaneth hearer lawe doe outwarde workes lawe feare rewarde hypocriſie el bée iuſtified doer caulleth hée doe workes lawe intent ye lawe lawe commaundeth true fayth chriſt ieſus ende ye lawe fulfilling law saint paule ſayth beléeue wherefore men bée hearer onely lawe till tyme haue fayth chriſt ieſus imputed vnto iuſtice workes lawe bée cauſe iuſtification alonely outward teſtimonie witnes lawe fulfilled inwardly conſcience afore god fulfilled hath accuſation againſt chriſt hath made ſatiſfactiō bée partaker fayth ſo lawe muſt bée content admitte theſe men bée fulfillers doer ye law ſhall ſay dreame bée auguſtines wordes doer lawe ſhall bée iuſtified muſt bée auguſt de ſpiri lit vnderſtāded wée may know cā none otherwiſe bée doer lawe excepte bée firſt iuſtified iuſtification belongeth vnto doer iuſtification doth precéede maner doinges c heare iuſtificatiō firſt geuen men might bée able doe workes lawe alſo expoſition gloſe haue meruayle ſtudie better alſo haue scripture gloſa cornelius gētile great almes prayd vnto god alwayes ʋnto whome aungell ſpake maner thy prayer thy almes come vp remembraunce preſence god actes 10 texte gather hys good workes helpe iuſtifie hym aunſwere holy ghoſt hath opē ly declared hymſelfe hée ſayth cornelius deuoute man one feared god coulde bée without ye god taught hym inwardely fayth yea coulde hée know god deuoutly fayth ergo hée iuſtified afore god fayth man iuſtified god 〈◊〉 bee idle muſt doc good ye world knew iuſtificatiō therfore yt holy ghoſt doth declare hys inward iuſtificatiō whē hée ſaith hée deuoute feared god alſo doth ſhew openly fruit iuſtification hée ſayth hée almes moreouer haue holy ghoſt fell afore baptiſed water declareth openly iuſtified afore god well declared alſo owne lawe whoſe wordes bée theſe cornelius cēturio yet heathē mā made cleane ye gifte ij queſt 〈◊〉 non omnes epiſcopo holy ghoſt haue playnely yt hée iuſtified yt gifte yt holy ghoſt afore good work hée heathē mā ſcripture yée haue haue faith ſo yt may trāſpoſe moūtaines haue charitie nothyng gather fayth wythout charitie iuſtifie aunſwere gather paule open hée ſpeaketh thyng whereby men may bée iuſtified alonely hée teacheth bée iuſtified muſt worke charitie alſo plaine hée ſpeaketh fayth doth iuſtifie inwardly faith doth worke outwardely caulled gifte holy ghoſt yt gifte tounges gift propheſies gifte healing gifte interpretation opē chapiter afore fayth geuen iuſtifie alonely doe myracles wonder ſignes therefore ſayth paule fayth ſo coulde moue mountaynes alſo open certayne men ſhall ſay vnto chriſt beholde wée haue done myracles caſt deuils math 7 thy name yet hée ſhall ſay truely know fayth gifte god iuſtifieth gifte ſcience propheſies ſometyme church ſometyme neuer neceſſitie bée faith wée ſpeake doth béeleeue promiſes god ſticketh faſt bloud chriſt hath none vertue iuſtifie muſt néedes iuſtifie whereſoeuer hée hée ſticketh ſo faſt god worde hée looketh myracles thys fayth neuer church lyfe church fayth mayſter chriſte iohn 17 prayde myght neuer fayle therefore paule deſcribeth fayth hée caulleth fayth worketh charitie iuſtifieth charitie ſayth playnely neyther circumciſion yet vncircumciſion gala 5 valure chriſt ieſu fayth doth hée playnely exclude iuſtification hygheſt worke lawe circumciſion ſetteth fayth alone gyfte fayth doth myracles gift fayth worketh charitie yée ſhall thinke thys bée dreame bryng athanaſius ſayinge whoſe wordes bée theſe two maner ſaythes one iuſtifieng atha ad rom ſpoken thy fayth hath ſaued thée cauled gyft god whereby myracles bée done written haue fayth grayne muſtard ſéede c haue playne fayth doth iuſtifie onelye perfectly maner work fayth geuē god fréely ſoules fayth iuſtifieth v geuē v freely god vnto fayth iuſtification onely promiſed onely imputed rekened god neuertheles fayth tyme place conuenient ſtrength hée muſt néedes worke charitye bée iuſtified thereby afore iuſtified poſſible hée coulde haue charitie owne ſchoole men infidell cā haue charitie ye iuſtified mā hée frée ſeruaunt vnto god loue ye hée hath vnto loue ſéeketh god owne profit owne aduaū tage hée wicked ſéeketh alonely wyll god profite men worketh neyther loue heauen yet feare hell hée knoweth well heauen wyth ioyes thereof prepared begynnyng world hym hys father muſt néedes folow contrariwyſe infidell wicked man doth worke hys wicked déedes becauſe hée woulde haue hell euerlaſting dampnation hys rewarde hée woulde rather contrary notwithſtandyng hell euerlaſting dampnation muſt néedes follow wicked déedes finally righteous man frée ſeruaunt god worketh hyerelyng poſſible heauen yet woulde hée doe leſſe good reſpecte maker worlde lord rewardes alſo argument thys fayth worke workes doth iuſtifie ergo fayth doth iuſtifie aunſwere truth doe meane fayth owne dignitie hys owne perfection doth iuſtifie v scripture doth ſay fayth alonely iuſtifieth becauſe thyng alonely whereby doe hange chriſte faith alonely partaker ye merites mercy purchaſed chriſtes bloude fayth alonely receaue promyſes made fayth onely iuſtifieth becauſe fayth attaine benefite chriſtes death onely iuſtifieth v chriſt wherefore wée ſay bleſſed paule fayth onely iuſtifieth imputatiue ye merites goodnes grace fauour chriſt ſaluation imputed reckoned vnto v becauſe wée hange beléeue hym hée deceaue man doth beléeue hym iuſtice ſchoole men teacheth formal iuſtice fulfillyng lawe deſerued v iuſtification grace mercy deſeruing duty iuſtice reckened imputed vnto v ye fayth chriſt ieſus deſeruyng clearely fully mercy imputed vnto v moſt honorable gracious prince haue declared vnto highnes faith doth iuſtifie v god alſo brought ſentēce alonely bleſſed word god ſufficient cauſe expoſition holy doctours grace might ſée moued opinion light cauſe doctrine myne ſo new men hath new doctrine nowe taught noted moreouer haue declared vnto grace woulde haue good workes done would haue chriſten man life bée idle thyng el life vncleannes would haue bée chaunged vertue goodnes liue good workes commaundement god grace may well perceiue myne aduerſaries hath reported truely haue ſayd would men ſhould neither faſt pray geue almes yet bée penitent ſinnes haue neuer ſayd yet taught lyke ſentence take god recorde workes déedes writynges euer wrote made wherfore doubt pleaſe grace graciouſly wil proue vntrue cauſe many mo doth almighty god know bée true euer preſerue moſte royall maieſtie honour goodnes amen church bee therof whereby men may know name holy church haue thoſe mē long tyme vſurped preſumptuouſlye pope hys churche agreeth maners holy churche darkenes light wt ſhame greateſt enemyes holy church could haue earth agrée wt maners holy church darknes light god yt deuyll holy church hard man chriſt onely would heare manner men ſauing chriſt neuer heare except weare profit glory holy church ruled world would rule world holy church would bée holy chriſt onely would bée holy owne helpe holy church allwayes deſpiſed perſecuted world would bée honored yt pope perſecutor holy church world perſecuters men holy church inwardly decked ſpiritual vertues would bée outwardly ſhinyng ſpirituall araye holy church would bée chaſte ſpryte would mouthes vow chaſtite ſpend liues whore dome holy church dyd allwayes ſhew méekenes worlde would bée ſo proude yt hart could deuiſe breifely whatſoeuer thing ye farre pope doth differ churche true holy church agreable church neuer crumme allonely violence vſurped name holy church man crowne long goune white ſmock ouer gowne thē remedy hée muſt nedes bée church yea holy church ſelf ye barber made bul crowne taylor iack nape lōg gowne brought aſſe forth foule greate abuſe pope takyng vpō hym hee ye holy church white rochet thē mā might dout ye holy church euerye man muſt fall downe receyue clene remiſſion poena oulpa toties quoties came ſucceſſours peter paule haue deſpenſatiō chriſtes bloud merites holy ſaints ye ſuffrages holy church diſtribute key bearer heauē hell denye truth opē néede probation wee ſée dayly eye man compare chriſt yt ye head holy church vnto theſe prelate call ſelues viccars hée ſhall finde ſmale agréement betwéene perſon vicar hée conſider peter paule withall apoſtels ſhall think eyther none holy church el prelals agrée nothing yea hée may reckē peter paule ſtarke fooles ryght mad men liued ſo deſpectuous lyfe néede make many wordes tell name ſpeake doubt galde horſe béewray hym ſelfe ſhortly deuyll would come owne perſon diſguiſed tell impoſſible hée could bée contrary chriſt hys apoſtels thoſe men call thē ſelues ye holy church yea take away name church ſet ſtéede name deuyll know byſhop frō deuyll workes nay trewly difference betweene byſhop deuill bée one yet bée heades chriſtes church yea holy church ſelfe ſo yée wicked ſo wherefore bleſſed ſpouſe chriſt may bée knowen thée open abhominable whore harlotes therefore god grace ſet holy church men ſhall know worde eccleſia ye new teſtament olde taken oftē tymes whole congregatiō whole multitude yt people good bad booke numeri haue brought nume 20 congregation church god wildernes alſo place king 3 king 8 turned face bleſſed whole congregation church iſraell church iſraell ſtoode likewiſe new teſtamēt saint paule corinthian haue ſēt 1 cor 4 vnto tymothy ſhall learne wayes ye bée chriſt ieſu doe learne euery congregation alſo place doe deſpiſe 1 cor 11 congregation god ſhame thē haue theſe place many moe open greke word eccleſia taken whole congregation good bad wherfore ye church greatly ſpeake church iewes saraſens murtherers theeues baudes harlot though know holy church paule ſpeaketh ephe 5 men loue wiues chriſt hath loued church hath geuē ſelfe hée might ſanctifie clenſe fountaine water worde life make ſelfe glorious holy churche
