truely defined church without ſpot wrincle ſuch thyng ſhe might bée holy without blame haue true churche chriſt ſo pure ſo cleane without ſpotte wherby ſhée pure cleane owne merites owne might exteriour araye gold ſiluer yet precious ſtones neither myters croſeſtaues pillers pollaxes wherby chriſt onely hath geuen ſelfe intēt hée would make cleane therefore ſayth paule hée gaue ſelfe hée might ſanctifie true holy church ſanctified made holy chriſt hée might clenſe make ſelfe glorious church alſo place waſhed ſanctified iuſtified name ieſus chriſt ſpirite god sée lordes church waſhed chriſt 1 cor 1 holy ſpirite bleſſynges ſpirituall ornamentes ſpirituall holy water theſe thynges cannot helpe holy church ſhe holy ſpirite outwarde hypocriſie ſhe alſo clenſed chriſtes bleſſed bloud outward diſguiſinges doth auguſtine wel proue ſaying chriſt church made fayre firſt ſhe filthie ſinnes afterward pardon grace auguſtinus de verbis domini ſer ſhe made fayre c auguſtine ſayth yt chriſt hath made church fayre grace pardon pardon grace church ſtādeth chriſtes election chriſt haue waſhed choſen bée none church though ride thouſand ſpiritual horſes haue ſpirituall tokēs earth ye ſonne god haue deliuered thē iohn 6 truely deliuered ye make power holynes ſhall alwayes finde good ale wyne hangeth gréene ſigne ſpirituall ſignes token make churche god folow aſſigne churche ſhall bée nay nay lord bée beléeue ye chriſt faithful beleuers chriſtes merites yt ryght holy church god hath waſhed ſinnes ſticke faſt vnto merites promiſe made hym onely bée church god ſo pure ſo cleane ſhall bée lawfull peter ſay bée vncleane whether bée iew gréeke kyng ſubiect carter cardinall butcher byſhop tancardbearer cannelrater frée bounde frier fidler monke miller beléeue chriſtes word ſticke faſt bleſſed promiſes truſt onely merites bleſſed bloud bée holy church god yea true church afore god ſpiritual token exteriour cleannes remaine filthynes ſinne bleſſings pardon ſpirituallitie holynes clenſe bring churche boaſt crake blaſt bleſſe curſe till holy eye ſtart head wil helpe chriſt chooſeth church iudgement holy ghoſt frée inſpireth hée hée neither bée bound god bee ruled ſtate degree perſon pope cardinall archbiſhop byſhop abbot prior deacon archdeacon parſon ʋicare nunne frier briefly come whole rabble togither call ſelues ye holy churche exclude yea take ſunne moone ſtarres helpe frendes haue heauē earth yet ſhall bée holy church except haue yt ſpirite chriſt bée waſhed bleſſed bloud ye holy churche chriſt nothyng el congregation ſanctified ſpirite redéemed chriſtes bloud ſticketh faſt ſure alonely promiſes hée made therein church ſpirituall holy churche yt true church god ye worlde inuiſible thyng exterior thyng inuiſible carnall eye ſay bee inuiſible bée church holy church ſelfe inuiſible fayth purenes cleanes chriſt onely worlde worlde hath iudgement knowledge honour cleanes chriſt ſure faſt appeare goodnes vnto worlde ſhée maketh reckenyng thinketh ſelfe thyng thyng better worlde iudgeth well truſt chriſt onely ſuffereth worlde rage blaſpheme agaynſt agaynſt chriſt maker shée ſtandeth faſt beléeueth ſted faſtly ſhal haue ſhamefull ende euerlaſting damnation rewarde briefly meditation thoughtes heauenly ſhée doth ſpirituall ſhée erre ſhée cleaueth ſo faſt worde god veritie cauſe paule calleth true holy church piller ground trueth piller grounde truth ſhée ſo ſure owne ſtrength ſhée ſticketh ſo faſt lyuyng god hys bleſſed worde true church ſcattered thorow worlde neyther bounde perſon reaſon dignitie yet place reaſon fayned holynes ſhée frée thynge thorow worlde auguſtine doth witneſſe theſe wordes holy church wée doe auguſt ſer 〈◊〉 de tempore ſay one ſhould ſay wée bée alonely heare mée many faythfull chriſtened mē church ſay thys citye many bée thys region many bée beyonde ſea many bée worlde ryſing ſunne till goyng name god prayſed ſo holy church mother c haue playnely holy church congregation faythfull men ſoeuer bee world holy church congregation faythfull men whereſoeuer bée worlde neyther pope yet hys cardinalles bée church thys church pooreſt man earth church ſtandeth alonely ſpirituall faith chriſt ieſus dignity honour worlde liranus doth declare theſe wordes lyra mat ca 19 church doth ſtand men reaſon ſpirituall power ſecular dignity many prince many pope inferiour perſons haue ſwerned frō fayth wherfore church doth ſtand thoſe perſons whome true knowledge confeſſion fayth veritie c lordes ſay lyra haue great maruayle burne hym hye tyme condemne hym heretike hée ſpeaketh agaynſt lawe xxiiij q 1 quodcun que gloſe declareth god ſuffereth church rome erre lyra ſayth playnely many pope haue erred alſo church ſtandeth dignitie confeſſion chriſt hys bleſſed veritie wyll bée obiected fayne ſuch church logitions doe intentionem ſecundam thyng yt ſhall man finde church ſo pure ſo cleane hath neyther ſpot wrinckle wythout ſinne ſéeyng men muſt trueth ſaye forgéeue v treſpaſſe man ſay bée hée neuer ſo righteous hée hath math 6 1 iohn 1 ſinne thē hee lyer veritie hym thys aunſwere ephe 5 thys holy church hath ſin yet ſhée pure cleane marke paules wordes chriſte hath geuen hymſelfe hée might make glorious cleannes holy churche made pure cleane without ſpotte wrinkle holy church mercy god toward thorow chriſt whoſe ſake layeth nothing charge yea perſon woulde hée ready géeue cleanes let fayth clayme right hys purenes owne betwéene common betwéene man wyfe church looke owne merites owne workes ſhée full ſinne muſt néedes ſay demitte mihi debita ſhée néeded ſay ſhée none ſhée referre ſelfe vnto merites bleſſed huſbande chriſt ieſus cleanes ſhée hath hys bloud thē ſhée without ſpotte reaſon ſhée ſticketh fayth ſo faſt vnto huſband chriſt doth abyde confeſſion ſinne requireth mercy therfore nothing layde charge thyng forgéeuen therefore ſayth paule damnation vnto bée chriſt ieſu may bée playner wyll bryng auguſtines wordes auguſtinus de verbis apoſtoli ſ 〈◊〉 vexed donatiſtes wyth thys ſame reaſon layd agaynſt mée hys wordes bée theſe whole church ſayth forgéeue v ſinnes wherefore ſhée hath ſpottes wrinckles knowledging wrinckles bée extended ſtretched knowledging ſpottes waſhed away church abydeth prayer ſhée myght bée clēſed knowledging ſinnes lōg liue hereſo ſtandeth wée ſhall departe thys bodye ſuch thynges bée forgéeuen euery mā wherfore church god treaſures god without ſpotte wrinkle thys meane y• church god treaſures god wythout ſpotte wrinckles therefore doe wée lyue wythout ſinne wee ſhall paſſe hence wythout ſinne c haue clearely church god clenſed purified chriſt knowledgyng ſinnes owne purenes wherefore ſuch church muſt néedes bée though ye carnall eye ſée fleſhly reaſon iudge wherefore wée beléeue thys article fayth holy church communion felow ſhyp holy men know ſéeyng féelyng wée doe felowſhyp draper mercer none article faith playne exterior fayth neither bee ſeene felt ſignes wyth holy ornamentes holy myters holy croſſeſtaues holy pyllers polaxis holy red gloues holy ouches holy rynges holy annoynted finger holy veſtmentes holy challices holy golden ſhowes yea take alſo helpe thomas canterburyes holy ſhowe wyth holy bootes holy monkes theſe togither make one crumme holynes helpe one pricke forward may bée wythin thys church theſe thynges coulde helpe maſtery make aſſe bée church god holy mother church true holynes right holye mother church hath holynes commeth god father thorough ſwéete bloud bleſſed ſonne ieſus chriſt confidence truſt ʋnto ſhe ſticketh onely ſted faſt fayth whoſe purenes ſhee alſo pure ſhe doth confeſſe vnclennes ſhee beléeueth ſtedfaſtly ſhe hath aduocate ſinne ye father heauen chriſt ieſus hée ſatiſfaction ſinnes 1 iohn 2 hée mercy merites hath choſen bée becauſe ſhe therfore muſt ſhe bée cleane ſo long ſhe abideth well declared iohn iohn 15 maſter chriſte compared vyne member holy churche branch braunches bring foorth frute ſelues ſo cā holy church ſelfe bring foorth goodnes except ſhee remaine chriſt perſite fayth wel proued owne law whoſe wordes bée theſe therfore church holy becauſe ſhe beléeueth righteouſly god c de con 4 c prima igitur cauſe wherfore church holy becauſe ſhe beléeueth righteouſly god ſhe beléeueth nothyng ſhe beléeueth heareth worde maſter chriſte beareth witneſſe ſhéepe heare voyce man voyce doe know alſo place hée god heareth wordes god cō meth ye church god hath ſo ſure iudgemēt ſhe knoweth voyce chriſt frō voyces erre iudgement becauſe chriſt hath choſen becauſe ſhe learned god maſter chriſt ſayth becauſe ſhe hath iohn ſayth inwarde 1 iohn 2 oyntmēt god y• teacheth maner verity ſo ſhe erre ſhee erre becauſe ſhe may doe ſhe becauſe thing ſhe doth well done becauſe ſhe may make new rule newe lawes pleaſure becauſe ſhe may inuent newe ſeruice god scripture wil nay nay lordes ſhe woman muſt bée ruled huſbande yea ſhe ſhéepe muſt heare ye voyce ſhepheard ſo long ſhe doth ſo long cā ſhe erre becauſe voyce ſhepheard bée falſe may proued de p • ne diſ 2 si gloſſa 24 q 1 arecta gloſſa law whoſe wordes bée theſe ye whole church erre alſo place congregation faythfull men muſt néedes bée alſo erre c theſe wordes bée playne church erre faythfull congregation erre congregation faythfull men bée gathered chriſtes name whiche haue chriſtes ſpirite whiche haue holy oyntement god whiche abyde faſt chriſtes word heare mās voyce lordes gather togither lawes cā make holynes deuiſe crye church churche councels councels lawfully gathered power holy ghoſt may ſay yet lye haue déede holy ghoſt doe heare voyce chriſtes churche deuill théenes murtherers chriſt ſaith come fold chriſt without bring voice come owne voyce owne ſtatutes owne word owne mandamus voyce murtherers theeues mandamus precipimus precipimus excommunicamus excommunicamus theſe bée voyces murtherers théeues chriſt therfore erre bée taught god haue holy oyntment haue worde god heare voyce true ſhepheard therfore muſt néedes erre counſells maner rule lorde rocheſter doth aſſigne examine counſels rule rocheſter teacheth know difference betweene y• pope councell hée ſayth pope counſell doth agrée one hée ſuſpect counſell bée right euer heare ſuch rule chriſtean man yea biſhop yea doctor diuinite hath hée learned diuinite recken counſell bée trew becauſe ye pope ſo many men doe agree one yea ſuch men haue ſo often tymes erred coūcels hée doth declare hym ſelf rekening councell erreth pope agree ynges counſell conſtantinople 330 byſhops yet erre hée knew cauſe bée cauſe pope agrée reſonable cauſe cā pope erre let hym read lawe diſtinctio 19 anaſtaſius pope haue erred diſtinctio 40 si papa alſo 24 q 1 arecta gloſe ſhall hée fynde pope hath erred wherefore ſhould matter ſtande iudgment pope condemned heretickes hée thys rule ſaue counſels conſtance baſell counſels pope condemned heretykes ſame counſels make mencion alſo councels haue erred graūted hée hymſelfe peraduenture hée ſaye full councels well amended diſtinction conſcernyng veritie counſell hath thowſand byſhops hath fyve thowſand multitude helpe veritie turke veritie falſed prophet micheas worſſe part 3 king 2 3 king 18 hée alone againſt iiij hundred ſo ye verytie ye prophet ball elyas foure hundred fyftye hee one man briefely chriſtes flocke alwayes litle flocke ye flocke chriſt ye ſmalleſt nūber world yet beſt ſmalleſt number maketh chriſtes flocke chriſtes church ſtādeth neyther greateſt number yet ſmalleſt iudgmēt numbring man callyng eleccion god wherefore let lorde bring forth counſell hée haue word god onely ſay may erre alſo doe erre verye déede proue greateſt lawyer haue called panormitanus whoſe wordes de electio c ſignifica bée theſe councels may erre haue erred concernyng contract matrimony inter raptorem raptam ſaying saint hierome afterward preferred councell meldelci dyd erre boue ſtatute counſel proued 36 q 2 tria thinges concerning fayth ſaying priuat perſon bee preferred afore ſaying pope hée haue better reaſōs ſcriptures new olde teſtamēt pope helpe ſay counſell erre becauſe chriſt pray church ye fayth ſhould fayle aū ſwere though ye generall coūcell doe repreſent ye whole vniuerſall church neuertheles déede ye vniuerſall church repreſentatiue vniuerſal generall councell vniuerſall churche church ſtādeth ye election fayth full men faithfull mē y• world make vniuerſall church whoſe head ſpouſe chriſt ieſus pope vicar chriſt head church church erre c open counſell may erre priuate perſon hauing ſcriptures hym bée heard pope alſo ye coū ſell hauing ſcriptures haue alſo trew church erre thing bée veryfyed counſels bée neyther without errour yet holy church doe repreſēt church legate repreſenteth king perſon followeth hée ye king hath much power king aboue king may rule king may alſo bée proued auguſtine whoſe word auguſtinus de bap li 2 c 3 contra donatiſtas bée theſe thoſe counſelles bée gathered euery prouince muſt without doubt geue place auctoritie ful counſels bée gathered chriſtendom alſo thoſe full counſels oft tymes muſt bée amended full counſels come thyng bée opened experience fore ſhut thing bée knowen hydden may bee done without councels haue erred many erre ſhadowe ſuperſticious pride without boaſted arrogancy contentiō malicious enuy holy méekenes holy peace chriſten charitye c playne full coū ſels may bée amended reformed ye thing néede could erre yea erre déede moreouer muſt néedes graunt rule counſels muſt bée exammined ſentence muſt bée geuen councels bée true falſe rule counſels bée ordered muſt néedes erre bée falſe deuill wherfore gather coū ſels togither yet make holy church peraduenture may bée many coūſels good perfite men holy churche togither make vnyuerſall holy church erre neither haue anctoritie ouer holy ſcriptures iudges councels doings holy church holy ſcripture god ſoone forſake chriſt holy worde ſo ſoone congregation deuyll théeues murtherers yet muſt néedes bée holy church chriſt earth neyther bounde ieruſalem conſtantinople yet rome though ſhée lyke vnto aſſe fole wyll bée obiected mayſter chriſt commaundeth math 10 brother offende mée ſhoulde complayne church church haue ſet ſpirituall man knoweth god onely ſhée alſo ſcattered thorow worlde wherfore man complayne church aunſwere chriſt doth playnely ſpeake man hath wronge muſt néedes bée perticuler certayne man therefore likewyſe hée biddeth perticular church whome wee may complayne hym complayne vniuerſall church perticular church particular church ſhée bée god true member vniuerſal church ſhée iudge righteouſly chriſtes worde probation brought afore neuertheleſſe oftētymes cōmeth paſſe y• particular church doth fully wholy erre iudgeth vnryght excommunicateth bleſſed god open owne lawe whoſe wordes bée theſe oftētymes hée caſt within 24 q 3 si quis et c cū aliquis hée within kept without c haue playnely ye particular church may erre wherefore church erre vniuerſall church caulled communion felowſhip communion felowſhip saintes vniuerſall church saintes addition made holy father ciprians time mention likelyhode declare preſumption certayne men certayne congregation reckened themſelues bée holy church wherfore lordes ſée well leaſt holy ghoſt haue pricked wyth thys addition haue alwayes made ſelfe holy church yea wythout holines haue declared vnto holy church congregation faithfull men thorowout ye world whereby ſhée holy chriſtes holyneſſe chriſtes bloud alſo cauſe ſhée erre becauſe ſhée kepeth ſelfe ſo faſt worde god whiche perfite true rule nowe muſt declare ſignes tokēs may know mā may know church place place bée certeine member holye church though ſhée bée ſelf ſpirituall▪ bée perfitely knowen exteriour ſenſes yet neuertheleſſe may haue certeine token ſpirituall preſence whereby may recken place place bee certeine member naturall example example teaching ye true church may knowne though ſoule man ſelfe bée ſpirituall inuiſible yet may haue ſure token preſence hearyng mouyng ſpeakyng ſmellyng ſuch likewiſe word god truely perfitely preached without damnable dreames men well hearer receiued alſo ſée good woorkes doe openly agrée doctrine goſpell theſe bée good ſure tokēs whereby may iudge bée ſome men holy church firſt whereas goſpell truely preached muſt néedes light ſome men harte prophete witneſſeth word ſhall returne agayne fruſtrate eſay 55 ſhall doe thyng ſhall proſper thoſe thynges vnto ſend alſo paule ſayth fayth cōmeth hearyng hearyng commeth rom 10 word god therfore open holy scripture peter actes 10 ſpake wordes god holy ghoſt fell downe wherfore open god worde neuer bée preached vayne ſome men muſt néedes receiue thereby bée made holy churche though men doe know neither name yet face word receiued harte ſecond token receiuers woord doe worke well thereafter paule declareth 1 theſſ 2 hearer receiued v word wherewith god preached receiued word men euen déede word god whiche worketh beléeue men doe good workes fruite good fayth worke worde god good token bée men churche though hypocriſie ſo ſubtile ſo ſecret may bée oftentymes deceiued theſe outward workes neuertheles charitie iudgeth well thinges haue good outward ſhowe bée opē ly agaynſt word god charitie may deceaued fayth neuer bee deceaued ieoperdy though charitie bée deceiued opē ieoperdies fayth neuer deceiued purpoſe worde god preached truely good perfite token bée ſome mē chriſtes church may bée prooued chriſoſtomes wordes bée iudea let thē flée vp mountaines ſay bée chriſtendome let geue thē ſelues scripture wherfore commaundeth hée chriſtened men tyme ſhould flye vnto scripture tyme hereſies haue crept church bée true probation chriſtendome refuge vnto chriſten men willyng know veritie fayth ye scripture god afore many wayes ſhewed church chriſt congregation gentile way know whiche true churche chriſt alonely ſcriptures workes firſt church chriſt knowen conuerſation chriſten men either many holy holynes wicked men nowe chriſten men bée euill worſſe heretickes gentile yea greater continencie founde among among chriſten men wherefore hée knowe ye church chriſt ſaying chriſoſtome ſhall hée knowe scripture onely wherfore lord cōſidering ſo greate confuſion thynges ſhould come latter dayes therfore commaundeth hée chriſten men bée chriſtendome willing reſerue ſtedfaſtnes true fayth ſhould flye vnto thyng vnto scripture haue reſpect vnto thynges ſhall bée ſclaundered ſhall periſhe vnderſtandyng whiche true church c theſe wordes néede expoſition bée plaine inough doe alſo exclude maner learning ſauing holy ſcripture wherefore ſée honeſtie ſaue holy lawes defend againſt chriſoſtome ſendeth v ſcriptures learne holy church vnto call themſelues ye holy church chriſoſtome moreouer chriſoſtome complayne incontenency dayes would hée complaine hée liued ſawe baudry fornication church alſo ſendeth men ſcriptures know holy church vnto ye holy church church hereſyes ſcripture alſo paule witneſeth ſame ephe 2 ſaying built vpon foundacion apoſtles prophet heare haue playnely trewe church grounded yea holy church builte founded vpon apoſtles prophet founded holy ſcripture therefore whereſoeuer worde god preached good token bée ſome men chriſtes church fruites workes church ſhe doth onely fetch maner lyuing good workes ye holy word god ſhe fayneth dreameth new holines new inuented work ſcripture ſhe content wt chriſtes learning beléeueth chriſt hath ſufficiently taught manner good workes bée honour heauēly father therfore inuenteth ſhée way heauen followeth chriſt onely ſuffering oppreſſions perſecutions blaſpheminges al thing may bée layd vnto aguſtine ſayth ſhe learned chriſt holy mother yt church auguſtinus throughout world ſcattered far long trew head chriſt ieſus taught hath learned feare true church ſufferer perſecutor contumely croſſe yet death ſhée ſtrengthed reſiſting ſuffering c lordes compare ſelfe rule aguſtine let v ſée bring ſelf church el proue ſelf bée holy church ſuffereth perſecutions paule ſayth liue deuoutly chriſt 2 tim 3 muſt ſuffer perſecution ſtand thinges ſuffer nothing oppreſſe euery mā bée oppreſſed mā perſecute euery man man may ſpeake worde agaynſt though bée neuer ſo true caſt euery mā priſon mā may touch ſhal bée curſed compell euery mā ſay ſay ſay chriſte ſayth holynes worlde knoweth ſtandeth clothing decking watching ſléeping pope church perſecutors ſufferers eating drinking meate ye meate drynke drinke pattering mumbling theſe pſalmes thoſe pſalmes without deuotion bréefly holines book bel cādels challeces oyle creme glory pope churche traſh water horſes houndes pallaces mighty gloryous world hange glory crake boaſt vpon builde ye nature ye church holines whome haue learned theſe maners deny theſe bée true would denye world witneſſe agaynſt yea alſo owne factes déedes haue learned holynes chriſt yet holy church haue learned arians ye ſeruauntes deuyll hilarius hilarius cont arianos wryteth theſe wordes church doth threaten banyſhmentes pryſonmentes ſhée compelleth men beléeue exciled caſt priſon hangeth ſhée dignitye fellowſhip conſecrated threateuinges perſecutors ſhée cauſeth prieſtes flye encreaſed chaſing away prieſtes ſhée gloryeth ſhée loued ye world ye could neuer bée chriſtes except worlde hate thynke lordes doe theſe thinges bée layd arians charge owne frendes yea owne conſciences muſt néedes accuſe theſe thinges yet bée called chriſtes child lay nothyng holy doctours lay vnto let v ſée barnarde barnardus ſuper ſ 33 ſayth call themſelues miniſters chriſt ſerue antichriſt goe gorgiouſly arayed lordes good vnto whome géeue none honour theſe good commeth harlottes decking note ſaying saint barnard thou ſéeſt dayly game player diſguiſing kynges apparell thys cōmeth golde bridle ſaddles ſpurres ſo ſpurres bée bryghter thē aulters thys commeth theyr plenteous wine preſſes full ſellers bolkyng thys vnto thys cōmeth tunnes ſwéete wynes thys bée bagges ſo filled ſuch thinges theſe bée bée ruler church deacon archdeacon byſhoppes archbyſhops c lordes thought haue added cardinalles legate abbottes pryors haue made company holy ourſt thinke doth hée ſpeake hée fayth byſhops archbyſhops holynes doth hée reprooue hée ſpraketh gorgious araye harlottes deckyng game player diſguiſing goulden ſpurres ſaddelles bridle c vſe yet muſt néedes graunt barnard greatly reproueth inſaciable pride pope church hée ſpeaketh hée paſſeth mée ſore condemning holy ornamentes hee caulleth ſeruauntes antichriſt holy ornamentes harlottes decking game player diſguiſing hée ſaith neyther church church ſeruauntes antichriſt thinke barnarde tyme condemne hym hée ſpeaketh agaynſt holy church holy ornamentes thys dare well ſay beſt chriſten man within realme ſhould preach theſe wordes saint barnarde woulde ſticke condemne hym beretike wonte call hym ſwéete barnarde mée thynketh hée ſoure inough thys thynge wherefore diſpute matter wyth hym may come church wyth mée finis declaration church wherein hee aunſwereth maiſter firſt booke dyd declare certayne men dyd take vppon bée counted holy church whoſe maners lyuynges dyd nothyng agrée wyth holy church commeth hée layeth charge counted ſpiritualtie bée naught becauſe hée would make name ſomewhat odious vnto verely hée doth mée great wrōge neuer meanyng yet ſaying myne intent declare neyther pope colledge cardinalles yet byſhoppes worlde gathered togither make holy churche becauſe theyr name elſe theyr long gownes theyr ſhauen crownes elſe annoynted finger yet exterior thynges worlde admiration yet neuertheleſſe dyd graunt alſo doe confeſſe many good men haue ſhauen crownes alſo longe gownes yet theſe thyngs neuer church pope learning hath béene xiiij queſt c quodeū que verbo reconciliat hée hath béene ye church erre thing belong vnto called ye good holy church lawes made lawes holy church myght bée conuē ted temporall prince becauſe men holy church myght bée hanged murther becauſe annoynted holy church briefely bée innumerable ſuch thynges inuented maynetayne defēde theyr holyneſſe proue bée holy church thinges thynke denye hée woulde yet bée great many bookes forth comming proue ſentēce againſt alſo ye practiſe hath béene vſed ye worlde teſtifie ſame thinke yet mā lyuyng dyd euer know hys tyme would haue v thinke none holy church ye pope cardinal byſhops c man iudged taken bée church ſuch men haue ſpoken thynke thys name church neuer named taken ſpecially principally thoſe men ſhauen crownes lyke token let mée bée reported thoſe men bée alyue becauſe ſaw theſe thynges nothyng cauſe holy church yet belonged greatly holy church therefore ſay moued declare holy church thereof ſignes token men myght know ¶ declare brought certaine place ſcripture prooue worde eccleaſia taken ſcripture whole congregatiō good bad ſayd would greatly ſpeake cō gregation could erre mine intent ſpeake brought ye ſaying paule chriſt hath epeſ 5 geuen hym ſelfe church hée might ſanctifie clenſe fountaine water worde lyfe make hym ſelfe glorious church without ſpot wrincle ſuch thyng ſhée might bée holy without blame prooue churche clenſed chriſt brought ſaying auguſtine mée chriſt church made fayre firſt aug de ver bi domini ſerm l ſhée filthy ſinnes afterwarde pardon grace ſhée made fayre c moreouer proue ye church made cleane chriſt name clothyng exteriour thyng brought ye ſaying iohn ye ſonne god haue deliuered iohn 6 truely deliuered alſo paule waſhed ſāctified 1 cor 6 iuſtified ye name ieſus chriſt ſpirite god vnto theſe thing doth anſwere doe well exclude church bad mē ye knowne church ſayth hée ſtandeth gathering togither good mē bad prooue hée bringeth certeine parable sauiour chriſt aunſwere neuer denyed ſuch cō gregatiō good bad ſayd ye true church afore god though beare name church déede hys owne parable doth declare maiſter chriſte ſhall length géeue ſentence agaynſt call ſelues falſely churche iudas called apoſtle taken ſo company yet maiſter chriſt calleth deuil haue iudas hys euill men church churche muſt bee content hée ſhall alſo betraye chriſte trueth bad men bée mixt churche outwarde ſignes bée taken member churche ſpecially bée excommunicate churche whiche dyd ſpeake felowſhip gathered togither cōſent exteriour thing ceremony politicke felowſhips bée felowſhyp ſpecially gathered true church vnitie fayth hauyng holy ghoſt within ſanctifie ſpirites whiche doth ſet truſt onely redemptiō promiſed thē chriſtes bleſſed bloud ſay true church god let worlde ſay let men call ſelues pleaſeth thē paule ſaith rom 〈◊〉 hée hath ſpirite god none alſo more learnyng homo mortuus non eſt homo graunt euill men bée dead member churche bée worth let men iudge reckoneth ſuch churche earth without ſpot wrincle paul ſayth church ſayth epheſ 5 hée gracious glorious truely haue marueile hée meaneth thus expound saint paules ſaying thinke hée prooue paules ſaying verified church militant church triumphaunt tyme greatly diſpute hée hée hath béene would ſay ſome thyng hym doe tyme hée neither mocke ieſt cōceite diſpoſed couple hym hys foule ſhameles woorkes vntrue ſayinges hée layeth could feare hath pleaſed layeth many thynges wrōg fully god without helpe know ledge bryng hym vnto fall praye god hym geue hym grace hée may reuoke ſuch falſe doctrine hée hath brought worlde doubtles hée abyde meanyng hée doe ſée hée dye god ſeruaunt yea knowen church agaynſt hym whō hée ſayth men bound beléeue vnder payne damnation truely god ſhall iudge ſory hys trouble could helpe hym lawfull meanes would doe beſt ſo euill beare procéede farther matter greatly ſpeake much church reaſon many men ſence fyrſt writinge haue declared article much better doe wherefore onelye reſite place holy doctours haue brought mée fyrſt booke intent wherefore aleaged prooue ye church afrée thing throughout world bounde eyther place perſon brought ye ſaying auguſtine ſaying theſe wordes holy church wée aug serm 99 de tempore doe ſaye one ſhould ſay bée heare onely heare mée many bée heare faythfull chriſtean men church ye ſay cytie many bée region many bée beyonde ſea many bée whole world ye ryſing ſunne tyll goinge downe name god prayſed y• holy church mother c alſo lyra ſayth church doth lyra mar ca xix ſtand men reaſon ſpirituall power ſeculer dignitie many prince many pope inferiour perſōs haue ſwerued fayth wherfore church doth ſtand thoſe perſons true knowledge confeſſion fayth veritye c lyra ſayth much doe cleare wordes doth yet cā refell hym afterward bring ſaying auguſtine prooue church hath ſpottes wryncles yet confeſſing ſtycking chriſtes bloud bée imputed vnto ſaying whole church prayeth lord de verbo apoſt ſer xxix forgeue v ſinnes wherfore ſhe hath ſpottes wryncles knowledging wryncles bée ſtreatched knowledging ſpottes waſhed away church continueth prayer ye ſhée myght bée clenſed knowledgeing ſynnes long liue ſo ſtandeth euery mā departeth body ſuch ſinnes forgeuen hym ought bée forgeuē bée forgeuen dayly prayer hée goeth hence clenſed church anotable ſaying auguſtine god layde vp treaſure god puregolde meane church god treaſure lord without ſpotte wrynkell foloweth let v therefore pray god may forgeue v may forgeue dettours ſéeing ſayde ſhall forgeuen vnto ſay dayly dayly doe thing done dayly v without ſinne ſhall departe hence without ſynne c let euery man iudge whether place auguſtine maketh purpoſe ſay whether ye church hath ſpottes wrincles yet neuertheles ſhée hath ſpottes wrincles auguſtine ſayth ye church god treaſurie god without ſpotte ſo god mercy nothing imputed vnto cleannes ye ſhée hath ſpots béecauſe chriſtes ſake nothing layd charge maketh many wordes • enyall ſynnes deadly ſynnes ſpeake owne ſchoole men ſhould bée harde hym defende expoſition hée maketh auguſtine proue church cleane reaſon chriſt brought mée owne lawe whoſe wordes bée theſe de co • ſe iiij c igitur therefore ye church holy becauſe ſhée beléeueth righteouſly god c furthermore prooue congregation faythfull men church erre brought mée owne lawe whoſe wordes bée theſe holy church erre c alſo place xxiiij q ar • cta gloſa congregation faythfull men muſt néedes bée alſo erre c cleare firſt muſt nedes bée congregation faythfull men bée neyther bounde rome hieruſalem uor yet certayne place ſpread abroade throughout whole worlde ſtandeth vnitye faythfull chriſten men church god ſuffereth uot erre thoſe thinges belong ſaluation wherefore dyd ſay booke pope councels church coulde erre y• moſt part thoſe coū ſels order themſelues god worde wherfore ſayd myght well erre cauſe pryuate perſon hauing ſcripture hym ought bée preferred afore whole counſell ſcripture god worde ought bée iudge ouer counſels prooue brought mée ſaying panormitanus ſayth de electio c significal 1 counſell may erre hath erred concernyng ye contracte matrimony inter raptorem raptam ye ſaying hierome afteaward preferred aboue ſtatute y• coū ſell counſell weld • u erre prooued 36 queſt 2 tria theſe thynges concernyng fayth ſaying priuate perſon bée preferred ſaying pope hée haue better reaſōs scripture newe olde teſtament hym pope hath neyther helpe ſay counſell erre becauſe ye chriſt pray fayth church ſhould fayle aunſwere thys though generall counſell doe repreſent whole vniuerſall church yet neuertheleſſe déede vniuerſall church repreſentatiue vniuerſall church ſtandeth election faythfull men throughout whole worlde whoſe head ſpouſe chriſt ieſus pope ʋicar chriſt ye head church thys church erre c ſayth doctour ſame ſētence church ſayd brought alſo ſame purpoſe ſaying auguſtine whoſe word bée theſe thoſe counſels gathered au de bapt li 2 cap 3 euery prouince muſt without doubt geue place auctoritie full counſels bée gathered chriſtendome alſo thoſe full coū ſelles oftentymes muſt bée amended full counſelles come afterwarde thing bée opened experience ſhutte thing bée knowne tha • hydden muſt bée done without ſhadow ſuperſtitious full counſels may erre pride without boaſted arrogācy without contention malicious enuy wyth holy méekenes holy peace chriſten charitie c auguſtine ſayth plainly full counſelles may erre may bée refourmed declare mā ſhould know church man may knowe church fignes token ſayd worde god purely ſincerely preached ſacramēts orderly miniſtred bleſſed ordinaunce chriſt mē patiently ſuffer veritie hearer apply lyuing chriſtes doctrine méeknes receaued holy ſacaments theſe ſayde good perfect token iudge vppon certayne member chriſtes church prooue brought alſo auguſtine ſaying holy mother church ſuffereth church world ſcattered farre wyde taught true head chriſt hath learned feare contumely croſſe yet death ſhée ſtrengthened reſiſting ſuffering alſo chriſoſtomes chriſ opere im ꝑſecto wordes bée theſe bée iudea let flye vp mountaines ſay bée chriſtendome let géeue themſelues ſcriptures wherfore commaunded hée chriſten men tyme ſhould flie vnto ſcriptures tyme hereſies haue crepte church bée true probation chriſtendome refuge vnto chriſten men willing know verity fayth ſcriptures god many wayes ſhewed ye church god congregation ye gentile none ſcriptures men may know veritie waye knowe whiche true churche chriſt alonely ſcriptures workes firſt ye church chriſte knowne congregation chriſten men eyther many holy holynes wicked men chriſten men bée euill worſe heretikes gentile yea greater continencie founde amonge chriſten men wherefore hée know church chriſt ſhall hée know ſcriptures onely therfore lorde conſidering ſo great confuſion thynges ſhoulde come latter dayes cauſe commaundeth hée chriſten men willing reſerue y• ſtedfaſtnes true fayth ſhoulde flée vnto none thyng vnto ſcriptures haue reſpect vnto thynges ſhall bée ſclaundered ſhall peariſhe vnderſtandinge true church c maiſter hath great thing pointe agaynſt mée ſauynge hée ſayth theſe ſayinges none chriſoſtomes mā written chriſoſtomes name neuertheleſſe let paſſe let men iudge betwéene v afterwarde becauſe ſawe ſo great perſecution vſed pope church agaynſt maner ſortes good men whome caulleth heretikes pleaſure theyr deſeruynge cauſe ſay brought ſaying hilarius hilum contra arrianos prooue exerciſe ſuch tyranny bée compared arians chriſtes church ſaying church doth threaten banyſhmentes impriſonmentes ſhée compelleth men beléeue exiled caſt priſon shée hangeth ye dignitie felowſhop conſecrated threatenings perſecutours shée cauſeth prieſtes flee encreaſed chaſing away prieſtes shée glorieth ſhée loued ye worlde coulde neuer bée chriſtes except worlde hate c brought ſaying barnard proue name barn ſuꝑcā ſerm 33 ſpirituall array gorgious apparell ye vſed ye pope church dyd make ye church hys ſaying thus bée miniſters chriſt ſerue antichriſt goe gorgiouſly arayed lordes goodes vnto geue honor theſe commeth decking harlot thou ſéeſt dayly game player diſguiſing king apparell commeth golde brydells ſaddelles ſpurres ſo ſpures bée brighter aulters commeth plenteous wyne preſſes full ſellers bolking vnto ye cōmeth tūnes ſweete wynes bée bagges ſo fylled ſuch thinges theſe bée bée ruler church deacon archdeacon byſhops archbyſhops c men may make expoſition barnarde wil bée hard frame hym purpoſe concluſion doe vary poynt hée ſayth church god ſtādeth true church chriſt ſtādeth onely good men bée good bad ſay trew church chriſt ſtandeth thē onely bée good men kingdome chriſt diſtincted déede kingdome ye deuyll euell men bée doubtles membres dyuell paule ſayth ephe 2 alſo chriſt ſayth vnto pharyſyes father dyuell wherefore ſtande learning wicked men bée member deuyll bée gouerned hym bée member chriſts body though preſent lyfe bée yet ſo declared vnto ye worlde god ſend v grace y• may bée holy church mēbres bleſſed sonne ieſus amen finis keyes church bee geuen declare matter schoolemen haue wrapped ſelues ſuche doubtes neuer able come thē yet ſatiſfie thē ſelues good chriſten man conſcience ye write dreames theyr inuention paule calleth doctrine ye deuill agaynſt 1 tim 4 holy word god wringyng wreſtyng bleſſed worde god purpoſe alonely conſideryng might right wrong ſtabliſhe authoritie miſerable men cōſideryng intent holy ghoſt whiche intended nothyng el place scripture opē vnto v chriſt looſing ſinne hym alonely keyes ye church openyng chriſt looſing v ſinne thyng dreamer inuenters ſubtile lye dyd neuer preſerue neuer ſought deſpiſing holy worde god ſtickyng ſo faſt owne corrupted reaſons dyd fall innumerable hereſies diſſentions contention brawlynges wordes ſcoldyng lyke harlot ſo none thē could agrée wherfore ſaying holy prophete may well bée verified people haue heard voice pſal 80 iſraell hath taken héede vnto therfore haue let thē paſſe deſires hart therefore ſhall folow inuentiōs alwayes ſore vengeaunce god beléeue receiue alonely hys worde doth hée let v paſſe ſo doe nothyng erre notwithſtandyng ſo blynded thinke darkenes light errours veritie openly proued greate clarkly ſchoolemen may bée open men recite learne keyes dun ſcholers ſay theſe keyes sc • tus 4 ſent di 18 bée nothyng el authoritie geuen prieſtes whereby geue ſentence heauen muſt bée opened dūs interpreteth keyes man ſhyt vnto ſo heauen opened ſhyt ſentence ye prieſt learnyng could haue inuented ſuch doctrine y• deuill ſelfe ſpeake greater hereſie ſpeake openly agaynſt chriſte hys holy scripture authoritie prieſt bée keyes heauen open open ſhyt heauen néede thyng ſaluation authoritie prieſt man bée ſaued without authoritie prieſt prieſtes bée damned haue keyes heauē thinke wil bée ſo mad authoritie ſhyt ſelues deuill briefely néede haue chriſt hys holy word authoritie prieſt keye heauen let bryng owne word ye matter may bée playner keye purpoſe taken nicho de orbel di v ſupra ſimilitude materiall key whiche next inſtrument ſhyt open doore whereby enter houſe lykewiſe authoritie geue ſentence heauen muſt bée opened vnto man called keye c vſe many wordes refellyng damnable opinion néedeth agaynſte ſet authoritie hierome whoſe word bée theſe ſhal geue thée ye keyes heauē hiero c 16 place byſhops prieſtes vnderſtandyng haue vſu • ped vnto ſomewhat phariſeis pryde ſo ye thinke may condemne innocentes looſe bée giltie afore god ye ſentence prieſt lyfe giltie regarded c haue playnly ſentence ſaying hierome vppon keyes prieſt looked able looſe ſinner afore god marke alſo hierome ſayth vnderſtād place moreouer would know cā bryng one example scripture ſentence prieſt hath looſed ſinner bound righteous man doe thyng aboue ſentence prieſt furthermore auctoritie ſhould bée keyes heauen gaynſt reaſon agaynſt owne learning dun alſo lyra ſame text qnodcunque ligaueris scotus 4 ſen diſt 15 queſt 1 doe playnely declare key auctoritie may erre may erre right key locke heauen right key neuer erre owne locke wherfore moſt make picklocke belongeth robber théeues onely moreouer key thē ſhould neuer bée ſuretye whether heauē opened firſt haue promiſe worde god made vnto key againe know openeth heauen whē may erre owne doctours chaūce erre heauē gate opened ye meanes ſhall bée alwayes doubt whether bée loſed frō ſinne wherefore muſt ſéeke key trew key locke erre ſhall bée ſurety without doubt ere wee declare key firſt ſhew nature propertye key auguſtine ſayth muſt auguſt ſer 2 de ſane called key hardnes hart opened vnto fayth whereby ſecretnes mindes made manyfeſt key ſayth hée doth open conciēce nature property keyes heauen yt knowledge ſynne alſo includeth grace vnto wholeſomnes euerlaſting miſtery c diffynition key ſpeake auguſtine compare power vnto diffinitiō ſée doe agrée fyrſt power doe call key remoue away hardenes harte bring fayth agayne key iudge ſecreatnes man mynde thirdly power doe men conſciences make thē knowledge ſinne yea doe know awne ſynne power haue prieſtes like knowledge fynally grace doth power include hym ye may bring v euerlaſting ioye wherefore ſée deffinition agréeth well key chalke chéeſe therfore muſt ſéeke key ye hath theſe property nothing el holy worde god whereby receaue fayth harte paule ſayth fayth hearing hearing rom 10 wordes god cauſe holy prophet calleth lanterne pſal 118 ſaying thy word lanterne vnto féete lyght vnto pathes word doe receiue lyfe prophet ſayth thy ſpeach ibidem ſhall quicken mée alſo ſecreates harte opened word paule declareth ſaying 1 cor 14 come one doth beléeue hée reproued word men ſecreates harte opened worde alſo declared vnto v grace euerlaſting lyfe paule ſayth chriſt hath put away 2 tim 1 death hath brought lyfe immortalitie vnto light goſpell thing onely conſcience loſed made frée ſynne therefore ſayth holy prophet much peace vn pſal 118 loue lawe god ſclaūder vnto much peace nothyng el remiſſion ſinnes yea without doubt hée looſed worde god hée hath open word god hym ſinnes bée forgeuē hée bée ſclaū dered nothyng make doubt though heauen hell life death doe threaten hée offended hée ſclaundered hydeth faſt knoweth ſurely theſe thynges muſt periſhe word god bydeth thinges ſhal periſh y• word god endureth euer euer wherefore keye iudgeth thoughtes intentes hart paule ſayth haue alſo knowledge ſinne paule declareth romaine hebr 4 alſo declared vnto v grace alſo remiſſion rom 3 ſinnes beléeue wherefore muſt néedes bée true keye may ſée euidently thoroughout scripture boaſted craked power ſuch thynge yet bée man looſe ſoule man hys ſinne wherefore damnable deuilliſhe learning commeth preſumptuous pride mā learne man hath power hym power man ſoule bounde looſed ſinne man hath hée miniſter diſpenſator heauenly worde god whoſe ſake ſinnes power prieſt hath bée remitted beléeue ſinnes bée retained wée doe de ſpiſe therfore bleſſed word god keye word god true keye openeth loſeth might power loouſe ſinnes man miniſter ſeruaunt vnto worde may bée prooued maiſter chriſtes wordes hée ſayth goe wayes worlde preach goſpell vnto creature hée doth beléeue baptiſed ſhalbe ſaued hée doth beléeue ſhall bee damned math 6 may playnely ſée apoſtles bée miniſters ſeruauntes haue power alonely miniſtration keyes haue whereby muſt looſe men bynde worde god therfore ſayth maiſter chriſt hée beléeueth ſhall bée ſaued hée doth beléeue ſhal bée damned worde holy apoſtles declare grace thorough chriſt learned mē ſet hope ſaluation chriſt onely worde learne men knowledge ſinne ſéeke grace fully wholly hope remiſſion forgéeuenes theyr ſinnes chriſt onely briefely theſe keyes opened goodnes bée receaued goodnes ſhutte v wée receaue keye receaued faith thing • wſed ſinnes bée forgéeuen conſciences bée made frée commeth receaued faith thynges bée ſhutte bounde maner holy apoſtles acte 2 bynde looſe preached holy worde god vnto y• people wée haue open example peter preached holy worde preaching ye hearer pricked harte aſked peter myght doe hée aunſwered repent bée baptiſed euery one name ieſus remiſſion ſinnes ſhall receaue gifte holy ghoſt wherfore many receaued word baptiſed haue playnely true maner looſing ſinnes true maner loſyng byndyng openyng ſhottyng ye holy apoſtles vſed people beléeued worde preached thē declared ſinnes remitted chriſtes ſake thorow power miniſters power word god whereby deliuered ſinnes well proued maiſter chriſtes word hée ſayth vnto goe preach ſaying kyngdome heauen hande kyngdome heauen math 10 power man remiſſion ſinnes ſhall bée geuen receiue either power perſons therfore followeth houſe enter ſay firſt peace bée houſe bée worthy peace ſhall come vppon ſame ſay reciue word beléeue ſhall peace peace goſpel bring geue quietnes conſciēce loſe ſynne houſe bée worthy peace ſhall returne agayn whoſoeuer ſhall receiue heare preaching depart houſe ſhake duſt féete ſay vnto ſhalbe eaſyer sodom gomorra day iudgment cytie peace ſhall returne agayne nothing el ſhall bée pertakers thereof ſhall remaine bound ſinne becauſe receiue perſons power nay trewlye becauſe heare preaching bée doubted hearyng worde god beleuyng ſame loſeth v ſinnes many men hearing apoſtles preaching word god loſed ſynnes yet neuer ſpake apoſtles wherefore receauyng word apoſtle loſeth v ſinnes cauſe apoſtle declare departing frō thē would beleue word ye remained ſtill ſinnes marke ſayth departyng ſhal bée teſtimonie agaynſt ſay token condemnation haue alſo open practiſe paule hée dyd bynde thē receiue preaching whō mark 6 hée ſayth theſe wordes bloud vpon heades departe frō hence clennes vnto gentile actes 18 haue playnely holy apoſtle dyd bynde looſe keye preachyng holy word god becauſe thyng ſhoulde bée don without errour man ſhould doubt hée gaue holye ghoſt ſaying theſe wordes whoſe ſinnes doe forgeue ſhall bee forgeuen whoſe ſinnes doe iohn 20 retaine ſhall bée retained theſe wordes addeth luke thē opened hée wytte might vnder ſtand scripture ſo iohn ſayth hée gaue holy luke 24 ghoſt luke ſayeth hée opened wytte vnderſtand scripture foloweth luke thus thus written chriſte muſt ſuffer death riſe agayne thyrd day repentaūce remiſſion ſinnes luke 24 ſhoulde bée preached hys name among nation saint iohn ſayth whoſe ſins doe looſe ſhall bée looſed c ſayth luke theſe wordes remiſſiō ſinnes muſt bée preached hys name preachyng word god loſing ſinne whoſe ſinnes doe looſe ſhal bée looſed nothyng el muſt preach remiſſion ſins name many receiue word ſhall looſe word many doe receiue ſhall bynde ſame word ſentence theſe two place opē ſpeake one ſtory thyng done one day doth alſo paule prooue wel actes 17 hée reciteth wordes luke ſaying chriſt muſt néedes ſuffer ryſe agayne death ieſus chriſt plaine ſ paule loſed men ſinnes preaching remiſſiō chriſt ſo haue openly practiſe holy apoſtles bynde looſe preaching word god bynde word worde god byndeth loſeth beléeued dyd looſe worde beléeued thus dyd one word preache ſaluation damnatiō vnto diuers men vertue 2 cor 2 worde doth paule declare theſe wordes vnto god ſwéete ſauour chriſte among ſaued alſo among periſh one part ſauour death vnto death vnto parte ſauour lyfe vnto lyfe ſauour nothyng el goſpell vnto one ſauour lyfe nothyng el looſing remiſſion ſinnes vnto ſauour death vnto death occaſion bynding reteinyng ſinne doth paule alſo declare place preachyng 1 cor 1 croſſe periſh fooliſhnes vnto v whiche ſaued power god ye power god nothyng el remiſſion loſing ſinnes worde god remiſſion ſinne bee beleeued preached fooliſhenes nothyng el deſpiſe goſpell recken value power wherfore remayne bound ſinne thus declared one word god worketh diuers mē diuers operatiōs ye one worketh lyfe ye remiſſion ſinnes worketh death taken fooliſhnes declareth bounde retained dānable ſinnes yet ſelfe hée one goodnes nature diuerſitie commeth bée receiuers may bée proued naturall example dew heauē cō meth downe indifferently vppon grounde one bryngeth forth good corne ſwéete frutes bryngeth forth nettle brombilles bée nothyng worth fier exāple haue epiſtle hebrues hebr 6 ſame purpoſe likewiſe one word doe holy apoſtles chriſtes miniſters looſe bynde doe charmyng coungeryng iugglyng whyſlyng abſolutions doe preachyng holy preaching worde god heauē opened ſhut word god beléeued doth quiet looſe conſcience ſinne offereth v chriſt onely beléeued doth bynde v retaine v ſinne holy worde true keye heauen heauen opened ſhut doth chriſoſtome wel prooue chriſo c 15 de doctr chriſti li 1 c 15 e 18 theſe wordes key word knowledge scripture whereby gate veritie opened vnto men c auguſtine doth alſo witnes ſame ſaying theſe keyes hath bée geuen churche ſhée byndeth earth ſhall bée bound heauē ſhée looſeth earth ſhall bée looſed heauen ſay ſoeuer doth beléeue ſinnes bée forgeuē hym churche bée forgeuen hym hée doth beléeue auerte ſelfe ſinnes beyng church ſame fayth amendement hée made whole c haue openly bée leeuing worde god ſinnes bée looſed vnbeléefe bée boūde ſins muſt ſearch theſe keyes bée geuen may onely bée geuen peter paule two ſonnes thunder may bee geuen one auguſtine ioan trac 124 chriſt indifferent apoſtles confeſſion one wherfore doubt theſe keyes weare geuen vnto chriſtes apoſtles vnto whole church auguſtine doth declare openly vpon iohn may bée alſo proued wordes owne lawe bée 24 q 1 quodcū que theſe peter haue power onelye binde looſe doth church bée donne church peter hée receaued ye keyes ſygnifie holy chucrh c heare haue openly peter onely keyes hée receiued name church wherefore béelong chriſten men doth origene well prooue theſe wordes tu e petrus origenes super ho 1 c theſe wordes ſpoken vnto peter vnto apoſtles vnto maner perfect faythfull men church builded vpō confeſſion apoſtles faithfull people petrus builded church chriſt agaynſt none gate hell preuayle dooſt thou recken yt keyes heauen onely geuen peter chriſten man receaue c clearely chriſten men bée peter haue receyued keyes heauen hell preuayle agaynſt auguſtine doth alſo teſtifie ſame theſe wordes wherefore church super ioan trac 124 c 21 founded grounded chriſt hym hath receyued peter keyes heauen ſay power bynde looſe c thus playne thoſe keyes geuē ye whole church chriſt fayth bée cōmon treaſure church béelonge one man becauſe men vſe theſe keyes together ye would make confuſion therofore doth church congregation faythfull men commyt miniſtratiof theſe keyes preaching ye worde god vnto certayne men whome thinke moſt able beſt learned worde god mē thus choſen bée miniſters commen treaſure lordes ouer churche preacher abuſe preaching maye bee depoſed may depoſe ye ſhée may take away open common myniſtration ſhée committed vnto vſe well bée chriſten men hauing common office adminiſtration church wherfore may neither preach yet miniſter ſacramentes openlye chriſten men may doe pryuately owne houſes place men bée gathered wil heare chriſt ſaye chriſtē men may ſpeake learne chriſtes worde declare gift ye geuen vnto god doe beléeue word thus preached chriſten men bée power ye keyes loſed ſinne bound beléeue church euery part church haue power execute theſe keyes onely open order bée broken doth paule declare ſaying may interpretate 1 cor 14 ſcriptures ſée thinges ſée done order kéepe order nothing ſhould bée done confuſe manner therefore church aſſigneth certayne men open common myniſters treaſure bée onely minyſters lordes cō mon treaſure priuate treaſure paule ſayth let man ſo reckē v miniſters chriſt diſpenſators mynyſtery god alſo place paule appollo myniſters 1 cor 4 item 3 haue beléeued alſo peter predeceſſor 1 pet 5 commaundeth ſhoulde exerciſe dominion ouer miniſters churche ought lordes congregation geue example flocke bée theſe playne ſcriptures bée lordes miniſters chriſtes treaſure leaue miniſtration vſurpe auctoritie petter whoſe ſucceſſors boaſt ſelues bée commaū deth ſhoulde bée alonely miniſters keybearers theſe keyes chriſoſtome prooueth c 23 theſe wordes keye bearer prieſtes vnto whome committed worde teach interprete scripture c heare bée keybearers teacher y• worde god doth ambroſe witneſſe theſe wordes ſinnes bée forgeuen li de cain et abell worde god whoſe interpreter deacon c marke ſinnes bée forgeuen word god bée interpreter pray lordly power call keyes heauen scripture practiſe apoſtles expoſition holy doctours opē ly againſt vſurpe thing contrary theſe pray finde holy scripture one peter byſhops cleargie abuſe chriſtes keyes paule aſſoyle maner keyes yet doubt keyes yea alſo dyd vſe wherfore mée great maruayle whome haue learned vſage haue gotten ſuch keyes maketh matter mée though cry wonte father father counſels counſels churche church wilnot helpe ſée opē ly haue holy worde god maiſter chriſte elder father haue alſo practiſe holy apoſtles vnderſtand thynge better counſels let v graunt haue father counſelles next way deceaue church god chriſten men falſe allegyng father councels next way deceaue churche god bée deceaued ſuch men bée auctoritie dignitie yt world know men bée deceaued horſes calues muſt bée men fooliſhe mē regarde fooles bée reckoned wiſdome reputation world one wiſe man wyſe man may bée good reputation wiſdome hée muſt bée many el haue ſhyne colour excellencie yea ſuch multitude reaſon ſuſpect neuer ſo great daunger vnto church god theſe thynges come togither therefore ſayth ye holy prophete bleſſed man foloweth counſels wicked pſal 1 men know counſelles cā bée ſmale thing fooliſhe wicked men themſelues doe recken ſmale thinge greateſt thynge wyſeſt thyng ſtrongeſt thinke deuiſe doubte hath fore reaſon fore worlde great apparence ſmale wiſdome ſo ſtrong euery man compelled receaue yea alſo thoſe men haue auctoritie prophet ſaith ſitte chayre doth ſignifie great learning alſo great auctoritie yet ſaith ye prophet bleſſed hée foloweth counſelles ſitteth theyr chayre theſe thynges coulde bée iudged ſome reaſon el ſéemed ſo euill worlde could iudge néede holy ghoſt make ſuch dooe write ſo ſtrongly agaynſt yea ſay bleſſed hée ye heareth wherfore hée muſt néedes ſpeke ſuch miſchiefe ſuch falſhod ſuch errours haue thoſe thinges brynge fatherhod wyſdome learning auctoritie multitude long cuſtome thyngs bée able peruerte man bée hée neuer ſo wiſe neuer ſo holy hée ſticke faſt worde god onely therefore ſayth prophet bleſſed whoſe meditation law god bleſſed hee whoſe wyll meditation night day continually law god ʋnto coūſels father cuſtomes briefly bring bée compared ſhall wée ſée whether bée true god themſelues haue truth bée inuentions corrupted reaſon perſwaſions deuill peruerte holy church god lordes let v goe reaſon tell mée honour reaſonable holy churche god redéemed wyth chriſtes precious bloud aſſoyled hym ſinnes ſhould bée bounde vnto abſolution ſhée ſhould bée releaſed thorow power ſéeyng bée miniſters ſeruauntes ordayned chriſt vnto profite honour thys wyll declare example put caſe bée priſoner exāple bounde faſt cheynes ouer haue cuſtody kéepyng kynges commaundement kynges grace ſaith vnto looſe fellow let hym goe frée priſon vnder cōdition ſhal promiſe ſerue prince mée onely looſe cā dare kéepe hym longer woulde compell make compoſition alonely ſerue ye king woulde miniſtration church belongeth byſhops miniſters authoritie ſame belongeth chriſt kéepe longer priſon runne kynges diſpleaſure hée promiſe compoſition hée bounde thereto nay doubtles moreouer looſing thyng doe auctoritie yea thyng doe myniſters vnto kynges commaundement ſeruaunt poore fellowe miniſtration ſeruice auctoritie kinges haue neuer crumme take example pleaſe kynges grace make example embaſſadour geeue commiſſion commaundement fetch home lande baniſhed man vnto kinges grace writeth pardon ſuch wordes vnder ſuch condition pleaſeth grace pardō deliuereth hée beare declare vnto baniſhed man woulde know doe baniſhed man written cōmiſſion alſo doe againſte hym theſe thinges kinges grace hath pardoned hym neyther adde take away kinges pardon doe declare vnto partie hée receaue may hée lawfully fréely come land may ſay right haue auctoritie diſcharged hym geuen pardō baniſhmēt alonely haue deliuered declared vnto hym kinges pardon hée receaued conſiderations therein hée diſcharged hys baniſhment hée receaue kinges pardon neyther helpe land yet diſcharge hym trāſgreſſion onely leaue hym declare vnto yea kinges wordes hée baniſhed man ſo ſhall remayne till hée receaue kinges pardon likewiſe ye word god pardon ſinners committed vnto preach declare receiue faith frée looſed ſynnes doctrine true preaching worde god pardon remiſſion ſins doe bound auctorytie bée myniſters ſeruauntes goe commyſſion ye auctorytie god onely wherefore ſée well conſcyence diſcharge ſelf afore god doe ſo preſūptuouſly vſurpe auctorite haue neyther worde example ſcripture moreouer prooue manner abſolution ego abſaluo te auctoritate mihi comiſſa bée lawfull pray euer auctoritie cōmitted vnto man take away ſynne auctoritie authoritie churche belongeth chriſt onely committed vnto man onely miniſtraciō worde abſolucion maketh mencion auctoritie yea without ſworde great many vnderſtode worde dun ſayth quod abſolutio ſacerdotis eſt diſpoſitio neceſſitatis ad remiſſionem culpae thinke bée theſe fitte wordes chriſten man abſolution bée neceſſary god take away ſinne without wt hym god togither take away ſinne whether aſcend ſo hie bée check mate god thinke ſhortly alſo bée god phareſies recken much better god doe ſayd god onely abſolue ſinnes ſay doe aſſoyle yea auctoritie ſo farre paſſe phareſies let v ſée auguſtine ſayth ſuch mē many ſinnes bée forgeuen thee hée prophecyed men bée come weare luke 7 auguſt lib quinquaginta home liarum 23 many men come would ſay forgéeue ſinnes iuſtefie ſanctifie make whole ſo many baptiſe wherefore iewes better vnderſtande remiſſyon ſynnes thē heretykes doe iewes ſayde mā ye forgeueth ſynnes heretyke ſaith forgeue make cleane ſanctifie c theſe wordes bée playne inough agaynſt ſay haue auctoritie pope clergy condemned auſten bee heretickes remyt ſynnes auguſtine ſayth bée heretyckes ſo ſaying denye auguſtine reprooueth owne abſolucion ſay abſolution requiſite neceſſitie remyſſion ſinnes nothing el clearly denying chriſt bleſſed bloud alſo holy worde wée grace wée might perceaue neyther abſolucion yet thing ye doe weare god ye doe clearely done mony cauſe recken one thing doe concerning miniſtration haue money ſo much waſhing heape ſtones whereby haue gotten great poſſeſſions alonely vnder collour bée chriſtes holy biſhops money make whore dome lawfull matrimony money pope beſt marchaunt money ſtollen good ſhall bée better thē heritage money make vſury lawful marchaundiſe money ſinnes bée vertue yea alſo haue great pardon money ſell man wife mayde child king land money make good marchaūdiſe woman priuities goldſmith doth gilted plate recken shamefull doyngs muſt bee ſhamefully rebuked ſhame write ſhame doe theſe ſhamefull déedes ſhoulde haue none occaſiō make ſhamefull writyng take away ye cauſe take away yt writyng yea ſo content ſell chriſt ſel bleſſed sacrament fleſh bloud ſell holy worde ſell sacramentes briefely ſell maner thyng euer hée left earth pope ſelleth god ordinaūces comfort man ſoule money yea ſo content make alſo lawes ſtatutes diſpenſe money theſe thynges doe authoritie keyes open heauen hell man coffer alſo purſſe yea ſometime loſſe coate frō backe maiſter chriſte ſayth vnto pope folow obey chriſtes commaūdemēt hee biddeth hym looſe haue receiued frée geue frée agayne geue nothyng frée know aūſwere ſay ſell maſſe sacramentes word god labour haue thou deuill wilt thou bée without excuſe whē wilt thou graunt thy ſelfe gilty tell ye bée without ſhame doe ſell labour ſore vnlawfull price ſell ſo deare byſhop deſerue labour thouſand pound yeare yet ſome haue great deale labour nothyng deare wil pope ſelleth hys ware deare theſe men ſell labour ſhoulde bée tankerdebearers would make water dearer thē wyne yea tel labour realme halfe ſo deare ſold idlenes belly god chriſtes apoſtles take paynes labour miniſtration worde fulfillyng office one day doe lyues yet lawfull receiue lyuyng maiſter chriſt ſayd yt worke man worthy meate ſo ye math 10 maiſter wold ſhould receiue neceſſarie alſo paule ſayth lord dyd ordeine 1 cor 9 whiche preache goſpell ſhould lyue yt goſpell marke hée ſayth preach yt goſpell doth preache ye goſpel one yet enioye hierome theſe innumerable poſſeſſions hierome ſayth ſame text muſt lyue goſpell bée chriſoſto ad ti 5 riche alſo chriſoſtome ſayth ſay boldly byſhops prelate church may haue nothyng meate drinke cloth c heare haue playnely chriſoſtome ſtraight byſhops reſt clergye labour faythfully truely goſpell could haue lyuyng lordly poſſeſſions doe nothing worlde excerciſe tyranny would preach goſpell make lawes ſtatutes deſtroy holy goſpell chri ſ 6 de anathemate god ſo chriſoſtome ſpeaketh well beholde ſée men haue trew ſence holy ſcripture yea vnderſtand nothing thereof paſſe ouer many thing aſhamed call thē mad mē trifler wrangler bée ſuch know ſay thynge ſpeake onely bée mighty bold make lawes curſe cōdemne thoſe thing yt know nothing c bée theſe workes ſay theſe wordes ſpoken maketh ſtatutes lawes curſeth condemneth lay theſe thinges auoyde thē ſo long ſhall bée layd agaynſt tyll bring one gylty think bée long yet haue theſe great poſſeſſions bée alſo greate lordes nothing therefore al al onely play part byſhop chriſtmas game player doth king popet ſpringeth byſhops compared popets ſtage player vp downe cryeth peepe péepe goeth way doe make coūtenaūce great holines great perfectiō ye world teſtify doe indeede ouer bound goſpell men bee ye world thereby haue honour rich lordly poſſeſſions goſpell men would regard doe coblers yet deſerue worſt men goſpell wherefore ſay vnto wordes maiſter chriſt woe bée vnto hypocrite whiche ſhut heauen gate men luke ſaythmath 26 luke 11 haue taken away ye key ſcience neyther enter ſelfe yet ſuffer come enter ina ſore ſentence chriſt agaynſt vnpreachyng prelate let mée ſée keyes al power aſſoyle frō ſame woe yt chriſt doth heare laye vnto worde god byndeth euerlaſting damnation let v ſée piklocke open locke ſay haue keyes heauen el thinke may ſéeke clegge keyes fynde one open locke finis ¶ free man fall adam hys naturall ſtrength doe nothyng ſinne beefore god article wée diſpute man may doe cōmon influence geuen hym god ouer theſe inferior worldelye thinges power hée hath eating drinking ſléeping ſpeaking buying ſellyng ſuch naturall thinges bée géeuen god indifferently men good bad wée ſearch ſtrength thinges haue freewill none man naturall power without ſpirit god doe thoſe thinges bée acceptable god vnto fulfilling god beléeue god loue god commaundemēts loue iuſtice ſelfe take god father recken bée mercifull vnto feare god louingly thinges mē doe call good workes thing wée ſearch knowe hée doe nothyng theſe cauſes frée wil maiſter chriſt prooueth theſe wordes hee iohn 15 abideth mée bringeth forth much fruite without mée cā ye doe nothing man abide mée hée caſt braunch ſhall burne open fréewill without grace doe nothing doe ſpeake eating drinking though bée grace nothing fruitfull meritorious worthy thanke acceptable frutes freewill freewill without god grace doe nothyng good god hee hath chriſt hym caſt firſt fruite freewill wythereth hée ſecond fruite wythering helpeth hym nothing goodneſſe hée muſt wither let doe beſt hée gathered caſt fire thirde fruit bée fire doe nothing burne hée lye thing indifferent hée muſt néedes burne hée cā come yt fier owne ſtrēgth let hym intende much hée intention bona intentio helpe hym yet hym might fréewil hée left alone nothyng el firſte bée caſt ſeconde wyther ſo decayeth hée thyrdly caſt fire wors wors finally hée burneth worſt hée paſt helpe ſo ſtrength fréewill hath bryng ſelfe vtter deſtruction dun men bryng bonum conatum ſo longe bryngyng fréewill brought fire hée neither ſaue ſelfe frō burning yet helpe ſelfe lord rocheſter aunſwereth certaine place fréewill doe good meritorious ſed tamē non omnino facit nihil ſay nihil hée doe good yt meritorious worthy thāke god pray doth hée nihil diſputation goodnes hée doe wtout grace graunt hée doe goodnes yet ſay hée doe ſomethyng let v ſée auguſtine vnderſtandeth text iohn leſt man ſhould ſuppoſe super ioannem tract lxxi braunche hym ſelfe could bryng forth leſt wayes litle frute therfore ſayth hée doe litle without doe nothyng therfore whether bée litle much without bée done without whō nothyng done one two thing muſt braunche néedes doe either abyde vyne el burne fier bée vyne fire c lord bryng ſomethyng fréewill doth saint auguſtine ſayth without grace cā fréewil doe neither litle much ſhée bée chriſt ſhée burneth fire call ſomwhat bée nowe dunſis dūces doctrine ouerthrowen mē bonum conatum bonum ſtudium applicationem ad bonum muſt néedes lye fire good intētes good preparation holy diſpoſitions alſo paule 2 cor 3 ſufficient thinke thyng ſelues ſufficiencie god able thinke thyng ſelues bée ſmaller thyng thē thinke yet ſmall thynge doe alſo open saint paule ſelues ſelues • ſo much thinke good thought meaneth thinkyng cō meth naturall power yt god doth let letteth proceede firſt ordinaunce haue open experience infidel hée ſpeaketh ſuch thinkyng acceptable thankful god therefore foloweth god hath made v worthy miniſters ye new teſtament open hée ſpeaketh thinking ſingular ſpeciall gift god common gift nature nothyng miniſtratiō goſpell let v ſée barnarde barnarde lib arbit ſayth text ſhall ſay alonely merite fréewill hée doth alonely conſent yea doubtles ſame conſent whiche merite god neither thinke whiche leſſe conſent thyng ſelues though ſufficient ſelues theſe wordes bée myne apoſtles whiche geueth vnto god fréewil maner thinges bée good ſay thinke performe c thyngs bée good barnarde geueth god ſtrength hath fréewill hee neither thinke good wel yet performe remaineth know nothyng either included thinking willyng performyng theſe bée geuē god alſo maiſter chriſt ſaith math 7 shal men gather grape thornes figges bromble buſhes euill trée bryng foorth good frute meaneth maiſter whē hée ſayth grape bée gathered thornes nothyng el ye frute muſt bée lyke manner trée therefore ſayth hée euill trée bryng forth good frute denye fréewill without grace euill trée ergo frute muſt needes bée euil hée may well bryng forth frute ſhall bée good fréewils power declared theſe wordes hée pray meaneth maiſter chriſt theſe woordes hee chriſt ſayd hée ſay hée alſo maiſter ſayth adder byrdes howe math 12 ſpeake good thynges ſéeyng bée euill theſe men fréewill yet ſayth maiſter could man freewill without god grace doe nothing good ſpeake good thynges recken ſmall power ſpeake good yet ſmall fréewill doe hée may well ſpeake ſhall bée good ſhould hée ſpeake good euill ſelfe ſhould hée doe good knoweth good enemy goodnes yea aſmuch • yeth hée wold goodnes haue alſo commō principle nothyng loued deſired knowne ſhould fréewill flée ſinne deſire goodnes hée knoweth whiche ſinne paule ſayth law knowledge ſinne ſo blinde fréewil roma▪ 3 hée knoweth ſinne bée ſinne vertue bee vertue iudgeth thyng bée good euill thyng euill bée good hée loſt hath true iudgement auguſtine ſayth enche 〈◊〉 • 9 goodnes hée doe loſt except hée bée deliuered miſerie hée doe good fréewill god forbyd man euill vſing freewill looſe ſelfe alſo freewill man alyue doth kill ſelf whē hee hath killed ſelfe hée cā make ſelfe aliue agayne likewiſe whē doe ſinne fréewill ſinne hath man vſ • ig freewill euill loſe hymſelfe freewill victory fréewil cleane loſt man ouercome vnto hym muſt hée bée ſeruaunt doubtles ſentence peter apoſtle whiche ſéeyng true pray maner freedome bonde ſeruaunt haue except bée pleaſeth ſinne c bée ſayd doth hée clearely ſay mā hath loſt fréewil ſinne doe vnto goodnes dead man doe make ſelfe alyue agayne yea hée doe nothyng delight ſinne call fréedome call bonum conatū call preparyng grace auguſtine de • erbis apoſt▪ ſer 11 doth declare goodnes fréewill deſerueth without grace ſaying curſed fréewill without god haue experience freewill cā doe without god therfore miſerable becauſe haue experience fréewill able doe without god behold man made good fréewil hée made euill mā whē ſhall euill mā freewill forſakyng god make mā good hée béeyng good could kéepe hym ſelfe good hee euill ſhall hee make hym ſelfe good hée good hée kepte ſelfe good hee euill ſhall hee ſay make ſelfe good c ſtrength freewill man freewill cā doe nothing ſinne ſtrength wée made miſerable doth experience learne yet wée boaſte fréewill auguſtine calleth curſed fréewil wée call bleſſed fréewill goodly fréedome great power bryng v euerlaſting miſerie bonum conatum facere qoud ce eſt preparare ſe ad graciam dampnable dreames wée haue whoſe concluſions nothing el bryng v dampnation ſée auguſtines word bée ſo plaine mā auoide alſo paule ſaith rom 8 wiſdome fleſhe enemy god ſubiecte vnto ye law cā bee ſerue yt fleſhe pleaſe god hée hath ſpirite chriſt ſame mā none ſelfe ſpirit beareth witnes ſpirite wée child god haue mās fleſhly wiſdome enemy god plainely wiſdome yt fleſhe enemy againſt god cā bée ſaide wiſedome vnderſtandeth beſt thyng man better thē wiſdome cā nothing bée yet enemy god fleſhe man without ſpirite god paule declareth hée ſaych hée hath ſpirite chriſt ſame man chriſtes playne reaſō wiſdome hart whatſoeuer thing y• man without ſpirit god fleſhe bée obedient hée ſayth wyll hée hath might hée hath power let hym intende beſt doe yt lyeth hym might power yet pleaſe god fleſhe dun make diſtinction ſay fleſhe takē dun fleſhely deſires onely voluptuouſnes deſires ſoule electiō yt woulde know part man deſireth coueteth thys voluptuouſnes bone ſinowes fleſhe hangeth thereon higheſt parte man ſoule man hée grounde auctor conſcupiſence take away hym remayneth voluptuouſnes therefore paule declareth hym hys operation hée caulleth wiſdome fleſhe woulde gladly know hée vnderſtandeth vncleane deſires voluptuouſnes hée vnderſtand euill cogitation aduoutry fornication manſlaughter thefte couetouſnes deceite vncleanes blaſphemy pride fooliſhnes hée call theſe volupouſnes theſe bée come hart man bée choſen election chriſt doth clearely declare mark vij yea marke 7 bottome hart inuent vncleanely deſires thē theſe theſe come bone ſinowes frō ground hart theſe bée hys deſires hath hée none hym ſelfe wherefore theſe dreamer dreame wot ſpeake vnderſtand man harte ſoule fleſhe bone c wyth theyr workes fleſhe excepte ſpirite god bée euery man hath ſoule hée chriſtes thē infidel chriſtes ſpirite chriſt maketh rom 8 hym chriſtes ſpirite god géeueth witnes ſpirite bée child god ſpirite géeueth witnes himſelf hée chriſtes ſpirite god fruſtrate wherefore let ſpirite well hée ſtudye hys beſte apply hymſelfe goodnes vttermoſt power yet wiſdome fleſhe hath witnes god yea enemy muſt néedes bée ſinne auguſtine ſayth hée féedeth de verbis domini ſer xv without mée féedeth agaynſt mée c marke hée ſayth agaynſt mée wherefore fréewill doe without grace ſinne marke alſo paule write vnto freewill without grace ſinne iewes yea beſt ſtudye doe good workes yea beſt workes workes lawe yet theſe bée caulleth fleſhe declareth openly theſe good workes coulde helpe yet doubt iewes dyd much lay theyr fréewyll doe come fauour god yet helped wiſedome fleſhe enemy god alſo paule ſayth mortifie rom 8 déedes fleſhe ſpirite ſhall liue recken paule doth iudge ſpirite god neceſſary kyll deſires fleſhe ſyndwes bone thyng man beſide ſpirite man ſmall thyng yea fruſtrate ſet ſpirite god kylle theſe thynges ſpirite man kill yea alſo rule owne philoſophers ſpirite man ruler guider woorkes bée done body wherefore ſpirite god muſt bée hee ſhall kyll diſeaſe ſpirite whiche moſt ſpirituall thyng v yet fleſhe afore god power hym hye de verbis apoſt •… ij lowe kyll hys deſires voyde call ſpirite god helpe let v heare auguſtine ſayth texte mortifie fleſhe c thou wylte ſay wyll doe fréewill doe wyll maner fréewil except hée guide thée thou falleſt excepte hée lyfte thée vp thou lyeſt ſtyll canſt thou doe nothyng good without ſpirite god doe thy ſpirite ſéeing yt apoſtle ſayth many bée ledde ſpirite god bée child god wilte thou doe thy ſelfe wilte thou bée ledde thyne owne ſelfe mortifie déedes fleſhe profite thee thou bée epicure thou ſhalt bée stoicke whether thou bée bée epicure stoicke thou ſhalte bée amonge child god bée guided ſpirit god bée childrē god lyue owne fleſhe lyue theyr owne ſpirite bée ledde owne ſpirite many bée led ſpirite god bée child god heare man ſay ergo wée well ruled doe yt child god rule aunſwere thou ruleſt art ruled doeſt thou well rule thou bée ruled good ſpirite ʋtterly thou want ſpirite god thou canſt doe good thou doeſt truely without helpe thy fréewyll euill done ʋnto yt thy apte cauled frée euell doeing ſhée made damnanable bonde ſeruant ſay without helpe god thou doeſt nothing vnderſtand good thing doe euell thou haſt frée without helpe god though bée fréedome wherefore ſhall knowe ſo doe goodnes helping ſpirite bée guider whiche bée abſent doe good c mée thinke ſaying ſufficient men would beléeue aguſtine marke hée ſayth without ſprite god lye ſynne let ſpirit doe ye beſt hée bée child god yt guided owne ſpirite ſpirit god ſpirite doe good euell ſpirite doe leade hym bonum ſtudium bonus conatus applicacio ad bonum bonus conatus verstum de congru • ſpirite doe nothing euell hym ſelfe damnable ſeruant good damnable ſeruant doe hym ſelfe openly proued frée man owne ſtrength owne power con doe nothing ſynne commeth damnable fleſhly carnall reaſon reaſoneth frowardly crookedly reaſon fleſhly wiſedome diſpute ſay frée cā doe goodnes néede god commaunde ſo many good thinges neede god geue thoſe cōmaundementes knoweth well bée impoſſible v bée impoſſible right hym damneth v thyng impoſſible v doe aunſwere thou blinde preſumptuous damnable reaſō haſt thou learned creature enquire cauſe thy maker el murmour agaynſt ordināce thy lyuyng god haſt thou doe require cauſe actes hée hath made thée without thy cōſēt counſell may hée ſet lawes commaundementes rule thée pleaſure without thy counſel thou art worthy none aūſwere thou art ſo preſumptuous godly aunſwere ſatiſfie thée neuertheles ſtoppe thy blaſpheming mouth thine wiſedome thy great ſhame fyrſt thing muſt thou graunt god nothynge goodnes ſo hee commaunde nothyng good mée thy god eſſenciall goodneſſe nothyng goodneſſe wherefore hée commaunde nothyng good iuſte righteous thynges thou doe bée able doe thy maker may let goodnes vndone becauſe thy naughtines thyne vnablenes thou bée able doe thoſe good thynges hée cō maundeth thée faulte commaunder yet commaundementes wherfore dooſt thou grudge agaynſt hym wythout cauſe yet wilte thou murmure ſay hée knoweth bée impoſſible thée truth hée knoweth wylte thou ſay wherfore doth hée cōmaūde mée thou preſumptuous creature ſufficiently aunſwered thée ſay pleaſure ſo commaunde couldeſt thou ſay occaſiō haddeſt thou murmure wronge haſt thou wil goe farther thy maker knoweth bée impoſſible thée hée knoweth alſo thy damnable preſumptuous pride reckeneſt thou canſt doe thynges bée good thyne owne ſtrength wythout helpe ſubdue preſūptuous pryde thine bring thée knowledge thyne owne ſelfe hée hath géeuen thée hys commaundementes whiche thou canſt complayne bée righteous good thou complaine becauſe bée impoſſible thée conſider thy dampnable pryde thoughteſt thy ſelfe ſo ſtronge thou couldeſt doe goodneſſe wilt y• doe theſe god hath geuen v commaundementes bee kept commaundementes bée géeuen ſhall bée chaunged ſatiſfie thy preſūptuous pryde wherof wylte thou complayne god commaundementes bée reaſonable good bée righteous bée laudable ſhal theſe thing bée deſtroyed ſatiſfie thy pride nay ſo thou ſhalt rather remaine wyth thy pride vnder damnation theſe commaundementes ſayeſt thou thereto cāſt thou auoyde cāſt thou ſay right canſt thou ſaue thy ſelfe daunger canſt thou auoyde thy dāpnation thy carnall wyſdome nay verely hée thy aduerſary omnipotent wherefore ſay thou wilte ſo muſt bée god ordinaunce may bée chaunged wilte thou aſke remedye remedy onely confeſſe thy weakenes confeſſe thy pryde knowledge thy vnablenes graunt yt theſe cō maundementes bée lawfull holy good thou art bounde kéepe geue laude prayſe god goe thy mercyfull maker confeſſion deſire hym hée helpe thée hée bée mercyfull vnto thée hée ſtrengthen thée thou art weake hée geue thée ſpirite thy ſpirite fleſhly fulfill theſe ſpirituall commaundementes doubt thou thou ſhalt finde hym mercyfull alſo gracious hée gaue thée theſe cō maundements intent ſecretly declaryng thy pride alſo thy weakenes thou mighteſt ſéeke call vnto hym helpe doth auguſtine declare de temp ſer lxiij well theſe wordes man doe perceiue commaundements thing impoſſible el hard let hym remaine hym ſelfe let hym runne vnto god helper hath geuen commaundementes intent deſire might bée ſtyrred vp hée might geue helpe c marke auguſtine ſayth commaundemēts bée impoſſible vnto ſtrength muſt call god ſtrength pelagians dyd recken got great victory whē made carnall reaſon yt god would commaūde nothyng impoſſible reaſō glory triumphe thought muſt néedes haue ſome naturall ſtrength power fulfill commaundementes god ſéeyng god would commaunde nothing impoſſible man ſame reaſon doth lorde rocheſter ſcholers glory vnto ſame day let v ſée auguſtine de lib arb cap xvi aunſwereth pelagians ſayth hée thinke know wōderous thing ſay god commaunde thyng whiche hée knoweth impoſſible man doe euery mā knoweth therfore doth hée commaunde certeine thyngs doe becauſe might know thyng ought aſke fayth eccl 12 god commaundementes bee impoſſible nature ſhée prayer obtaineth thyng law commaundeth briefely hée ſayeth thou wilt thou mayeſt kéepe commaū dementes ſame booke litle ſayth hée ſhall geue kéeping mouth playne may kéepe commaundementes becauſe prepared god muſt bée aſked may ſo much wil wil ſuffice v doe thē truth whē hée maketh v thyng good c haue playne lord rocheſters opinion pelagiās one doe agrée commaundementes god bée impoſſible natural ſtrength auguſtine ſayth bée impoſſible therefore bée geuen ſhould know weakednes alſo aſke ſtrēgth fulfill faith prayer doth obteine ſtrength fulfil impoſſible commaundementes law whereof good commeth haue alſo god moueth v cauſeth v bée good willers geueth v good el wold neuer euill alſo bée noted yt pelagians dun mē agrée one ſay ye grace god doth helpe mās good purpoſe ſo man doth firſt intende purpoſe de cōgruo well dun ſayth diſpoſeth hym ſelfe attriciō receiue grace thē god doth helpeth hym truth contrary good purpoſe man good diſpoſition good intent agaynſt goodnes cleane cōtrary againſt thing agréeth grace vntill god hys méere mercy commeth geueth grace chaungeth mās vnto grace geueth hym goodnes yea hée thought nothing goodnes doth clearely reſiſt goodnes doth auguſtine proue de lib arb cap xvi theſe wordes pelagians ſay yt graunt grace doth help euery man good purpoſe y• pelagians ſayth god giueth good lawes man may keepe natural ſtrength el cōmaundemēts fruſtrate hée geueth loue vertue hym ſtriueth agaynſt thyng doe ſay though man hym ſelfe without helpe god hath good purpoſe good mynde vnto vertue whiche merite procedyng afore hée worthy bée holpen grace god foloweth doubtles grace foloweth doth helpe good purpoſe man good purpoſe ſhould neuer haue beene grace preceded though yt good ſtudy man begynneth holpen grace yet dyd neuer begyn without grace c open pelagiās graunt much grace lord rocheſter doth dun men whiche learneth man may haue good purpoſe bonum ſtudium good mynde loue grace owne naturall ſtrēgth pelagians graunt euen ſame ſée saint auguſtine cleare agaynſt let v dun wordes ſinner may naturall commō influence iiij ſen diſt xiiij queſt ij god conſider ſinnes thyng hath offended god thing cōtrary law god letteth hym reward bringeth hym payne meanes may hée hate abhore ſinne calleth hée attriciō wherby diſpoſition ſayth hée merite man congruence take away mortal ſinne attrition ſufficient man ſhall receiue sacramentes quod non ponat obicem hée haue mortall ſinne actually ſufficient alſo neceſſary way receiue grace c ten tymes worſe pelagians ſayinges graunt man muſt néedes haue ſpeciall grace performe good purpoſe dun ſayth man may performe attrition naturall power yea attrition congruence diſpoſition take away mortall ſinne without ſpeciall grace pray dun congruence it▪ hath attrition deſerued mortall ſinne ſhould bée taken awaye pleaſure hath hée deſerued grace muſt folow hym infidel may haue attrition graunt cōmeth naturall ſtrength yet ſhall folowe congruence inuſt receiue grace alſo remiſſiō ſinnes alſo iudas attrition hée ſayd haue ſinned ſory ſinne alſo repēted knew well hée offended god alſo deſerued payne willyng thinke ſo doe yt property belongeth attrition yet ſée hée dyd deſerue congruence grace remiſſion ſinnes yea dyd attritiō bryng hym extreme deſperation howe man without ſpeciall grace abhorre ſinne poſſible hee hath yt grace god cānot abhorre ſin hée muſt loue ſinne ſo longe hée enemy god yea hée woulde god puniſhe ſinne ſuch pleaſure hath hée vnto ſinne nature harte doth euery one v féele though theſe men teacheth contrary ſay word prophete redite ad cor preuaricatores grope boſomes finde mortal enemy god neither careth god diſpleaſure yet ſinne ſay hée may haue good attritiō naturall ſtrēgth attrition bée good may hée doe good grace ſo ſhall gather grape thornes figges brier ſayth paule rom 18 good attrition ſayth thing without fayth nothyng man fleſhly man hath nothyng ſpirit god learnyng hée hath commō influence yet ſhall hée bée ſory hée
