hath offended god shall hée abhorre ſinne shall hée depoſe hym ſelfe congruence grace paul ſayth fleſh luſteth cōtrary ſpirite workes fleſhe bée aduoultry fornication vnclennes idolatry witchcraft hatred wrath zeale ſedition enuying ſuch pray doe theſe workes agrée attrition call abhorryng ſinne call heauines offēdyng god bée theſe good diſpoſitions bee theſe good preparatiōs vnto god thinke theſe workes doe deſerue congruence remiſſiō mortal ſinne theſe • beſt workes ſinner hath hart el paule lyeth wherfore poſſible hée muſt haue wil actual ſinne hée cā nothyng ſinne therefore hée receiue sacramentes attrition hée receiueth damnation grace hée vtter enemye god sacramentes wherefore god muſt mere mercy mollifie hart geue grace goodnes el hée cā neuer doe yet deſire auguſtine doth declare theſe wordes de grede • • cap 8 grace geuē largenes god priuely men hart bée deſpiſed maner hard hart therfore geuē grace findeth harte ſtony hardnes hart ſhould bee taken away wherfore whē father hard within doth learne muſt come ſonne taketh hée away ſtony hart geueth v fleſhely harte meanes hée maketh v child promiſe veſſels mercy hée hath prepared glory wherfore doth hée learne men come chriſte bicauſe thoſe hée learneth hée learneth mercy thoſe hée learneth hys iudgement doth hée learne c marke auguſtine ſayth hardneſſe hart reſiſt grace dun ſayth may bée obſtacle mās hart auguſtine ſaith grace findeth harte hardnes obſtinacie dūs ſaith mollifieng precedeth grace whiche hée calleth attrition auguſtine ſaythmeritum de congruo father learneth v within taketh hée away ſlony harte dun ſayth doe common natural influence diſpoſe ſelues cōgruence marke alſo men bée taught come chriſt alonely yt bée taught mercy bée taught bée mercy congruence attrition briefely greater hereſie contrary chriſte bleſſed word cā man learne yet muſt hée bée taken great clarke ſubtile doctour bicauſe hée pleaſeth fleſhe ſhortly haue openly proued inuincible scripture doctours great authoritie fréewill naturall ſtrength ſpeciall grace doe nothyng abyde ſinne fayne inuent excogitate dreame many holy purpoſes many ſubtile diſtinctions many good attrition many good applicatiōs bée ſinne till grace come sine fide impoſsibile eſt placere deoyea ſléepyng eatyng drynkyng almeſſes prayer ſingyng ryngyng confeſſyng mumblyng mournyng wayling briefely cā doe hypocriſie double ſinne afore god till tyme hée hys mercy chooſeth v hée ſayth haue choſen haue choſen declare ſcripture two men bring proue conatum bonum studium fyrſt place god béeginnyng dyd ordayne man left hym handes owne counſell hée geue hym commaundementes preceptes thou wilt kéepe commaundementes alſo kéepe peaſably fayth euer ſhall kéepe thée haue ſet thée water fyre ſtretch thy hand thou wilt place gathered mā may haue good intent good mynde apply hym ſelfe god naturall power proued text neuer worde entending ſtudying applying take wordes text ſound rather prooue may kéepe commaundementes god yea alſo beleeue god thing ſure man graunt howe could men auoyde phyloſophers ſaued man denye dyd aſmuch lay naturall power come god moreouer pelagians bring text proue man may doe good naturall ſtrength nowe auoyde denye proueth opinion ye wordes ſound moſt denye proueth conatum bonum studium text ſpeaketh neuer worde wherefore text maketh neither thē yet plaine wordes text ſoūde kéeping beleeueuing intending ſtudying wherefore maketh purpoſe let v goe text god frō eccl 16 béeginning dyd make man theſe wordes bée open creation ye fyrſt man hée left hym handes owne counſell theſe wordes make nothing fréewill heare nothing commaunded hym doe onely heare ſignifyed man lordſhyp ouer creature god man made lorde ouer inferior creature vſe hys pleaſure opē geneſis 2 thinges brought afore adam receyue name ſignifying left vnto vſe hys hée lorde ouer none ouer hym kingdome y• hée dyd raigne gouerne thing commaundementes yet generall influence geuen firſt god hée adde cō maundementes preceptes theſe wordes power geuen vnto hym heare bée geuen hym commaundementes whereby hée muſt bée ordered ruled rule owne counſell counſell commaundementes god wherefore theſe man dominion reſtreined commaundementes parte hys frée domination lordſhip hée ouer inferior thinges taken away god commaū ded hym hée ſhould eate ye trée knowledge good euyll frée hym vſe trée owne commaundement god power hée frée kéepe commaundement ye effect declare thou wilt kéepe ye commaundementes beginneth doubt yet theſe wordes gather hée hath power kepe yet yt hee might intend kepe followeth thou wilt ergo thou mayſt thou mayſt entend foloweth would ergo could depoſe let conſequent alſo haue generall rule condicionalis nihil ponit wherefore theſe wordes thou wilt kéepe commaundementes geueth power ſtrength frée onely foloweth texte man kéepe commaundementes ſhall kéepe hym ſhall hée haue hys power looke auguſtine aug de lib arb cap xvi aboue recited ſhall ſhall fynde man commeth alſo wordes ye text bée thou wilt thou mayſt kéepe intende kéepe bée man may kéepe intende hée thou wilte kéepe ſhall kéepe thée wherefore theſe wordes conclude power man foloweth god ſayth doe heare heare kéepe kéepe thou wilte doe yu wilt doe doe theſe thinges intende doe god commaundeth v doe good thinges ergo bée able naturall ſtrength doe ſpirite god fruſtrate ſpirite god geuen v geue commaundementes geue v ſtrength fulfill righteouſly vnderſtand thoſe thinges yt bée commaunded v commaundementes auguſt de verb apoſt ſent xiij declared thynge ought doe alſo ſhew weakeneſſe imbecilitie might learne ſéeke greater ſtrength greater helpe v sainte auguſtine ſayeth theſe wherefore lawe giuen woordes lawe geuen man myght fynde hym ſelfe make hys ſickenes whole preaching ſicknes increaſed y• phiſicion might bée ſought wherfore lawe threatning fullfilling thing hée commaundeth maketh man vnderneath hym law good man doe vſe well vſe law well law know ſinnes ſéeke god helpe helpe health c heare playne commaundementes god geue v ſtrength yet declare ſtrength bée v ſheweth v dutye alſo weakenes alſo mooueth v cauſeth v ſéeke ſtrength theſe wordes ſi voluris ſi feceris ſi audieris ſi emundaueris ſi vi ſuch bée wordes commaundementes wordes vnder condition doe nothing declare bounde doe ſhall folowe doe wordes lawe doe threaten euyll ende ſynne onelye feare euel doer wicked perſons euell ſo doe wordes promyſe ſtyre vp quicken good mēs harte doe well alſo comfort thē ſhould diſpayre ad • erſities neither theſe thoſe geue v ſtrēgth doe commaunded alonely doe declare paine reward ſhall folow breaker kéepers ſcripture haue maiſter chriſt ſayth often math 23 woulde haue gathered thy child woulde cry liberum arbitrium lib arb fréewyll néede maiſter chriſt ſay thou wouldeſt firſt muſt wee conſider yt two wils god two maner wils god one called hys godly wyll hys ſecrete vnſcrutable whereby thinges bée made ordered thing bée done creature hath knowledge hée ought thereby doe doe paule ſayth inſcrutable therefore ſufficient v knowe therof alonely inſcrutable god called declared manifeſt declared geuen v holy scripture gene 2 ſhewed vnto vttermoſt chriſt ſonne god therefore lawfull alſo men bound ſearch know thys wyll conſideration manifeſted vnto v wyll doth declare what▪ euery man bounde doe euery man bounde flie thys wyll offered vnto euery man thoſe thynges bée ſaluation god haue man damned hée letteth worde bée preached indifferently men nowe hée wyll knowe wyll muſt goe maiſter chriſt whome paule ſayth treaſures wiſedome ſcience hée ſhew v much neceſſarye v knowe much father heauen woulde wée ſhoulde know texte ſpeaketh god incarnated ſent ſpeake doe preach bée familiar v doe myracles yea alſo ſuffer death ſaluation ſayth hée woulde haue gathered howe chriſt willed ſaue iewe▪ thy child ſay dyd preach labour wyth diligence conuerte thee myracles afore thée yea wepte wailed thy ſake theſe thynges thinges myght bee thy conuerſion belōged god incarnate doe theſe thing profite becauſe woulde hym faulte nothyng vndone belonged hym doe ſo hée wyllyng yet profite ieruſalem becauſe woulde woulde becauſe theyr power wyll conſent wyll conſent nay truely becauſe iohn ſaythe iohn 11 coulde beléeue hée blinded eye hardened harte ſhoulde ſée theyr eye vnderſtand harte muſt néedes alonely wherin th • libertie freewill conſiſteth conſent coulde otherwyſe doe conſent yet neyther conſtrayned compelled wrunge wyth violence fréely woulde conſēt yet libertie fréewill bée agaynſt chriſte bée wyth hym libertie fréewill ſtandeth may wil thing alſo contrary therof ſtandeth magiſt ſen ij thyng hée wyll wyll owne wyll therto conſtrayned wylleth fréely wythout compulſion yet hée chooſe wil chooſe bu • ſo wyll ſo wyll neceſſitie immutable neceſſitie compulſion coaction nowe open place maketh power none entente fréewyll conſent vnto chriſt wyll contrary wyl vnto hym becauſe handes chaunge blynded harte hardened therefore naturall ſtrēgth coulde none otherwyſe doe vary chriſt would deſtred otherwiſe ſwarue hym delyte wherefore blynded wherefore hardened muſt inquire inſcrutable wyll pleaſed hym ſo leaue thē may • ee inquiſi •• ue god ſec • etes cauſe therof ſure hée cā tel hée woulde ſure rightteouſly done inough mée commeth blynde fleſhlye reaſon murmureth thys aſketh wée cōdemned doth god puniſhe v ſéeing wée wyll otherwyſe alſo hée blyndeth v hée maketh hart harde wée amende v lieth power wythout nowe complayneth hée v layeth hée charge nothynge done hys wée bée inſtrumentes hys wée doe well geeueth hée v ſtrength doe better thou dampnable reaſon ſatiſfie thée reckoneſt nothyng bée well done thou dooſte done wyth thy counſell thynkeſt thou thou art good perfecte thyne owne nature thée wel righteouſly made thou wilte aunſwere yea thou wi • condemne thy ſelfe thing thine aunſwere mee hath made thée ſo well geuen thée thy righteouſnes thys goodnes thou haſt thou muſt néedes ſay god cauſe thou art ſo well ſo righteous ſo good made ſéeyng thou deſerueſt nothyng yea▪ theſe thynges bée done ſo well ſo righteouſly thou canſt complayne amēde yet deuiſe way amende doeſt thou murmur agaynſt god ſéeyng thynges done without thy knowledge alſo without thy deſeruing doeſt thou inquire cauſe hym murmureſt thou hée hath made thée ſo good ſo rightfull ſéeyng thou haddeſt nothyng deſerued wilt thou graunt god dyd thyng beſt doeſt thou lykewiſe thynges furthermore thou muſt néedes graunt god thy maker nothyng god doth cā bee amended gouernour thyngs moſt wiſe moſt righteous moſt mercyfull ſo wiſe nothyng hée doth bée amended ſo righteous bée ſuſpition hym vnrighteouſnes ſo mercyfull • ée hée cā doe nothyng without mercy howe thinkeſt thou wilt thou graunt theſe thynges thy maker thou muſt néedes graunt compare vnto rule thy note wicked ſinnefull ſtate man blindnes within thée thy induratiō thée thy peruers toward goodnes cauſe haſt thou complayne thou haſt graunted hée doth thynges righteouſly ergo thou haſt wrong hée doth thing mercyfully ergo thou art thy blyndnes thy hardnes better intreated thē thou haſt deſerued moreouer thou beleueſt god righteous god wiſe god mercyful fayth thoſe thynges doe appeare bée prooued exteriour cauſes hold thée faſt fayth thy fleſhely reaſons bée aſſ • iled whē god ſaueth ſo men damneth ſo many thou knoweſt cauſe yet muſt thou beléeue hée mercyful righteous fayth doth come exterior cauſes mere gift god fayth could bée prooued exteriour cauſes néede beléeue thou beléeue hée mercyfull good righteous vnto thée wherefore murmureſt thou yet wouldeſt thou know wherfore hée durateth thée blyndeth thée geueth thée grace amende vnto thy brother hath better deſerued thou haſt yea hée hath likewiſe euill deſerued thou haſt yet hée geueth hym grace taketh away hardnes geueth goodnes indifferently done thou thinkeſt firſt ſay thée thou haſt cauſe complayne thou haſt god diſpoſeth hys mercy pleaſeth hym wrong thou haſt thyng thyne nothyng taken frō thée belōgeth thée doeſt thou complayne right yea yet ſayeſt thou hée geueth one mercy geueth none aunſwere thée mercy owne lawfull geue hée thy eye euil becauſe hée good take thyne goe thy way math 20 bée wil ſhew wrath make power knowne ouer veſſels wrath ordeined rom 9 damnation declare rich glory vnto veſſels mercy hée prepared elected vnto glory haſt thou therewith doe cauſe haſt thou therof cōplayne god bée well righteous thou ſayeſt thou beléeueſt wherefore leaue thy murmuryng god hath delight damnation thy diſputation agaynſt god recken hée nature mercyfull hath delite pleaſure thy damnatiō beléeue thou ſtedfaſtly hée ſhewe hys mercy vnto one man worlde thou ſhalt bée ſame one man though aungell would make thée beléeue world ſhould bée damned yet ſticke thou faſt mercy iuſtice iuſtifieth thée beléeue ſwéete bloud bleſſed ſonne bée ſhedde vayne muſt néedes iuſtifie ſinners ſo many ſticke faſt vnto though bée comfortable wholeſome doctrine neuer ſo blynded neuer ſo hardned ſhed alonely thou canſt thus ſatiſfie thy ſelfe doeſt thou wel thou art doubtles ieoperdie thou wilt bée content wilt diſpute inquire cauſes god inſcrutable ſtand looke ſée victordome thou ſhalt get doubt repēt thée hée conclude thée maner may doe haue aūſwered intricable doubt ſchoole men wrapped whiche would know cauſe predeſtination reprobatiō dun béeyng eſau iacob iacob eſau elected eſau reprooued afore borne afore done either good bad bée playner example meaneth paule theſe word weare neyther borne done neyther good bad election god myght ſtand doth hée clearely take away manner merites de congruo alſo de condigno declare wyll meritum de congruo god bée cauſe onely heare ſubtyll blyndnes ſay god ſawe béefore iacob ſhould doe good therefore dyd hée chuſe hym hée ſawe alſo eſau ſhould doe good therefore hée repelled hym ala blindenes iudge god ſaw know god ſawe hée ſawe yet know cauſe iacobs election iacob elected eſau reiected theſe child bée vnborne haue done neyther good bad yet one choſen refuſed paule knoweth none cauſe god diſcuſe ſay god ſée afore one ſhould doe good praye cauſe whereby ſaw hée hée ſhould doe good muſt néedes ſay hée would geue hym grace ergo god yet cauſe election becauſe ye god would geue hym grace therefore god ſaw hée ſhould doe good ſo ſhould alſo ye haue done god woulde haue geuen hym ſame grace wherefore gyauntes ſubdue heauen earth leaue ſearching cauſe bée content god doubt god righteous lawfull cauſe merites bée doubt paule toke ſo great labour rom 9 matter dyd ſée farre man deſeruing doe yet hée concluded theſe wordes ſcriptures ſhew mercy god mercy ye cauſe onely ſaluation ſhew mercy haue cō paſſion haue compaſſion lyeth man cunnyng mercy god hée ſayth haue mercy hym ſée ſhall doe good ſhew mercy wil hée ſaith haue compaſſion hym y• ſhall deſerue de congruo haue cōpaſſion doth auguſtine well proue theſe word diſputatiō thē vain auguſt ſuper ioannem tract lxxxviij y• doe defend ye preſēce god agaynſt grace god therfore ſay choſen afore ye making world becauſe ye god knew afore ſhould bée good béecauſe hee ſhould make v good hée ſayth haue choſen mée ſayth hée dyd therefore choſe v béecauſe hée knew wée ſhould bée good thē muſt hee alſo knowe béefore wée ſhould fyrſt haue choſen hym c playne election god becauſe hée ſawe afore ſhould doe well onely cauſe election mere mercy cauſe well election therefore paule ſayth workes callynge goe ſubtill dun men carnall reaſons ſearch cauſe ſecrete dyd beléeue hée good righteous mercyfull great comfort electiō ſtoode onely hys ſo ſure ſhould bée righteouſly done mercifully haue god mercyfull fayth therfore muſt nedes myſtruſt god fall inuent cauſes election ſtrength one ſhould ſay béecauſe god righteouſnes mercy chooſe v ſure ſhall bée elected fyrſt mās good intent ſaue hym ſelfe inuent election commeth deſeruyng alſo dreame certayne workes ſhall thereunto bée appoynted v thoſe doe pleaſure ſo election reprobacion ſhall ſtande hand let god doe pleaſeth béecauſe bée certayne open place ſcripture geue onely cauſe god onely election alſo reprobation therefore theſe men ſore troubled tell remedy onely ſtudye may wring wreſt open ſcriptures fortifiing errour ſatiſfyinge carnall reaſon ſo holy ghoſt ſayth obdurate hart pharao take vpon learne teach holy ghoſt ſpeake better ſay maner ſuffer pharao bée indurated doe eaſynes ſoftnes whereby ſhall ſuffer ſhall bring men repentaunce pharo ſhal make obſtinate malice god doth indurate ſay hée doth chaſtice ſynner ſheweth ſoftnes eaſynes ſufferaunce hym hée mercifull hée doth call ſinner repentaunce affiction ſcourging induration expoſition nothing el ſuffer euyll ſoftnes goodnes haue mercy nothing el correcte ſcourge punyſhe men ſynnes expoſition induration origine per • arcon gloſ rom 5 hier • ſuper eſaiam hierome common gloſe hieromes wordes bée theſe god doth indurate hée doth caſtigate ſynner hée hath mercy hée doth call ſynner vnto repentāce affliction c auctoritie inough thinke ſhoulde ſearch farther dyd theſe men vnderſtand ſcripture expoſition playne taketh away inconueniēces expoſition god auctor euell clarkely expoſition briefly muſt néedes bee true expoſitiō wherfore weare better erre hierome oulde ſchoolemen ſay true theſe newe heretykes ſo call reproue oulde errours haue well defended bee newe men matter cauſe well proued muſt holy ghoſt chang wordes hée hath new ſchoolemayſters wheare hée wont ſay haue hardened pharos hart muſt hée ſay pharao hath hardened hym ſelfe ſoftnes eaſines haue done yet pray woulde ſatiſfie weake conſcience ſtickes faſte worde god reckeneth holy ghoſt knoweth well hée ſhal ſpeake wil ſpeake nothing without great cauſe hée ſpeaketh ſhall bée ſo well ſpoken amende thynke ſufficient ſay poore man hierome ſchoole men ſay ſo holde thou thy peace bée thou content expoſitions ſerch thou doth become thée know hée wyll laye charge thyng opēly writin ſcripture wordes moyſes paule bée playne therfore muſt aunſwere ſhall bée lawful neceſſary hym know minde holy ſcripture expoſitiō hierome dun scripture ſaith plainly god doth indurate pharaos hart pharao owne hart new expoſition ſay indurate pharaos hart ſhall bée much pharao ſhall indurate himſelfe thorough ſoftnes patience rule ſhal anaragoras philoſophy come place ſhall howe papiſtes ſchoole men peruert holy ſcriptures make euery thing hée wyll ſcripture ſayth saul saul dooſte thou perſecute mée shall bée much ſay ſuffereſt thou mée bée perſecuted alſo father heauen ſent hys onely ſonne worlde ſhall bée much ſay hée ſuffered ſonne bée ſent wée ſhal expounde place scripture owne purpoſe looke ſentence holy scripture yet mynde holy ghoſt expoſitiō pleaſe v beſt beſt ſerue carnall minde furthermore god doe harden men harte hée ſuffereth hée ſofte ſheweth mercy hée harden harte iewes whē brought egypt wilderneſſe hée harden hée brought captiuitie babylon hardeneth hée worlde hée ſuffereth great ſoftnes mercy alſo expoſition hée mercifull iſraell hée ſent babylō dyd hée chaſten affliction prouoked repentaunce likewiſe father heauen mercy worlde whē hée ſent ſonne hée gaue • n occaſion induratiō hée hée damneth ſinners rule hath mercy chaſteneth puniſheth ſinnes rule induration mā may ſay againſt miſerere may ſignifie geeue grace remitte ſinne chaſtice ſcourge paine prouoke repentaunce indurare ſhall ſignifie harden ſuffer bée patient bée mer •• ull chaſtice maiſters god mercifull vnto pharao ſoftenes ſufferaunce whome hée chaſtened ſo ſore ten plague wyth ſuch plague moyſes marueyled call ſoftnes ſuffering pharao occaſion induratiō patience eaſines ſufferaūce god ſend aduerſaries patience ſufferaunce pray coulde god chaſtice hym yet euery plague ſayth indurate pharaos hart wherefore pharao none occaſion induration ſufferaunce patience god rather ſcourging wherfore muſt bée ſence theſe wordes doe make wee muſt ſéeke waye know god doth worke induration god indurateth men harte ſuch wordes doth holy ghoſt vſe therfore dare wée ſpeake hée y• doer good euil yet thynges hee doth well done fyrſt muſt néedes graunt fall adam pure nature man corrupted ſinne whereby wée bee wicked borne paule ſayth nature ephe 2 child wrath dauid ſayth wee conceiued ſinne notwithſtanding corrupt nature doth god make mē good bad thoſe bee good good hys grace thoſe bée badde bee badde corrupted nature yet god hath made neuertheleſſe nature ſame goodnes better thē nature ſay euill yet creation god workemanſhip good thouth thyng bee euill ſelfe yet god worke hymſelfe good though worlde ſay naye nowe god hys infinite power doth rule guide maner men good badde mē infinite power moued vnto operation euery man nature owne philoſophy primum mobile reaſō ſwifte motiō caryeth inferiour thinges ſuffereth nothing bee vnmoued notwithſtā ding hee moueth thynges owne naturall courſe likewiſe god infinite thyngs ſubiect god power letteth nothyng bée exemted hym b • thynges bee ſubiecte vnto action nothing done principall motion ſo hee worketh maner thynges bee eyther good bad chaunging nature mouinge alonely worke nature ſo god worketh good euill worketh euil god vſeth inſtrumentes yet doth hee nothynge euill euill done alonely thorowe euill man god working hym euill inſtrument take example man doth ſawe blocke euil ſawe nothyng apte cut wel yet muſt néedes cut mouing man though bée neuer ſo euill man mouing doth chaunge nature ſawe neuertheleſſe action ye man good cunningly done cutting ſawe nature likewiſe god moueth theſe euyll inſtrumentes working common influence geuen creature ſuffereth bee idle chaungeth nature wherfore operation fruite god actiō good conuenient corrupted nature yet faulte god mouinge haue howe god workes thynges men good bad let v goe induration bée euill thus firſt bée euill nature abyde nothyng good yet ſuffer good bée done wherefore god author goodneſſe doth thyng ſayth thyng vnto ſorer ſorer contrary vnto god hys workes nature ſo corrupted agrée god thynge good offered either word déede thē blaſpheme withſtād theyr might power prouoked corrupted nature miſchief alwayes harder harder yt faithfull take profite hearing word god ſo wicked vnfaith full take hurt thereby example bleſſed word god preached vnto bée wicked god hath geuen grace receiue nothyng amended indurated alwayes harder harder yt word god preached obſtinate miſchief intende ſtudy wiſedome labour might power craft ſubtiltie frendes make heauen earth nothyng el oppreſſe word god yea thinke litle yt preached grudge woodder bée maner hart pharao indurated whē word god declared vnto hym moyſes hée grace receiue moyſes laboured worde ſturdyer hée withſtandyng alwayes harder harder alſo euidently ſéene corrupt nature man thyng forbydden hym deſireth hée doe néede goe egypt fetch exā ple prooue looke mine countreymen bée openly indurated ſo blynded mā able defend reaſon law therefore take ſelues violence oppreſſion pharao dyd whiche bée right ſignes token induration yt word god preached veritie declared vnto ſturdyer obſtinate bée agaynſt theyr ſtudy theyr wyttes theyr counſels craft miſchief gloſinges lyinges blaſphemyng god hys preacher nothyng el kéepe yt word god vnder withſtand veritie know conſcience muſt néedes goe foorth though world ſay nay therfore heare man reaſon man euen ſay pharao dyd let people go • indurated verye enemyes vnto veritie woulde leſt wayes heare poore brethrē charitie know coulde ſay coulde prooue ſaying bée true yt loue ye veritie haue ye ſhadow would geue inmortall thākes god great méekenes low ſpirite receiue heauenly verity thanke brother hartely warned ſuch damnable way good tyme ſeaſon loue veritie yet feare god regarde daunger ſoules child induration blaſphe therfore preached obſtinate verye induration god worketh men harte wherby bée child darkenes therefore let v pray inſtantly god mollifie hard hart chriſtes deare bloud ſake amen lawfull maner men read holy scripture antichriſt bée better knowen thys token hée condemneth scripture maketh hereſie high treaſon againſt kynges grace lay men reade holy ſcripture though alonely poſſeſſion heritage certayne men bée marked alonely exteriour ſignes truth ſay wyth token beaſte ſhauē crownes long gownes pope cleargie wil allow yt ſcripture bee yt mother vulgar tongue yt people baners neckes haue theſe token bée heyres holy scripture may reade pleaſure though vnderſtand much popingaye holy scripture ſent v heauen yea ſonne god deſtroy hereſies holy ſcripture ſhall ingender lay men hereſie bée doctrine antichriſt know hys doctrine tell mée bée contrary chriſt violence oppreſſe ſcriptures cōdemne vnlawfull yea hereſie certaine men reade ſay bée certayne ſecrettes belonge lay mē know thing ſhall bée denyde know bée ſlipper haue doe wyth holde therefore wyll recite open acte worlde doth remember lord londō opēly paul byſhoppe stokeſley croſſe aſhamed intollerable blaſphemes condemne holy teſtament chriſt ieſus hauing common practiſe prelate deface ſcriptures hym damnable collour deadly reaſon deuill tranſlation ſo many hereſyes yt world knoweth abhominable deadly lye though lordly lye ſuch probation doth god wayes let haue bée agaynſt holy veretye let v graunt tranſlation ſo falſe dyd take vpon cleargie willing finde faulte wyth tranſlating scripture amende openly amend ſet forth truely holy teſtament chriſt muſt néedes graunt holy teſtament earth except denye chriſt doubt effect wheare haue weare doe ſet yt true teſtament ready condemne w tyndal man faythfull labour dilygence charytie amende thinke alwayes diſceaue world holy hypocriſy men bée ſo blinde well indge condemned teſtament onely béecauſe errours yet yt leaſt wayes ſhould charitie alſo dutye haue ſet forth trew text would men haue thought yt condemned reaſon errours men may euydently ſée yt dyd condemne errours ſakes ſholde iudge errours bée ſo vnlearned onely béecauſe veritie yt could onely cauſe scripture condemned byſhops abyde men ſhould knowe dyd proceſſe ſermon alſo tyranny doth folow wil proue lord ſay doe amend ſhall bée eueralſting damnacyon god take rebuke hand remember hée hath ſworne mouth hys eſay 61 prophet hys right hand myght ſtrength hée wil defende cauſe bée theſe lordly wordes eternall god think make hym forſworne remember holy ghoſt threatyneth place ſaying man hebr 10 dyd diſpiſe lawe moſes hée muſt without mercy dye howe much worthy puniſhment doe treade ſonne god vederneath féete deſpiſe bloud teſtament thinke openly agaynſt condemne onely chriſt alſo bleſſed worde longeth hym take awaye chriſtes word remayneth béehynde chriſt nothing word god firſte written nation people prieſtes onely pray lorde whome worde fyrſt preached whome written onely prieſtes vnto lay men yea written worlde yes truely wherby conuerte turke infidell holy scripture bée conuerted wil learne wyll géeue reade thing holy scripture thinke nay make owne countreymen owne citizen owne ſubiectes yea owne brother redéemed chriſtes bleſſed bloud worſſe iewes infidel reaſon brotherhod chriſten charitie mooue helpe ſo blynded ſo obſtinate againſt chriſt rather worlde ſhoulde periſhe doctrine ſhoulde bee brought light doe promyſe god doe ſpare mée lyfe géeue mée grace ſhall ſo ſet doe reuoke ſhall bée vtter ſhame confuſion finde beſt remedye doe beléeue ſtedfaſtly god mightier doe recken byſhoppes worſe great turke faythfully beléeue ten tymes worſſe greate turke hée regardeth rule dominiō worlde therewyth content alſo rule ouer mēs conſconſciences yea oppreſſe chriſt holy worde blaſpheme condemne worde worſhyp full counſell vnpreachyng prelate holy connſell chaunceler london counſell certaine marchaunt buye robyn hoode ſeruauntes read ſhould doe wyth vitas patrum bookes holy scripture alſo ſame chauncelour ſayde man findeſt thou goſpell ſtory good canſt thou take lord god art thou earneſt zeale doctour barnes ſléepeſt thou ſuffereſt thou blaſphemy thou haſt defended thy prophetes wild fire heauen wilt thou ſuffer thy onely fonne thy heauenly word thus bée deſpiſed bée reckened ſtory robin hoode riſe vp good lorde riſe vp thy enemyes doe preuayle thy enemyes doe multiplye ſhew thy power defend thy glory thy contumely haue doe alonely thy glory reuenge cauſe thy enemyes ſhall recken bée thy cauſe thou eternall god thoughe ſinnes haue deſerued yet looke thy name yet looke thy veritie sée howe thou art mocked sée thou art blaſphemed yea haue taken defend thy glory heauenly father ſéeyng thou haſt ſo ſuffered yet glory thy name geue ſome man ſtrength defend el ſhalt thou bée clearely taken harte men wherefore moſt gracious lord thy mercy grace beſéech thée may haue ſtrength defend thy godly word thy glory honour vtter confuſion thy mortall enemyes helpe good lorde helpe ſhall feare thouſande thyne enemyes thy name begyn defend cauſe firſt commeth thy faythfull ſeruaunt doctour barnes moſt earneſtly defē deth chriſtes cauſe moſes true iuſt thy workes hée commaundeth faithfully truely great threatnings man woman child ſhould diligently read thy holy word ſaying set hart wordes doe teſtifie vnto day may commaunde vnto child kéepe doe fulfill thynges bée written booke law marke hée commaūded learne child thynges bée written booke ſo learne thē deut 32 might kéepe fulfill thing written yt booke moſes made nothing ſecretnes make ſecretes therin ſhall men fulfill thoſe wordes knowe men knowe true way god haue word god knowledge therin prophet ſayth thy word lanterne vnto féete light vnto pathes hée calleth lanterne pſal 118 light yea vnto men call ſtory darkenes thyng ſecretnes yea occaſion hereſie occaſion darknes geue light lanterne bée thing ſecretnes veritie god bée occaſion hereſie holy prophet ſayth bleſſed pſal 1 man ſetteth delectation pope chriſt contrary god meditation god law night day ſayeth ſpirite god men bee bleſſed ſtudy word god ſay men bée heretickes ſtudying doth ſpirite god agrée alſo paule commaundeth v epheſ 6 receiue helmet health ſword ſpirite whiche worde god pray doth hée ſpeake prieſtes onely many prieſtes dyd hée knowe yea epiſtle written whole churche epheſians dyd read lay men ſhall lay men read red moreouer doth paule call ſword ſpirite lawfull lay men haue ſpirit god ſpirite god frée bound alonely alſo iohn godly ſaying ihon ſayth man come bring doctrine receiue houſe yet ſalute hym holy ghoſt would ſhould haue doctrine holy ſcripture take alonely v furthermore written vnto woman child yt man wyfe childe ſhall reade ſhould receiue prieſtes houſes rule thinke ſhould bée greatly cōbered haue word alſo chriſt ſaith vnto phareſies ſearch ſcriptures thinke haue eternall life maiſter ſent phariſies phariſies iudged better ſcriptures god byſhops dyd ſcriptures forbyd chriſten men reade worſe ſprite yet iudged better holy ſcriptures thē doe iudged haue lyfe thē iudge haue hereſyes thē ſo bée ten tymes worſe ſcriptures thē euer alſo paule ſaith ſcripture geuen inſperation 1 tim 3 god profitable teach improoue enforme io enſtruct righteouſnes man god may bée perfect prepared vnto good workes denye ſcripture geuē v god ergo foloweth c paul ſaith profitable learne ſay dawnable good learn heriſes paule ſayth good improoue papiſtes paule contrarye hereſyes ſay engendereth hereſyes paule ſayth good informe inſtruct righteouſnes ſay enforme hereſies paule ſayth man god may perfect ſay prieſtes al onely ſhal haue ſo play ouerthwart paule thinges alſo paule ſayth may interpretate ſcripture one one men may learne men may haue comfort let wynes kéepe ſylence congregation marke men may propheſye auguſtine doth declare interpretating scripture therefore belongeth onely prieſtes alſo hée ſayth woman muſt hold peace hée néede cō maund vnlearned furthermore hée womē ſhall learne huſbāds home ſhall huſbandes learne bée vnlearned thēſelues alſo paule geueth teſtimony 2 tim 3 tymothy hée learned holy ſcriptures childhode able inſtruct hym vnto ſaluatiō fayth chriſt ieſu tymothe learned holy ſcriptures béefore hée eyther prieſt byſhop yea childe paule ſayth weare able enſtruct hym ſay bée able condemne mē cleane cōtrary againſt paule aſhamed work ſhall antichriſt doe cōtrary chriſt thē theſe bée let chriſtē one chiefeſt workes antichriſt condemne ſcriutures god men write déedes antechriſt muſt agrée hée ſhal condemne ſcripture ſhall doe without ſome colour right holynes condemne hauyng colour ſhadow holynes onely reaſon fleſhlynes ſtarke madnes thinke great turk would receaue ſuch reaſons bée yea great deale better agaynſt hys mahomet hée coulde raigne ſo long hée hath done nay doubtles yet loke bée alowed agaynſt chriſt ryght ſonne god yea chriſten men coulde bée hard agaynſt mahomet alſo chriſt commaundeth apoſtles ſhould preach y• mar vlt mat vlt goſpell vnto creature mathew ſayth ſhould teach mē kéepe manner thing hée hath cōmaunded marke goſpell muſt bée preached manner men prieſtes onely apoſtles muſt alſo learne kéepe thinges goſpell doe without know theſe thinges apoſtles dyd learne ſhould ingender occaſion hereſies holy apoſtles occaſion theyr doctrine hereſies yea commaundement chriſte néede apoſtles learne v thing might bée occaſion hereſie wée hereſie béefore came wée diſpoſed nature vnto maner miſchiefe yet learning come learne thing occaſion hereſie papiſtes blaſphemers god heauēly word conſcience aſhamed thus damnably blaſpheme heauenly worde god thus ſhamefully cō demne god worde thus preſumptuouſly vndertreade gifte ye holy ghoſt yea vnder pretēce holynes chriſtēdome though dyd fauour chriſt make chriſt auctor hereſy vnder name holynes holynes damnable hipocreſye condemne chriſt auctor goodnes brieflye woulde teach nothing chriſt hath left bée taught ſhould haue ſo many heretykes haue nowe men bée heretykes ſpeking agaynſt scripture graunt men ſpeak ſcripture ſpeaking agaynſt law ye cauſe bée made heretykes ye bée proued heretykes let euery chriſten man iudge hys conſcience bée right lawfull merueilous thing let man liue fornicatiō whoredome theft murther drunkennes extortyon bribery briefly mā ner miſchyfe haue nothing doe thē ſcarſly reproue hym yea hée ſhall bée great officer vnderneath greatly fauour let man come papiſtes abyde true preacher goſpell preach ye true goſpell chriſt thereby reprooue damnable lyuy • g thē béegynneth hée bée heretycke ſhall coſt great labour make hym heretyke déede yet haue nothing reprooue hym concerning hys lyuyng onely hée preacheth goſpell thys merueilous heretyke whoſe lyuyng muſt néedes graunt bée good alſo prooue learning chriſt onely pleaſeth dare take hand prooue falſe onely vyol • ce condemne thinke god thus ſuffer remember hée ſayth holy prophet thou haſt reproued pſal 9 vnfaythfull people haſt deſtroyed wicked takē away name euer lorde hath prepared trone iudgmēt doubt hée ſhal ſhortly reprooue trone ſet iudgemēt muſt come ſhall neuer bée able defēd cauſe muſt periſhe euer ſay preach goſpell people inongh néede haue englyſhe aunſwere pray lawe euer men bounde kéepe geuen wrighting ſay doe teach right goſpell know able beare away euangeliſtes apoſtles onely preache alſo wrote scripture mē might read thing ye doe heare may heare may alſo reade looke luke wrot goſpell men might know certayne thoſe thinges informed moreouer y• apoſtle write yea vnto lay men ſéeyng ſo diligent preachyng dare boldly ſay bée▪ let v ſée howe lay men forbydden read holy scripture apoſtles actes 17 tyme nobleſt theſſalonia whiche receiued worde ſearched scripture dayly whether thoſe thinges paule preached ſo haue playne lay men ſearched scripture knowe whether paules doctrine true alſo read dayly scripture come ſay lay men ſhall read scripture alonely receiue thē papiſtes preach lye preaching preache lye bée prooued face doe ſhall bee lawfull ſearch scripture learne lye recite great prelate chriſt churche firſt letter name doct allen interpretate dect alen expoundeth scripture declare certaine place scripture ghoſtly inſtruction chriſtes churche men may iudge firſt place thrée fold cable hard breake thrée fold cable hée vnderſtode reuerent father god lorde cardinall firſt fold hée popiſh doctor interpretation engliſhmā borne ſtrong thing hard withſtand ſecond fold hée legate common maner legatus latere ſprōg bleſſed ſide holy father pope ſtrong fold could bée lightly broken thyrd ſold hée lord kinges counſel ſtrōg fooliſh tale tubbe fold theſe thrée together dyd make ſo ſtrong cable man within realme might breake withſtand ſore afrayde hée ſhould haue reckened noble royall bloud thréefolde cable dyd ſpryng béen ſo ſtrong ſtrongeſt oxe butcher ſtall could breake expoſition dyd ſat hym therefore teſtifie better ſeconde scripture syon ſhall come law papiſticall vayne doctrine papiſtes word god frō ieruſalem hée expounde maner commaundement moſt reuerēt father god lord legate come highe palace noble grace hither vnto thyrde scripture sumite pſalmum date tympanū dyd hée expounde maner haue done viſitatiō geue money thinke holy doctour prelate chriſtes church hath hée wel declared holy scripture hée worthy bée beléeured reaſō lay men ſhoulde ſearche scripture might reprooue noble prelate order ware right hée well ſerued ye hée thréefold balter ſtretche authority prooue ſcriptures ought bee mother toungue ſuch doctours theſe bée muſt poore people bée ruled wil ſearch veritie ſelues muſt bée heretickes bycauſe beléeue theſe holy father let v procéede matter agaynſt theſe blaſphemers god word priſcila aquila dyd expoūd actes 18 vnto apollo great learned man y• perfite vnderſtanding ſcriptures theſe lay perſōs yet ſo learned ſcriptures yt wer able teach great doctour lay men may read scripture alowed peter paul ſucceſſours condemne hereſie alſo eunuch treaſurer acte 8 vnto quéene ethiopian dyd read eſay prophete whiche hée vnderſtode till god ſent philip declare vnto lay man alſo infidell yet forbidden god read scripture rather holpen vnderſtandyng forbid chriſten mē read holy scripture ſworne vnto yea alſo defende vnto death alſo paule ſayth let word colloſ 3 god dwell plenteouſly paule woulde lay men ſhoulde learne worde god yea plenteouſly commaunde ſhall haue nothinge ſtandeth nothing wyth saint paules aboundaunce aboundantly nothing bée farre ſunder thus doe alwayes agrée paule holy scripture woulde ſay playnely wordes déedes doe declare openly wée pope hys clergy • lntechriſtes doubt y• worlde woulde take bée taken béefore god antichriſtes world looketh neuertheleſſe doubt god ſhall declare openly time vtter confuſion damnation doubt leſſe neither holde chriſt holy doctours yet owne lawe bée againſt theſe muſt bée expounded wroonge vnto carnall purpoſe el make hereſie thinke father heauen great tender loue hée man ſoule ſent hys onely ſonne redéeme alſo géeue lawe liue owne mouth ſhall thus ſuffer loſte thorough hypocriſie godly worde bée ouer frodden mayntaynyng worldly glory nay doubtles poſſible hée coulde regarde pompe pride man ſoule godly word yet vnpoſſible euer hée ſhould ſo diſpiſe ſwéete bloude bleſſed ſonne ſwéete ieſus wherefore looke vppon charge purpoſe auguſtine auguſt ad fratres ſ 3 • openly againſt theſe word brother reade holy scripture ſhall finde ought holde oughte flye man reputed without learning hée hée ſhéepe goate hée oxe aſſe hée better thē horſſe mule hath vnderſtandyng c auguſtine moueth men reade holy scripture commaunde reade auguſtine ſayth ſhal know doe doe ſay ſhal learne nothing therout hereſies auguſtine ſayth mā without learning ſcriptures better brute beaſt good father make childrē better thē beaſtes alſo athanaſius thou wilte epiſ ad epheſ c 6 thy child ſhall bée obedient vnto thee vſe wordes god thou ſhalt ſaye béelongeth alonely religious men ſtudy scripture rather béelongeth euery chriſten man ſpecially vnto hym wrapped buſineſſes worlde ſo much scripture reache commaundementes god becauſe hée hath néede helpe hée wrapped y• trouble worlde therefore greatly thy profite thy child ſhould heare alſo reade holy scripture ſhall learne thys commaundement honour thy father thy mother c theſe wordes bée playne inough againſt néede expoſition doctour auctority wherfore anſwere hym alſo chriſoſtome gen 〈◊〉 9 ho 28 byſhop well bée cōdemneth ſentence openly ſaying béeſéeche notable ſaying chriſoſtome oftentimes come hither diligently heare leſſon holy scripture alonely bée alſo take handes home godly bible receaue thyng therein great ſtudye thereby ſhall haue great aduantage c theſe wordes bée ſo plaine adde nothyng woulde wée ſhoulde take byſhops holy father bée ſo openly agaynſt scripture ſo centrary holy doctours neuer doe liue neuer looke ſée antichriſtes ſo take till ſée almighty god conuerte alſo ſame doctour ſaith bée required coulde ſay one pſalme without • mat c 〈◊〉 hom 2 booke part holy ſcripture one doubtles alonely worſte bée ſo ſlow ſo remiſſe vnto ſpirituall thinges vnto deuilliſhneſſe hotter fier men defende miſchief excuſe religious mā haue wife child houſe care ye excuſe wherewith ſcripture meete bee knowen ſtates ſortes people doe peſtilence corrupt thinges doe recken ſtudye holy scripture béelongeth alonely vnto religious men bée much neceſſary vnto vnto c may ſée damnable inſtitution harte men chriſoſtomes dayes howe woulde reade ſcriptures ſée hée condemneth calleth peſtilēce bring agayne louſie ſtatute owne againſt mée man woulde call v hetikes neither regarde chriſtes holy worde holy doctours yet thinge ye agaynſt let v ſée owne lawe ſaith chriſt paul di 38 si iuxta ſayth bée power wiſdome god thē bée ignoraunt ſcriptures much bée ignoraunt chriſt c haue playnely take away ſcriptures lay men much take away chriſt frō doubt doe intēde hart doe thing god knoweth workes doe declare god ſhall aduenge full ſtraitly ouer alſo place ſet meditation thy iuſtifications 7 sinod c omnes et • 38 forgette thy wordes thing excéeding good chriſten men obſerue kéepe c counſell owne hath admitted chriſten readyng scripture allowed counſell men ſhall ſtudy scripture condemne neither scripture god practiſe chriſtē men expoſition doctours owne law yet ſtatute counſels hold agaynſt bée marueilous giantes ſhal mā behaue ſelfe handle poſſible ouercome wil admitte nothyng againſt yet ſo leue firſt declare manifeſtly ye bée cōtrary chriſt holy doctours hierome reprooueth ſore theſe wordes paula euſtochium bée thyng prohe epiſt ad epheſ li 1 life doth preſerue wiſe mā doth perſuade abide good oppreſſions thraldomes world doe reckē ſpecially meditation ſtudy holy ſcripture ſéeyng doe differre creature ſpecially bée reaſonable ſpeake reaſon maner wordes cō teined godly scripture whereby may learne knowe god alſo cauſe wherefore bée created wherfore doe ſore marueile y• bée certein men geue thē ſelues ſlouthfulnes ſluggiſhnes learne thoſe thing benefites may receaue readyng scripture bée good recken thoſe men worthy bée reprooued haue good mynde c marke written two woman learned alſo hée reckeneth nothyng better ſtudy holy ſcriptures hée alſo marueileth certaine neither ſtudy scripture ſelues yet let mē ſtudy thē well knowē theſe wordes pricke men ye bée ſo ſlouthfull ſo geuen voluptuouſnes ſelues ſtudy scripture yet ſuffer mē ſtudy doe ſtudy deceiue ſimple poore brother maintaine abhominable liuing wroſtyng wryngyng profite commeth none ſtudy worlde knoweth may preach haue damnably condemned chriſtes bleſſed word el violence made ſome poore brother heretickes come gorgious eſtate pompe pride face chriſt ſimple brother outward dānable pride afore face great arrogancy pride tyranny papiſtes world lordes leue faſing braſing lord whoſe cauſe defend agaynſt length bée faced remēber holy ghoſt prayeth againſt ſaying iudge lord pſal 5 may fall cogitation expell lord haue prouoked thée doubte holy ſpirite preuaile agaynſt though god ſuffer ſeaſon yet hath hée till day defended ſelfe godly wordes agaynſt proude crakyngs world thinke hée wil take fall hand nay nay hée ſhall firſt thruſt headlonge world ſhall take example beléeue word haue cōdemned doth thus learne wherfore doe reuoke condemnation new teſtament ordeine chriſten men may read holy scripture ſhal haue greateſt ſhame euer men world neuer able defend meanes power ye earth power earth wil withſtand hée ſhall rather bryng duſt raiſe vp ſtones newe ruler wormes meate ſtinking car doctour barnes vehement rion nouriſhmēt hell fire dare thus preſume againſt god omnipotent whether flie auoyde daunger heauen earth water fire ſunne moone ſtarres ſaintes angel man child bée againſt holde accurſed though deuill laugh ſeaſon remember ende god geue hys grace loſe labour let mée aſſoyle carnall papiſtes firſt reaſon prooue lay men ought read scripture reaſons bring fyrſt euyll men doe take occaſion hereſy ſcriptures wherfore beſt haue aunſwere lykewiſe good men doe take occaſion goodnes ergo people ought haue condemne thinges men doe take occaſion euill thē muſt fyrſt put eye take occaſiō ſée many idle thinges muſt alſo deſtroy handes féete tongue al haue theſe doe myſuſe often muſt alſo deſtroy hart whereby haue alonely occaſion euil doe thinke euil déede muſt alſo deſtroy fayre womē take ſore occaſions euyll muſt alſo burne goodes deſtroy rich thē men take occaſion théeues euill men take occaſion euill euery good thyng bée proud muſt alſo deſtroy wynes thē men take occaſiō bée drōkē muſt deſtroy meates géeue mē occaſiō gluttony yea muſte deſtroye mercy god euell men take boldenes myſchief briefly ſo good thing euell mē take occaſion euill yea chriſt hym ſelfe saint paule ſaith vnto 1 cor 1 iewes offence vnto gentyls occaſion folyſhnes yet al may deſtroy chriſt hée muſt remayne ſtil ſo likewiſe goſpell though euell men neuer bée good receiue occaſion euyll yet ther bée many thouſandes ye receaue ſaluation béecauſe ſpider gathereth poyſō ye good herbes reaſon therfore deſtroy al good herbes reaſōs thrée bée certayne math 13 ſētences ſcripture y• doe belōg euery man know reaſon papiſtes chriſt ſayth vnto geuē know miſteries kingdome heauen vnto geuen aunſwere meane ſay vnto geuen meane apoſtles onely ſucceſſors may reade holy ſcripture bée ſucceſſors ye apoſtles lord rocheſters auctorytie meane chriſtē people haue y• ſpirite god chriſt ment bée excluded haue ſprite god ye effect doth declare therfore may read ſcriptures marke alſo mayſter ſaith vnto geuen ſayth geuen ſhoulde haue men proue vnderſtanding ſcripture geuen you▪ ye text maiſter chriſt ſpeaketh heare ſprituall right vnderſtanding holy ſcriptures gift god onely hée ſpeaketh ſtudying▪ reading holy ſcripture haue ſame place meant ſaying geuen true vnderſtyng interpretation ſcriptures many dyd followe heare preaching yet vnderſtoode therefore text maketh directly againſt work doe declare bée hearer reader worde god vnderſtanding geuen wyllmy lord rocheſter ſaye haue vnderſtanding holy doctor though ſcriptures themſelues owne nature bée plaineſt beſt bée knowen yet bée ye holy doctor playneſt vnto v wherefore hée vnderſtand ſcripture muſt fyrſt learne vnderſtand doctours ſhal bring hym true vnderſtanding holy ſcripture el hée muſt erre aunſwere lorde doe wryte ſafe conſcyence thinke y• diſcharge conſcience béefore dreadfull face chriſt triflyng diſtynction quedam ſunt notiora nobis et quedam notiora naturae pray wil proue god wiſe would béegin proue wiſedome would proue god aliue woulde proue y• bée aliue would perſwade man beléeue god would learne hym hée muſt néedes beléeue becauſe y• bée creature theſe thinges bée beſt knowen vnto woulde prooue man hath true ſence scripture proue hée hath ſence doctours ye doctours taken falſe contrary ſence caſe poſſible would therefore ſay ſence mā hath takē ſcripture falſe pray lorde rule could men vnderſtand ſcriptures peter paules dayes weare doctours owne learning ſame scotus 11 sent di 3 q 3 ſcience muſt proue princypelles ſciences fyrſt knowē actualiter diſtinctly bée pryncipels doctours proued • rew holy ſcripture therefore ſaying expoſition ho scripture muſt bee firſt knowen therby may iudge opinion doctours whether ſay right ly doctours yt bée perfectly knowē except ſcripture bée fyrſt knowen owne dyuynitie denye wherefore proue haue verytie muſt proue béecauſe haue ſence holy ſcripture ſēce holy doctours doubtles haue great meruell lord rocheſter neyther aſhamed mā yet afrayde vengeance god y• thus triflyth wt holy ſcripture beſides haue third reaſon papiſtes bauld reaſon citie london hath certeine priuileges ſecrete counſels reaſon men ſhould know lorde london reaſon paules croſſe hée condemned new teſtamēt aunſwere lord ſay cōſcience ſpeake coūſ •… bee kept ſecret scripture muſt bee made knowen men theſe wordes pleaſe lorde maior london brother pray like ſimilitude y• certeine counſels mē whiche muſt bée kept ſecrete bycauſe bée coūſels holy ſcriptures whiche brought world bée▪ kept ſecrete bée preached openly maiſter chriſt commaundeth preach mar v •• goſpell creature heare creature let theſe mē haue theſe bee ye counſell kéepe reſidue furthermore maiſter chriſt ſaith place haue ſhewed ſecretnes preach tope houſe alſo paule ſayth goſpell ti 1 2 tim 2 declared openly preachyng place god haue brought life immortalitie vnto light thorough goſpell alſo maiſter calleth light world nowe iohn 3 math 5 ſet hée ſaith light vnder buſhell rather openly mē may bée lightned wherfore lord ſimilitude far vnlike lord woorthy bée deſpiſed doubtles may bée wel thought fooliſhe ſimilitude made stokeſley byſhop london ſore exigent compelled prooue thynge ſo • auld reaſon would haue looked ſo ſimple reaſon ſo earneſt matter ſo wiſe man ſo great doctour ſo worſhipfull father biſhop london yea called salomon notwithſtanding ſuch haltyng ſimilitude dyd hée neuer learne prouerbes salomon béene better ſimilitude king proclamatiō proclaimed yt men might know alſo kéepe man bound kéepe till bée proclaimed likewiſe goſpel geuen bée proclaimed euery man bound kéepe wherfore muſt néedes bée proclaimed euery man vnto lorde beſéeche god may bée one ſpokē geuē know miſteryes god amen ¶ men conſtitutions grounded scripture bynde conſcience man vnder payne deadly ſinne two maner power article muſt note bée two maner miniſters power one temporal power called ſpiritual powera temporal power tēporall power cōmitted god kinges duke earles lordes baron iudges maiors shriues miniſters vnder thē theſe bée haue onely tēporall ſwordthe deſcription temporall power wherby muſt order al ye cōmō wealth world ly thinges lōgyng thereunto ye diſpoſition theſe worldly goodes ſhal bée right owner probation men teſtamentes ordering payment cuſtomes ſettyng maner taſkes forfaites correction tranſgreſſions wherby cōmon wealth priuate perſon diſquieted wronged correction théeues murderer harlotes baudes ſclanderers wrangler extortioner brybers vſerers falſe buyer ſellers thynges whereunto béelongeth outwarde orderyng corporall payne thys power kyng chiefe full ruler bée miniſters ſeruauntes paule doth declare • aying let euery ſoule bée ſubiect obedient vnto hye power c alſo peter bée ſubiect vnto rom 13 1 pet 2 kyng vnto chiefe heade eyther vnto ruler vnto thē ſent kyng puniſhmēt euill doer ʋnto power muſt wée bée obedient thynges pertaine rom 13 miniſtration preſent life commō wealth alonely paule ſayth auoyding puniſhment alſo diſchargyng conſciences ye wyll god power commaunde anything tyranny againſt right law alwayes prouided repugne agaynſt goſpell deſtroye fayth charitie muſt néedes ſuffer paule ſayth charitie ſuffereth thyng alſo 1 cor 13 maiſter chriſt man ſtrike math 6 thee one chéeke turne hym hée doth exerciſe tyranny ouer theſe worldly good theſe preſent thynges ouer thy corporall bodye chriſten men doe alonely regarde diſpiſe neuertheles hée commaunde thée thyng agaynſt ryght doe thée wronge example caſt thée priſon wrongfully thou canſt reaſonable quyet meanes without ſeditiō inſurrectiō man wrongfully impriſoned tyraunt maye quyet maner make eſcape breakyng commō peace ſaue thy ſelfe auoyde hys tyranny thou mayſt doe wyth good conſcience thou priſon thou couldeſt auoyde without ſedition thou mayſt lawfully doe thy cōſcience frée ſo doyng thou dooſte ſinne offende lawe god paule ſayth thou mayſte bée 1 cor 7 frée vſe wiſe bée ryght wrong mayſt thou make reſiſtaunce wyth ſworde wyth hand obey except thou canſt auoyde haue ſhewed thée y• cauſe haue made offē ce common weale ought breake priſon bée ryght lawfull profitable cōmon wealth thou muſt obey thou mayſt flye wtout ſinne men haue fled tyranny wrong thys power wée haue openly diuers place ſcriptures elezy fled tyranny kyng siria alſo helyas 4 kyng 6 3 king 89 fled tyranny kyng achas alſo peter fled priſon actes 12 idem 9 14 paule citie damaſcum iconium open actes apoſtles agaynſt power though thou haue wrong mayſt thou make corporall reſiſtaunce alonely auoyde flying el kéepe ye thing commaunded thée bée ryght profite cō mon wealth thou muſt fulfill alſo abyde wil bée inquired mée caſe pleaſe y• kinges grace condemne newe teſtament engliſhe commaunde none ſubiectes ſhall haue vnder diſpleaſure whether bée bounde obey thys cōmaundement aūſwere doe béeléeue moſt noble prince hath forbidden chriſten bee done kyng ſhould forbyd v readyng scripture men may haue chriſtes teſtamēt whether bée latyne engliſhe french douche gréeke hebrue chriſtes veritie one tonges grace knoweth vnreaſonable man ſhould eyther counſell forbid grace hée ſhoulde know reade teſtament moſt noble prince hys father alouely géeuē promiſed worldly good ſoone bée géeuen bée ready decay periſhe ſay bée vnreaſonable vnright much vnreaſonable take awaye v father heauens teſtament whoſe legacy promiſes doe farre excell legacy noble prince father god doth excell man ſhoulde make many reaſons prooue vnto hys grace thyng bée lawfull father heauen hath ſent v frō cōmeth nothyng goodnes yea ſent man angell saint onely ſonne god god mā diligently declared hym worlde vnto phareſies alone vnto maner people houre death alſo thereof tooke death yet ſo content ſent glorious apoſtles declare learne thys godly worde thorough worlde béecauſe miniſtration thys worde required greater ſtrength naturall man therefore alſo gaue hée eternall ſprite eſtabliſhe confirme make ſtrong thinges might bée nothing deſired declaration ſetting worde coulde finde hart true ſubiecte regardeth honour noble prince ſaluation ſoule eyther thinke grace would condēne el mooue hym condemne thyng cōmeth heauen yea frō father heanen ſent learned eternall ſonne hath ſealed wyth hys moſt precious bloude alſo commaunded glorious apoſtles preach confirmed wyth ſo many myracles alſo géeue confirming writing glorious conſolatour holy ghoſt open father heauen ſend godly worde ſmall diligence though hée cared whether ſhoulde remayne earth ſo hath hée declared holy worde wyth ſuch proſſes heauē earth hell ſhould know y• worde men ſhoulde haue hée woulde defende bée enemy vnto thē woulde ouerpreſſe wherfore let bée cappitall enemy vnto grace hart déede ſuſſpect grace moue vnto doubtles neuer doe dare boldely ſay deuill hell enemy vnto grace body ſoule moue hym vnto thing alonely ſo condemne god worde thing doth grace know well therefore doubte hée hath alſo auoyde daunger thereof neuertheleſſe may pleaſe god take ſo great vēgeaūce abhominable ſinnes hys grace dayes hée may ſende v ſuch tyraunt ſhall alonely forbid newe teſtament alſo thynges may bée honour god yea paraduenture vnder ſuch co • llour god name men ſhall recken none hée god frende bée great ſcourge intollerable plague father heauen hys infinite mercy defende v ſuch terrible vengeaunce greateſt plague come earth paule doth declare rom 1 romaynes god veritie condemned god name mē bée ſo blynde perceaue bée géeuē peruerſe ſēce plague neuer cōmeth tokē euerlaſting reprobatiō moſt merciful redéemer chriſt ieſus defēde v frō amē come wée muſt néedes ſuffer plague howe ſhall chriſten men vſe themſelues prince ſo condemne god worde lordes byſhoppes woulde depoſe hym ſhorte deliberation make conſcience haue depoſed prince leſſer cauſes thē great deale againſt alwayes lay chriſtes facte holy apoſtles worde god chriſten men muſt alonely follow therfore kynges commanndement note bee done kyng doe ſorbid scripture • bee read ſubiectes muſt bée conſidered maner kyng forbid newe teſtament chriſtes sacramēts preaching worde god thynge agaynſt chriſt vnder temporall payne el vnder ye payne death men ſhall firſt make faythfull prayer god diligent interceſſion vnto ye kynges grace due ſubiection hys grace woulde relealſe commaundement hée doe ſhall kéepe teſtament subiectes muſt obey ſhewed ſorte maner ordinaunce chriſt let kyng exerciſe tyranny flée wiſe vnder payne damnation ſhall withſtand violence ſuffer patiently tyranny hée layeth bodyes goodes leaue vengeaunce vnto heauenly father whiche hath ſcorge tame thoſe bedlames hée ſéeth tyme wiſe ſhall reſiſte violētly neither ſhall deny chriſtes veritie yet forſake béefore prince leſt runne daūger theſe woordes hee denyeth woorde béefore men ſhall deny hym béefore father heauen let men regarde matter lightly thinke may geeue vp teſtamentes yet denye chriſt ſo euer hée bée geeueth vp teſtament thyng worthye bée condemned hee doth béefore god denye chriſt though teſtamēt bée peraduenture hée knowyng falſe vntruly printed vntruly trāſlated yet vnto true teſtament therfore ſhall hée deliuer condemne vnlawfull ſhall hée doe man learned doe finde faulte hée ſhall bée glad amēde faulte ſuffer wiſe note chriſtian ſubiecte muſt ſhewe himſelfe obedient thoſe faultes whole teſtament bée condemned vnlawfull ſhould bée ſuffered ſhould haue teſtamēt teſtament yt ſo true either bée faultes déede el men cauilations may inuent yt bée defaultes dare ſay boldly new teſtament engliſhe ten tymes truer old tranſtion latin bée many place doe want whole ſentē ce many place man cā defend without hereſie texte non omnes immutabimur 1 cor 15 math 20 act 20 1 tim 6alſo sedere ad dexteram meam vel ſiniſtram non aeſt meum dare vobis alſo theſe place want commorati ſumus trogilij seiungere ab qui huiuſmodi ſunt many place man ſay bée euidently falſe yet may burne bookes kéepe amende neither ſhall goe depoſe prince lordes byſhops wont doe ſhall boldely confeſſe haue veritie abyde alonely ſhall praye heauenly father chaunge hart prince may lyue vnderneth hym chriſtes worde quietnes paul exhorteth v ſaying1 tim 2 exhorte prayer ſupplications petition geuyng thankes bée men kynges preheminence may lyue quyet peaceable lyfe goodneſſe honeſty ſhal men behaue ſelues towarde prince wiſe ſhall denye chriſtes worde graunt burning teſtamentes kyng doe violence muſt ſuffer obey agréement may bée prooued ye example apoſtles hie prieſtes temple commaunded peter iohn ſhould preach teach act 4 5 name ieſus made aunſwere right god bee obeyed beefore mē obey god man alſo pharyſes came commaunded chriſt herodes name hée ſhould depart frō thence hée would kyll hym hée would obey made aunſwere herode great threatning goe tell wolfe béehold caſt deuils make luke 13 men whole day morrow third day conſumed neuertheleſſe muſt continew day morrow next day c ye hée left miniſtration ye word neyther kinges pleaſure yet feare death alſo haue openly thrée child would obey commaundement daniell 3 king nabuchodonoſor becauſe againſt ye word god lykewiſe haue exāple king darius commaunded dan 6 man ſhould aſke petytyon eyther god man within ſpace 30 dayes hym onely notwithſtanding daniell wēt houſe thriſe day made prayer god ieruſalem thyng hée put denne lyon hée dyd obey ſuffering payne conſenting vnright commaundement chriſten men bounde obey ſuffering kinges tyrāny conſenting vnlawfull commaundement alwayes hauing béefore eye comfortable ſaying chriſt feare ye kill body done doemath 10 alſo peter1 pet 3 happy yée ſuffer righteouſnes ſake neuertheleſſe feare though ſéeme terrible vnto neither bée troubled ſāctifie lord god hart god doth wōderfully worke ſaue defend hys poore flockand let feare ye father heauen hath care ſhall deliuer alſo brynge godly worde vnto lyght ſhall pleaſe eternall agaynſt tyraunt able withſtand tyrant thinke themſelues moſt ſure victory bée ready prouided burne suſanna ſhall hée rayſe dan 13 vp daniell ſhall caule agayne ſentēce lecherous prieſtes ioſeph ſolde egipt caſt priſon hée make lord ouer egipt yea gene 37 39 alſo ouer ſolde bringeth alſo paſſe proude hamon bée hée neuer ſo great kinges fauour ſhalbée hanged owne gallowes hée made mardocheus iſraelite alſo pharao hath cōmaūded vnder payne death deſtroy y• mē childrē iſraell cā hée finde meanes ſaue moſes yea yt water exod 2 yt power egypt could ſaue kyng yea hee nouriſhed kynges houſe kynges coſt yea kynges daughter pharao ſuppoſe coūſell pharaos could preuaile agaynſt wiſedome tyranny earth able extinct moſes nay verely furthermore iſrael hath béene egypt iiij c yeres great captiuitie thraldome yet agaynſt pharaos keepeth hee promiſe deliuereth maketh water fire earth ſerue thē iſraell deſpayre pharao tyraunt ready ſucke bloud ſhewed god mighty power iſraell thinke hée hath read sea béefore pharao might power euery ſide great mountaine hope hath hée man might mās power man wiſedome man pollicie bée deliuered none béefore iſraels carnall • tye thyng extreme deſperation prince iudge earth learne take héede pſal 〈◊〉 commeth god iſraell egypt hath deſpiſed ſcorned mocked condemned ſheweth might nothyng cā helpe bée onely tyrauntes recken bée moſt ſure victordem bryngeth hee malice end herode hath peter priſon faſt bound cheynes actes 12 euery ſide ſouldier kéepers ſet priſon doore euery man office watching peter ſhal eſcape herode intendeth day folowyng bryng hym foorth wonderyng alſo death agaynſt herodes aboue might aboue wiſedome pollicie notwithſtandyng ſouldiers gaylers priſon cōmeth power eternall god ledeth peter firſt ſecond ward yea braſen gate muſt wilfully opē let peter lord god would deliuer shortly ſhould bring many example prooue god power declare truth god childrē bée alwayes perſecutiō ende alwayes glory vnto wherfore one exāple maiſter chriſt ſhall bée ſufficiēt ſtabliſh confirme féeble hart alſo mollifie ſtony hart finally cōfound violēt tyranny mortall tyraūtes bée ſtubbles haye duſt momēt bee brought lumpe ſtynkyng carryon cōſider maiſter chriſt math 27 28 true ſonne god god ſelfe yet hée crucified put death ſeditious perſō malefactor chriſt euer bee ſet beefore v example comforte v perſecutiō théefe traytor yea hereticke hée layd alſo graue great ſtone béefore doore ſouldiours common ſort romaine hée ſet diligently kéepe graue pollicie wiſedome byſhoppes could deuiſe hée ſhould riſe vp agayne accordyng worde could helpe power god woulde bee let veritie could bée prooued falſe worde could bee oppreſſed tyrauntes thought make triumphe victory thē moſt ouercōmed neither water fire sea land heauen earth death hell cā let god defend child bring foorth godly word light kéepe eternall promiſes therfore let chriſten mē feare kéepe worde god faſt abyde deny tyranny day ſhall come ſhall bée greatly glory sodome gomorra ſhall bée eaſely handled thē ſuch prince doe perſecute holy word god cleare made cannot reſiſt temporall power wiſe vi • lēc •• haue wrong eyther muſt doe thing commaunded v el flie thing bée commaunded v againſt wee muſt rather ſuffer per • ecution wiſe reſiſte word god whereby fayth hurt ſhould doe wiſe rather ſuffer per ſecution alſo death againſt power goeth article cō maundeth nothing conſ •• rning conſcience onely concerning ordering worldly thinges therefore myniſtreth temporall payne ouer body onely therwith cōtent wherfore wil ſpeake power men call ſpirituall fyrſt noted power none auctoritie ſpirituall power worldly onely miniſtration word god ſpirituall regiment preaching gouerning ſoule myniſtration ye ſpirit hauing nothing doe erterior iuſtice righteouſnes worlde therfore hath power ſpirituall power hath auctoritie make lawes rule worlde right law make ſtatutes lawes order worlde onely faithfully truely preach miniſter word god ther inſtructing conſcience man nothing addyng thereto taking paule ſayth 2 tim 3 abyde thoſe thinges haue learned bée commytted vnto paule hée hym ſelfe rom 16 ſayth • urſt ſpeake thing thoſe thing chriſt wroght hée curſeth bée mā angel preacheth goſpell gala 1 hée preached therefore prophet commaundeth v ſhould heare wordes thoſe prophetes diſceaue v ierem 23 ſpeake viſions owne harte y• mouth god yet ſpeake name god wherefore theſe men ſo long ſpeake onely y• worde god ſo long heard chriſt himſelf ye ſaying hée ye heareth luke 10 math 23 hereth mée alſo whatſoeuer ſay vnto ſytting chayre moſes ye text ſpeketh auguſtine ſyttyng ye chayre super ioan trac 46 vnderſtand learning lawe god therefore god doth teach teache chayre moſes▪ vnderſtand lawe god moſes deliuered iewes owne doctrine heare doe ſuch men ſéeke chriſtes c theſe wordes bée playne agaynſt preach thing law god onely wherfore theſe mynyſters tyranny aboue worde god make lawe ſtatute muſt bee conſydered two maner wayes fyrſt whether bée openly derectly agaynſt word god ye deſtructiō ye faith ſtatute whereby haue condemned new teſtament alſo forbydden certayne men preach worde god hauing trew cauſe aganſt onely malicious ſuſpectiō alſo ye learning wherby learne workes doe iuſtifye moreouer ſtatute whereby bynde men vnder payne damnation bée aſſoyled theſe ſtatutes ſay lyke men boūd obey neither charite faith hurt geueth place charitie yet auoyding ſclaunder worde god may bée auoyded yet géeue place vnto ſclaūder ſhoulde neuer bée preached muſt bée fa •• e ſtucke vnto men bée offended withall ſtiffer hée againſt openly playnely yea face make ſuch ſtatutes • ſt wée reſiſte wyth theſe wordes wée bounde act 5 obey god man well proued hilarius hylarius mat • 14 wordes maner plantes hée planted father heauen muſt bée plucked vp rootes ſay tradition men whoſe meanes cōmaundementes lawe hée broken muſt bée deſtroyed therefore caulleth hée thē blynde guide waye euerlaſting life béecauſe ſée thyng promiſe cauſe hée ſayth blynde guide bee led ſhall fall dyke c marke tradition men agaynſt god lawe muſt tradition men agaynſt god muſt bee rooted vp rootes deſtroyed therfore let euery man take héede longeth charge blynde guide alſo bée led ſhall fall dyke ſhall bée none excuſe hym led ſay hys guyde blynde let heare worde god holy prophetes walke preceptes father kéepe iudgemēts ezechi▪ 20 walke preceptes kéepe iudgementes maner ſtatutes bée certaine thinges bée caulled indifferent bée commaunded thinges bée done neceſſitie vnder paynes deadly ſinne example eate fleſhe fiſhe day thynges indifferent bee done done bee obeyed ſo ye ſame bee commaūded vnder peine deadly ſinne day indifferent frée alſo goe rayment colour colour ſhaue heades prieſt wear lōg gowne ſhort gray fryer weare gray coate ruſſet whyte fryer weare white blacke prieſt marry marry heremyt haue bearde theſe ſuch outwarde workes bée thinges indifferent may bée vſed alſo left byſhoppes make lawe ſtatute theſe thynges ſhall bée determinately vſed ſo ſhall bée lawful v leaue vndone wée muſt preciſely doe contrary vnder payne deadly ſinne muſt bée withſtanded wiſe obeyed • hurt fayth libertie chriſtendome whereby wée frée bounde exteriour worke frée thing vnto men tymes maner except bee ſuch cauſe brotherly charitie common peace ſhould bée offended therefore theſe thynges bée wée frée wée muſt withſtand take libertie v thys texte scripture wée bought 1 cor 7 price chriſtes bloud wée bée ſeruauntes men texte open againſt bynde mennes conſcience vnto ſinne thoſe thing chriſt hath lefte frée wée haue euident example saint paule whiche would circumciſe titus galat 2 falſe brother woulde haue compelled hym thereunto thynge neceſſitie vnto paule gaue romthe cōcernyng bée brought ſubiectiō paul note thing • ſelues indifferent yet comaunded bee neceſſitie obſerued thoſe bee diſobeyed dyd withſtand bycauſe circumciſiō vnlawfull might bée vſed chriſten men bycauſe would haue compelled hym vnto vnto thyng neceſſitie thyng woulde saint paule ſuffer agaynſt libertie haue chriſt ieſus hée ſayth playnely wherfore bée alonely chriſte made frée ſinne alſo made frée vſing maner thynges bée different vnto bée bounde vnto thynges neceſſitie friday eate fiſh thereunto bée bounde conſcience vnder payne deadly ſinne may obey againſt word god béecauſe euill eate fiſhe tyme conuenient thou art diſpoſed good bycauſe thyng bynde conſciences make thynge neceſſitie god hath left frée therfore ſpeaketh paule agaynſt theſe wordes latter dayes certeine men ſhal ſwarue 1 tim 4 fayth applying ſelues ſpirites errours doctrine deuill forbiddyng mariage abſteine meates god hath created bée receiued faythfull mē thanks creature god bée good nothyng bée refuſed receiued thākes marke paule ſayth nothyng bée refuſed may bée receiued thankes openly agaynſt thē forbid either fiſh fleſh day day thynge vnright chriſtē man eate paule ſayth meate doth commende v vnto god alſo 1 cor 8 place kyngdome heauen neither meate drinke therfore rom 15 doe vnright bynde conſcience ſuch thynges thinke v vnfaythfull bycauſe obſerue thē let holy hypocrite charter houſe looke cōſciēce superſtition monkes charterhouſe whiche recken buy ſell heauē péece fiſh fleſh recken vyce lyue hatred rākour malice neither ſerue god neighbour ſuch hypocrite ſeruice haue inuēted hypocriſie receiued god thinke great perfection abſteine béefe mutton eate pike tenche gurnarde coſtly fiſhes dentieſt faſhion dreſſed péece groſſe béefe may touche may ſmell loſe heauen merites chriſtes bloud goodly fayned hypocriſie béefore world ſhynneth bryght compare vnto chriſtes scripture bée greater blaſphemy clearely damned chriſt ordinaunce make neceſſitie ye chriſt left indifferent agaynſt theſe holy hypocrite writeth paule ſaying coll 2 ought led traditiōs men ſay touche taſt notable ſaying paule handle thyngs periſh vſing commaundements doctrine men whiche thynges haue ſimilitude wiſedome ſuperſtitious holynes hūblenes ſpare body doe fleſh worſhyp vnto néede clearely condemned ſuperſticiouſnes fayned holines men haue inuented eating drinking touching handling ſuch thinges may doe doe thinges neceſſitie recken ſelfe holy whē doe thē ſynne deadly doe thē dānable inſtitutions men auguſtine condemneth theſe wordes apoſtle ſayth touche handell c becauſe thoſe men ſuch obſeruations led veritie ad paul epi 59 y• made frée whereof ſpoken veritie ſhall deliuer ſhame ſayth hée vnconuenient farre noblenes libertie ſéeing bée body chriſt bée diſceaued ſhadowes bée iudged ſinners diſpiſe obſerue theſe thing wherfore let mā ouercom ſeing body chriſt ſéeme meeke hart holynes aungels bringing thinges hath ſéene c haue wée playnely thoſe thynges bée inuention man doe bynde conſcience though ſéeme bée neuer ſo great holynes humblenes holynes angel paule ſayth colloſ 2 wherefore let make ſtatutes much holynes deuiſe inuent much god ſeruice thinke lye haue receaued frō heauen leſſe holyneſſe angel haue ſet thereunto mandamus remandamus excō municamus ſub pena excommunicationis maioris minoris precipimus interdicimus ſub indignatione dei omnipotentis apoſtolorū petri pauli ligamus ſuch blaſphemies haue doubtles belly ripped ſhould bée nothing found blaſphemes god holy word detraction oppreſſions confuſyons damnation poore brother good haue none let chriſten men aunſwere conſcience trew yet frée conſcience theſe neyther bynd damne conſcience frée made thorow chriſt conſcience bound vnder ye paine deadly ſinne nothing mā order ſet except conteined holy ſcripture body bound euery man doth auguſtine proue σρι ad ro propo 72 theſe wordes seing bée made ſoule body long doe liue temporall lyfe muſt vſe noryſhing lyfe theſe tēporall goodes therefore muſt bodyes ſubiect prince ſoules god part béelongeth lyfe bée ſubiect vnto power vnto men doe miniſter worldly thing ſome honour concerning part wherby beléeue god bée cauled vnto hys kingdome ought bée ſubiect vnto mā peruert ſame thing v hath pleaſed god geue v eternall lyfe c playne conſcience chriſt bée made frée nothyng bynd v vnto ſinne word onely clearely open power heauen earth commaunde thyng againſt god worde deſtruction miniſhing ſame mā may obey caſe vnder payne damnation god veritie indifferent bée lefte bée lefte agayne man commaunde thyng bée done may bée done time place conuenient hée wll binde thing indifferent cō maunded bee done neceſſitie ſame obeyed becauſe ſame deſtroyeth ou • freedome chriſt v vnto indifferent thinges vnto thing neceſſitie ſhall wée doe béecauſe euill doe damnable bée done thyng neceſſitie neuertheleſſe theſe thynges bée commaunded byſhops burden thinges indifferent ſhall wée kéepe tyme place conuenient may ſerue brother edifie hym doe good may bée vnto hym meanes come verity neuertheleſſe tyme place conuenient ſhall offende brother ingender ſclaunder diſquietnes common wealth may fréely without charge conſcience without maner ſinne breake byſhops commaū dement burden tyraunt layde v neither helpeth increaſing god honour edifiyng brethrē ſelues kéepe thē theſe ſpeaketh maſter chriſt binde gréeuous vntollerable burden lay men neckes themſelues ſet litle • inger example eate fleſhe fryday math 2 • forbidden byſhoppes compell thée vnto thyng neceſſary without thou canſt bée ſaued ſhalt thou doe vnder payne ſinne haue thée kéepe thyng congruence thyng may bée exterior meane mortifie bodie outwarde ſhyne holynes vnto compell thée outwarde paynes thyng ſhalte thou doe thy charitie béecauſe thou wilt breake outwarde order make diſquietneſſe thoſe thinges neyther make thée good yet condemne thee béefore god paule ſayth wée eate neither 1 cor 8 wée better wée eate wée worſe alwayes prouided theſe indifferent thynges thou neyther ſet confidence holyneſſe yet offende thy weake brother charitie therein though thou bée frée thy ſelfe thyng alſo indifferēt thée yet charitie fréely makeſt thou thy ſelfe ſeruaunt mē paule ſaith frée thynges yet dyd make ſelfe ſeruaunte might winne many men note hée alwayes ſpeaketh weake brother obſtinate indurate perſons agaynſt whome thou ſhalt alwayes withſtand defende thy libertye hée dyd hée thy weake brother hath good minde 2▪ cor 9 béeléeueth worde god neuercheleſſe hée hath gifte perceaue yet libertie vſe indifferent thynges fréely wyth thankes therfore fayth charitie muſt bée thy guide theſe thynges folowing thou canſt erre finis men bounde receiue holy communion vnder kyndes vnder payne deadly ſinne men ſtucke opē ſcriptures god ye practiſe chriſtes holy church ye expoſition olde doctours béecome chriſten men doe béene néedefull mée haue taken theſe paynes labour cauſe yet haue layd charge thoſe thinges y• antichriſt doth onely hee doth workes antechriſt ſame antichriſt ſeeyng doe open déedes antechriſt muſt bée contēt may alſo geue name world may openly know y• antechriſt doth raine world yea vnder name chriſt heare ſet forth act whē cō pared chriſtes wordes doe doubt trew chriſten men iudge bée deuyll déede though childrē world doe iudge otherwyſe doe ſay acte councell conſtance dyd make agaynſt moſt holy glorious ſacrament eternall god ieſus chriſt one kynde moſt bleſſed ſacrament condemned vnlawfull lay men receiue y• euery man may know councell cōſtāce forbad sacramēt bee receaued lay people kyndes auctoritie dyd thing moue condemne ſo bleſſed ſo gloryous ordinance lord ieſus chriſt wryte owne wordes theſe cuſtome auoyding certayne ſclaunders perrils reſonably brought notwithſtāding wordes councell determination antechriſt béeginning church ſacrament receiued chriſten men vnder kindes afterward receiued al onely vnder ye kind bread wherefore ſéeing ſuch cuſtome church holy father reaſonably brought long obſerued muſt bée taken lawe yt ſhall bée lawfull reprooue without auctorytie church chaūge mās pleaſure wherfore ſay y• ſacrilege vnlawfull obſerue cōſuetude law muſt bée iudged erronius doe pertinaciter defende contrary theſe premiſſis muſt bée reſtrayned heretikes greuouſly puniſhed byſhops official bée inquiſitores hereticae prauitatis bée kyngdomes prouinces theſe men doe attempt preſume thyng agaynſt thys decrée ſhall men procéede agaynſt holy lawfull decrées bée inuented agaynſt heretickes fauters fauoure catholicall fayth c wyll exhorte chriſten men ye glorious name mightie lord ieſus chriſt redéemer ſhall bée iudge wyll indifferently heare article diſcuſſed bleſſed worde maiſter chriſt ieſus whiche alonely god alſo god himſelfe hée dyd done counſel whole trinitie alonely whole counſell counſelles heauen earth muſt bée ordered counſell contrary whether bée sainte angel ſoeuer doth alter y• worde god ſet vp theyr owne inuentions ſame deuill man muſt bée accurſed iudged bée deuil though bée neuer ſo mighty neuer ſo well learned neuer ſo many multitude power learning yet multitude neither heauen earth ieoperdies ſclaū ders may iudge chriſt hys holy worde may géeue place vnto wherfore prooue open scripture mayſter chriſt alſo practiſe holy church counſell falſe damnable let chriſten men iudge v muſt bée heard béeléeued eyther counſell hauyng ſcripture yea contrary ſcripture el haue opē worde god vſe practiſe holy apoſtles holy church chriſt god mā doubteth ye holy counſell though fiue thouſādes byſhops therin muſt proue thēſelues bée god worde god theyr workes doe bée contrary chriſt hys bleſſed worde moreouer chriſt true vnder condition bycauſe men doe low hym though worlde agaynſt hym yet hée neuertheleſſe true coūſell true alonely vnder condition bycauſe doth agrée chriſtes holy worde ſelfe hath veritie deuill varye chriſt dreadfull trone god ſhall ye counſell bée iudged chriſtes holy worde chriſt ſhal bée iudged decrée counſailes deuill varye frō chriſte counſell hée ſhall bée counſels iudge chriſtes worde condemne coūſell ſhal approoue ſhall prayſe ſhall defende temporall ſworde god word iudge councels councels iudges god word multitude byſhops interdiction excommunication curſing helpe wherefore let euery true chriſtē man looke matter indifferently trifling wyth god holy worde god remayne euer holy word muſt bée fulfilled wil fulfill bée ſhal caſt v déepe pit hell make ſtones mē ſtede ſhall kéepe worde light thyng lyeth ſaluation damnation body ſoule frō bée deliuered theſe glorious wordes concilium conciliū patres patres epiſcopi epiſcopi theſe may bée miniſters deuill yea though aungels therfore one agayne doe moniſh exhorte glorious name lyuing god ye ſwéet bloud chriſt ieſus true chriſtē men take héede doe agaynſte chriſtes holy word whiche eternal god mercyfull redemerand ſhall bée alſo mighty glorious iudge let v examine wordes note councell hath graunted councell firſt councell graunteth begynning church chriſten men houſeled vnder kyndes nowe would knowe councell church receiued maner chriſt holy apoſtles doubtles ſhée dyd authoritye councell chaunge inſtitution chriſt holy apoſtles alſo vſe practiſe holy church firſt churche god ſhée kéepe chriſtes inſtitution ſhée fulfill chriſtes word ye holy apoſtles learne ſo ſhall councell conſtance firſt condemne chriſt bleſſed word learnyng chriſtes holy apoſtles alſo long vſe practiſe chriſtes bleſſed church without scripture without authoritie without ſpeciall reuelation frō god alonely auoydyng certeine peril yea content alonely cōdemne theſe thinges vnder paine hereſie cōdemne ſore cōdemnation chriſtes open woorde thyng whiche graunt church dyd vſe begynnyng furthermore councell ſayth councell doth ſhamefully bee lye father scripture holy father church dyd bryng cuſtome houſell laye men vnder one kinde aſhamed theſe woordes doth conſcience prike thus openly lye yea chriſt holy church chriſtes worde openly agaynſte graunt vſe church alſo otherwiſe holy father may ſée ſay child kyngdome lye doubtleſſe bryng foorth holy father make ſhall alonely bée taken abhominable •… en lyers alſo ſhameful deteſtable ſclaunderers holy church alſo holy father wonder antichriſt muſt declare ſelfe openly bée agaynſt chriſt yet hée neuer without antichriſt doth tymes declare hym ſelfe bee agaynſte chriſt excuſe ſhaddow holynes hée may blynd poore people excuſe hée councell cōdemne chriſtes worde might auoyde certaine ſclaūders perrils béecauſe body without bloud bée theſe lawfull cauſes condemne chriſtes
