open word yea vnder payne hereſie new maner law make new doctrine made antichriſt hée obeye ſtatute made agaynſt god word hée boūde obey vnder payne euerlaſtyng damnation alonely auoydyng perrils bée condemned hereticke briefely reaſon may condemne holy scripture laying icoperdies perrils thereto may condemne creature god may bée perill vſing néede many wordes prooue councell bée ſoeuer contrary chriſt ſame deuill deuill bée deuill contrary chriſt hath excuſe alonely auoyde perrils cā tell deuill ſure antichriſt ſhall neuer bée without ſome carnall excuſe hée deny chriſt bée god man hée ſhall haue ſtronger carnall reaſons councell hath matter muſt bée iudged carnal reaſons god worde aboue creature wherefore let v goe scripture ſure ancore ouercome antichriſt carnall reaſons firſt maiſter chriſt hée dyd inſtitute bleſſed sacrament vſe theſe woordes take eate body c likewiſe takyng math 26 marke 14 luke 22 challice hée gaue thankes gaue vnto ſaying drinke bloud newe teſtament ſhall bée ſhed many remiſſion ſinnes theſe bée playne wordes drinke hée ſayth excepteth man furthermore chriſtes inſtitution sacrament body bloud hée knewe might bée ieoperdies receiuyng yet hée ſayth drinke bloud ſhall bée ſhed remiſſion ſinnes ſhed lay men ſinnes ſhal drinke maiſter lord ſayth drinke therof ſhall miſerable ſeruaunt withſtand commaundemēt yea commaunde playne contrary ſay drinke therof commeth lord rocheſter perceiueth councel connict conſenteth whole church begynnyng receiue sacrament vnder kyndes yet forbiddeth ſame thyng ſayth rocheſters gloſe vpon chriſtes wordes mainteine errour chriſte ſpake theſe wordes drinke alonely apoſtles men apoſtles therfore muſt alonely drinke therof aunſwere lord thing alonely lawfull vnto apoſtles diſcharge primatiue churche whiche thoſe men chriſt miniſtred sacrament vnto yea ſelfe men miniſter vnder kyndes whole congregation accordyng commaundement drinke dout vnderſtoode chriſtes well commaundement way communication let v graūt apoſtles onely ſayd thē diſcharge owne prieſtes deadly ſinne receiue vnder kindes yet bée neither apoſtles ſucceſſours thē learnyng biſhops alonely bée ſucceſſours prieſtes doe repreſent lxxij diſciples shal thyng repreſēt apoſtles abſoluyng ſinne diſciples let v ſée farther fetched reaſon tel v authoritie highe pollitike rule ſaued dare géeue either theſe kindes laye men ſeyng alonely geuen apoſtles euē authoritie haue power take away one kynd ſelfe ſame haue power take away geuen pope may aſwell forbid lay men eate chriſtes body forbid drinke chriſtes bloud indifferently receiuers ſo many receiued one receiued alſo hée ſayd take eate body hée ſayd drinke c may thus take away ye partes ye ſacramentes pleaſure ye cōſequent ſhall bée y• incontinuance ſacramentes ſhalbe deſtroyed chriſtes word ſet naught wherefore lord blaſphemous euation helpe ſuch ſhamfull ſolutions muſt vſe agaynſt open worde god amend conſcience lorde doe remēber barnes playne wyth byſhop rocheſter terrible wordes y• prophet hée ſhall ſhake ſword bend bowe make al ready therein hath hée prepared ſhot death arrowes burne ſmal threatning lightly auoide let v ſée ſcriptures ſay gaue vnto receaued ye lord marke paules wordes hée receaued thyng lorde c lord ieſus ſame night ye hée betraied tooke bread thanked brake ſayde take ye eate body broken doe yée remembraunce mée ye paule ſetteth forth inſtitution chriſt ſame manner hée tooke cup ſaid cup new teſtament bloud doe oft drinke rememberaunce mée often ſhall eate bread drinke c • p ſhall ſhew lordes death tyll hée come marke diligently paule declareth lord ieſus chriſt dyd inſtitute bleſſed comfortable ſacramēt kindes kindes dyd myniſter hymſelfe onely alſo enacted cōmaū dement chriſten people muſt receiue doe often c yea commaūdement geuē sacrament miniſtred kind teaching v kindes lord hath inſtituted sacrament bée receiued alſo y• ſo receaue breake commaundement lorde doe often c commaundement paule lightly let ſlyp hée knew ordinaunce ye commaundement lord alſo knew ye one iot tytle wordes ſhould ought bée let ſlip without perrell ſoules y• ſo littell make word therfore hée durſt would yet hée great auctoritie counſell conſtance let ſlip tanſpoſe inſtitution commaundement lord wholy fully diligence hée wrote thoſe wordes vnto whole congregation corinthian miniſters prieſtes onely whole congregation well myniſters word lay men alſo contrary hée ſayth come togither may perceaue y• hée ſpeakes indifferently hée reproueth thē tarryed poore men alſo theſe wordes bée playne ſo euer ſhall eate bread drink cup worthely c vnto whole congregatiō doubt ye ſpirit lord ſawe béefore damnable errour bée inſtituted antichriſt onely myniſters hée ſayd drinke yea reproue manifeſtly declare open errour hée adeth worde cuppe ſignifying teaching chriſtes ordinaunce chriſtes bloud bee receaued body onely cup receaue bloud body onely receaue bloud inſtitution ſelfe cup leſt ſhould bée found correctours blaſphemers holy inſtitution commaundement lord paule receaued cōmaundemēt coūſels chriſtē man doubt chriſt thing bare open thing preſent alſo come knew bloud owne body alſo saynt paule ſcholer learned leſſon hym ignorant bloud body yet firſte maiſter chriſt géeueth bloud alone ſelfe cup diligent ſcholer knowyng doctrine maiſter dyd ſame regardyng maiſters doctrine preferring carnall reaſō knew bloud euery body maiſters doctrine taught maiſter kept bloud body v loſt damned perſons innume rable deteſtable aboue capacitie declare damnable abhominable ſinnes brake body ſhed bloude thereout plentouſly therewith made ſacrifice ſatiſfactiō ſinnes saint iohn ſayth bloud ieſus chriſt clen 1 iohn 1 ſeth v ſinne alſo ſanctified offeryng body ieſus chriſt chriſten men bée ſanctified offeryng body ſheadyng bloud body ſhoulde alwayes haue thoſe hebr 10 partes remēbraunce hée according bloud deuided frō body ſinners indifferētly come vnto chriſte accordyng maiſters inſtitution commaūdement miniſtred sacrament alſo ordeined bée miniſtred men body ſelfe bloud ſelfe might alway remember alonely sauiour paule miniſtred chriſtes body ſelfe cup bloud ſelfe lay commō people chriſt offered body v alſo ſhed ſame body moſt precious bloud therfore ſayth paule maiſter chriſt taught often ſhall eate bread drinke cup ſhall ſhew lordes death till hée come lordes come counſelles chriſt paule defendeth thys thyng partinaciter call ſtifly ſtrongly wyll abide reuoke wherfore decrée counſell bée condemned heretickes ſay god helpe remedy muſt néedes fier bée abiured wiſe piteous caſe two ſo good men theſe bée bée thus openly agaynſt decrée holy counſell yea againſt ſo many ſo noble father ſo great clarkes knew matter ye ſay well bée thought holy ghoſt would leaue ſo many excellent holy father great doctours diuinitie ſo many noble prince wiſe men worlde bée theſe two poore men bée reputation worlde wherefore lordes procéede againſt holy decrées councell conſtance condemne chriſt paule heretickes bée inuented agaynſt heretickes ſticke name neither chriſt paule cā hurt haue alſo condemned theyr learning preuailed againſt ſhould condemne well bée lord haue ſtrength wiſdome worlde certayne doctour law ſayde haue man holde ſorte beggers deſpiſed perſons worlde wherfore ſpare bée bolde implete numerum patrum veſtrorum tyrantes bée yet dead haue condemned yet haue muche doe euer owne de conſecra di 2 6 cōperimus lawe openly agaynſt theſe wordes wée vnderſtand certayne men receauing alonely portion bleſſed body doe abſtaine chalice holy bloud doubtles ſéeing tell pope lawes agaynſte hym ſelfe clergie ſuperſtition learned abſtayne let eyther receaue whole sacrament el let bée forbidden whole sacrament diuiſion one ye ſame miſtery bée done wythout great ſacrilege c thynke theſe wordes bée playne men ſhall eyther receaue kyndes none haue hereticke hée iudgeth ſayth ſacrilege openly agaynſt counſell receaue one kynde paraduenture wyll ſay law written prieſtes aunſwere whomſoeuer writtē maketh matter theſe wordes bée plaine diuiſion one miſterye bée done without great ſacrilege theſe word bée ſpoken perſons ſhall receaue deuiding ſacrament whoſoeuer ſhall receaue ſacrilege deuide thynge aunſwere marke alſo pope owne lawe ſayth ſuperſtition receaue one kinde onely owne lawe cauleth ſuperſtition receaue one kynde doubt receaue ſo blynded damnable reaſon body without bloude yet hée calleth ſuperſtition let v ſée gloſe ſaith texte ſuperfluouſly ſayth hée receaued vnder kindes kynde bread referred vnto fleſhe kynde wyne vnto bloude wyne sacrament bloude ſeate ſoule therfore receiued vnder kindes ſignifie chriſt receiue body ſoule partaking thereof doth profite bodye ſoule wherefore receiued alonely vnder one kynde • gloſer agaynſt counſell ſhoulde ſignifie profite allonely one part c thinke doth gloſe vnderſtand preiſtes onely haue lay men ſoules may sacrament profite bodye ſoule marke alſo hée ſayth ſuperfluouſly without cauſe receiued vnder kyndes alſo lawe hoſt brokē de conſe • r di 2 c cum frangimus bloude ſhed chalys mouthes faythfull men thyng ſignified immolation lord body croſſe ſhedding hys bloud ſide c plaine bloud géeuen chalys body faythfull men mouthes alonely prieſts mouthes alſo lawe de conſecr de 2 c si quocienſcum que bloud chriſt bée ſhed remiſſion ſinnes oftē ſhedde ought lawfully receaue doe alwayes ſinne muſt alwayes receaue medecyne c owne lawe ſayth receiuing bloude medycinall pope lawe ſaith receauing chriſtes bloud medicinable way bée receiued thē ſinne denie lay men ſinne wherefore ſhoulde receiue medicyne ſinne may perceiue thys alonely ſpoken prieſtes ſinners c furthermore ciprian ſayth ad corneliu •… apam doe wée teach wee prouoke men ſhed bloude cōfeſſion chriſtes name wée goodly ſaying cyprian doe denye bloude chriſt ſhall goe battayle dare wée able vnto victordum martyrdome wée doe firſte right admitte drincke cuppe lorde congregation c cyprian openly againſt many ſhall receiue ye bloud chriſt doe confeſſe name chriſt yea cuppe body alſo ambroſe ſayth emperour theodoſius ſhalt thou eccleſiastica • iſt lift vp thy handes yt doth yet droppe vnrighteous bloud ſhalt thou thoſe handes receaue body god boldnes wilt thou receaue thy mouth cup precious bloud ſéeing wodnes thy wordes ſo great bloud ſhed wrongfully c marke manner saint ambroſe saint ambroſe willeth men receaue cup bloud chriſt tyme lay men ſhould receiue yt bleſſed bloud chriſt yea cup ſeuerally body onely wherefore lord ſee conſcience diſcharge ſelf dreadfull trone chriſt ieſus making deteſtable dānable ſtatute agaynſt yt heauēly word god▪ agaynſt vſe holy church▪ pope hys clergie feare breake chriſtes inſtitution ordinaunce contrary expoſition holy doctours great thing ſo preſumptuouſly breake ſtatute mortall prince howe much immortall god bée auoyded carnall reaſon condemnation hereſye yet ſaying bée ieoperdies peril ſclaūders theſe proud crake excuſe yet helpe doubt great turke hath good reaſons hym theſe bée alſo proude crake haue though peraduenture hée vſeth ſo hipocritely agaynſt god omnipotent doe yet helpe hym wherefore moſt excellent gracious prince doe barnes exhorteth k henry viij reſtore ſinceritie chriſtes holy word méekenes due ſubiection admonyſh exhorte moſt noble grace yea ye father heauen doth openly commannd vnder payne diſpleaſure auoyde daunger eternall damnation alſo vertue chriſtes bleſſed bloud receiue remiſſion ſinnes thorow merites gloryous bloud doe defēd might chriſtes bleſſed worde ſwéete bloud holy ordinaunce ſuffer ſo lightly bee oppreſſed troden vnder foote grace may conſyder cauſe yt multitude dignitie men bée good beſt thē grace muſt conſider god omnipotentes cauſe chriſtes cauſe word god yt bleſſed bloud chriſt ouer troden ordinaunce commeth heauen counſels yea geuen god hymſelfe man auctoritye ſhall grace ſuffer thys thynge ſo lightly bée broken béecauſe men doe inuent carnall reaſon agaynſt deuill neuer without reaſon proueth cauſe againſt god word king saul ſmale reaſō hym whē hée dyd ſaue kyng agag beſt ſhéepe orē offer 1 reg 15 god reſonable cauſe ſaue beaſtes god honour offer thē vp vnto god goodly ſhine ſaue kyng rather kill hym man recken euill ſaue mā man iudge euill ſaue beaſtes yt beſt offer god god beſt worthy reaſon deuotion contrary god mere blyndnes impietie good conſideration good intent finally ten tymes better reaſon counſell yet saul good reaſon wyth good deuotion good purpoſe fatte beaſtes repelled god euer bycauſe hée ſtucke good intention left commaundement god men thinke light thynge whether receiue yt bleſſed bloud ſelfe el body light thinke yet god word yet chriſtes ordinaūce yet apoſtles obſerue yet holy church ſo fulfill yt word god away reaſon light thyng baptiſe water wyne worde god open muſt bée done water wyne yet cauſe worde god moreouer reaſon light thyng ſay bée glad y• daughter siō behold thy kyng cōmeth zacharie 9 math 20 thée ſittyng aſſe fole ſaying reaſon alonely ſimple alſo fooliſhe ſay kyng ſhal come riding aſſe yea borowed aſſe therof make ſo much doe though wer notable thyng would mocke kyng hée dyd ſo ryde notwithſtandyng theſe bée wordes god yea alſo fulfilled déede maiſter chriſt owne proper perſon moreouer reaſon madde token sauiour luke 2 world chriſt ieſus borne ſay ſhal finde young child wrapped cloutes layd cribbe purpoſe prooue ſauiour yt world borne reaſon mocke wil reaſon bée perſuaded token yt ſayinges doinges chriſt bee iudged naturall reaſon meſſias prophetes patriarkes haue promiſed ſo many hūdred yeares afore borne yet token came heauē yea miniſtration aungels ſhepheardes dyd beléeue yt word briefly reaſon bée article fayth chriſt remiſſion ſins yt lyfe come reaſon mocketh theſe thynges yet bée true bycauſe alonely yt word god ſpeaketh wherfore moſt noble excellēt prince looke word god blynde reaſon ſaue honour therof ſhal ſaue grace moſt néede furthermore doe exhorte require honour yea doe cōmaunde vertue chriſt ieſus bleſſed word duke earles lordes maner eſtates hygh lowe bée chriſten men bée ſaued vertue ieſus chriſtes bleſſed bloud doe ſée ordinaūce iohn 6 god heauen obſerued vttermoſt power ſoeuer bée houſeled receiue bleſſed sacramēt vnder kyndes leſt deſire hart curate ſo deſire may bée diſcharged afore immortall god heauen whiche bée mocked auoyded damnable reaſō ſoeuer thyng bée agaynſt holy word god glorious ordinaūce collour ſoeuer ordeined agaynſt ordinaunce chriſt ſame occurſed ſo euer bryng holynes let bée curſed reckened deuill doth cyprian learne v ſaying thyng ſoeuer bée ordeined man madnes ordinaunce god violated whoredome deuil ſacrilege wherfore fly frō ſuch contagiouſneſſe men auoyde woordes canker peſtilence c theſe woordes bée playne maner men eſtate dignitie honour ſoeuer bée collour holynes ſoeuer bryng wherfore preſent writyng doe counſel exhorte true chriſten men take héede doe word god ſo playne matter deſire playner childes game trifle god worde god bée trifled yet mocked nowe helpe poore men bée vnlearned aſſoyle certeine damnable reaſons firſt geue blynd reaſons papiſtes vnder kynde wyne leſt ſhoulde negligence either prieſt receiuer fall droppe grounde aunſwere chriſt dyd know ſuch chaunce might come deny except ſay hée god would greatly ſticke doe might haue maintenaunce yet notwithſtanding dyd hée inſtitute kindes aunſwere moreouer doe reaſō owne prieſtes abſtayne frō wine ſéeing perill may alſo chaūce cautelles yt maſſe doe graunt alſo bée reaſonable cauſe ſhal kéepe chriſtes ordinaunce béecauſe auoyding perilles may take away whole sacrament auoyde perilles receauing ye kinde bread ieopardous leaſt remayne crumme receauers téeth reaſō good ſo sacramēt kindes taken away furthermore auoyde perilles may géeue thys sacrament man tell deadly ſinne know harte ſore perell greatly ieoperdye geue pure body chriſt ieſus foule ſoule papiſtes finde faulte gnattes ſwallowe caniels yt drop bloud negligence ſhould fall ground falleth drop yt whole body foular place ground alſo may bée auoyded good diligence wiſedome prieſt ſacrament ſhall alwayes bée receiued pure conſcience dilygence prieſt make thinke whole ſacrament chriſtes bleſſed ordinaunce clearely taken away auoyding ieoperdies perells thus trifle chriſtes holy word yea yt great holy counſels reaſons lorde rocheſter bringeth bée worthy ſolution hée doth mocke ſcorne trifle god word hée bringeth yt myracle yt fiue loues mentiō made wyne therefore lay men muſt bée houſeled one kinde madnes meane theſe men yt neyther feare god yet bée aſhamed man purpoſe chriſt dyd myrackle fyue loues iohn 6 mencion made wyne ſacrament bread fygnifyed one part ſacrament ſygnifyed 2 fyſhes theſe 2 thing fonde argumentes made y• byſhop roche eſtr muſt néedes ſignifye part alſo lay men touch breade moreouer place chriſt geueth onely wine therefore ſacrament muſt bée receiued kinde wine al onely lay men bée theſe goodly argumentes yea biſhops madnes aunſwere god worde lawfull prieſtes hath gift chaſtitie marry wiues cauſe moued hym write thing haue ſéene heard diuerſe countryes haue béene intolerable perſecutiō agaynſt prieſtes compelled weakenes nature mary wyues intent might god law man law vſe honeſt cōuerſation world thyng ſay haue béene ſore perſecuted ſome caſt countrey ſome drowned ſome burned ſome beheaded finally cruelnes could bée excogitated againſt men thought litle wherfore recken ſelfe debtour ſeruaunt vnto mē thynges wherein may profite ſpecially thynges apperteine inſtructiō conſcience hath taken vpō cauſe ſhew litle ſmall learnyng charitably deſiryng thē bée ſome thing yet againſt thyng let ſelues bée taught inſtructed god word ſet themſelues obſtinately agaynſte verity god bleſſed word lord eaſely beare ſuffer vnwilled ignoraunce peruerſe malice froward reſiſtyng veritie hée ſuffer thereunto hée mortall extreme enemy wherefore let men conſider article doth ſtand god word • ith chriſtes holy doctrine reſiſte ſet themſelues agaynſt doe reſiſte god man able performe certaine men bée two ſorts men peruerſe froward obſtinate mynde doth ſet ſelues agaynſt article moe wiſe admit either reaſon learnyng ſtill remaine theyr old errour haue conceiued braynes whiche neither grounded god holy word yet holy conuerſation lyuyng bleſſed vertuous mē ʋnto theſe men write nothyng bycauſe trouble bycauſe would bée loth bée torne dog téeth elles caſt pearles béefore ſwyne ſorte mē bée math 7 doth admit article reaſon bée ignoraunt scripture know groūde therof alonely led old cuſtome haue béen brought vp yet neuertheleſſe obſtinate enemyes vnto veritie would gladly geue place learnyng reaſon doe ſearch ſober méekenes ye truth thing glad embrace ſoone layde ʋnto theſe men writyng labour ſpent doe charitably beſéeche fauourably indifferently iudge writyng doe bynde ſelfe prooue thing god grace chriſts holy worde ſayinges holy doctours authoritie authē ticall ſtories example practiſe holy vertuous men doe bée contented bée beléeued thyng performe thinke reaſonable men géeue credence mée finally la • ſhew thoſe reaſons authority wherby pope hath bounde hys prieſtes kéepe hée calleth pure chaſtitie concluſion poore learnyng aſſoyle thoſe scripture reaſons prooue thyng cā haue place ʋnto performyng whiche ieſus infinite mercy graunt holy ſpirite amen firſt cōmeth bleſſed saint paule church god hath alwayes reuerence hée approueth doctrine mine ſaying let euery man auoyding fornication 1 cor 7 haue wife euery woman haue huſband marke bleſſed paule cōmaundeth daunger fornication euery man auyoding vicious lyuyng ſhould take wife man excepted text euery man ſpecially lyue ſole ʋnto thē ſtreight commaundement marry none remedy ordeined god auoyde fornication mariage yea ten remedy mariage yet muſt mariage bée lawfull bée vſed yea great deale ſéeyng ſpecially appoynted god remedy caſe remedyes faſtyng watchyng labouryng chaſtiſing prieſtes bounde mary auoyding vicious liuing thē chaſtiſing theyr body ſeyng god ordinaunce ther unto appointed man body though bée lawfull laudable good yet bée appropriately onely appoynted god bée remedy agaynſt fornication bleſſed paule doth appoynt mariage bée wherefore bée lawfull prieſtes faſt watch auoyde fornication muſt néedes bée lawful thē marry wiues bée daunger fornication mariage caſe alonely commaunded god appointed god eſpeciall ſingular medecine diſeaſe marke alſo occaſion paul write text corinthian certeine men amōg reckened holines perfectiō certeine mē doth prieſtes chriſten mē ſhould lyue ſole without wiues text declareth good man touch woman doth bleſſed paule aunſwere holy hypocriſie maner auoyde fornication ſayth hée notwithſtandyng holyneſſe let euery man mary wyfe bleſſed saynt paule thought vnlawfull marry chriſten man would hée haue ſayde let euery man marry marke alſo agaynſt perfection chriſten man marry hée rather boūde marry hée haue gifte chaſtitie farthermore note paule neither biddeth thought holynes bée vnmaryed faſt labour weare héere alonely marry ſhoulde ſay god hath ordayned approoued lawful laudable remedy againſt ſicknes doctrine ſhall heare god vſe comforte thoſe creature remedy thankes géeuing god hath appointed therewith bée cō tent recken ſelues wyſer god helpyng curyng diſeaſes nothing bée vnlawfull god doth allowe prooue vſing god creature ordinaunces tyme place requiſite man bée blamed béefore god refuſing god remedy whē bée neceſſary let man thinke hée ſhall auoyde god daunger example hée wyll eate drinke hée hungry thirſty excogitateth ſome remedie owne brayne ſo long hée bringeth himſelfe vtter deſtruction let man doubte caſe god hée murtherer homicide thinke learning contrary wherefore woulde mē ſhould well remember themſelues thys caſe thinke cā inuent thyng pleaſaunt vnto god hée doe hym ſelfe pleaſure beſt knowen vnto himſelfe cauſe iudge lawfull euery prieſt hath gift chaſtitie vſe remedy god hath ordayned alſo ſanctified bleſſed paule ſaith mariage honorable bedde vndefiled fornicatours aduoulterers god ſhal iudge marke paule caulleth honorable cleane thyng preſumption hebr 13 therefore v recken diſhonour vncleanneſſe prieſtes vſe maryage god ſayth hée ſhall iudge whorekéepers aduoulterers bée maryed wherefore yet agayne ye doctrine paule exhorte prieſtes liue chaſte receiue god remedie thankes paules doctrine 1 cor 7 hée ſayth woulde men ſelfe euery mā hath proper gift god one maner ſay vnto vnmaryed men wydowes good abide doe abſtaine let mary better mary ſufficient god auoyde paule light vayne ſolution burne deuiſe clearer text purpoſe thys saint paule woulde euery man gifte chaſtitie much men hath one gift therefore ſayth paule muſt euery man vſe himſelfe gift hée hath gifte chaſtitie paule wyll plainely hée ſhall mary hée ſayth hée ſhal chaſtice himſelfe wyth labour wyth payne remedye weakenes though woulde bée contente parte gladly men ſhoulde prooue maner lawfull remedy helpe lyue ſole ſo continue wyll wiſe ſhall refuſe maryage thyng vnlawfull filthy rather vſe prooue leaſt wiſe haue done remedy haue inuented ſéeing god hath iuſtituted thyng hée iudgeth lawfull principall remedy note paule ſayth better mary burne paules meanynge man hath gifte extincte burnyng ardent deſire nature hée muſt mary rather bée ſubiecte vnto ſuch concupiſcence paule ſayth rather mary kéepe whore hys wée ſhoulde bée ſo farre whoredome wée ſhould ſuffer ſelues ſo much burne whiche precéedeth whoredome leſſe déede whoredome yet paule wylling v auoyde leſſe thing commaundeth v mary much auoyde open whoredome abhominable deteſtable vncleannes vſed ſhameleſſe worlde doe reprooue prieſtes whoredom lawful caſe mariage lawfull diuerſe caſes ergo mariage muſt rather bee alowed whoredome doth lyue ſole rather thereto exhorte deteſtate men rather ſuffer allow prieſtes liue whoredome abhominable fornication vſe lawfull remedy god hath ordayned ſanctified wée haue mention ſtorye euer prieſt burned kéepyng whore mariage haue ſéene doe ſée dayly cruelly violently men doth perſecute though god bleſſed ordinaunce rather bée extincted abhorred thyng ye god nature reprooueth one man england hath ſo great loue reuerence holy ſtate matrimony hée ſhould kéepe maryed prieſt hys houſe prieſtes lyue vnlawfully agaynſt god law man law agaynſt honeſty morall vertue bée euery man houſes company ruler coūſellers controller ala pitie ſhall ſay affectiōs men harte thus winke ſay alow ſuch abhominable thynges yea ſelfe ſame men ſhall bée moſt extreme cruell vnto poore ſimple prieſt good hart towardes god ordinaunce maryeth lawfull wife prieſt ſay ſhall neither haue meate drinke thē yet office charitye ſort ſhalbée exalted ſet vp honour kept reuerence eſtimatiō bycauſe ſay bée good cleane felowes loueth péece fleſh well theſe blaſphemous woordes haue heard diuerſe tymes many men ſit laugh haue great reioyſing ſore god holy ordinaunce morall vertue goodnes extincted men harte lord god thy mercy world able cō tinewe thus abhominably ſhamefully iudgeth thy halowed ſanctified workes oh lord haue thou mercy pitie v ſwéete bloud thy ſonne chriſt ieſus loke ſynnes oh lord god able abyde thy ſyght lord thine infinite mercy ſend downe thy ſpirit ye hart thy people may bée taught better iudge thy heauenly godly inſtitutions amen purpoſe article haue written bée ſomething harde obſcure ſauing onely theſe men bée learned article mée thinke ſo playne meruayle mā ſhould doubt doubtles néedeth learned iudge onely ciuell morall good man write agaynſt thoſe prieſtes cā doe lyue chaſt rather exhorte thē ſo continue indued reaſon equitie ſurely mine aduerſaries doth earneſtly defend pure cleane chaſtitie know prieſtes bée kéepeth chaſtitie yea know ſore haue punyſhed thoſe men hath broken theyr chaſtitie doe defend chaſtitie rather fylthines abhominable lyuing ye moſt part ſpiritualtie doth liue bée reported let thoſe men leſt marrye wyues ſeyng doe lyue chaſt recordes kinges court alſo owne recordes ye ſhould bée ſerched ſhould bée found innumerable ſort detected vncleanes theſe matter bée open notwithſtanding right ſory rehearſe compelled ſeing ſuch intollerable violēce vſed agaynſt thoſe poore mē marry cauſe would onely lyue vertuouſly béefore god alſo morally world let men onely vſe reaſon man doubteth greate many doth thus lyue whiche bee greate perſecutors maryed prieſtes would deſire proue pacience ſore know theyr name ſome theyr child 1 theſſ 4 caſe make compariſon betwéene theſe two manner lyuings conſyder doth béecome polytike order common wealth beſt whether reaſon better mée defile ſhamefully men wyues men daughter mennes maydens man ſeruaunt ſhoulde bée ſafegarde mée el ſhould marry wyfe myne noble kinges duke good men world hath done doth dayly ſo continew lyfe myne neighbour māner good neighbourhod let men heare without malyce iudge indifferētly bleſſed saint paule procéedeth farther matter proueth clearely man ought bée bound verginitie farther ye gift god doth ſtrengthē hym thus hée ſayth cō cerning virgin haue precept lord onely geue councell thinke good ye reaſon preſent neceſſitie man ſhould lyue ſo hée would ſay ʋnto verginitie • inde yo • farther gift doe recken thing neceſſary wyn heauen heauen neyther price virginity yet mariage onely reken verginitie maryed men ſhall teſtifie ʋirginitie quyet lyfe good expedient thing liue quietly world mariage many thinges ye doth diſtracte diſturbeth man mynde paules meanyng wel proued ye texte followeth mariage hath greater croſſe virginitie virgin doth marry ſhe doth ſinne vut ſhée ſhall haue much tēptation fleſh ſay many occaſions diſquietnes ſayth paule would gladly ſpare ſuch occaſions would haue without ſorowe ſhée vnmaried hath care ſerue god ſhée maryed hath much care ſorowe ſhée ſhall diſpatch worldly buſines paule doth clearely declare meaning virginity nearer way heauen mariage ſauyng onely vnmaried perſon hath ſo many occaſyons bée diſquieted maryed hath wherefore ſhall marke text fyrſt paule hath commaundement binde men chaſtitie commeth therefore y• pope compelleth thoſe men y• •… xxxi ca •… nte trie •… • ée prieſtes fyrſt forſweare mariage vow chaſtitie learning able proue pope cā make preceptes god bleſſed paule could doe furthermore auctoritie hath pope bynde v thyng god holy apoſtles hath left frée learned men euer wrote doth graunt ye bee two manner thinges world bée called re neceſſariae re neceſſ thinges bée neceſſary muſt bée done béecauſe god hath commaunded theſe thing man able make iudifferent muſt néedes bée neceſſarily done thinges bée lerned mē cauleth re mediae thinges 〈◊〉 ••• bée indifferent theſe may bée done may bée left without ſinne nature theſe contrary may bee chaūged thinges neceſſary agaynſt nature paule declareth roman rom 14 diuers place trueth virginitie thyng ſelfe god ordinaunce indifferēt may bée vſed left without ſinne wherefore virginitie ſtate differens ſtandeth learnyng mās law ſhould chaūge nature thyng make vnto man thyng neceſſarie whereas god commaundement thyng different much chaunge god ordinaunce alſo ye nature thing ſtādeth learnyng pope world make god commaundement coūſell god counſell make precept wherfore cōclude bleſſed paule man chaſtitie god gift ought vow chaſtitie farther god hath geu • n hym gift chaſtitie thyng could bée obtayned kept vowyng gift god gift vowyng whiche agaynſt maiſter chriſt alſo agaynſt math 19 1 cor 7 bleſſed paule farthermore let euery man thinke ſelfe ſéeyng bleſſed whether bee better folow ſ paule pope paule commaundement ouer chaſtitie yet would geue commaundement whether bée ſureſt way lawfulleſt folow pope commaundement el folow bleſſed paules doctrine knew perfection virginitie alſo dyd béecome prieſtes doe well pope doth moreouer men iudge thoſe prieſtes marry whiche foloweth paules counſell doctrine greuouſly ſinne bée heretickes ſhould rather iudge thoſe men greuouſly ſinne bée ten tymes worſe heretickes foloweth pope commaundement marying • paules doctrine lawful bée keept farre ſinne pope cōmaundements bée paule great auctoritie churche god pope thinke yes note alſo paule would bynde 1 cor 7 corinthian virginity bycauſe hée would tangle ſnare alonely hée exhorteth virginitie vnto honeſt comely thyng might yt quietly ſerue god ʋpō ſame text ſayth athanaſius apoſtle would compell athanaſius 1 cor 7 mā kéepe virginitie agaynſt hée would make virginitie thyng neceſſitie wherefore muſt néedes folow firſt pope byndyng men virginitie doth lay ſnare nothyng el except haue gift chaſtitie bryng men daunger damnation secōdarily hée maketh thyng neceſſitie ye holy ghoſt bleſſed ſ paul durſt would doe thyrdly thyng paule reckened onely conduce helpe quietnes preſent lyfe ſame thyng maketh pope sauiour helper heauē great blaſphemy chriſtes holy bloud alſo peruerſe vſing god bleſſed creature let euery chriſten mā iudge bée charitably done pope yea whether hée hath authoritie doe let man beſeche hym iudge matter parcia litie euen hée aunſwere béefore god bleſſed paule goeth farther cōcernyng haue purpoſe promiſe god 〈…〉 virgi • itatem 〈…〉 kéepe charitie hys woordes bée theſe hée purpoſeth ſurely hys hart hauyng néede hath power ouer owne wil hath ſo decréed hart yt hée kéepe hys virginitie doth well note firſt paule compelleth man vow hée letteth euery man ſtand owne farthermore bleſſed paul willeth ſoeuer hée bée decréeth hart kéepe virginity bée muſt firſt conſider whether lyeth power kéepe decrée bée power ſayth bleſſed paule diſpenſeth vnlawfull vowes paule doth hée better kéepe virginitie thē marry lye power bée chaſt doth body ſoule willeth paule hée marry note paul notwithſtandyng man decrée purpoſe hée made kéepe virginity willeth hée doe marry hée cā kéepe decrée purpoſe cōtrary pope doctrine whiche rather ſuffereth prieſtes liue vnclennes yt reaſon fooliſh promiſe made vnto hym hée would ſuffer marry wyues paules holy doctrine yea pope aſhamed cruelly puniſhe poore woman marying hée doth ſhée whore nunne ſhée marry x • v • q c de filia verbo de filia ſayth hée ſhall neuer bée admitted receyue bleſſed sacrament chriſt ſhée bée whore ſayth hée may ſhée penaunce bée admitted sacramēt abhorryng mariage bée none compare yea make worſe thē whoredome ſhée haue vowed chaſtitie hath ſhée alſo vowed flye fornication ſhée bounde vnto virginitie man law auoyde fornicatiō whoredome god commaundement wherfore ſée hygh pope ſet hym ſelfe aboue god holy ordinaunce theſſ 4 furthermore paule ſayth god ſhould abſtayne fornicatiō euery one v ſhould know kéepe veſſell ſanctifiing honour marke paules ſaying firſt god ſhould abhorre fornication reſiſte god regarde thyng god haue done truſt chriſten man furthermore god yt euery man ſhould kéepe veſſell honour prieſtes bée men haue gift chaſtetie bounde regard commaundement hée ſayth euery man marke alſo bleſſed paule calleth veſſell maryed men honorable ſanctified wherfore thē ſhuld bée vnlawful prieſt vſe ſanctified holy veſſell poſſeſſe men veſſels vnclennes agaynſt god man lawfull man text poſſeſſe veſſell hys owne god hath ſanctified honored man occaſion curſe thyng god hath ſanctified make vncleane god hath purified paule hauing yt ſpirite god prophecie ſhould come 1 tim 4 men latter dayes ſhould forbid men marry theſe men ſhould ſpeake lye holy hipocriſie nowe marke texte men ſhall forbyd maryage latter dayes trueth mā hath forbidden certayne ſtate men marry pope onely wherefore texte muſt néedes touch kingdome ſéeing hée alſo latter dayes certayne heretickes called taciani condemne fully wholy maner maryage though taciani saynt paule ſpeaketh againſt yet déede pope doctrine excepted ſéeing contayned theſe latter dayes though twenty hereſies thē taciani yet muſt texte bée applied agaynſt doth cōdēne el deſpiſe mariage whole parte text againſt doth forbid maryage ſpecially latter dayes hée doth forbid prieſts marry doth forbid ſo much mariage pope forbyddeth mariage therefore texte maketh agaynſt pope note alſo theſe men ſhall forbid mariage ſhall haue holy colour hypocriſie hath pope forbidden hys prieſtes marry vnder colour holynes béecauſe hée ſayth prieſtes muſt bée pure cleane ſhoulde ſay maryage vncleane vnpure prieſtes vſe bée holy hypocriſie bée hypocriſie holy pure inſtitution god condemned thyng vncleane holy prieſtes vſe moreouer taciani forbid mariage vnder colour holynes ſaid fully wholy vnlawfull thynge doctrine maner colour pope ſayth mariage good laudable ſelfe prieſts bée pure holy vſe ſimple thyng thynge ſayth hée doth become yt ſtate perfecte mē belōgeth weake vnperfect men iudge good reader theſe hereſies eyther taciani papacy doth pretende yt greateſt colour holynes yet ſure yt holy ghoſt paul ſpeake againſt greateſt alſo ſmalleſt hypocriſie hée alloweth maner fayned holynes certayne heretikes called marciani theſe receiue man bée chriſten man excepte hée woulde refuſe mariage marke diuerſitie betwéene theſe heretickes pope learning pope receiueth prieſts except forſweare maryage marcianites pope one marcianites receiue man bée chriſten man excepte hée forſweare maryage diuerſitie betwéete heretikes pope theſe heretikes doth excepte greater number yt pope doth ſpeaketh generally thynge one marcianites iudgeth mariage vncleane ſorte ſo doth pope ſorte farthermore marcian ſayth among chriſten men may bée temporal maryages coniunctions muſt bée turned vnto ſpirituall mariage diſt xxxi ca l • x ſelfe ſame thing ſaith pope prieſtes wherefore ſéeing doe graunt bleſſed paul 1 tim 4 alſo holy father hath condemned hereſie marcian • ſt néedes alſo folow opinion pope lykewyſe condemned yet paraduenture bée obiectio ſayde doctour eckius mē writing matter ſayth pope doth condemne maryage hée cauſeth men alonely kéepe vowe aunſwere thys ſmall euaſion pope compelleth mē vow ſo much hee forbiddeth maryage firſt pope cōpelleth wyll bée prieſtes vowe forſweare maryage ſtatute made béefore pope prieſtes ſhould forſweare maryage ſhoulde vowes bée made prieſtes againſt mariage thing ſhoulde bée frée vowe commeth pope decrée prohibition decrée vowe therfore ye probation goeth béefore vowe wherfore euaſion haue place take exāple emperour maketh ſtatute man ſhalbée admitted ſeruice excepte hée firſt ſweare bée enemy vnto kyngs grace england emperour firſt enemye good example agaynſt pope practiſes vnto kynges perſon alſo forbydder loue fauour towardes kinges grace englād thynke hys grace wyll take acte none otherwiſe though hée doth make men kynges enemy yet hee maketh appertayne hym bée kinges enemy lykewiſe pope though hée doe forbid men maryage yet hée forbyddeth many bée prieſtes yea hée admitte man bée prieſt excepte hée firſt forſweare maryage ye vow firſt made ere priſthoode géeuen hée enemy déede vnto maryage ſhoulde mooue hym compell hys prieſtes forſweare maryage doth hée well bynde hys prieſtes maryage hée doth chaſtitie yea doth hée yt leaſt kéepe hymſelfe indifferent neither make decree againſt mariage agaynſt chaſtitie trueth protectours vncleannes filthy liuing doth know well ſolution ſtrength valure déede harte doth recken matrimony vncleane vnpure though woulde make gloſe yet owne lawes yt bée ſprong harte doth ſhewe much holde holy vnpolluted diſt 32 c erubeſcant matrimony pope doth cal clark yt bée maried impios yt wicked curſed vncleane filthy yt nought alſo place hée cauleth matrimony lay men fleſhly carnall thyng chaſtitie 31 c lex ſpiritualtie hée cauleth ſpirituall maryage ſaith marcian abhominable doctrine thus ſhameles ſpeake holy ſanctified matrimony call fleſhly carnall yet hée thus content hée cauleth yt maryage prieſtes ſinne defender ſame ſectatores libidinum diſt 82 c plurimos folowers filthy luſtes preceptores viciorum teacher vice laxantes frena luxuriae géeuing libertie lechery tell mée man woulde ſpeake reprooue yt whore ſtewes wordes co • ld hée vſe agaynſt ſhameful theſe yet wil bée noted condemne matrimony miſchiefe deuill cloke men woulde beléeue hym farthermore let v ſée holy bleſſed hée reckeneth matrimony bée reaſon honour rewardes hée geueth vnto prieſts marry firſt diſt 82 c quia aliquanti ſaith hée prieſt doth marry ignoraunce reaſon hée knew ſtatute pope forbidding prieſtes marry prieſt pope lawes agaynſt maryage prieſtes fyrſte ſhall forſake wife ſhall ſo continue farther promotion long hée lyueth bee prieſt defēd mariage example prieſtes ould lawe hym doth pope priuate maner eccleſiaſticall honour euer moreouer new deuiſed ſinne agaynſt holy ghoſt helpe god hée ſayth ſpirituall mā doth decrée marry ſinne ſhall neuer bée forgeuen hym may neuer afterward handle bleſſed ſacramēt becauſe mariage fylthy foule concupiſcence ſayth hée iudge indifferently chriſtē reader bée diſpiſing holy matrimony thus ſhamefully ſpeake ſo cruelly handle holyly doth liue hauing nothing hym louſy decrée pope siricius men may perceaue clearely hée byndeth prieſtes reaſon vowe protectours doth ſay yt reaſon ſtatute siricius made afore prieſtes vowed chaſtetie paule hée ſhould order ſuch byſhoppes ſhould bée 1 tim 3 church god irrepreſēſible among thinges hée would hée ſhould bée man one wife hauing tit 1 child well brought vp saint paule aloweth hym one wife commeth men ſay prieſt ſhall haue wyfe agreeth one none men muſt leaſt wayes graunt paule dyd recken mariage vnpure vncleane byſhop hée hée would haue graū ted hym one wife yea moreouer hée ſpeaketh child well brought vp hée admitteth aloweth coniunction copulation child bee gotten lookyng woman onely béetwéene two bée godly vertuous hée hath eye looke bleſſed holy coniunction betwéene man wyfe pope hath pope rekeneth fylthy ſemely prieſt ſhould holy handes touch woman body ſame handes conſcecrate yt holy ſacrament oh lord god cā deuill bring paſſe abhominable holynes hypocriſye recken prieſt vnpure vncleane béecauſe hée hath vſed hym ſelfe god holy ordinaunce much ſay god thou art inuenter ordayner thing maketh men vnpure vncleane thou art auctour vncleanenes haddeſt thou inſtituted ſo men vſed pope alloweth prieſtes keepe whore cannot abyde ſhould haue honeſt wife ala fayne would chide could ſay ſome thing would may neuertheles gréeueth mée tell vſe euell wordes ſhall vſe thē againſt ſuch abhominable execrable hereſye yet pray one worde bée hāds defiled handeling whore ſleſhe whore ſleſh ſo cleane prieſtes may handle fleſhe honeſt good woman ſo vncleane burne prieſtes bee knowen open whore maſters beneſices bee thē better chepe recken earneſtly defend chaſtitie prieſt muſt bée burned handeling fye deuill thinkeſt thou men hath neyther reuerēce • artes toward god yet reaſō iudge theſe thing bée ſhameles thing ſhall bée thus alowed amongeſt chriſten men bée honeſt woman honeſtie abhorred deſpiſed whore compariſon bée ſanctified bleſſed oh thou lord god doe yet beléeue thou wilt bée reuenged • ſhonour ſhamefulnes moreouer doth oppreſſion violence thefte defyle prieſtes handes well mariage hath pure matrymonye offended alonely ſhould defyle prieſts hand maner vice vncleanenes doth nothing contaminate ala pitye blindly doe iudge holy ordināce inſtitution god thus doe blaſpheme men ſay bleſſed 1 cor 9 paule hée ſayth haue power lead ſyſter wife well bretheren lord cephas diſpute whether paule wife ſure text doth clearely proue yt mind great doctours peter apoſtles wiues wherefore ſhould bée vnlawfull prieſtes marry bée prieſts holier thē peter apoſtles mariage vnlawfull peraduenture great blaſphemy agaynſte chriſt holy apoſtles bée ſayd apoſtles wiues beefore yt chriſt dyd chuſe thē afterward forſooke wyues folowed chriſt aunſwere inough ſo ſay ſéeing haue graunted apoſtles wiues whē cauled ſtandeth reaſō theſe men ſhould proue open ſcripture apoſtles theyr caulyng dyd forſake theyr wyues yea wyll goe farther wyth ſay playnely abhominable lye great blaſphemy agaynſt god holy apoſtles ſay forſaken theyr wyues chriſt taught forſake math 19 wyues wyſe kéepe thē ſauing alonely fornication apoſtles forſooke wiues men dreame election vnto apoſtleſhip neyther fornication yet like vnto fornication wherefore ſay boldely falſe lye agaynſt holy apoſtles ſay forſooke wyues alſo ſame place paule doth prooue falſe lye paule ſpeaketh peter hys apoſtleſhyp alſo diſciples chriſt caryed theyr wyues wyth went preaching wherefore lye ſay forſaken chriſten reader haue perfourmed truſt one part promiſe ſay haue proued article myne god holy worde ſo playnely man truſt deny theſe scripture bée ſufficient moue al mē bée doctrine ſecond part promiſe proue alſo holy doctours ʋnto prepare ſelfe afore thinges louingly charitably deſyre reader ſet apart parcialitie malice iudge indifferently doctrine hée aunſwere y• dread full day doome refuſe thyng truth hatred diſpleaſure perſon ſurely myne intent neyther hurte harme yet diſpleaſe much lyeth mée perſon though haue tymes paſt ſomwhat vehemently written agaynſt thoſe thinges thought errours yet would require hartely euery man weye euery thyng indifferently hymſelf conſider haue taken vpon mée enuey agaynſt perſō alonely fight agaynſt deuilliſhe doctrine diſhonour chriſt hys bleſſed bloude perillous dampnable vnto chriſten men ſoules secondarily haue béene wrongfully vncharitably handeled god good men doth knowe bée bounde prooue whenſoeuer ſhall pleaſe god kyng aſſigne indifferent iudges heare mée myne aduerſaries let mā require mée hée finde hymſelfe ſay ſo patiently ſo eaſely beare ſuffer theſe intollerable wronges ought doe yea paraduenture gladly woulde doe wherefore confeſſe many wordes hath béene ſharpely written mée would gladly béene charitablyer written god geeuē mée ſo great patience wherefore truſt god grace ſomethyng temperately ſpeake deſiring euery good man hys charitie helpe mée wyth deuoute prayer amen purpoſe fyrſt commeth bleſſed ciprian aſked queſtion ſhould bée done ciprian • piſt 11 wyth thoſe religious perſonnes could kéepe theyr chaſtitie vowed theſe bée hys wordes thou doeſt aſke wée doe iudge vyrgins haue decréed lyue chaſtly afterward founde one bedde wyth man thou ſayſt one deacon wée doe wyth great ſorow ſée y• great ruine many perſons cōmeth y• reaſō ſuch vnlawfull perillous companying togither wherefore haue dedicate ſelues vnto chriſt fayth lyue purely chaſtly let ſo remayne wyth fable ſtrongly ſtedfaſtly abyde rewarde virginitie ciprian regarde honeſt liuing religious vowe wyll abyde el abyde better marry fall fier concupiſcence let géeue vnto brother ſiſterne none occaſion ſclaunder c doe parte require bleſſed cyprian doth teach ſay prieſtes lyue ſole beſéeche lord rewarde géeue grace continue woulde haue ſnare layd theyr ſoules yet haue compelled thyng kéepe woulde thyng ſhoulde bée indifferent lyue chaſte ſo remayne haue gifte ſo lyue vſe lawfull remedy god hath ordained hath men doe moueth thē maryage prieſtes allowed god therefore bee condemned men compell prieſtes marry long god contēted prieſts wedlocke let man thynke ſuch compulſion acceptable god men wyll bée contē ted doctrine ſo good ſo reaſonable ſo honeſt cā ſay muſt bée content doe ſay learnyng let god alone wyth hys puniſhment alſo bleſſed auguſtine writing thys ſame matter ſayth theſe aug de b • coniugal • ad iulianum wordes certayne men doe affirme thoſe men bée aduoulterers doth marry haue vowed • haſtitie doe affirme thoſe men doe greuouſly ſinne doth ſeparate c note firſt anguſtine wryteth vowed chaſtitie yet notwithſtanding hée woulde thoſe men ſhoulde continue maryage togither thyng hée would neuer haue ſuffered béene vnlawfull hereſ • e men woulde make dayes secondarily obſerue dayes • ée many thought greuous aug diſpenſeth wyth vowes daū ger fornication ſinne man marry hys vowe yet opinion auguſtine doth condemne let men admit doctrine auguſtine wil require condemne let alſo condemne auguſtine haue learned hym alſo bleſſed ambroſe writeth virginitie maner chaſtitie body ought bée deſired v thyng doe geue coūſell doe commaūde imperiouſly virginitie thyng alonely ambr • 32 queſt cap 1 integritas ought bée counſayled bée commaunded rather thyng voluntary precept c note ambroſe teacheth virginitie ought bée required vnder precept wherfore muſt néedes folow pope doctrine vnlawfull whē hée commaundeth man ſhall bée prieſt except hée vow chaſtitie • ere pope compelleth men vnder colour vow chaſtitie example chaunceth méete way théef ſayth vnto thou ſhalt goe ouer y• bridge except thou wilt deliuer thy purſe trueth may chooſe whether goe ouer bridge yet man doth violence cōpellyng mee either goe backe agayne el loſe purſe goe ouer doubt vowes haue vnlawfull condition bee obſerued kynges lawe condemne hym doyng violence alſo take théefe likewiſe pope doth wrong hée ſayth ſhall bée prieſt except firſt vow chaſtitie ſay condition vnlawfull wrongfully done bynde thyng vnder condition god hath left frée moreouer chriſt require condition hys prieſts wherfore muſt néedes folow thyng neceſſitie belongeth prieſthode alſo hierome approoueth hi • 37 cap legan • doctrine mine ſaying let biſhops prieſtes read thyng hée ſpeaketh agaynſt miſpendyng goodes offered helpe poore men doth teach child prophane letter maketh read commedies ſing baudy ſonges ieſters theſe child finde charge church c obſerue y• hierom ſpeaketh byſhops prieſts child whiche could haue vnmaryed bée ſuppoſed hie • ome ſpeaketh baſtardes whore child hée would haue vſed wordes good reader cleare doctrine holy doctours lawful prieſtes haue wiues ſpecially lyue ſole goe farther ſée holy councels hath ordeined cauſe trueth y• deuill hath long tyme harped ſtryng ſorbyd prieſtes matrimony deuotion hée virginitie hée knew well men could kéepe farther theyr gift alonely hée might lay ſnare men ſoules alſo bryng holy inſtitution ordinaunce god contempt deſpiſing god hath alwayes hys infinite mercy ſtyrred vp ſome good man reſiſte hym doe read authenticall ſtoryes coū cell nicene certeine men went haue pri • ated prieſtes wyues almighty god dyd l • woordes ſtoryes bée theſe councell nicene holy councell willyng reforme lyfe men dyd ſet certayne lawes call canones among whiche certayne ex tripertita hiſtoria▪ diſt xxxi ca nicena men would haue lawe hée brought byſhops prieſts deacon subdeacon ſhould lye wyues maryed theyr conſecratiō paphnutius confeſſour dyd withſtand ſayd theyr mariage honorable pure chaſtitie thē lye theyr wyues coūcell perſuaded make ſuch law affirmyng bée greuous occaſion vnto alſo vnto wyues fornication thyng dyd paphnutius though hée hym ſelfe vnmaryed councell dyd alowe ſentence nothyng decréed cōcernyng thyng euery man left vnto hys freewill bounde neceſſitie c bée noted holy coūcell dyd recken vnpure▪ filthye thyng byſhop councell nicen • dyd thinke vnmeete thing byſhop haue wife prieſt cōpany wyfe doe graūt pure cleane chaſtitie prieſt company wife clearely agaynſt y• pope hée ſayth fleſhly carnall handes bée defiled made vnworthy thereby handle bleſſed sacramentes bee ſayd theſe mē wyues theyr conſecration whiche thyng alſo graunt maryed man may bée choſen byſhop alſo kéepe wife afterward hée may marry hys cōſecration wyfe aunſwere lawfull ſolution thus ſay bée lawfull mā kéepe wyfe prieſthode ſhall bée lawfull hym take wyfe hys cōſecration thyng hys matrimony made hys conſecration matrimony hys conſecration cauſe dyd hée take wyfe hys conſecration hée dyd auoyde fornication hée much bound take wyfe becommeth hym great deale worſe lyue fornication hys conſecratiō hée dyd theſe mē maketh lighte ſolution doe hādle matter truely god meanyng maryed men ſhould either bée byſhops prieſtes let ſhew pop • ſuffer maryed mē ſhal • e choſen byſhops chronicle euer maryed man choſen bée byſhop▪ ſince made lawes prieſtes ſhould haue wyues wil beléeue alonely ſéeke e • aſion defende matter dare ſay man ſhould goe aboute chuſe maried man bée byſhop el perſon would thinke hée mad ſo much ſome hath ſayd mariage ſo vnlawfull di • xx • ca •… • pieſtes haue fayned y• • olye apoſtles forſake wiues election ſtā deth theſe two togeathers maryed men may bée biſhops feare maryed men may byſhops ſecond brother ſhall longer bee beggers byſhoprickes ſoone bée gotten handes moſt parte alſo benefice wherefore woulde counſell rather graunt prieſtes myght haue wiues maried men bée made byſhops furthermore marke holy counſell made lawe whether y• prieſt ſhould marry conſe • ration wherefore muſt néedes bée taken away frée indifferēt thing prieſt marry cōſecratiō reckened vnlawfull hym marry would haue forbidden counſell gathered reforme thoſe thinges y• •… ſſe text ſaith clearely moreouer chaunced prieſt haue maried conſecration hee offended lawe day forbyd hym therefore neceſſary artycle men bée content theſe auctorities yet ſomewhat ſatiſfye bringe lawe papiſtes calleth canon apoſtolorum wordes bée canon apoſt theſe man doth teach prieſt y• reaſon order ought forſake wyfe curſed bée hée c marke lawe colour holines mā ought forſake wyues wherefore muſt néedes folowe prieſts marry wiues conſecration againſt holynes note alſo text ſayth prieſts wiues owne went borowing doe reade counſell conſilium gangrens canon 4 gangrens made decrée man doth iudge condemne prieſt maried hée may reaſon mariage doe ſacrifyce abſtayne maſſe reaſon thereof curſed bée hée c fyrſt ſhall know occaſion wherfore counſell gathered certayne heretyke called euſtachius dyd among euſtachius hereticus hereſyes teach mari • man could ſaued alſo taught prieſts dyd marry ought bée deſpiſed wiſe handle bleſſed ſacramentes againſt heretick decrée made let euery mā iudge diuerſitie betwéene heretyke pope doctrine heretyke ſayth mariage vnpure vncleane maryed prieſt may touch ſacramentes ſelfe ſame doctrine ſayth pope diuers place eſpecially chapter y• beginneth wt nullum diſt 2 • hée ſayth byſhop ſhall pre ume conſecrate deacon except hée fyrſt vow chaſtitie man ought bée admitted ſayth hée ſerue aulter except chaſtitie bée fyrſt knowen alſo chapter hée ſayth diſt 28 〈◊〉 de • ernimus eyther kéepe whore el marry wiues ſhalbe priuated benefice vnworthy bée temple god touch holy veſſels church doth vſe ſelues ſuch vncleanenes ſayth hée condemning sauyng pope euſtachius matrymony bée hée cō pareth whordome matrymony bée like cleane neuer none heretyke pope goeth diſt 28 diſt▪ 28 c aſſumi pr • teria ſayth man may bée eyther prieſt deacon maryed except promiſe forſake wiues c theſe lawes make againſt ſay maryed men may bée prieſtes ſame dist 31 ca ſac • rdotib •• • piſcopi tenere co si laicus thyng doth pope alſo confyrme dyuers place lawe hauing none cauſe becauſe hée ſayth prieſtes muſt bée pure cleane ſame cauſe alſo euſtachius reckened pope doth maryage vnpure vncleane dyd therefore forbyd prieſts marry yea dayes dare ſay man forbiddeth prieſts marry reckē mariage vncleane let • goe farther ſée holy counſels haue decréed conſerning prieſtes matrimony doe reade counſell called ſyxt sinod theſe word 6 sinodus conſidering yt decréed amongeſt lawes made thē rome deacon prieſt ſhall company wiues therefore withſtanding decrée folowing yt rule apoſtles conſtitutions holy men wyll thys day forth maryage ſhal bée lawfull wyſe diſſoluyng matrimony betwéene wiues depriuing thē familiarity time conuenient whoſoeuer therfore ſhall bee founde able order coū cell doth fully eſtabliſh cōfirme mariage prieſts deacon subdeacon prieſthoode wée wyll ſuch men bée prohibited aſcende dignity aforeſayd cohabitation wyues bée conſtrained receite theyr order profeſſe chaſtitie abſtayne company lawfull wyues foloweth man preſume therfore agaynſt canon apoſtles depriue prieſtes deacon copulation felowſhip theyr lawfull wyues let ſuch man bée depoſed semblably prieſts deacon putteth away wyues vnder colour holynes let bée excommunicated continue ſame let bée depoſed note thys counſell doth condemne name pope decrée hath commaunded ſpirituall men forſake wyues thys alſo bée obſerued euaſion papiſtes ſay marryed mē may prieſts falſe lye pope dyd neuer admit counſell witneſſeth alonely driuen narrow exigent yt violence argumentes haue none euaſion delude people wherefore bée compelled helpe themſelues ſuch lye playnely thys counſell declared pope haue prohibited thoſe prieſtes yt marryed cōpany wyues would admit myniſter béefore forſaken wiues farthermore note thys counſell doth alleadge pope doctrine condemned councell rule holy apoſtles cō ſtitutions bleſſed men chriſten man wyll nowe ſet hym ſelfe agaynſt thys holy counſell hath ſo good auctoritie afterwarde bée marked counſell doth commaunde man ſhall vowe chaſtitie whē hée ſhall bée conſecrated thing clearely agaynſt pope cō pelleth hys prieſtes vowe chaſtitie béefore bée ſacred let euery chriſten mā iudge whether bée better ſurer follow pope hauing none auctoritie hym béeyng alſo one mā follow thys holy counſel hauyng auctoritie holy apoſtles bleſſed men finally marke bleſſed counſell doth depoſe thoſe doth priuate prieſtes companye lawfull wyfe doth follow pope hys adherentes bée ipſo iur • depoſed •… errour bée excōmunicated wherfore conclude counſell prieſtes may lawfully haue wiues wée haue alſo euen theſe wordes open neither diſt xxviij c diaconi deacon ſubdeacons ought bée forbidden maryage c thys bée playne tell diſt xxviij ca de siracuſ playne wherfore gracianus concludeth whether hée bée prieſt deacon ſubdeacon hée may lawfully vſe matrimony men bée content wyth theſe ſayinges tell ſatiſfie reaſonable men ought fight agaynſt god man yet let v goe farther ſée pope lawe ſayth innocent thirde writeth de vita honeſt cloricorum decretalles thys maner thoſe prieſtes maner countrey hath forſaken coniunctiō maryage doe breake wedlocke ought greuouſly bée puniſhed ſéeyng may vſe lawfully matrimony marke maner certayne countryes prieſtes might mary therefore muſt néedes follow prieſtes matrimony forbidden god lawe bée forbidden • p god lawe charitie pope compell mē ſo violently vnto thyng yt god hath bounde thē cruell thyng pope burne man hereticke becauſe hée kéepeth commanndement lyueth open whoredome doth hée commaunde hym well neyther hunger yet thyrſt hée eyther hunger thyrſt doth hée forbid hym eate drinke much power vowe chaſtitie kéepe wée haue gift god vowe wée wyll neyther hunger thyrſt inclination nature implanted god cicero ſayth alſo emperour hys lawe cicero lib officiorū iustinianus lib cap ius naturale wée naturally inclined vnto coniunction matrimony cauſe propagation much handes neyther hunger thyrſt chaunge naturall inclination wée implanted nature marry god gift doe chaūge nature wée hungry thirſty cā abſtayne eatyng drinking wée kéepe chaſtitie notwythſtanding vowe god haue geuen v gyft mē may pleaſe ſomthyng thēſelues ſtand theyr owne conſeyte ſay inuent many remedy kéepe chaſtitie dare ſay woulde clothes belongeth backes purenes cleannes harte writtē great letter ſet vp yt church dore wherfore woulde deſire mē bée contented ſet aſide hipocriſie ſpeake trueth written theyr harte god wyll bée deceaued yet mocked doubtles coulde ſhewe infinite example prieſtes neyther doe yet cā kéepe theyr chaſtitie mē myght well blame mée mouyng thys article ſéeyng theyr lyuyng doth teſtifie doctrine yt great offence ſclaunder chriſtes holy church alſo great rebuke ſhame many good man childe yea finally dampnation many deare ſoule mée thynke men ought bée contēt thāke mée takyng ſo great labour deliueraunce theyr ſoules alſo mayntenaūce honeſty good morall vertue according god lawe man lawe let v procéede farther magiſter sē tentiaru • lib ij dist 〈◊〉 prooue thys matter maiſter ſentēces wryteth thys maner weakenes prone fall filthynes helped wyth honeſt maryage thyng vnto whole men offēce vnto ſicke mē remedy marke sentence ſayth wée ready fall filthynes maryage honeſt remedy men theyr owne learning condemne mariage honeſt thyng ſéeyng theyr owne clarkes cauleth honeſt moreouer mayſter sentēces perfect vnperfect may vſe honeſt thyng firſt offēce neceſſary remedy ieſus woulde men cry agaynſt v poore men halfe ſo much againſt v wée haue agaynſt lorde ſende hys grace moliſie theyr harte amen haue alſo pope law ext de 〈◊〉 preſ cap ad preſentiam ʋen • ēs propoſuit 〈◊〉 tranſmiſſa title de filijs presbyterorum bée many chapter written byſhops englande concernyng prieſtes child wherfore hée ſuppoſed prieſts wyues thē may authoritie prieſts compelled haue prieſtes nowe article theyr fayth yet wil bée ſayd pope law ſpeaketh baſtardes lawfull child mée thynketh ſame charitably aunſwered doe accuſe fornication many honeſt prieſt agaynſt haue alonely light ſuppoſition made aunſwere knew thoſe men yet theyr lyuyng text ſpeaketh prieſtes child baſtardes farthermore ſolution 〈…〉 〈…〉 de 〈◊〉 holy 〈◊〉 doe graunt thē 〈…〉 baſtardes many honeſt man defamed • ée baſta • whiche euill name thinke vncharitably layd theſe men vnto charge wherefore note theſe men doth ſore defame prieſthode agaynſt order charitie rather graunt theſe prieſtes law ſpeaketh ſmall nōber bée breaker theyr vow bée open whoremaiſters yea alſo theyr child bée baſtardes rather would graūt thoſe prieſtes lawfull wyues neither agaynſt honeſty yet order prieſthode wherfore ſhoulde thus haue defamed prieſtes theyr child men would • ore haue beene greued yea afrayde ſome men bée diſpleaſed alonely bycauſe doe write agaynſt thoſe prieſtes whō know ſurety bée naught hauyng child teſtifie ſay yt pope law ſame place whoſe wordes bée theſe thou doeſt aſke v ſaith extra lib de fi •… preſbyterum c ad 〈◊〉 pope byſhop caſſell whether theſe men hath prieſtes theyr father may bée promoted holy order hée good honeſt de •… well learned aunſwere ſayth pope bée gottē lawfull marriage bée none canonicall impediment may lawfully bée promoted vnto holy order may enioy ſame benefice father c mā cā deny yt law ſpeaketh prieſtes child yt gotten lawfull matrimony wherfore muſt néedes follow yt prieſtes maryed yea lawe calleth theyr marriage lawfull muſt alſo bée noted ſo yt men may ſée doctrine myne new thyng elder theyr law alſo ſame title pope ſayth haue vnderſtanded n borne gotten prieſthode ibidem cap litteras lawfull wife hath alwayes affection ſerue god office ſpirituall man c note pope ſpeaketh prieſtes child yea gotten lawfull marriage fornication wherfore pope ſuppoſeth prieſtes may haue lawfull matrimony therfore mee thinketh men finde law mention made prieſtes child ſhould rather ſuppoſe bée gotten matrimony fornicatiō honeſty father mother alſo childe ſpecially ſéeyng yt prieſtes wyues thoſe dayes ſtādeth alſo honeſty prieſthode graunt wyues rather whore let v ſée emperours imperator conſtan lege omnis • ad perangariam codice de epiſ ele lawe ſayth prieſtes wyues ſayth hée maner ſpirituall men ſhal haue prerogatiue theyr wyues child ſeruauntes ſay male female ſhall bée frée homage whiche called perāgariam bée noted emperour doth alonely admit prieſtes matrimony alſo hée honoreth priuilege prerogatiue whiche hée would haue done hée iudged matrimony vnlawfull wherefore men may ſée indifferent forefather hath béene vnto holy ſtate matrimony wold become v euill learned better iudge theſe thyngs god maker hath inſtituted ſanctified good reader haue prooued article god holy word ſayinges doctours authoritie councels ſome certaine lawes emperiall popiſh wherfore wil goe farther vnto hyſtories prooue thing example practiſe holy mē firſt haue ſhe example bleſſed peter doubtles wyfe may bée prooued mathew ſayth quod ſocrus petri math 8 tenebatur magnis febribus peter wyues mother gret agew peter wife text clere thyng ſhould forbyd prieſts mariage thinke boūde peter wife chaſtitie peter helpe ſay hée forſoke wife calling scripture ſpeaketh peter wyues mother doe well take hys wyues mother name awaye take away hys wife haue aunſwered reaſon largely inough alſo philippe euangeliſt thrée daughter whiche hée could actes 11 haue bad hée philip euangeliſt marryed wyfe thinke good mā reckē bée baſtardes whore child neither helpe ſaye theſe child borne hys electiō ſimple ſaying probatiō inough ſay ſéeyng men haue ſo neceſſary article men muſt alſo prooue open scripture el may ſaye good authoritie theſe daughter borne hys election mē ſay borne hys election haue better ſuppoſition texte haue called philip daughter alonely philippe euangeliſt daughter wherfore may good reaſon ſay philippes daughter may ſay father none euangeliſt doe read tripertita hiſtoria theſe wordes prieſtes orientall ex tripertita hiſtoria lib 9 cap xxxviij church doth abſtayne frée neceſſitie frō wyues many tyme whē bée byſhops haue lawful wiues chlidrē note hiſtory declareth clearely prieſtes orientall church compelled vowe chaſtitie secondarily yt hiſtory cauleth prieſtes wiues lawfull wiues alſo byſhops childrē conſecration doth learned men know orientall church receiueth maners nerer apoſtles wherefore bée preſuppoſed theſe men tooke cuſtome marryage holy apoſtels leaſt wiſe muſt followe prieſtes may haue wiues lawfully prieſtes may haue alſo god hath layde none burthen prieſtes neckes thē hée moreouer doe reade eccleſiaſtica li iiij ca xxiij hiſtoria penitus byſhop citie called gnoſeos would haue made decrée yt prieſtes ſhould haue penitus dioniſius vowed chaſtitie dioniſius byſhop chorinth wrote agaynſt hym required hym hée would lay neceſſitie compulſed chaſtity men neckes penitus folowed counſell may ſée yt deuell hath béene long tyme aboute bring ſnare prieſts god hath reſiſted hym haue alſo ſame hiſtorye li▪ iij ca xxx agaynſt thoſe men deſpiſe mariage goodly ſaying reproue apoſtles peter philip wiues alſo geue daughter mariage ſo much peter crye vnto playne place prooue peter wife wyfe ſhée ſhould bée led vnto paſſion called name ſayde vnto oh deare wyfe remember lord heare cleare péeter wife heare alſo againſt ſayth yt peter forſoke wife proued falſe lye moreouer spiridon byſhop ibi li x c • v cipres hauing gift prophecye alſo daughter whoſe name called irenem faithfull ſeruice dyed vergin heare cleare yt holy man daughter hée could haue hée wife farthermore eccle hiſt li v cap xxiiij reade policrates byſhop epheſum doth ſhew ſeuen parentes lynially biſhops order hym hée hym ſelfe eyght coulde bée father ſeuenth policrates epheſ epiſ degrée could haue béene byſhops biſhops wiues text cleare father kynſmen mée thinke cleare example ſufficient proue great matter men would bée content ſatiſfied reaſon ¶ ex damaſo papa ad hieronimum ex platina nauclero bvt let v goe farther ſée many pope haue béene prieſtes child matter may bée opened pope ſelues may witnes doctrine fyrſt siluerius pope byſhop father called siluerius papa ormiſda siluerius lyued yeare lord 524 pope felix third name felix iij yt ſonne felix prieſt rome man lyued yeare lord 474 pope deus dedit ſonne deus dedit stephane ſubdeacon lyued yeare lord 623 pope theodorus ſonne theodorus theodore byſhop hieruſalem man lyued yeare lord 634 hadrian yt ſecōd gordianus hée lyued year lord 534 pope siluerius father called siluerius siluerius byſhop rome man liued yeare lord 544 pope boniface fyrſt yt name bonifacius ſonne iucundus prieſt pope oſius yt ſonne stephan ſubdeacon oſius pope gelaſius fyrſt byſhop father called valenus anno gelaſius domini 484 iohn x pope yt name ſonne pope surgius yere iohannes x lord 924 theſe great many pope lawe teſtifieth diſt •… i▪ ca oſius child ſubdeacons deacon prieſtes haue borne rule church rome wherefore meruayle fore men doe recken ſo new learning prieſts ſhould haue wiues ſéeing ſtandeth god holy word ſaying olde doctours determination counſels yt emperours lawe alſo yt pope olde decrées moreouer chriſtes holy apoſtels many holy men ſince dayes haue liued holy eſtate matrymony finally hath many holy men alſo holy woman borne wedlocke prieſtes reaſō wil mē damne theſe thynges bée ſo great auctoritie men wyll heare neyther god mā yet good reaſon néede men ſo much ſpeake learning ſéeing wyll heare nothyng alonely iudge good truely great high minde mē thus wrongfully condemne men heretikes hauyng ſo good learnyng yet themſelues grounded onely owne ſenſuall mynde hauyng learnyng reaſon wyll put matter god iudgement let men doubt béeléeue god god wyll bée reuenger ſuch wrongfull violence men doe vſe thys caſe agaynſt hym agaynſt bleſſed company saintes yet doe men pleaſure myght bée perſwaded poſſible declare vnto yt wée doe finde old monument teſtifiyng clearely prieſts peaceable poſſeſſiō matrimony childrē gottē ſame matrimony admitted ſpiritual benefice tyme pope alexander yt thirde controuerſie patronage benefice betwéene pryor plimptō deuenſhyre one iohn de ʋalletorda deputed iudges rychard archbyſhop caunterbury roger byſhop wyncheſter béefore whome pryor plympton prooued patronage reaſon hée poſſeſſion géeuen vnto diuers perſons fyrſt hée ſayth prieſt plymptō called alpheghe yt gyft pryor plympton benefice sutton called plymmouth alpheghe ſonne cauled sadda alſo benefice hys father sadda prieſt cauled alnodus benefice likewyſe alnodus ſonne called robert dunpruſt diſceaſe father alnode alſo ſame benefice thys robert dunpru • william bacon hys ſonne enioyed benefice lykewyſe men may ſee neyther ſo new learnyng yet ſo long agoe ſince prieſtes lawful wyues moreouer reade owne chronicle tyme kyng croni▪ fa • henry iij raygned yt yeare lord 1101 prieſtes myght lawfully marry wiues ſo much yt anſeline archbyſhop caunterbury seane hée helde london make decrée yt prieſtes ſhould forſake wiues agaynſt god lawe man texte mayſter chriſt cleare quos deus coniunxit homo non ſeperet marke theſe two wordes deus homo howe much one paſſeth farthermore pope hymſelfe hath greatly regarded prieſtes chaſtitie hée myght get money diſpenſations thyng hée coulde haue diſpēſed béene god lawe bée man lawe charitie pope compell men ſo ſore kéepe ſéeyng ſo great daū ger vnto prieſtes ſo many ſoules béene loſt thorough yea tyranny hym thus cruelly kill men breakyng alonely hys commaundement power kéepe purpoſe pope hath often tymes diſpenſed wyth prieſtes religious men vowe hath géeuen licence marry vnknowen many men abbot sā • te readyng abbot reading men perfecte lyuinge called abbot sancte man béeyng daunger certayne diſeaſe prieſtes hath maryed prieſthode reaſon hée wyfe ſente vnto pope deſiring hym diſpenſe wyth hym hys vowe yt pope diſpenſed wyth hym gaue hym licence marry wyfe vnder condition ſhoulde bée ſecretly done facie eccleſie men may ſée pope himſelf holdeth ſo much prieſts chaſtitie hée woulde regarde money pope may diſpence wyth thys abbot auoyding diſeaſe corporall much ought hée diſpenſe prieſtes ſéeing bée ſo many ſoules daunger yea alſo order prieſthoode ſore defamed ſclaundered reaſō prieſtes hath wyues moreouer wée doe reade n •… generatione xl pope celeſtine third diſpenſe nunne whoſe name cauled conſtatia kyng rogers daughter cecyll gaue licence cranſius canutus ſeuen yeares monke ¶ iuniacenſis yet pope diſpenſeth hym marry wife marry henry yt emperour ſixt name yt yeare lorde 1186 mē may perceaue pope doth greatly regarde vowe hys ſpiritualtie thing may bée gotten pay diſpenſation wil helpe ſay pope diſpenſe woman common wealth ſtories maketh mention pope diſpēſed vnder cōdition hée ſhould paye hym yearely pencion kyngdome cecyll ſhould recouer owne charge handes tancredus poſſeſſion béecauſe hée myght haue better title kyngdome hée gaue hym onely daughter cecill yt pope common wealth owne lucre graunt for▪ common wealth therefore firſt god commaundemēt prieſtes ſhould liue ſole god word géeueth place common wealth y• pope diſpence cōmō wealth doth hée diſpence auoyding fornication ſo many innumerable prieſtes doth mē recken common wealth expell fornication occaſions therevnto commō wealth bée regarded béecauſe ſhyning golde offered yt mariage prieſtes neither agaynſt god lawe man lawe leaſt wayes mée thinketh prieſtes marry bée farre hereſie neyther agaynſt god lawe yet agaynſt common wealth many example bée brought pope hath diſpenſed monkes frier nunnes paſſe ouer ſhe neare chronicle lōg▪ pope hath gone bryng vow chaſtitie doctour eckius doth ſay calixtus primus dyd firſte make ſtatute prieſtes ſhould vow chaſtitie b • falſe chronicle beareth witneſſe prieſtes wyues councell nicene almoſt hundreth yeares calixtus dayes wherfore bée ſuppoſed yt ſtatute made béefore councell nicene authenticall hyſtories doth make mention nicholas firſt whiche nicholaus 1 byſhop rome yeare lord 860 goe thyng hée could bryng paſſe reaſon holy man huldericke epiſcopus auguſtenſis wrote ſharpe epiſtle agaynſt hym reproouyng hym ſore bycauſe hée would compell prieſtes vow chaſtitie hys woords bée theſe thou haſt ſwarued litle diſcretion yt thou oughteſt haue counſayled prieſtes chaſtitie thou haſt lordly violence compelled iudgement wiſe men compelled chaſtitie againſt inſtitution goſpell great violence whē thou agaynſt inſtitution goſpell agaynſt ye decrée holy ghoſt wilt compell men obſerue thy priuate decrée c hée reciteth alſo agaynſt ye byſhop rome thoſe ſame ſcriptures haue brought herein booke matter al • certain counſels purpoſe haue brought men ought thinke firſt thus hath vnderſtande scripture yet firſt hath ſpoken agaynſt prieſtes vowes note alſo holy mā ſayth prieſts ought bée admonyſhed counſelled chaſtitie compelled ſayth hée great compel prieſtes vowe chaſtitie hath yt gifte halfe brother vnto hereſie violence agaynſt chriſtes holy goſpell yt bleſſed ſpirite god theſe bée vehement wordes haue ſpokē theſe woordes men may gather farre hereſie compell prieſtes vow chaſtitie holy man procéedeth farther yt biſhop rome telleth fact gregory went compell prieſtes vow chaſtitie vpon day gregory ſent vnto hys pondes fiſh nettes lamentable horrible ſight fiſhed withall brought vp aboue ſixe thouſand young childrens heades thyng gregory ſaw ſtroke hym ſore hart hée heauy ſight perceyued anone hys decrée hée made prieſter chaſtitie occaſion great murther prieſtes could lyue ſole yet durſt auow theyr child feare decrée ſo ſauegarde theyr honeſty fell fearefull abhominable ſinne kyll theyr child cauſe gregory ſayth holy byſhop dyd reuoke hys decrée agayn greattly lord god byſhoppes woulde nowe bee ſo charitable alow ſaying apoſtle ii better marry burne addyng vnto hys owne better marry geue occaſion murther note good reader terrible fearefully example piteous caſe ſo many thouſandes innocētes bée thus ſlayne ſhall chaſtitie keepyng prieſtes worlde bée occaſion ſo great goodnes law chaſtitie hath béene hereof miſchief ala pyty •… ēs harte nothyng moued whē read ſuch horrible factes holy men writyngs doe men thinke miſchief dayes done reaſon prieſts compelled chaſtitie men thinke come miſchiefe reaſon men recken auoyde god vengeaūce ſo ſtifly ſtrongly mayntayne ſame haue béene informed credible perſons whiche néede could yet bryng foorth place religion within fewe yeares religious man dyd frute chaſtitie get woman child whiche woman brought bed brother chamber fayre ſonne child chriſtened ſame chā ber ſoone chriſtened hée brake necke buryed night churcheyarde horrible tale trueth cā prooue terrible thyng dooth nature abhorre yet men rather abhominablenes thē releaſe litle theyr oh lorde god howe ſtreightly ſhalt thou puniſh yet yt minde mā ſinnes yt honeſt man loſt daughter reaſon prieſt defiled trabbe yt ſame tree bycauſe hée would bée diſhoneſted kylled mayde priuely afterwarde caſt well men bée moued ſuch lyke factes tell moue could recite great many abhominable deteſtable factes aſhamed tell prieſtes hath béene doe neither recite ſhamefully men daughter men wyues men ſeruauntes hath béene dayly caſt awaye the▪ reaſon prieſtes ſo hoate courage kéepe theyr chaſtitie would abhorre chriſten mā heare tell innumerable baudes made yt reaſon yt prieſts cā lyue chaſte petious caſe ſée ſo many young men caſt away th •… whiche doth ſée dayly maiſters vncleane liuyng many ſpeake litle prety • oyes folow prieſtes long doublets▪ ſhort hoſen thynges bée recited honeſty compelleth paſſe thē ouer thinke good man hée thinke much hym ſelfe either would ſay ſay could tell would occaſion yt thoſe cardinal rome kéepeth whore bée noted common people bée beſt ſort cardinal paſſe ouer neuertheles gréeueth mée lyttell may ſomewhat opē hart promyſe chaſtitie court rome frō whiche god defend v theſe proiectours fylthy chaſtitie doth take hand defende agaynſt mée bée aſhamed write • haue béene aſhamed doe kéepe ſecrete certayne byſhops england alſo country doth let whore ferme vnto prieſts béecauſe ſuffer marry yet heare tell one prety tale byſhop lyuyng ſame day germanye ſpare little ſpeake one word néede great ſome money could
