great ſomme money deſyring hym helpe hym alſo counſell man ſayde vnto hym hée would folow coū ſell hée would ſhortly helpe man intended declare holy father honeſtye mayntayned prieſtes chaſtitie byſhop glad graūted folowe counſell ſayde gentylman lord lordſhip ſhall geue ſtrayte commaundement prieſtes within dioceſe ſhall put away whore within two monethes vnder payne hereſye leaſt lordſhip ſhall ſend ij coūſellers bée knowen bée greately fauour handle prieſtes owne name take vp thys matter betwéene lordeſhip vnder condition prieſts ſhall graūt vnto certayne ſome money ſhall promiſe prieſtes yt bring paſſe lordſhip notwithſtāding ſtrait commaundement ſhall bée contented ſuffer liue haue done tymes paſt olde cuſtome church byſhop prety practiſe finde naughty concious byſhop contented counſell incontinent gaue yt commaundement afterward ſent two beſt frendes priuelye treate prieſtes name hée woulde bée knowen becauſe hée vowed chaſtitie thinke theſe two mē gather one byſhoppricke within yt ſpace ij moneths ʋerely • xx guyldens money byſhop receiued deuoutly thought againſt vowe chaſtitie ſhall men ſay theſe men conſcience ſticke burne poore prieſt maryeth wife yet receyue xx guyldens mayntayne open whoredome lord god thou knoweſt yet doubtles thou ſuffereſt béecauſe ſhould haue ſpace reſpite amende vnto god geue grace amen agayne purpoſe men may perceaue holy byſhop hulderyke agaynſt pope dyd alſo alowe doctrine declare gregorie repēt diſt 〈◊〉 ca ante trienium yt ſtatute yt hée made prieſts •… aſtitie wherefore conclude yet agayne god holy worde olde doctours holy counſelles emperours lawe olde decrées church practice holy apoſtels lyuing holy men god lawe man lawe nature reaſon doth alowe article myne wherefore truſt good reaſonable man withſtand mée caſe runneth greate voyce world lye mée haue maried wife cauſe men doth recken ſomething proue witte alſo ſtretch learning mayntain prieſtes myght haue wyues haue meruayle men aſhamed come lay thing charge trueth béefore god mā haue wife • neuer went marry thanke god grace haue noble prince bée germany beare mée witneſſe alſo many worſhipfull honeſt men yt doth knowe mée conuerſation haue alſo ryght worſhipfull man doctour lée kinges embaſſadour v ſeruauntes teſtifye mée bée honeſt men ſufficient greater cauſe finally alſo byſhop citie doe dwell moſt conuerſant heare alſo embaſſadours lubycke doth alſo know mée conuerſation doubt teſtifye mée farre lawe ſhall require yea dare boldly ſay yt myne aduerſaries haue ſo good teſtemony kéepe theyr vowe chaſtitie haue maryed done bringe mée defamation let god prouide neuertheles wyfe ſo great crime men make hath many noble prince good men wyues mē make article ſaluation mée prince barnes lyued ſole vnmaryed chriſten men haue deſerued thus bée taken men haue doe mée promiſe ſhall get good may come aunſwere wil bée able alwayes defend wyfe weare diſpoſed marry agaynſt thoſe kéepe whore let begin notwithſtandyng doe abſtayne wife béecauſe euell vncleane marry haue lawfull conſiderations let man doubt trueth wyfe would haue medled article becauſe men myght haue ſuſpected mée would haue defended article maintenaunce facte ſyde men ſhould think deſpiſed mariage thought vnlawfull prieſt marry much ſelfe doe marry therfore haue takē labour mée wryte meaning ſo much boldely béecauſe men haue cauſe ſuſpect mée ſpeake defende myne owne cauſe onely ſet veretye ſo god helpe mée amen goe pope lawe ſée tyme thys thyng begunne take ſtrength beene often time attempted alwayes repelled one good man tyll dayes saint gregory pope siricius made ſtatute prieſtes ſhould haue wyues tooke none effect diſt 82 ca plurimos hym came pelagius ſeconde hée commaunded thoſe prieſtes maryed wiues ſhould abſtayne wyues next hym came gregory hée thought ſtatute pelagius ſore men ſhould abſtaine wyues neither vowed chaſtitie yet vſed thē ſelues continencie therefore hée decréed byſhops ſhould conſecrate subdeacon except hée woulde firſt vowe chaſtitie thys openly pope lawe béegan thyng ſomthyng ſpringe diſt 31 ca ante trie • ium take effecte yet fully eſtablyſhed afterwarde gregory hymſelfe repented hym hulderike beareth witneſſe yt reaſon great murther thath hée ſawe come thereof wherefore remayned ſo ſtyll great whyle vnto commyng leo ix hée ſayth prieſtes may kéepe theyr diſt 31 ca omnino wyues may company wyth apoſtles ſayth hée dyd forſake company wyues alonely prouided meate clothe hym commeth innocentius ſecond regarding diſt 28 ca docerni 〈◊〉 god ordinaunce ioyneth prieſtes maryeth prieſtes kéepeth whore vnder one damnation theſe yet coulde bryng thys matter paſſe woulde many place prieſtes wyues tyll tyme gregory ſeuēth cauled nauclerus alber •• hirſucid •• ſis hildebrande man euill lyuyng chronicle teſtifieth alſo great nygromancer familyar deuill chronicle ſayth man poyſoned 4 5 pope hée myght come ſooner thys man ſay yeare lord 1074 beganneth prieſts cha •… get •… hand captaine • ce began attempte thys matter ſharpely germany prieſts quietly ſuffered haue wyues thys man ſent commaū dement vnto otto byſhop conſtā tinople commaundyng forbydde prieſtes yet maryed marry thoſe yt maried bée ſeparated wyues byſhop otto perceiuyng thys thyng pe •… 〈◊〉 gem quos deus cō • ūx •… homo nō ſeperet et nemo dimittat vxorē excepta fornicationis cauſ • bée deuilliſhe woulde exerciſe hys commaundement wherfore pope gregory curſed aſſoiled men obedience cited hym vnto rome hée gathered counſell hée made decrée prieſte ſhoulde afterwarde marry maryed béefore ſhoulde forſake wyues moreouer decréed man ſhould receaue holy order afterwarde except hée firſt ſweare lyue ſole theſe decrées prouulgated ouer italy prieſtes byſhops fraunce reſiſted decrée cā require better aūſwere theſe byſhops make wordes • god wordes ſayde counſel contrary god worde tooke prieſtes god nature graunted therefore yt pope ſayde hereticke auctour ofdamnable doctrine decree came god deuil alleaged ſaying mayſter chriſt • omnes math 9 capiunt verbum hoc alſo paule de virginitate prec • ptum non 1 cor 〈◊〉 habeo ſaide alſo pope woulde compell lyke lyke angel hée dyd opē wyndow vnto fornicatiō vncleannes wherfore made hym aunſwere rather forſake benefice wyues hée woulde deſpiſe maryed prieſtes ſhoulde hée goe prouide angel ſerue cure pope hath alwayes beene pope maner teachyng doctrine hee neuer nothing moued ſcriptures reaſons ſtill wrote yt byſhops ſtraite letter cōmaundyng threatning vnder payne curſing priuating byſhopprickes yt ſhould bring thing paſſe yt laſt moſt parte byſhoppes conſented feare laboured yt coulde perſwade prieſtes forſake wiues vowe chaſtitie long ere prieſts perſwaded yea ſome woulde neuer agrée thereunto long liued pope wrote alſo archbyſhop mentz cōmaunding primate germany compell maried prieſts forſake wiues cauſe vowe chaſtitie byſhop called conuocatiō hée declared pope pleaſure yt prieſtes reſiſted meruaylous earneſtly alleaging scripture reaſons counſels farre procéeded togither lyke haue béene greate tumulte prieſtes wyues tumulte byſhop beynge wyſe man conſideryng ſtiffe earneſt prieſtes •… ere deſired thē take halfe yeares deliberation exhorting agrée vnto thing wyth good vnto hée muſt el compell pope auctoritie halfe yeare come byſhops called conuocation ʋniuerſitie erforde required aunſwere prieſtes ſtiffer thē ſayde rather dye forſake wyues cō trary god law ſide deuill ſleepeth geueth gladly place chriſt archbiſhop earneſt ſetting forth pope commaundement prieſtes required take counſel ſo departed conuocation agreed ſéeyng neither ſcriptures reaſons counſels yet interceſſiō could • helpe ſayd would go agayne kyll byſhop byſhops hym ſhould bée well aduiſed ere ſet foorth thyng byſhop ſome frendes amōgſt reuelated thyng vnto hym hée ſtreight wayes ſent certaine frendes vnto yt prieſts requiryng come agayne peaceably hée would promiſe thē ſo entreate pope hée ſhould bée contēt let paſſe ſhould kéepe cure ſtill done notwithſtandyng archbyſhop could chaūge pope mynde wiſe yeare pope ſent downe hys legate curienſen epiſcopum ioyned byſhop mentz hym commaundyng gather conuocation mentz propounde decrée agayne yet yt prieſtes would wiſe agrée vnto layde scripture reaſōs could theſe thynges would helpe fell entreatie interceſſion pope legate ſhall men doe agaynſt violence tyranny ſo ſtiffe remedy tyranny violence bée vſed ſoone prieſtes ſawe gathered togither made tumulte pope legate ſcaped hardely lyues conuocation houſe ſo conuocation broken archbyſhop mentz would neuer medle committed matter pope diſcretion pope fayne tary conuenient tyme till hée gotten certaine byſhops certaine prieſtes partie determinate tyme doth yt ſtories declare alonely ſée nowe hée preuayled miſchief wherfore procéede promiſe recite scripture reaſōs wherby prooue celibatum sacerdotū firſt ſcripture bée ye holy holy diſt xxxii •… cap tenere ſayth lord ʋpon scripture diſputeth yt pope maner prieſtes old law company wyues tyme miniſtration wherefore prieſtes new law whiche doth solution reaſons alwayes miniſter muſt much alwayes kéepe chaſtitie firſt pope doth alleage scripture pope argument yt maintenaunce conſtrained chaſtitie wrong moyſes mynde text ſpoken compell men wiues marry thyng pope hath taken vpō hym prooue moyſes ſpeaketh whole houſhold iſraell houſe iſraell cōpelled text either forſake wyues el vowe chaſtitie wherfore text make pope purpoſe farthermore text ſayth ſhould bée cleane holy matrimony either vncleane vnholy thyng inſtituted ſanctified god pureſt creature adam eua euer god made dyd vſe therby defiled ergo text maketh pope purpoſe pope ſaith yt prieſts newe law ſhall bée cleane leuitirall cleannes lyeth much pope head graūt ſame deſire god harte may bée ſo béecauſe would ſhould bée ſo therfore doe exhorte vſe god holy ordinaunce may bée holy creature 1 tim 4 god bée good vnto bée cleane nothyng vncleane matrimony god ordinaūce▪ wherefore muſt néedes bée cleane ſelfe may bée lawfully vſed thankes farthermore argument pope prieſtes old law abſtayne frō wiues alwayes somtime tyme miniſtration ergo prieſtes muſt alwayes abſtayne foloweth alwayes old prieſtes ſometyme hath • ot prieſtes ſometyme wyues olde prieſtes thinketh pope ſhould rather take occaſiō place bynde hys prieſtes mariage lyue ſole prieſtes law god cōmaundement wiues ergo god would recken mariage vncleane vnpure cleane muſt much bée cleaner vnto prieſtes thynges bée cleaner vnto v wherfore thinketh yt pope ſhould rather diſpute maner prieſtes yt old law wyues thereby defiled ergo prieſtes muſt much rather haue wyues ſhall bée leſſe defiled moreouer foloweth prieſtes old law abſtained wyues tyme miniſtration ergo prieſtes muſt abſtayne alwayes bycauſe bée alwayes miniſtration many thinges vncleane prieſtes old law bée vncleane vnto prieſtes alſo vnto commaundement ſo doe el béene lawfull tary wyues prieſtes hath commaundement ergo bounde abſtayne finally text scripture dyd bynde apoſtles holy father apoſtles till innocentes tyme abſtayne theyr wyues ergo byndeth prieſtes god word full ſtrēgth innocentes dayes ſecond scripture abſtayne diſt 31 c • ▪ nam ſicut abſtinete ad tempus vt vacet orationi tyme ye may better geue attendaunce prayer texte diſputeth pope maner paule commaundeth ſayth hée laye men abſtayne tyme ergo much prieſtes bounde abſtayne alwayes whiche muſt alwayes pray bée continuall ſacrifiyng argument alſo falſe concluded saint paules mynde paule woulde text forbydde mariage reaſon prayer howe could hée ſaye abſtayne tyme ʋnmaryed men muſt abſtayne alwayes tyme onely commaundement vnto lay men pope ſayth abſtayne paule yt ſhall abſtayne except agréed yea alſo caſe yt abſtayning ſhould bée occaſyon prayer abſtayning may bée occaſyon vncleanenes el one party abſtayne bleſſed paule neyther ſhall defraude bounde thys caſe vſe felues offyce matrimonye pro illo loco tempore pray yt text clere ʋxori vir debitum reddat let men marke ſaying well though bée bound pray goſpell yet thynke cercumſtance tyme place man lawe reddere debitum caſe goſpell wherefore muſt geue place take wordes charitably learning yet graūt commaundement folowe prieſtes ſhall neuer marry becauſe lay men bound pope ſayth abſtaine tyme doth pope pope doctine repugnaunt doctrine paule rather bynde prieſtes tyme place requiſite matrimony auoyding fornication paule doth world knoweth yt prieſts doth alwayes pray wherefore doth pope graunt ſame lybertie yt paule doth w • leſt yt deuyll ſhould tēpt incontenency yt ſhould returne againe prayer yt office matrimony lorde god would men crye agaynſt mée ſhould thus pope tearer • nd wreſter scripture teare wringe ſcriptures popet may doe hée lyſta nd hée doth men doe recken bée article fayth ſtronger place ſcripture matrimony ſo much learned men euer ſpake matter hath brought ſame chapter paule yet yt deuill pope turne topſe turuy yt maketh agaynſt muſt néedes make hym el hée wring tyll hée breake necke learning prooue prieſts may marry béecauſe boūde pray doe ſacrifyce doth mariage defyle prayer cōtaminate ſacrifyces holy patriarch prophetes haue cleane ſacrifyces yea chriſtes apoſtles vncleane ſacrifices wonderfull iuglynge deuyll ſometime pope maketh hotchpot mariage matrymony ſhall bée holy bleſſed ſacramēt ſhal géeue grace ſhall bée againſt god ſacrifices defyler god myniſters prayer wherefore conclude texte paule abſtaine time may diligētly pray maketh nothing pope wée ſhould bée boūde yt pope ſaith marry reaſon lay men bounde prayer well prieſtes ought pray might lay man marry wife laye men much bounde goſpell prayer prieſtes bee tyme goſpell cōmaundeth prieſt pray yet prayer commaunded prieſtes yt goſpell lay men bonnd ſame wherefore pope conclude prieſtes ſhall haue wiues becauſe bound pray ſame reaſon prooue yt chriſtē man may haue wife help ſay prieſtes bound pray lay men therefore haue wyues whether bounde leſſe maketh matter yt argumēt party bounde prayer therefore pope doctrine neyther may marry whether one bounde maketh matter mée bounde therfore muſt abſtayne woulde deſyre papiſtes let reaſon myne ſtande ſtill vnaſſoyled reaſon pope dist xxxi ca omnino 1 cor 9 nunquid nō habemus poteſtatē muliere •… ſor • •… circunducēdi c leo ix bringefh text paule haue power leade aboute v wyfe brother lord cephas texte diſputeth pope thus paule ſayth haue power amplectendi mulierē embrace woman circunducendi 1 cor 9 leade v ſhée may bée ſuſtayned pope ſayth huſband may bée company maryage betwéene euery chriſtē man may ſée ſklē der argument pope paule ſayth amplectēdi ſed cercū ducendi ergo non licet ſacerdotious habere vxores man denye paules mening prieſts may lawfully haue wiues example peter doth prooue wherefore thinke man ſo madde iudge apoſtels dyd myrry wyues alonely lead thē pope ſayth put men coſtes charge office might haue woman neded marry leading woman wherefore muſt néedes follow ſéeing paules meaning prieſtes may lawfully haue wiues may alſo lawfully vſe office matrimony owne doctrine man hath power ouer owne body 1 cor 7 wife wherefore muſt followe pope maketh euell ſuppoſition hée ſuppoſeth apoſtles hadde wiues onely cary geue meate drinke company alſo marke argument pope graunteth apoſtles wyues wherefore muſt prooue apoſtles forſooke company wiues hée ſayth content take argument pope hand pope graunteth apoſtles ledde wyues aboute wyth wherfore muſt néedes follow euē pope prieſtes may alſo leade wiues aboute ye graunt content binde prieſtes amplectendi vxores put wiues diſcretion two cā agrée ſo cōtent alonely let haue libertie pope graunteth holy apoſtles haue doubt wyll many factes could recite amplectēdi folow token onely circumducendi amplectendi truely haue great maruayle yt men bée aſhamed thus trifle child bee gotten might beare witnes holy scripture yea matter bée ſo waighty wherby ſée dayly ſo great offence ſclaunder ſpring holy church god scripture pope hath diſt lxxxi •… c propoſu • ſti qui carne ſunt deo placer • non poſſunt fleſhe pleaſe god thys text diſputeth pope thus defiled fleſhe prieſtes marry wyues defiled therefore bée yt fleſhe pleaſe god men eyther feare god thier harte el reuerēce god holy inſtitutions ordinaunces would thus ſpeake iudge pure cleane matrimony truſt pope accompteth whoredom bee cleane holy matrimony chriſtē man bee graūt mée matrimony god ordayning ſettinge wherefore muſt néedes bée pure • cleane god god vncleanenes filthines let pope iudge hym hée wyll nowe pope argument pope ſayth hys minor prieſtes marry bée vncleane denye ſay ſtedfaſtly pope blaſphemeth god holy giftes whē hée prooue minor true graunt vnlawfull prieſtes marry wyll take pope argument pope blaſphemeth god prooue man ſhall haue wiues ſo ſhall worlde ſoone bée ende pope maior bée fleſh pleaſe god maryed mē pope thinketh lyue ye fleſh therefore maryed man bée ſaued let pope rome hys adherentes aunſwere argument ſoone aunſwere ſure ye ſcriptures bringeth maketh agaynſt matrimony yet againſt prieſts agaynſt lay men wherfore let hym conclude hée againſt prieſtes conclude ſame agaynſt laye men theſe bée scripture finde pope law againſt matter wherefore goe reaſons principall reaſon maryed men haue wiues may bee prieſtes prieſthode may marry men may bée choſē bee prieſts prieſthoode ſay may marry theſe mē muſt firſt conſider doctrine defend yt ſay intēde defēd ye pope doctrine yt doctrine call doctrine church none doctrine agaynſt v nowe doth doctrine clearely deterne agaynſt ſay diſt x • viij c nullum c aſſumi ca preterea c pr • uſquam mā hath wife may bée choſē bée prieſt deacō neither cā bring mée one exāple euer pope graunt maryed man myght bée prieſt excepte hée got money diſpenſing pope diſpenſation hath alwayes teſtified againſt law remember tyranny gregory vij compelled prieſtes forſake wiues maryed man bée prieſt wherfore theſe mē defende lawes church muſt bée bound prooue maryed men may lawes church call bée choſen elles aunſwere naught reaſon ſhould faine ſolution owne braynes ſay may bée ſo muſt prooue church doth graūt lawful ſo bée moreouer bée scripture whereby prooue prieſtes may marry defilyng company prieſt kéepeth hys mariage one prieſthode wife conſecration graunt pure cleane béefore conſecration hath conſecration made yt thyng vncleane yt pure wherfore hée may kéepe wyfe theſe men hée maryed conſecration may prieſt lykewiſe marry wife prieſthoode doth thys man concerning office matrimony mā doth farthermore wont ſay prieſtes might kéepe wiues ſo much fained yt apoſtles forſake wiues ſtādeth thys wyth ſolution maryed men myght bée biſhops mée thinke doe trifle matter ſéeke light euaſion helpe tyme moreouer practiſe lawes church declareth clearly meaning chuſe maried man bée byſhop cuſtome man may bée subdeacon 16 yeares olde man cuſtomably maryed ſo younge hée ſhall ſubdeacon diſt xxvi •… cap null •… hée muſt forſweare mariage pope lawe commaundeth therefore muſt néedes folow maryed man bée prieſt hée hath forſworne maryage many yeares moreouer doctours doe graunt fall adam matrimony remedye againſt fornication paule approoueth ſame vnuſquiſ que ſuam habeat vxorē propter fornicationē man conſecration ieopardie fornication hée béefore remedy men finde nowe infirmitie conſecration taketh away naturall appetite maketh god remedy vnlawfull eyther hée muſt lyue fornication elles marry wife let men iudge becommeth prieſt beſt conſecration farthermore man denye hyſtories make mention diuerſe prieſts haue béene maryed conſecration diſpenſation pope wherfore muſt folow agaynſt god law prieſt marry conſecration pope might diſpenſe men muſt graunt many prieſtes haue wyues ſtādeth good reaſon learnyng prooue yt theſe men dyd marry prieſthode onely ſéeyng wil haue ſo neceſſary ſo perfect ſolutiō cā prooue pope mainteineth conſtreined chaſtity agaynſt inſtitution chriſt doe affirme ſo ſtyfly moueth thē ſo ſay yea ſo boldly yet bée content let matter bée indifferently handled let many maryed men bée choſen bée byſhops bée vnmaryed ſéeyng graunt lawfull ſure yt ſhall auoyde great heape fornication béen vſed yea feare chaſte men ſhall ſoone bée quyt maryed men ſhall haue reaſon haue prieſtes may extinct brennyng prieſtes may get chaſtitie praying faſtyng heate thē faſtyng labouryng watchyng praying good workes doyng doe thus doubt god wil geue gift chaſtitie hée liberall geuing mercyful hearing prayer ergo néede marry firſt deſire know thoſe mē ſay cōſcience thyrd part prieſtes englād doe kéepe chaſtitie thinke rather ſweare nay thē yea notary london ſayd openly hee written thouſand diſpenſations prieſtes child dayes many haue notary writtē come argument ſée ſhamefully doe reprooue prieſts durſt ſpeake ſo much agaynſte theſe men doe firſt ſay prieſtes pray faſt like good workes thē god would yea hée muſt liberalitie mercy geue gift chaſtitie secondly graunt yt thyrd deale prieſtes kéepe vow much ſay thinketh firſte prieſtes bée naught déede secondarely neither yet deſire bée better deſire god hée would geue ſaye hym fault ergo fault prieſtes neither bée good déede yet praye deſire bée good would gladly haue ſuch patron cauſe moreouer graunt prieſtes prieſtes ſhall faſt pray helpe ſhall faſt pray kéepe bodyes lowe ſhal prieſts alſo marry auoyde fornication well faſt pray ſéeyng god hath ordeined matrimony peculiar ſingular remedy agaynſt fornication doe condemne true faſtyng praying doe condemne marying ſéeyng god ordeyned faſtyng praying hath alſo ordeyned marying yea thinke one thing ſhould bée firſt prooued ſhould mariage bée firſt prooued ſéeyng deputed god proper ſpedy remedy agaynſt fornication notwithſtanding bée content firſt exhorte prieſtes praying faſtyng ſo kéepe chaſtitie thanke god wiſe ſhall bée cōpelled either law vow chaſtitie agaynſt god word doctrine holy apoſtles yet let touch grounde nearer would deſire thē tell prooue vnto learnyng god bounde much god bound much hath promiſed hée liberall mercyful graunt vnto yt gift chaſtitie theyr praying faſting inough thus ſaye ſéeyng many good men hath prayed faſted yet gift chaſtitie muſt bryng open scripture wherin promiſe made vnto faſtyng watchyng elles muſt graunt bée bounde vſe god remedy hée hath ordeined inſtituted helpyng infirmitie hungry thurſty would goe praye god ſlake hunger thurſt would vſe thoſe meanes remedy god hath ordeined thinke god bound liberalitie graunt requeſt nay ſ •• th rather bée iudged tempter god deſpiſer holy ordinaunce would bée content thoſe remedy god hath appointed deuill commeth like tēptatiō math 4 chriſt requireth honour god doe miracle leape higheſt temple hée would bée taken ſonne god harme hée could haue none scripture pſal 90 teſtifieth ſaith hée god commaunded aūgels beare thée vp armes wherefore ſayth deuill ſhall bée great honour god alſo great declaration thy power thou deſcende frō height temple otherwiſe man doe thou goeſt downe ſteyers god ſhal deuill tempteth god bée glorified thy fact men thou ſhalt bée taken man thou art wouldeſt bée moreouer thou néedeſt doubt god helpe thée ſcripture ſpeaketh thée whiche bée falſe notwithſtandyng chriſt calleth temptyng god men ſéeke vnto hym remedyes hée hath appoynted therfore chriſt doth clearely declare ſame scripture deuill bryngeth maketh purpoſe though god doth promiſe helpe chriſt yet hée bée glorified creature ſhal vſe thankes entent purpoſe yt hée hath ordeined bée thing lacking vnto health ſaluation hée ſhal pray truſt hym boldenes cā deſyre god helpe mée concent receiue creature hée hath inſtituted helpe mée whereby ſhall god helpe mée diſpiſe ordinaūces creature hée hath alreadye ordeyned helping reaſon god inſtaunce ſhal make new ordinaūce god chaungeth order pleaſure new remedy diſeaſes content bée helped god hand thoſe remedyes bée ready inſtituted ſmall thynge vyle thyng maner chriſt deſcēd ſteyers heyghte temple ſéeyng deuill required hym god honour alſo owne ſhew ſome ſpeciall power weare diſeaſed ſycke would vſe counſell phiſicions medecines yt god hath inſtituted wil faſt pray watch doe almes déedes thynke men would recken mée wiſe thus dye deſpiſer god good ordinaunces god hath apoynted phiſicions geuen vertue hearbes creature help diſeaſe whèrefore bounde méekenes thankes receyue pray god yt hée fortifye ſtrengthē nature theſe creature may haue vertue effecacy chriſten man bound god hath ordeined euery thyng purpoſe thereunto muſt bee vſed reaſon theſe men ſhall haue ſtrength thē vſe mā ner creature remedy yt god hath ordeined agaynſt hunger thirſt heate could ague peſtilences pouertie neceſſitie ſwoordes gonne agaynſt maner diſeaſes againſt manner miſfortunes vſe nothing onely pray faſt el geue almes ſhall thinke beſt teach god thing beſt helpyng imperfection thanke good mayſters good doctrine praye god rewarde fynally haue great meruayle prayer faſtynge ſhall onely get prieſtes gift chaſtitie men prieſtes haue priuilege beefore men mē may haue gift chaſtitie prayer bée men moued lyue chaſte ſéeing yt chaſtitie déede higher ſtate matrimony bée prieſtes bounde pray gift chaſtetie chriſten men bée nowe marke doctrine lymme deuyl would come preach vniuerſally men ercellencye chaſtitie ſhew greate quiet lyuing pleſaūt ſtate god contrarywiſe mariage would fleſh would gladly haue quyet lyuyng pleaſaunt ſay weare ſorowfull ſtate full trouble full care full heanines pope ſayth fleſhely carnall ſtate ſéemeth haue ſelf vnclenenes theſe reaſōs perſwaſyons many moe hée might bring would exhort manner mē england lyue ſole vnmaried would alſo teach pray faſt gift chaſtity doute god liberalitie would géeue thē would fayne know learned men▪ man god frend king much hée god diſpute ſure could bée greater traytour kinges grace thē hée hée might bring paſſe hée intendeth doctrine fyrſt ſhould deſtroy yt kyngs ſucceſſion secondarily hée ſhould within ſeuen yeres make yt king lorde fewe ſubiectes none fynally none indéede would doe faſting praying thing ſo euer tell v faſting praying world continued would haue made v poore men beleeue gotten child wt faſtyng praying ſure fall getting childrē ſone men doe faſting praying ala thing deuill miſuſe let mā take mée though condemned faſting praying ſurely would ſhould bée vſed diligently would haue vſed tyme place convenient intent purpoſe god hath ordayned yet would remedy gyftes god ſhould bée thought vnlawfull alſo bée deſpiſed moſt gracious prince haue ſhewed vnto grace fyrſt myne obedience willyng euery man ſhould ſo learne ſo doe secōdarylye haue ſhewed learning certaine article yt variēce world day proteſting vnto grace haue ſayde nothing truſt bée true agreeable god holy worde learning doctours▪ notwithſtanding bée man within realme prooue good learning cōtrary ſo grace ſhall alowe agrée god word bée ſuffycient béefore god dreadfull iudgment ſhall bée content ſubmyt ſelfe grace determination doe thing béecō meth chriſten man true ſubiecte doe thus lord ieſu chriſt ye purchaſour grace goodnes euer preſerue grace al vertue honour amen againſt holy scripture honour image pray saintes men verye true faith chriſte ieſus béelongeth chriſtē mē haue article open ſelfe without farther probation men béeléeue firſt chriſt god omnipotent mighty géeue thinges secondarily hée mercifull gracious louing towarde v ſo louing wée coulde deſire nothing hym yt woulde géeue v men ſay thys fayth loue towarde chriſt would goe farther onely woulde make inuente deuiſe mediatours faithfully receaue hym according ye scripture onely mediatour sauiour redéemer beléeue knowe ſurely coulde aſke nothyng ſo great name ſhoulde receaue ſo hée woulde hym ſelfe géeue thereunto able alſo fayth ſhould perfectly know coulde bée ſo vnworthy hée onely méere mercy able alſo woulde make worthy receaue peticions ſo men faith ſhould perfectly know néede one chriſt ſhould ought ſéeke mediatour eyther obtayne thing el make worthy ſhould know confeſſe worde déede chriſt alonely able inough yea ſo mighty ſo mercifull fayned inuented mediatours men bée vile filthy abhominable themſelues bée compared fayth ſay printed harte mē ſhoulde could deſire one mediatour ieſus chriſt could haue could obtaine truely nothinge coulde righteouſly aſke scripture beare witnes nowe let theſe maker new god cumilate themſelues togither heape ſhewe mée one place yea one iot one example holy scripture euer men pray saintes one entered heauen saint prayer chriſt aſcended scripture chriſt aſcended heauen owne power bée plaine heauen hys owne power woulde knowe theſe new godmakers whoſe power helpe firſt sainte came heauen ſay interceſſion saintes ſay none heauen owne holynes dyed chriſt vayne hée came chriſt onely may hée alone helpe v thither power weakened mercy leſſe towarde v towarde ſée cauſes brought firſt sainte heauen theſe cauſes bée ſufficient yea alonely allowed scripture god therfore bée alſo ſufficient v wée béeléeue ſcriptures god declare make matter open recite word scripture firſt ſpeake image ſpeaketh moyſes exod 20 deut 5 theſe wordes thou ſhalt make thee grauen image ſimilitude thing heauen wee forbidden god make image aboue earth beneath water vnder earth thou ſhalt neither honour worſhip bée theſe wordes plaine againſt maner image ſimilitudes ſaints bée heauē earth vnder earth bée figure excepted either bée honoured wee muſt neither honour image worſhippe worſhipped marke hée excepteth honouring alſo worſhipping géeue image neither hohonour worſhip maketh matter mée whether call latria dulia bée eyther honour worſhip againſt scripture bée neither nothyng voyde name inuented inſaciable couetouſnes deceaue ſimple men heape innumerable good ſelues profite image haue deuotion ſhoulde bée ſoone lefte downe hath ſéene precious offerynge prieſt géeuen image wée ſée dayly yée robbe image men oblation let v returne purpoſe dun text ſaith dun 3 diſtin 9 forbydden make image béefore incarnation chriſt c muſt prooue bée allowed ſince incarnation ſhew manifeſt ſcriptures text condemned new teſtament el ſtādeth faſt agaynſt dun dare deny alſo yt prophet ſaith mā dyd plante pinaple tree eſay 44 raine nurriſh therof made fire vnto men hee toke warmed hym burnt baked bread therewith parte hee made hym god dyd honour prayd vnto ſaying deliuer thou art god marke proceſſe yt prophet firſt man planted trée thē hée burnt part baked bread part made hym god hée honoured worſhypped marke alſo theſe bée true fulfilled image one made god doe honour deſire bée deliuered ſome frō death ſome ſickenes ſome frō peſtilence ſome pouertie ſome théeues ſome frō euill fortune ſome frō hāging ſome frō drowning ſome ſaue tooth ake ſome ſaue horſe ſome pyges ſome helpe wéemen child many thynges ſo euery thyng deſire haue god aſke part made payre gallowes true playne thyng earth ſaying yt prophet bée verified image may verified hūdred thing yet alſo true vayne imaginatiōs men image vnto agréeth moſt peculiarly prophet ſpeaketh one onely thinges bée lyke deliuer god cā wil bée deliuered wt aunſwere doctour rydley make vnto mée man ſo blynde ſo mad fooliſhe honour ſtocke ſtone ſtandeth béefore referre honour thyng image doth repreſent aunſwere good maiſter doctour pray tell mée one thyng cicero whole senatours rome honour ſame thing ſtoode béefore thē yet ſay referre vnto thing thereby repreſented theſe men wiſe mē well learned tyme yet ſée lacke knowledge trueth honoured ſtockes ſtones ſure excuſe idolatry yea béecauſe honour ſtockes ſtones alonely honouring thing repreſented alſo dyd roboam hée dyd ſet vp two golden calues bethell 3 kyng 12 ſayd people go • hieruſalē behold thy godes iſraell done honour god ſo mad ye ſay thinke thoſe calues goddes honour honour god well declared ſacrifice whiche none ſuch god commaunded law ergo rule might law fully honour theſe calues referryng god alſo great collour old father alwayes offer god calues abrahā wt many oblatiō accepted god wherfore might well thinke god would bée honoured image calues thing lay whereby prooue honoured ſtocks ſtones calues thoſe ſame thinges ſhall alſo bée layde vnto vnto prooue doe likewiſe honour ſtocks ſtones firſt runne frō place place ſéeke tokē doe honour ſtocke ſtone haue nothynge sainte place ſauing onely ſtocke ſtone haue founde thē howe wee haue beene ignoraunce led worſhip ſtockes ſtones pray béefore knéelinges knocking ſhaking heades lookyng deuoutly pitiouſly kiſſe féete ſhoowes bée ſeldome barefooted leaſt ſhuld haue murre coaffe reaſon bée vſed coulde may ſée ſmooked ſcolions face handes féete place ſtande wipe napkyns rubbe bead licke tounges lay eye ſet lightes béefore offer though yt doctour perſon nothyng giltie great oblation ſo ſhine golde ſiluer precious ſtones yea thus content alſo promiſe viſite ſtocke yeare god good sainte ſende life health c pray honourynge ſtocke ſtone cicero romaine ſtockes ſtones roboam calues bée honouring define mée honouring exteriour honour deuiſe yet doe ſay yt honour ſtockes ſtones worldly ſhame inuincible scripture haue brought make damnable euaſion béecauſe ſée men waxe wyſe lorde ſée clearely falſe diſſimulation hypocriſie true honourers god bée ſecret hypocrite would make damnable euaſton ſtabliſh vphold maintaine idolatry yet ſuffer ſo much laye thynge bée done hath collour ſhadow holynes might bée occaſion idolatry béecauſe bée hypocrite vnſaciable belly god care ſo may deceaue ſimple people lead blynd ſhadowes therby fill offeryng box chéeſtes maintaine vnſaciable carnall appetite honour god bée ſaued poore brethrēs conſcience bée deceaued thinke inough ſay mā ſo mad ſo fooliſhe honour ſtockes ſtones yet ſuffer dayly béefore eye ſée ſo great exteriour honour geuen vnto toung expreſſe hart deuiſe yea béeleue ſubtile dun stockes ſtones papiſtes honour god geue vnto ſhall well prooue diffinition honour whiche called latria latria owne learnyng ought bée geuen god onely ſayth dun latria called exteriour honouryng bodely ſeruice c bée trewe followeth geue honour ſtockes ſtones onely pertayneth god doe exterior honour whether bée offering candels kiſſyng ſhowes thing make concluſion néede ſay doe idolatrye farthermore word latria wher deceaue ſymple people gréeke word auguſtine ſignſfyeth ſeruice cā denye geue ſtockes ſtones cōclude propoſytyon ſubtill doctour dunce diffinition pray haue leaſure thinketh doctourhed child iſraell wt hie prieſt aaron could haue made pope holy excuſe ſo mad ſo foolyſhe honour golden calfe rather refer honour ye lyuing god good colour knewe none god ſaint hym yet excuſe lawful could bée alowed whē moſes came word god marke alſo hée made calfe foole ignorāt perſon among people one none auctoritie moſt wiſeſt eloquenſt chiefe amonge yea hée tyme hed church congregation alſo note ye intent kéepe people togither good order hée alſo made calfe thing father pleaſed god ſacrifyce ſo might well thinke y• might bée acceptable god bée honoured image calfe image theſe colour bée naked béefore worde god brieflye would alowe people hym ſo long beléeue hym according holy ſcriptures conning artificyall grauer made god made mée haue ij thinges aboue caruers diſtinctions géeue ſtockes ſtones liuinge creature ſtockes bée deade created lyue euerlaſting god ſtockes bée made fyer ſure man wil alowe one merueilous wōder beſt moſt holy new god yea one doth myracles euery day taken hand ſet againe ye caruers maker houſe hée ſhould bée better thē ſtock ſtone could doe myracles yea hée prayed practiſe papiſtes cauſe image worke myracles neuer ſo much ſo much ye houſe fyer ſaue either ye houſe hym ſelfe alſo lawful ſo longe hée ſtādeth neyther pray yet offer offering would helpe poore man hys wyfe childrē ſeruaunts let ſuffer take wormye god handes agayne hée lord ouer world maketh hée rych men poore men maketh hée men blynde blynde ſee agayne maketh hée lame men whole maketh hée men childe yea alſo bringeth well bed expelleth hée deuils telleth hée thinges come ruleth hée heauen earth water brieflye hée defeneth king kingdome ſudden mutation béecauſe hée hath got hym new new place o▪ hypocrite thynke men bée ſo blynde y• hipocriſie papiſtes hath greatly preuailed practyſyng aduauncing idolatry cā ſée falſed would make blynde déede would make honour ſtockes ſtones yea name thing alſo know hath ſéen lady ſaint may lerne make ſimilitude haue nothing lay becauſe ſhée woman image much ye ſimilitude harlot ſtues bereth ſhape y• belongeth naturall woman wel lady notwithſtanding bleſſed lady vergin ſtrumpet yet exterior formes ſhapes may bée ſéene iudged ſenſes bée one yea image exterior ſignes great deale lyker vnto harlot pure bleſſed méeke virgin yet aſhamed wt theſe damnable ſhadowes priuate god honour alſo compell ſimple bretheren ſhamefull idolatry looke ſelfe ſée clearely idole pure mirour reade vj chapter baruch wherin ſhall fynde theſe wordes ſtockes poliſhed baruch 6 carpenter bee gilded ſiluered falſe notable declaration baruch prophet againſt idol idolatry cā ſpeake thinke haue image theſe property god haue golden crownes heades prieſts doth take away golde ſiluer ſpend themſelues geeue alſo vnto ſtrūpets decke harlotes whē haue takē away frō harlot thē deck god againe wherfore know bee god bée theſe thinges fulfilled doe take away oblation therwith maintayne pompe pride decke alſo harlotes ſay nay world condemne opē lyers matter ſo plaine god haue ſepter like mā like iudge land cā ſley hym offendeth thē wherefore feare doth agre god note bolde prophet dare crake god ſayth yt cā hurte enemy wherefore hée biddeth v ſhall feare think bée ſpoken god ſtanding none theſe thinges bée voyde goe cry remember crye aloude bée thicke hearing per aduenture gone forth toune occupied therefore ſay crye whoope aloud byd god haue honour y• auēge themſelues enemyes doe nothing thē lay vnto mocke profyt feare haue ſworde hande axe delyuer ſelues battel frō theeues therfore feare righteous mā better hath none image ſhall free frō obprobriouſnes thinke haue god theſe token many théeues haue hanged robbyng good god neuer ſaued thē ſelf frō théeues moreouer make ſo ſuer locke ſo ſure dores god bée able kéepe good thinke feare runnyng away farthermore kéepe ſo great bandogs god bée able ſaue god frō théeues mée thinketh bandogs bée mightier goddes alſo truſt defende goddes dumme ſtockes reaſon wit wiſdome policy godly faith ought haue god heauen aſhamed thus groſlye deceaue men yea wyth thoſe thynges neither defende ſcripture yet wyth reaſon paraduenture ſay prophet ſpeaketh idol image aunſwere pray call idolum much imago di • ferēce betweene idoll image latin wée call ingliſhe image wée varry name let v goe y• property haue image theſe property ye prophet layeth theſe thinges call idol cā ſay nay prooue contrary doth experience learne v bée one matter name géeue property thyng one moreouer prophet dauid doth define idole wyth theſe property firſt hath eye deſcription idoll image ſee hath noſe ſmell hath mouth ſpeake hath eares heare hath handes feele hath feete goe c theſe property hath idolles make prophet dauid maketh idolle ye thynge hath theſe property wyll make god helper thē pray offer runne place place ſéeke diſtinction ſubtiltie helpe reuerence ſeruice honour cultus dulie may doe image prophet woulde wée ſhould doe idol bée one property condition myracles defende bée illuſions deuill inuēted owne imagination cōtrary woorde god vnto greate blaſpheming omnipotent god heauen myracles bée neuer done god man prooue ſurety onely magnifiing declaratiō bleſſed woorde myracles may bée ſuſpected bée done deuill ſufferaunce god probation fayth ſpecially bée againſt open woorde god may bée prooued woordes moyſes ariſe deut 13 midſt thee prophet man ſaith haue ſeene viſion tell thee afore ſigne wōder thing hee tolde thee doe alſo come paſſe man ſay vnto thee let v goe follow ſtrainge god thou knoweſt let v ſerue thou ſhalt heare prophet dreamer wordes god doth prooue may bee open whether loue hym harte ſoule bée theſe woords open againſt manner myracles yea againſt prophetes whoſe prophecie true yet béecauſe hée drawe harte y• people vnto thing béeſide god therefore ſhall hée bée heard image bée excepted farthermore ſignifieth god haue harte ſoules god haue image haue part marke god doth prooue faith ſuch myracles ſo hée woulde neyther heauē hell sainte myracles prophet idolles image worke myracles hipocrites fayne bee worker myracles true falſe ſhoulde draw hart frō frō word alonely ſticke faſt wherfore lay idol cā firſt bée god ſecōdarily doe doe ſo much doe miracle tel thoſe thynges bée come yet helpe openly agaynſt woord god may heare farthermore agaynſt idol ſet braſen serpent whō written miracle ſo openly man cā deny yea worde god alſo ſtand many hundred yeares till people ſo much doe god offer inſēce oblation therto therfore deſtroyed withſtāding inſtituted god ſo bée none idolles wherfore miracle helpe among turkes bée miracle done thinke yet prooueth ſect bée lawfull tell miracle writtē law certeine tyme controuerſie betwéene prieſtes religious men ſhould haue oblation people prieſts layd beſt worthy béecauſe miniſters temple myracle done falſe god turkie kyng whiche thought haue geuen ſentēce prieſtes frier knew came kyng deſired hée would deferre ſentēce vij dayes ſée god would ſhewe night béefore kyng ſhould geue ſentence hée compelled nature goe preuy whē hée came ye preeuy brake hée fel hée cry ſpace houre til hée ſo wery hée coulde cry man could come pallace locked thē ſodē ly appeared vnto hym religious mā wt glorious light ſaying vnto hym bée y• thou woldeſt haue geuen ſentence wel worthy oblation helpe thée daūger mayſt thou ſée may doe god thée thy land kyng without paine hurt taken ye préeuy layd agayne bed hée wiſt day folowyng gaue hée ſentence religious men ſhould haue oblation thinke open miracle done ſtinking myracle kyng vnderſtādyng reaſon open matter hée préeuy préeuy broken hée true image leape worme eaten god yea haue burnt many poore mā ſpeakyng againſt theſe dumme idolles tell byſhops england vexe trouble man ſpeakyng doyng yea deſtroying true image god rather deſtroy ſelues ſhould bée vndeſtroyed let kynges bookes bée ſearched throughout realme liuely image man many haue byſhops burned theyr worme eaten image one ſhall bée ſmall number founde theſe image bée troubled vexed caſt priſon trifle yea vtterly vndone byſhops prieſtes yet wil bée yt honourers image yea honour god holy saintes againſt wiſedome yea agaynſt nature yet man may tell alſo ſame doctour clemens codē libro place thing ſo wicked ſo vnthākfull receaue benefyte god geue thankes vnto ſtockes ſtones wherfore wake vnderſtād health c thinke vnthankfull vnto god whō haue de • er • roli ca vlti receiued thing thanke worme eaten god farthermore auguſtine ſayth let v loue viſible ſpectakilles leſt erring veritie louing ſhadowes brought darknes let v haue deuocyon phanteſies better haue trew thing ſo euer māner thinges may fayned owne pleaſure c bée idol viſible ſpectakles bée thinges ſhadowes yet loue honour aunſwere saint auguſtine infydels haue lyuing god bring v hym dead ſtockes alſo super dani hierome knowen vnto kyng c property wordes marked ſayth worſhip thy god yet honour thy image neither come ſeruauntes god doe c haue neyther worſhipping honouring belōgeth image yt worſhiping ſaints hath greater ſhadowe holynes saintes ſayth papiſtes bee worſhypped pray v theſe dumme god haue primis ſay ſayntes muſt pray v bée mediator god v wée may bée able receiue petition richardes opynion de medium villa thing bée inuented yt craft deuyll may bée greater blaſphemye derogation chriſt bleſſed bloud saintes bée neceſſary bée mediatours v chriſt vnſufficient phyloſophers neuer put ij cauſes one ſufficient thing bée geuen v god ſayntes ſakes bée thinges geuē chriſtes ſake yt plainely againſt paules ſaying god v hath geuen ſonne ſhall geue ʋs rom 8 thing let euery chriſt en man iudge blaſphemy let v prooue chriſte onely mediator paule ſayth one mediatour god man mā chriſt god hath geuen v one mediatour ieſus chriſt appoynted saint bee mediatour ieſus hath geuen ſelfe redemption men marke hée ſayth one medyatour betwéen god man one ſayntes come moreouer ſayntes bée men therefore muſt haue mediatour ſelues mediatours men farthermore mediatour betweene god man named ieſus saint ſo named mediator god man cauled chriſt ieſus ſaynt hath name bée none hath name none vſurpe office without blaſpheming chriſt farthermore hée hath redéemed v onely without helpe ſaints ſhal hée bée onely mediatour without ſaintes redemptiō chief acte mediatour alſo holy ghoſt ſayth ſhall bee called emanuell much ſay god v eſay 7 god v hée v one man god chriſt euer v cote backe nav hée wayes v redéeme v ſaue v kéepe v defend v euell yea v hée ſyde holdeth v hée ſpeaketh v hée excuſeth v hée maketh cauſe good briefly hée obtayneth thinges v ſaynct ſpoken doe ſayntes v alſo iohn ſayth mā doe ſinne 1 iohn 2 haue aduocate father chriſt ieſus hée aduocate father bée none aſſigned chriſt ieſus hym haue onely remiſſion ſynnes ſhall saintes obtaine saintes cā obteine nothyng v v ſhall deſire v ſinnes bée remitted hath father heauen diſpleaſure agaynſt v ſhall pray v alſo paule ſayth ſpirite god maketh interceſsion mightyly v mighty deſires cā bee expreſſed toung marke ſpirite god deſireth prayeth v man ſhould recken néede mediatours hée ſayth hée prayeth mightyly v great feruēcie bée expreſſed hée able obtaine thing v hath taken office v doubtles great rebuke saintes ſhould bée ſet ſteade ioined wt office though hée vnſufficient thinke doe ſaints great honour make godes ſet thē chriſts ſteade doe great diſhonour diſpleaſure bée saintes god yea chriſtes helpe owne alſo paule faith chriſt ſitteth rom 8 right hād father whiche doth alſo praye v marke hée prayeth v father heauē deny thyng prayer doth hée aſke thinges neceſſarie v scripture ſayth wiſedome 1 cor 1 iuſtice ſatisfactiō redemption made god reſteth saintes aſke deſire chriſt v therefore wee neede yt helpe • saint wiſedome iuſtice ſanctificatiō redemption theſe hath chriſt obteined v yea hée alonely thereunto ordeined god saintes ſay hée ſaintes world would ſay contrary yet hée ſelfe ſtādeth faſt againſt cōdēneth lyars blaſphemers ſaying iohn 14 man commeth father note theſe wordes firſt ſaith man c ergo many euer ſhall come father heauen bée cōteined addeth hée saintes bryng v father heauen muſt bee chriſt onely bée ſaintes fayned mediatours merites thinges cleane excluded word wherfore plaine ſo euer hée bée yt maketh mediatour goeth meanes ſéeme neuer ſo holy chriſt onely come father heauē firſt deſpiſeth chriſt deſpiſe chriſte hée deſpiſeth alſo hys father whiche hath alowed onely bée iohn 14 mediatour way writtē way onely father therefore let thē bée ſure yt ſéeke waye mediatour chriſt alonely heauē accordyng word yt veritie cā lye ſhall neuer come many truſt onely let thē doubt ſhall onely obteyne come heauen alſo ſoeuer deſire bée ſide name according promiſe word cā deceiue iohn 16 v ſoeuer ſaith hée aſke name father ſhall geue marke theſe woordes ſoeuer ſhould runne hée addeth alſo name nothing excluded thinges fréely bée geuen v name ſake ſainctes name none holynes merites chriſtes name runne thys ſwéete promiſe moſt louing sauiour redemer onely mediatour ieſus chriſt ſaintes workes playne euydent token infidelity vnthankefulnes yée thinke hym vntrue fulfill hys promiſe yée able make hym lyar vntrue worde alſo paul ſayth hath geuen onely ſonne v bee yt hée ſhall geue thing marke ſayth hym ſaints ſayth thinges certaine thing hée faith excludeth tooth ake leaueth appolyne c hée excludeth nothing infidelles miſtruſters chriſt haue father heauen cā harte deſire chriſt able obtaine béeléeue able office thereunto onely appointed yt father none yea bée excluded wt manifeſt wee aſke chriſtes name wee ſhal obteine ſo ſhall wee name ſcriptures moreouer bée ſo fooliſh aſke thing one yt hath géeue cā geue yea hath néede hymſelfe leaue hym hath aboundaunce yea hath made open proclamation fréely without goulde ſiluer marchandiſe hée géeue ſelfe ſame thing many come aſke whatſoeuer bée lord hath alonely goodnes hée goodneſſe himſelfe saintes haue ſinned luke 18 néede goodnes hath made proclamation bleſſed euerlaſting worde whoſoeuer commeth vnto hym ſhall haue goodnes aboundauntly leaue goe ſaintes euer goodnes receaued father iames ſayth good giftes cō meth iaco 1 father lyght marke hée ſayth good giftes haue diſtinction yt onely god good nature saintes good receauinge goodneſſe well doe pleaſure allow diſtinctiō bée good make ſubtiltie saintes haue goodnes haue receaued goodnes saintes receaued god goodnes thē ſelues v haue receaued thē ſelues onely yea géeue none receaued themſelues yea neceſſary alonely mercy open mathewe parable fiue wiſe virgines fiue fooliſhe wyſe vyrgins ſo much oyle lend fooliſhe virgin would kindle lampes finally nothing coulde ſpare yet wiſe virgin yet saint yet admitted enter heauen farthermore doe openly againſt god deſire thing ſaintes whether bée proſperitie wealth health remiſſion ſinnes aduerſities conſolatiōs comfortes thyng ſéeing scripture onely knowledgeth theſe thynges bée receaued hée onely géeuer yea prophet father tribulation cryed alonely hym dauid teſtifieth ſelfe theſe wordes troubled cry vnto pſal 119 lord hee helpe hée cryed saint ſpeake god ſayth cry vnto lord yea hée doubted hée woulde heare hym béecauſe hée man ſinner faithfully ſaid hée helpe mée hée teſtifieth place ſaying helpe god hath made heauen earth pſal 120 runne god aſke saint comforte proſperitie health wealth thyng ſéeing béelongeth alonely god géeue ſeing hée alonely fountayne auctor goodnes saintes haue parte géeuen vnto alſo chriſt teaching al creature pray biddeth goe thynge alonely father heauen hée maketh mention saintes ſo much bée meane betwéene father commaundeth pray pray thē ſelues father thing doubt hée would haue done hée would ſhoulde haue béene mediatour géeuers goodnes moreouer madde manner prayer men vſe lady father art heauē halowed thy name c thus doe learne men mocke fond prayer made lady lady learne ſay ladyes pſalter infidel mocker god man aſhamed theſe open blaſphemies doubt call grace yt lord may amēde yea ſhortly god ſhall ſtraitly auēge blaſphemy hée hath ſuffered long doubt infinite mercy notwithſtā dyng wil neuer béeleue hée wil much lēger ſuffer ſéeyng hée hath brought ſo graciouſly glorious veritie world ſo openly ſo clearely deny withſtand neither reaſon learnyng owne conſciences bée confounded marked hote yrons notwithſtādyng perſecute tyranny increaſe damnation lord bée mercyful vnto may bee knowen bée deceiue people theſe woordes father father holy doctours holy doctours ſhall recite certeine father doctours ſayinges may knowē alonely open lyers blaſphemers god bleſſed eternal word alſo holy ſaintes father vnto hée hath reuelated scripture veritie firſt auguſtine ſayth theſe auguſt • vera relig cap vlti wordes let v haue deuotion honoring dead men lyued well may coūted ſuch men deſire ſuch honour god ſhall honored v whoſe lightening reioice made cōpaniōs glory wherefore saintes muſt honored folowing honoring thē deuotyon c bée theſe plain right honoring saintes wordes auguſtine father doctour hée ſayth yt ſaints bée honoured v god ſhall bée onely honoured secondarily may folowe good lyuing ſo honour wiſe pray honour deuotion foloweth auguſtine wherfore doe honour loue charitie ſeruice build temple vnto wil ſo honored v know well bée good bée temple god wherfore well written man forbidden angell worſhip apoc 19 22 hym onely worſhip one god vnder angell alſo ſeruanut c deſire playner wordes theſe cā doe loue ſayntes charitie wiſe ſerue may alſo build temple honour marke alſo hée bringeth ſcripture hym angell god would bée honored man cā auoyde ſaying auguſtine example ſcripture alſo chriſoſtomes ſaying mat 15 tom 6 ho de profect •… nge text woman thy fayth great dooſt thou ſee woman vnworthy perſeueraunce made worthy wilt thou learne alſo praying vnto god owne perſons doe profyt men doe praye v woman crie diſciples came praied would ſpeed ſhee cryeth v aunſwered ſēt vnto ſheepe whiche periſhed houſe iſraell ſhee came ſelf perſeuer cry ſaying yes lord whelpes doe eate crūmes authoritie declaration chriſt heareth v ſelues apoſtles v fall maſters table geue benefyt ſaid bee vnto thou wilt dooſt thou ſe repelle whē men prayed ſhee came ſelfe cried hee graunt ʋnto hee ſaid ſent vnto loſt ſheepe vnto womā ſayth bee vnto thee thou wilt c heare playnly ſooner obtayne petityon god owne ſelfe thē midlers marke alſo yt apoſtles pray woman repelled ſhée heard alſo ſame chri • 6 ho de profect • euangeliorum doctour wrighteth theſe wordes haue need patrōs afore god nede much proceſſe ſpeak fayre vnto men though alone wanteſt patrō prayeſt god thy ſelfe yet ſhalt thou haue thy deſire god doth ſo lightly graūt men pray v whē pray ſelfe yea though bee full ſinnes c bee theſe neede patron god heareth wordes playne haue neede patron god heareth v ſoner pray owne perſons mē pray v wherefore make mediator onely chriſt doth miſtruſt chriſt beleueth omnipotēt god mercifull lord therefore flye vnto saint vnto saint truſting fynde mercy handes could fynde chriſtes trew chriſten exod 20 man leaueth fanteſye remembreth theſe wordes holy ſcripture heare thou mā thy god therfore ſetteth truſt confidence belief hope harton onely wil haue thing neceſſary body ſoule hee aſketh onely prophet dauid learneth v ſaying pray vnto lord pſal 5 morning thou ſhalt voyce morning ſhortly quickly thou art ſo mercyfull thou wilt prolong tyme ſhortly therefore diſtres body ſoule thee call deliuerace truſt obtayne thee onelye thou lord rhou haſt ſet thy hope onely pſal 4 thus doth euery good man pray chriſten mā putteth truſt god hee heare truſt god hée taketh alonely god alſo merciful god yea father deny nothing cō trarywiſe doe infidel fained chriſten men miſtruſte hym recken bée tyraunt terrible fearefull iudge looketh much interceſſion regardeth perſons therfore runne hither thither ſéeke mediatour ſéeke helper ſéeke deliuerer chriſt bée ſatiſfied yea reckē bée ſo proude ſo ſtately ſo cruell ſo hygh dare ſpeake firſt deſire clearely miſtruſt • ūme therof cauſe ſeeke miſtruſt chriſte cauſe ſhould runne gadding saint thyng neceſſary v saint saint deſire one rich health one holpen heauen bée deliuered frō hel one wil haue frēdſhyp worlde long lyfe one bée ſaued ſicknes wil bée made whole bycauſe miſtruſt chriſt reckē yt hée either able hée wil obtaine theſe thinges grounde harte let lye mouthes compelled flye frō chriſt making many godes paule ſaith couetouſnes idolatrie bycauſe mās hart goodes much idolatrie whereas mās faith hope truſt ſet ſo much saint holy yet godes creature trueth saintes bée holy worthy bée béeloued chriſt chriſt yet bée creature godes loue wel doe prayſe magnifie wherfore bycauſe haue chriſt author goodnes whiche hée away would ſpit deſpiſe thē doe make chriſt sauiour redéemer cōforter truſt hope bycauſe yt chriſt mercy grace dwelleth ſéeke alonely yt hath made thē holy hath alſo alonely power men likewiſe make wherfore deare brother wyll bée chriſtes make hym alonely chriſt onely interceſſor mediatour interceſſour father heauen thynges deſire deſire hys name onely make hym firſt frende haue saintes ſide chuſe bée frends wherfore ſet truſt hope confidence chriſt onely directe deſires petition prayer vnto hym onely saintes ſhall loue fauour magnifie praiſe god ſake god honour liued well chriſtes worde therein ſhall folow wyſe ſhall béeléeue hope truſt make prayer vnto thē deſire petition lyuing ſhall bée rule lyue farther folowed yt word chriſt bée cauled chriſten men chriſt saintes anſwere papiſtes carnall reaſōs carnall reaſons firſt haue lawe whoſe wordes bee theſe chriſten men doe call worſhipfull image god doe ſerue god ſet hope ſaluation doe looke iudgement come doe worſhip effectually pray vnto remembraunce recordation firſt fruit doe ſerue yet creature godly honour c let euery chriſten man conſider god onely omnipotent almighty well conſcience wordes lawe call alſo remembraunce god hymſelfe ſay omnipotent hée liberall hée mercifull hée gracious hée vnto v thē thinke hée ſhall well perceaue decrée neyther made wyth faith learning yet reaſon open blaſphemy agaynſt god great miſtruſting mercifull maiſter chriſt ieſus briefly nothing heape blinde vnfaithfull wordes inuē ted béeguile ſimple men thereby firſte worde venerabiles faith learning reaſon image ſhoulde bee iudged worthy veneration doth yt lattin worde venerabiles ſignifie ſéeing bée deafe dumme dead reaſon call venerabiles maiſter doctour rydley ſay mā ſo mad worſhip honour ſtocke ſtone yet owne law caulleth venerabiles much ſay worthy bée worſhipped honoured call one thing name recken vnworthy déede foloweth chriſten men call god néede theſe wordes worlde knoweth bée goddes déede call venerabiles farthermore would knowe maiſters yt lawyer bée ſuch blaſphemers god ſuch infidelles ſuch mortall enemyes vnto god fo ſuffer yea compell ſimple men géeue thoſe ſtockes ſtones ſuch exteriour honour béelongeth onely god ſéeing call goddes maketh matter ye name ſo long géeue thynge aſſigne exteriour worſhipping papiſtes geeue ſaints yt worſhyp ſtockes ſtones ſhould geue god honouring béelongeth god wée may doe doe god prooue yee compell men geeue ſame ſtocks ſtones yet thinke ſelues ſufficiently diſcharged becauſe men call god foloweth ſet hope thē neede men pray vnto néede men aſke petition néede men offer vnto neede men vowe néede men runne barefooted barelegged kiſſe licke doe aſke thyng haue hope receaue doe mocke foloweth pray vnto thē worſhip thinke ſay godes yet men pray vnto worſhip adde latine word ſignifieth much aſke forgeuenes fully effectually pray ſtād fayth honour god let euery chriſten mā iudge ſtandeth decrée call godes much ſay bée hypocrite diſſemblers god man ſay one thing wordes compell people doe contrary déedes honour godes▪ contrary theſe woordes scripture thou ſhalt honour thy lorde god ſerue hym onely marke holy ghoſt ſayth thou math 4 ſhalt ſerue god onely ſelfe latin word adorare decrée hath scripture ſhall onely bée geuen god geue worſhypfull image marke alſo occaſion chriſt ſpake theſe wordes deuil required hée ſhould fall downe honour hée required faith hope yet hée ſhould make prayer deſire petition licke kiſſe foote make oblation alonely fall downe ſo exteriour ſeruice honor maiſter ſayd yt belongeth alonely god neither deuill yet woorſhipful image ſay conſcience doe ſame thing ſtockes ſtones deuil required maiſter chriſt auoyde thys gloſ • de cō ſec dist 3 c venerabiles commeth gloſe wyth diſtinction learne mayſter chriſt hée ſhall honour deuill excuſe hym idle damnable diſtinction whoſe woordes bée theſe cultus latriae includeth thrée thing loue multitude ſacrifice veneration béelongeth onely god ſaith hée worſhipping cauled dulia thys hath one thing veneration hath neither loue multitude ſacrifice thys béelongeth creature c bée theſe heape idle wordes without ſentence inuented deuill deceaue ſimple men ſaye cultus latriae includeth loue multitude ſacrifyce veneration belongeth god onely tell mée cōſciēce aſhamed theſe wordes fere vengeance god thus mocke trifle god man nothing blindnes ignoraunce malicious papiſtes agaynſt theſe wordes bée fyrſt loue image ſayntes secondarilye doe offer vnto cal ſacrifice yea ſo much hange thyrdly doe geue veneratiō vnto yea al harte el bée hipocrites diſſēblers geue ſtockes ſtones cultum latrie owne diſtinction béelongeth god onely auoyde idolatrie ſeconde parte diſtinction ſay ſaintes creature yt worſhipyng dulya without loue without multitude ſacrifice cal meane worſhipping without loue without ſacrifice opē hipocriſye honor thing outwardlye neather loue fanor inwardly yet offer ſacrifice vnto nothing el open mocking may well math 27 compare vnto wicked iewes crouched knéeled vnto chriſt neyther loue fauour mockage doe honour ſayntes image commeth wayes thē mocke trifle god holy word whē thinke auoyde damnable diſtinction moſt agaynſt ſo chriſtē men may ſée hand god heare alſo baulde reaſō haue rychard ſaintes de medium villa 4 ſent confirmed grace charitie pray v therefore muſt pray much ſeing confyrmed charitie c goodly bauld reaſon caſt byſhops cure hée proue ſcripture hath hée hym heare well carnall reaſon heare probation make lyke reaſon ſayntes weare heare charitie cloth naked men fede papiſtical reaſon well aunſwered confuted hungrey gaue drinke yt thirſty viſited priſon therefore much confyrmed charitie theſe bée déedes charitie lykewiſe paule heare dyd hys charitie wryte epiſtelles declare veretie therefore muſt • ée much wryte ſo y• afore hée wrot one epiſtell muſt hée yt leaſt write thrée el hée confyrmed charitie thinke hée dyd neuer greater dede charitie wright epiſtell declare owne piſtels world variaunce vnderſtāding blynd gydes hath learned declare wherein charitie ſayntes doth ſtande hath geuē auctoritie geue déede charitie vnto ſayntes ſcripture doth geue wherfore déede charitie one pray cauſe holy ghoſt ſo declared word wherfore charitie lyfe worde god byddeth doe workes charitie ſhall haue lyfe belongeth iudge farther word god alſo haue reaſō god ſheweth myracles place papiſticall reaſon place honouring ſaynt ſaynt therefore muſt lykewiſe honour aunſwere myracles though haue aunſwered beefore yet adde vnto god god ſuperſtition fauoreth one place hath affectiō place wherefore ſuperſtition inuented deuill god neyther bée honored mountayne yet ieruſalem men harte iohn 4 myrakles great godes diana alſo myrackles may actes 19 reade ſcripture conſyder honour ſcripture ſpeketh compare honour image may ſée doe agrée farthermore apollo caſtor aeſcu lapius ſuch alſo greate myracles ſtories doe make mention alſo many men wyſe well learned alſo many men great reputation honour bée yea mē great holynes doe beare witneſſe y• ſame therfore reaſon muſt alſo honour alſo reaſon haue iob conuert thy ſelfe vnto ſome ſayntes iob 5 conclude muſt pray vnto ſayntes aunſwere may conclude bee blinde dull aſſes vnlearned ſtockes papiſtes wreſters ſcriptures god peruerters tearers renter holy ſcripture pray ſayntes dyd yt old father puniſhed ſayth hée prooue hée biddeth iob call memory holy men ſeruaunts god recken one hée among god ſo puniſh wherefore hée concludeth iob ſeruaunt god foolyſhe man scripture enemye god god ſhall ſlaye wrath ſentence place fynallye haue reſon ſhall praiſe god ſayntes pſal 150 therefore ſayntes muſt bée honoured aunſwere good conſequent muſt praiſe god beares ape therefore beares ape muſt bée worſhipped adde yt foloweth ye text muſt praiſe god timbrel orgens pypes therefore conſcequent timbrel orgens pypes muſt bée fooliſhe papiſticall argument well aunſwered worſhipped weare learned ſcriptures ſhould fynde ſentence holy pſalme trewe text laudate dominum ſanctititate ſua praiſe god holynes let v graunt hée ſayth prayſe god ſayntes doe knowe ſcriptures ſay bleſſed god giftes follow ſhall worſhip pray god giftes god ſhall bée prayſed honoured giftes ſaint man angell reaſon haue ſimilitude fooliſhe reaſon ye papiſtes like mā come ſpeach kyng hée muſt haue certayne mediatoures duke erles ſuch men bée fauour betwéen king may entreate matter likewiſe béefore god aunſwere infidelles miſtruſters god make god make fleſhely carnall ſtocke full paſſions affection ʋnto mortall prince make mediatours béecauſe hee knew hart béecauſe hée affectionat one man thē beecauſe hee iudgeth ſight hys eye ye percialnes affection hart ſo doth god alonely mere mercy grace ſimilitude haue duke ſpeake excepte géeue rewardes excepte haue carnall affection therfore ſimilitude muſt likewyſe doe saintes ambroſe anſwereth clearly damnable reaſon ſaying men wonte vſe thys ad ro c 1 miſerable excuſation theſe thinges may wee come god may come kyng erles aunſwere wee doe come vnto kyng meanes duke erles becauſe kyng man knoweth hee may committe common wealth vnto god nothing bee hidde hee knoweth men merites wee neede ſpokeſman mediatour alonely deuoute mynde c clearely aunſwered ambroſe youre carnall reaſon item reaſon lawe image bee vnto vnlearned de conſec diſt 3 c perlatum men ſame thyng letter writinges bée vnto bee learned may thereby learne ought folow image bee vnlearned men writinges learned men therefore may image bee worſhipped thē bookes learned men reade doe learned men doe letter woulde ſuffer learned men come kneele offer booke ſette vp candels make vowes come yearely thereunto deſire petitiōs béefore booke thoſe saintes yt bée written therein sée owne example maketh agaynſt thing bringe wherefore bée grace bée ſhame worlde chriſtes ſake leaue falſe▪ learnyng colouring idolatrie doe onely deceaue ſimple brother doe alſo blaſpheme immortall god heauen doubtles auenge ſhortly rebuke doe amende whoſe violēce might able withſtand wherefore exhorte ye bleſſed name chriſt ieſus repent tyme take vpon learne veritie god onely bée honoured onely bée ſacrificed vnto hée onely bée prayed vnto hym onely muſt petition bee aſked hée onely yt géeueth wealth proſperitie hée muſt deliuer comforte v aduerſities hée onely muſt helpe v diſtreſſe vnto saint paule ſayth alonely glory honour 1 tim 1 euer amen moſt excellent noble prince haue poore doctour barnes concluſion gifte god hath géeuen mee ſet vnto grace certain article though ſéeme firſte ſight bee newe yet haue prooued openly euerlaſtynge worde god wroonge wreſted lyghte brayne expoſition clarkely doctours yea oldeſt beſt wherfore moſt excellent prince moſt humbly moſt méekely beſéeche grace may finde ſo great indifferencie grace hand byſhoppes ſhall condemne booke maner olde tyranny excepte open scripture holy doctours refell haue prooued would ſhould pleaſe grace call beefore commaunde many condemne booke euery one ſeuerally without others counſell write cauſe condemne ſcriptures whereby condemne bryng grace grace may iudge betwéene party doe doute wil bring grace maruailous probation ſuch neuer hearde thrée agrée one tale bée deuided let mée dye grace ſhall well ſée father heauen hys moſt mercifull ſonne ieſus chriſt kéepe grace honour pleaſure glory amen originall maſſe euery part therof tranſlated engliſh booke de doctorum sententijs ¶ de conſecratione dist 1 cap iacobus ex 6 synodo iames brother lorde cconernyng fleſhe vnto firſte cōmitted church ieruſalem baſilius byſhop caeſaria gaue vnto v celebration maſſe sayth gloſe ſay manner celebrate yt maſſe woordes body made deliuered frō lord ſelfe afterward others alſo added ſome one péece ſome comlynes ſolemnitie thus much ſayth hée god chriſtian reader theſe men wholy addicted lye otherwiſe doe beguile deceaue onely endeuour whiche although may bée manifeſt vnto thée many déedes withſtanding one▪ yt ſo greatly boaſt ſo manifeſt none cā dony attribute originall maſſe vnto iames apoſtle baſilius ye biſhop errour bée ſuffered aſmuch moſt falſe foloweth ſhall appeare let declare iames made thereof baſtill added thereto let bryng bold chal • nge doctour barnes foorth one apoſtles euer ſayd maſſe ſhal haue yt victory ieames died yeare lord 62 maſſe vnderſtand mention made churche ſpace 200 yeares moreouer baſill papiſtes lye manifeſtly diſplayed tyed yeare chriſt 380 could hée agrée iames aboute maſſe maſſe church death iames vnto baſiles tyme authoritie baſill deliuer v ye maſſe moreouer theſe mē doe adde auctoritie vj synode lye might bée notorious bring foorth vj synode whiche theſe thinges bée written pray handled vj synode maner celebrating maſſe agaynſt ye vj synode gathered togither agaynſt thoſe yt would ſay maſſe nothyng leſſe agaynſt ſuch wickedly taught one operation chriſt read actes synode ſhall finde bée ſo let v graūt meane • eaſon handled yt synode doth prooue contende matter intreated synode whether ieames baſill deliuered vnto v maner celebrating maſſe doth vj sinode prooue contention hence vj synode certified iames baſill deliuered maſſe writinges woorkes iames baſil falſeſied papiſtes remaine amongeſt v whiche founde one ſillable bée read concerning maſſe moreouer vj synode gréece vnto day doe varye frō manner celebrating wherefore muſte néedes bée either wée doe erre ordinaunce iames ſaye vj sinode celebrated yeare chriſt 674 tyme tooke manner celebratyng tradition ieames yt yet vnknowen world firſt ye synode opened ye world matter may bée better knowen vnto world ſet agaynſt auctoritie gregory ſayth apoſtles peculiar maner celebratyng maſſe onely ſayd lordes prayer whoſe wordes bée regiſt lib ca 63 theſe maner ye apoſtles onely ſaying lordes ſimplicitie celebratyng communion primatiue prayer conſecrated▪ sacrament thus ſayth gregory tradition ieames gregory knew surely chriſtians would bée aſhamed leſt wiſe reuerence god ſo perſecute teare ſlay brother wicked maſſe boaſt chriſt apoſtles auctors bryng foorth one good man teſtimony therof ſpeake maſſe pe • red thée woordes chriſt may briefly finiſhe matter becauſe maſſe ſo deare gayne aduauntage maketh maſſe bee better loued papiſtes vnto good cauſe ſithens fill bellyes kéepe horſes dogges conſecrate harlot venus many ſuch kynde good woorkes yet bée vncertaine auctor wil deſcribe vnto author patched maſſe owne writer leſt ſhould obiect vnto mée lutheran cronic cro f • ſci tempfirſt pope gregory ſurnamed great held generall councell rome ye yeare chriſt 594 whiche hée ordeined entrance introite maſſe bée begon ſome pſalme introitus hée added moreouer kyrieleiſon ſhould bée ſong ix tymes kirieleyſon hée alſo added cannon maſſe dieſ que noſtros reader nowe haſt thou maſſe patched togither authours euery part thereof whiche papiſtes ſo wickedly defende bée ſacrifice neither meruaile doe tooth nayle defende thyng ſo deare ſo laborious hath béene ſo longe tyme makyng dare boldly affirme magnificent temple salomon greate deale leſſer tyme builded iſopes crow decked hys borowed fethers neither yet would haue thée forgette decrée pope prooueth maſſe ordained iames baſill praye • hée take away whiche added theſe father remaynyng maſſe lefte iames deliuered baſill commended vnto nothyng woordes chriſte thus doe theſe good father ſet v woman cry diſciples came prayed hee would ſpeed ſhe cryeth v hee aunſwered ſent vnto ſheepe periſhed ye houſe iſraell ſhee came ſelfe dyd perſeuer cry ſaying yes lord whelpes doe eate crūmes fall vpon iohn tractat 17 take vp thy bed c manyfeſt corporall worke yt body done healing onely body playne bodely worke chriſtians ought ſeeke ſpitfull reuengement extremitie law vtterly ſinne among ſayth paul becauſe go 〈◊〉 cor 6 law one rather ſuffer wrong rather ſuffer ye ſelues bee robbed alſo math 5 maiſter ſayth man ſue lawe take thy coate frō thee let hym haue thy cloke alſo 208 col 2 athanaſius texte saint paule ſayth vtterly ſinne among athanaſius ſay condemnation ignominie doe exerciſe iudicials among wherefore doe rather ſuffer wrong c 209 col 1 alſo hierome ſayth • inne vnto doe agaynſt com hiero ad cor 6 maundement chriſt haue iudgementes among ought alwayes keepe peace yea though loſſe temporall good wherefore doe rather ſuffer wrong yee ought commaundement goſpell example yt lorde patiently ſuffer doe cō trary onely ſuffer doe wrong vnto yt doe wrong c 209 col 1 haymo ſayth offence ſinne haue iudicials haymo ad cor 6 accuſation engendreth ſtrife ſtrife engendreth diſcorde diſcorde engendreth hatred leaſt peraduenture woulde ſay ſinne require myne owne therefore ſayth yt apoſtle truely ſinne vnto againſt commaundement yt lord ſayth hee taketh away luke 6 thy good aſke agayne wherefore doe rather ſuffer loſſe ye might fulfill commaundement lorde c 209 col 1 auricular confeſsiō neceſſary ſaluation tranſlated engliſh booke de doctorum sententijs ¶ de poenitentia diſt 1 cap conuertimini tvrne vnto hart turne vnto turnyng ment turnyng vpſidedowne hart hart bee turned thoroughly euill vnto god forthwith deſerueth frute conuerſion god beyng turned wrath mercy may pardō offence beefore hee intended reuēge wherby geuen v vnderſtand without confeſſion mouth may bee forgeuen meanes alſo theſe leypers lord wylled ſhew ſelues prieſtes made whole ſoūd way came prieſtes fact geuen v vnderſtād ſhewe face prieſt confeſſe ſinnes clenſed lepry • inne foloweth alſo lord would declare yt ſentence prieſt gift diuine grace ſinner made cleane clēſed lepour touching afterward according law cōmaunded offer ſacrifice foloweth hee came prieſt hee clenſed whileſt contrition hart confeſſion mouth remiſſion ſinne graunted therfore onely cōtrition made reuiuing taketh away ſinne hee hath therfore reuiuour preſent dwellyng within hym ¶ ſame place cap scindite rent harte garmēt c shewyng contritiō hart vnderſtanded rentyng therof ſinnes forgeuen confeſſiō mouth part exteriour ſatiſfactiō hee calleth rentyng garmentes part vnderſtandyng whole ¶ ſame place cap facilius houre ſoeuer ſinner ſhalbe conuerted c ſaid whē ſoeuer hee ſhal cōfeſſe mouth onely hee ſhall bee turned ſhall bee ſory ſinnes hee ſhall liue dye ¶ ſame place cap facilius doe eaſely purchaſe god fauour beeing conuicted man iudgement accord acknowlege faultes doe either owne confeſſions bewray ſame el mē know priuye offender bee doe cōdemne ſelues voluntary excommunication ſeperating ſelues aulter whereon miniſtred compultion willingly bewayle life life beeyng ſure beeyng recōciled fruites effectual penitēcy onely recouer thing loſt god beeyng alſo made citizen euerlaſtyng habitation may come ioy euerlaſtyng ¶ chriſoſtome vpon pſalme miſerere mei homi 11 confeſſe thy ſinnes thou mayſt blot thou abaſhed confeſſe thou haſt offended cōfeſſe dayly thy ſoule doe ſay thou ſhouldeſt confeſſe thy companion felow ſeruaunt may obrayed thee declare thē god hath regarde thou declare god ignoraunt hee learne thee thou dideſt thē hee hād whē thou cōmitteſt hee perfect knowledge ¶ ſame chriſoſtome vpon epiſtle hebrues let v therfore perſuade ſelues haue ſinned let toung onely pronounce inward conſcience alſo neither let v onely ſay wee bee ſinners let v ſpecially accompt euery ſingulare offence doe ſay yt thou ſhouldeſt bewray thy ſelfe publikly neither thou ſhouldſt accuſe thy ſelfe others would haue thee obey prophet ſaying reuele thy waye vnto lord pſal 31 ¶ ambroſe de poenitentia petri sermo 46 peter bruſt forth teares aſkyng nothing voice doe finde hee wept finde ſayed teares read hys ſatiſfaction read nothyng ¶ auguſtine lib 10 cōfeſsion cap 1 therfore thee lord manifeſtly knowen ſoeuer profiteth confeſſe ſelfe vnto thee neither doe wordes fleſh voyce wordes ſoule clamour thought thy eare vnderſtandeth whereas euill confeſſe ſelfe vnto thee nothyng el miſlike ſelfe godly confeſſe vnto thee nothyng el attribute ſame ſelfe becauſe thou lord doeſt bleſſe iuſt firſt thou doeſt iuſtifie hym beeyng wicked confeſſion therfore god thy ſight made vnto thee ſecretely ſecretly ſecret ſpeach crieth hart neither doe ſay good thyng vnto men thou haſt firſt heard neither thou alſo ſhalt heare ſuch thyng thou haſt firſt ſhewed vnto therfore haue doe men ſhould heare confeſſion though ſhould heale ſorowes griefes commonly wont bee curious know man lyfe ſlow amende owne demaūd heare heare thee ſelues know heare bee true foraſmuch man knoweth done man ſpirite mā man ¶ de poenitentia diſtinc 1 cap quinatus foraſmuch therfore proued confeſſion wee quickened grace made child light manifeſtly appeareth onely contrition hart without confeſſion mouth ſinne remitted ¶ ſame place cap omnes qui therfore confeſſion made vtteraunce obtaynyng pardon euen circumciſion geuē abraham ſigne iuſtice cauſe iuſtificatiō confeſſion prieſt offered ſigne pardon already cauſe remiſſion bee receaued ¶ notwithſtandyng man fell paradiſe aungell heauē ¶ diſtinctione 41 cap clericus whoſoeuer deſpiſing thoſe thing wherby hee preſently liueth doth ſeeke either delicate hom lyer apparell foode otherwiſe commonly vſed hee either vntemperate ſelfe ſuperſtitious ¶ faſtyng chriſtians doth cōſiſte choyſe difference meates tranſlated engliſhe booke de doctorum sententijs ¶ diſtinct 41 cap quiſquis ʋerba auguſtini ſoeuer doth vſe thinges preſent maner faſt fare ſo dētely fiſhe would rather faſt eate turbate thē v eate porke baken cōpare one exceſſe yet forſoth doe ſeme faſt ſtraitly maners hee liueth either vntemperate ſuperſtitious ſoeuer vſeth thē ſuch ſorte paſſeth yt boundes good mēs vſage hee liueth either doth ſome ſpeciall purpoſe el hee wicked perſon ſuch caſes vſe thyngs carnall luſt fault therfore agreable place tymes perſons muſt diligently marke neither let v raſhly reprehend offence may come paſſe wiſe mā may vſe moſt precious delicate meate without greedy luſt glotony vnwiſe perſon may haue vnſatiable appetite ſome groſſe foode ſome man maner chriſt leyther feede fiſhe fine brothe dyd eſau abrahames nephew coren cattle doe wee doe accompt moſt part brute beaſtes bee continent thē others becauſe bee nouriſhed wt vilder foode ſuch kynde thynges vſe ſo much conſideration nature cauſe vſyng thē maner deſiryng wee either allow improoue ¶ auguſtine ad ianuar epiſt 12 whereas frier bee ſo preciſe eatyng fleſhe thinke vncleane doe cate moſt manifeſtly agaynſt fayth ſound doctrine ſure two preceptes god thynges bee contained end precept loue proceedyng pure hart good cōſcience vnfayned fayth ſoeuer therfore ordeined ouer beſides cuſtome ſhall obſerued though sacramēt allow albeit becauſe would bee offence holy weake perſons dare freely diſalow many ſuch thynges foloweth true chriſtian religion mercy god would haue free onely celebratiō manifeſt sacramentes oppreſſe ſeruile burden ſo ſtate iewes tollerable although knew tyme libertie ſubiect powred water euilly luſted helyas dyd eate fleſh ¶ ſame place cap quod dicit concernyng lord ſayth euangeliſt wiſedome iuſtified child declareth ſonnes wiſedome vnderſtand righteouſnes conſiſteth neither abſtainyng eatyng pacient ſufferyng ſcarcitie temperaūce corupt ſelues toe much aboundāce conueniēt taking taking thoſe thinges whereof gredy luſt reprehended ſimple vſe forceth lawes goſpell lord commaundeth faſting wiſe thou dooſt faſt annoynte thy head c wouldeſt thou ſhould yet ſhew thee kind faſting thou oughteſt faſt faſt ſinne take meate malice make bankeres pleaſure waxe whot wine ſenſualytye faſt euill artes practiſes abſtaine euill talke ſtay thee euill thoughtes touch ſtolen breade peruers doctrine thou ſhalt luſt deceauable foode philoſophy may ſeduce thee aunſwereth child bridegrome faſt long bridegrome preſēt therefore doe faſt haue loſt ye bridegrome yt haue bridegrome v faſt neyther yet withſtanding doe ſay let loſe bridle chriſtian abſtinencye miſchiefe ſame place cap cum aliquis ʋerba orige man doth goe trueth feare onely caſt yt faithfull beleeuyng whoremō gers adulterer bleſſe ſhould caſt thē church would bee ſmall god fayth charity
